<Author>Carleen_mc
<Content>Tried to enjoy ourselves - but didnt Booked our trip with Air Transat- Nolitours.Our plan was delayed 4hrs at YVR so we did not arrive untill 3:30am.Staff were somewhat friendly and spoke moderate english, got our mickey flask of rum and were escourted to our room- (by an eager porter looking for a tip) First impression good- we were in room 11109 (swim out room in building 11)... room was spacious, bright, seemed clean..... over the next 6 days we had some not great experiences with room such as: the stinky/musty/tropical/cigar/urine smell, bed was hard, had 1 gecko in room, were told we were not allowed to flush toilet paper, maids forgot to clean rooms one day, air conditioning work but had only one setting - mega cold-, barely any hot water,  We found over all, the restaurants to have really bad serviceAqua- Exclusive (Cameleon etc)- OK, very bad service, tables not cleaned, pre-used silverware sitting at place settings, food most often cold with flies around.WINDOWS- usually something edible, bad service in most sections- but good waiter in the back middle section finally took care of bringing us drinks, water, cutlery etc. Often flies around desserts (because all have sugery glazes on them) and fruits. Food recycled from meal to meal and not really refrigerated.De Mario- Good Food, ok service-- GONG SHOW to get reservations at any alacarte restaurant- what they do is let the rest. fill up at 6pm and then start taking a waiting list after that time- so if you send one member from your famliy up from the pool to book a table they had to wait sometime 30-40 mins to get a time to come back...poorly managed (often tables sat empty for long periods of time after first dinners left)Beach Garden- ok if starving- got shooed out of sitting inside at 3pm because they were trying to get tables ready for the dinner sitting but didn't close untill 4pm- fries were always cold (ON THAT NOTE- SAW HOTEL STAFF WITH A CHIQUTA BANANA BOX CARRYING COOKED FRENCH FRIES FROM BEHIND WINDOWS REST. DOWN THE PATH TO THE BG REST- not covered)DIdn't go to Seafood restaurantAmerican Grill-Tex Mex-- Great food (veal tenderloin was hubbys fav) again same type of mis-management as de mario- one night we waited outside untill 630 cuz they were seting tables, but were told the 'cooker hadn't shown up yet'*note- they say you can only go to the alacarte restarants 1 time, but we actually went to the Italian 2 times and tex mex 3 times nobody asked for our coupon *bars were ok, drinks sometime rancid/strong- all alchohol was fake? (baileys in similar bottle but called sallys, no premium labels- all Brugal?) Beach- lots, walked past the 3 resorts to public not crowded beaches that was nice tooPools- nice, favorite was the new one out back by building 15? great bar there often quite- NO HOT TUB- what looks like a hot tub on the map is actually colder then pool its near by. Pools were kept clean/with out much debris, and i actually saw somebody scrubbing the 'scumline' 2 times while thereGrounds- really nice, pathways a little rough for wearing high heels but pretty flowers, flamingos and turtles to look atBorrowed Kayaks- paddled that was fun-Did Zip Line with Bavaro Runners (AWESOME) cost $220 cdn-Was supposed to go the Marinariam tour but company FORGOT to pick us up- we waited at designated location but no one every showed up and we got to watch the boat drive away from pier with out us (was told we were getting refund- will check credit card again to see if processed)- took free shuttle to nicoles which is a store of a french canadian lady that sells jewlery, vanilla $3, santo domingo coffe $5, hand rolled cigars god prices. Wanted to get to hard rock cafe at the end (to get some stable food) however couldn't peice together enough information from the 6 people we asked about the 'free shuttle' to the 'plaza del mar??? shopping centre' which may or may not pick up a couple times a day We tried to enjoy oursevles but in the end the minor details got to us--- especially the extra 16hr delay for the way back.... at the resort we found if you spoke spanish you got better service, howevereven then you might never get your drinks at dinner, and don't even try to ask for a modifcation to a meal at the a la carte restaurants.  Our resort was set about 30mins away from others like Bahai PRincipe etc- there were 3 of us out there, you can see the marinarium and reef explorer locations from the hotel beach- they are right out front. There is a very agressive market across the street from the hotel- 'my friend, my family come have a look', we would walk past to the mini market to get snacks much cheaper then resort mini-bar and store... (price on resort for pringles $5usd mini can, $3 chocolate bar) In all like a said we went there with an open mind, we tried to like it but in the end were defeated by the continual rude/inattentive service.  I would never go back to the Dominical Republic not just based on this experience- but flying from Vancouver is 6hrs 30mins there and 8hrs 30mins back--- to enjoy nice beaches, tropical destination etc- I could do that in mexico within 4-5hrs....

<Author>yellowmellow2
<Content>Trapped At the last minute, my friend and I decided to go somewhere warm and all inclusive for New Years. I returned last night (January 5, 2009). My flight and hotel were very reasonable and I was looking forward to 6 days in the sun with fresh fish, fruit and the wonderful caribbean spirit... What we got instead was dismal service, food that was inedible and all red wine stored in large fruit juice plastic bottles. While the staff was always all smiles and calm, nothing was ever delivered or handled. The restaurants that were advertised as part of the all inclusive were mysteriously closed on the days you wanted to book them and when they weren't, they had run out of food. I would NOT wish this place on anyone... the lack of customer service, quality assurance and training for the staff will catch up to them...

<Author>Cdnbanker
<Content>Terribly Over Rated We just returned from a 2 week stay Dec 19-Jan 2. We had stayed here in Feb 06 (was Punta Cana Grand then) and thought it was great. I can't believe a resort could go so far downhill in that short a time!Checkin took forever. Very slow, inefficient and unorganized. The little drink they give you while waiting doesn't help when it is midnight and you have been in line for an hour!Had to change rooms 4 times to get satisfactory room. One neither door would lock.The hall door had been kicked in and night lock hanging by screws, patio door wouldn't lock.Toilet wouldn't flush, phone didn't work, etc....Other room had not been cleaned (and by now it is 1 am) The food is terrible. At the buffet the only way to get hot food was the pasta bar or cooking station. Only overhead light bulbs keeping other food warm. Last day there saw ants all over the fruit, and a yellow coloured fly came out of a sweet roll I was eating. Friends saw a cockroach going across the floor. Service in buffet excellent but does not make up for quality of food. DiMarios was so bad we walked out and left food on table.Ceasar salad tasted like it had been cooked in fish.Tex Mex restaurant really good but you can only eat at each a la carte once a week.Christmas and New Years were done very well, but food quality a real issue.Adult pool is not maintained that way. One day there was 6 little kids in the jacuzzi that we asked to leave. their parents were very upset. Two other times we told kids they had to leave. The staff does nothing about it. This is also supposed to be the only area where topless is allowed, but not the case. Around the main pool, and on the beach, once again not supervised by the staff.Booked a trip to Higuey that was supposed to be shopping at a market, visit a cathederal, tobacco place and a Dominican lunch. Our driver spoke no English, took us to the church and said there you go, took us to one shop where he was angry we didn't buy anything (it was too expensive) then took us to a supermarket. (we didn't really need any groceries)Then he took us back to the hotel. That trip was $60US a person.We booked a trip to go on speedboats ($75 US a person) but they never came to get us as the Sunwing rep wrote down the wrong time. He wrote 12:25 am not pm. Logic would think that no one is going out in speedboats at midnight! Rep was MIA for 2 days. We got oyr refund as we were getting on the bus to airport (after many calls)Pool is clean and good temp.Beach is nice except for the seaweed. They clean it up once a day but needs done more often as there is a lot of it.This was one of our worst vacations ever. It also rained for 5 days (that's the chance you take!) which didn't help!We were so dissapointed as we had such a good time when here before.Would never go back. This is rated 4 star and 5 star (depending on the company) but is barely a 3.

<Author>saltysdad
<Content>Nothing Grand About the Grand Oasis First, let me say that if you have already booked your trip and are locked in, do not worry. It is possible to have a perfectly nice week at this resort. HOWEVER, if you have not booked yet, I would sincerely advise you to look elsewhere.The resort is truly beautiful...great beach, lovely pool. However, my wife and I agree that this is a case of missed opportunites. Poor management has rendered this resort quite meidocre.You will read other reviews that say that the food is atrocious. Perspective is everything and so are expectations. No great meals were had at any of the restaurants, but we did not go hungry. Some around us felt the food was quite good but MOST felt it left alot to be desired.You will read other reviews that state that the staff is unfriendly. Not true. The waiters, bar staff, and housekeepers were all helpful and engaging. The front office staff was not helpful at all. My wife's beach bag was stolen from the pool area and they refused to activate the safe in our room gratis after such a traumatic event. Finally, one manager, Karen,,,,(apparently the keeper of the administrative brain) realized that to deny us this meager request could be a public relations nightmare and acquiesced.Our room was okay, but a persistant leak from the airconditioner condenser was a nuisance and was not fixed properly when we requested this.Towel shortages have been written about in other reviews. What can I say? This is true. For a resort of this size, they should have an adequate number of beach and bath towels which they do not.The grounds can be noisy at night...a problem if you have small children that might want to sleep. A private party at one of the bars blasting loud music at 3 am was very irritating. I complained to the staff member running it but he was DRUNK and refused to turn down the music. I finally unplugged the stereo speakers myself. (Fortunately, I was not physically attacked by the partygoers). I filled out a complaint form at the front desk which was never followed up upon by management.The animation staff was quite entertaining and our fellow guests, overwhelmingly Canadian, could not have been nicer.Again, if you've already booked, don't despair: keep an eye on your belongings, pack an extra towel, and dont expect 5 star cuisine. If you still have a choice to go elsewhere, exercise that option!  
<Date>Jan 1, 2009

<Author>Whitelys
<Content>Great Vacation !! I was there from dec. 18 to dec. 25 with my sister and we had a great time!!we traveled with sunwing and loved the service and the food. At the airport, everything went well and the bus took us to the hotel in less than 20 minutes. The room was ready and we didn't had to wait.The service at the reception, restaurants and bars was most of the time perfect !!!! A lot of smiles and the tips are appreciated but we didn't feel that we had to give any to have good service.I want to say thank you to Nicholas (adult pool) and to denny (window's buffet) for the excellent service !! The food at window is great (and i'm a peaky eater) .... i always manage to find something i liked, we always had a big variety of choices. The white wine is o.k. For the a la carte restaurant, we went to mare, very good and the fact that you can hear the ocean is great ! we also went to da mario (italian) good service but we didn't like the food but i spoke with others and they just loved it. so it depends on your tastes and what you take. we went to amerian grill tex mex and this was our favorite..... great mexican food .... we went twice... perfect nachos and fajitas !! Perfect service and great ambiance !!you don't need any reservation for the a la carte restaurants , only for the japanese one but we didn't go there.The beach is fantastic ..... white sand, a lot of palapas and available chairs. It was a bit windy while we were there but it was still good to be on the beach !! a little of seeweed but the workers was taking them out in the morning.we went to only 1 show and it was o.k. The maid service was great, we had the fresh towels in our room before 4 pm. the fridge was restock every day. we had a room in the block 6 (room 6304) and it was a standard room that was renovated .... we didn't really had hot water and the pressure was low ... but it was o.k. It was really clean, the bed and the pillow was firm enought. we had 2 double beds. We had a balcony very private. We never had any problems with the beach towels. We return them at 4h00 pm and took fresh ones in the morning at the beach. The resort is very weel kept .... you can always see the workers cleaning and fixing things. It's a small resort... everything is close and we liked it !!! The 24th, we had a special chistmas diner at the buffet... live music and the food was incredible ... better than usual ... even the wine was better ... a lot of see food !We only got out of the resort once and it was to go to Don Lucas ... they came and pick us up for free and to us to their store. You will see people working in the cigar factory and you will shop in the store (cigars, alcool, souvenirs, paintings ...) a lot of nice things .... we really enjoyed going there !!No problem and no waiting for check out.My vacation was perfect and i would definatly go back again !!  
<Date>Dec 29, 2008

<Author>Caribbeanlover23
<Content>Good 4 star hotel, if you get a good price My boyfriend and I stayed at the Grand Oasis Bavaro from Dec 11- Dec 18, 2008. We booked through Selloffvacations.com, we got a very good price, so we decided to give it a try. The Grand Oasis Bavaro part is connected with Grand Oasis Punta Cana, however the lobby and hotel rooms are a lot nicer in the Bavaro part. In addition, the use of the aqua restaurant makes it better. Our stay was nice, for the price that we paid, however we ran into some issues that made it very disappointing. Here is a review from an open-minded Canadian couple:What went WRONG: 1.) we paid to have use of the safe during our stay, we paid at the lobby and they told us to call the lobby when we get to our room and they will send someone to activate it. We called for 2 days, and waited in our room forever. No one came, we asked for our money back, and they would NOT return it. We fought with the staff working at the lobby for an hour, and finally they gave us our money back.2.) A little bit shocked at the variety of food. I know it is the Dominican, however I have been to 5 star hotels in the Dominican and this hotel has a 3 star level buffet. Very disappointed with how little fruit and desserts they had. Also, everything was fried.3.) Our flight was late at night, therefore our last day we had the entire day to still spend at the hotel. Check-out time was at 12pm. This was incredibly slow. They had one person working, checking out about 30 of us in the group. We waited 1 hr 1/2 to check-out, missed breakfast, and fought with the guy to get our money back because no one came to activate our safe.4.) We were required to reserve a hospitality room to shower and change after the beach our last day. We booked the hospitality room for 5:20pm, they did not give us a key until 6:00pm. We went to the hospitality room to find that the toilet was plugged, there were no clean towels, and there was no water, plus the shower head was broken. They did not want to give us another room instead they sent a guy from maintenance to repair it while we waited in the room, then we waited forever for someone to bring us clean towels!!! We missed dinner, and just made our bus to the airport. OVERALL REVIEW:Check-In: We were excited to be in the warm Dominican Republic, getting away from the snow, therefore the slow check-in did not really get to us. There were 2 couples ahead of us, and it took about 20 min to check-in. We were greeted with a small bottle of rum, and they explained that we could have 2 beers and 2 soda's each day from the mini-bar, however everything else we had to pay for. We had to carry our own luggage to our rooms, no one helped us, and we were not given any welcome drinks. Perhaps, this is because we arrived late, 1 am.Hotel Room: The hotel room was very nice. We had a nice view of the pool. The bed was extremely comfortable, as well as the pillows which was important to us. There was a plasma tv which was also very nice. The bathroom was nice, the tub had jet's which was relaxing, and the shower had good pressure. Overall, we did not see any mold in our room and it was clean. However, some other rooms definitely have mold in them because you can see it on some of the doors of other rooms on the floor below us.Beach: The beach was horrible the first 3 days that we were there, there was a lot of black seaweed both on the beach and in the ocean. They tried their best to clean it twice a day, however it just kept coming. The last 4 days however, were the total opposite. The beach was completely clean and the water was clear. Perhaps, some bad water came along. The beach is soft white sand, the waves are calm. There were always enough lounge chairs, and shade could always be found.Activities: There was always something fun going on around the resort. We did not participate much in activities, however you could always hear music, and something fun happening. *** If you want to go out one night outside of the resort, I recommend CLUB IMAGINE this was amazing. We paid $20 US a bus took us from the hotel to a hugeeeeee cave, called imagine. In the cave we could have 2 drinks part of our price, and each part of the cave had a different D.J. It was one of the coolest night clubs I have seen. It is worth going!!! Ask the entertainment guys at the hotel about the club.FOOD: Here is where my boyfriend and I have different opinions. He says that he liked the food and that it was good. My opinion differs. The breakfast buffet is ok, you have eggs, beacon, toast, cereal. However there is minimal fruit and variety. Because we were in the Bavaro part, we had access to a restaurant called aqua, we could go there for breakfast and dinner, it is not buffet style, it is a la carte, for breakfast they had 3 choices, which got boring, after 3 days. Dinner, was the good part because you had access to 5 a la carte restaurants that you didn't have to make reservations for. You could just go. You had the American grill, which was great, Mare, which is on the beach, seafood, this was very romantic. You have the Japanese restaurant, we didn't go to that one, not a big fan. And there is aqua, which was nice. The buffet restaurant windows was horrible. Very minimal choice, we would walk around twice, have empty plates and have to go to one of the a la carte restaurants. For lunch you had the windows buffet and the beach buffet. I was so annoyed because all they have is fried chicken, french fries, pasta, burgers. All junk food. There was very minimal choice for lunch, and it was always the same. Overall, you were never hungry, however I expected more from the buffet restaurants.Overall: The grounds are nice, they have nice big clean pools, the bars had a large variety, it wasn't over crowded. it is a small romantic resort, the staff are nice, considering they are over-worked. Some guys we saw working breakfast, lunch, and dinner all week we were there, they treated you nice regardless if you tipped or not. We experienced some problems that made it disappointing, like I mentioned above, however it was a nice 4 star hotel for the price we got. In Addition, when we were there, there were a lot of europeans, therefore a lot of the women were top-less on the beach, even around the pool area. Kind of inappropriate, considering kids were around the pool area, and people were eating at the restaurant on the beach.Hopefully I covered everything, if not, please send me a message.

<Author>all4jah
<Content>Great if you get it at a good price Four friends and I decided to travel here for our Christmas university break. We booked online and chose this resort because it had a 4 star rating on Orbitz and was very cheap. We paid $162 (USD) a day for a 7-day vacation, including flights from Seattle, WA. After we booked it, I found all of the negative reviews here on TripAdvisor. Needless to say, I was very worried. We arrived on December 14th and stayed until the 22nd. First off, some reviewers had a problem getting to the hotel. It's really easy, just hire a taxi. It cost $30 USD for a trip to the resort and they all know where it is. Doesn't matter how many people you cram in the taxi, and its quick and direct.Upon arrival in the morning, we checked in. There was no line in front of us, though I noticed that the check-in counter is ridiculously busy in the late afternoons. The person helping us was friendly enough, though it was hard to always understand him and he kept making fun of us. I think he was trying to be friendly, but it wasn't professional. We also got a free drink at the check-in counter.We were placed in Block 3. I'd originally requested a suite in blocks 9, 10 or 11, but they were all filled. Block 3 is a renovated portion of the resort that overlooks the ocean and pool. After walking around, I much preferred Block 3 from anywhere else.We had the third floor. Very high ceilings, two queen-sized beds. The room was large and clean, though the bathroom shower water was rarely very hot (but not cold, either...just that medium hot that's irritating when you're cold from the pool). The grounds are nice. The pool is big, though we spent most of the time at the beach. The beach isn't the nicest, and its on the atlantic side of the Dominican Republic so its windier. Lots of seaweed, though there are men who clean it up as it gets washed ashore. Lots of chairs and huts for shade; that was never a problem. You can also walk down the coast and find nicer beaches. I'd STRONGLY suggest getting a tour to Saona Island...best daytrip ever and that's where you'll find pristine white beaches and that clear, green-blue water that you think of when you think of the Caribbean.The food was good. All the restaurants are free except for the Japanese restaurant, so we never ate there. We ate at the Tex-Mex restaurant three times, the seafood restaurant one, and the Italian restaurant twice. For lunch, we ate at the snack bar (fries, burgers, fried chicken, and random main dishes). Breakfast, we'd eat at Windows. We only ate at Windows once for dinner. The restaurants are clean and the food is good. We liked the Italian restaurant the most. The hotel gives you reservation tickets and tells you you can only eat at one restaurant once. We went several times. Sometimes they asked for a ticket, sometimes they didn't. But they just leave the used tickets out on a desk and we grabbed extras.There are something like six bars. The drinks are ok, most of the time they don't know how to mix stuff so you have to know exactly what you want. Don't expect anything too fancy. If you want to get drunk, it's easy. Just do a lot of tequila shots.The people can be very rude and pushy, or very nice. The sales people that come on the grounds to sell you tourist trinkets are annoying and you just have to be firm and tell them you're not interested.I'd strongly suggest going off the resort for excursions. We did a Saona Island trip (all day) and an ATV ride (4 hours). Both were totally worth it.This resort is EXCELLENT if you are getting a good price.  
<Date>Dec 27, 2008

<Author>JaneeSLC_Utah
<Content>Only if bargain rate Our 2nd room was WONDERFUL; the first one was stinky-smeling and took us 36h to get them to switch us. FOOD: they tried, but hey, this is DR; can't expect American taste in food preparation Don't expect INTERNET, even if paid for in a shop.STAFF very sweet, friendly, and helpful.BIGGEST PROBLEM--nighttime noise. Security guards everywhere did nothing to stop loud, sometimes drunk guests gathered around pool between buildings, room patios, or sidewalks--groups of 4-10, lasted 30-45 minutes until finally my very loud SHHHH!. This at 2, 3, or 4am every night. (Paradise shouldn't require a sleeping pill!) Sometimes guards were the ones playing outside radios at 4am!! Loud music and partying 'til last die-hards go off to sleep is typical Latin culture most places; NOT expected in a more expensive resort2nd complaint--smoking all through the lobby. Though open air, impossible to avoid the smoke.Oh, WATCH YOUR KIDS!! Could fall easily down a 3-story shaft in building 9. Hotel aghast, but never put a lock on the main hallway closet the 5d we were there.Oh, you'll rarely get Internet, even if you pay for it.

<Author>tgrant64
<Content>nice basic hotel w/ some issues The hotel was nice. But there are some issues that travelers should be aware of when visiting. The property is being renovated. The bathroom was very basic and in need of renovation. The property lost power several times and at one point the bathrooms were not working. The time periods seem to be for one hour or less.The best things about the visit were the staff and the food. The staff is very nice and worked very hard to meet all of our needs. The food was very good and plentiful.If you want a basic vacation and are not too concerned about the property, this would be a good spot. If you want something nicer this may not be for you.Also, there are more vendors, timeshare and people selling things than I am used to for visiting other properties in the DR. I would rate this property 2.75

<Author>funinthesun099
<Content>tourist trap The good reviews must be from people who have never seen anything other than their back yard before. I have seen better service in 3 star resorts in Cuba. This was the first place ever where tipping was totally useless. Nicely polished on the outside, totally rotten inside. Don't go there with babies and don't travel with Air Transat/Nolitours: 5 hours delay getting there from Toronto. 1 more hour waiting in the bus at the Punta Cana airport so that they could cram more people inside from other pending flights. 1 more hour waiting to be checked in (around 2 am with a 9 months old baby). Total time: about 11 hours. I've reached destinations in Europe faster than this.... Travelling back: 2 hours to be checked out (try that with your baby crying in your arms). Getting overcharged for minibar water that was supposedly included in the price (had to take it since they missed leaving us the regular 2 bottles one day). The most pathetic checkout process ever. 1.5 hours flight delay due to a supposed snow storm in Toronto that never happened. 1.5 hours waiting for the baby stroller at the baggage claim (came in after all of the other people picked up their baggage). Total travel time approx. 8 hours. I've never seen an airline more pathetic than Air Transat.The italian and japanese restaurants were ok. We tried the Seafood restaurant and had to leave after not being even served the appetizer after 1 hour. Never tried any other after that. Had dinner at the Aqua the rest of the time. The Aqua (for the Cameleon club residents) was all right but had a very limited menu. Not much to eat in the morning either except for eggs. Wouldn't have touched the cold cuts if my life were threatened...Windows restaurant food was ok but service (such as getting a glass of wine) was almost non-existent even though there were a lot of servers running around aimlessly.Constantly bombarded by people trying to sell you something.Water always had some algae and debris of all sorts and was agitated and unclear. None of the resorts fault; I think there are some currents that bring all the stuff onto this part of the shore.Boats idling their engines on the right side of the beach (there's a boating club over there) caused the air to smell worse than the 401 highway in the middle of the day.For the bright side, the resort seems well mantained on the outside and the beach is nice.Water around 26 celsius. Pool water very cold.Would I go there again ? No way. I've been to 6 countries in the Caribbean / Central America area and this was my worst experience. I decided not to go to the Dominican Republic again either due to the poor service and the large number of people there who seemed mentally retarded at best while regarding tourists like walking stupid money bags.....

<Author>T1980
<Content>DONT GET MARRIED HERE!!!!! I had 18 friends and family accompany me to the Grand Oasis Punt Cana Dec 4-11th. I was supposed to get married there (my fiance and I broke up before the trip , so we turned it into a family vacation) THANK GOD I did not get married there as I would have been VERY upset. Our problems started at check in. As an anniversary gift, my friends were going to upgrade to a suite. They didnt have that available. They put us in building 10. This is the new area. So new in fact that after a long night of drinking we woke up to hammering, drilling at 0800!! I then asked them to move us, as that was unacceptable. If they are not done that section, they should not have people stay there. We then all moved rooms to buildings 3 and 7. Those were o.k. Through out our week the power went off atleast 3 times, the maids went on strike, there were no face cloths, no beach towels, they charged me $22 for a local call, the list goes on and on. They were so unorganized, I cant imagine how a wedding would turn out. They told us we could get married on the beach, but there wasnt really any good place where they could have set it up. I dont know why they would say that they have wedding packages. All in all, we made the best of our trip. When we initally booked it a year ago, reviews were good, and it was listed as 35th most popular hotel. I would NEVER tell friends to stay here. Half of our group was there for 2 weeks, and they stayed in a great hotel the first week. They all said the Grand Oasis was terrible, the beach wasnt as nice, the staff was rude. We even met some flight attendants the night before, on our flight home, they stated they will not be staying there anymore as the flight company needed to have certain standards. For the price we paid, we totally got ripped off!! If you get a cheap deal, it would probably be o.k, but dont even consider getting married there!!!!  
<Date>Dec 13, 2008

<Author>alenka-a
<Content>Mixed Feelings I just got back today from a week long vacation at Grand Oasis Punta Cana and read the first couple reviews - something I should have done BEFORE going on the trip. The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous (if you overlook the fact that to get to the hotel you must pass by the broken down city and riding in a bus/taxi by a driver that drives like a maniac). However, the problem indeed was the fact that the people cannot speak a word of English. Our check out this morning was at 9 am and yet when we arrived last week, our room wasn't ready till 3 pm. As soon as you step into the hotel be prepared to be BOMBARDED with salesmen calling you amigo and trying to sell you something. Also be prepared that they WILL try and rip you off. I suggest having a travel agent arrange all your activities to save money. Their gift shops sell beautiful things, but to my dismay - expensive things. What got me the most was the fact that ALL the staff was hitting on me (young adult female) and my mom. The men have no problem staring you up and down whether you like it or not. In fact, nevermind the younger men, a 40 something or older man wanted to show me a good time thinking that I had my own hotel room and we wouldn't need to tell anybody because of the age difference. It wasn't until my dad was around everywhere my mom and I went that men behaved in such inappropriate manner. Our room was average. Nothing special but not bad. However when it came to servicing rooms that's when the problems started. If you want to wake up at 6 am on your vacation then you're fine, but if you want to sleep to say 9 am, you won't be able to because the maids there act as foreign roosters shouting to one another in Spanish while standing on two opposite sides of the hallway. Also, they never have enough towels to give you (they bring towels around 5 pm) and we actually had our luggage lost and needed toilettries. However, all we got were 2 half empty tubes of shower gel. We asked if they had shampoo they said they didn't but ended up giving it to us 4 days later when we didn't need it anymore. The pool is beautiful, the whole scenery with palm trees and flamingoes is gorgeous. They have a bar on every corner so if you're a drinker - you'll be okay. But if you're looking for some peace and quiet, you need to go a little further into the beach, as near the pool there is always music playing and little contests. the beach is beautiful but the ocean and the shoreline is covered in seaweed so usually people stay near the pool. The contests that are organized by the staff are very sexual but fun. And you practically get forced to get involved. The food was great. Not much variety - the main meal involves rice or pasta and occasional potatoes but I ate like a pig and have no complaints. For breakfast you get REAL 100% fruit shakes that are AMAZING but for lunch and dinner you get juice out of the bottle that you can by in any grocery store. At night there is always disco club going on that you can hear in your room while trying to fall asleep and sometimes electricity dies out EVERYWHERE and you need to wait 1 - 2 hours while they fix it. Now light isn't the only problem. Their electricity is connected with hydro so if your lights aren't working, neither will your sink/toilet/bath. Good luck flushing! Overall, it was my first vacation so I have nothing to compare it to but if you're coming down here you must: bring a man, and get involved as much as possible otherwise there's nothing to do but lie out and tan. Also there's a bazaar that sells everything the gift shops sell but you can get it 3 times cheaper if you bargain. But when you do get there - since you do not have Canadian or American staff serving you - do not give expect them to serve you like you get served in Canada or U.S. One family ended up in jail because of a salad situation. Also, they have a safe that you NEED to purchase for $21 otherwise your stuff WILL go missing. One man's cell phone was stolen while charging on his first day there. And not even that, don't depend on them taking care of YOU. YOU need to go and ask questions. Also, always have american $$ on you for transportation purposes. I think other hotels won't make you pay for it. Anyways, very beautiful with setbacks like sexually addicted men and serice. Good luck! and Enjoy.  
<Date>Dec 7, 2008

<Author>fun2run
<Content>very disappointing My husband and I stayed one week at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana with eight family members. We are seasoned travelers to the Caribbean and all-inclusive hotels. The exdperience here was, by far, the least enjoyable. It began the first day of our arrival.We all waited hours after the check-in time for our rooms. Two couples in our group arrived at their rooms only to find water all over their bathroom floor from a plumbing problem and one rooms bathroom door was leaning on a wall not installed! The rooms of the others were not supplied with bath towels, so we had to wait to shower even longer. When we complained to the staff for other rooms, we were told there were none to switch to. We called Expedia to change hotels, but got us hours of frustration on the phone with them and got no where. We were stuck! The rest of the week was fair. We still had to wait for dry towels everyday. The one couple still had problems with plumbing. We were not allowed to leave our wet bathing suits out on the balcony to dry, therefore, even though we had more than one suit, they were never fully dry. We've always looked forward to the wonderful variety of good food but, again, this was not the case here. Windows, the one place open for breakfast, was always in good supply of flies and always short staffed when it came to coffee refills or cleaning tables. Despite air conditioning, everything remained damp in our room. Our rooms were all in one hallway in building 3 which was all newly renovated. I hate to think what it was like before. The grounds were very pretty and the pool was always inviting, but that didn't make up for the all the disappointments we encountered. We definitely blew it with this hotel!

<Author>nazaar
<Content>Horrible - Not a 5 Star I would not recommend this place to anyone.The hotel itself and staff over all was good, but it's definitely not a 4.5 or 5 star resort.They alway ran out of towel and sometimes didn't have any at all. <Author>racespace
<Content>Worst Place in the Carribean Not sure where to begin but we stayed at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana, scheduled for 6 nights. We were searching for flights back to the US after 2 days. We decided to give it anther chance but finally left 2 days early. This place is a dump and not as advertised on their website nor on Travelocity's site. There was trash on the beach (dirty diapers, cups, mild crates, old shoes we even saw a SYRINGE). HOW DISGUSTING!!!!! It's pretty bad they have one person cleaning up the natural sea grass that washed ashore but they leave the actual trash on the beach.We stayed in Room 1108 for 3 nights. That is Block 1. Behind Block 1 is the theater. In front is the pool bar, courtyard and disco. It was loud all day and well into the night. We were finally able to get sleep starting around 3-4am. We asked 3 days in a row to be moved but they kept telling us there were no rooms available. Funny when we finally paid for Internet service we checked and saw there were rooms available. That right, PAID FOR INTERNET. Wow an all inclusive resort where you pay for more things than you realize. Even the basic Hampton Inn's in the US have a free breakfast, free alcohol and evening snacks and free Internet. The cleaning service also woke up around 7:30 am each morning even though the Do Not Disturb sign was on the door.The food was all fried and no color at all. French fries, rice, fried fish, fried potatoes, hamburgers, hotdogs, bland pasta, hard bread, horrible deserts, melted ice cream. There was no really good fresh fruit. Only over ripe papaya, tasteless watermelon, star fruit that was not ripe but the pineapple was great. There were no strawberries, no bananas, no coconut, no citrus, no mango, no kiwi, no grapes, no apples or pears or cantaloupe.The drinks were all low shelf liquor. There were no American brands of liquor on the property at all. The majority of the bartenders only knew how to make basic drinks. Rum and cola, bad vodka and cranberry, too sweet pina coladas and rum and cola. Any basic drink I ordered, amaretto sour, whiskey sour and margarita they had to go ask how to make them. The beer was good!Lastly, we were the few American/English speaking people on the property. Most were from Europe and were extremely rude. They loved to cut in line while waiting for tables at the buffet or bar. They used their hands and unclean plates to get more food at the buffet. Hello...that what they make the tongs for!!! They were all very rude.We were really disappointed in the food, the people, the staff, the drinks, lack of activities and the property in general. There are way too many places in the Caribbean that are better than here! Also beware of ll Inclusive?here. We were told we could eat at Windows buffet and the beach Garden as much as we wanted. The Italian, Seafood and Tex-Mex restaurants can only be eaten at only once during your stay. You can eat here twice if you stay 14 days or longer. Now is that really all inclusive?I would not recommend this property to anyone!!!!!!!!!  
<Date>Nov 25, 2008

<Author>matthaus19
<Content>We will not be going back I stayed at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana (GOPC) with my girlfriend on Nov. 17th through Nov. 21st of 2008. This was our first vacation together so we spent some time researching the various resorts in the DR and when we came across the GOPC, it fit our budget the best. We read many reviews and saw a trend -- either people loved this place or they hated it. So we figured overall the place is probably average so why not try it out. It's relatively cheap afterall. Also, we figured that for the people who hated it, they were probably really picky and were expecting too much of a cheap all-inclusive place. Well, after spending four nights at the GOPC, I sadly have to agree with those reviewers who were very critical of the resort. Here's our observations of the resort (both problematic and positive)...you can make up your own mind.(1) Check in -- I was surprised by how quickly we were able to check in. It may have had to do with the fact that we flew in around 5 pm.(2) Our room -- we stayed in 1303 (building 1, room 303). Room was pleasantly large. First problem was that the fan wouldn't run without the attached light being on. When we tried to call the front desk, our phone didn't work (it wasn't fixed for another two days -- despite repeated requests). The maid was really cool and attentive -- we left her about $2-3 per day. ONE THING -- make sure you put the bolt/chain on the door whenever you're in the room. The first night we were fast asleep and someone tried to get into our room they were able to use a key card and enter the room but were stooped by the bold/chain across the door (I think the hotel rebooked our room to another guest -- my impression is that the front desk is really disorganized and does not keep track of which rooms are checked out etc. -- btw, random people trying to enter our room at night because the rooms were probably rebooked happened two different time on two different nights -- just be aware of this. It could be a really alarming experience if you're by yourself). Also, avoid building 1 -- it's right next to the theater where they hold the nightly events and right next to the early morning construction. A better bet would be building 5 or 7.(3) Pool - was the big plus. The main pool was big. I loved the swim up bar. There are multiple pools but not many people used the subsidiary pools. I spent a lot of time at the pool.(4) Beach - Terrible. Do not be fooled by the pictures. The ocean is nothing like in the pictures. I don't know if it was the time we were there but the beach and the water by the GOPC was completely saturated by seaweed. Plus, if you don't get up at 8 in the am and reserve the huts etc., you'll never get a space. Frankly I was very disappointed by the beach as it was nothing like they lead you to believe. That water is not the crystal blue you think it'll be. I basically walked on the beach twice and never went in the water.(5) Food  Drinks - Food was terrible. Now, don't get me wrong, I didn't expect 5 star food etc. But the main cafeteria (Windows) didn't (IMHO) have a variety of foods and if you're a vegetarian, don't expect many good choices (or many choices at all). I found the selection lacking. As for the restaurants on the resort. We tried the TexMex place and were so disappointed that we didn't do any of the other restaurants. The Japanese place is supposed to be the best but I wasn't up for paying the extra $15/person after the TexMex fiasco (it took them 50 minutes to get me my sub-par steak burrito or whatever). No complaints about the drinks, we were flowing and always strong. Also, did not have to wait long at the bars to get my drinks.(6) Service - Overall, the service was crap. Very few staff at the hotel said hello, many were more interested in talking amongst themselves than serving you, and if you don't speak Spanish, in general, don't expect good service. When we were there, a majority of the guest were from Spain and many of the servers weren't interested in serving those guests that didn't speak Spanish. Curiously, I found that tipping didn't get you better service. Call me a glutton for punishment but I still tipped every time. BTW, some of the staff are real jerks -- I speak a bit of Spanish and was somewhat shocked at how the servers would address some of the non Spanish speaking guests -- many times some of the bartenders addressed the guests using curse words. Another time at the disco, a bartender offered my me and my girlfriend weed. And, while he may have tought it funny, when I checked in, another frond desk guy told me that he'd offer me a better room if I tossed him some cash -- while he laughed as he said this, I thought it was poor form. Also, when in the disco or the piano bar, you'll notice that the staff would rather enjoy themselves by hanging out amongst themselves than actually cater to the guests requests.(7) Guests - Just wanted to comment on this because I've never been surrounded by a group of people more rude and just plain unpleasant as I was during our stay. Now, I'm 31 yrs. old, was in a fraternity, and can throw down with the best of them, but the crowd at the GOPC was ridiculous. The guest at the resort were about 85% European (mostly Spain. And a smattering from France, Portuguese, Dutch). There were also some Canadians and very few Americans. Now, I'm an American and I've been taught to be polite to people, wait my turn in line and hold doors for people. Now this is not a condemnation of non-Americans etc -- just a commentary on my experience. But, I found the European guests the most rude people I have ever met. Not only did they not wait in line and would cut you at the drop of a hat, most never said hello, or than you for say holding a door for them. And frankly, in the pool area, it was frankly embarrassing to watch some of them act like children. Please realized that I am in no way a prude etc. But watching 30 somethings yell and scream at 2 pm in a pool is uncalled for in a non-springbreak setting IMHO.(8) Entertainment -- Hmmm, the nightly shows, how can I put this, when I was watching it all I could think of was a bad B movie/ those 70s blacksploitation movies. Don't expect a Vegas show here. The disco had potential but the music is ear-splitingly loud. And while we were there, only played one type of music - salsa. I don't mind salsa, but if you have an international crowd, shouldn't you cater to it? (i.e., have Spanish and English music?). The piano bar had a lot of potential but it fell short due to the poor service and the fact that the staff would rather close up the bar early so that they can go dance at the disco (this is not an exaggeration, this actually happened when we were there). (9) Miscellaneous - make sure you use of the transportation services from the airport to the resort. We used Prieto tours and the total rountrip cost was $40. Not bad considering it would cost you about $60 roundtrip if you took a cab. Also, once you book the transportation, make sure you print out the voucher or they will not take you from the airport. Also, keep copies of all your paperwork. When we got in the van at the airport the guy told me that I had to pay him $30/one way (even though I had already paid). I told him to call his boss and lo and behold, he relented. Don't be pushed around by some of these people. The airport is a total fiasco. Make sure you get there 3 hrs before your flight takes off. Frankly 3 hrs is necessary because the check in process (we flew US Airways) is farcical. Many of the reps. there (1) have not clue what they are doing, (2) don't care, or (3) are completely imcompetent. We got there 3 hrs in advance and stood (not in line) but at the counter for 1.5 hrs. because they couldn't find our connection boarding passes. Total fiasco. Also, when they tag your bags when you check them MAKE SURE you check those tags before they put in on the conveyor belt -- they put the wrong tags on our bags and if we hand't noticed it, our bags would have been in Orlando, when we were flying to Pittsburgh. Finally, if you have to pay a fee for your luggage being over the permitted weight (50 lbs), make sure you have pesos, because the DO NOT accept dollas.Alright, I apologize for the rant and please ignore the poor spelling and improper grammar (I wrote this stream of consciousness). But there you have it, our experience in the DR. Now, here's the thing, I knew not to have too high expectations -- after all, I paid $1500 for two roundtrip tix and 4 nights -- but still, despite the cheap price, I think it's not too much to ask for simple professional service etc. I think this place has a lot of potential, however, until it is managed in a more efficient manner, it'll always get negative reviews, IMHO.Hope this was helpful. Happy Travels.

<Author>VaPaPutaPerry
<Content>Overall a good vacation stay These reviews were helpful.I found the hotel room to not be up to a 4.5 star level. However the rest of the hotel was nice... there is a large selection of places to eat and the food itself was good. My children had no issues with the food either. The beach is great and the pool is also well kept.I only found the hotel lacked informing the guests of entertainment through out the week. The staff that works at the hotel were great and helpful. Tipping is not required but it goes a long way.The animation crew at the hotel lacked content. They were silly and only stayed with a few guests. They did not advise everyone of the events for the day.The maid serve was great, just ask and you will receive. Spanish is their language so for those that are traveling to this country I suggest you brush up or learn basic spanish.The employees are very accommodating and will try to serve you to the best of their ability.  
<Date>Nov 22, 2008
<Rating>3	3	2	4	5	4	5	-1	
<Aspects>
19	8(day):1	68(travel):1	91(guest):1	194(tip):1	349(lack):1	352(basic):1	369(spanish):2	452(suggest):1	530(country):1	663(advise):1	698(language):1	703(learn):1	722(require):1	1106(event):1	1564(brush):1	1654(crew):1	1660(animation):1	2638(silly):1	2688(content):1

<Author>Dottypops
<Content>Could be better We booked through Thomas Cook, This was to be a special holiday for 9 of us as it was my 50th Birthday. Sadly we were disappointed. The hotel is average but nearly everyone we spoke to had some probelm with their room, whether it be the air con not working, leaking toilet, TV not working etc. Each had something wrong.The hotel either has insufficient staff or bad management as every evening when we sat at a table by a bar we had to clear it up ourselves first. I have never stayed in a hotel where they dont clear tables. Guest were also using the plastic glasses to put their cigarette end out, which then meant you could be drinking from that same plastic glass at any time.They have a piano bar which only opened once the whole 2 weeks were were there dispute this being the only bar inside and we were there when the hurricane was passing by so we had several evenings of VERY heavy rain and wind with no where to go but your room.There is a large stage outside where there was supposed to be evening entertainment. This was very poor and was repeated weekly so you saw everything badly twice. There is nowhere to go outside the hotel, just one small shop about 5 mins away if you dared to walk there which sell snacks/drinks etc.Over all we were all very disappointed with Thomas Cook for giving the rating they gave this hotel. The Rep took no interest what so ever in our comments. So our advice would be to stay away.

<Author>vacationer16
<Content>Good Stay at Grand Oasis I had a good stay and Grand Oasis Punta Cana. It exceeded my expectations since it is very solidly rated by TripAdvisor travelers as a 3.5 star hotels, giving a 5 star to a Ritz or Four Seasons hotel.I went with a group of 5 friends. I previously contacted Ines and Karen in the reservations department requesting our rooms in block 3, which has renovated standard rooms. We were honored with our request. Beds are big and comfortable, rooms are VERY clean, big and well appointed. Good selection of channels. The one-bed rooms have an enormous king size bed, perfect for couples. One person in our group had a room in block 2 because a smelly odor in her block 3 room, and her room in block 2 was nice, not renovated, but still with all the basics a room could have, and also very clean. The best of those rooms in block 2 is having the pool that faces the Suites in front of her balcony, and just 5 steps of going into that pool. It is a very quiet pool, clean and resembles a river... I loved it....The only problem i found in the room was the A/C, which its temperature didnt go below 21c, but they have ceiling fans and it was not bad at all. The room in block 2 was a little bit hotter, but it was ok. The other thing i must say about rooms in block 3 is that many of them face the main pool and bar, and sometimes during the night, if the bar is crowded and the music is loud, then you might experience some noise during your early sleep. Try and request rooms facing the garden instead if you like to sleep early and want to avoid noise. However, those with the garden view dont have a view!The beach is good but not the best in Punta Cana, there is some seaweed but there is always personnel cleaning it, so it is fine. A terrific secret about the beach: walk left for 15 minutes past the Sunscape and Natura Park hotels, and you will find a pristine water beach! It was amazing. Many tourists walk by too and there are miles of virgin beach. Lovely! Water is crystal clear and aqua blue. Very clean and waves are not hard at all. That was a very good insiders tip. Recommend it.The food is good. I went to Windows and the food is plentiful and you will always find something good to eat. I found shrimps, fish, other good selection of seafood, veal, beef, pork, pasta and bread station, fruit, dessert, vegetables, etc... Food is very above average and the items are VERY good in this buffet. Breakfast is very plentiful too, with made to order ommelets, ham, cheese, bread, sausages, bacon, pancakes, fruit, fresh juices, cereal, etc..... I went to AQUA and MARE restaurants and the food was good too. I had the steak at Aqua and it was very good! Mare is by far the best restaurant we had. Loved it. We didnt try the Japanese, American/Tex-mex nor the italian, however, i read the menus and the food and selections seemed very good. The italian had so many good treats.... You should give them a try. Aqua is the only one which needs reservations, all others are open to everyone as you walk by. The Michael Jackson show was good, there is a casino on site but it did not seem crowded. The disco is not too big but it serves the purpose. The front desk staff was very helpful, acommodating all of our requests. Sosie was great. The servers and other staff was very corteous and always smiling too. Bring lot of singles to tip maids, bartenders and food servers. It is much appreciated and will work a long way....Furnituring and landscaping of the hotel is very nice, clean grounds and ample spaces. There are plenty of chaise lounges and cabanas in the beach. Before breakfast take your beach towels to your favorite spot and have a great day.I definetely recommend the Grand Oasis Punta Cana and will be coming soon again. I am a very well traveled person, being in Europe, USA, South and Central America and stayed in many 3-4.5 star hotels. The Grand Oasis is solidly a 3.5 star, which is very good for the price i paid. If i had stayed in a suite, i would have rated it a 4 star.If you need more information about the hotel or my experience, you can email me at raymondrios@hotmail.com  
<Date>Nov 3, 2008

<Author>england1966
<Content>Not a 5 star, but not an awful place to go either. When 29Sep ?15OctPaid 714 eachRoom StandardVERY IMPORTANT ?This is NOT a 5 start hotel. Probably a 3 star.HOWEVER, if you get a good price it is still worth going to.ROOM ?Not bad, clean, spacious, we had a great view. Bit tatty around the edge, although they are currently updating and refurbishing the rooms. Was happy to spend two weeks there.FOOD ?Windows was poor, food was not warm, lots of flies, no A/c, good variety though. The other restaurants were decent, not all were open at the same time (you can eat in 5 restaurants in one night anyway) but you have to remember it was off-peak for them.SPORTS FACILITIES ?Pretty good, Volleyball etc, free canoes for the sea etc.SHOPS ?Ok, not a great variety, some were expensive. Be aware of the corner shop not having any change!STAFF ?Most were fairly miserable, but did do a good job. Our maid was good (but we did tip $3 a day) we had heard others were not so good.POOLS ?Very good, clean, spread out, not to busy (again off-peak though)DRINKS ?Very good selection.BEACH ?Very good, clean, lots of sun loungers, lots of palm trees.SEA ?As you would expect, clear, warm.RESORT AS A WHOLE ?Ok, needs some work (which they were doing), location good as only 15mins from airport.BAD Stuff:Some foodSellers on stalls on Tue  Fri, VERY VERY VERY PUSHY.Staff in general, need to smile more.Some areas of the resort need a good tidy up.Currently there is construction work on both sides of the resort.Not a great deal to do (but then you do go for the sun!)GOOD Stuff:Price we paid.Generally clean.Aqua restaurant.Jewellery shop in reception.View from room 2317.Our Maid.Beach.Sea.OVERALLWould I go back, NO. Would I recommend it to others, yes if they have paid a decent price. The main thing is to remember it is not a 5 star, if that what you are expecting, you WILL be disappointed, hence other people complaining. It does have faults, but overall it a nice resort. The staff do need to cheer up, and the food needs a massive improvement. The main reason we would not go back, is we would like to be able to walk for longer, as the beach ends pretty quickly, takes about 10mins from one end to the other, and we would like better food.TIPSWalk down and into the Natura resort near the end of the beach, as it was off-peak they said we could use there pool (you have to wear wrist bands of your own resort, so they knew we were not from there) they also have nice grounds with ducks and fish etc! The shop is also cheaper and of better quality.Take mosquito repellent with 50% DEET. Spray the vents and door frames in your room. Also use a plug in bug killer. Buy repellent patches for sunbathing etc during the day (can be worn under your clothes) Me and my partner got bit less than 12 times each, others we met got bit up to 50 times!Take Anti-Histamine bug bite cream, as you will get bit, and it will itch!  
<Date>Oct 23, 2008

<Author>N0thingbutthetruth
<Content>Please do not waste your money and valuable holidays/vacation going to this hote If you like your cold food warm and your hot food cold, poor service, accomodation in desparate need of repair(unless you pay extra) and extremely limited facilities then this is the Hotel for you.Please do not listen to the reviews that make this hotel sound wonderful because it is far from being so, the only reason I can see for giving a good report about this place is that they've wasted their hard earned money going there and don't see why others shoud'nt do the same.The hotel is situated at the moment between two building sites, and depending upon which rooms you are allocated you will notice the noise during the day.On arrival you will notice that the hotel has 5 stars below its name on the gate, believe me this should read no more than 2.Check in was ok but they tried to charge for the safe in the room which was in the all inclusive package.Which room you get is a lottery, some have new furniture some have very old and tatty furniture but if you want a nice room block 7 is the one for you,however you will be charged an extra $350 per week to upgrade and be aware that this block is next to one of the building sites I mentioned.Not all of the hotel facilities were available during my stay, noticably the five restaurants advertised were never open at the same time, at most three were available for use each day and this included the main windows restaurant.The food in the restaurants was in the main awful, warm salads and cooked meats, cold hot dishes, food not protected from flies which are in abundance. These standards applied to all restaurants we tried during our stay and I'm sorry to say to most meals, even the ones on the sizzling platters, how they managed that I am at a loss to know but believe me they did.The service in the restaurants and bars is somewhat hit and miss depending on which members of staff are working that day, but in the main the service was poor, some of the staff appeared to have all the enthusiasm of someone reluctantly doing community service. Mind you a few dollars or a tight fitting short skirt and low cut top will go a long way towards getting served a bit sooner if you get my drift.Drinks at the bar are ok but don't expect anything exotic or in a glass or with fresh ingredients eg fruit or mint as in a Mojito they simply just don't have them. The beer is not to good either but it will get you drunk it thats what you want.If you like being pestered by hotel staff every morning as you come out of the windows restaurant after breakfast trying to sell you timeshare or apartments then this is the place for you, believe me they are unrelenting trying day after day with the promise of a baseball cap and teashirt to get you into their sales office.Also twice a week Tues. and Fri. evening the main bar and entrances to the restaurants are surrounded by stalls eagerly manned by local stall holders trying to sell you their wares, on these days you will be mobbed by them as you make your way from your rooms to the restaurants for your evening meal, escape is not possible as they have all entrances and exits covered with military precision.The only good things about the hotel is the location ie right on the beach and some of the shows are ok.All in all I would not recommend this hotel, not even to my worst enemy and I would never go back there for a holiday again. There are better hotels on the island, please use them instead.  
<Date>Oct 16, 2008

<Content>l wish two weeks could last a life time. After reading 80 reviews about the hotel grand oasis i was alittle bit apprehensive,im very fussy when it comes to cleansiness and food so i was thinking all sorts of things about the grand oasis.All i can say is i didnt want to come home the staff were so lovely and friendly,treat them as you would want to be treat yourself and you will make friends for life.The staff at windows angel louis,preciuos,arismendy,mercedes,louis molina,bartolo,willy,audis,to many to mention,you couldnt meet a nicer bunch of staff they are what made our holiday,ps the water we drank was always bottled ,ice cubes from a bag ,i honestly couldnt fault a thing .see you next year amigos .karen and neil .newcastle

<Author>happytraveller4093
<Content>Don't go to the Grand Oasis Punta cana Hello, just wanted to warn others about this hotel, the Grand Oasis Punta Cana , my wife and I tried to stayed there in April 2008 and were very disappointed. I have been to the Dominican several times before and have enjoyed the island and it's people. We are both very relaxed travellers and usually do not let the little things get to us, after all we are on holidays. So here's my rant, check in was a nightmare, slow and disorganized, and also found out that the hotel had been overbooked so we were put at a Sister Hotel, which was not up to the same standards as the Hotel we paid for. We did not actually get to stay at the hotel, my complaints are with the treatment from hotel staff, particularily reservations . We were given a complimentry 1 week gift certificate as a good will gesture from the Hotel for all the problems we had ( we did not request this or complain ), the problem is trying to use it. The certificate says just call and book 1 month in advance, I tried to do this ( well in advance ) and was given the run around from the start. I spoke to reservations and was told there was lots of room in the resort at the time we wanted to go, once they found out that I was wanting to use the complimentry certificate things got complicated. They requested a faxed copy of the certificate so they could verify it's authenticity, from there on in it was frustrating trying to get ahold of anyone as they would not return my many calls or e-mails for over a week. When they finally did get back to me they said that there was no room at the resort for the time we requested ( even though they already told us that there was lots of room ). It is apparent to me that they issued this certificate with the intention of never honoring it. I will certainly never stay there again, nor will I book at another Oasis Hotel.  
<Date>Oct 7, 2008

<Author>lisasfather
<Content>not a 4 star! we just returned on saturday, oct.4-08.this is definitely not a 4 star hotel (this is our 5th stay in D.R.-three times in Puerto Plata, twice now in Punta Cana).had problems checking in, told our rooms would be another3 and a half hrs...we were too early!.check in was only at 3pm..all 3 couples of us..(not alot of rooms to get ready here)and we could use a public washroom to change, and thencarry our carry-on luggage around with us! after complaining tomanagement, we got a room in an hour or so..but it was nota great welcome. Our room was in building 4...mould in theceiling the size of your hand...the stairs to the rooms weremissing chunks of stone -dangerous- and the doors to therooms had very little, if any paint left on them...the place looksvery tired and in need of a facelift. even at the buffet, cosmeticrepairs are needed badly.the hotel was very empty..2/3 of buffet was closed, and eventhen, approx. 50 people at a time..food was ok..not thebest selection, but enough.on the plus side,...the beach is beautiful, all staff friendly andcourteous. The maid was exceptional...lots of towels, barrefills, and cleaned to perfection.would we go back? no.

<Author>vanswarptour
<Content>This is the review to read! If you have not stayed in a 5 star resort before.......Then you will love this place!. If you have stayed in a 5 star resort then it may see disappointing at first but It is a beautiful location and the beach really is second to none. You must remember that this is not a rich country so expect some differences. TIP - you will be given a room in the lower blocks upon arrival (stay there one night the beds are actually quite comfy) then the next day during your orientation complain that your room isn't up to your standards and they will give you a much nicer room in the higher blocks. However if you do like your room and a comfy bed and being close to everything is important than just stay put because while blocks 8-11 are nicer rooms the beds are hard are there is construction next door. The rooms will always have a damp feel it is not the hotel it is simply the climate so just try to keep sliding door open while you are in the room and it should help. Bring washcloths** they dont see to have any and it is definatley something you will want. Tip people who do nice things for you ie: maid, bartenders and waiters who give extraordinary service they will remember and it will insure prompt service the whole trip.The vendor selling things will ask a much higher price off the bat so barter with the you can usually get it for 1/3 the asking price. They are persistent at ties especially on the vendor night but by being polite and simply saying no and keep walking you wont have too much trouble ( they are poor ppl and this is how they make a living) .The drinks are great again dont expect to have name brand alcohol but the generic brands are good and there are so many drinks to choose from ( again your in there country dont expect them to have everything your accustom to, enjoy yourself) Overall the food is alright and does seem to get better as the week progresses. WINDOWS BUFFET is mediocre but you can find some tasty food there. This isn't 5 star so dont expect 5 star food . As for people complaining of no air in the restaurants they have huge fans and you are going to a hot country its going to be hot deal with it. Sitting inside the restaurant helps with any insects that might come along they seem to like the patio more.BOTTOM LINE: If you expect too much or think too highly of yourself yes you will feel somewhat disappointed. If you just want a relaxing fun week in the sun then its a good choice.  
<Date>Sep 29, 2008

<Author>bronco4life98
<Content>made the best of it.... CT I recently vacationed in punta cana sept. 2-6... this was during the time when Hurricane Hanna decided to grace us with her presence l0l.. I was very pleased with the resort and the front desk crew (hola luis) for making our stay as comfortable as possible during this time.. We stayed in building 26 (this building has renovated rooms and is close to the beach) The only problems that we had was during one of Hanna's rainy nights it started leaking in our bathroomwhich made it hard to use the toliet. It was hard to communicate with the night shift because they spoke little english.. so we waited until the morning and politely spoke to the front desk and explained our situation.. we were allowed to move to another room.. Also the hotel provided each room an umbrella and a ride to your room on a golf cart.. Restuarant: the buffet is the same everyday.. make reservations at the other restuarants.. I personally loved Le Reces (Brazilian) the late night pizzeria always came in handy.. Entertainment:: was great.. you must have fun and participate.. I won a bottle of dominican rum (yea)Beach: was breathtaking.... after hanna decided exit stage left... we were able to enjoy the white sand and the water... you must take a stroll along the beach.. Spa: you must get a 60 min full body massage.. it was wondering. I will return to Punta Cana but next time I would like to see what another resort can offer..

<Author>HSandHA
<Content>5 stars?? Ie been in 4 stars much better then Gran Oasis Loved my second time in Punta Cana, but I wouldn go back again to Grand Oasis Punta Cana.When my boyfriend and I made our check-in at the hotel we were told that we were getting a deluxe room, but if we had any problems with the room we could upgrade to a junior suite for an extra $50 a night!! That sounded strange?what problems could a deluxe room have!? Well?when we got to the room it had a very strong smell of moister, the bathtub seemed that it hadn been cleaned in a long time and the windows didn closed.We complaint to the reception and they immediately showed us another room. This second room had the same smell (I couldn stay there because of my allergies) and same problem with the windows. The third room we visited looked (and smelled) much better, although it was clearly older them the previous 2, but we decided for that one.When we took our first bath, we discovered that the bathtub had some kind of leak to the bathroom floor and we always had to use 1 towel to stop the leak; luckily there was always an extra bath towel, although we only had one 1 hand towel.The room balcony columns and walls were full of cracks and the handrail seemed to be falling (we didn spend much time there enjoying the wonderful view to the beach). The maids in our floor started to clean the rooms very early in the morning (around 6:30 or 7:00am) and never knocked before they enter.We met another Portuguese couple in the hotel that was staying in block 9 he honeymooner block?(our first room was in block 6, we saw another in block 2 and the last one in 4) and their room was a completely different story. They tolds they had a new and very clean room and their only problem was the moister smell in the first day and the lack of the tv remote for 2 days.Another big problem was the food?in the main restaurant (indows? there was a large variety but everything tasted the same; the salads and desserts were out of the cold (even the ice cream); and there were flies all over the food and tables.One night we tried to go to the Tex-Mex restaurant but it was closed because the hotel was having a low season and they started closing the restaurants. The alternative was the main one or the Japanese that was not included (had to pay $15 a person). One day I got sick after eating at are?(seafood restaurant). We talked to the other Portuguese couple, which went to are?the same night and the girl ordered the same food I did?she got sick too. We couldn handle anything in our stomachs for a couple of days. The hotel staff was always helpful and very friendly, but just the staff doesn make a 5 star hotel!! I've just been to 3 different all inclusive hotels (2 of them 4 stars) but this one was by far the worst.

<Author>jaydensmother
<Content>worst vacation of my life this hotel was a nightmare. i went with friends and family and most of us got sick. the first day we got there we went to eat at Windows and there was no air conditioner they had the windows open and a big cockroach flew onto our table. then a couple of night later we were going to eat at the same restaurant and we saw a mouse by the entrance and the server asked us if we were not going in and when we said no she replied just because of that. there were also lots of flies all over he food. The best meal that i had all week was a taco salad form wendys at the airport. The service was horrible. we never had any clean towels (we always had to call for them to bring them up) and the maid would start cleaning the room at like 6 in the afternoon so we had to leave our room just to let her clean. and once we gave her a $10 tip and we told her to please make sure that we had at least 3 towels in the room and when we got back we didnt even have a hand towel. we called the front desk and it took them like 30 mins to bring them to us. there was also never any towels by the pool. our room was never clean. i have a baby who got sick witha fever and threw up all over the bed and the sheets had a red stain on them and i told the lady to please change the sheets and i went back to the room and i checked and it was the same sheet. also, one night my friend sat at the end of the bed it broke and it took maintenance like 2 hours to come up. so when we finally went to sleep the bed (that they had just fixed) broke again and my husband and i had to sleep in the bed like that. we never had any toilet paper. my friend called the fornt desk for toilet paper and it took them 30 min to come up while her daughter was sitting in the toilet waiting for it. also we booked our hotel through apple vacations and our room service was included but when we got there they told us they charged $6 for froom service and we did it many times and then we found out we were not supposed to pay for it. so when we told the manager they said there was nothing they could do about it because they didnt know which server it was. also there was never any umbrellas by the pool becuase people would put their towels on the chairs and never come back and when we told management they said they didnt have any rules for that. I've read some reviews that say not to forget that it's the south and people dont loive the same way and while that might be true, myself, being dominican (born and raised), i never had service like that anywhere else i went. I been to hotels in Puerto Plata and they're absolutely beautiful and the service is great. I had nevr been to punta cana before and going to the oasis made me not wanna go there again. Dominican Republic is beautiful but if you go make sure you dont stay at the Grand Oasis. Pay the extra money and stay at the RIU. believe me its worth it.

<Author>Snorkling_Bunny
<Content>Surprisingly - very good ! We were a little scared booking as we read the reviews ! but once we arrived we realized that the people writing bad reviews must have had a bad attitude themselves ! Hotel - excellent shape, very good rooms. everything works and if it doesn't all you have to do is mention it and it gets done momentarily. they really try hard to maintain the resort in good shape. staff - great people ! we had a blast with them singing and being so positive to all the people.beach - awesome ! very clean ... we went to visit other resorts in the area and ours was by far the best and the cleanest from the rest. Snorkling is great ! Catamarans were fun . Bar was working 24 hours and no one bugs you from running around doing crazy things. Excellent night entertainment and Disco.Food - great variety ! amazing breakfast choices, lunch was special especially when they were making seafood on a grill right in front of you ... we ate like 4 plates ! Dinner was really special in a la carte restaurants. the only thing is if you go in a large group reserving space in a restaurant was a pain in the [--].Everyone tried hard to make our stay great and comfortable, lots of entertainment available during day and night ! great for young people and couples but defenitely NOT a good resort to bring small kids.Make sure to appreciate peoples hard work and leave a tip. even a $1 works great. We tipped $2 to our cleaning maid and had extra water and extra towels every day. Overall we were very happy ! the people, the beach, the food, the alcohol it was worth the money we spent !
