<Author>motheroftwoNewJersey
<Content>wouldn't go there again Maid service was horrible, she didn't come to clean the room until about 6pm everyday and never left clean towels, we had to complain and wait 1/2 hr to 1hr or more for some clean towels. My sister in law waited a 1/2 hr in the hallway oneday for some toilet paper while my niece sat on the toilet. Maid never changed the sheets on the beds the whole time we were there. Everytime we went to get our beach towels they were always out of them. No policy on beach chair reserving, for example I was traveling with small children and everytime we went to the pool there was never no lounge chairs available under the umbrellas, people had reserved them with their towels and left for hours, so a few days into the trip we started to montior how long it took people to come back to their chairs, one couple reserved the chairs first thing in the morning and came back at 5:30pm stayed for 10 min and left to go eat and NEVER came back, another couple I saw reserved chairs by the pool and by the beach, stayed on the beach all day then came back to their lounge chairs by the pool for about 30 min, then left again to the beach never to return to the pool, mind you their towel was on the pool lounge chair all day, so we began complaining to the managers about the situation explaining to them that we are traveling with small children and we need an umbrella, and that people reserve the chairs and never use them, they basically told me oh well, theres nothing they can do. so my sister in law woke up at 5am every morning from then on, grabbed towels and went to reserve chairs for our family and then went back to bed. My 4 yr old had to use the bathroom when we were by the pool one day, so i rushed her to the nearest poolside restroom, there was only two stalls both toilets were clogged one with bo and the other with multiple tampons and urine, the bathroom stunk and was filthy, i ran out carrying the baby yelling for my husband to take her in the mens room, he came running out saying that one was filthy too, so he had to run her back to the hotel room. one day we were eating in the buffet and my sister in law spotted a huge bug on the wall behind the bar, she told the waiter and he just laughed, everyone was skeeved, all of the sudden the bug flew from the wall across the bar and on to our table, we screamed it was a huge flying cockaroach, the wait staff tried to calm us down saying that they had the windows open today and it probably came in then. BULL CRAP a few days later I woke up in the middle of the night half asleep to use the bathroom, as i am using the bathroom something moving catches my eye, another huge flying cockaroach, I ran screaming almost giving my husband a heart attack. Again complaining to the managers and no one gave a crap! The food wasn't all that, the best place to eat was the beach patio resturaunt (can't remember the name) and that food was alright, all the liquor is watered down BIG TIME! Overall it really wasn't worth the money, I regret booking it, we go to a different country every year and this one was by FAR the worst trip! Before i booked this trip i checked book it.com and they gave it 4 1/2 stars, i checked a few other places I can't remember and they all had given the hotel 4 stars, i dont know where they get their info from, I wouldn't even give it 2 stars!

<Author>KentLoz
<Content>Do not worry!!!! We only got back this morning and stayed here for 2 weeks. After reading the reviews on here my fiance and I are very worried about this hotel. If you are picky and like to complain about trivial things then dont stay here. We had a room in block 5 overlooking the adult pool. The building does need updating but the hotel is being refurbished so it will get there eventually. (im glad we didnt stay up the posh end as there was some building work going on). The room was big and the bed huge, the television worked fine and in the second week there were loads of good chanels, the room is basic but unless you are going to spend the whole time in the room, who cares? The air conditoning worked well and the maid cleaned really well and topped the mini fridge up with beer, soft drinks and water. There were a few days when we didnt get clean towels until the early afternoon and there were a few ants in the room a couple of days. The buffet restaurant was a bit hit and miss, really nice food one night then not so good the next, the water and ice in there is fine it is all bottled! Breakfast is definately the best meal and they do try to cater for everyone. Some of the plates have chips in them and when we were late eating they did run out of plates a few times but they would be replaced after about a two minute wait. The grounds are kept really nice and the pools are really clean, the entertainment is good and the staff speak english but they do like it if you have a go at speaking spanish. The beach is lovely. We had friends staying in a 5 star hotel and we walked there a few times, took nearly 2 hours along the beach which was a really nice walk. We had a great time even in the tropical storms, we saw lots of people complaining about little things which they made into a big deal. If you go here expecting luxury and perfection you will be disapointed, go with an open mind and chill out you will have a great time, we loved it!  
<Date>Sep 9, 2008

<Author>Namor1
<Content>Recommend other Hotel. Loved Punta Cana I enjoyed myself here; however, there were quite a number of things that would have improved my stay. First issue has to do with towels. We did not have any towels in our room upon checking in and did not get a towel for the pool or beach for three days. The rooms are very nice; however, there were little things that were irritating. There was no TV remote, the TV had poor reception, there was no clock radio in the room, and the mini-bar was not cold. Also, the sliding doors to the balcony made a tremendous amount of noise when opening or closing. The main issue was the food. It could have been a lot better. First, the main eating area had absolutely no A/C and you sweat like a pig during lunch and dinner. The refrigeration there was horrible too and most of the foods that need to remain cold were always suspect. That takes a lot of available food right off the menu. The hard ice cream was ridiculously left in an open freezer area so that it was like scooping soft butter rather than ice cream. Food in the other restaurants were tremendously better, however, a meal will cost you two hours due to the poor service. Getting a cocktail was also a hassle. For example, you couldn get any type of a mixed drink in the main eating area, not even a Bloody Mary. Also, forget about getting a Mojito. It is non-existent here. The pool and beach areas were fantastic. Skip the gym as it was small, hot, had little equipment much of which was rusty. The check in and checkout process was a joke. I couldn extend my check out from 12 to 2 PM and the front desk clerk was pretty rude. I spoke to the manager who was supposed to have someone slip a note under my door to let me know I could check out later. I saw him at 12:30 and he asked if I got the message, which I never did. Great freaking service! In meeting people from other resorts, I would definitely recommend another place in Punta Cana. I would go back to DR, however, Grand Oasis is not for me.

<Author>izabo
<Content>don't read the negative...you are in the SOUTH don't forget... We were in this hotel the week of august 16... When we first arrive we got a room in block 5 wich is the lowest class room... it's ok but I always like to have the higher class room and this is very personnel... but the room was very ok.. I'm just picky... the next days we asked for a room in block 9-10 or 11 but there was none we were offered in block 7 wich is the highest...WOW...what a room.. it was a suite delux master. we had a private lounge with a big screen tv and internet free at any time of day and there was never anybody there...always very clean. so that's for the room...RESTAURANT: it's fine.... however be aware for the men to bring on pair of long pants cause you won't be able to get in... and that is the real thing, this is for the Italian restaurant. The sea food resta. wich is outside at night is ordinary,,,, for the American Grill we went 3 times... the margaritas are super good... the food is good also... the buffet is ok but I always try to go less cause I like rest. a la carte... during the days there are many choices of food on the beach: pizza, chicken, hot dogs , hamburger and many other foord... VERY GOOD ,,,fries etc...... We always bring our own glass like a plastic patio glass... it's bigger and our own... a lot of people do it the bartenders are use to it... The beach is not that long so we took a 25 min. walk back and forth 3 times a day. However the water sports with no motor are free and very fun... the guys are very nice and Philipps like people and is very helpful.We had a super nice trip... no it's not a 5 stars but it's a very good 4 - 4 1/2 .... don't forget you are in the south and not at home... people there don't live the same way we do,,, litlle things that might offend you are not important to them... like towels beeing late or other...so if you think those little things will heritate you... take a big 5 stars and again some people are so picky that a 10 stars would still not be good enough for them... so have a great vacation and I strongly recommend this hotel.  
<Date>Sep 1, 2008

<Author>CarolynnNJ
<Content>Good Time at the Oasis Don't believe all you read . . . was freaking out after reading some of the bad reviews for the Grand Oasis - but everything turned out fine. We booked our trip thru Cheap Carribean and stayed at the Grand Oasis from August 16 - 22 - 2 adults, 3 children (16, 10, 9). Requested adjoining rooms in building 5. Rooms were old, but clean. A/C worked well in our bedroom, just so, so in kids' room so we kept adjoining door open and ceiling fans on. We left a note requesting extra towels and bottles of water and $5 daily for the maid and we received both. Beach was beautiful, but something needs to be done about the people who reserve chairs and don't show up all day. We were still able to pull some chairs together under a plam tree in the shade even in the late morning or afternoon. The lazy river was very nice and not many people used this pool. Our room looked onto the adult pool and many times saw children in it. The grounds were being cleaned up constantly - always someone raking, cleaning or picking up discarded drink glasses. Food was OK. We did not drink any of the water - which was always offered at lunch and dinner - nor did we eat too much fruit or any salad. Still 3 of us experienced a slight stomach disorder the last 2 days - could of been from the ice in drinks??? Overall, a beautiful place to visit and for $1,500 (not including air) for 6 nights all inclusive for 2 rooms and 5 people - a great deal!  
<Date>Aug 26, 2008

<Author>mamajuana0009
<Content>OK The hotel is decent, but some parts looked run down. Most batrooms are clean, although many did not flush properly. The rooms were clean, spacious but not enough towels were provided. The staff are friendly and accomodating but tourists need to have more information about what is offered instead of searching on our own. The beach is spectacular and the pools are lovely, although there are no deeper ends of the pool due to no lifeguards. Plenty of food and drinks. The buffets are satisfactory but not enough variety. The restaurants are ok, portions are small and food was too salty for my taste. Spa services are affordable and pleasant. Entertainment was minimal, not too professional.Would I go to this particular resort again? I don't think so. I rate this experience average.

<Author>Heaton75
<Content>We hated it ! Having just returned from our most disappointing 2 weeks at the Grand Oasis resort I felt that I should warn other British holiday makers who may be thinking of going there. Avoid this place unless you speak Spanish, otherwise you will be the last to get served at the bar or noticed by the waiting -on staff. You can expect to order your drink two or three times before you actually get any service in Windows buffet style restaurant. The staff were rude and ignorant unless you flashed the cash! Infact I wondered whether the staff in the resort shop were infact mute ?!You will need to be at the beach by 6am if you expect to reserve a parasol by placing your towels on the sun loungers. We obviously relied on the shade of the palm trees, as we were on holiday and did not want to get up at the crack of dawn.This holiday was far from relaxing. My partner and I suffered sickness and diarhoea on more than 6 occasions from the poor food provided at this all-inclusive resort. Observing a rat running around inside Aqua a la carte restaurant really was the final straw as far as eating was concerned. We lived on boiled eggs and bananas after that experience ( the only safe options available) and couldn't wait to return to England.The other place you can expect to see live animals is around the pool and along the beach, where photographers use monkeys,parrots and iguanas as props to attract holiday makers to have their picture taken. We found this disgraceful and were amazed it was deemed acceptable by the hotel.Our room was basic and the decor tired. The towel rail came off the wall with the weight of a small hand towel and there was rust round the bathroom door hinges. The maid service was really lacking. We returned to find our room had not been cleaned eleven times during our fourteen night stay. Surely they had had enough times to service it between 8.30am and 5.30pm ? We will definitely not be returning to this hotel or resort again. Infact ,after this, our first impression of the dominican, we wil not be returning to the Island.The first time I have ever wanted to return home from a holiday. It was terrible to say the least.  
<Date>Aug 15, 2008

<Author>Muggsy0
<Content>Enjoyed our stay My family 2 adults and 2 teenagers ages 13 and 15 visited Chameleon select section of the Grand Oasis in July. The weather was wonderful-hot, sunny and no rain at all. Our flight and arrival was smooth. Finding the bus to transport us to the resort took a few minutes and getting us dropped off at the right location took a few tries. The Chameleon Select section has it's own lobby so check in went smoothly although we never received a welcome drink and the rum that we were promised in our package outline. Arriving at the front of the resort was a great disappointment-it looks terrible and we wondered what we had gotten ourselves into. Our rooms 10313 and 10314(3rd floor/has elevator but 10313 faces a wall-a better view from 10314) Asked to be changed to a room with a view but of course he said that all the rooms were full. Then we did not push so ended up in the room for the stay. Inside the room was very nice. The maids were wonderful and kept the rooms clean. The beach towels were always damp but this is to be expected with this type of climate.We enjoyed eating at the Oasis. We able to eat there for all meals if we wished. The staff got to know us so our service was great. The food at all the a la carte was good-Mare, Tex Mex/American grill and the seafood one. We easily made reservations at all the a la cartes(except the Japanese which you had to pay extra) and went to Mares 3 or 4 times for dinner. Almost everything that we ordered at the Italian restaurant was great. We ate at Windows a few times and found that it's service and food improved greatly during our stay. We found that we needed to limit the amount of fresh fruit that we ate as it made our stomachs upset but once this was realized everyone felt better.The beach restaurant was good if you are at the beach for the day(right on the ocean and served snack food). The beach was beautiful and we spent most of the time there near the entrance to the adult pool. Nikolas, the bartender at the adult pool was great along with the bartender at the main bar(he amazed me with how quickly that he can serve drinks). We got to know a few of the servers and they made us feel welcome. Some European topless but you get used to it. Some of them look quite silly when almost everyone else is walking around with tops. The shows were acceptable although we saw the less amount of shows on this vacation-nothing there to draw us back . We also hated going near the vendors that they allowed on the resort a couple of nights a week. We would try to find a path away from them as we walked through the resort.Overall we had a good, relaxing and sunny holiday. I don't know if we would go back to this resort(we usually try different places) although I am sure that we would go back to Punta Cana.  
<Date>Aug 11, 2008

<Author>Disney38
<Content>needs improvement We went to this resort knowing that we might not be staying at a 5 star resort. Overall, we liked our stay. The grounds and pools are beautiful. The activities, shows and movies are very family friendly. The food is average and needs some work. I think they could improve on their food. The specialty restaurants were wonderful, but the buffet needs some work. The dishes are chipped and the table linens sometimes need to be changed more than they were. The rooms at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana are average, but we kept asking and were moved to the Grand Oasis Bavaro. This was a very nice room that opened to the pool. The front desk staff was very nice in this respect.We did have a problem with our safe. We paid for the safe and it was broken daily and was a little frustrating. The front desk at the Bavaro did not want to hear of our problems with the safe. So if you can take a lock and lock your stuff somewhere else. The safe was our only problem with the resort.My advice is you get a nice vacation that is relaxing and pretty. Is the place perfect, no. You need to go with an open mind and just relax. Stay at the Bavaro if possible. The rooms are much better. I hope the new owner of the resort keeps the place up. With the lovely surroundings, it would be a shame to let the place slip anymore than it has.  
<Date>Aug 10, 2008

<Author>Tomohio
<Content>Not what I expected We stayed on the last week of July 24-31, we are a group of friends in our middle 20's and this was our first trip to the caribbean except for cancun in mexico, so we decide to come because we got a great deal.Our room was spacious with a view to the main pool / garden area, the only problem we had was how prompt will the towels be changed.On the food you have several choices to pick from, but be sure to be early at the reservations desk, unless you are going to be in line for a while.Variety was ok at the buffet restaurant.The service at the bars is fast and you will always have a smile and good music going on the beach bar, unfortunately there are not premium drinks as for a 5 star, but if you ask for some brands you may find them behind the counter.Since we came to have a good time in the sun, we have no complains on the beach, is wide and you may always find a good spot. The beach towels are stinky, so bring your own.There are plenty of activities going on around the day and the activities staff is always friendly, they'll make sure to invite you to every activity around the clock.On the night time there's not much to do around the hotel, we didn't come to sit down for an hour and watch a show, the Disco gets boring after an hour, so we decided to take a tour to the mangoo disco, watch out! this guys will offer you anything there, from prostitutes to drugs, which is not nice when you are traveling with your girlfriend, so avoid going there.Also get away as soon as you can from the vendors from the dominican market which goes to the resort on tuesdays, they are worst than vultures, all these merchandise you can get at reasonable prices, bargaining of course, at local markets in Bavaro Plaza, get a taxi to get there.It was not a bad vacation but we expected more and better.  
<Date>Aug 5, 2008

<Author>Stillhadfun
<Content>You get what you pay for! Our family consisted of 8 people. 2 parents and 6 young adult children ranging in age from 17 - 24. 3 girls and 3 boys. We arrived with no problems. The airport was busy as a Saturday would be and we eventually found our tranporation company. We had planned to bring golf clubs but at the end decided not to and it was a good thing there was no room in the van for them along with our luggage. (I had made arrangements ahead of time for the clubs!)The check -in at the Grand Oasis was good with the exception of a small language issue. Very few employees of the resort speak English. We had a total of 3 rooms. All 3 rooms were located on the same floor an in building 4. They were all old and needed updating but were clean. A/C did not cool very well in 1 of the 3 rooms. and the last day we had issues with the water in our bathroom.LBe advised listen carefully to all of the desk clerks instructions because you will not see them written anywhere to review later. (ie: beach towels, restaurants reservations, safe info, location of activities)Make your reservations for the specialty restaurants on your first day of vacation. You will not be able to get in and eat at those if you don't. You can only eat at each of those restaurants once during your visit. (Not explained anywhere on the web or with the travel companies) You will eat frequently at Windows with the same basic food choices each day. (Our entire group had stomach issues and so did most of the guest we spoke with. Take plenty of immodim for that situation -very expensive in shop so bring it with you) Again food was not great the best we had was in the Japanese Steak house but we had to pay extra to eat there and we were the only ones there at the 6:00 seating.Beach was lovely and pool good. Bar drinks were easy to get but taking your own large cup is helpful so you don't have to walk up from the beach so frequently. (Even for H20)Lots of misinformation on the excursions. Nothing in writing when you book with the details so when you go you are disappointed in what you get. The hotel books excursions but are more expensive than the booking agents on the beach. Same event just different prices. They also make promises that are not kept on what the excursion is really going to include. It is an adventure no matter what you do because of the unorganization!Snorkling is non-existance at the resort so you will have to pay to get to a location where there are fish and coral reef to see. Pretty good once you get there but Jamaica and Mexico are better.Lastly take snack food with you. You will want it. Chips, Candy Bars, breakfast bars, etc. It will help when you don't feel well and it will also get your system back to normal. Overall we had a good time. Language barrier was hard because the shows were in spanish, lessons in spanish, dealers in the casino were not English speaking. The vendors were obnoxious you could not walk through the resort without them truly begging you to buy something.  The rules and the way they had things organized were stressful and not very relaxing for us as guest. We were always trying to find out something because nothing is written out for you to know when / where / how things worked.Side Note: Not the resort's fault but the entire island's transportation shut down (went on strike )from 6 am - 12 pm the day we left. So we had to check out of the hotel at 3 am catch a cab to the airport with all the other Dominican guest that went on vacation from Saturday to Saturday. What an experience.....good for the story though!I truly would not recommend this resort to anyone unless money is an issue and you want a vacation in the tropics. Then go, be prepared and enjoy the sun, beach, pool and drinks otherwise spend a little more and go where you are treated like a guest who is valued.  
<Date>Aug 4, 2008

<Author>Opinion62
<Content>African American My sister and I went to Punta Cana July 23 - July 30, 200 from Chicago with Apple Vacations. We chose this time because it better suited her work schedule.Pre-Planning: I read a lot of reviews from this and other sites as well as talked with friends and co-workers about the destination. I was told that Punta Cana was a better location that Puerto Vallarta. After carefully reading all reviews, I decided that this was the better location and the resort appeared to have positives and negatives but overall it had everything that I was looking for --- food, entertainment, spa, pool, premium drinks (as I was told by my travel agent).Departure Flight: The flight was as 6:00 AM and was on time and comfortable. Of course with the economy considerations only beverages were included. There was a crying toddler on board who cried for at least 45 minutes. Sat in Row 10 --- seats would not recline (USA 3000).Check-In/Arrival: Check-in was fast and efficient, or at least I thought so. Fatima was very friendly and I asked for a room in the newer building 7, 8, 9, and 10 as I knew these were the better building from reading prior reviews. We were given a junior suite in building 7. I tipped her $10 --- but later found out that I did not have to since all Apple Vacationers were upgraded.Room: The room was clean with a king size bed, Jacuzzi, balcony, and separate shower. Closet and drawer space was huge. The room did have a smell --- like the beach ?seaweed but I was expecting that from reading the reviews. Three days we had a towel swan with different flowers but I think that because we did not use those towels to mess up the decoration. There was a fan made out of Kleenex and another in toilet issue. We always had clean towels. The sheets were damp at least on two nights. I noticed that I brought paper work with me and left it on the desk and it was damp on day 3 ?so it must be the moisture and being near the beach and pool. Tipped the maid service (Esperanza Carpoi) daily (5, 4, 3 dollars) and we had extra water, soda, and beer. Although, she was off a few days and we didn get extra from the other maid until I asked her.Food: We at lunch and dinner at Window on the first day and made our reservations to the other 4 restaurants. Windows buffet, the food was not appetizing, and food was warm unless you got it from the chefs who were grilling. The fruit was bland and tasted spoiled. Breakfast was the most tasteful with omelets. Some of the chairs would be wet because people came from the pool or beach. Beverage staff was attentive and prompt except with the decaffeinated coffee (instant ?they could never find the container). Food also appeared to be recycled. Ate once or twice at the Beach Garden and the food was about the same. The best food was at Mare Restaurant (Beef Tenderloin) was delicious and my sister had the seafood entre ?which was also good. Bad service at Aqua ?had Beef tips and asked for well done ?I had to send it back because it was too red. The second time it was still red. The American Grill was okay the salsa and chips were good and well as the waiters. DeMario restaurant was okay ?I had the chicken fettuccini and my sis had Lasagna. The lasagna was good. Hot dogs at the snack bar didn taste like hot dogs. We ate just enough to sustain. Couldn wait to get back home for real food. I also tipped at several of the restaurants because of their friendliness and good service.Bars: The bar service was good and fast. I was disappointed that no premium drinks were available. We wanted Jack Daniels. The main bar did have Absolute vodka but only after I asked. Of course it was hidden behind the bar unseen to the public eye. The bar in the theatre did appear to have at least 5 premium brands. We mostly had beer ?which was okay. We did pay one of the guys on the beach $30 to purchase us Jack Daniels --- It still did not taste like that in the USA. Of course we over paid because on the return we found that it was $17.00 in the Duty Free Shop.Entertainment: We didn participate in much entertainment when we found out where it was located. We missed the manager party because of the time difference. We went to the disco for 3 minutes ?it was dull and few people. We went to the theatre for the Michael Jackson Show and the production and special effects by the entertainment staff were good but the audio was bad. We left before it was over. We saw one movie ?Spider Man but the 2 entertainment staff members were in the back talking so loud and they had to be asked TWICE to be quiet but they kept talking. If you go to the theatre, then use insect repellent. Also, all of the activities are communicated in Spanish.Spa: We had the combination massage and it was great. That was one of the enjoyable experiences of the trip.Activities/Excursions: We did the glass bottom boat and snorkeling with Fruitti Tutti on the beach. Alex was nice and friendly but the boat glass was dirty. Neither my sister nor I can swim but other people on the boat were helpful and could speak English and Spanish. We have gone snorkel several times on different vacations but always with a friend that could swim --- she didn go with us. My sister enjoyed the snorkeling. Wanted to do the horseback riding but we didn. We walked up the beach 3 nights after dinner to Natura Park Resort. We saw the Flamingos and geese and walked back. When looking at the map on the internet if appears as though you can walk up the beach to the various resorts but I don think so. Did take the free bus to Palma Real Shopping mall --- bought a necklace and cigars. We left at4:10 and driver said he would be back at 6:00 for pickup --- He did come back at 6:00 but then said that he was coming back at 7:00 pm to pick us up. Again, the language.Disappointments: Lack of premium drinks was disappointment. The check in staff should have included a listing of all of the daily activities in the check in package. We had to keep going back to the service desk to ask were the activities were and when they were occurring. Domingo at guest service printed me c copy of the activities after I asked. Although, they do have an activity board posting and posting in some of the walk ways. I guess I used to cruises were we get daily iternaries. I did not know about the free bus to go shopping until I heard someone else asking about it. A lot of this information should be distributed to you during check in. The food was bad except Mare restaurant. There were no ice machines in each building ---- had to go to the main bar ?with the sun beating down on our heads to get it. The Lounge in building 7 was nice but I didn know it was available for use ---. Sometimes the door would be locked and the maids didn speak English --- I key has to be activated at the check in desk. They activated my key to the Lounge on one day and the next day it was deactivated. Then I went to get it activated again and they activated the Lounge but deactivate my room. The computer has free internet access but there as a virus on it the last 3 days and no one fixed it. DON GO THE TO MINI MARKET store up the street from the resort. I go Doritos and Chips for $11.00. The shops and huts at the resorts are expensive and they are expensive. The vendors that come on Tuesday and Thursday were very rude. All of them had the same items for sell. We were buying things from them and having a good time. I knew to bargain for a good price from the reviews (thank you all). One Tuesday, one of the vendors called my sister A CHEAP AMERICAN. He wanted to sell my sister 2 piece of DR jewelry for $85. I told him that was too much and that we could buy gold for that! When I later confronted him, he admitted to saying it and wanted to forcefully push me with his body. He then called me the N-WORD. I told him that I was going to complain to the manager, he said the manager wouldn do anything because he Dominican. When I returned 3 minutes later with the manager, the man was gone and his friends at his table were trying to cover for him. They offered my sister a free cheap bracelet to make amends. One Dominican at the cigar table was helpful and stepped up to explain the situation and apologized although he didn do it. But again they were talking in Spanish first and then to me in English --- so who knows!!!!Recommendations for African Americans: It a nice place to visit. The resort was nice considering all of the above comments. If you don like the hot sun and a lot of water sports -- then it not the place to offer other activities to keep you busy. We went to the pool and beach at least 4 days but the heat was getting to us. The activities were around the main pool where it very HOT. I was looking forward to some of the activities but again it took me a while to find them and then it was hot. Not too many people were participating. We tipped graciously although tips were included in our package. But to be called a racial slur was TOO MUCH. It appears as though the resorts are profiting while the residents are suffering. Also, brush up on Spanish or take a couple of classes. I plan too! Most everyone speaks Spanish and it most difficult to communicate. They did have some staff that spoke English and some just spoke it a little. I was getting tired of saying ?NO COMPREHENDE? My sister was a great help because she new some of what they were saying. It a good place to relax, be with family or for couples. Would I go again? Probably not to this resort but maybe with my boyfriend or a group of friends but never in JULY!Return Flight: I was glad to be returning home! I went for 7 days and was ready to leave in 5 days. Flight was on time and uneventful. It was supposed to be non-stop but we were told that we had to stop in Florida to refuel because gas prices in DR were $5.11 a gallon. Immigration and Customs were a nightmare. We had to wait in the line for over an hour. It good to be back home!Thanks to all TripAdvisor reviewers for your comments/reviews!

<Author>Poel
<Content>Would not recommend to anyone The arrival was smooth, got to our rooms quickly and then the horror began. We were with 6, 3 couples each in seperate rooms. I think after 5 minutes in our rooms we were already back out asking each other if their room was just as bad. In 1 room the airco didn't work, the bed was broken. In the others the door off the dressing closet fell off and in room nr 3 the door jammed so bad you had to force yourself to get inside. Bathrooms were very outdated and rust everywhere. Also in the block on the opposite side off the road they were upgrading the rooms so you could hear construction works going on all day. Complaining at the front desk didn't work so the next day our travel agent had to arrange new rooms which luckely enough were not 20 years old.In the restaurants the personnel hardly speaks english and the service is terrible. Mistakes in drinks ordered, tables not fully decked out so you had to take knives or forks from other tables to make yours complete. Asking for coffee resulted in a 10 minute wait which made you think they forgot. If you arrived a bit late for breakfast a lot off tables were dirty so you had to scrape together clean stuff from different tables to make your own, the staff just didn't know what to do, food on the floor was not picked up, we watched 9 waiters walk by a pizza on the floor before someone finally picked it up.Every 2 days a complete market was setup around the swimming pool with salesmen pulling your arms and really annoying you when you just wanted to get a drink from the bar. Bartenders were unfriendly and they just looked like they hated their job. Toilets beside the pool were horrible, in the men's room from the 6 toilets 5 were just filled with fecies, like they were not cleaned in weeks. We went to our rooms every time we needed to go. It seems since the name changed from Sunscape to Grand Oasis everything started to go wrong.We just got home yesterday 29/07/2008 and I had the worst holiday in more then 10 years, money not wel spent.  
<Date>Jul 30, 2008

<Author>Mommy2be08
<Content>A COMPLETE NIGHTMARE! Wow! Where should I begin? From the moment my husband and I walked into the lobby we knew our trip was going to be a nightmare! First of all, the check in process was terrible, the staff at the front desk hardly spoke English and was unable to answer many of our questions. To top it off, the lobby isnt air conditioned...which makes matters 10 times worse when it's already 100 degrees outside! The rooms are TERRIBLE, we had to switch rooms twice! Cracked, dirty walls surrounded us, and besides our room smelling absolutely HORRIFIC, we were welcomed by spiders and ants which when we called to complain the staff offered to spray the room with pesticide? Being 4 months pregant I dont think that would have been such a smart idea. The second room was slightly better, being that it was on the 3rd floor rather than the 1st, it smelled better and was insect free. However, the ceiling was made out of wood with big cracks, so who knows how insect free it truely is. Showering is another issue. The water comes and goes and to top it off IT STINKS!!!!!! So you get out smelling worse than when you go in. The beds are completely uncomfortable, no box spring, just a mattress on a wooden platform. Oh, and dont bother calling for wake up calls.....you never get them!The outside grounds are pretty and kept very clean. The pools are ok also, only 4ft deep though. The food is completely DISGUSTING! The flies however dont seem to think so! FLIES EVERYWHERE!!!!!! Making reservations for the restaurants was a disaster unless you spoke Spanish, then that's when they had whatever time you rquested. On the whole, our 5 days in Punta Cana were a nightmare. Starting with the disappointing 5-star hotel and ending with each one of us getting horrible stomach viruses because of the food/drinks! This was definitely an experience I will NEVER forget! The list of problems could go on and on, but I think by now you get the hint. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!

<Author>Alan_T_82
<Content>Superb Holiday Having just returned from this hotel I thought I would help settle peoples nerves.After reading bad reviews about this hotel our group were a little worried about what it was going to be like... There is no need to worry.We had very quick transfer to the Hotel there was only our group so no other stops on the way... GREAT!On arrival Staff welcomed us, took our cases and we made our way to check in. We were given our keys and also given a cocktail with RUM in LOVELY!!On our first day we had a storm. So we just sat around and had a few drinks. Our rooms were cleaned every day and we were given fresh towels. We left a tip for the maids in a beer can and we were given a six pack of beer instead of the usual 2 cans, so if you wan more beers you know what to do!The food was gorgreous there was a different theme each night of the week in the main buffet, and the al la carte's were all very VERY tasty. The only fault we could make was that we had to wait a long time at the Tex Mex... Maybe we are just greedy.All the drinks were lovely, you could get pretty much anything you want. The beach bar was great at a night time and it was open 24 hrs if you felt like staying up late.But the best bit was the adult only pool... Apart from a couple of kids now and again (who were always cleared out of the pool) it was heaven. Lots of peace and quite. A jacuzzi. Waiter service from Nikolas... give him some tips as he works hard.All in all I had a brilliant holiday.  
<Date>Jul 22, 2008

<Author>lunagirl3
<Content>NOT an Oasis....more like mucho aggravation I stayed at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana with three of my friends from 07.05.08 - 07.10.08 and found it to be highly unsatisfactory on many levels. We booked with CheapCaribbean because my friends had used the site last year for a trip to Punta Cana and spoke so highly of the service. We thought that the 3 1/2 star resort we chose would surely provide excellent service if it was backed by CheapCaribbean. Upon arriving to our rooms, my friends and I discovered the couch that belonged in my room was on the balcony. We soon discovered why it had been moved outside. It smelled horrible. No alarm clock was provided, as you were told to pay for a wake up call instead. There was no dresser in the room. I specifically requested a King sized bed, but when we checked in, I was told I would have 2 Queens instead. When I actually got to the room, I saw 2 full-sized beds. My friend got an eye infection the first morning we were there. I called down to reception and spoke to Juan who told me there was no medic available in the resort and I would have to take a taxi to the hospital if my friend needed to be seen. Rather than travel through a dangerous and unknown area, we decided to try warm compresses and see if it would help. That was when we discovered there was no hot water in either mine or my friends' rooms. We had to run water through the mini coffee maker in our room to get warm compresses. The next day I spoke to Lourdes, our Turinter travel guide, and she arranged to have my friend driven (In the resort's golfcart) to the next resort to be seen by their medic. Why hadn't this been arranged for us from the start? I was told I had to get a taxi to the hospital. After my friend was seen by the medic, she was made to wait 40 minutes to be picked back up. We found the bartenders to be rude, and most of the staff unwilling to step up and help without the incentive of money. Was this NOT an all-inclusive? Why do I feel like my money is the only thing that will get me some decent service?! Our room was cleaned, but fresh towels were never left. We called down to reception and they stated they would have someone bring us towels. They never showed up. The next morning I walked down to reception and asked for towels in person, only to be told the same story...someone will bring them to me. My friend finally had to track down a maid's cart and take some towels herself! Attempting to eat was another journey. The food was terrible at Windows, the buffet. It was the only restaurant that did not require reservations. And since Lourdes never informed us that we needed to make reservations 2 days prior, and only between certain times, we had to eat at Windows alot. The ice cream at Windows tasted like chemicals. The eggs were very very runny. The only thing that was consistently good was the pasta. We did manage to get 2 restaurant reservations during our stay, and watched as a family of four walked in stating they had no reservations and were seated immediately. Why was I told I could not make reservations for this very restaurant the day before? Both times we had reservations, the place was almost empty. I don't get it. The other place that had food we liked was Beach Gardens. The only problem was, it was almost never open. On several occasions my friends and I stood staring at the restaurant hours, yet there was no one inside during those hours. We were baffled that this place simply didn't comply with ANY set schedule, no less the one posted on their doors. Just getting a beach towel was a hassle. We had to walk around to find a tiny hut in a corner of the resort I didn't know existed. When we got there we were told there were no clean towels. I walked all the way to reception only to be told to go back to the hut and they now have 4 towels waiting for us. Just tell them Juan Carlo sent you. Do I need to KNOW someone to get a beach towel? Again, I don't get it. Unfortunately for us, it didn't stop there. The guide Turinter provided us with was anything but knowledgable, helpful, or even reachable. We spent an entire morning/afternoon trying to track down Lourdes to book an excursion. The first time in the travel room we were told she was downstairs in a meeting. We came back and were informed that Lourdes came back and was told we were looking for her, but has now gone to lunch. After an hour, we also decided to have a late lunch. We ate quickly and went back only to be told that Lourdes had left for the day. Worst of all, on the day we were leaving, she gave us the wrong time to meet the Turinter bus (also already paid for) that would take us back to the airport. When we arrived, we were told the bus already left and were not offered assistance. We explained that our guide had given us a time of 2:20pm and were told it should have been 2pm and it was our problem. Finally, we were told another bus would take us. Thankfully, we say goodbye and leave the resort. Upon arriving at the airport, the driver asks us for $30. At no point were we told we would have to pay this man. We thought they were providing us with transportation to make up for the fact that the guide got us stuck with no way to the airport. I had booked airport transfers to avoid this very issue. Overall, this trip was more of a hassle than a vacation. I've never gone all-inclusive before and have been told it is wonderful. I may try it again, but never with CheapCaribbean. And NEVER at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana.  
<Date>Jul 21, 2008

<Content>Grand Oasis Disaster We have arrived to what is supposed to be a 5 star hotel but  found it to be more like 2. Here is why:1. The first room we got into smelled like PP all the time no matter how much it was cleaned. Later I found out that the sewer system was about 200 feet away from the room.2. The food is not great and there is no variety.3. The specialty restaurants are not good and if you'd like dinner at the Japanese, you need to pay extra $15 per adult.4. The minibar in the room has some cheap drinks that are included and the rest are to be paid for.5. Once we transfer to a presidential suit, the room was clean and smelled good but there were bed bugs that you couldn't see but left marks on your skin.6. The Italian restaurant was so bad that both of my kids got sick and vomitted all night long.DO NOT STEP IN PUNTA CANA!2 good ponts:NICE GROUNDS AND BEACHGOOD ENTERTAINMENT.

<Author>kinzas
<Content>Poor upkeep Maintanance and upkeep of the hotel is terrible. The property was sold to us as a 5 star hotel by the tour operator, Sunwing Holidays, but the only thing that was 5 star in the hotel was the size of the rooms. All rooms on the main floor were very moldy. The mold most likely lives in the air conditioning. I had to change rooms twice and although the smell in the last room I stayed at was not as bad as in the previous ones, I could not spend any time in my room, only when I had to go to sleep. Returning home I had to wash all my clothes three times, even those ones I did not wear at the hotel. Most of my clothes still smell bad of mold. Mold is very unhealthy and toxic, it can cause bad migraines or serious lung problems mimicking Tuberculosis, etcWe were not allowed to put our wet bathing suites on the balcony to dry them, we had to leave them in our cold air conditioned rooms. Of course they could not get dry inside the room, they just simply soaked in more mold. It was impossible to adjust the cooling of the air conditioner, so it was either very cold or too hot when we turned it offI asked guest services at the hotel to clean the air conditioning in my room, I do not know if they did it or not, the smell of mold was still prevalent when I checked out.I spoke to guests staying on higher floors, They did not have mold but they lacked water pressure in their room, they could not take showers.I found live cockroaches running around in the bathroomFood was mediocre but the selection was good at the buffet. We were allowed to have dinner 4 times in different restaurants within the resort. 2 of these restaurants were bad. I can recommend only the American Grill or the Di Mario restaurants where the food selection was limited but the servings were tastier than in the main restaurant serving buffet food. Do not eat desert at any of these restaurants though. 90 % of the food is imported, the deserts tasted like card board freshly taken out of the freezer. The worst restaurant is the Aqua which was supposed to serve new, innovative food. Instead, they served stale, dry Italian Focaccia bread, untoasted with a thin slice of cheese and a bite of Prischiuto as one of the 3 entrees on the menu. It was obvious that their chef has never been in Italy There is lots of food going to waste at the buffet (Window) restaurant. After each meal all the untouched buffet food is thrown into the garbage even though the country is very poor with many people starving on the island. The beach is nice but for some reason they cut most of the branches of the palm trees, so there is hardly any shade. I had to get up at 6 a.m. on my vacation every morning to secure lawn chairs with umbrellas on the beach. Do not go to this property in July and August. Since the hotel is owned by a Spanish hotel chain, most guest were from Spain as Europeans take family vacations in July and August. While there were very limited number of people from English speaking countries, they had huge Spanish families. The hotel is catering to kids. There is not much adult entertainment and with the exception of the front office, the staff does not speak English. It was surprising that the host of the evening entertainment program did not speak English either. I have been at other resorts, even 3 star ones in the Dominican Republic where they had much better entertainment and many more bilingual staff.Drink selection was good, they even served imported wine and other alcohol. Landscaping was nice, although during the period I stayed at the hotel there was construction going on at the middle of the resort as well as at the next door hotel. It was impossible to enjoy quiet time on the beach due to the construction noise from both directions  
<Date>Jul 17, 2008

<Author>Sharon2410
<Content>Lovely hotel and a fabulous holiday ! We've just returned from a two week holiday to this resort on Monday and I felt compelled to write a review to say what a brilliant place this is, after reading so many negative reviews before we went. When we first booked I was seriously concerned after reading review after review slagging off this resort and was starting to get nervous about it. My concerns were soon laid to rest and franky we spent the rest of the holiday questioning the sanity of the people who posted the negative comments !!!The rooms were a little dated, but were clean and comfortable with fresh towels and maid service daily and our mini bar stocked regularly. If we wanted more water or beer we just asked and got it no problem. Food and drink was of a high standard and was plentiful ! You can eat and drink 24 hours if you feel like it! The main buffet resturant 'windows' was varied and themed each night. Mexican being a favorite of ours and there was always a station doing fresh pasta to your specification. Lunch was either Windows or the Beach Bar, the beach doing pasta, fish, chicken, salad, fruits and ice cream etc. And a stall on the beach front did burgers, southern fried chicken, hotdogs, fries and some lovely slices of pizza. Breakfast was also good with loads of choice, we especially enjoyed the omlettes made to order.The A la Carte resturants were a really high standard although service in the Tex Mex was slow it was still enjoyable. But Di Marios (italian) and Aqua were both amazing all our meals were so nice we all wish we had ordered what the other had ! We also visited Le Mare which specialised in fish. We didn't visit the Japanese resturant but heard some good reports and wish we had.The bar by the main pool was open until 12.00 and if you sit on the terrace above you get a lovely breeze which was nice on the evenings, the beach bar was open 24 hours and did snacks like ham and cheese toasties and chips until the early hours and was a really peaceful relaxed place to spend the evening.There is a piano bar in the main lobby (which is a karoke bar) was a good laugh, although we only discovered it in our last night after befriending two American couples. The barman held the bar open long after closing and drank shots with us.There is also a 'disco' called sneakers which we never went in after peering through a window and hearing what sounded like german techno and seeing people with their shirts off !!!!The main theatre shows movies for the kids early evening and after is a kids disco, this is were they held the main entertainment however we didn't really bother with it.The beer was good (presidente) and there was plenty of rum and other spirts as well as some good cocktails, the bananamama (made with 151 rum) being a favourite in our group. The wine wasn't the best I have had, but was drinkable.We spent most days by the adult pool which was lovely and quiet and you didn't have to worry about children dive bombing you ! The main pool looked good, and was a good size with a swim up bar but was quite packed and noisy. The adult pool was a little oasis if you wanted to chill in the sun with a book and a beer ! It has its own little bar ran by Nicolas who will tell you he is numero uno bar man in the dominican republic, and he isn't lying. Although he mostly runs it single handed he still finds time to serve at the bar and run around the pool taking orders and bringing your drink to you. Often bringing drinks without orders, just when he see's your empty ! He also make the best bananamamas.We did four trips Saona, Monster Truck, Tropical Sunset and Reef Explorer all of which were brilliant and highly recommended. If you do Monster Truck take some present for the kids, if we go back we plan to fill our hand luggage with childrens shoes and clothes as they have so little.If you do fancy a change from the hotel your only a $20 taxi ride form a very nice shopping centre that has a few bars and resturants. My partner and myself went to the Hard Rock Cafe had a great meal, desert and drinks (including 2 cocktails where we got to keep logo-ed hurricane glasses) and it only cost $110 (about 55) and we had a brilliant night.All in all this was a brilliant trip and we couldn't have asked for a better holiday, and we really can not understand how anyone could find this anything other than brilliant. We went as a group of 2 couples aged ranging 21-31 and couldn't fault it, I would go back in a shot. The only change I would make would be to learn some spanish as many of the staff struggle with basic english, and I felt really ignorant that I couldn't converse with them.  
<Date>Jul 17, 2008

<Author>dizzy1926
<Content>Nothing grand about this place The service at this resort was terrible. Day 1 we had to wait on a 45min line to book reservations for dinner for 4 nights, which is included in the package deal. They can only fit us in for 2 nights which means its buffet meals all the time which was very untasteful. They also stressed we needed a reservation but when we finally went on day 3 with a reservation, a family of 4 had no reservations and they got seated as well. Then we requested towels for our rooms which never showed up even when I called mutiple times. I was forced to then track down a maid's cart and grab them myself. All the eaterys in this place open and close as they please so sometimes we had to wait to eat which was a big inconvience for us. We went to the beach to get our beach towels only to find out they were out of them. I then had to walk all the way back to the lobby to complain only to have him tell me to go back to the beach to get them. How did they all of sudden show up now? There was no medic or doctor on the resort because of renovations so when my friend got sick she had to go to the next resort, they left her there for 45mins waiting for a ride back. To top everything off they told us the wrong time for our pick-up back to the airport. The shuttle which is included in our package and paid form left us. I tell one of the staff members only to be told it's my problem, not theirs. He then sends us to another shuttle for a ride, but when we arrived he charged us $30. Price was never spoken about and at this point all I want is to be home. We paided him and finally left the resort with the worst service ever. Lack of care for their customers was appalling. I used cheapcarribean.com and I'm really surprised at them for representing them. I will be contacting them as well.  
<Date>Jul 16, 2008

<Author>kathryn87
<Content>EXCELLENT! Just returned from this hotel a couple hours ago and just wanted to come on here and say all the bad reviews must be for a different hotel as myself and the rest of my party found absolutely nothing to complain about during our two week stay.We stayed in block 5 on the ground floor which had a perfect location - in the centre of everything, but far enough away from Sneakers disco so we couldn't hear it at night. The rooms themselves could do with a lick of paint here and there but overall they do the job for the amount of time you spend in the room. Maid service everyday, fresh towels everyday, bed linen changed every couple days. We had 4 cockroaches in the room over the course of two weeks which is nothing really. Bathroom is simple and could do with updating, but our shower worked and was nice and hot so no complaints. The food in the resort was extremely varied and all very high quality. Windows the main buffet restaurant has a different theme night every night (Spanish, Dominican, Italian, Gala, Beach Party, Mexican and International) and the food within each theme is so varied - how anyone can not find something they like is beyond me. Every night there is a pasta station with various types of pasta and sauces - all delicious and freshly cooked in front of you. Breakfast is again a buffet, containing various breads and cold meats, cereals, hot items such as eggs, bacon, sausage as well as cakes, muffins, doughnuts etc. You can also create your own omlette which is made to your liking - very tasty!Beach restaurant offered more of a snack based service - rice, salads, cold pasta, chips etc. With a snack bar just outside cooking fresh burgers and hot dogs - just be careful to check your burger is cooked thoroughly before you eat it.We visited 4 of the 5 a la carte restaurants and enjoyed them all.Aqua (the main restaurant for the Bavaro Suites) is amazing! I swear that my meal there was the nicest meal I've ever had, not just on the holiday but in my whole life!D'Mario's Italians was really nice too, good range of pastas and pizzas as well as several types of meat. We visited there twice as we enjoyed it so much. On our second visit we found the service quite slow but not slow enough to make a complaint.The Tex-Mex American Grill was also an enjoyable night however the service in there was extremely slow, it took us over two hours to eat our 3 courses. The food however was very enjoyable, with a wide variety of choice.The fish restaurant on the beach side was also enjoyable, they have a great range of fish available but also a non-fish meat for those who don't enjoy seafod. Yes you do have to pay extra for lobster but there is so many other choices to select from that there is no reason to bring this up as an issue.The bars are scattered right through the resort, you're never too far away from the rum and cocktails. We spent most of our nights either at the beach side bar or the backstage bar, where they have quite an extensive cocktail menu that they can customise for you (change Rum for Vodka etc.). Every night there is a different show in the theatre, we only saw one (The Micheal Jackson show) which was really good and entertaining. We used two of the resort's pools - the main one and the adult pool. We found the main pool extremely loud and busy so we found the adult pool a fantasic haven - this is not a negative of the main pool it simply wasn't what we were looking for, but it would be great for fun loving families and children. The adult pool was perfect for us, we were able to lounge by the pool on sunbeds which were always readily available as the area was so quiet. There was often some kids who invaded the pool but staff were quick to remove them. The adult pool bar is where we found our favourite staff member Nicholas - he is amazing and deserves a pay rise! He brought us drinks in and around the pool without even having to be asked, we just kept tipping him a few dollars every day and we seemed to become his favourite customers!As for excursions I highly recommend every trip we went on; Tropical Sunset, Reef Explorer (it's about 30ft away from the hotel, not travel necessary!), Saona Island and the Monster Truck Safari. If you do go on the Monster Trucks take some gifts for the children of the DR and Haiti as they come up to the truck and you visit a school. Many people on our trip simply took the hotel's toiletries and the children loved it - it's a very eye opening trip! A few times a week some vendors come into the resort and set up stalls throughout the site. It is a little annoying but it's also quite fun and interesting. They sell all DR produce - Rum, Cigars, paintings, jewellery, clothes, ornaments etc. and and definitely flexible on their prices so always haggle! Some give you free gifts just for looking. It's good to compare rock bottom prices with the stall vendors and the shops within the resort as there is often a severe price difference.One tip I would give for anyone visiting this hotel would be to take effective insect repellent. I came away from the resort with a very high number of mosquito bites, mostly on my ankles and feet. We were told when we arrived that you can purchase insect repellent patches (similar to a nicotine patch) that I would definitely buy if I returned to the DR.Overall I highly recommend this hotel to anyone, we had an amazing holiday and I'm sure you would to if you went.  
<Date>Jul 14, 2008

<Author>dbechard87
<Content>VERY NICE but... A group of 6 of us went to the Grand Oasis between July 5th and July 12th from London Ontario and we had a great time. The beach and grounds were amazing. The food was actually pretty good even though by the end I was getting sick of it. WINDOWS had a big selection but some of it wasnt to good. I guess it depended on the night.One problem we found was the swim up bar servers were miserable and it attached to the kids pool. We wished there was a swim up bar for the adult pool even though our server Nicholas was excellent. Also on occasion there were kids in the adult pool which was annoying abnd awkward because thats where the topless girls go. AQUA and AMERICAN GRILL were both okay but Damario was actually very good. Overall the food didnt make me sick so I was happyOur maid service was okay but remember to tip because the one time we forgot we got bad service!!!! All in all we enjoyed ourselves and I would probably return if I got the right price. Like I said the beach was amazing and the grounds were amazing but a few things here and there could have been better.

<Author>Ermizs6
<Content>You get what you pay for! We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana. This was our 5th trip to Punta Cana and our 1st to the Grand Oasis Punta Cana. We have always stayed at the Barcelo complex at the Barcelo Bavaro Palace, which is a true 5 STAR resort. I had read the reviews of the Grand Oasis and they were mixed review of people who love it and hated it - so after speaking with our travel agent at MKTravel - she highly recommended it, so we went for it. Our experience just like some of the other reviews I've read, are mixed. First we were put in a room in building 5 on the 3rd floor. We immediately complained as there are no elevators and we were a group of 10 in 3 separate rooms with kids, older people, etc... They moved us to building 4 on the 1st floor, we were happy, but when we went into the room we did not like the smell - to make a long story short, we complained and complained at the lobby, as supposedly, we had requested a room in building 7, but were told that we had to pay extra for that. The next day, we received a call from the manager at the reception area and she told us that she was going to upgrade us to rooms on the 1st floor at the Bavaro Suites. Now, that was A NICE ROOM!!!! We were on building #11, it was absolutely the best!!! The food was great at all of the a la carte restaurants, the buffet Windows was good, but they need more variety. The only thing that really upset us with the food was the fact that there is NO LOBSTER unless you pay $25.00 per pound for it - and this is SUPPOSE TO BE ALL INCLUSIVE. We ate shrimp, but they were not available all the time. Other than that, the food was good. The service could have been better. I think the entire resort in under staffed, so the few employees they do have are over worked and under paid, so they aren't as happy as they should be. As far as bugs and stuff, we did not see any - everything was pretty clean. The hotel is still undergoing some remodeling, but you don't see it unless you go to the actual building that they are remodeling. The entertainment was absolutely great, they do a very nice and fun beach party once a week, great disco, excellent shows at the theater, etc... If you have never been to a 5 star resort and you are taken to this one, you will love it. Now, if you have been to a 5 star resort and then go here, you will see the difference. You get what you pay for. We wanted to save some money and went here, therefore, like the saying says, you get what you pay for. Will we go to the Grand Oasis again - probably not just because we have like other resorts better - but for the price we paid, it was great!We are from Miami, Florida  
<Date>Jul 11, 2008
<Rating>2	2	5	3	3	3	2	-1	
<Aspects>

<Author>rosaidarrrr
<Content>Not so great! We stayed at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana for our annual vacation. When we got to the hotel we were surprised to see how different it looked from the online pictures I had seen a hundred times. Those online pictures must've been taken 20 years ago. They told us the hotel had been recently remodeled, but guess what, only part of it has been. It still under construction. The facilities have still not been remodeled. The hotel is pretty old and needs heavy maintenance. The pool had mold and the water was not so clear. The childrens pool was the size of a bathtub and it didn look so clean. The floors throughout the pool deck were cracked, and the reception looked nothing like in the pictures. Even the bridge that goes over the pool looked way different than I had seen in pictures. We booked 2 rooms, one for my husband, the baby, and me; and the other one for my parents. We were given 2 rooms on the 3rd floor, (no elevators by the way!!). The railings at the balcony were so huge that a 3 yr old child could fit between them. We have a 1 yr old baby, so we asked to be moved to the 1st floor to avoid any accidents. Our rooms SUCKED. There was no water in the shower; no air conditioning and it had various leaks from the ceiling. When we asked to be changed to another hotel, our travel agent asked me to wait until the next day and they will change us to new rooms. We were changed to the new rooms, but I found 2 huge roaches in my room, and my parent's room smelled really bad. The safe was not included, and we had to pay $18.00 dollars to rent one. Ie been to hotels in Vegas, Cancun, Punta Cana, various cruises, and I never had to pay for the safe before. I found this very awkward. Our room mini bar had many snacks, but you had to buy them separate. Their ll inclusive package?only included 2 drinks and 2 beers, everything else was separate.The food was not so great. The buffet restaurant is equipped for air conditioning, but it was very hot in there. We literally sweat when while we were eating. There was no lobster included in our ll inclusive Package? If you wanted to eat lobster, you had to pay $25.00 per lb. I have been to Punta Cana 4 times and it was never like this before. I always stayed at the Barcelo Bavaro Palace Hotel where everything is included except for the tours. The beach was good, but I've seen better at the Barcelo Palace Hotel. The people were really nice at the Grand Oasis, can't compliant about that. We had a good time after all, but I will not go back to this hotel.  
<Date>Jul 11, 2008

<Author>officer119us
<Content>Great Time...... My wife and I stayed at the Grand from July 28th-July 5th.....We had a great time. I really dont have many complaints at all. The flight there was fine, as well as getting through the airport. I think it took 20mins to get through the airport, and another 20 to get to the resort. CHECK IN: We arrived about 1120am. We were told our room wouldnt be done until 3pm. I asked Roberto to help me out, and he was able to get it done by 1pm. The front desk staff was great. ROOM: I had a Master Jr Suite building 7. I wanted a beach view got had a room on the first floor, which walked right out to the lazy river. It was the nicest hotel room I've ever been in. Kind of had a mildew smell, but whatever, nothing to bad. A little mildew smell went away when you walked out and seen the beautiful beach. Oh yeah it didnt bother me after about 4 hours of drinking the President...LOL Food: I could find something to eat everywhere we went. It wasnt the best food I've ever had but it wasnt bad. WINDOWS has a good selection but it's a buffet, dont expect mouth watering food. I wouldnt suggest the Japanese. It wasnt horrible, but it wasnt great. The steak was real good, but everything else, was so so.... DIMARIOS was very good. Not authentic italian, but your in the DR. It was very good. AMERICAN GRILL was very good as well. I didnt try AQUA, heard it wasnt that good. We also did not try MARE. I passed out after being at the ADULT POOL drinking with my ST LOUIS friends..... Just remember you are going to the DR, if your expecting the best food you have ever had, stay home......BARS: My Favorite place in the resort was the ADULT POOL. NICHOLAS is the best bar tender I've EVER HAD, even in the State. I tipped him 2 dollars after the second beer he brought to the pool for me, and I never had an empty glass. He was responsible for me missing dinner reservations...HA HA HA. The pool bar was nice, but there were to many kids floating around and I felt weird drinking around a bunch of kids. I would suggest the adult pool, except Tuesdays. NICHOLAS is OFF..... The bar behind the Pool Bar, was very good. The bartenders were dancing, and having a great time. Very enjoyable. The piana bar was closed when we tried to go. Sneakers, was ok, very loud, young crowd (we are 30) so you know it was a very young crowd. We stayed about 2hrs danced, drank, and had a good time. I drank beer all week, but after the 3rd day my wife found the best drink int he resort. FRUIT PUNCH and VODKA. Oh yeah K from ST LOUIS, I didnt forget that shot of MAMAJUANA you made made me drink. MAID SERVICE: I cant say anything bad, except one thing. I forgot to tip one day, and didnt have any towels, or water that day. I called my buddy Roberto at the front desk, and was able to get it. I didnt forget to tip again. OVERALL: We had a great time, and met some great people there. I wish we could have hung out more with them, but the time we did we had a great time. If my friends from NY, OH, and ST LOUIS read this send me a message with your e-mail. Oh yeah one more thing. Stay away from the VENDORS.

<Author>rbeca78
<Content>Will not return. This resort is, without a doubt, not a 5-star. We just got back about 6 hours ago and I wanted to write this review while it was still fresh in my mind. We won't be returning. First, I read trip-advisor and took bug spray, Febreeze, Downy Wrinkle Release, hangers, and loofas. I read that the bugs were horrible, the sheets smell musty because of the humidity, no irons/ironing boards, no hangers, and no washclothes. None of that was true. I also read that there is a problem with ants, cockroaches and RATS! I saw 1 ant. That's it. In fact, we ordered room service one night (this will be addressed later on) and we put the plates down at the end of the hall because I didn't want any rodent squeezing under the door to get to the leftovers. The next morning the plates were still there (not for too long) with the leftovers still on them. I would say that speaks for the non-rat problem.I'll start with the positives.Location - The Grand Oasis is just a short drive from the Punta Cana Airport (which is very nice and well organized). There are no real rules of the road so I was pleased that we didn't have to stay in the van long.Appearance - The main lobby is beautiful. It is open-aired and very nice. The grounds are also attractive. Check-In - No problems here. We arrived before check-in and were able to get into our room before 3pm. D'Mario  The American Grill - Both of the restaurants were excellent. I'll re-address food in the negatives.Adult Pool Bar - Nicolas is, as the reviews state, is amazing. Beach Chairs - These were not a problem to find. Either at the beach or at any of the pools. Finding them under a palapa early on in the morning was tougher, but not impossible. Cleanliness - We constantly saw people cleaning, cleaning, cleaning. They would scrub, or mop essentially, the walkways and areas around the pool. We saw a team of 2 men scrubbing the walls and ledges of the pools. One in the water and one out of the water. Two men raked the seaweed multiple times a day. Our room was also cleaned very well everyday. Lazy River Pool - Very nice and clean (except after they mowed the grass) and has an infinity edge. The adult pool is nice, in theory. We switched to this resort for this reason alone and everyday there were kids in the pool. I left my 2 year-old at home and, therefore, did not want to deal with other peoples' kids. There is one sign by the pool that says it's the adult pool and that's it. If you're coming from the other 2 entrances or simply miss the sign, you don't know that children are not to be in the pool. The pool was never over-run with kids (that was kept for the main pool) so when it was child-free it was very nice. The last few days of our stay, though, the water was cloudy. We would just walk over to the lazy river and swim for a bit. We liked to relax by this pool. Nicolas at the bar helped balance out the negatives of the adult pool. Thanks Nicolas!Our Room - I am putting this part of the review in between the positive section and the negative section because I have mixed reviews. We were on the main level on building 5, all the way at the end of the hall. The location of the room was perfect. We were just steps away from the beach and just around the corner from the adult pool. The room is nothing spectacular. It's a basic hotel room. We were okay with that because we didn't go on vacation for a hotel room. If you do, just book a room at the Holiday Inn. You'll save a bundle. As much as I thought it wouldn't, the rust and showerhead and things irritated my husband and me more than we anticipated. The shower head was horrible. It was supposed to have 4 different settings but they all would shoot the water out at like Mach 5. No big deal until you have a sunburn and then it hurts like nobody's business. Nice big tile ledge in the shower, though which was really nice. Nevatives:FOOD!!! - With the exception of D'Mario and the American Grill, the food is horrible. There is a big selection to choose from at Windows, but unfortunately for my husband and me not much of what we eat and I'm not picky. The food is just not geared toward our culture. (This is not a complaint, just a statement.) I am realtively certain that some of the foods that I saw out at lunch were put back out at dinner time. We were not able to get reservations at Aqua or at Mare. The Japenese restaurant did not appeal to us and is a $15 charge per person. The room service - if you book with Apple, it's free. If you book from anyone else, there is a $6 charge. My husband and I ordered room service on Saturday night, our second full day there. 24 hours later on Sunday night we had to leave D'Mario before dessert (my husband couldn't even finish his meal) because my husband was having such horrible stomach cramps. Mine started the very next morning and we continued to have diarrhea for the rest of the week. My husband is still not recovered. (I felt better after eating yogurt for breakfast.) We had unbelievable stomach cramps, gas, bloating, and diarrhea and it made the rest of the trip miserable. We concluded on the next to last day that the room service was the culprit. This is because we saw the room service being delivered...in a wheelbarrow . Lord knows how long it sits in that dirty rusty wheelbarrow before it gets to you. The vendors - This (and the room service) are reason alone to not come to this resort. The beaches in the DR are public and, therefore, vendors can walk the beach and even come into the resort to hound you! They are selling everything under the sun. Yes, you can give a firm no, but they will hound you the next day. Tuesdays and Thursdays they bring in the local vendors and they will try to charge you astronomical prices. Offer them a 1/3 of what they're asking and don't budge. One night of this would have been more than enough. Overall, the resort is just not what we're looking for in a resort. It wasn't horrible (except for the above 2 mentions areas), but we will not be returning. The El Dorado Royale in the Riviera Maya, Mexico is our definition of paradise. Go there. I will be positing pictures soon.  
<Date>Jul 11, 2008
