<Author>Samantha61
<Content>Good Holiday Our journey to Punta Cana was plain sailing however you have to be prepared to pay $10 to enter into customs. Once at the hotel it all looked very nice. We were disappointed when we were shown our room. We had booked the standard double room. It was very basic and dated. The bathroom had rust around the doors and the taps were coming away from the wall. On the first day we noticed there were ants all around the bathroom sink. We had to call reception 4 times throughtout the day to arrange someone to come and spray the area. They came in the evening and sprayed the whole room and we were left to sleep in the smell. We also had a problem when the toilet flush broke and again had to chase the reception staff to get it fixed.The best rooms are in block 7. They charge $50 a night to upgrade. The pool and the surrounding areas were very nice and clean but you have to be prepared for all the children to be in the adult pool. They have daily pool based sports. You collect the towels on the beach and some days there were no clean towels. We had the same problem with our room where there were no clean towels. Again we had to chase the reception staff to arrange for these to be provided. When you arrive you should book your meals straight away. We left it to the second day and was told everything was booked. We finally managed to get a booking at the American Grill but had to wait until 9.45. If you do not tip the waiters the service that you get is really poor. The first night we did not leave a tip and when we returned we did not even get shown to a table. We were treated very well once we started tipping. The food was ok. It was not great. You only get the national alcoholic drinks as part of the all inc. If you want international drinks they are charged at $7 each. The excursions are worth going on especially the quad bikes but be prepared for a long bumpy ride getting there. Do not bother with the meal for 2 on the beach. The food is not great. We had this and our table was put in the dark and we could not even see each other. We had to asked to be moved under a light. Overall we had a good time. We would go to the Dominican again but we would not stay at this resort.  
<Date>Jul 9, 2008

<Author>Wantsalot-foralittle
<Content>Great for the Money I understand that there are mixed reviews of Grand Oasis. You have to compare what you are paying to what you are getting. For our honeymoon we booked 7 nights for a junior master suite and spent $1200, for TWO people. Our room was very luxourious, jaccuzzi, huge walk in shower, CA, cable TV. The choices of restaurants were sufficient, specialty restaurants' portions were sort of small. The buffet has more than enough choices for all meals. Our house keeping was great, remember to leave a modest tip each day if you want them to go the extra mile; ie: flowers on your bed. We chose not to do any excursions because the tour guides charge too much. We did however opt to use the sea kiaks and sail boat. You should learn a little Spanish to talk to local venders, my husband is bilingual so we had no problems. The only problem that I can mention is the venders that come out a couple of evenings, I guess they do this so tourists don't have to leave the resort. Yes they are a bit pushy, just keep walking if you're not interested. We also had to walk way down the beach, off the resort grounds to find peace and quiet. Don't go alone, for safety reasons. It was an adventure for us, we found someone selling coconuts and handmade art. There was too much activity for us and loud music at the main pool and lots of toplessness going on at the resort beaches. Bugs were minimal, and only at night. Oh, and we wanted more local music and dancing, like marangue, bachata, salsa. I think the resort mostly catered to the prodominent Eureopean crowd.All in all we were pleased with our trip, we will go back again.  
<Date>Jul 8, 2008

<Author>jvpbatesville
<Content>Wonderful time Family of eight, Batesville, InOur family of eight, six adults and two children ages 8 and 5 spent from June 28 thru July 5 at this property. Flew USA 3000 departing Cincinnati. Flights both going and return were excellent with airline staff providing superior service.Processing upon arrival at the Punta Cana Airport was quick and easy taking less than 1/2 hour before boarding the ground transportation to the resort. Check in at Grand Oasis was also uneventful. We were treated very well by check-in staff.We were checked-in to building 5. Yes, building 5 is showing some age but it provoded exactly what our family needed, efficient A/C, hot showers with good water pressure, and a very clean and well attended room. I should also note that Grand Oasis is in the process of up-grading the older buildings as building 3 was closed for a total remodel. We tried 4 of the ala carte resturants, Del Mario (Itallian), American Grill (Tex Mex), Mare ( seafood) and the Japanese all of which offered a nice selection of food which was well prepared and nicely served. We did venture off property one evening to the Jellyfish. A twenty minute, $20 van/cab ride to a very beautiful setting with great seafood. The Jellyfish picked-up the cost of the van/cab ride back to your resort. The Windows Buffet always offered a large selection of choices for breakfast, and the Beach Resturant always had a nice lunch selection. The beach grill served grilled Burgers that were equal to most Burgers served in the US.The beach and pools were all very well maintained. Yes, there were vendors on this property none of whom ever became too pushy. Just let them know you are not interested in what they have for sale. The service at Grand Oasis was very good. The Housekeepers, Bar tenders, and wait staff were excellent. Nicholas at the Adult Pool bar has something about empty glasses. He will never let your glass be empty very long. No, we did not see a mosquito, or a roach, only a common house fly from time to time.Remember, the Dominican Republic is a third world country and 5 stars there is different than 5 stars most other places, but if you go to the Grand Oasis you will get the best they have to offer.Go there , relax and enjoy this beautiful resort. Remember not only ther house keepers, the bellmen and the bartenders with a tip but also the other support staff such as the guys who rake the beach.  
<Date>Jul 7, 2008

<Author>TorontoIslandgirl77
<Content>First Vacation.....mixed feelings!!! Finally after 13yrs together my hubby and I took our first vacation!! I was really nervous...actually terrified because I have never been anywere outside of Canada!! I read alot of reviews before we left and I'm glad I did!! Thank you to everyone who warned us to bring lots of sunscreen and bug spray!! They really do charge $25 dollars for a small bottle of sunscreen!!Arriving at the Grand Oasis was breath taking! We were greeting with Rum Punch and staff dancing in the front lobby. Check in was very quick and the staff took you luggage to your room.(of course a tip is expected) Our room was a disapointment, I paid for a garden view room, and we got a room in block 2 with a view of construction and contruction garbage, our patio door would not open(my hubby smokes) and our shower was just a trickle of water. I complained to the front desk and the wrote our name on a piece of paper to requst a room change if one came free. So we spent our 1st night quite unimpressed!! Oh!ya! the floors were so dirty they turned my feet black!! So the next morning we talked to our Sunwing representitive and he quickly brought us down to the front desk and told them how unhappy we were and how unexecptable this was! The staff told us that he would have a new room available A.S.A.P at no extra charge. The bell boy took me to go see the new room while my husband pack up our things. Wow!!! what a pleasant suprise...we got a room on block 4 on the 3rd floor end unit (4323) with an absolutely beautiful ocean view, our balcony wrapped around the end of the building(l shaped). We sat outside everyday at different times and always had a beautiful breeze from the ocean! We found out the next day that our new room had no air conditioning, they came right away to fix it, and by the 2nd day it still didn't work so the moved us again right across the hall! My advice....if you are unhappy, complain, be nice but persistant...I very nicely told them I was unhappy and this was unexceptable, and they with the help of our representive did everything they could to make us happy!!The food was okay, the buffet Windows had something to eat, but sometimes the food was cold and the fruit was warm and dry!Try to watch for the cooks putting out fresh food, if it looks cold or old, wait a few minutes rthe new stuff will come out! I found breakfast the best at windows, you could always get fresh bacon, scrambled eggs, or omletts made to order, and the fresh orange juice is amazing. We ate at 3 of the restruants, we booked upon arrival thanks to other reviews. The first restruant was DeMario's we both has the pasta trio and Ceaser salad. The ceaser salad had anchovies on top and mixed in the salad (yuck I had anchovie taste in my mouth all night, even after brushing twice) The pasta was okay but very salty, so taste your food before adding salt.The second restruant was the American Grill, the Steak was the best I have ever tasted!!! We did wait longer to be served, but it was well worth the wait!!Aqua was the last restruant we visited, we wern't impressed at all!! Neither of us enjoyed the meal or the service!! But that's only our opinion, other have really enjoyed it!!The beach and the pools were amazing, we tried every pool and the beach more than once. The ocean was warm and very clear, it was both of our first time in the ocean and we decided we liked the pools better. The main pool was always busy lots of noise, enertainment and music, and a swim up bar. But after a few days we wanted to find something quieter so we could just relax!! BINGO!! We discovered the adult pool hidden behind block 5, right by the Aqua restruant. This was our spot for the rest of our vacation...very quiet adult only pool and bar. The bartender Nicolas was amazing, you never had to leave you lonnge chair, he walked around getting you drink orders and delivered them to you moments later. Once he new what you were drinking (if you stuck to the same drink) he brought you a fresh one before your glass was empty!! Always good always strong!!lol I had to tell him little bit of Rum Nicolas was great!! On our last day we tipped him our last 200 paso's and took our picture with him. He was so greatful he gave us both a big hug and refilled our mugs to take to our room.We went on 2 excursions (we booked through Tuiti Fruity Tours off the beach) and found it to be alot cheaper than the resort. We went snorkeling for 1.5 hrs of $15 dollas U.S each, the resort wanted $45.We had an amazing experience the guide threw pellets into the water and instantly there we hundreds of fish around us! We also book horseback riding with the same people, it was $25 U.S and the resort wanted $50 U.S each. The riding was okay, the guide Willie was a 17yr old boy who took us through a small rundown area just outside of the resort (a little scary at first) but really lets you see how live in the Dominican isn't all beautiful resorts and beaches. He then took us to a private beach which was breath taking, and cut off some coconuts and it to us to drink. I guess the riding was okay for the money we paid.Now the bad!!! BEWARE of the venders!!! The resort lets them in twice a week!! The hound you like vultures on a fresh kill!! The also try to rip you off!! Watch them as they use thier calculators!! I caught them converting 64 pasco's instead of 34, I had no money left but wanted a few necklaces so i went to the front dest to get a cash advance from my visa, the lady at the desk said that $30 U.S was only 890 paso's and the vender wanted 1190 paso's. After that we did some conversions ourselves and kept it on paper in my purse so they couldn't try to rip us off again!! And believe me everyone will try to rip you off, so be prepared with your own calculator or know your conversion and exchange rates!!Lastly.....bring Immodium!! Both my hubby and i got really sick our last 2 days. Bad stomach cramps, gas, bloating then diarreah. In fact a few people that were on our flight that stayed at this resort were sick too! 3 days after we were home we went to the Doctor's and ended up on antibiotics with an intestional bacteria infection. We took all precautions before we left, we got our Hep AB vaccinations, antimaylaria medications and Dukoral for travellers diarreah and we still got sick!!All in all our vacation was great cause we don't know of anything better it being our first. I probably would not return to this resort. #1 people we met recommended better resorts that they have stayer at (they were sick too) #2 would like to try somewere new so that we have something to compare too!!  
<Date>Jul 6, 2008

<Content>Fantastic Holiday Eileen  Ernie Northern Ireland. We had a fantastic time at this hotel. It was better than the brochure. Cant fault it anyway. It was so close to airport, so no long coach journey. The beach is only a few steps from block 2 which we stayed in. The hotel and rooms very clean. Staff on Reception were very helpful, nothing was a problem to them. Restaurants had good selection of food , and it was always hot so no need to go hungry. The Beach restaurant and snack bar also excellent . Everyone was friendly. The only problem we found was the vendors who visited the hotel a few nights a week, you couldn't stop to view anything as they were very pushy in getting you to buy, and nearly every stall sold the same thing. The entertainment was excellent a great animation team, they put on great shows. Will definately go back again.

<Content>It was sooooo worth going! Loved it! SERIOUSLY DONT LISTEN TO ANY NEGATIVE REVIEWS AT ALL TODAY IS JULY 3RD AND I just got back today from the Grand Oasis in Punta Cana and it was amazing everyone was extremely nice! Especially Carlita the House keeper and Ernest the Receptionist! Best Service! If you dont have a problem with men in speedos or women topless than you should deffinatly come here. The food here is really good! I deffinatly recomend eating at the japanese place and Da Mario! great food also i recomend going to the disco sneaker on the 2nd floor of the lobby - great music. You will hear a bunch of bad reviews about the rooms to be honest with you i didnt rele find anything wrong except for the fact it smelt kinda funny and the only reason they are rebuilding areas of the resort are to make it better for the guests so please stop complaining! Also if you are going to book an exscurtion such as swimming with dolphins or scuba diving book it through the travel agency cause people will walk up to you on the beach trying to get you to buy through them and a lot of the time they are doing it illegally and if they see the police they will leave you stranded! It is deffinatly a family oriented place! There are tons of stuff for kids to do at night and during the day they have a movie theater, a play station room, pool tables, volleyball nets in the pool and out, they have a playground for the little kids and for the adults they have a spa and gym! The only bad thing i can say about this place is that if you DONT rent one of the safes it is very likely a housekeeper might steal one of your possessions...2 days ago our normal cleaning lady carlita left and the next day we had a new cleaning lady well we went out for the day and when we came back to get showered for dinner my mom found out she stole 5 packs of my moms cigarettes and left her with one so just lock your stuff to be on the safe side! Otherwise there is nothing really wrong with this place the beach is beautiful! Deffinately didn't regret this trip at all!

<Author>tony2000
<Content>Becareful of vendors (fake cigars) I would like to share our feeling about the Grand Oasis Punta Cana. Firstly i would go back to this hotel anytime. Food was very good, hotel was good, and service was good. Obviously it could get better, but the resort is pretty good.We stayed in room 5307. block 5, 3rd floor. The room was nice, 2 queen beds and nice bathroom, very high ceilings and space. The buffets was great, good al-carte restaurants. beach and pool was very good.My problem or warning to anybody going to this or any resort, is BE CAREFUL OF THE VENDORS THAT COME TO THE RESORT TO SELL, CIGARS BRACELETS, RINGS AND SO ON.We purchased Cigars Montecristo #1 a box of 25 and found out later they were fake! There was only 24 cigars inside and the green label was not real and obviously the cigars were not as well. If your going to buy cigars from these people that come to the hotel with green shirts and love to use the calculator, make SURE YOU KNOW WHAT TYPE OF CIGARS YOU ARE BUYING! If you don't you are going to get SCREWED!, THEY START at a very high price and will come down, if you keep to your lowest price. There prices are way to high, ex. for the whole kit of bracelet, necklace and earings with the dominican stone, MAX 35$ usd, DON'T PAY MORE BECAUSE YOU'LL BE SCREWED.! THE CIGARS, ASK TO OPEN THEM, AND MAKE SURE YOU KNOW REALLY HOW THEY ARE! AND COUNT THEM! IF THE guy refused, then don't buy them, once they are bought...its too late.Also there is acouple of shops near the grand oasis, 2 minute walk,there they will deal, if you know how to deal....REMEMBER THEY ALWAYS START AT THE CRAZY HIGH PRICE, SO you go to the lowest price and stay there, never mind about the calculator they will show you..... its a stupid pressure tactic.!Remember don't buy cigars from them, unless you know ABOUT CIGARS!, most of the time they are fake!, open the box and see and count them,The whole jewelry kit with the Domincan stone 35$ max or lower!Go to the flee market, 2 minute walk and deal!Forget about buying anything at the airport, its too expensive, buy the liquor at the flee market, for the Canadians (Montreal) becareful, buy the liquor at the duty free, they may not have it available in the plane or at the flee market, unless you want to buy Dominican rum, which is good!Good luck and remember don't get screwed, deal and know what your buying!Remember your the one with the dollars, not them!

<Author>vacati0n1
<Content>Cant complain My boyfriend and I stayed at the resort the 1st week of June. Overall we had a great time. We only had a few issues with our stay but for the most part we couldnt complain. First, the rooms. It seems that every building was built totally different. We were in building 9 which was new. The only problem i had with it were ants. The resort itself was gorgeous. Everything was really clean and the workers were always busy making it look even better. The beach was really clean and we never had trouble finding chairs, same with the pool. The drinks were really strong which was great for us and we really enjoyed the pool bar. Food, well the food was okay. We quickly learned how to eat at the windows buffet b/c most of the food was ICE cold! We learned to go to the made-to-order stations b/c we knew it would be hot. The variety of food was pretty good. We absolutely loved the italian restaurant, da mario, we went there twice. The only other rest. we went to was aqua and we wern't impressed. It was very difficult getting reservations to the restaurants so make sure you go and do that as soon as you arrive. The entertainment was ok. The night life was sort of lacking. The day time activities were always fun, such as aerobics, dancing, or volleyball. By far, the worst part of the trip was the PUSHY sales!!!!!! I understand its like this at all the resorts but we were CONSTANTLY hounded about buying excursions, time shares, and stupid lobster dinners. The resort doesnt seem to care about this taking place... it was even worse on the beach. We booked through apple which was great, i'd recommend booking your excursion through your travel agency, not guys off the beach! Things that are good to have, insulated mugs for drinks, bug spray ($20 there same as sunscreen). All in all we had a great time and would recommend this resort to someone whos looking for a cheaper trip.... NOT for a honeymoon in my opinion.  
<Date>Jun 15, 2008

38	5(time):1	10(restaurant):1	16(food):4	22(pool):1	27(bar):1	40(love):1	47(eat):1	51(enjoy):1	63(drink):2	72(resort):1	77(buffet):1	109(pretty):1	117(dinner):1	119(window):1	189(absolutely):1	222(cold):1	280(buy):1	347(twice):1	358(italian):1	391(understand):1	413(variety):1	453(okay):1	471(quickly):1	520(share):1	547(ice):1	602(bug):1	703(learn):1	734(excursion):1	893(strong):1	995(constantly):1	1099(spray):1	1113(lobster):1	2105(sunscreen):1	2224(mug):1	2434(insulate):1	2708(stupid):1	3488(mario):1	5330(hound):1

<Author>NickyMlln
<Content>Room for improvement We stayed at the Grand Oasis from 6th - 12th June 2008, and I can say that it was a mixed experience. We arrived to be greeted with a nice cold fruit punch and a fast check in service. We immediately upgraded to block 7 (room 7220) for US$50 per night, as we had read the reviews on this site before leaving. Not having seen any other rooms I can't comment on them, but we were really happy with the room we received, except for the small sand ants that seemed to congregate around the coffee pot. We reported this to reception and they offered to fumigate our room but couldn't offer us alternative accommodation! We declined as we didn't want to die of toxic poisoning, and lived with the ants. However to be fair we weren't over-run, and avoiding the coffee pot worked a treat. The view was amazing and we overlooked the beach, with a lovely balcony and inside and outside Jacuzzis. The restaurants were hit and miss, the American Grill was the worst, we waited over 20 minutes to be served, and eventually left after being ignored by several waiters. I also asked for wine to be told no wine and then have the tables either side of us (both with Spanish speaking guests) served white. I'm prepared to be generous and say that it was perhaps a language barrier, but I discovered later on that being an English speaker made you a second class citizen as some waiters would serve Spanish speaking guests first, and they had a habit of queue jumping. However the remainder of the staff were really helpful and courteous - I guess it just depended who you got on a particular day. The Italian restaurant in comparison was fantastic, the food, service and wine (yep got some eventually) was wonderful, and I can only praise the D'mario. The resort should look to D'Marios as their benchmark, and the service would improve 10 fold.The only other restaurant we tried was Windows with a buffet style theme. I've read a few reviews that stated the food there was cold, and while I agree that it could have been hotter, it was a buffet and there was always fresh fruit, vegetables and salads on offer. We ate more in there than other restaurants as we always found something we liked and enjoyed the flexibility of not having to book a specific time slot to eat. The pools were clean and the bars were always very very generous with their measures. But you must be aware that there is a tipping culture. We tipped the cleaner $5 per day (more than normal, but I know how messy my boyfriend is), and hoped for a more special service. We received the minimum, no extra cokes or beers and the number of towels we received depended on the day. But the room was always spotless and this to me was more important. Yes there was seaweed on the beach but there were staff cleaning every day, and it really wasn't too bad. Finally the one and only thing that I felt really let the resort down, were the sellers. We were badgered all the time, and although we did buy a few items in the end we felt continuously pressured. One of the shop keepers tried ripping us off by trying to charge us 85 peso to 1 US$, instead of the ex. rate of 33 - 35. We argued, and told him take 35 or leave it and he changed his tune. I suppose that you get people everywhere trying it on, but it did leave a bitter taste in my mouth. To be fair though I don't know how much influence the hotel has over the sellers.To summarise if you speak Spanish or French and don't mind tipping a buck or two for everything then you'll have a great time. Otherwise it might be a bit hit or miss.  
<Date>Jun 15, 2008

<Author>ellieric
<Content>Not 4 Star: AVOID FOOD this hotel is certainly not 4 star like thomson claim, also it is not a new build as we were led to believe. My partner was offered cocaine by one of the hotel staff which was shocking. Prepare to be hassled constantly to buy goods, as the hotel staff let outside vendors into the resorts and you will be surrounded. You MUST haggle the price, we got ripped off on our first day, spent $100 dollars on a pot, but we soon got wise to it. Our line was we're going home tomorrow, and only have this amount of money left you will not be surprised that they will accept your offer.Now the food: Avoid the burgers! We have never been so ill in our lives, and the burgers are raw! One night, i asked the cook to cut the burger in half, as i wanted it cooked, he threw his spatula down, then started yelling at me in Spanish. The staff can be very rude, especially if you are a woman. Eventually a manager came down, and got me a burger, i said i wanted it burnt, so i knew it would be not be pink, guess what? it was still raw.We booked an excursion with thomson to saona island. We were told we could trust thomson, so spent $304 for this day out. On the day, we waited 1hr 40 mins for our pick up, only then to receive a phone call to say we would not be picked up as we were too far away. We got our money back the next day, but the Thomson rep, was not very helpful, was very sheepish, but that's most likely as she was trying to sell her excursions to a new set of holiday makers. My advice? Get the excursions off the fella's on the beach. We met another couple on a thompson holiday, and they bought the same excursion as us, from the beach and only paid $80. That's a big price difference, and they went on their day trip. We could only afford one excursion, and as that was canceled, we spent two weeks feeling trapped on the resort. There's a lot more negatives we experienced, and Thomson will be receiving a written complaint from my partner and I.Overall: Prepare to be disappointed as we were.I'd like to add, we have been on many Thomson holidays over the years, and this is the First time we have felt need to complain.

<Author>JoeD05
<Content>Decent resort, awful food First off, they initially tried to stick us in one of the new rooms which was supposedly a free upgrade. That particular room had an awful mildew stench and no AC. Then they tried to stick us in another room which was at least 30 years old. Finally they put us in building 10, the room was pretty nice although we had to settle for two queen beds.  Now lets move on shall we? As soon as we arrived, the peddlers were all over us. I have NEVER seen a resort that had people BEGGING you all day long to go on their fishing trips, dinner cruises, buy their cheap overpriced jewelry, etc. Usually thats what you see when you travel OUT OF THE RESORT. That was VERY ANNOYING. As we are trying to relax on the beach, CAPTAIN COOK kept approaching us to go on his stupid Lobster dinner cruise. The food? WOW, just the WORST I have ever seen. The booze was also terrible. The all inclusive is a joke. Don't even think about trying the vodka unless you want the hangover of your life. On the positive side, the service was pretty good, the staff was very nice and the pools were pretty good as well, although no water slides or pools over 4 1/2 ft deep. Also they ran out of towels continously. Basically you get what you pay for. Stay away from this dump.

<Author>Satchy
<Content>Its great I am so fed up with reading negative reviews I am so fed up of reading such negative reports about this resort. We have been to the Dominican Republic for the past seven years, and have stayed at The Grand for the last five of them. When we first stayed there it was a Sunscape Resort, and we thought that is was very good but since it has been taken over and is now The Grand Oasis it has improved immensely.They have built three new buildings; there are now five swimming pools, and twonew restaurants. The staff cannot do enough for you and every one of them will go the extra mile, they are always smiling, are happy and polite. It a shame that some of the guests are not the same, and find fault with everything.The food is great, always fresh, and loads of choice. There is always lots of variation, at windows (the main buffet) as well as the other restaurants. The whole resort is spotless. Unlike other resorts we have stayed at in the Dominican Republic.We have met and made so many friends, both staff and guests, over the years, and still stay in touch with quite a few of them. We arrived home on Tuesday 20th May and I have rebooked for next year already. People ask why we keep going back to the same resort and I answer it like going home and they make you feel like part of their family. So why would I need to go anywhere else  
<Date>May 26, 2008

<Author>ac_rivera
<Content>Awesome Getaway! We just returned from our wonderful vacation in the Dominican Republic at the Grand Oasis. We couldn't have asked for a nicer resort to stay at! The staff was very friendly and welcoming. At first we were concerned as it appears everyone speaks in Spanish, which we do not, but after some inquisitive looks we gave them they started speaking to us in English. We booked our trip on CheapCaribbean.com - which I highly recommend. They had great prices, reviews, and took extra care of us the moment we landed at the airport. They told us things to look out for and what to do. The food at Grand Oasis is decent, not excellent, but not terrible. The main restaurant, Windows, has a great buffet that changes every lunch and dinner so you got a good variety. The other restaurants you have to make reservations for or they won't let you in to eat. So be sure to make reservations for all of the restaurants the day you arrive. The fish place was okay, the Italian restuarant was good, and the American Grill was excellent - if you like Tex Mex food.The Grand Oasis had constant entertainment. There was a sheet listed as to the daily activities and they kept you busy all day if you wanted to. With water aerobics (trust me it was a ton of fun) to salsa dancing lessons by the pool side to beach volleyball, you were sure to never be bored. The nightly entertainment was pretty neat as well - a different show everynight. Just be sure to bring bug spray or you will get bit up.Also, bring plenty of sun screen as the sun is extremely hot and the sunscreen in the gift shops will cost you upwards to $25. We sadly had to pay that price. Overall, I highly recommend the Grand Oasis as a great place to stay while in Punta Cana. I wish I was still there!!!  
<Date>May 17, 2008

<Author>Jerzeegirl129
<Content>So Sad We had to leave!!! First of all...anyone reading this and worrying about all the bad reviews, please please trust me...they are WRONG WRONG WRONG!!!... My Husband and I stayed at the Grand Oasis from May 7th to the 14th (which was not enought time!!)The monute we walked into the lobby there was a nice man bringing us a drink!.... We upgraded immediately while checking in just because we wanted to treat ourselves. The guy at the desk was more than pleased to help us, and it was only 50 bucks extra a night. If you have some extra money, spoil yourself, if you don't, trust me, you'll be fine in the room your at. Lets be honest here...how much time do you spend in your room? FOOD... NEVER ENDING ALL YOU CAN EAT ALL DAY! The Windows is different every night. We only went to the Japanese Resturaunt once which was very good, and Aqua once which was also good. Plus if you go to the resturaunts and you don't like your meal, Windows in open til 10!! Just go there and grab something.. GET THE MASSAGE ON THE BEACH!!! ($60 for 50 min) The Beach was beautiful and clean.. I'm sure you heard it is very hard to get an umbrella on the beach, but there are plenty of chairs and plenty of shade from the palm trees. BRING ENOUGH SUNTAN LOTION AND ALOE!!!! On the resort Sunscreen in $20!!! Snorkling is awesome...We used a local on the beach. We went with another couple we met at the Hotel. The local wanted to charge us $30 a peice and we talked him down to $15. The work staff is so kind and willing to do anything to make you happy! Treat them nice and don't be cheap, tip them a dollar here and a dollar there, these people work VERY VERY hard to keep you happy! And when you do give them a few bucks, they remember your face and go above and beyond for you! BRING OFF!!!!!!!! The pools are gorgeous and always clean.... Hard to get an unbrella chair unless your an early bird!!! We did an excursion outside of the resort!!! Just know that these are 6+ hour excursions with all the traveling to the place and back.  We are already planning our next trip back there. I can write on and on and on, but you'll see for yourself. If there is a problem with something when you are there, tell one of the workers, they will help you, don't wait to come home and cry the blues on Trip Advisor. Hopefully I'll get some pictures on here soon!!!!

<Author>RobboUK1
<Content>BEWARE of double-booking . . . My husband and I were booked into the Grand Oasis from 14th to 28th April. On arrival, after a total of 14 hours travelling from the UK, we were told that the room was double-booked. We were taken to another hotel and after three hours of negotiations were eventually provided with good accommodation. If you book a room at the Grand Oasis be aware that double-booking is common practice with this hotel - there were two other incidences of this at the time of our arrival. We were not at all impressed!

<Author>PaulLexingtonKY
<Content>Good Value - Nice Resort We stayed at the Grand Oasis from May 3, 2008 through May 10, 2008. We booked the trip with Apple Vacations, flying out of Cincinnati Ohio. Apple Vacations did a good job. Our rep at the hotel was very helpful and not at all pushy. He gave us some good advice. The Hotel overall was nice, but not over the top or anything. We have stayed in two other all inclusive resorts, one in Jamaica and one in Cancun. Both of them were in this same price range and the Grand Oasis was better without a doubt than the other two resorts.The food is pretty good, the specialty restaurants are OK. aQua is the most interesting and their food is good. We didn't try the Japanese restaurant.Our room was in building 10. It was nice and clean and was right next to one of the pools. Maid service was good. Mini bar was stocked with cold beer, Coke, Sprite and water.The bar staff and wait staff were very friendly.The entertainment was pretty good...not like Broadway or anything but very fun to watch. We don't have children but it looked like they had plenty for the kids to do.I would recommend taking a side trip to Santo Domingio. It's a neat city and makes a nice day trip. it's a long bus ride but worth it.Overall I would rate the Grand Oasis as a very good value. It's not super posh or anything but for the price we both thought it was a good deal.Enjoy!  
<Date>May 11, 2008

<Content>Great Little Resort Visit Dominican Rep. every year and try a different resort.Buzzed thu airport to transfers and to this hotel within 20 min.of the airport. We wanted to upgrade to Building 7, front desk seemed uninterested in helping us. Went to the Apple Rep., Angel. He took up directly to Caren de Vries (Rooms Division Manager) She was great! Upgraded us and gave us the best room we had ever seen. 7221, faced the ocean, 2 whirlpool baths, huge shower. Check the travelers photos, they tell it all.If you want a better room upgrade at an additionl cost of $50-$80,per day. To e-mail Caren at [-]to reserve a better room. Windows buffet food was good. Be patient, you're on vacation.Italian rest. food was good. Pool clean, maid service good.People friendly. Beautiful beach. Remember, you're in the tropics. Hot sun, some bugs, and flies. Vendors a pain.If you want a 6 gold where everyone waits on you hand and foot,go elsewhere.We would recommend resort with upgraded room.

<Author>hotstuff454
<Content>Good and Bad Over all our trip was pretty good. A few pointer's though:make reservation's for dinner when you arrive because even if the restaruant's empty they wont seat you.Bring your own floats  lot's of sunscreen,They'll try  charge you an arm and a leg.ALWAYS bargain, there's no price set in stone (even on the hair breading at the beach) Hotel ad state's: free room service for 24 hour's, ya right. It's $6 a trip and they take FOREVER! Hotel also states free pony rides, never happened. No pony's anywhere in sight. I heard they stopped doing it along time ago. Also LOT'S  LOT'S of topless women every where even children not just at the adult pool. Bld 7 was beautiful all marble with walk in shower and jacuzzi, slidding glass door's lead's to patio and lazy river. About the food- it was mediocre, you get what you pay for, I was sick for 1 night my daughter was sick for 2 ( cant exactly say it was the food ) Our family went for 7 days: my husband ,myself, 2 children 1 age 9 and 1 age 15 they enjoyed themselves. There was alway's something to do. WWWEEEE ABSOLUTLY loved NIKKO the bartender at the swim up bar. He was the best. He was alway's in a good mood, funny and entertained the kid's. HE WAS GREAT.

<Author>halfE
<Content>Don't believe everything you read but it wasn't perfect either...... My husband and I stayed at the resort from April 17th to May 1st and overall had a great time. We tried to book Club class for the flights but our travel agent waited too long and it was all booked. We will definately ensure this is done right off the bat in the future since coach was not comfortable at all and on a 10 hour flight from Vancouver BC to Punta Cana it was a bit much. However the flight attendants worked very hard to keep you happy as best they could.When we arrived we had a similar feeling to some other folks as we dropped people off at the first resort Calodina and saw how beautiful it was, made us less than impressed with our hotel when we pulled into the narrow courtyard. We were among the first to check in and went to our room, this first room in building 10 and was horrible. The floor was dirty, the patio door did not lock(first floor room) and the bathroom was dirty too!! We complained and they sent someone to fix things but they could not to our satisfaction so they moved us to another room(we had to insist and although we felt bad being pushy there was just no way I was staying in that room) The next room was not much better but at least it was clean. It had an amazing view of a brick wall-not good but by now it was 9pm and we were hunger and tired.The next morning we went to the Nolitour orientation and found out we were not alone. The rep Sandra listened to our problems and helped us to arrange for a better room, the funny thing is another couple who were complaining had been given our first room and they had the same complaints plus the air conditioning had stopped working in the middle of the night.We were finally moved to room 9204 and things were much better here. We had to insist on being moved though and even offered to pay for an upgrade-they said they had nothing however I listened to someone complain later that day and they were moved to building 7(by far the nicest rooms-we went and looked at them)With the room settled we went about our vacation feeling much better. The elevator in our building was working as of day 3 or so and although the landing of the elevator is a bit bumpy it is not too bad.We enjoyed the food overall except the coffee in the room-it made us both sick the third day and we stayed away from it after that. Windows restaurant can fill most needs and usual waiter David gave us the best service! He even managed to teach us some useful spanish words and phrases. The aQua restaurant was good most of the time although not exceptional for sure.The Restaurants were not easy to book and we ended up eating late most nights- we were afraid to book too far in advance since we wanted to make sure we liked the food they had to offer. If we had to do it again we would have booked everything the first day.Pools were clean however they need to be better at enforcing the age limit at the adult pool. Now do not get me wrong I love children-but mostly I love that I choose to leave my kids at home and wanted a vacation that was kid free. Not a huge deal most of the time though.Casino was great, we did not spend any of our own money just used the tickets they give you.($10 per day) we would play the ticket on the table assigned and then take our money(we won 12 nights out of 13) and change it into slot tokens. We came out about $40.00 ahead for the 2 weeks so enjoyed it.We did not take in the shows except for the first night, so we cannot really comment on them. We did do some of the tours though and enjoyed the Country Adventure tour-full day and it was worth the money. Had a chance to learn about the country, see a school, visit a typical home and go horseback riding as well. The Kontiki tour was good although we were with a large group who all knew each other so we did not enjoy it that much. We went to the shopping centre twice to use the bank machine since the one at the resort did not work for us. There is a free shuttle every 2 hours so it was easy. We ate at Tony Roma's when we were there and it tasted just like home. I think we both enjoyed this since sometimes the food at the resort did not agree with us.Overall, I would recommend the resort but would suggest booking the Club class seats on the plane and would suggest you not hesitate to be a bit pushy to get the best room you can!  
<Date>May 6, 2008

<Author>missingit_8
<Content>it was amazing. I went with 20 of my best girl friends down there from April 13th til April 20th. We had an excellent time. Rooms: Are rooms were all nice, all within the same two buildings, 2 and 3. I was in building 3 ground level and it was very nice. No bugs or rats or anything like that. Our maid was very nice after we tipped her. Food: The food was okay, it was anything special but Windows did have good food on certain nights. I ate at the Italian twice and it was very good. Drinks: The drinks were okay, it was very cheap alcohol but the drinks still tasted good. Alcides in the Piano Bar is the best bartender at the resort we loved him. It was our favorite bar to go to before we went to the disco every night. We also really enjoyed the bartenders at the Beach Bar, they were a lot of fun. Overall: It was a very good trip, we had a lot of fun, I however would recommend booking in block 7 because the rooms are a lot nicer. I also recommend if you are going to do an excursion we went on the Kon TIki, a snorkeling booze cruise and we all agreed that it was our favorite part of the trip. The staff at the hotel is amazing, too. We met one guy who is there doing the water aerobics at 6 am, and we saw him at the disco closing it at 2 am. He was at every activity and he really was great.

<Author>mavmom
<Content>Had a great time We had a great time at the Grand Oasis. I travelled with my daughter and some friends for spring break.I had a room in block seven. The room was very nice. We did have a problem with the air conditionong leaking and it was noy until my friend fell in the water that we were finally able to get someone to look into our complaint. It only took four days. My daughter had a room in building three. The room was okay. She did have fifty dollars stolen from her from maintanance workers while she was in the room. We were not expecting much from this trip for what we paid but for any amount of money I don,t think you should have to put up with standing water on your marble floors. We enjoyed the ala cartes very much with the Japanese being our favorite. Breakfast at windows was delightful. Really enjoyed the smoothies and orange juice. The shows at night were fun,make sure and catch the all star review it was great. Had a lot of fun at the piano bar. We did go to lunch at jellyfish, great food and what a view on the beach. Taxi from grand oasis was eighteen dollars for seven of us. Did find vendor night to be interesting. Expect to be pretty much harrased all evening . If I ever return to the dominican republic again I don,t know if I would stay at this resort yet or not.  
<Date>May 4, 2008

<Author>SMCChic
<Content>Not Grand, but very good My husband and I stayed at the Grand Oasis from March 24 - March 29, 2008. We stayed in Room 10209 in room block 10. Overall this was an above average hotel and experience but there were a few problems/issues. If you are expecting perfection at this resort, you will not find it. But if you are looking for a good overall vacation this resort will be great for you.A few of the issues  - the resort is still finishing room block 10 and adding on. That means that part of the hotel is quite loud with construction noise. - if you want shade on the beach you must set your alarm for 6am and be prepared to defend your seats. We saw a big disturbance between some Europeans over shade and chairs - the rooms are not perfect: there is water damage from the shower leaking into the rooms, the air conditioning does not keep up making rooms damp and a little smelly.A few things that make this resort GREAT - the pools - the friendly staff - the Aqua rest. for breakfast - the beautiful ocean and beach - the cleaning staff - the friendliness of other vacationers - the outside main bar in the eveningsWe want to send a special thanks out to staff who made this vacation even better - Wander and Sandra in the American Grill, Martha in the main bar, Lebron in Aqua and the Apple Reps Sandy and Angel were absolutely terrific!We would go back to this resort but would probably venture onto another destination if available too.To compare - the Ocean Blue is much nicer and the Jack Tar in Puerta Plata is much worse. Grand Oasis is going to fall in the middle.We got a deal on this place - about $800US including tax and flight. For the money this was worth it.Resort pictures on not deceiving - it is a picture perfect place.  
<Date>May 3, 2008

<Author>pigo1
<Content>Great time My wife ,myself and and 9 year old daughter flew from Toronto on April 10. The flight was fine on Air transat with exception of a couple of loud idiots poring their own booze and yelling profanity. The staff did have a talking with them , however. When we arrived in the D.R we boarded our bus(#98) to the Grand oasis which also was taking people to the Catalonia resort next door. The bus pulled into the Catalonia first and disembarked EVERYONE except for us an an elderly couple. The catalonia lobby looked beautiful at night. I started to wonder why we were the only people going to the Grand Oasis. Five minutes later we pulled into this tiny driveway which led to a building that looked more like a prison from the outside than the resort I thought I had booked to. This was our first trip and I was starting to worry. Had we made a mistake? Check-in was very informal and I received my free bottle of rum as promised. We were escorted up the stairs(elevators don't work) to room 10304. Upon opening the door , the smell of mould hit us hard but then we turned on the lights and discovered that this room looked nothing like the one in the brochures. We were also directly under the main ventilation system on the roof which was very LOUD. I was ready to make a stink but my wife convinced me otherwise. The resort itself is absolutely beautiful. It is a perfect size to manage on foot and the grounds are kept spotless. We dined at all the ala carte restaurants and the food was very good. Seriously , no complaints. The drinks were also great and we never had to wait long to be served. The beach is nice if you don'tmind a little seaweed and the pools are clean. Staying in the Bavaro side gave us exclusive use of the AQUA restaurant at which we had breakfast each day. Nice Place too. All in all we really enjoyed our stay save for the noisy room..would not let them pull that one on me again.The Bonus of staying at the Bavaro suites is the smaller concierge....it was really no easy dealing with them as opposed to the main building which was always a zoo . Go and enjoy but be careful with your room selection.  
<Date>May 1, 2008

<Author>Bomni
<Content>Excellent Experience We got married at the Grand Oasis in Punta Cana and it was awesome. One thing many people fail to realize its not Canada or the US.. so expect some problems to occur. We went down there expecting things to go wrong with our wedding and our stay there, but there simply were no mistakes. As bride and groom we stayed in Building 7; The rooms in this building were beautiful we had ground level, beach front and one of the pools were 10ft from our room! ALL staff were excellent to our group no complaints. Food was pretty good at the buffet, but mostly the restaurants were the places to eat. The Wedding Coordinators were more than accommodating. The ceremony was fantastic everything worked out very well. Lots of activities to enjoy while we were there. We enjoyed our stay here and will DEFINITELY RETURN to Hotel Oasis in Punta Cana. It was clean, friendly, memorable, and will recommend to others. My only regret is that I did not know any Spanish! But most employees knew quite a bit of English. Tipping the maids extra got us extra towels and beer. I just can not say enough good things about this hotel.

<Author>Dodrill1
<Content>Grand Oasis, wonderful the second time around!!! A group of 20 friends went to the Grand Oasis April 5-12 and had a fantastic time. My husband and I had been there in January and planned a wedding for friends in this group. The wedding was AWESOME!! Jose, the PR person made all of the arrangements and even married the couple down on the beach as planned. We had champange on the beach and then had the wedding dinner in DaMarios (Italian) The housekeeping staff decorated their room. The entire staff watches every little thing, right down to the last detail. We ate at all of the restaurants, loved them all. On Friday night, we were given a special dinner on the beach because we were with Apple Vacations, steak, grilled shrimp, BBQ chicken and all of the trimmings. I cannot say enough nice things about this resort. EVERYONE does a wonderful job, from the GM, Pablo, Carin, Jose, registration staff, all of the wait staff , housekeeping and even the guys sweeping up seaweed EVERY morning. We plan on going back again in January and April 2009. May husband says he's found a new home!

<Author>pvm
<Content>an awesome vacation - loved it there First of all don't believe all the negative reviews you read. we just got back from a fantastic 1 week trip and loved our time there. We went from April 8th -15th. First all the beach is absolutely beautiful. The water is warm and clear and the sand is white. You will always find a place to lounge in at the beach. Our favorite place to lounge at though was the adult pool. If you are lucky enough to have Nico as your bartender then you will be in for a treat. Our favorite drink was the Chocolate Monkey and he truly makes it good, we had everyone in the pool drinking it at 10AM to start the day! We never had any problems with the food, we always found something to eat and everyday it was a different theme night at the Windows buffet. The service is good and fast and you can always find a place to sit down. We always had the same waiters and they automatically know what you want to drink and have it at your table before you sit down! That is service with a smile. We were in building 5 and it was close to everything, the beach, the pool and of course the buffet restaurants. The rooms were comfortable and Rosa our maid was awesome. She would always put flowers in our room and make sure our room was very clean. We had an amazing time, I would gladly go back in a heartbeat. Remember to tip when you are down there, its not expected but I know its truly appreciated by all whom work there. We are planning our next trip down there for the fall. We made wonderful friends from all over and our one week went by way too fast. Don't believe the negative talk you hear about the resort. If you go with an open mind you will enjoy yourself. Remember its not the Ritz so don't compare it to that or even go expecting that! Would I recommend this resort to my friends, absolutely I already have!  
<Date>Apr 20, 2008

<Author>Alexic
<Content>Holiday Inn on the beach meets unbearable food with plenty of "free" alcohol My wife, my 3 year old daughter, and I were at the resort during April, '08, and let me tell you, we were looking towards our trip home on the 3rd day we were there. I couldn't wait to eat something better, my daughter was subsiding on snacks that we brought from home and fruits, and my pregnant wife lost 3 pounds in one week ;-)  travel about 50% for work and I have been in my share of restaurants and hotels to compare.If you are traveling with kids, my best recommendation is to get travel insurance, I wish I had it, and from now on, I am definitely buying one! Also, make sure to bring your medical insurance cards to any trip, I am glad I did.By the way, I want to say that all Apple Vacation reps (the travel agency) were extremely polite and helpful throughout our trip, hats off to them.Let me start with good things first: If you are travel without kids, get a few cocktails to in the morning to get you through the day, and can get this resort at $700 per person / week, air included, this, probably, would be a good value, otherwise, I would stay away.Flight (3/5 stars): We booked the trip with Apple Vacations and used the chartered USA 3000 flight from Chicago. Checked in at O'Hare without any problems, Apple representatives were very helpful. The flight was non-stop, non-eventful, but the cabin was crammed, seats were uncomfortable, the plane looked old (I noticed some Air Canada logos inside the cabin), and some flight attendants weren't very polite (but some were quite nice).Once in Punta Cana, we had to pay $10 per person to get in the country (its $20 to get out if you are not with Apple Vacations, who prepay this fee). We were greeted with a bunch of luggage carriers who offered to get our bags to Apple bus, we refused and in about 10 feet were greeted by Apple rep who told us where to get on the bus. Once there, we were helped with our luggage and sat in the air-conditioned bus waiting for other people. The reason we had to wait is that some people use those non-Apple affiliated luggage people who loaded their bags on the wrong bus, and then they had to look for their luggage and reload it to the correct bus. Beware, you can still use those luggage carriers if you have a lot of stuff, just make sure that they don't leave, and you are with them to show them where you are going. Check-In (3/5 stars): I slipped the front desk person $20 to get us a good room, and we were placed in Building 2. (The best rooms from what I can see are in building 7, they can tell you that it's far (and it looks like that on the map), but really everything is very close so don't fall for that. The reason I didn't get #7 is that the guy told us he only had 1st floor, and I wanted to avoid any possible pest problems. Although we checked in at the same time, one of my fellow travelers was told to wait 3 hours to get a room, so make sure you show them the money first! In short, the check-in desk: Very helpful and accommodating if he/she knows that you are going to tip. When we were checking out, a different guy was quite rude, almost refused to take my beach towels (wanted me to go on the beach (5 min away) to return them, took my room keys and threw them on his desk, didn't say anything polite like Thank you for staying with us, and I had to remind him to get me a check-out form (which later was required to board the bus). Concierge (1/5 stars): When I tried to book dinners at the restaurants (it's required unless you are eating at the buffet), he told me that everything was booked (apparently waiting for a tip). I didn't see anyone tipping him, which explains why he looked constipated. My wife later went a raised a big deal about restaurant reservations and another lady (who was not generally taking dinner reservations) helped her, and we got all prime time reservations at all restaurants. My wife later tipped her $20 for her help.Rooms / Room Cleaning / Maintenance (3/5 stars): Room was quite comfortable, overall. But it is a Holiday-Inn style room with old bathroom and bad mattresses. On the other hand, TV and clock worked fine, there were a few US programs on, water pressure was o.k., all outlets, A/C, and fans worked as they should. I tipped the room cleaning lady $4 per day and we always had towels by noon, fridge was promptly restocked with 4-5 bottles of water (there were 2 when we arrived), 6 cans of premium beer (there were 2 cans of regular when we arrived), soda, etc. Cleaning lady did a very nice job of making beds, bringing some flowers to pretty up the room, floors were cleaned very nicely every day. I did not see any pests while staying in the room, except maybe a few ants in the bathroom. When I needed more drinking water or towels, all I had to do is call an operator and they brought everything within 15 minutes. Maintenance was fine, I saw them scrubbing streets, chopping dead leafs from the trees, gathering seaweed, adding chemicals to the pool, etc. Food (2/5 stars) / Drinks (4/5 stars): Overall, it was edible, but quite bad.Windows buffet: Breakfast and lunch were 'OK, dinners were tolerable. The servers were very helpful once they knew that they will get tipped (they refilled our coffee, juice, brought high-chair for my daughter, etc). However, if there were no servers that knew us, we had to go to a bar to ask for drinks, had to find and bring a high-chair from other table, etc, you get the picture. Restaurants: Most were pretty bad as well. (I didn't try Japanese or Aqua). They badly need chefs to come up with menus for this resort. Japanese: I didn't want to pay $15 for what I saw on the menu (poor selection) of something remotely Japanese. Aqua: Once I looked at the menu and 3 people in the whole restaurant, I said, the food does not sound appetizing, there is probably a reason why Italian and Seafood have people and this place is empty; however, my friend tried it once and said it was not bad. Tex Mex: There is Taco Bell, then 15 feet of cr? then there is Tex Mex food, but the service was good.Seafood: I liked the seafood restaurant, the fish and the service were good. Italian: The Italian restaurant was hit  miss. The first time we went there, I couldn't eat their pasta, it was so bad. The next time my wife and I ordered mixed grills and enjoyed the food that evening, but I spent the next day in the bathroom. Thanks to the person who suggested bringing Imodium, it saved my life ;-) My 3 year old had diarrhea for the first 4 days and hardly ate anything, I don know if it was a bug that she caught in the US or down there or a combination, so I am not going to pass judgment. We went to a doctor there, who was extremely helpful and very nice, he gave us some medicine for her, it's called Perenterol and also told us not to use Imodium Pepto-Bismol with kids because it may make a possible infection much worse. At any rate, after one day of this new medicine and Gatorade (which I bought at the resort), my little one was much happier, her stool became normal and she munched the food with better appetite. If you are traveling with little kid, beware that food at the resort is generally sub par.Room Service: Almost non-existent, there are 6 sandwiches, but that is it. Keep in mind that room service is subject to a $6 charge (plus tip), unless you are an Apple vacation guest.Drinks: All alcohol beverages were good, servers used plenty of alcohol, so I'd say it was one of the best features of this place. There are no servers roaming around, so you have to go to a bar. Also, make sure you wear slippers when getting drinks, I cut my foot on a piece of broken glass near a bar, not sure how it got there since I only saw plastic glasses being used.Service (2/5): Some servers are nice, but others make you feel like they are doing you a favor. My friend had especially bad service experience, they were rude to him (refused to give bath towels saying they didn't have any, and he should come back the next day). It took a call from Apple rep to get him towels. Also, a casino dealer was very rude to him, ignoring his questions, throwing chips. What I experienced is the indifference by some service staff to the guests. It worth mentioning that not all of them speak English so you may not get much help unless you go to the front desk or call an operator. Beach/Ocean/Pool (4/5): Beach was not bad, plenty of palm trees, there were enough umbrellas to take shade under (but only if you get up at 6AM to reserve the place with beach towels). Water was warm and relatively clean to swim in, not counting occasional smell of diesel from nearby parked boats or sewer smell from time-to-time. Watch out for occasional broken glass in the sand. Also, right on the beach, in the middle of the hotel property, there is a run-down shack that's literally falling apart (apparently original owner refused to sell, so he's just sitting there day in and day out, not bothering anybody). Entertainment (4/5): Ok, my daughter was sick, then I was sick, so we didn't get a chance to enjoy everything. However, it does look like there are plenty of things to do for people with older children (10+ years) or people without children. There are games at the pool, casino, dancing, billiards, tennis, exercise, movies, etc. They go around with exotic animals (parrots, monkey, lizard) to take pictures ($10/printed pic or $50/CD containing 10 pics). There are excursions, snorkeling, diving, speed boats, deep see fishing, etc. I only did snorkeling and speed boats; speed boats event was very fun while snorkeling was uneventful, there are not a lot of fish and there is no colorful exotic reef, just a bunch of rocks. Surrounding Area (1/5): I did the trip to a nearby store to pick up some diapers and the scenery is ?well, 3rd world country, garbage on the street, smell of sewer, roads are beat down, etc; in short, there is no reason to venture out. Conclusion: I would not recommend this resort to anyone except if you are traveling without kids to enjoy the sun, free drinks, and don't mind feeling ignored by the hotel staff, can tolerate bad food, average rooms, and have dollars in your pocket to flash them every time you need something. Enjoy!

:1	2055(raise):1	2089(conclusion):1	2118(restock):1	2167(operator):1	2199(pocket):1	2867(flash):1	2890(edible):1	2958(roam):1	3345(diarrhea):1	3626(medicine):1	3738(tolerable):1	4020(sub):1	4217(stool):1	4239(tolerate):1	4337(pregnant):1	4346(imodium):1	4411(mex):2	4636(appetite):1	4714(tex):2	4741(taco):1	5390(appetizing):1	6242(judgement):1	6257(carrier):1	7363(6am):1	7728(munch):1	9502(subside):1	10383(billiards):1	10497(gatorade):1	10909(cr):1

<Content>had the best times ever       beach  
<Date>Apr 18, 2008

<Author>leslie1459
<Content>Beautiful Resort!!! We just got back from a 7 night stay at the Grand Oasis booked through Apple Vacations and had a great time. Do not listen to the bad reviews!!! Some people are just snotty and forget that they are in a different country and expect the world to revolve around them. CHECK IN We checked in around 12:00 noon and got right into our rooms. We got a welcome cocktail and a cold towel while waiting to check in. Some people had to wait to get into their rooms, but people need to keep in mind that if you are checking in before 3pm (check in time) you might have to wait. Our room was in building 3 on the bottom floor. My only complaint was that the halls echoed and other guests were VERY NOISY at night, so maybe request a room on the second or third. They were remodeling the room right next to us and we were initially concerned about the noise, but it turned out to be no problem at all. They didn't start working until later in the morning. ROOMS We tipped the maids a few dollars every day and let notes about what we wanted stocked in the fridge. She did a great job. They did take the towels in the morning and then brought clean ones back in the afternoon. We always had them in plenty of time to shower before dinner.RESORT The resort itself in absolutley beautiful and well maintained. There were palm trees and beautiful plants everyone. There was always staff cleaning up. There were some flamingos in one of the pools. BEACHThe beach was beautiful and always very clean. Staff raked up any seaweed on the beach. We walked up the beach for several miles and our beach was actually the cleanest. The water was warm and crystal clear. There were always plenty of beach chairs. The huts did get snatched up early but we did not want them. We switched our towels every day at the towel hut. Make sure you get your towel cards back at the end of your stay and turn them in when you check out or they will charge you.FOODThe buffet and beach grill were both very good. We always found plenty to eat. They did a good job of offering different choices every day, so it did not get repetitive. They had Italian Night, Mexican Night and so on. There is definitley more variety at Windows Buffett. Make sure you make reservations for dinner early in your stay. They didn't let us pick the nights we wanted to go to the restaurants. They said they were full, but they really were not. I think you have to be a little pushy when making the reservations, but we didn't know that. We ate at the American Grill and Da Mario. Both were excellent. We tipped at both restaurants. The service was great!EXCURSIONWe booked the Outback Safari through our rep. I highly reccomend it this tour. We were picked up at the hotel at 8am and got dropped off a 5pm. I think it is a good idea to get away from the resort and see how real Domincans live and that is just what this tour is. We visited a school, a real home, a coffee, sugar, and cocoa plantation, a ranch and went to a private beach. The countryside is breathtaking and it was nice to see other parts of the country. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I would reccomend it to anyone. People need to remember that they are in a foreign country and not to expect it to be just like the US. Use your brain and common sense and don't let tiny things bother you and you will have an unforgetable trip.

10	0(staff):1	3(clean):2	45(beautiful):1	56(morning):1	72(resort):2	125(towel):1	142(bring):1	364(afternoon):1	562(maintain):1	3962(absolutley):1	
16	5(time):1	23(little):1	26(people):2	32(check):4	85(wait):3	117(dinner):1	125(towel):2	136(charge):1	156(reservation):2	202(welcome):1	222(cold):1	292(card):1	294(mind):1	716(cocktail):1	2120(pushy):1	6855(3pm):1

<Author>HockeyMom044
<Content>Relaxing Vacation This is our 4th trip south and our 2nd to Punta Cana. We always book at 4 or 5 star resorts.Go and have fun. The resort is fine an the service is good. The culture of the Dominican people is to be laid back, so relax, walk slow and enjoy.CHECK INOur room was not ready so we went ahead and had a drink and some lunch. We also went to check out where our room would be and it was going to be on the first floor. We went back and asked to be moved off the ground floor and we were accomodated and went to 3rd floor, building 4.ROOMOur room had a nice view and very high ceilings being on the top floor. It could use some fresh paint for sure and sometimes the tub leaked but that didn't bother us. Room was always very clean. If on day one you leave an extra dollar by the mini-fridge and let the maid know what you want (in Spanish), your fridge will be restocked with an extra beer or two! Some days the towels came around 4 or so but that was okay since we always went to supper around 7 or 8. Balcony was pleasant to sit out and we enjoyed it. In one review I read about too many birds ---- it is tropical - of course there are birds!!FOODBuffet was fine - typical of any the resorts we have been too. Beach restaraunt was very relaxing for breakfast as it was quiet and you were looking out over the ocean.TexMex/American Grill. Excellent. We ate there 2 nights. Very good food and very good service. Italian. Excellent as well. Ate there one night.BEACHES AND POOLSWe visited all. If you need a hut for shade - get up early. If not you can always find a chair at a good location any of the places. Beach is beautiful and being next the the marina you have lots to watch with boats, etc. Also very close to food, drinks, etc. which is nice.Adult pool. Nice and quiet for reading or napping. Nico, the bartender there, is the resorts best!Other pool. Lots of activities if you want - noisier because the Animation Team is always doing something. Swim up bar - what can you say - a swim up bar is always great!SUNWINGVery good service and Antoine was very helpful.OVERALLThere is alot of other things about the resort I could go on with but basically the grounds are beautiful but some of the buildings are getting a little old. Overall, we had a great time. It is not perfect, but if you are pleasant with the staff, they are very pleasant and helpful to you. You're on vacation - relax and have fun.  
<Date>Apr 18, 2008

<Author>Katerina474
<Content>Definitely not a 5-star resort... It was our first Caribbean vacation, but I have to admit I expected more for the money.... It is not a 5-star resort!Pros:1. Room was in a good condition (bldg#2 ?we gave a $20 tip to get a better room), maid service is excellent (subject to a $4 daily tip) ?Angela was great - the room was always clean and the fridge was well-stocked.2. Overall resort was quite clean and 50-70% of staff was friendly.3. Resort doctor was very nice and helpful ?my Daughter was very sick for 4 days with the stomach flu. He gave us some kind of medication (everything is Spanish) and she was in a tip-top shape after 12 hours! Plus we didn have to pay anything, b/c we were able to use our insurance (not counting a tip, of course).4. Pool ?great.5. Weather and ocean ?really enjoyed both!6. Haven seen any bugs, roaches or rats ?progress!!!!!Cons:1. TERRIBLE FOOD!!!!! The best place at the resort is Italian Restaurant, but in my opinion, I would rather go to Olive Garden. We ate there once and my husband got sick! Stay away from American Grill - food is simply inedible. Windows (buffet) is great for breakfast or lunch, but dinner selection is very poor (at least they compensate with the friendly staff!!). Seafood place is acceptable. Room service selection has ONLY 6 mediocre sandwiches for lunch and dinner...Japanese place did not appeal us at all - menu is limited and not enticing at all.2. Impossible to make reservation to the restaurants if you don tip! My husband didn tip and the rep gave him American Grill reservation for 8pm at night, saying that this is only one availability for the entire week, b/c somebody cancelled. When we got to the restaurant ?the place was EMPTY!!!! ?Later, I spoke to another rep - Annie, who was very kind and helped me to get reservations for every night of our 1-week stay there.3. Beach is not very clean. Aside from the seaweed (which is cleaned daily), watch out for broken glass.4. ATM machine dispenses only pesos ?bring cash with you!Overall, our experience was o.k. Would I recommend this place to anyone? Probably yes? but only for students.
