<Author>DRGal
<Content>Be Aware...Do Your Research Before You Go! We just returned from the Grand Oasis Punta Cana on April 13, 2008irst I need to say that Ie been a member of Trip Advisor for a number of years and always read the reviews prior to booking a resort. I have found this site has given me some great information from resorts to travel advice. This is my first time writing a review because I haven had any problems and have always been very happy with my vacations. However, I realized during this trip, whether it a good experience or a bad one, I vowed to write reviews so others can benefit. Unfortunately this year I am starting with a not-so-good review.A little information about mee been going to the Dominican for eight years. We started in the Puerta Plata area before discovering the wonderful beaches on the Punta Cana side so this is where we have vacationed for the past five years. Each year we choose a different ?-5?star resort like the Melia Caribe, Bahia Principle, Casa de Mar, Caribe Club Princess etc., all very nice in their own way, clean, with good to great food, no complaints. I travel with friends from work and we normally stay for two weeks. This year our husbands decided that they would like to come with us, so we planned for a one week vacation instead of two weeks. Thank God we did!!!Arrival: Upon arrival at the resort (11:30 am) we were greeted with a tropical drink, and a cold welcoming facecloth. At check-in we were told that we would not be able to get our rooms until 3:00 pm, a real pain but this sometimes happens in the Dominican. We came prepared for the delay, and waited for the buffet to open for lunch. So don expect to get your rooms until 3. The staff at check-in were friendly and accommodating with us, however this was not the case with other folks. Others checking in had problems with the resort overbooking and we witnessed many angry people. I don understand how a resort overbooks once they have confirmation of a client reservation. The travel agencies have to start taking responsibility for this. No one should have to start a vacation on such a sour note.Rooms: We were in building three overlooking the pool/beach, so we had one of the good views. Our rooms were adjoining which was nice, and all in all not that bad, a little tired but the resort is in the middle of renovating. There was trouble with the air conditioner, but once reported they came the next day. For the entire week we did not receive our clean towels until 5:00 pm or later, which made it impossible to bathe before dinner. Facecloths and hand towels were a luxury and most of the time we had none. Apparently the resort has a shortage of linen. Food: I don have a lot of good things to say on this subject. There are four aaarts which can be booked at the same time instead of daily; American/TexMex one restaurant with terrible food, hardly edible, poor service, staff not very friendly.Seafood; food was good, again service not great, staff seemed very unhappy.Italian; the best they have to offer, we ate there twice and the staff was always friendly. Don let the beef dishes in the buffet turn you off in this restaurant as the beef is a real treat.Japanese; never ate there, as we felt that an all inclusive should not charge and we refused to pay $15.00 per person for a meal.Buffet; the food was the same all week, breakfast was about the best, good omelets and bacon (when they have it) with a nice selection of breads. Lunch and Dinner were the same things all week, not much taste, and many many flies all around the dining room. I have been to other resorts where they had an open buffet, this one was closed in and I think there were more insects there then anywhere else. Desserts were very sad, nothing like other resorts, again very little taste, and the same selection. On a good note the staff was the friendliest and always served you with a smile. Beach: the resort is situated next to Natura Park and is probably on the worst section of Bavaro Beach, a lot of seaweed, even though the staff was good at raking it up daily, the water wasn as clear or clean as Ie seen at other resorts and there were a lot of boats anchored all over the beach area. The beach needed cleaning, as garbage and glass were lying around. The only person we saw doing anything was a boy picking up the cups and taking them back to the bar. We walked up the beach (about a couple of miles) and the two resorts next door weren any better. However, the water was lovely and warm so we certainly took advantage of the beach, but it could have been a lot cleaner. Entertainment: Where do I start?we arrived on Saturday so the first show was the highly anticipated ichael Jackson?show, music was good, as it was original and the dancing was great. They apparently contract with a group that travels from resort to resort with the same show, they are not on staff. We didn know this at the time and thought great good entertainment, next night was the Caribbean show, terrible dancing, all they did was scream through the show, not much entertainment and people were actually leaving. This was the same night after night, people left before the show ended it was terrible. On a good note they had some nice music and dances for the children. Grounds/Pools: beautiful, mature trees, and flowers, nice layout for a small resort. Not very many maintenance men cleaning up the dead palms or plants, they need more staff, as the place could have been cleaner. Pools are nice, large main pool with a swim-up bar along with various sections in the pool for playing volleyball, swimming, or just sitting around enjoying the jets. There are two other pools, which are located between buildings making them rather lengthy but nice and quiet for swimming. There is also an adult pool which we saw but never swam in. My only complaint about the pools is that I never saw any maintenance or cleaning of the main pool the entire time I was there. Remember my room was overlooking the pool, so you think I would have seen some chemicals being added especially to a swim-up bar pool.Unwelcomed Visitors: this is certainly not my favorite subject, but one I feel is necessary. This resort has very large cockroaches, crawling around. I didn see any in the rooms, hank God?but they were by the bar and casino. They also have RATS, not mice, but big RATS. Now I don know about you, but I didn feel like I should pay a good sum to see rats. I am not foolish, I know rats are mainly around food areas, but these ones were seen by the pool and by the buildings where we stay. I have never encountered rats before and pray I won again. I believe the trouble with this resort is due to the location. It is right off the main street, where the garbage is all over, housing for the locals is located about 300 feet from the resort and there is a major sewage problem outside off the resort. Nice welcome!!!Conclusion: I feel we didn make a good choice this year but we certainly didn let the resort spoil our time. If you have already booked your trip go with this knowledge but make the best of it, as you are the ones who will lose out in the end. If you are shopping around for a resort, be aware of what I said, it is the truth, I have nothing to gain by writing this review. We all learn from our mistakes and hopefully this won happen to us again. If you are in your thirties or younger you may not mind this resort, as there were lots of young people around having a great time. My husband and I, along with our friends are in our fifties and we like to have a resort that is cleaner, friendlier, with more features. The Grand Oasis is a small resort, with a casino, three bars, one by the beach, one in the theater and one located by the main pool, a theatre, spa, fitness centre, internet, and several small very expensive shops. If you have any questions please email me and I will try to answer them.  
<Date>Apr 14, 2008

<Author>katywoohoo
<Content>A fabulous vacation I have to say that I had an amazing time in Punta Cana. I was traveling with my family, a group of 18 people, ranging in age from 18 months to 61 yrs. The resort is beautiful and very well kept. The rooms are spacious and tended to very nicely. The staff is friendly and willing to help you whenever they can. I am a chef in Philadelphia and I must say that the food well exceded my expectations. We ate at the buffet mostly, but ate one night at the Italian restaurant and the Japanese Hibachi. I rarely ate something that I did not like or that I thought was not prepared well. For lunch I preffered the buffet by the beach.There are quite a few bars so it never took very long to be served. I felt that the bartenders at the Backstage Bar made the best drinks, but the pool bar was always the most fun.We very much appreciated the nightly movies and shows in the theatre, and mini disco was always entertaining for the kids.Some of us had spa treatments and we are all very happy with services provided. The only thing negative I have to say about the resort pertains to the scuba and fishing excursions. I am not sure if the people are directly linked to the resort but the trips were lacking just a bit and not all that well organized or of the best equipment.I can not wait to return to the resort and I know that I absolutely will!!!!!!  
<Date>Apr 14, 2008

<Author>kkm405
<Content>dominican trip # 4 I am writing this reviewing after being in the DR 4 times. I have stayed at the Grand Oasis one other time previously called Sunscape that was about 2 1/2 years ago,,things have changed. We only paid 800 for 8 days so for the value it was so worth it,, but the older buildings are a bit run down!! and no renovations or touch ups to these buildings have been made in the last 2 years ( rusted doors, doors not shutting,, cleaniness).The restrauants are good but make sure you make reservations, and when they tell you they are full,, dont take no for an answer we ate at a different restaruant every night and they were good. The buffets at Windows, and Beach Grill are very repititous and food is not great. The downfall I found going this time of year was that it is sooo crowded, we needed a hut on the beach or the pool for a few in my group we had to set an alarm for 5;30 everyday in order to get one, although we didnt encounter a problem, people at times were actually fighting over them.There are no floating mats in the pool like shown on line or in the previous years, so you may want to bring your own. If you are looking for things to do at night, there is not much Shows put on by the staff are ok,,, then there is a piano bar (that has no piano and no entertainment) Karoke is suppose to be there but was not, there is a SMALL casino,, and a disco (crowd quite young there). other than that thats it. The lazy river that is advertised is just another small pool.. I would defintely go back again to the DR,, I just think I would try a different hotel,,,,, we were told when we were there the RUI and Sunscape the beach are the nicest.Good luck, and have a great time,,the weather is wonderful!!!

<Author>scorpanog
<Content>All right, but too noisy and overcrowded Just came back from this resort so decided to share my experience. check in was fast, we arrived about 9pm. our room was ready for us(the thing I liked was the code card instead of a key). The resort is not that big on the shore line but it has about 7 3 store buildings, which means there are a lot of people.it was very noisy. We were awaken every day because staff was using carts on a stoned road, which makes a lot of noise, plus they love to sing and at 6.30-7am it's not a good thing.Then by 9am there is no places left at the beach so it's a pain to find yourself a chair and luck of shades is noticeable. The food was ok, but the variety was pretty poor (after Bahia principe resort) and sometimes it was hard to find what to eat.It was very expensive to shop there plus we were really annoyed by the sales people who were literally dragging us to their booths and bargaining all the time.not enough entertainments for kids, they were running with adults all the time.The bottom line is, it was nice to go to a sunny place after long winter in Toronto, but we would not go there again.

<Author>missed_connection
<Content>Beautiful Resort, Ugly Service Let me preface this review by saying that we won this trip in a contest. We would never choose an all-inclusive type of resort because we value quality over quantity. The front desk service was extremely inept. We were forced to wear these ridiculous yellow wrist bands for the entire week. When I asked why we had to wear them, Edgar, the front desk clerk, asked us if we wanted to eat or not. How tacky and rude. Edgar continued to be rude to us throughout our entire stay. The maid service was deplorable. At Grand Oasis, the maids must not follow the rule that towels that are hanging up should be left alone and towels that are on the floor should be taken away. We were constantly without towels. The maid removed all our towels (clean and dirty) every morning, leaving us with none until next morning. We had to beg the front desk for clean towels every day. By the third day, I was forced to lock up clean towels in my suitcase so they would not be taken away. Our safe did not work, so we were forced to lock our valuables in a suitcase. The resort is loud. There is a constant, steady stream of techno music piped throughout the lobby, all common areas, pools, restaurants, bars, bathrooms, even on the beach. The music is loud and grates on the nerves after a while. The watersports activity center was by far the worst aspect of this resort. Rude, apathetic staff ruined our snorkling trip. We paid 40 dollars US to go snorkling about a half mile off-shore. We asked about snorkling gear before we got on the boat. Monica, who worked at the watersports building, dismissively waved her hand toward the boat, indicating that gear was available once we boarded. There was no gear. We asked about the gear again when we reached the dive boat, and got a no English response. We were stranded on the boat with no gear. The boat operator found a dirty mask laying on the bottom of the boat and offered it to me. Um, no thanks. We asked for a refund and were met with attitude instead. Finally, the manager gave us our money back, but only after 20 minutes of haggling. No apologies were given for our wasted time. We were constantly bothered by Vacation Club reps on the resort, trying to get us to buy a vacation club through Oasis Resorts. We were hounded by these Vacation Club reps every. single. day. They are staked out all around the pools and outside every restaurant. A simple no, thanks was not enough. They even insulted us after we told them we were not interested for the last time by telling we were cheapskates for not snapping up such a good offer. Bottom line is this: go to Grand Oasis Punta Cana if you want to be treated poorly by apathetic, unfriendly staff. I was happy to leave that place.  
<Date>Apr 14, 2008

<Author>renee-nan
<Content>Loved the Grand Oasis Punta Cana Grand Oasis Punta CanaDate: April 3rd to the 10th. Booked our vacation with Sunwing. We travelled with Sunwing and I can't say enough good about them. Flights were on time and the service on the plane was excellent. ROOM: We arrived at 1h00am and check-in was very fast. We stayed in Building 3 top floor view on the beach and the room was very adequate. Spacious and very clean. The only negative point is the pillows. They are lumpy and not comfortable. If you have room in your suitcase bring yours. We tipped the maid every day and she provided us with everything we needed. To make sure we got what we needed I wrote it down on paper and she always left what was asked for. Tip: before leaving I went on the internet and translated some phrases from English to Spanish, ex: we need more towels please or we need bottled water or beer or soft drinks. I found that very helpful and it made it easy for the maid to understand our needs.  ENTERTAINMENT: The grounds are very well kept. The workers work hard to keep it that way. The entertainment was good. Movies every night at 8h00 but mostly for kids. The week we were there: Ratatouille, Spiderman, Monster Inc and Eight below. We saw the Michael Jackson show which was exceptional. Another show with the Dominican dancers that was very entertaining as well and a beach party the last night we were there. They are shows available every night. On your way to the theatre you find the shopping area and the boutiques. We walked in all of them are the sales people were very nice, not pushy and curtious. There is also an internet cafe, a casino and a spa-gym also. At the theatre after the movies they have dances for the small kids. FOOD: The food was delicious. You are sure to find something you like picky or not. The main buffet Windows has a great variety of food from pasta to fish to pork, beef, shrimps, cheeses and so on and so on. Know that they don't have coffee cream; they only have that powdered stuff. The butter is not salted like we are used to but by mid-week we had gotten to like it. We made reservations at the Seafood, the Grill and Italian Restaurants. All 3 of them were very good. The Grill is more Mexican but I did have the best steak there. Seafood was perfect, had the mahi mahi dinner and my sister had the seafood brochette, all very delicious. The Italian restaurant had a very nice setting and the food was again delicious. No waiting at any of these 3 restaurants and the service was excellent. We did leave a tip at all 3 of them. For what you are served leaving at least $5.00 tip is certainly fair. FACILITIES: The public bathrooms around the complex are exceptionally very very clean and always decorated with flowers and palm leaves. BEACH: The beach is great and kept free of seaweeds by the workers. The water was very nice, clear and warm. There are some vendors that are selling like parasailing, banana boat rides, glass bottom boat rides, tours, swimming with dolphins excursion but I can say they were a bother. It is best to book your tours with your representative. They have a list of all that is available for your enjoyment and at least you know the price is good. TIP: Bring lots of suntan lotion cause buying some in the boutiques will cost you at least 20$ a bottle. On the beach there are palapas (parasol) and if you want to make sure you get one for the day then you have to get up early (6h00 am) and reserve one by simply putting your beach towel on the chairs. I don't like this system would much prefer first come first serve but that is not how it workds. I have seen some palapas reserved and not used until 1h00 pm. I don't think that is fair but that is how the system works. COMMENTS: Did not see any bugs anywhere. The staff is always very friendly and alway ready to help you out. You can have all the drinks you want but don't expect Canadian Club to mention one. You are in the Dominican Republic and will be served their local liquor. Bahama Mama is very good and so is the Miami vice. We did not go to the pool area for we are beach people. The pool areal in my opinion is good for a younger crowd. Lots of entertainment there and a bit too loud for my taste. If you like joining in the games you will find what you are looking for in such things as dancing lessons, aerobics, volley ball, all kinds of games. We met a lot of nice people there and our vacation was a great one. I highly recommand this Beach Resort.  
<Date>Apr 12, 2008

<Author>Spooky123
<Content>Very Good Resort, but keep thieves in mind!! My stay at the Grand Oasis was very good overall! weather was good, resort hotel and grounds were well maintained, food was quite good, and service was very good. However, a word to the wise to future travellers that may stay here....keep thieves in mind. We all know that we should keep our valuables secured within the safe of the hotel room, which I did, however, I did not think I would have to lock up my clothes!!! Believe it or not, but the maid stole a few items of clothing from my suitcase. Ridiculous! A word to the wise...keep your suitcase locked or be present while housekeeping is cleaning your room, I know I will do this on any future vacations that I will take.

<Author>ggaudet1
<Content>GREAT VACATION AT THE OASIS My Husband and I stayed at the Grand Oasis from March 22th to the 29th. We had a great vacation and would recomend this Resort. We had read the reviews prior to leaving and the ones that complain, probably would complain at a 5* Resort. The resort is older but the grounds are very well kept, clean and beautiful. The staff is very friendly and I was surprised how many understood french and english.The Girl at the front desk was very awesome and after a little mix-up with our room, she upgraded us building 7, which is one of the new buildings. Our room was just beautiful and we had a view of the lazy pool and the beach. The maid did a good job cleaning our room and stocking our mini-fridge everyday.The beach is very nice and the staff did a good job cleaning the seaweed every day. There are always beach chairs available but if you want shade, make sure you go really early in the morning. If you walk to the left of the resort, past the other 2 resorts, you can walk for miles on a beautiful private beach. We just walked 5 minutes every day to go swiming on that beach beacause the water was just awesome and there were not a lot of people around. If you like to take long walks, this is the perfect place for it.We didn't spend much time at the pools but we could see how nice and clean they were. We prefer the beach.The food was good and there was always lots to choose from at the Windows buffet. We enjoyed the beach buffet for lunch and we went to 3 a la carte restaurants. They were all great. Be sure to go early to book your reservation for the restaurants.All in all, this was a great place for a vacation and we would return to this resort. Remember that you are on vacation and if you don't let the small stuff get to you, you will enjoy your stay at the Gran Oasis. A smile and patience goes a long way.  
<Date>Apr 11, 2008

<Author>beanlady
<Content>great vacation for two! Rooms We got a good deal from Sunwing (after a cancellation of our Mayan Riviera destination just one week before!! with no explanation!) so we were debating upgrading to the suites, but ultimately were still on a budget so chose the deluxe room. Initially had some problems, which gave us about one hours worry about our choice, but front desk and maintenance were quick to fix an adjoining door which had swelled open (maybe a family had been there all week and kept it open?) Also took a little wiggling to get the balcony door secured to my boyfriend's standards. Room was huge with King-sized bed, comfortable, with a closet with shelves and lots of drawers to put our stuff. Not the case in all rooms as we got a glimpse of a few down the hall. Could be the difference between a deluxe and standard room? Also suite rooms in Building 7 definitely nicer, but we ended up liking our room in Building 3 very much, close to beach and activities and as one woman in 7 said much closer to the bars to get a drink! However, one thing we noticed....DAMP. Took two days for our towels to dry from home and clothes and sheets always a little damp, which strangely enough didn't bug us while there but as you will see cost us on the way home!! Jeans not a good idea in any case, as I like to wear jeans capris and skirts. Not a good idea with the humidity! Tahira, our maid, was quick to answer any concerns about the room if spoken to directly, esp. about our preference for Coke Light and a remote that worked. Otherwise clean towels, face cloths and room every day. Did tip her few bucks a day, she obviously worked hard all day, but always had a smile or singing.Restaurants We had no problems finding something to eat at any time of day. Buffet breakfast had alot of selection, Carlos, our AM waiter always ready with a smile, high five and my tea, was the best, there for breakfast and lunch. Dinner waiters we found hard to get drinks from or missing cutlery, just seemed not to care as much as earlier staff. We ended up eating and leaving quickly to go to the pool bar to relax after dinner. We also tipped when we had good service, but guess the evening waiters actually never got to find that out! Italian was ok, but our reser was for 9:45, and we ended up pigging out at the beach grill on chicken and fries so we wouldn't be hungry!!! Needless to say we were still a little full. We missed the seafood place because I got sick (tried to blame the food, but my boyfriend was quick to point out the amount of rum I had the night before....oops) But we didn't think we missed out on much because was so windy couldn't have been that pleasant. American Grill we ate at twice and really liked it...loved the chips and salsa before the meal! First time we had resers, second time on our last night we just walked in and asked if we could be seated. Good beef enchilada in the combo, liked the fajitas. Also, could still find food to eat when i was not feeling my best...nothing a little white rice and bananas couldn't fix!Bars No complaints there...when I found my drink a little weak at the pool bar just asked for a little more rum. No problem. May have been the start of my downfall that day! My boyfriend thought the Presidente beer on tap tasted like Coors light, but we also loved the Vodka and orange with fresh orange juice....and can't forget the BananaMamas! Little too sweet to drink all week tho'. Pool bar very refreshing to sit in the water and get your drink or wander around the pool with it.Beach and Pools Beach was great, always cleaning up the seaweed, and always found a nice place to lounge when we wanted. Took a long walk to the left past the other resorts (we're really nosy about how other people are living!) and found the undeveloped beach and the sunset our first day there. Meant to go back but just never made it. Main pool was nice and refreshing , alittle bit of debris floating, but a guy cleaning it during the middle of the day. Always noticed someone cleaning something! Was windy some of the days we were there so could understand. other pools looked nice but never made it to swim as main pool more active and closer to the bar! Grounds Just amazing and beautiful! Took way too many pictures of flamingoes for my BF's taste but they made it seem more like paradise. Maybe saw some kind of a funky squirrel or rodent run across the end of the hall, but it's open, what can you do.Activities and Entertainment BF caught a beach volleyball game and was quite happy, we did the banana boat for $10 bucks each one day and the 1 hour snorkelling from the glassbottom boat for $20. Was worth it, as bread in hand attracts many coloured fish, blue and yellow, with some duller striped fish and some blending into the coral. Caught two shows which were entertaining, but missed alot of them as just getting through the kids show required more alcohol than I could handle all week! My son probably would have loved it, but....little too much! Disco was fun and packed the one night we made it, with animation staff staying to get the party started...they work long hours!! Casino was fun as my bf won on the 25 cent slots...I managed to grab $175 of his winnings...paid for our dunebuggy excursion and more. Animation staff also busy all day doing all kinds of exercises, games, dancing, etc. Fun to watch, didn't get too involved tho'.Tours Through Sunwing, booked the Country Adventure tour, which we figured, you can't visit a country without learning a bit about it. Didn't regret it one bit, very interesting and entertaining guide Alberto, forgot the school supplies I meant to bring for the kids, but others remembered. Really an experience to see how other people live in other countries. Bought some oregano off of the woman who's house (shack) we visited, then raw sugar and vanilla at the ranch. Then had some panicky thoughts going through customs with an unlabelled container of green leaves and white crystals!! But had no problem there. Found out I was allergic to horses at the ranch...travellers, a little Benadryl, Gravol and Immodium can't hurt and make sure you have your Ventolin if you're even a little asthmatic...you never know what your trigger will be (I'm a Nurse). Missed out on swimming at the beautiful beach because others in our group had dinner resers and we were late already. Oh well.Next we took the Tropical Storm Happy Hour Sunset Tour. Got stuck on a boat full of french-speaking people but luckily found two other english couples. Got to snorkelling point and unfortunately the Tropical storm part came out....the waves were too big and the boat ahead of us were rescuing their passengers as we got there!! Apparently some tail-end of a hurricane was causing big waves....and clouds! There went our sunset...no wonder I had too much rum. Still had fun but wouldn't do this tour again...only rum, coke, sprite, orange soda and beer on that boat. But the little bottles of mamajauna with our pictures on them were cute and only 10 bucks.The 3rd and final excursion (we found out we're not lounge people) was the dunebuggy ride. The MOST FUN we had all week....awesome, we were filthy and loving it. Finally made it to the Macao Beach we had missed earlier, which was amazing...but alot of kids and people trying to sell stuff while you're trying to wash off! Cheapie, cheapie, just 4 u! Then back in the dirt and off to a natural pool in a cave....equally amazing. At the end they offer you horse riding...I skipped this time!Departure and Check Out Went fine at the hotel. get the phone cards to call home though...my bf mistakenly made a ten second call home to Canada and it cost us $9. Phone cards are $20 for 18 min, internet $5 for 20 min, but for two days one of the computers was free so everyone kept sneaking on! Ok, here's the thing about damp rooms....you're luggage weighs a heck of a lot more going home than when you came. I bought some souvenirs, but nothing major, some pareos and necklaces for the kids, three little bottles of rum and coke light for my bf. However, when we got to the airport, they told us both our bags were overweight and charges us $100...between the two of us 10 kilos over. I can't figure out how since when we left both bags were under, but when I unpacked my jeans felt like they came out of the washer damp....that's all I can figure out....but caution for anyone who likes to skirt the limit, they will charge and we weren't the only ones because they kept announcing for all the people who paid overweight charges to verify their receipts at the airport. I'm thinking some kind of scam too, but whatever...they took american or canadian, they didn't care as long as it was cash!! I felt like a criminal.Conclusion We definitely had a great time, our first trip away from the kids by ourselves as a couple, you could definitely have a romantic, fun, amazing time here. We have no idea what a 5 star would be like, but we're not fancy smancy people and Grand Oasis suited us just fine! had a little of everything for us. We also like the size of the resort, not so big you needed a trolley to get from place to place, could walk to everything easily(especially when a little sick and needed to get back to the room quick, LOL) We would consider bringing the fam back here if we ever considered bringing the kids back with us, but I think we might keep it our little place for now (there's five of them!!)  
<Date>Apr 10, 2008

<Content>Great time but not a 4.5 star .. definately not a 5       bavaro suites poolside / resturant

<Author>nsw42
<Content>wonderful Resort Nfld canada Grand oasis is a great resort.Our family spend two weeks there.We had a wonderful time.The weather was beautiful. Here is just a little imformation on the resort itself.I hope it helps you with your vacation.We were welcomed to the resort with drinks soon as we arrived which was 11pm.Check in was quick .We were given building 3 top floor .Thebedroom were very clean and spaces.We did have problems with our maid though she would forget towels and to fill our refridgerator even though we left her tips daily. But a call to the front desk would take care of the issues.They were there to make sure everything was going smooth.Food: was great .We have two teenager that found there was always something there to eat.(hotdogs,hamburgers,french fries,onion rings,pizza.pasta, nachos,nuggets,).American Grill was delicious.Japanese was good.We weren't that please with the food in the Italian and Aque rest. Beach was a little disappointing.There was always seaweed there even though the workers tried very hard to keep it cleaned up you would see them raking it all day.Pools: are very clean, and the swim up bar was very nice. Quick service even for the teenagers. Lazy rivers are beautiful and very relaxing.Entertainment: The workers work very hard ,and are always entertaining you.Lots of volleyball,darts,contest,and games for all ages thoughout the day.Nightly there are movices for the kids and around 9:30 there is a show,ete.(the circus) was my favorite .The two weeks we were there I never seen any rats,mouse ,or any large bugs that some of the other reviews have said.This resort is very clean.The works are constantly cleaningJust a few items to remember to take with you on your trip:flashlights the power did go of for a few hours during the night (about 3 or 4 times )and for about 2 hours each time.medication for stomach pain .Off for the bugs. I hope you enjoy your trip and remember to relax this resort is very nice and it is very clean.I would go back ,we have travelled for the last 6 years to other resorts in Cuba and Dominican and this one is just as nice as the other 4 -4.5 star resorts we stayed on.  
<Date>Apr 7, 2008

<Author>dustyPuntaCana
<Content>Great Place To Stay Me and Wife arrived at this resort on March 21- 29. Check in was speedy and we recieved drinks while waiting for our rooms. The Lobby is beautful and very clean. The room we were given was very spacious and it had a private balcony. There was a bar fridge in our room, that was stocked daily with beer, coke, sprite and lots of water.There is a safe in your room that you can rent for just 18$ for the week. It is a good peace of mind and worth the money.The resort is not overly big which is a plus and the beach is no wheres away.The Staff are very friendly and would go out of there way to please you, we were really impressed with this. Our Maid Angela De Garcia was really nice. She would have swans made out of towels and fresh cut flowers put inroom on a daily basis, she was a darling.We stayed in building 5 and our room was on the ground floor next to the pool and hot tub. There is a bar there and the bartenders name is Nicholas. He was perfect and always aiming to please us. He would make sure our bubbas was always full.The Resort is very well kept up and the gardeners are always seen cleaning up the place and picking up the dead leafs and stuff and always with a smile on there face. Pools are great and the swim up bar is good as well but closes to early in the afternoon. There is a main bar in the middle of the resort and its open till 12 every night then there is the disco and that is open till 2 every night.Be very very cautious about the people who are selling stuff on the resort. There are stores or mini mall there and they are there to rip you off big time, especially the store called TABU . STAY AWAY FROM THERE !!!!! There prices are outragous. The Girl that works there is really pushy and gets really mad once you enter if you don't buy something. We felt very intimidated and unconfrontable. It really disturbed me that the resort would allow this to go on. What you pay there you can buy on the OUTBACK SAFARI for 1/4 the cost, so be aware.The food was excellent. The resort as 5 a la Cartes and the Windows Buffett. There is also a buffett on the beach and there is pizza,fries,hotdogs,hamburgers and fied chicken when ever you want it.You have to make reservations for the fine dining, so remember to book them once you arrive. Seating is very limited.We did two excursions off the resort and loved both. We had a blast on the KON-TIKI cruise/snorkiling and we went on the OUTBACK SAFARI. This is where you can buy all the cheap things like RUM,Cigars,Art,souviniers. On this trip we visited a school, please bring supplies with you, they really need it and the kids faces light up like christmas trees. Our guide on this trip was excellent. His name was ALEX . He was very informational and showed us alot of very different things. Overall the resort and the pople that work there are very friendly . This resort is not classified has 5 stars but you get the 5 star treatment, plus the price is right. I would without no hesitation go back there again. Beautiful.

<Author>averyis8
<Content>Take the good with the bad.... We have just returned from this resort booking at the very last minute this was recommended over the other sell offs we looked at and it was close to the airport which felt more reassuring having never been to the resort. The tour guide was cheerful and informative. I was disappointed by the lack of english speaking representatives/employees once at the resort. We were booked in at building six and quickly upgraded (another $300 dollars US) to block 7....amazing marble and canapy bed with jaccuzi tub....although for the first three days we had only cold water. Others informed us it was either hot or cold in their rooms. I didn't hear any noise at night in this suite until the very last night whereby new comers young and drunk arrived. Some couples informed us that they were next to construction and dogs barking at all times so when you book and it says deluxe this means very little. Aside from this there were many families and as a parent going with my partner Jeff I would deem it appropriate for both family and couples. I heard some horror stories about people arriving and their rooms were peeling, two doubles versus the deluxe and by the way the deluxe is not what it states on the review that is block 7 they are showing and we got the very last one. The food was okay and drinks were syrup not the real fruit. It was next to impossible to get a pool side recliner unless up very early as everyone puts towels on their chairs so beware of this. The a la carte venues...try booking these as soon as you get to the resort as they book up fast and unfortunately we were not able to eat at some given that we left it one day after arriving. Some charge a $15 surplus so make sure you tell the rep (who by the way doesnt speak any english). The Japenese restaurant was amazing I would highly recommend this restaurant. The other venues are by no means to our standards however the Italian was a very nice atomosphere and Aqua is very minimalist. There is a pool on the other side for adults only. We were touring at a time where europeans were there so expect topless (not that my partner minded) but is you are sensitive to this look at travel times. The night life dancers were gifted...there is true gifts in their genes! The spa is very nice I went for a Swedish massage for $60/hour but was dissapointed going back for a pedicure with my boyfriend (who also had one) given I have them all the time I was not impressed with sanitation of her utensils. I also used the medical portion as I broke out in a rash (coppertone and heat) they wanted to give me an injection and I refused so I took the oral medication. We went on the tour to Sanoma Island it was nice but not work the $80. People hound you for money so be prepared. I would not rate this a 4 star hotel I would rate it a bit less. The cleaning ladies and wait staff are excellent but remember no one speaks english. The people at the bars are not as friendly as I have seen at other resorts and we ended our friends we met ended up in an argument with a french couple about saving spots poolside...the stand off was one hour. Silliness really. Walk along the beach about 5pm and play tennis. There is a basic gym at the resort which wasnt busy afternoon or night. I have traveled to may resorts and we wanted a cheap getaway. Remember you have to pay $20 each to return to the airport and vendures bring jewellry to the resort so you really dont have to leave. My cell phone would not work and the bank maching didnt work the entire time I was there so bring cash. The casino is small and not impressive. Would not return to this resort ; overall,it was a nice time and great weather but being with the man I love always helps. I would not return to the resort but I had a nice time. Hilary and Jefffrom London Ontario

<Author>grodricks
<Content>Good resort, value for Monay We travelled with 3 other families all with pre-teen kids from Sunday 23rd March to Sunday 30th March on Sunwing from Toronto. Canada. We make this annual trip to different parts of the Carribean and this was our first to the DR. Resort: Nice layout, although the rooms are in a building' format with inside hallways (some might prefer 4 unit blocks). advantages - right on the beach and everything is close by - could walk the whole resort in 5 minutes - great for finding the kids! Some buildings have older rooms which are much the worse for wear (like Building 3 where we stayed) but buildings 1 or 2 have been done up and the ground floor rooms on the North have a walk out to the lazy river pool. Airconditioning, washrooms , water pressure etc were good, and other amenities acceptable for a 4 star. The always stocked Mini bar was a good plus.Check-in and out was smooth and efficient and although we did meet Caren we did not need her help as the desk staff took care of our requests to get rooms together (and on the ground floor). Suggest to take your own recognizable beach towels and use them to secure good locations on the beach early morning. Some people tipped hotel security to hold prime spots, but we were not that particular. Beach: Good for short swims and canoing/catamarans etc. need to book early for the catamarans, but we had great weather and enjoyed them all. Also paid $ 10 each for the kids to ride the Banana boat and they loved it. Plenty of seaweed, but not a show stopper, and if you wear water shoes does not bother you much. Walk North past other resorts for a better beach, South past the small village for a lovely walk or bicycling trip. Food: Overall was above our expectations, with choices to suit everyone. Loved the Beachside buffet for lunch, Windows was good for Breakfast and occasional dinners, and we managed to get bookings for all 4 A-la cartes. Italian and Japanese were excellent, Tex Mex good and Aqua below par (poor service, bad location with no proper air circulation, food nothing to speak about). Drinks were generally good, but the red house wine was terrible if not chilled. Made friends with some bartenders and waiter so got premium drinks and special cocktails. Used our insulated mugs on the beach, mostly for Beer or the Caipirina cocktail we all loved. (Lemon juice and bitters with premium rum)Did 2 excursions: Bavario splash speedboats (recommended) and Bavario runners (buggy tour) - Not recommended. Will write a more details review of these in the excursions forum. also did the horse riding next door and Entertainment: amusing and entertaining, and good fun if you go with the right expectations. Disco ok, Piano bar acceptable (with no Piano) and Spa/Gym/games area ok for 4 star levels. Overall: Go with the right expectations (this is a good 4 star, and don't go looking for problems), plan your time well, do not overindulge in food or drink and you can have a great time - as we all did.  
<Date>Apr 1, 2008

<Author>TorontoSunworshipper
<Content>Pretty Good I was a little worried heading to Grand Oasis after reading the previous reviews but I can say I was pleasantly surprised. Transport to the hotel was fast and comfortable in a new air-conditioned bus. Check-in was also fast.Our room was quite nice and we had no problem with either the air-conditioning, shower, or electricity.Contrary to other reviews, I thought the food was excellent with a great variety at the buffet. I do, however, agree that getting a drink, especially a re-fill is near impossible and you will not be offered a coffee after your meal by anyone. You may want to try to a la carte restaurants- I visited the Italian restaurant on the first night and thought it wonderful- food and service. Our second night we went to the Acqua restaurant which, I must say, was really bad- the atmosphere was unpleasant with a bad smell, and our server seemed to hate his job. After that experience we stuck to the buffet but I did hear good things about the other restaurants from other tourists. Oh- and make sure to make your a la carte reservations one your first day if possible.It's true what the say about chairs- both at the pool and the beach. I noticed that people would leave a towel or shoe or book or any random item on a chair in the evening to reserve it for the following day and then wouldn't show up till late afternoon.There was also a lot of seaweed both in the water and washed up on the shore but not really much you can do about that- it could be a seasonal thing.Overall, I quite liked the place and think you will enjoy your stay.  
<Date>Mar 31, 2008
<Rating>4	4	4	4	3	5	3	5

<Author>beach bum in ohio
<Content>Nice resort We stayed at the Oasis March 21-28, 2008. First, I'll say that my husband and I knew we were going to a resort that was supposed to be a step down from what we normally went to. On an Apple Vacations scale from 1-6 apples, this resort was rated a 5 overall. That's pretty accurate. We'd give the resort grounds 5 apples and the older rooms 4 apples.Grounds: Check in/out was fast and easy. The lobby is very nice and large, with lots of places for people to sit and mingle or wait for their rides. The gardens throughout the resort were clean and very beautiful. They were constantly grooming the place to make sure it looked nice. Main Pool: huge and winding. lots of places for kids to play and for adults to relax or join in pool activities such as water aerobics. The smaller adult pool looked decent but we never went over there. we preferred to stay by the swim up bar. The wading pools near the newer buildings looked nice but we didn't go in those either. The ladies public bathroom by the main pool was clogged twice during our stay. I'm not sure if that's a result of guests who don't know how to flush or if it's a problem the resort was having.Beach: the beach is pretty big (as are most of the ones in the DR). there was a lot of seaweed but that's just because of the way the wind blows the waves in to shore. There's not much you can do about that. They were constantly cleaning it up though. We were told when we checked in that there had been a huge storm and some trees were uprooted and the original towel hut on the beach was damaged. We saw a dilapidated building on the beach, so maybe that was it? They made a big dent in removing the debris and seaweed during our stay. HOpefully that shack will come down too. Rooms: We were in room 4123, first floor, right next to the beach. We considered upgrading to the newer buildings but, once we saw our location, we decided not to. The rooms are a little older and could use some fresh paint and recaulking around the sink and tub. They're overall very clean though, and pretty much what we expected.Restaurants: the food was good no matter where we ate, but the Japanese and Italian restaurants were the best. The Japanese restaurant was our favorite. We also tried Aqua. The food was good but we didn't really care for the atmosphere. I wouldn't bother with that one. We only ate breakfast and lunch at the beachside buffet. The food was good and there was plenty of variety. There was always kid-friendly food like fries and burgers. The grill on the beach is good and is open all day if you want a snack between meals. The only staff person we had a problem with was the guy booking restaurant reservations. He was rude and didn't really listen to what you were saying. All other employees were awesome. We ate at the main buffet on our last night there and were waiting for an outdoor table. One employee made room and brought out another table for us, even after we said we had no problem waiting.Bars: we only tried the beachside bar and the pool bar. all were good. Sometimes they didn't understand why we wanted to mix certain things, but that was ok. they just laughed at us. tipping goes a long way here. we wanted mimosas a few mornings and they told us there was no champagne, until we tipped them. then all of a sudden it appeared. The white wine is better in the restaurants than it is at the courtyard/swim-up bar. They don't shy away from the alcohol in mixed drinks. A couple of times we had to tell them to ease up on the pour.The entertainment was too late at night- 9:30. We only watched the Michael Jackson show, which was pretty cool. I caught part of the beach party show and it was really boring. They took too much time getting it going.We had no problem with bugs or mosquitos. I did kill a few mosquitos in our room, but i never got bit. We always take Avon Skin So Soft bug lotion with us and never have a problem. It's better than the spray -- not so sticky and you don't smell like bug spray.Overall, I would definitely recommend this resort. The grounds are as nice as any other all inclusive we've been to. The resort could easily get a higher rating with a fresh coat of paint in some spots and redecorating the older rooms. But, if y ou're looking to save some money, book this resort. you'll have a great time.  
<Date>Mar 31, 2008

<Author>ABE750
<Content>Very relaxing vacation My wife a I had a great time on vacation even though we spent the first day and a half with no luggage. This was just one of those weather issues that screwed things up, no ones fault. If you let those kind of thing bother you need to spend your vacation at home. Now to the Grand Oasis.The Grand Oasis is a excellent resort. Very clean and maintained. We stay in Bld 7, which is the new building. Very nice junior suite. Refrig is stocked daily with beer, pop and water. The room safe is included in the room price in Bld 7, not so in the other building. I believe it was $3.00/day or $18.00 for the week in the other building. I did hear a few people complain about noisier than average air conditioners in the other buildings. My suggestion would be to make sure you book for Blg 7 just to be safe.Before I talk about food let me explain something. As many Americans that are at this resort or in Punta Cana there are as many if not more Europeans. In order for the resort to keep everyone happy, you might not find that the sellection is what you have found in Aruba, Cancun, St Thomas Etc. My purpose for going on vacation is to relax, have fun and experience different things such as food. The food here is VERY GOOD. There was always something to eat at the Windows buffet and new things were added nightly. The a la carte restaurants book quickly, so book early in your stay. I waited and was only able to get in the Tex-Mex. I have the Red Snapper which was excellent. Service. The service was great and friendly every where in the resort. Check in was quick and both the resort and Angel, our Apple rep where helpful in making sure we got our luggage and had called the airport to assist us. Most of the help speaks 3 or more languages which is pretty amazing to watch. We Americans have a lot to learn.Beach. The beach is very nice. Yes as others hace said, there is more seaweed here then at other places I have been. Its just the way the currents flow. The staff does an excellent job of cleaning up the beach. The Storm the other reviews mention consisted of just strong winds that really increased the surge. The staff and the Dominican Civil Defense team where out surveying the beach and geting thing cleaned up before we left. If you want a good walk, hit the beach, turn left and keep going. Talk water, sunsceen and your camera. Wished I would have done it earlier in the week.Pools. Clean and fun, but poolside a little crowded for my taste. Really didn't go that far to sit at a pool so it didn't mater to me, I could sit in my bathtub at home if thats what I wanted.Things to do. Nighlty entertainment is good and lots of activities during the day. Outside excursion are available. I would recommend the Outback Safari. Excellent trip. If you have room in you luggage, take some school supplies. The guides will make sure the schools get them. Trips to the larger cities are a little far away. If you are look for somewhere to go and relax and not run your butt off, Punta Cana is the place to do nothing. I mean this in a GOOD way.Over all this is an great resort that I would go back to. Yes we did get our luggage and met a great couple from Canada in the process. Spent the week relaxing, eatting, drinking and shootin the bull. Needed about 3 more days.  
<Date>Mar 30, 2008

<Author>Nancy52
<Content>Beautiful Location Just returned from a week's vacation and had a wonderful time. We stayed at the Grand Oasis Bavaro Suites which is adjacent to the Grand Oasis. The rooms are new and much nicer. Absolutely no complaints or problems with the room. Ate at three of the four a la carte restaurants which we enjoyed and would recommend you make those reservations. A nice change from the buffet and more relaxing. We thought the food was very good but did not like their house wine. The staff was very friendly overall - maybe noticed a couple that weren't. I think the only drawback we had was they could not understand English at all and any communication/correspondence we received was in all languages but English and a few people mentioned this. So not a major problem. Also both my husband and I did get sick and think it was from the glasses they use around the resort.. Last year in Cuba we noticed they used disposeables but here they were plastic that were rinsed - I am sure they clean them properly at the end of the day but they seem to run out of them during the day so quickly rinse them out when you order a drink. All week we carefully used bottled water for absolutely everything but had no choice but to drink out of unsanitary glasses at the snack bars. The pools are all warm and clean and the beach is spectacular. We would definitely go back, but would want to again stay at the new Suites.

<Author>hennssy
<Content>I Give Paradise a "B" My wife and I stayed at the Grand Oasis for 4 nights, from Mar 17-21. It was our first trip to Punta Cana. My wife isn't crazy about flying, but if you want to see the world, you gotta do it! I would rate our overall experience a B. It's hard to give a lesser grade to paradise without being a spoiled brat. We feel very fortunate that we are able to get out and see places such as Punta Cana. Apple Vacations gives the Grand Oasis a red 5-apple rating. That is probably a stretch. Our non-stop flight from CLE went smoothly. We left CLE @ 6am  landed before 10am. It's nice when you don't have to waste a day travelling. When we loaded our bus for the resort, we were happy to learn that we were the 2nd stop, and would arrive within a half hour. We went to check-in  were told our room wouldn't be ready for about 4 hours. Somewhat disappointed, we grabbed our suitcases, set them down in the large open-air lobby, and started to grab our swimwear. When I looked up, the bell hop, Martin, told us that he took care of it (that our room was ready). 5 minutes instead of 4 hours! Could this be some sort of scam they conjoured up in order to get a bigger tip? Whatever the case, we had our room. Building 4 on the 1st floor. One of the closest rooms to the beach! The room was large, tile-floored, walk-out porch w/view of Caribbean, and pretty clean. No complaints. The beach had plenty of chairs. We never got to sit under an umbrella because they were always spoken for by 9am. That's OK, we'll take the sun! The pools were nice and clean. The pina coladas were the best! The service was very good. The employees  natives always seemed happy. There were only about a handful of topless women on the beach. Unfortunately, they were the ones that shouldn't have been topless! It was really no big deal. The food was OK. You never go hungry. We had reservations for Italian one night (A), Japanese another night (A-), and also Tex-Mex (C). The rest of the time we ate at Window's the buffet (C-). I strongly recommend making reservations for dinner for your entire stay as soon as you arrive at the resort! The entertainment was OK. They sure know how to dance! It's a comfortable open-air theater. The casino was small, but nice. I won $15 the 1st night, $150 the 2nd, and then my wife wouldn't let me go back. You're pretty much stuck on the resort. The excursions, as we have experienced in the past, are rather expensive. If you do venture off the property by foot, you'll only find your typical Caribbean gifts (necklaces, t-shirts, paintings, native artifacts, etc.). They're very friendly, but you feel bad if you don't buy anything. I really didn't need that stuff. We just wanted to explore. We liked the Grand Oasis, but if we ever go back, we'll most likely try a B+ or  resort.  
<Date>Mar 25, 2008

<Author>slippery_slu
<Content>Great week March Break 08Hotel:The hotel was very well maintained. We stayed in building 4. It wasn't the newest or the nicest of the buildings but it was very clean and comfortable for our whole week. Plenty of hot water, towels and water every day.Beach:We Chose Punta Cana because of the beach. It was a very nice beach with enough shade to retreat to. There was no shortage of lounges and it was a busy week for the hotel. Nice enough swimming area. It was the best amongst the hotels in the same area.Food:Food was good. Never had any trouble finding something delicious to eat. I think my only complaint for the whole trip fits in this category. We had to make reservations for the a la carte restaurants. We ended up with a few early meals because it was so overbooked but the 4 nights we ate at the a la cartes they were pretty much empty every night. I'm not sure if people were making reservations and not keeping them? There was no need for us to eat as early as we did or no need for a reservation for that matter. Something small we took note of.Staff/tourists99% of the staff were super nice and accommodating. Very pleasant and enthusiastic. I found we had a great mix of people down at the same time as us. Everyone was very friendly and easy to get along with. If you're looking for quiet and boredom the adult pool is the place to be. The music, games, and fun are in the main pool. (where I spent my days)OverallI would definitely recommend this resort. I will return if I want to play it safe. Meaning if I don't want to try somewhere new. Can't beat the beach and the drive to the airport. 20 mins (if the guests at the other hotels are ready). I would recommend 7 nights is enough. 10 would be fantastic but 14 would be too much! Please email me with any questions!

<Content>Fantastic Time...Loved our Stay!! My husband, our 2 girls (7  9 yrs.) and I just returned from a wonderful week at the Grand Oasis, Punta Cana and we LOVED every minute. Our room was in block 3...a bit older, the room was average but very clean and well kept. They weren't in a big hurry to bring fresh towels or even enough for all of us but when we called the desk they were there with them right away. The room would be the only thing I marked a little lower on the scale in my opinion and really we were there to sleep and shower...other than that we were enjoying the beautiful, hot weather. The grounds were well maintained, the food was fantastic and the staff was superiour. We felt so comfortable, relaxed and safe our entire stay. Our entire family had a fantastic week and we highly recommend this hotel...wish we were still there!!!

<Author>beachgirl1958
<Content>Rest and Relaxation I really don't understand all the complaints about this resort. Not only did we have beautiful weather, the service was outstanding. We visited this resort on March 10th through the 17th. We really did not like the first room we were in, but the hotel dealt with the problem in an urgent and extremely professional manner. We were moved the next morning to a much better room. The first one was run down and in need of several repairs. In defense of the hotel, we were assigned to a room in building 3 upon check in, but the other couple we were with were in room 5. We asked to possibly being put in building 5 and this was the only room available. After my husband looked at the room, I guess not closely enough, it was not up to standard so they agreed to change us, again but we had to wait until the next morning. The new room was fine with a beautiful view of the beach and ocean.The maid did an excellent job of cleaning everyday and stocking our fridge with water and diet coke. We never had to ask for more. The restaurants were good, the best in my opinion being the Italian restaurant and the American grill. The buffet was pretty good. We could always find something to eat. We always made sure to sit in Angel's section because he is a excellent waiter. Angel is extremely friendly and always had a smile on his face. Our coffee cups were always full without having to ask for it. The beach grill has excellent fried chicken and french fries. The nachos were only okay, but edible. The beach is absolutely beautiful with an abundance of palm trees all along the beach. You do have to go down early to reserve a hut if you want shade, but the palm trees served this purpose also. The pools are also very nice, but we stayed on the beach the entire time. The drinks were also excellent, especially the Coco Loco. Most of the bartenders did not skimp on the alcohol, but if you got one that did, you can always ask for an extra shot and they are very happy to oblige. The entertainment was typical of most all inclusive resorts, with the Michael Jackson show is the best. The casino is pretty small, but I'm not a big gambler anyway. I won $200 and I took it and ran. You shouldn't expect to win big at any all inclusive casino anyway. Pointer: stay away from the multi-ball roullette. It looks like a rip off. They try to get you over to the table by giving you free chips to play. I saw a couple playing and it looked as though they were winning a little in the beginning and they had big smiles, but when I looked over later on they were not smiling anymore. Also, the casino personnel do not let you stand and watch the game. They say it's a private table with no spectators allowed. There's also a sign on the table stating the same thing. Sounds and looks like a big scam to me. There are vendors on the beach walking around trying to sell excursions, but they are not pushy and if you say no, they keep walking. The same thing is true with the vendors that have stands that are set up by the main bar. There was a flea market set up twice a week around the resort. Those vendors are a little more pushy, but we just said no and they didn't bother us. I did notice that they're not as flexible when you try to bargain with them. They'll let you walk away. We did not get approached by any Time Share vendors our entire stay. If you booked this hotel, you'll have a great time. Just remember to be polite even if you have a problem. If you treat them with respect instead of yelling and screaming, you'll get a positive result. Also, it's all how you deal with it. I guess we could have let our room problem ruin our vacation since it happened in the beginning, but if you laugh about it, then you will have a great time. The hotel staff do try to help you, but you can't be rude. Also, remember that there is a language barrier as many of the staff do not speak a lot of English. But we were able to get our point across each time. Remember the Dominican people are proud and hard working and they do deserve to be treated with respect. If you run into a few kinks, just go with a smile on your face and you'll be amazed with how fast the staff tries to fix your problem. Also,don't sweat the small stuff, nothing is perfect whether you go to a 5 star luxury resort or a 2 star budget hotel.  
<Date>Mar 18, 2008

<Author>MBSunLover
<Content>Wonderful Week Our group of 3 couples just returned from a wonderful week at the Grand Oasis. We all had a great, relaxing time.Check in was fast and efficient. The staff were all very friendly and the service was excellent. One couple had some initial concerns about their room, but these were dealt with very quickly.The beach and pools were wonderful. There was always a lot of selection at the restaurants. Not all meals were what I would consider fine dining, but the quality was reasonable and I was never hungry.I am not a fan of the aggressive sales methods in the towns and in the shops on the resort, but that is a feature of the local culture rather than the resort.In summary, the week was exceptional with no significant complaints. I would gladly return to the same resort in future.

<Author>April_613
<Content>Great Vacation Was Had by All! Hello fellow trip advisor readers! We travelled to the Grand Oasis, Punta Cana resort from February 23rd, 2008 to March 1, 2008 and had a wonderful time! There were 6 of us in total: 2 girls aged 12 and 15, my husband and I (45  38), and friends of ours (49  69).The overall consensus was that it was a great vacation and we want to be back there now instead of being back in the Ottawa weather that we're experiencing now!This was our girls first time to the Dominican and they loved everything about it. Everyone else has been to the Dominican 3-4 times before. We love it down there! You just can't go wrong with the beaches or weather!Okay, down to the details:Check In / Check Out: Very quick and no problems whatsoever. We were to have two rooms - my family in one and our friends in another. At check in we had asked if we could be located close to each other and Sandy at the front desk was very helpful in doing so - managed to get us in the same building - Building 3.Rooms: Our rooms were nice but you could tell at first glance that they needed some freshening up. Everything was neat and clean but the TV stand / dresser drawers have probably been around for a number of years...not that that really matters in the grand scheme of things. We later found out when we showered for dinner that our bathroom shower leaked and so did the sink, which left large-sized puddles on the floor but nothing that throwing down a towel couldn't fix pretty quickly! Our feeling is that we spend very little time in our room so as long as it has a comfy bed to sleep in and the amenities work, it's all good! The maids kept up our room clean and supplied with drinks in the fridge and towels in the bathroom. The one day that they forgot to leave us water, we simply visited the front desk and within 15 minutes we had two bottles of water. They did not provide our room with facecloths so we used our hand towels instead...no big deal. Our friend's room was absolutely fine with no issues (well, except that they had trouble accessing their safe but again the staff was very quick to respond and help them out). They were on the third floor so their room had nice high ceilings...made the room look that much bigger. Both rooms had a nice view of the beach!Food: Great stuff to be found at the buffet restaurant Windows. Our girls are a tad picky when it comes to their food but they absolutely LOVED the pasta section where you pretty much create your own pasta dish. The Italian (D' Mario's) and the Tex Mex (American Grill) a-la-carte restaurants were amazing - both in respect to the food and service. We loved the Italian so much we went there twice and the entire group of us thoroughly enjoyed our Tex Mex Fajitas and Combo plates. Nobody was particularly interested in the Seafood restaurant so we didn't venture out to that one. Yes, you have to make reservations for these restaurants but it's pretty painless compared to other resorts that we have stayed at. Bars: For the most part the drinks were good and plentiful but they appeared not to have a menu of any kind which may have suggested what they knew how to make. We got by okay though!! We were served their version of Bailey's after dinner with our coffee and Liquera de Mentha (Creme de Menthe) and Amaretto on ice...all very yummy! They have premium drinks available (Absolut Vodka) but they are supposed to charge you $5. If you're nice to them maybe they won't charge you...worked for us a couple of times! Drinks are served in reusable plastic cups - very small which means you have to visit the bar more frequently. We always bring our own insulated mugs. It just so happened that we got to the airport and we realized we forgot our mugs so we ended up buying some at Tim Horton's with our breakfast vouchers that SunWing gave us due to the flight delay we experienced on the way out). Thanks SunWing!Beach: Awesome! All days but Friday the water was as calm as could be. Very nice to get in there for a cooling off! Friday was windy so it stirred things up a bit. The Grand Oasis staff kept the beach as clean and seaweed free as possible. I wish I could say the same thing for other people at the resort who left their lunch  snack plates (full of left-over fried chicken  fries, etc) all over the place, not to mention their empty drink glasses! There were a number of groups of university kids that were at the resort at the same time as we were and while most of them kept their area tidy, there were some who were pretty inconsiderate too! Kudos to you guys that did your part to clean up your stuff! Always lots of chairs but we are fortunate enough to have our friends who are early birds get us chairs in the early morning...thanks Paul  T!Pool: The main pool was nice but busy. At times the university kids were pretty inconsiderate by jumping in and not caring about who they were splashing (i.e. the bartender at the swim up bar) or how loud they were. Not all were rowdy, just some. The lazy river pools were nice and relaxing although I must say that we spent the majority of our time at the beach. It was hard to tear us away come 5:00 / 6:00pm.Spa  Beauty - only walked by and had a quick peek inside...looked gorgeous!Gym: Nice and very clean. Only one of us (our friend Paul) used the gym. The attendent was very helpful to him when he was there in showing him how to use the machines (they are a tad different from what we have in our gyms at home).Entertainment: Great fun! Michael Jackson show was amazing. A lot of time and effort went into putting that together. Anthony is one hilarious and fun-loving guy! My girls absolutely adored him! We could watch him perform 24/7. Don't forget to check him out dancing to Shakira...that boy can shake his bootie better than us girls can! The Ideal Couple show was funny...couldn't stop laughing the whole time. The group of them entertain at 110%.Disco: Went only one night. It was a lot of fun but the strobe lights kind of get to you after a while. We were way too tired to venture out to the disco again. Most nights we were back in our rooms after the show ended at 10:30. It's a hard life relaxing on the beach all day, filling your gut with food and then trying to stay up past 11:00!! :o)Doctor / Medical Services: Unfortunately my youngest daughter had a medical issue before we left and she almost didn't come with us. The doctor in the Children's Hospital Emergency gave us instructions to pass along to the doctor at the resort. We were more than a little leary to be needing to visit a foreign doctor but everything worked out just fine. The doctor was extremely friendly and helped us for 3 days with changing bandages, etc. One other couple that we met in his office on the first day also had very good things to say about him and his staff. Thank goodness he was there. (He is the only doctor and works on call 24/7 between the Grand Oasis and the SunScape resort right next door.) We also were fortunate enough to meet a doctor and his wife, who happened to be a nurse, from Boston. He very kindly offered to have a look at my daughter's arm to make sure things were healing as expected. Thank you again!We met tons of people - mostly like us trying to escape the winter - all of which were very nice. Hopefully we'll be bumping into you again soon! There were a lot of foreign languages (French, German, Spanish) as well which made for an interesting time just listening to them speak.Ladies, if you are getting your hair braided - Kathy by the Water Sports building was very nice.Try to catch a sunrise in the morning if you can - spectacular!Did we have fun? Yes, we sure did! I'm sure you'll love your vacation as well!

<Author>anndreea
<Content>The Honest Truth About Grand Oasis .. My family and I stayed at the Grand Oasis just recently, February 24th - March 2nd 2008 . We enjoyed our stay here but there is still some things this hotel can improve on. Here is the honest truth about the main components at the Grand Oasis.Beach: It was probably the nicest beach I have ever seen. The water was clear and turquiose and was just amazing. Loved the beach and so did my family.Pool: The pool was alright. It had a swimup bar, but it was always packed there.. however a few times it cleared up. The pool was pretty big. I might add that they have two lazy rivers, one on each side of the resort. They also have an adults pool with a jacuzzi.. these were all nice and refreshing. Service: The service was actually very good. We usually got our food and served right away so again there was no problems here.Food: Wow pretty much describes it. The food was very good. They had a main buffet resteraunt called Windows that offered an assortment of food. I always found something to eat. We also ate at the three a la carte resteraunts.- American Grill - Was pretty good. It is mainly mexican food. The service was excellent.- Italien Resteraunt - Was my familys favourite. The resteraunt was really elegant and nice, and the food was amazing! Great service as well.- Seafood Resteraunt - Was slightly disappointed. They didnt have much on their menu, but the food was still very good. the service wasnt the greatest either.BREAKFAST OPTIONS: you could either go to Windows buffet or down by the beach they have another buffet.LUNCH OPTIONS: Windows Buffet, buffet down by beach, the grill on the beach.SUPPER OPTIONS: Windows Buffet, Italian Resteraunt (reservations required), Seafood Resteraunt (reservations required), American Grill (reservations required).Rooms: When my family goes on vacation, we don't really care about the look of the room. Our rooms were alright. Nothing too fabulous. Me and my brothers shared a room and my parents shared a room right next door, Our rooms were in the 1st building, numbers 1206 and 1208. My parents had more problems with their room than we did with our though. It wasn't a big deal with the rooms so if you dont really care either, dont worry.Check-In and Check-out - the check-in took a long time since we arrived with a bus load of people. But once we got to the front it went quick. We also had to wait a bit for the bell boys to take our luggage over. The check-out was quick and easy, we got there early to do so.TIPS: - do not keep your cards for your room with cellphones, cameras, anything that might act like a magnet because it will cause the card not to work. I think i went up to the front desk three times before I figured this out.- do NOT buy packages with tutti frutti tours or any person who claims to work with another company that is on the beach. They rip you off and take your money. You will know the difference between the people who actually work at the hotel and those that dont. - the vendors near the lobby can be very annoying, so if they ask you to go over just make up an excuse to go. (i often said I have to go eat! or something like that). - if you are looking for vendors (me and my family were) dont even bother heading down the left side of of the beach. To finally get to the vendors is about a 2 hour and 30 minute walk one way. Go on the right side, their is some vendors about 5 minutes away. Also their is vendors who came to the resort on the Tuesday and Thursday when we stayed.- the a la carte resteraunts require a reservation, to make one go to the lobby and there is a guy on a computer to the left. just talk to him there.Overall, I would recommend this resort for people who want a nice beach, and great food as well as a good pool. I hope this helped you somewhat.  
<Date>Mar 5, 2008

<Author>haventgotemail
<Content>horrible Don't stay here! Checked in on 4/12/07 and the air conditioning was leaking from the ceiling onto the tile floor, the ceiling tiles were falling down, the light in the shower did not work and the room smelled. I went to the reception desk three times and each time I was told a maintenance worker was on the way to fix the problems. This NEVER happened. I went to see the Apple Vacations representative and was told that weI could not have a new room until the next day and we would have to spend the night in this room. We had to leave the room by 10:00 in the morning and the new room was ready for until after 12:00. On 4/12/07 we made reservations with the concieger for dinner for two of the nights we were staying, when we went to the restaurant for dinner we were told that our reservation was for the following night and not that evening. The conceiger made us two dinners reservation for Saturday night and nothing for Friday night. The restaurant was full and could not seat us but suggested that we check with the other restaurants to see if any of them had a cancellation and might be able to fit us in. We were able to eat at the Italian Restaurant. One night there was a beach party and the food was horrible and the bugs were really that night. This is definetly not a 5 star resort. Don't waste your money at this place!
