<Author>Dbra404040
<Content>Loved Punta Cana We just returned from Grand Oasis, Punta Cana, DR on 3/1/08. The weather was absolutely beautiful. We had stayed at Natura Park 2 years ago and the Grand Oasis was a much nicer resort in our opinion. Natura Park had a lot of seaweed on the beach but Grand Oasis beach was very clear, free of seaweed. The food was much better than Natura Park and the drinks were better. Most of the staff was very friendly. There were a few that did not smile or try to be friendly. The food at the reservation restaurants was excellent. We never had a problem with our room being cleaned or having enough towels. The first night and each night after we left $2 for the maid and she took very good care of us. We stayed in Building 3 and had the room closest to the Beach. Our balcony wrapped around so we could sit on the balcony and see the ocean. On Saturday night the Michael Jackson show was really worth watching. I am not a Michael Jackson fan but they did a terrific job in putting on this show. There were a few times that we had to wait to get beach towels as they had run out and had to wait for clean ones. The Vacation Club salesmen were all over the resort. My husband wanted to see the rooms so we sat through their presentation. The Vacation Club rooms were really really nice. You do get a free T-shirt and hat. We didn't have any problem finding chairs on the beach near our building. We didn't have to go down early and reserve chairs. We just went after breakfast and never had any problem. We didn't want to come back home and would definitely go back to this resort.  
<Date>Mar 4, 2008

<Author>agizmo
<Content>Great Time Spent a week at Grand Oasis Feb 20-27 typical all inclusive vacation.Resort itself is older but well maintained with alot of updates we were in building 2 our friends were in 1 both the same.Did get to see inside building 7 which is newer much nicer inside.The layout of the resort is nice since your never far from the Beach,Pool or Bars.Service I would rate very well a few dollars go a long way.All of the people working there did a great job and this made our vacation very enjoyable.The American restaurant was our favorite the beef tenderloin was excellent.The buffet was typical.The beach Food variaty was also good.The venders can be quiet pushy at times and they do have tables in the resort twice a week just say no thanks every time you walk by.The timeshare people are also there and always talk to you very politely trying to get you to ask them about the vacation club we never asked or told them we were busy.I see people complaning about sea weed on the beach the staff is cleaning constantly not a problem the other resorts down the beach seemed to have more.The water in this area is very calm there is a reef way out in front breaking all waves.We used the sail boats windsurfers and kayaks.Great beach for children.Bars only thing we missed was there lack of any canadian whiskey could not find it anywhere.Wheather was perfect comparing it to cancun area for febuary it is much warmer always in shorts.We also lost electricity a few times but were never in room.Would return again

<Author>kngihtmc
<Content>The Worst Vacation Ever This was by far the worst vacation I have ever been on. If we aren't able to get our money back, the very least we can do is prevent anyone else from making the same mistake we did by going to this resort. As two young adults looking for a great value on a vacation we were not expecting the Ritz by any means, however the Grand Oasis was simply unacceptable. Not a single thing was as advertised and it was a disaster from the moment we stepped on to the property. We were moved from our room several times then placed in an upgraded room in the new building. We had no hot water, no air conditioning, the ceiling fan did not work and neither did the fridge. The toilet ran and leaked 24 hours a day. The excess moisture attracted flies, which infested our room. The staff at the hotel all but refused to help us in any way, shape or form. The restaurants were absolutely abhorrent. RATS were running around the windows eating area every night we went in there. It was no surprise when my boyfriend contracted a HORRIBLE case of food poisoning from the mush and scraps they offer to their patrons as meals. They use bottom shelf liquor in all their drinks, which are very watered down. The rental equipment is all dingy and out dated- not to mention impossible to try and reserve. There are WAY too many people therefore impossible to get a chair by the beach or the pool. I could go on however I chose not to re-live the worst vacation of my life. PLEASE, take my word and book another resort, I promise you will thank me.

<Content>Don't book with Adventure tours booth near the pool Party of 8 people- the Grand Oasis is beautiful, clean resort, food buffet was great lots to select from and 3 la cartes- no problems in booking. Stayed in building 2- clean, quiet, air conditioner in 2211 not working properly but only on last nite, (did hear about building 5 - noisey and full of teenagers) Swam in all pools and the ocean. Managed to get beach chairs every afternoon near the lazy river or far side of beach with no problems. Nightly shows were lots of laughs and all bars served whatever we wanted, baileys, sinapore slings, tequila sunrise, etc. No complains about the resort.!BUT PLS DO NOT go on the Adventure Tours booth set up near the pool- Scai Quads/Tropical Wheels @ 110.00US per couple for dune buggies. At 7;30 am was told 20 min bus ride- to drive dune buggies to ocean then to caves and retn back to resort by lunch. Turned out 40 min bus ride to the place, drove dune buggies down side of busy paved roads to ocean-Thompson Park bugged by vendors and trying to sell beer, left there heading back stopped at a store to buy stuff,( we were here to enjoy a dune buggy ride not shop)! being passed by other dune buggies on the road and back past the place we started at down a road to the caves.Issues all on this jouney were 1 buggy kept stalling -2 guys part of tour at the back kept repairing along the way, 1 bike battery cables sparking and smoking, our bike left front wheel broke right off. No other dune buggies available was oftered the ATV they were driving- (similiar to the ATV from CT 250s) but with semi flat tires and broken pieces. Once again 1bike stalled and I needed to use the bathroom- not far back from breakdown and told the guide I was going to drive back on the ATV- he say to get on with him and he would take me back. Upon our retn to the breakdown of dune buggies he tipped the ATV on me and the broken reverse shifter caused me to have 2 bad bruises back of calf and knee(hobled around resort for the rest of the wk) Not pls at all but to far to walk from the group, back on I get with the the stearing all bent and never spoke to him again. All of us had enough and said forget this trip to the caves and take us back to the resort. Guide offered tomarrow another trip - NOT Discussed with rep at the booth that the bikes were unsafe and need maintenance and that person was injured- unable to talk with his boss or get satisfaction by complaining to them- Wish to tell others- though that this booth being in the middle of the resort was reputable. Beware

<Author>holidayhunterOntario
<Content>Good and bad Just got back from the Grand Oasis this morning and anyone trvelling to this hotel in the near future should read and believe the reviews on this site, good and bad. The rooms are tired but housekeeping kept our room clean and well supplied with anything we asked for. The food is good and plentiful, you have to be careful what you pick but we didn't have a problem finding something to eat. Front desk staff were professional and helpfull with a problem we had with our door lock.Maintenance showed up promptly and quickly had the problem solved. The reason you need to read all of the reviews is we met a couple while we were there that did experience some of the nightmares reported.(dirty rooms, long delays) so go prepared.We had a great week but it seems with this hotel it is hit and miss.

<Author>SunkistOntario
<Content>Resort was Good, a few issues though We just returned From Grand Oasis Bavaro Suites Cameleon. The staff there was excellent. Our room was a Junior suite and was in Building 10, 3rd Floor ( really need to get that elevator built). The Room was clean and comfortable. Our maid did a good job and after a little tip we went from 2 beers in fridge to 6. We ate mostly at the Agua restaurant which is a buffet for breakfast and lunch and then a la carte for dinner. Food was good. We did the Italian restaurant once and it was very good and we did the Tex-Mex once and it was more than adequite. Service was good everywhere on the resort. The food does become a little repetitive by the end of the week but _No_Montezumas Revenge for either of us. Always found more than enough to eat and Variety was OK.We stayed almost all the time at the Adult pool and Nicolas and Nico did a great job making sure that the drinks were never empty.( Thanx guys). We also had a great bunch of Canadian people and 2 couples from Baltimore that also hung there most of the time and made for a fun time at the pool, except for a small European invasion on a couple of occasions. For the most part was a great time at the pool.The entertainment was OK, nothing fantastic, but not bad either. The entertainment staff did a good job trying to get people involved but most of their activities were around the main pool.The beach was great as ussual and the staff did a good job trying to keep up with the sea weed problem. I would like the thank the doorknob that left a broken wine glass on the beach instead of picking it up. The wife found it with her foot and really appreciated the fact that she did not have to swim for 2 days. I would like to thank the Doctor who came down to the beach and tended to her and again the next day in his office.Over all it was a good trip. The building still has a few minor growing pains but nothing to ruin a good holiday, but you have deal with the minor problems. The whole trip was a good value for the $$$ that we spent. The airplane food on the flight there was pitiful. We did appreciate the fact tha Nolitours paid our $10 to get into the country and our $20 to leave. This was our 3rd trip to the Dominican and we would definitely would come back here again.  
<Date>Mar 2, 2008

<Author>Shanny9387
<Content>Awesome Place ... Just Dont be Ignorant This was our first trip ever outside of Canada and it was a wanderful experience! We tipped generously to the bar tenders (mainly the 1) and he was always making sure we had fresh drinks in our hands even if we didnt' ask, i'd walk up to the bar and he would already be making my drink. My boyfriend and I are way too trusting in the sense of money. We went shopping on the resort and bought quite a bit from one particular store. The boyfriend was charged $23US but informed us that he only accepted pesos so he kindly converted and we got our credit cards and used the ATM paid him what we thought was $23 but in reality when we got home was $147 US. Aswell with me I was told $235US and knocked it down to $200 US but once again didn't accept US dollars so I did the same thing this time in reality paying him $488! So know your exchange and dont trust them to do it for you, there's nothing we can do about our loss try to not let it happen to you :)Other than that we would 100% think about going again to this lovely resort.  
<Date>Mar 1, 2008

<Author>gbigsea
<Content>Just Ok Stayed Feb 21 to 28th '08. Charter was with Sunwing which was first and last time booking with Sunwing.....flight 14 hours late and representatives on sight were/are completely useless.We are a family of 4 with 2 young teens and this was our first resort vacation after 4 cruise vacations.The positiveEnjoyed the resort property. The pools were great and the beach beautiful. Food was good and plentiful and locations convenient.Staff was great except front desk staff. Maid service was excellant and very deserving of tip provided. The negativeRooms, we stayed in Building 4 which had really nice garden view however the room was well worn...bathroom ceiling leaked, bathroom was very worn. Resort is short of beach towels so you need to bring your own.All rooms lost electricity on 2 occasions due to mechanical problems. This effects plumbing, therefore no showers, toilet, etc...200 college kids (Canada, USA, Spain) arrived which made sleeping impossible as partying was 24hours in the hall ways. Broken beer bottles in the lobby and pool area. Just like living in the University dorm again....good memory's bad vacation. 11 year son enjoyed the sights of the drunk, topless young Canadian college girls running around the resort.!!Kids got a craving for a candy bar but changed their mind when they found a cute little mouse on the second shelf in te resort store munching down on its own candy bar.Anyway...resort is a absolute maximum a 2.5 to 3 star resort (due only to the grounds, food and staff) therefore do not pay anymore than a 3 star price. We were fortunate in that we purchased a last minute deal that was cheap. Resort run spa was scam as you needed exact cash payment as change was not available therfore larger tip was requested...as appearantly 20% was not enough.We most likely will not return or recommend to anyone unless very cheap price.

<Author>TorontoIndy
<Content>Not a 4+ My wife and I just returned from the Oasis. Given what we paid, it was very good value. However, it is not a 4+ star and I would not pay the book value. Staff and service are very good as is typical of a Dominican 4 stars we have stayed. The room was large and clean. The beach itself is very nice and there are plenty of chairs.On the downside:The buildings are very close together inhibiting the view of the ocean. Our building backed onto a grimy residential/business area that would be seen as you enter and leave your room. The wine was a vile concoction that a wino would think twice about consuming. A la carte restaurants: Italian good (I had the beef tenderloin), seafood okay, American grill not so good. We were able to order good wine at $35 per bottle at the Italian.Hot buffet breakfasts are always a challenge. Oasis did not do well. Scrambled eggs, french toast and pancakes were not warm. Lunch and dinners were good.Mixed drinks were passable with the exception of pina colada which were bad. One I had at least worked well as a laxative. We had to endure a gauntlet of badgering merchants who set up on the property several nights however this is typical of Punta Cana resorts.There was no live band. A garden area featured a large cage of budgies. It is a great feeding station for rats. On one evening we saw one feeding inside the cage on what looked like bread.Overall we had a good time and would consider Oasis again at the sale price we paid.  
<Date>Feb 29, 2008

<Author>horsevet1
<Content>Would never go back to this resort We were there Jan. 13 to the 21st and originally booked to stay in the junior master suites because the Bavaro suites were not ready yet, there were 57 of us down for a wedding. We were booked in all different buildings. We were one of the couples that got booked in the Bavaro suites, block 11. There were a few other people from the group in that building as well as block 10. We didn't have any hot water the cold was white, the phone didn't work, construction went late into the evening and started early in the morning (sometimes 5am) and the dogs on the other side of the wall barked all night. Some people had no running water at all, so therefore there toilets didn't work. Most of the problems were fixed the next day.We also got locked out of our room the one day because the lock didn't want to work anymore, so we went to the front desk and they sent someone to fix it...half hour later, they had to actually replace it. There was also a giant spider in our room, not impressed, and another couple from block 10 had a few cockroachs. .The food was pretty good, the pool and beach were great. Not impressed with the maid service though, ours had an attitude.The wedding went well except for the minister not showing up til after dinner, 3 hrs late actually. So he just signed papers for $600. There friend that was reading the translation had to marry them, because they obviously weren't waiting. So after this stay I will never go back to this resort if I go to Dominican again.  
<Date>Feb 22, 2008

<Author>Appleontario
<Content>Wonderful vacation place for family!!! After our booking, I read the reviews for Grand Oasis, and must say that we are so nervous about some of the complaints. We stayed from Feb 7 to 14, 2008, turned out that we had fantastic time there with my husband and two boys. Every one found something we can enjoy. The weather is beautiful, the beach - do have seaweed most of the time - there are three staffs clean them consistently. The staff is trying very hard to make our stay clean/comfortable, the entertainment staff is everywhere and we really enjoy all the activities they create. Especially the Aqua-gym, mini.Disco - every night for the children, dancing lesson, and night shows. Even though, there are minor problems from time to time (switch for the cold water to hot water, missing towels, but the front desk solved the problems very quickly.Food is pretty good, lots of varieties. The three special restaurants are offering very unique food, we loved the seafood one - the most!!We really had a relaxed and stress released vacation!!

<Author>Justgothome
<Content>Great Resort My wife and I just returned from the Grand Oasis this morning. When we first booked the resort and then read the reviews we were nervous. However, the week was fantastic. The food, people, sand and accommodation was great. The weather, well what can I say about the weather except it was exceptional. I must mention two staff that went above and beyond. Cathy from the Bocchi Ball area never stopped smiling and always was upbeat. Anthony who part of the pool activity area and as well part of the evening entertainment made the week more enjoyable for us.In our week at the resort, we saw 6 nightly entertainment shows. All but two were entertaining. The content of the shows ranged from comedy to dancing. The two that I did not enjoy particularly were the shows of the adult nature. Our main goal when we first booked our trip was rest and relaxation. These were achieved. I highly recommend this resort.

<Author>sbaptie_5
<Content>What a wonderful week! I can't say enough wonderful things about this place! I was reading the reviews before we left, and was starting to worry about our choice. I am not sure where some of these people were, butthey certainly weren't at the Grand Oasis! We were originally supposed to be at the new Grand Oasis Bavaro Suites, but a weekbefore our departure, they moved us to the original resort (Grand Oasis). We were upgraded to Building 7....and we are still amazedat our good fortune. The rooms were gorgeous and we overlookedthe ocean, with a tub on the verandah outside!! The resort is amazingly clean and the staff always pleasant. The food was great.Sometimes the buffet wasn't perfectly hot, but that would be impossible for the length of time that the buffet is open. They do their best, and the variety of foods were amazing...something for everyone! The 3 restaurants (Seafood, American Grill, and Italian)were great, and we had no problem reserving a spot for when we wanted. The only downfall for the week, was that there was noCanadian Club whiskey for my husband, but he made out okay with a few other things and we had taken a bottle from the duty free at the airport, so he drank that in the evenings. I would totallyrecommend this resort to others, and would certainly go back again! It would be nice to see what the Bavaro suites is like, when it is completed. I also have to mention that the shows in the evening are a lot of fun. My husband was asked to take part in the Miss Oasis competition (which is very unlike him) but had a lot of fun doing so...and we have pictures to prove it!! He ended up with a funky hair-do, and his Miss Oasis won the competition hands down!Holidays are what you make of it, and this week at Grand Oasis was beautiful! Thanks to the great staff!  
<Date>Feb 14, 2008

<Author>whispers_canada
<Content>Great Resort! Hi Everyone! I just got back from the Grand Oasis Punta Cana at 3:30 am this morning! Usually I'd wait a few days before posting a review however I felt the need to given all of the 'mixed opinions' on this site!I travelled from Toronto, ontario to punta cana with sunwing. firstly, I have to say that sunwing is an awesome carrier to fly with! they did not stop serving us food and beverages - hot meals on both the departing and returning flight, complimentary wine with the dinner, champagne, hot towel service etc. A great flight!As for the resort - honestly I don't know what people are complaining about. Here is my quick review:1) Rooms - overall they are nice and spacious. we were NOT in building 7 but in building 3. the rooms are large and clean. that's what matters most! also we had no issues with the AC and even had to turn it off at night sometimes because it is fairly strong2) Food - I'm vegetarian and so I'm usually pretty limited in what I can eat. i found that they had enough variety even for me. The one thing that I really appreciate about this place, is their nighttime snack bar. most resorts that claim to have a nightime snackbar usually just have cold sandwiches and stale fries. this place serves rice, chicken, vegetables, french fries, a few salads etc up until 5 am... which is awesome! Overall the food was very fresh- I travelled with a friend and neither of us got sick. I liked Windows (the main restaurant) - it was very spacious and overall well ventilated... not sure why everyone is complaining. The staff there are very nice as well - always smiling :)3) Drinks - my goodness, do they ever serve up strong drinks! usually places like this will limit how much alcohol they mixx into a drink, but we actually had to ask them to make our drinks light once in a while as they are not shy pouring the alcohol4) Resort - these guys do a good job trying to keep everything clean. they are constantly racking the sand to get rid of seaweed - they wash the premises everynight, the bathrooms are overall very clean outdoors which is rare. I don't get the folks that complain about this resort being dirty - I beg to differ!5) Entertainment- I have to say that the animation team works extremely hard... they are all very nice people and very friendly - Kathy and Reynol especially! Also some very attractive folks working on that team which doesn't hurt ;)6) Things to look out for - every tuesday and friday, they have vendors that come in from offsite and set up shop on the resort grounds - these guys are like vultars and I really hated having to walk past them. They do not relent and constantly try to harass you into buying things! On the positive side though, I spent some time on the beach and did not get hounded or harassed like many others have mentioned in their reviews - so for me this was a non issue. Be careful of the folks that have stalls set up permanently on the resort - they inflate prices like crazy, you can get items even cheaper than what they may quote you at the actual resort shops. Overall, I had a great time. I know some folks complained that the AC wasn't working in the rooms, or that it was really loud - I think we got lucky because our room was just fine. The staff are great, don't speak much english but make a good effort. The medical facilities are awesome as well; my friend had to visit the doctor and she was an absolute sweetheart - even called the next day to follow up and make sure all was well.I'd recommend this place and maybe even go again!  
<Date>Feb 13, 2008
<Rating>4	4	4	5	5	4	5	-1	
<Aspects>

<Author>JackTarlover
<Content>We had a great time We had a great time at Grand Oasis.I was a little leary after staying at Excellence last year but this place was great.We stayed in room 3325 and the maid service was usually done in the morning. No complaints at all about hot water or water pressure. Nice view of the ocean while drinking our coffees on the balcony in the morning.We spent most of our days by the swim up bar and met alot of great people. Ola to all of my friends from Carol.The restaurants are good. We loved the American Grill. Jean is fantastic.Go to Grand Oasis and have fun. You won't be dissapointed. If you have any questions just ask.

<Author>Proud-Canadian66
<Content>Don't worry.... not a bad place We stayed at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana from Feb 2 to Feb 9. Like other travellers I was very nervous about going to this resort because of the reviews I read before going.This may be a long review but I want to be honest and somewhat thorough.Firstly, don't let all the negative reviews ruin your holiday before you arrive.Let me say that if you are a picky traveller and like things to be top notch and to have everything in order from the service, to your room to the overall resort to the restaurants then this place is not for you and you won't be happy. If this is what you want then you need to pay top dollar to get that level of resort in the Dominican.We were looking for a decent and reasonably priced resort for our family of two adults and two kids as well as grandparents and another family of four with teenage kids (group of 10) and that is what we got..We were looking for a clean room, lots of sun, things to do for the kidsas well as decent quality of food and drinks so we wouldn't get sick. We got all of this.Yes there were things that were annoying and could have been better, but overall it was no where near as bad as the previous reviews had made it out to be...thank goodness. We felt we got our monies' worth.Check in and Check out went well and was quick.Food: We could all find something to eat on the buffet. Sometimes Pizza wasn't very hot and the drinks/juice need ice to be cold. Breakfast was good with the usual stuff plus a great smoothie bar. Lunch had a variety of dishes plus usually pizza, stuff for sandwiches and again always fries. So'me days at the buffet were better than others but we were never hungry. There was a pasta bar, salads, breads, lots of fruit and each night varied with chicken, pork, beef, lamb , ribs, fish, fajitas, always french fries, vegies, potatoes etc etc...The deserts were better than we have seen in the past. Always icecream for the kids. So I don't know how anyone could be hungry. There is also the Beach Grill which was good and a nice change. Just a note we ate at the big buffet Windows but we also at e at the smaller one over by the American Grill Restaurant for breakfast and lunch. At breakfast the lineups were much smaller for omellets and eggs etc. and still lots of choice but just on a smaller scale...same for lunch.We ate at two of the ala cartes...the Italian one Da Marios and the American Grill (Tex Mex) and we all liked both of them... the kids preferred the American Grill. Some of the group didn't like Sea Food so we didn't eat there. Yes, some of the meals were better than others but it was a nice change from the Buffet and the food was pretty good and some of the dishes were amazing. For 10 of us we had no trouble getting reservations. We went the first day and booked for the week. You can have 3 ala cartesfor the week. The only time there is a problem is if there is a wedding and it is full. We talked to other people and opinions vary so... you will just have to go yourself and form your own opinion.Service...yes sometimes depending on when you went there was no utensils or napkinsat the table... but no big deal just take from the next table or ask for them and you got it...but as I said if you like the service to be top notch... you will be upset at times. We just dealt with the issues and did not let it bother us. It was much better then being at home in the cold. They did their best to please with drinks and any other requests. Yes there may be some staff that were better than others...but if we worked the hours they did and received the numerous complaints they do...we may not always be in the best of moods. Overall...they were great.Rooms. We were in building 2 and the rooms were OK...pretty big in comparison to other resorts we have stayed at.. We were just there to sleep. We did look at the rooms in building 7 and they were beautiful, but expensive. Since were were travelling with the kids and for the most part only in the room to change and sleep it was not worth the money for us to upgrade. If the nicer rooms is an issue with you than pay and upgrade and you will be happy with your accomodationsRoom was cleaned every day and fridge was cold and well stocked and once we learned that the patio door had to be completely shut for the air conditioner to work and our room had to have the door card in the slot for things to work it worked well.. haha If we needed anything they did their best to get it or fix it. We had lots of hot water...sometimes too much. Downfall of our room: Only light that worked all the time was the table lamp... others would come on when they felt like it including in the night. Since we were on the third floor one night when it rained hard our roof leaked.... Since it was not near where we were sleeping we did not let it bother us.... and yes the toilet was a little testy at times. Other families we were with also had problems with bathtub or showers... but one or the other worked and we just didn't let it bother us.Entertainment....not bad... what we saw was better than we have seen in the past at other resorts. Only complaint was it started to late... 9:30-10:00 p.m. which was too late for the kids and most of the time us to so we did not get to see all the shows. Would have liked to see more of it. They tried hard to include the kids in an earlier program and they seemed to really have fun.The Spa was good and we booked the big hot tub located in there for the 10 of us for $5.00 US pp a couple of times which was fun. The one located in the adults pool was cold. Someone with us got their hair done and another got the massage which they enjoyed.Shopping. We walked just outside the resort in a little shopping area and got pretty much everything we wanted. They were willing to barter and were very friendly and if you said no thanks they respected that.We also went by a taxi boat down the coast and stopped at a Plaza and looked around. This was bigger and had a good selection of items. They didn't tend to come as low in their price. We found you would have to wander from place to place to get a better deal, but overall their prices were higher. But again very friendly and for the most part respected no thanks.The vendors they let on the resort were more aggressive by far...and you had to be firm in saying no or just keep walking.There is also a little mall on the resort... but their prices were higher and they did not like to come down in their prices.There was lots to do outside the resort if you wanted to pay and do it. We went horseback riding on the beach and rented a boat to take us up the coast to look around. Other than that we went for a bicycle ride which is included, walked the beach alot , went swimming, played volleyball, pingpong. You could be busy or just sit and relax.Be careful with the internet... they tended to duplicate the codes so you were not getting the time you paid for and you have to make sure you are logging off properly or when you go back your time is done. Any problems we had they were good at helping and fixing them.We were not bothered with time share sales people or reps from the vacation club like I have read in past reviews. There were also no vendors on the beach except for people to braid your hair. In the spa a full head of breads was around $40.00 and on the beach it was around $25.00 or $30.00.The weather was good. It was pretty windy most of the time. Yes there is some seaweed on the beach... but they worked hard to clean it up. We were pretty far down the beach and there was seaweed in most places.The language barrier can be tough. Sometimes it was hard to get things because they couldn't understand you... but in fairness they did try and so did we.They were always sweeping and cleaning up around the resort. If you look hard enough you will find lots of things that needed fixing and sprucing up...I think that would be the same pretty much anywhere whether it be at home or on holiday in the Carribean. We didn't do this.. we just wanted to enjoy the sun and our holiday and we didn't dwell on the bad.Overall, we were pleasantly surprised with the Grand Oasis and our time there.Don't pay much attention to all the negative reviewsyour vacation at the Grand Oasis will be what you make it... whether it be good or bad.If I can help with any of your questions just ask.  
<Date>Feb 11, 2008

<Author>travelsalot333
<Content>One BIG Problem turned into more We (2 couples in our 30s without children) stayed at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana from January 19th to January 26th 2008. To give anyone perspective on our benchmarks we have stayed and enjoyed them all:Punta Cana (DR)- Iberostar Bavaro- Caribe Club PrincessPuerto Plata (DR)- Bahia PrincipeMayan Riviera (MX)- Riu Playacar- Bahia Principe TulumSo, about the Grand Oasis Punta Cana / Bavaro ... We were booked for the Grand Oasis Bavaro - Junior Suites Cameleon Package. This building wasn't ready (under construction) so we were put in a Master Junior Suite rooms in the Grand Oasis Punta Cana - block 7. Grand Oasis Bavaro and Punta Cana are the same resort just the Bavaro is the name for the newest building - block 11. The room (7304) was outstanding - by far the best we've stayed in on any of our vacations in the Caribbean. HOWEVER, the air conditioning for the entire building (block 7) did not work for our entire stay. You may wonder why we didn't ask for a room change, and that was because we were told it would be fixed (over and over by the resort, by our tour rep and every other guest in the block - we all kept getting assured it would be fixed that day) ... additionally, our building was the only one with the junior suites and the rooms in the rest of the resort are a little below average for the Caribbean (very worn).In any event, not getting sleep 'cause your room is 35 degrees (Celcius) or more all night can make people grumpy and tired. We didn't have the energy to go on any excursions so we slept in the shade a lot during the day and then sweat all night. It can also make you see everything with a little glass is half empty point of view so I won't share any more thoughts on the resort because I don't have much positive to say.And, because we really wanted to see a resort map before we went but couldn't find any online, I've enclosed a copy for reference. Building 7 has no air conditioning but the rooms are great (there are some traveller photos of them). I wrote on the map where Building 11 is and this is where anyone booked to stay at the Grand Oasis Bavaro will be staying once the construction is complete.  
<Date>Feb 8, 2008

<Author>tp2
<Content>Don't do it The food is horrible really had to try hard to find something to choke down. Bit into two raw hamburgers a raw piece of chicken and raw pork tenderloin(spent lots of time on the [--]). Tried to order room service three times it never arrived. The rooms in some blocks are nice the other are old and beat down. The nice blocks however are under construction expect a 9:00 a.m wake up hammer. Most of the service was bad with the exception of the bartenders and waiters. The only thing that saved the trip was the 8 other amazing people we spent the 7 days with and the beautiful Beaches and cold Beer.  
<Date>Feb 6, 2008

<Author>houseofma
<Content>Overall it was Great! We stayed at the Grand Oasis from January 20 to the 27, 2008. I read all of the reveiws prior to going and went with a very open mind. It was overall a fabulous time.We stayed in one of the new buildings number 11 and our room was quite nice. Unlike some of our travel companions who had minor room issues(the gigantic spider, a warm fridge and finicky toilet) we had no complaints about the room. Our Maid Carlita Flores was an absolute sweetheart and did an excellent job keeping our room clean and well stocked. Our room safe was bolted into the wall of the closet and we were not charged for the use of it. I assume it was included in the price of our package through Sunwing tours. They were still working hard at getting the rest of the building opened up so there was some construction going on throughout the day but we did not find this to be a problem.There is a beautiful new pool outside of building 11 and we watched them complete the final touches on it and open it up just as we were about to leave for the plane home.There was enough food there to feed anyone. Yes there were certain things that were on the buffet every day but they did try to switch it up by having different themes each evening. Considering the many different types of people that were at the resort I thought they did a pretty good job of trying to have something for everyone. Remember you are in a different country and they are trying to cook what they think you like to eat. I over heard 3 american women say that in the future they would not go to any all inclusive resort that didn't serve grilled cheese sandwiches and kraft dinner....hmmn if that is what you are looking for than don't go!!!!We tired 2 of the ala carte restaraunts Da Mario(italian) and Marinera(the seafood).....Da Mario is a beautiful atmosphere and the accomodated a large group for us for a birthday party for one of our Travelling companions(there were 13 of us all together). The appetizers were all a great hit but the main courses were not such a success. Those who chose the pasta as a main dish all seemed pleased but the Pork was extremely tough and very bland. They made a beautiful birthday cake that was extremely well presented with a large group singing to the birthday girl in Spanish and in English!!! It was absolutely deliscoius!!!!!!!!Marinera was excellent. Eating under a thatched roof in the light of the full moon beside the beach. The food was proabley the best I had all week. We did 3 trips while we were there. The first one was the quading adventure... my husband and his brother went and although it was fun I highly doubt we would pay to do this a second time. The Quads were no in the best of shape and it is a follow the leader type tour so you only go as fast as the slowest person. For people who have quadded before it wasn't really an adventure.The second was a half day charter with FIRST CLASS FISHING. It was beautiful day and the waves weren't to bad. Unfortunately we didn't actually catch anything but the other boat that went out when we did actually caught a couple of really big fish. My biggest problem with the fishing was the disel fumes from the engine when we turned the boat around. Despite feeding the fish my breakfast about halfway through the trip I would not hesitate to head out on another deep sea fishing adventure. The stay of First Class Fishing were just that first class.Our last trip was definately the highlight of the trips we did the day trip to Saona Isla. Absolutely beautiful. We travelled by bus to the Catamaran then by Catamaran to the beach on Saona.(As soon as we got on the boat a Canadian guy got up an tied the canadiaan flag to the front and that started the trip off on a good note) Once at the beach we were fed an excellent buffet lunch and given a few hours to spend on the beach. Following the beach time we were taken by speed boat to the natural Starfish habitat and allowed to go in and check them out. Way to cool!!!! I would definately do this one again but when they say full day trip they mean all day. We left the hotel at 7:30 am and did not return til after 7:30 pm. Overall our trip was most enjoyable might have had something to do with the wonderful group that we travelled with or the many new friends that we made while we were down there. Party Goat Rules!!! I would definately return to the Grand Oasis Punta Cana....  
<Date>Jan 30, 2008

<Author>Robyncicle
<Content>Beautiful Resort I was at the resort from January 20th to 27th.The place is beautiful! The staff, the food, the drinks and the beach were all wonderful! The staff was always smiling and always said hello when they saw you. We even saw one guy hanging on a bench from the roof of one of the buidings painting, and he waved at us when we said hello. It was a crazy sight!The hostesses in Windows are right there to seat you breakfast lunch and dinner. They make sure you have what you need. The staff in Windows make sure you have a coffee or tea ASAP and also at night a lunch or drink, whether it be a beer or a pop and the glass doesn't stay empty for long at all. The beach did have quite a bit of seaweed that washed up this time, but the grounds keepers did the best the could to get it off the beach quickly. The beach huts went quickly so you had to be down at the beach early to get one. My only complaints about the resort was that the toilet in our room wasn't working towards the end of the week, the fridge didn't work but I enjoy room temp water so it wasn't a big deal, and the giant spider we had in our bathroom one morning. We called thr front desk and they sent someone up right away to dispose of the spider and to fix the toilet. Overall it was a great experience and I would go back!  
<Date>Jan 29, 2008

<Author>durhamlady
<Content>Grand Oasis with Family We stayed at the Oasis from Jan 14-22. I was with my mom(Granny) and 2 boys, 3  5 years old. We checked in at 10:30pm. Everything was fine. I had requested building 2 on the lazy pool but was told it was unavailable. After showing some money I was told I could be moved in the morning, but the desk clerk walked us to a room he said would be better. It was building 6 near the adult pool. It was a suite, with 2 rooms, 2 balconies. Very spacious and nice. We decided to stay.Food was plenty and good. Always choices that pleased adults and children. Pools were clean and not too overcrowded. We did swim in the lazy river it was much cooler and didn't have alot of action for the kids. The kids club was a little lame. We did play there but I would not leave my children unattended as no one seemed to watch them carefully. The beach was nice but had a lot of seaweed. The hotel had men cleaning it up constantly so it didn't bother us. We did 1 excursion to Animal Adventure Park. The boys loved it. They picked us up on a boat for the 2 minute ride to the park. We got to touch sea lions, parrots, a nurse shark, starfish, sea urchins, monkeys, large snakes and a tiger! My boys were in awe. All in all we had a good trip. The hotel is a perfect size with everything within a quick walk.If anyone has questions feel free to contact me.

<Author>KelB-Rad
<Content>A bit of false advertising..... Stayed at the Grand Oasis from Jan 17-24th. The Chameleon Suites were recommended to us by a travel agent with Holiday Market on line agency. Right up until the day of arrival we were unsure exactly what we'd be getting into as there were conflicting reports as to whether the building/rooms would be ready for occupancy. It's unfortunate that the agent didn't seem to be fully informed as to the status...I'm going to start with the not so good and end with the good...So.....the internet pics showed a floating rock climbing apparatus in the ocean-not there-it showed a large private pool alongside the ocean-not there-showed a nice hot tub in the spa area-did not say you had to pay $5.00 for 15 minutes to use. Showed a lazy susan style pool exclusive to Chameleon Suites-not filled. Booked in a group of 12  asked to be booked in the same building-assured this wouldn't be a problem-it was-we ended up in 3 different buildings-and not all in the Chameleon Suites. Friends in building 11 had no hot water a couple of times. Friends in building 6-had 2 beds pushed together vs a King size bed and the hallway smelled like raw sewage-they asked to be moved and it took a couple of days to get this changed. Our room in building 10 was nice-fridge wasn't very cold. We tipped our maid daily with money, candy etc. Didn't notice any extras -but we fully intended to tip regardless :)Chameleon Suites advantages advertised: Private Check in  out-unsure what this exactly meant as we received no special treatment here.Free internet-had to pay $5.00 for 20 minutes-and it wasn't up and running very often.Beach towels in room-never happened in our room-and it was only for the 1st day-the rest of the time you had to go and get yourself.Poolside drink service-never happened.$10.00 per room/day for casino-did get this, but could only be used at black jack or roulette tables. Could only use 1 voucher per day and Casino staff were very rude and accused a couple of people of trying to use more than 1/day when we didn't. Casino staff did not speak english.Restaurant reservations-we were able to book this-outside of the scheduled booking times for other guests.We enjoyed the entertainment. Most of the Recreation staff were fun and polite-we liked Yeti, Kathi, Coco Loco and the M.C.Kathi-braids hair at a good price and is located on the beach by the water sports building. Just barter with her as she will start off at a ridiculous price.DON'T book the dune buggy excursion with the fellas by the pool. They told us it was a 20 minute drive from the hotel-it was 1 hour 1 way. We were supposed to visit dunes and caves and swim in a natural spring. First of all-we were 1/2 hour delayed as one buggy had no brakes-one buggy's wheel fell off after driving approx. 20 feet. They didn't have enough buggy's for us to begin with. Once we got to the beach, 3 buggy's stalled and it took us at least 45 minutes to get up and running again. So we finally just told them to take us back and send the bus-we didn't even finish the excursion. We managed to get a bit of money back-but it wasn't worth the time it took.Even though it seems as though it wasn't that great-our group made the best of it and actually had a good time. We enjoyed the Karaoke nightly and had a great time by the pool each day. If you're travelling in a group-it's best to get someone to save your seats early in the morning as lounges get taken up quickly.The food was fine and the Italian restaurant was good.  
<Date>Jan 25, 2008

<Author>DDiddy
<Content>Not Impressed at all! Stayed at the Oasis Jan. 13 - 20Not Impressed at all.......Got to the Hotel and had to wait 3 hours for our room to be ready. 3 hour in the non-air conditioned heat waiting is not fun. Group of 8 of us, 4 rooms and not 1 was ready for our stay.Room was Ok, big and fairly clean but nothing special....stayed in building 3 close to the pool and beach. Location of the building was good, but very loud at nights due to the bar out the window. Had to call twice to get the air conditioning going, and it was unpredictable throughout the entire week.Beach was nothing like what i remember Punta Cana to be (stayed in Barcelo - Punta Cana last year and it was 100 x better) full of sea weed and the water was not clear. the further South you go the better.The entertainment was horrible, and I do not expect much from the all inclusive shows.....just bad, dont waste any of your time! Cant describe how bad it really was!If your going on an excursion dont buy from the booth poolside, although they are cheaper then the tour operators in within the hotel the product is inferior; Sona Island tour was ok but the boat was a little more run down then others, ATV's broke down every two seconds. Oh ya 20 min. drive = 2 hours!!!Not going to comment on the food b/c it is pretty much what I expected, ok but not great.3 * at best, spend the extra money and go to barcelo - punta cana or baha principe, beaches, service and atmosphere far superior!I do not reccommend this place to anyone,

<Author>MississaugaHendrix
<Content>I Do'nt know what the complaints are about!!!! My husband and I went to the Grand Oasis Jan. 10 - 20. We flew and booked with Sunwing, nice flight, food and service. We stayed in building 3 on the ground floor, when we first arrived we had no towels, but soon as you let them know, they were there within 10 minutes. This resort is always clean and the staff are always hard at work to keep it that way. We found the beach was nice and we never had a problem trying to find a lounger at any time of the day. The main pool did get a bit busy, but if you did'nt like it you could go to the Adult Pool. We had a male maid( Appollo) and he was one of the best, anything we needed he was right there. The bartenders were always right on top of things and there were no long lineups. The food was fine ( do'nt forget you're in the Dominican, not at the Ritz), the best a-lacarte was the Italian, we went twice while we were there, very good. Overall we had no complaints about this resort, and do'nt forget you are not going to get 5 star service for the price you pay, it is a 4 star resort.

<Author>Anna269
<Content>Tried hard to love it Have taken many vacations to tropical resorts and know what to expect when in a different country. Had read the reviews before going and decided that the few negative ones I had read were probably just sour grapes or inexperienced travellers. NOT! The beach was white sand covered in seaweed, our neighbours room was flooded because of an evening rain storm...and they did nothing to right the situation. Our room had cock roaches, smelled terrible, patio door didn't slide open, and we had to find our maid and ask for water and towels several times. The restaurants were nice...at best.... but we were seated at a table with dirty linen and a stained tablecloth...was verging on disgusting. Our special Christmas Eve dinner was a 400 person cattle drive....the food was nice but service was...well impossible even if they wanted to do well.The resort allow venders ON the resort so everytime you pass by to get food or go to your room (which is several times a day) you are approached to buy...very tired of saying no..10 times a day. On the plus side...well not much...the weather was nice and the hotel staff were very friendly....our teenagers enjoyed the beach grill and the rum bingo..... The evening shows...amateur at best! I rate it 2 star....no more than that!  
<Date>Jan 19, 2008

<Author>michelle61
<Content>Great activities Just returned from our week vaction and had a great time. The resort is presently being remodeld. I went with teenages and they had a great time. Staff was friendly, your typical Dominican staff. The shows at night are great, food is ok, avoid the American Grill. We stayed in one of the brand new buildings and it was super clean. If you like activities this is the place to go. Do not expect everybody to speak English, this is a Spanish speaking country. The alcohol was brand name, despite of what other people say - except for the rum which was local. This was our third trip to the Dominican and we were pleased. This resort has everything from shuffleboard to seakayaks, bananaboats pulled by motor boats, water arobics in the pool etc. For extra charge there is scuba at the coral reef, zip lines, parasailing and horseback riding and much more. We felt very safe and happy.

<Author>JimPim
<Content>Neither Grand nor an Oasis We (3kids  wife) rented 2 rooms over Christmas/New Years Break. Wife and I stayed in the Suites for $50 extra per day. We had no AC the entire week and they would not give us a different room even if we took a downgrade. Kept telling us it was going to be fixed then on the 3rd day told us it was a hotel wide problem but our kid room had AC the entire time. Frig didn't work (warm beer - yeah) and when we went to get ice - no ice machines, had to walk all the way down to the bar (200 yds away). Couldn't get a beach towel or seat at the beach for the 1st 2 days sorry wee really busy?that was the standard reply anytime you ask for something from staff. They allow merchants to set up INSIDE the hotel grounds so every time you walked to a meal or the pools someone was trying to sell you a timeshare or carved coconut, very annoying. If youe like me and need the shade, it was very limited unless you wanted to get up at 6:30 and do the towel save move and they had no umbrella to use or rent. Hotel was understaffed, not doubt. I didn see staff sitting around, those who we saw were running and hustling, just did not have nearly enough. Most breakfast meals you had to find someone to get you coffee only to get blown off and had to get it your self. All-inclusive was weak. No bottled water, no bottle or cans of beer ?everything was served in small 10oz plastic cups, didn matter what you ordered. Couple of stations were you could get self-serve water or soda rarely had cups (understaffed problem) so you had to go to one of only 3 bars for the entire hotel and wait in line.We used Apple Vacations who were of no help with our room situation, beach towels and other problems, they were only interested in booking our excursions which it turns out we could have done on our own for less. The weather and beach were awesome; we went on 2 excursions that were great, saw some nice spots and had a good time once I let go of the poor choice we made with the Hotel. We talked to other folks during our excursions and they had much better experiences with their hotels, wouldn give up on Punta Cana just the weaky-joe Hotel improperly call Grand Oasis, should have been called the Grand Mirage?.

<Author>Bosona
<Content>Disaster Resort This is my review for Grand Oasis Bavaro (Cameleon) Punta CanaFirst of all I have to say to everyone who is reading this, do not think that Grand Oasis Bavaro is a new Hotel like the Travel Agencies like to describe the new section of the older resort the Grand Oasis or whatever this Resort is called, it has 10 different names and 10 different ratings and 10.000 confusions about this Resort. Please read every review that people have left and think twice before booking or you will pull your hair afterwards!Entrance/LobbyAs we arrived the lobby was empty and the check in was really quick and the bellboy was right there to take our luggage. The Lobby at first looked OK not really impressive but OK, on the second look I realised that it is old and cosmetically needed an makeover, the desk is all wood painted probably quite few times and looks like and older low class European Hotel that probably will be demolished pretty soon. One thing that saved the Lobby look from total bad review are the nice new chairs and couches plus glass elevator that takes visitors from the ground to first level where the isco?is. There is not much to say about the lobby any more just maybe that it has two half round stair well and open air space from font (entrance) and back into the actually resort.RoomsWe stayed in the new building ??witch is still not fully ready but fully occupied and is still under construction. Anyhow, the room looked quiet nice, we had a double queen bed room with a 30 inch flat screen TV and a nice bath with Jacuzzi tub(never used it) so I can not tell you if it worked. Shower worked pretty good and had most of the time warm water, 2 times we had to warm the water in the coffee maker to wash our 19 months boy. Hair drier was not working until the second last day and after 3 calls for repair. The balcony door had no lock until the last day and the safe box could be carried out because it was not attached to anything, it was on the floor, the door lock did not work properly so we had to go back to the lobby x-times and make clear to the unfriendly personnel that our door is not opening, I went nuts. The room service was really nice and friendly, we had nothing missing. We found out that they slack if you tip same every day. Also I have to say we found two roaches and had about 20 mosquito every day to kill. Bring mosquito sprays!!!!RestaurantsHere I could write a novel, quite simple, the food is low bellow my expectation of good food. The Grand Oasis Resort offers 1 Buffet Restaurant,1 beach restaurant that transforms into 1 a la carte at night, 3 a la carte and one beach grill that has the size of two hot dog carts. ?Buffet or indow?restaurant is quite big but not big enough to accommodate the huge crowd, sometimes we had to wait or try to find table and even harder to find was a high chair for our boy. There are some wooden table (not very new) and half of restaurant has plastic garden chairs and tables, also to mention is, do not expect to have a clean table cover or chair.Unfortunately we had to eat most of the time here because no other or better choice. In the morning you can be sure to find always the same food over and over again. For better understanding the breakfast could be compared with the Danny restaurant in the States or Canada, if you like to eat at Danny you will like the breakfast at Windows Restaurant. Lunch we found out to be better than breakfast or dinner. Again, not my food choice but at lest you will not starve.Dinner was really bad also, same food over and over again, lots of pork, low in see food and salad bar sucked. Plus you can expect roaches to visit you while you eat , we have been visited by an giant cockroach witch tried to climb my wife leg.?Tex Max (a la carte) Restaurant was the worst of the 3 a la carte, we had a good laugh and residente?beer , the food was returned, so much from Tex Max.?Sea food (a la carte) Restaurand was OK nothing special but also not as bed as Tex Max, I had ai Mai?filet, my wife had grilled chicken, we did not returned it. To my great disappointment we had no choice of free lobster nor shrimp, Lobster dinner was at extra cost of $35 US ?) really great price for such Restaurant. I could not think of anyone who would pay that much for 1 pond lobster tail at low class restaurant.?La Romario (a la carte) Italian Restaurant was the very best choice of all the restaurants at Grand Oasis. Food choice was good, and the taste was not bad as well, the salad and beef tenderloin I had was quite good prepared.Again to say the food was not according my taste but I was not sick either, in total the food could be compared to Denny, Montana or similar restaurants in the North America.PoolsGrand Oasis has now 5 pools, 1 main centre pool is quite big and about the size of two Olympic swimming pools but only 1-1.35m deep, you will find one small baby pool, two lazy river and one adult pool with hot tub on side, all pools are in pretty good shape and are not dirty, just you have to wake up early in the morning about 6 to reserve a spot.BeachBeach is quite nice, lots of palm trees and palm umbrellas that provide enough shade, again early wake needed to reserve good spot. Beach bar is close by and should provide enough counterfeit boos. Also to mention is the beach sport choice of volley ball, soccer, bocce, dart, free kayak, catamaran.BarsThere are 4 bars, and 1 pool bar, all serve no name (counterfeit) alcohol, you will not find any brand name. If you like to get drunk have fun drinking a lot doe to lower alcohol content than other similar brand name drinks.All in total , think twice before booking, do not rush into this resort and do not believe the reat reviews?some people leave here, I have no idea what kind of Resort they stayed at.In my eyes this was a Disaster Resort, nothing went smoothly, from check in to check out nothing but trouble and stress. I have to say that people I have met at the resort all had the same opinion and experience. Do not think that Grand Oasis opened a new resort and that you can use the new and old facility, there is NO new resort just new rooms to cash in and get more tourists. Be aware of annoying time share dudes and lunatic vendors that will try to grab you and sell you a key chain for $10 US cost of 20 cent and so on. This was definitely the first and last time at this resort and probably in the Dominican, people are to rude to support them, Cuba is much more attractive to me now than it was ever before. I would not recommend this resort to experienced travelers nor expecting first timers, travelers with small children forget it. I would recommend this resort for younger travelers that do not expect much or do not care about services and care only about alcohol and some opposite sex action.

<Author>bnik98
<Content>Horrible service.....Stolen mp3 player We went to the Grand Oasis Punta Cana and stayed for one week. The hotel is bought out by Globalia, so there is bad management. While we were staying the weather normal (lots of rain). It rained 4 out of seven days, but the rains were pretty short. My worst experience was that I couldn't go snorkelling becauce my leg was broken, but my other family members say there weren't much fish to see.OUR FLIGHT TO PUNTA CANA:We flew by Sunwing. The flight was about 4 hours long.CHECK IN:Check-in was fast and effective. We got our room right away, and when we decided to move to a more private room, we got that room right away too.GROUNDS:The grounds of the resort were beautiful and very tidy. The resort is put together pretty well. There was some construction going on beside the adult's pool but that was hardly noticable.STAFF:The staff were very friendly and also very helpful. We rented a wheelchair for me (as I had a broken leg), and when I had some problems with it, the staff always helped. Though when we went to the Marinero (seafood) restaurant one of the staff was very unfriendly (he handed us the menu without even looking at us!) and completly ruined our experience there.SERVICE:The service was very bad compared to the hotel Playa Costa Verde in Holguin, Cuba. There if you give them a tip, they will do anything. At GOPC they just continue on with their work not paying any attention to you as though you didn't give them anything. When you ask for cofee you have to wait for a minimum of 20 minutes to get it, and they bring it cold. They don't seat you when you come, so they don't know where you are and that also adds up to the time. An example of bad management.FOOD  RESTAURANTS:The food was completely excellent! There were three  l crt restaurants: seafood, Italian and the American grill. We figured out that the Dominican Republic's national food is eggplant, and they serve it every day.Buffet:The food was excellent and there was a big choice of foods there. The buffet was built with a circle of food in the centre and tables around it. For those of you who like to smoke, there is a special area (you can eat there too). You can also request a table outside. There was a large roach on the cuttlery and the staff didn't even worry about it (!).Marinero Seafood  l crt:As I said earlier, the staff completely ruined our experience so I can't exatly say anything about it. Our waiter was rude and we went without ordering anything.American Grill  Tex-Mex:The food there was delicious. The restaurant was made in a mexican ranch style. The menu consisted of both mexican and american foods. We were pretty happy with the restaurant.Da Mario's (Italian):The best restaurant I went to. There were lots of food choices and the food was delicious. It was probably the hit of the trip. A wedding was going on there and everyone got a piece of delicous wedding cake.BEACH:The beach is OK. There are some choppers frequently going around the area, but that didn't bother us much. The beach has some vendors on it, but they just sit there doing nothing. There is also a beach bar (really good!). They have burgers, fries,hot dogs, chicken and pizza. The ocean is murky and you have to go to another area for clean water. My family members say that that there weren't any fish to look at and that the snorkelling trip was a rip-off.OTHER:The maid stole my 100$ mp3 player so I was extremly dissapointed.OUR OVERALL EXPERIENCE:We didn't have a very good time, and we don't reccomend this hotel to others. We will never come back to this hotel again.

<Author>Dolly28
<Content>Do your research First... Good Points. We upgraded our room with the hotel reception, the first room they gave us was pool view, horrible smelly room, we upgraded to Block 7, beautiful, comfortable, very clean and luxury.Reception staff and entertainment team great, the girls in the mini club are lovely.Weather was fab for the 2 weeks.Got out with a staff member, wish we had done this earlier cause day 7 we needed to do something else, as confined to the hotel it does get a little boring.Bad Points...The food is TERRIBLE,,,, Lots of food poisioning, I am very fussy when it comes to food and especially countries like this I don't trust there meats etc, my husband is Italian and we have a restaurant in the UK, we checked out the Italian rest on site, it is disgusting, myself and my son were both ill for the next 3 days.Coffee is bad, mineral water has a horrible taste,,,,,,if you just wish to eat fruit and veg all 2 weeks then you will be fine, burger, hotdogs, chips are served at the beach bar with a load of green flies all over them, stay clear!!!!!!!!We felt the need to bring some issues to the attention of the Manager, as that day in the childrens play are we were aware of a live cable coming out of the sand, we made them aware of there service which is definately not to 5 star standard, this is more like a 3 star.Overall if you want cheap, cheerfull, not bothered what you eat, and can cope with swimming in dirty water then this hotel is for you.......We WON'T be back ever.........

<Author>coffee12Toronto
<Content>Awesome We were 10 in our group. 6 adults 4 teenagers. Arrived Dec 20 and stayed for 2 weeks. If you get into building 7, congrats, if you are willing to pay an addition $30US per night. We were in building 3, which was just fine. We spent the whole day at the beach/pool. The beach was beautiful, but not enough huts. All you need to do is get to the beach early by 6:30 to reserve your favourite hut. You might want to purchase soem cheasp beach towels at home to mark your spot on the beach if you can't get towels sometimes until 10:00 a.m. Rememeber staying at building 3 will put you overlooking or very close to the courtyard were there is lots of noise from bands...etc. Building 2 might be a better choice for those that like it quieter.Yes there was some noise with the garbage trucks, removing the old huts and bringing in new sand. Once completed the new beach area near building 7 was quite and tranquil.A must is to check out the adult only pool and bar. Very relaxing and quite.The fitness centre is next to the spa and theatre, my kids worked out every day with great equipment. Niece went to the spa for a treatment. Enjoy it. Son went golfing at Cocotal. Played as a junior for $90 US. We also took the Country Adventure tour. If you have back problems, don't go. The roads are full of pot holes. Countryside is beautiful and mountainous.The pool was very well maintained as were the grounds. If you hear negative posts about buildiing 10, be aware that this building should have been completed by the Christmas rush, but unfortunately it was not. I know that our tour contact, Antoine, did everything in his power to help those who travelled with Sunwing and were originally booked into building 10. The rooms were spacious and clean. The maids are a bit slow.Here's how it works with the beach towels, between 8-12 tickets for towels, between 12-4 towels for towels, after 4pm towels for tickets. The food was amazing, we got treated to 2 nights of lobster. Amazing. Our server, for breakfast and lunch at Windows was Angel. He really is a great guy and helps you with your Spanish. There is a 24 hour bar and food service down by the beach. Unfortunately, there was one incident were we couldn't get any food after midnight, but a little palm greasing goes a long way. Finally, take lots of $1 bills to tip the servers and other staff. Take enough US cash with you. Don't pay by credit card, you will charged an extra %. We wanted to pay for golf by credit card and were told that it costs $90 US which, converted to pesos was 3240. Now when I get my MC bill it will be converted to Canadain so now I weill be charged $112.00 for a round of golf( hey aren't the dollars on par??). Rent the safe for 18.00 we paid for 2 weeks and keep your US cash there. You should take at least 600.00 US to take advantage of the great tours available. For great value this is a good place. You should remeber that Oasis has just taken over this hotel and within another year or so it should be top notch. Make sure you visit your travel doctor before you go and don't rent a car too many pot holes- barter with the taxi drivers. Vendors in the courtyard 2-3 times per week. Don't pay full price- remember let them go to their lowest point, then offer half and walk, if they don't want to sell, there are lots of vendors with lots of merchandise.About 1/2 km from the hotel, there are vendors that used to be on the beach. And a little further down from the vendors is a mini market store, were you can purchase items without bartering, the staff is very friendly. Take personal items like immodium, tums ($12 US for a small bottle) and gravol, the hotel stores charge outrageously for these items.Have a great time- Cheers

<Author>lvsraber
<Content>Only Getting Better !!! Stayed at the Grand Oasis Dec. 9 -14th, this was our 10th trip to DR and our third to this resort, but when it was the Sunscape before. Things have only gotten better ! The room manager was wonderful ! We traveled with my cousin and his wife. We requested a room in the new building 7, third floor and ocean view. We were placed in rooms at the end of the building, facing the beach. There was a hottub on the deck outside. We were there the day tropical storm Olga hit, one of only three named storms ever in Dec. in 100 years, (our luck), but that day we filled the tub up outside, relaxed. The rooms in building 7 were breathtaking, we stayed at the Iberostar Bavaro the last two years,those were nice, but these were a step up. The food was great at all the resturants. The staff could not be nicer and always will to help. We used the new Spa for massage, very nice and relaxing. The new casino was a nice added feature. Caren, the room manager and her great personality, made a great trip that much better. If you get a chance look her up. She is a great asset to the resort ! We are already making plans to return this Dec. and stay at the new resort next to the Grand Oasis, the Grand Oasis Bavaro Suites. Would recommend this resort to all. You can't go wrong.

<Author>xdreduardx
<Content>Great! Normally I go to Cancun.My wife convinced me to go to an all inclusive so off we went to DR Oasis.Beach: Excellent. Reefs outside break waves so you don't have large waves and you can swim without worrying about undertow (yes, I do worry about it, since somebody I know died that way). I swam every day.Guests: Mostly Europeans  Canadians. Kid friendly but things to do for adults. Not a heavy singles scene, no spring breakers.Food: Loved it. That was my biggest beef with the previous all inclusive. I live in NYC and love good food. The buffet was excellent. The tea was perfect.Rooms: Large, everything worked, new. Some of the rooms can be dark (if between buildings).Entertainment: Daily show. Off-off-off-off-off Broadway, but fun.Go to Michael Jackson. Dance lessons: Bachata, Merengue  The Oasis Club Dance. Ping-pong, tennis.Gym: Dumbells, a universal type machine, some stationary bikes. Not bad at all.Safety: No probs, you are in the jungle, nothing around you, felt safe.Previous experience: mostly Cancun, Acapulco, Bahamas, Florida (never again), Barbados.Night life: A wonderful bar outside, small but neat casino, disco and piano bar.Staff: Fun bunch. No attitude. Just remember: you are on vacation and the Dominican 5 minutes is 1/2 hour in real time.Overall: I recommend it strongly including to my father.

<Author>shoegal85
<Content>Just ok... Nothing great I stayed at the GOPC from Dec 29 - Jan 5. The weather was pretty poor. I was in Punta Cana last April and did not have one ounce of rain. This week it rained 4 /7 days and when it wasn't raining it was either cloudy or very windy. I guess Dec is their rainy season.... Now for the review of the resort:CHECK IN / CHECK OUT: Prior to the trip, I called the resort twice to ask if I could check-in early and both tiems they said yes, check in at noon would be no problem. My partner and I arrived at the resort at 1pm and our room wasn't ready. We waited until 4pm. Not really a big issue though - we dropped our luggage at the front, grabbed some lunch and explored the resort.Checking out was a breeze. No problem.GROUNDS:The grounds were exceptionally clean and well kept. We always saw employees of the resort working hard up keeping the gardens, or picking up any trash along the resort. RESORT:The resort is nice, however I think it looks much better in pictures. The resort is well laid out, however some of the rooms/buildings look run down and in need of some serious renos.PEOPLE/ SERVICES:Some of the staff were friendly, however we found that most were not. We found that we did not get what we wanted until we threw some money at the situation. As mentioned by previous guests, most of the employees do not speak English. Our maid only knew three english words: clean, coke and thank you.The staff in the Amercian Grill (one of the restaurants) were terrible. We (along with other guests) tried to order pizza at 11pm and they got very annoyed. They were also so slow and extremely lazy. It took over 45 minutes for us, and others, to receive our pizza or burgers. ALso, during checkout, we randomly overheard two of the reception staff talking about how two of the American Grill staff were fired last Friday. I wasn't surprised at all. They were horrible. FOOD:My partner and I found the food to be almost terrible, but I knew other people who found it to be ok. I found like most of the resort, the food catered mostly to Eastern European tastes. I also was extremely unimpressed with the food times. If you missed breakfast, it was 2 hours until lunch, and if you missed lunch it was 3 hours until dinner. The variety of food was also pretty poor. Same thing everyday it seemed.BEACH:The beach was great. However, I previously stayed at the Princess and the beach there was much better. Sand was much cleaner and the water was much calmer. If beach condition / location is very important to you, I would strongly advise that you book else where as this resort is right next to a marina, which means there are constantly numerous boats in the water, making noise and creating large waves. Also, there was a lot of seaweed that was constantly being washed up on shore. Some guests have said that you need to reserve a beach chair by 6am or 7am. We did not find this to be true at all. We were there during a very busy time of the year, and we never had any trouble finding beach chairs around 11am, 1pm 2pm or later. ROOM:We stayed in room 7201, the master junior suites. It was a very large spacious room with a jaccuzi. The only issue we had with the room was that it had a very strong musty/mold smell the entire week and our fridge did not work at all. Also, on the first day our a/c did not work, however we called front desk and someone was up within a few hours and it was fixed.OTHER: One poster mentioned that many ppl harassed him/her about buying time shares. We did not have one person approach us about this during the entire trip. However, be very careful about the vendors on the resort. They are EXTREMLY pushy and they try to rip you off. I wanted to buy a necklace and the man told me it would be $85 because it was a rare dominican stone. I laughed at him and told him I would give him $10. He said ok. When they give you a price for something, divide that number by at least 4 (seriously) and that should bring the price down to a reasonable number.OVERALL: I woudln't return to the GOPC. I did not like how the resort catered almost exclusively to Europeans, and I did not like the beach location of the resort. The food was also almost inedible for my partner and I.  
<Date>Jan 6, 2008

<Author>jojosask
<Content>Buyer Beware Our stay at grand Oasis was okay but still disappointing. We are a middle income middle aged couple who have travelled to a handfull of sunny desinations. I would only give a very honest and frank review.We lucked out on our rooms bigtime. I cant tell you the nightmares I was hearing from other canadians about thier accomodations. One poor family even got put in the workers quarters and they had booked a suite. They were devistated....finally moved on the forth day of thierstay.Another family who booked suites got the brand new building 9....it wasnt a suite,they were on the ground floor and thier patio door didntlock, no shower curtain, no working tv, no safe...on and on.We stayed in building one where 20 times a day you had to get past thevendors who were relentless.We left a tip as well as a gift everday for our maid....this got us nobath towels or faceclothes on most days.The room was big but the furniture delapitated.....at least it was clean.The vacation club people are also to be wary of.We were told we could see the new suites and an offical tour only to have waisted 3 hours and to be hit with a 14,000 dollar proposition to buy in, followed with anger when no was our reply. Real shady characters I can assure you.The food was good for the most part.We couldnt get a reservation at the itialian,we ate twice at american grill and it was excellent. The grounds were immaculate, the bar service down right rude at times, butmost often decent.The beach and pools were nice but aquiring a cabanna on the beach onlyhappened for us on one cloudy day.Pool loungers were also a hot commodity and were hard to get.Bring your own towels they really helped with the shortage of bath towels and less worry about the hotel towels.Forget snorkling off the beach...the water to choppy and lots of seaweed. They did keep the beach looking chean however.All I can say is buyer beware...maybe stay somewhere you will be sure to get what you booked.  
<Date>Jan 5, 2008
