<Author>StubbleJumper
<Content>A week in the DR Let me tell you a little bit about the trip. The flight down there waswith Zoom. It was a non-stop 7 hour (give or take) flight. They servedus okay food and showed three movies to pass the time. The airport in Punta Cana is really small but the neat thing about it is its a thatched roof building with very few walls! Its all open. We took the shuttle bus that was arranged for the different resorts by Sunwing. It worked out really well because we were the first stop.The resort itself was very nice. The lobby, the pool, the grounds werein great shape. The rooms were a little shabby. Our room was clean andcomfortable but nothing special. We noticed little things like peeling paint and rust but with the humidity down there its to be expected. The only thing that confused us was how to get the power to work in the room. When we got there there was one lamp on in the room.We tried the other lights, the TV, the hair drier and nothing would work. Eventually we figured out that you had to put your room card in this little slot by the door. I guess they do that so people don't leave lights and the AC on all day. Once you pull that card out, the lights turn off in about 5 minutes. Everybody says to tip the maid andyou'd get something a little extra in your room but we found the exactopposite. The more we tipped the less we got. In fact on one day when we left $5 they TOOK beer from our fridge!! The next day we left $2 and we got more beer and more towels. I don't get it. The beach was FANTASTIC! White sand that was so fine it was like baking powder. The water in front of our resort was a little weedy on some days but not too bad. A 20 minute walk up from our resort was the best. The ocean was completely weed free the bottom was all soft sand and the water was warm and a brilliant blue. The food was nothing remarkable. It was what we had expected. The buffet had a pretty good variety each day. For the most part it consisted of pasta, rice and various meats (chicken, beef or pork). There were seafood dishes but I stayed away because that's just not my thing. The a la carte restaurants were okay, on par with some of the chain restaurants we have here. The staff at the resort were for the most part really friendly with the exception of Osiris at the front desk. He was a bit of a crank. We didn't really do many of the activities that they offered (aerobics, dance lessons, volleyball, etc) so we didn't talk much to the activities staff. The bar tenders seemed to be friendly for the most part. We tipped a little bit but it never seem to have any effecton the level of service that we got. We went on a snorkelling tour and it was worth every penny! Neither ofus had either been snorkelling so we have nothing to compare it to butit was a lot of fun. I was a little anxious because I swim like I'm wearing cement shoes, so jumping off the side of boat in the middle of the ocean a couple of miles from shore was a little scary. They give you a floatation device that goes around your waist so everythingwas good. Once I overcame the instinct to hold my breath when my head was under the water I quickly got the hang of snorkelling. You don't need to be a strong swimmer at all. They have a pen that is about 30 feet x 30 feet that you snorkel in. In this pen there about 15 string rays 6 nurse sharks and various other fish. It was amazing! After snorkelling they took on a little cruise along the shore to a natural pool that was about 5 feet deep and they served us drinks in the ocean. The weather was great. It did rain a couple of times but they were short lived showers. You can see the weather coming in from the ocean so you have ample time to head for dry ground. After 10-20 minutes of hard rain the sunshine would return. The temperature never changed much. It was always between 25-30 degrees. It was an awesome week spent lying on the beach, reading, napping and relaxing.  
<Date>Jan 4, 2008

<Author>VMToronto
<Content>Great vacation We were in Grand Oasis Punta Cana from 19th Dec. 2007 to 26th Dec. 2007. We had a great time and my daughter who is 16 years old wants to go to the same place again.We liked our room (# 3130); it was next to the beach and the pool. Everything was very close by and in couple of days we feel safe to send my daughter to the room alone even. Hotel and surroundings were clean all the time.We really enjoyed all restaurants and food specially seafood including lobsters on Christmas even. We eat Lobsters lot but never had delicious Lobsters like that. My kids freely went to the beach restaurant and picked what they wanted during the day. Non-alcoholic drinks were very good. I never forget the Christmas Eve dinner at Windows.We enjoyed all activities: Table-tennis and Tennis (they have rackets), bike rides (with no helmets.. my son was not comfortable with it, but he did it) in the morning (thanks for the guide... sorry I forgot his name) especially with my 8 years old son. My kids and husband spend lot of time near the Pool table and thanks to Carmen for her kind smile and support all the time. It was an open and safe place for kids even.Except one day always our room was clean. Did not see any bug. Air-conditioner  iron worked fine. It was an ordinary hotel room but I liked the size. We took the Safari through Sunwing and it was a day long trip. I wish it was shorter than that. They could take us to a place for horse riding closer to the place we went. We saw the same thing on the way and it will be nice to organize this trip couple of hours less than now. They took us to a souvenir shop but prices were very high. I bought a mermaid wood statue from one of the vendors in the resort for US $ 60, but this shop said similar one is US $ 450 (finally he came down to US $ 200). All the fancy jewellery and cigars also were very expensive there. Sunwing should take us to a reasonable store for shopping. Be careful for buying things from this store.I learned to bargain during my holidays and got couple of good deals. If they say US $ 30 then ask it for US $ 5. I bought lot from Miguel and he bought things from the city even for my request.We tipped couple people but they were not expecting from us. I gave couple of Canadian pens and notes pads too. Everyone was nice, very polite and always smiling. Some could not speak English but we did not have any problem.I loved the coffee they make at the Beach Bar. I asked them to use a bigger cup and enjoyed every late night.We did Para Sailing, Kayak, Catamaran (thanks for the guy who trained my husband) and enjoyed all. We did not find hard time to find chairs in the beach because my husband or I went to the beach around 8 am and reserved them for the family (like others do).We enjoyed dance and water aerobics lessons at the pool during noon.Animation team always worked hard with kids and adults to make them happy. On 25th Dec. Santa arrived by motor boat and gave gifts to every kid.We had couple of disappointments too. - We want to get more US $ (they advised us not to use our Credit Cards) but there was no Bank Machine. Front Desk also did not have enough cash. They asked us to get a taxi and go to a bank. But my husband walked to another resort and got it done.- Somehow my husband lost his wrist-watch. I complained it to the front desk and they noted it. That was it. I do not think they do anything to find something you lost. There is no Lost and Found place or no inquiry with the staff (especially maids).- Most of Night Shows were great for adults and kids. But, there was one show not good for kids. These shows should suitable for the whole family because we have to go there with our kids at night.I would like to recommend this resort to anyone who likes food, relaxation and other extra activities during a vacation.

<Author>Shorty005
<Content>Not 5 Star! I recently got back from this hotel on the 21st December 2007 after a weeks stay in what i thought would be a 5 star hotel. Don't get me wrong it was well worth what we paid. However, WARNING! I advise that if you are travelling from the UK you DO NOT upgrade your room through your travel agent. Wait until you get there. I had set my heart on a room with a jacuzi and was utterly disappointed. We booked through the agent and paid an extra 300 dollars only to find that when we got there we had been upgraded to the Deluxe Suite which was in building 2 not 7. After enquiring at reception we could have paid that amount at the reception for the room we wanted however, although we had already paid one this was a standard upgrade charge so then would have to pay again! AS IF IM MADE OF MONEY! anyway after that we got into a room in building 2. It was adequate! the air con was an absolute god send. The alcohol was absolutely disgusting, i hardly drank anything all week. The food i would say was ok. Breakfast had a very good choice and was to a good standard and the evening meals were ok! didn't get ill thank god! As for the beach, it was lovely. However, be careful as you will continually be hassled everywhere on this resort by shop owners, time share guys, watersports guys etc! They drove me in sane! Also watch out for the local market people that appear at the resort twice a week! just dont even look, i spent half an hour getting very stressed trying to tell them that i WAS NOT going to pay 150 dollars for a stone necklace! They think your stupid! All in all i had a wonderful time here due to the fact that we booked on lots of excursions. Therefore, not spending much time on the resort. (Definately do the Outback Safari its a fantastic day out. Just hope you dont go on a day when there is a tropical storm like we did. ) If you go with an open mind you will love it here, just don expect the rooms to be anything like the pictures. The food also looks like its from a glossy magazine! How WRONG!! Take money with you and do the trips! And last but most importantly if any one approaches you JUST SAY NO!  
<Date>Jan 4, 2008

<Author>chumzy
<Content>Magnificent Time at Grand Oasis Punta Cana, Domenican Republic Stayed at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana from December 19-25, 2007. There was nine of us on this trip, us being middle aged with our children, some in their teens and some in their 20's.Travelled from Toronto on Sunwing, which we really enjoyed. They had a champagne dinner with great food. Now let me tell you about the resort, with feedback from the other eight people that accompanied me.Food: Was very good, fresh, and very tasty compared to some of the other resorts we have stayed at. No one got sick, not even heartburn. There was a good variety with always great foods that we loved to eat. We are of Portuguese descent, and there was fresh Passion Fruit there, Wow, was that a bonus. With a small tip, we got extra passion fruit during our stay.Service: Excellence with a smile. As i have posted in my past reviews, I love the Domenican People. They are most humble and present themselves very well. They are very appreciative of any tips you give them, but i never got the impression that someone was serving better to get a tip. Even if we didn't tip them, we received excellent service. Ok, so once in a while they would forget to bring us our drink, but i could see that they were extremely busy. It wasn't because of tips. Not at this resort anyways. But we did tip a waiter the night before Christmas Eve at one of the A La Carte Restaurants. He remembered us on Chrismas Eve, and we ate outside at one of the best table available. We also needed help with our safe, as it wasn't working, and they came to help us within minutes.Excellent Service at Front Desk as well.Beach: Weather was Gorgeous thoughout our trip. The only annoying thing was the first 2 days, there were trucks passing back and forth on the beach. Apparently, there were a few huts that were demolished and had to move out, so these trucks were carrying all the garbage and wood from the left of our resort. It was a nuisance, but only lasted 2 days or so, and that was it.A nasty storm had passed by there a few days before we arrived, so there were remnants from the palm trees in the ocean. It was not seaweed as some travellers have mentioned. For most part, the water was pretty clean, no complaints. Animation Staff: Although we didn't travel with small children, I found that the Animation Team was Fantastic. There is a kids club there, and if you have small children, this is the place to be.They spend a lot of time with the children, and even put them on stage doing either a little fashion show or other things.Some special Animation Staff that we met were Pedro, Anthony, Desiderio, Yety, Orchidia (which i met at Majestic Colonial in April), she is now at this resort, was so nice to see her again.They work so hard to keep all the visitors happy, congrats to you all for making our stay such an enjoyable one.We took the Safari ride into the country for one whole day. We really enoyed it. Got to see how the poor people live. We took clothes, toiletries, hats, gum and candy to all the different children. Stopped for lunch at a Domenican home, went horseback riding on their farm. Saw how they make the coffee beans, and also visited a sugar cane site. It was a lot of fun for 75 U.S. dollars a person, worth the trip really. Stopped by Macao Beach on the way back.There is a casino on this resort, as well as a Disco. There are vendors with small huts on the resort, which you can really bargain with when buying jewelry etc. Work with them down to half and you will have a deal. They are very nice and well mannered. Overall, We all loved this resort. Didn't see any bugs at all.There were a couple of mosquito bites, but you get that everywhere.Overall, we had a great time at this resort, and would recommend it to anyone. It was clean, great people, good food.Would go back in a heartbeat.Thank You Trip Advisor, for allowing me to post this honest review.  
<Date>Jan 3, 2008

<Author>vaxmastraveler
<Content>Grand Oasis? Property does not meet its name We arrived at the Grand Oasis the 22nd of December for 7 days. We were a party of 18. Fortunately, we booked a room in building 7 and obtained a room on the 3rd floor with an ocean front view. The room was large with a king size bed and sitting area. 2 jacuzzi tubs- 1 in the room and 1 on the outside deck. The room was clean except the pillow cases smelt like mildew and the maid service was late in the afternoon around 4 pm. One day, no one came and we had them clean the room while we were at dinner. The rest of the party stayed in building 4. The halls were dirty, rooms were old (needs updating) and the hot water was not plentiful.Internet - Not that you go to a resort to work, some of us have to - If you stay in building 7, there is a room opposite the elevator that has a large t.v., couches and 2 computers with free internet access. We were originally told that we would have internet access available in the room; there is none. The property has an internet room between the lobby and casino with only 2 computers that is for a fee for service. The front desk will not let you know of the free service in building 7 when you check in. I had to ask for the manager until the front desk finally told me about the room in building 7. The front desk help is good at deflecting requests.Food - The food is terrible. We have been to the Club Med in Punta Cana twice. While Club Med food is not spectacular, it was 5 star compared to the food served at the Grand Oasis. While there were multiple choices, I do not want to see another hamburger for a while after 6 straight days of eating them at lunch. I had a hot dog the final day. These were the only things that were edible. For Dinner, stay away from Windows cafeteria and make reservations in the Italian or Tex Mex restaurants. You order off a menu and are served. The Italian restaurant requires men to wear pants. I could not understand if i could eat in shorts at Mortons in Puerto Rico, why i would have to wear long pants at a restuarant at a resort that was no where near the quality of an Olive Garden.Beach - the water was dirty with debri washing on to the shore. We went on a fishing trip on the Atlantic side of the island and the water was clear and appealing to swim in. There was plenty of seating. The saving of seats was just as obnoxious as any other Carribean resort i have stayed. On 2 occaision around 9 am, we had to wait for towels. I would never return to the Grand Oasis unless they made great strides in the food. I could deal with the other issues. It is a trade off, if you want a cheap vacation to get a sun tan the place may be for you. If food is important, try another place.  
<Date>Dec 31, 2007

<Author>Cindy39
<Content>Needs Updating, Great Weather! We just returned from a Christmas vacation at this resort. We arrived on Dec. 20th and returned on Dec. 27th. When we arrived, we were amazed at all the Christmas decorations. Although it was our first family trip away over the Christmas season, the atmosphere was certainly festive. We have travelled to Punta Cana 4 other times prior and found that this resort was by far the most in need of upgrading. ROOM: We stayed in Building 5 and found that the first room we were assigned had bed bugs jumping on the sheets when we first pulled down the covers. The TV and the air-conditioning were inoperable as well as the mini-fridge. We immediately attended the front desk and they were able to relocate us to another room. Great customer service in this regard. We viewed two rooms before we found one that had operable air conditioning. We did see cockroaches, they were HUGE! FOOD: I have read several reviews that the food was awesome?not according to our family. We aren't too picky but out of our group of 10, we were definitely disappointed with the food. We recommend the Italian and the American Grill. Christmas Eve was rather interesting! The resort had two sittings in the buffet restaurant (Windows) with a very expanded menu of lobster, roast beef, pork, etc. The line-ups in the buffet were long and the festive cheer was not too positive. People were yelling at others for jumping the line. There wasn't much Christmas cheer in those line ups! We are still talking about Christmas Eve dinner, it certainly was different!SERVICE: The best service I have ever received in any of the resorts I have been to! I don't know if they brought in extra staff for the holiday season but I did not have to wait for a drink at the bar, never had to wait for beach towels, always had hot water for showers with our room always stocked with bath towels. Service was awesome!BEACH: The construction that you might have read in a review earlier was just finishing up when we arrived. We did see the heavy machinery but all was removed by Dec. 22nd. The staff were constantly raking the beach and you still see them using their wheelbarrals to dump their contents on the other side of the towel building but I found them to be aware of pictures being taken. They are hard workers! The availability of beach chairs is no different then any other resort. We usually were out getting chairs at 8:00 a.m. and there was slim pickins but I wouldn't leave it much later to get them. We found that people were dropping off their towels the night before, especially for the umbrellas. We had fun with those people?moving their stuff to the other end of the beach. Grow up people, at least play the game in the morning with the rest of the guests!OVERALL: Would rate it a 3 star and would definitely not return to this resort, mainly due to state of rooms and food. There are plenty of resorts to try in Punta Cana.Cindy, Waterdown, ON

<Author>Diamondcutie
<Content>Beware Time share hawkers everywhere! This was the third time for my family to visit this resort. We were here in April 2006 and in June 2007. Things have changed since then. Our trip was December 11th to December 25th, 2007. When we were there before, it was an All Inclusive resort only. There was one set of wrist bands worn. Now you can see yellow, white, fusia and blue bands being worn by vacationers. The Bad:BEWARE :The 'time share' people VACATION CLUB were a real pain in the butt with their hard sell. They stand usually in threes at any and all strategic points on the resort meaning every time you want to get something to eat you get harrassed by them. They also chase anyone and everyone down on the beach area.They hang out in the lobby as well. In the end, my family had to be a bit rude and asked them to stop the blah blah blahs! We would have to shut our eyes on the beach and pretend to be asleep to avoid them many times. We were used to the banana boat ride, parasail ride, glass bottom ride, tube ride vendors. We also got used to the massage and hair braiding ladies. Also the selling of disco nights out of the resort. We tolerated a lot of harassment that was very stressful on a constant basis.  There was a great deal of construction going on when we were there and this totally inconvenienced everyone on the beach. Children couldn't build their sand castles without dump trucks, garbage trucks, pick up trucks, front end loaders, motorcycles, wheel barrels etc. going by on a constant basis. This was ridiculous. We told our Sunwing representative about this and he confirmed that there were many complaints about this, too. The beach is supposed to be protected by the hotel and is not a public beach where every vehicle can travel up and down on a constant basis with their black fumes erupting whenever they went by. The vehicles honked their horns for people to move out of THEIR WAY. People had to move their chairs or else get run over. Also, coming back to Punta Cana Airport at Security we had two telescopic umbrellas taken from us as they were considered a weapon by the Dominicans. Never heard that one before. They were nice new ones, too. Also, not metal but plastic with nothing pointy or heavy about them. We strolled by to take a peak on their whereabouts and they had disappeared within 5 minutes. We had a pen taken also. It was a good one. They let us keep a cheap hotel one. Many women lost their lipsticks as they were considered a threat also. But they would pick and choose if they liked or disliked the brand name, colour or the condition of your makeup to whether they would keep them or not. We had to pay $72 cash for they CLAIMED that our baggage was overweight. We were underweight when we left Toronto Airport and did not purchase anything. Also, we used up a lot of product within the 2 weeks that we were there, so we should not have been overweight. The people behind us had to pay $130 and they weighed their luggage at the gym before leaving to the airport and thought that they were okay as well. There were two girls behind us who had to pay $300 for being overweight as well. They were nicely dressed and their suitcases didn't look very big either. They had no cash on them. They offered to use their Visa card to pay the extra cost but the airport wouldn't take it. They had to go back through the airport to find a debit machine as Security wanted cash. There were many other people that we spoke to who also got dinged for supposed being overweight with their luggage. We feel that we were TAKEN as far as this goes. Some people were foolish enough to have purchased rum at the resort and had the bottles in their carry on luggage. Well, these definitely were taken away, but they let them keep their resort water bottles and walk through with them to board the plane.  The whole picking and choosing and making up the rules on what was allowed and what was not allowed by Security made us very angry and others felt the same way, too. My advise is to make sure that you have a lot of cash when you return through Customs. Also, U.S.. or Dominican dollars. They do not accept Canadian cash at the Airport. Other:Food is very good, resort is relatively clean, nightly entertainment is good, but the raunchy club dance gets old fast-why must the animation crew always dance like they're fornicating, even in front of the children. The canned songs they play have disgusting lyrics, not appropriate for a family vacation spot.The karaoke bar was supposed to open 6 days a week, but in 14 days it was only operational 3 times. We were told it was because no one came in, but that was completely untrue, many people came and went because it wasn't set up. No, I would not go back, the time share hawkers are too intrusive, a relaxing family-friendly vacation spot this is not.  
<Date>Dec 27, 2007

<Author>Briggitte_37_Canada
<Content>Wonderful  We stayed at this resort from November 26th to December 3rd. This was our 2nd time to Punta Cana. The air port was very cute, and very fast processing us. We were taken by a van to the GOPC about a 25 minutes drive away. Check in was fast and efficient. Rooms:We were in Building 5 - corner unit on 2nd floor with ocean view. Our room was very clean and the mini fridge worked just fine. The maids were very helpful, and always left us a little flower and neat design with towels and bed comforter. Room was always clean. Food:Loved the food! Don't know what all the complaints were about from other reviewers, as I found the food to more than acceptable and plentful. Sometimes buffet hot items could have been a little hotter, but hey, they are cooking for hundreds of people.We ate at the American Grill 2 times, once by reservation and the 2nd by invite from Roberto (manager), service was great, and they have the best steak I've ever had outside of Canada! Enjoyed the Italian restaurant but they do kind of rush you in and out. - not sure why as there were always several empty tables. You could eat at the specialty restaurants as many times as you wanted, just make the reservation! We never ate at the sea food restaurant as it was outdoors by the beach and due to the regular breeze on the beach we thought that our dinner would cool off to fast. We spent several of our late afternoons at the adult pool with Anthony the bartender....too much fun. Be warned though, the construction of the Cameleon next door to the GOPC is still ongoing and there is lots of sawdust floating in the air and on the chairs. We met some wonderful people who were celebrating Aunt Diane's 75th Birthday - truely lovey people and great company!The shows were pretty much what you would expect from an all-inclusive HOWEVER the Michael Jackson show was AMAZING!!! This production is put on by an outside company and its like being at an actual MJ concert! This group of 16 dancers is really spectacular and well worth the viewing on a Saturday night! It was one of the best parts of this trip.Please email if you have any questions. As I said we relaxed on this trip so we did not take any excursions outside of the resort.Briggitte  
<Date>Dec 13, 2007

<Author>fadia
<Content>Much neede rest and relaxation!! We have just returned from a week at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana. We arrived Nov. 30th to a beautiful sunny day. The air port was very cute, and very fast processing us. We were taken by a van to the GOPC about a 20 minutes drive. Check in was fast and efficient. Please remember that I am not an experienced traveler, one of the people we went with was and did not share the same perception of the resort as I did.Rooms Bldg 3 Room 3106:Found our room to be very clean, the decor was average, but we only slept there any way so that is not a big concern. It could us a bit of a touch up, and those we traveled with found it to be a little below what they are used to. The tv didn't work, we never called as we didn't watch it, we may have called if we had terrible weather, but that was not the case.The coffee in the room was amazing. We were on the ground floor, and didn't find the room musty at all. We also did not see any little critters. The maids were very helpful, and always left us a little flower and neat design with towels and bed comforter. Room was always clean. Food:Wow, loved the food! Don't know what all the complaints were about earlier, as I found the food to be fab. Ate at the American Grill, service was great, food also very good. The buffet was wonderful and so were the staff, always smiling, chatting and singing!!! Loved it, miss Angel already!! Bread and cheese were wonderful, pasta bar good, and all the fresh salads and fruits were enough to keep me going and more!! I personally did not enjoy the wine, and I guess that would be my most disappointing part of the holiday. You could order bottles from a special menu, but our group were not big drinkers and split between red and white, so we only ordered one our whole trip.Loved the Italian restaurant and we ate there three times through out our stay. You could eat at the specialty restaurants as many times as you wanted!!! We never ate at the sea food restaurant as that didn't appeal to those we traveled with. There was a beach grill, beach buffet at lunch...also enjolyed.The bar staff were great! We went to all the bars but the swim up one. We hung at the beach most of the time. Chairs were easy to access, shade was hard to come by. Beach was beautiful., Water was warm.Excursion:The country safari was our excursion. Loved this,,left at 8:00 am returned at 6:30 pm. Long day in the beautiful country side of the Dominican Republic, the mountains, rice fields, plantations along the way kept me in awe. We stopped at a school where we met the children and were able to leave a donation for the school that would go towards what was needed (breakfast, paper, pencils supplies etc) then to a farm house, met the family and saw their home. We then went to the plantation for lunch, and to enjoy a 20 minute horse back ride, learned how to make coco, coffee, and had lots of laughs!! Our tour rep Antoine was great!! We then saw the sugar cane, went to watch cigars being made and then stopped at a beach for some fresh coconut juice!! The county is truly spectacular!! And the Dominican people very kind and helpful!The disco was fun, the shows were great! The grounds were beautiful! The entertainment staff were fun, and very energetic. Time went by so fast.I had a chance to meet Mike F. from this forum which was an honour, thank you for going out of your way to meet with us!!!!!!I only missed the mojitos, and the sangarias, as they did not make them here!I would definitely return to this resort, and would hope to see the same staff there!!Ps no problems at all with the Spanish English thing!!!!! Everyone tried their best, and were much better than we were!!! and taught us a few things along the way. I hope to learn how to connect my camera to the computer soon and will see if I can post some pics then! I won't bore you with another review....unless I remember things I am forgetting today.If you do get a chance to go please remember to take some donations with you, they are truly appreciated, and there are some people from this post that can help get them where they need to go!!!Any questions please shoot!Oh they were still working on the Cameleon next door to the GOPC, we didn't use the adult pool, because you could hear a bit of the construction, and I just need time to rest the mind!! They seemed to be working on it quite late at night also. Don't know when they are going to be done but when i enquired I was told in 3 weeks, before Christmas!!! It is booked for Christmas!!!!!Hope I didn't ramble on too long!!Cheers Fadia  
<Date>Dec 12, 2007

<Author>suziebabe
<Content>What a fantastic hotel My husband and I arrived at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana on Ocober 39th 2007 for 2 weeks. Having read reviews before we went we were not sure if we had done the right thing - but WOW. I really do not know what some people expect. We could not fault it.The setting is fab. Right on the beach with a lovely pool area. Plenty of sunbeds all over and very good water sports.The food - well I really cannot say much as it was all EXCELLENT. You can eat 24 hours a day, - a buffet breakfast in the main restaurant or on the sea front which we did every day as it was so wonderful, snacks on the beach during the day and buffet at lunch on the beach or in the restaurant. Some days there was a party by the pool with such as paella cooked in front of you. In the evening a different theme each night in the main buffet restaurant with so much choice of cooked meals or cooked in front of you, or there was A La Carte - we tried them all more than once and they were all fab. I cannot say we had a favourite as it was too hard to choose.All the staff are so friendly and work so hard. We had great fun trying out our Spanish and all the staff were always keen to help us.The drinks were always flowing and served with skill - even all the cocktails.If you just want lazy days on the beach or in the pool that is what you can have or you can take part in the entertainment - the Animation Team work extremely hard all day and night with many different ideas to keep we lazy tourists occupied, in fact they never stop with every language just rolling off the tongue.We did not try the Casino simply because after a few drinks and a lovely meal we had usually had enough but it did look great fun.We could have joined in more but were quite happy doing a little now and then.The Manager's cocktail party must be the best I have ever been to - a real friendly, homely atmosphere.The rooms are well air conditioned and very roomy with fresh coffee daily and a well stocked mini bar should you wish to sit in your room.The guest relations staff are also very helpful - nothing is too much trouble.The hotel is having an extension but I have to say we were not aware of any disturbance from the works. It will be nice to see it when it is finished.All in all we had a fantastic 2 weeks and are looking forward to returning. If you have a holiday booked at this hotel I cannot think that you would not have a good time.  
<Date>Dec 9, 2007

<Author>beachbum1165
<Content>Great Place We stayed at Oasis for a week and we were a party of 19 with 12 adults and 7 children ages 8-14. This was our 3rd time in 4 years and we still had a fantastic time. To begin with we were welcomed with drinks and cold cloths during check in which took no time at all. We stayed in building 2 and our back yard was on the lazy river, the kids enjoyed that so much especially in the late afternoon we would all sit out there and relax watching the kids play. The wait staff is as excellence as always. They are delightful and ready to accommodate you in any way. Always smiling with great sense of humors. The entertainment staff is just as wonderful they are great with the kids. Fernando, Spaghetti, Anthony, Koco Loco, Evelyn, just to name a few that were always fun and including us all in activities. Thank you to Caren for making our trip even more special. She is wonderful and really does a great job! The food was good always finding something to eat. Enjoyed the Italian and Tex Mex but the buffet was always a good choice especially for the kids. Our rooms were nice but they REALLY need updating, shower curtain had burn holes as did our sheets, toilet didn't flush right, our comforters were ripped, the pillows were really bad and the curtains in the room were dirty. But it didn't take away from our fun. All in all we had a great time and will be back next year!!

<Author>PuntaCanaLover2007
<Content>Absolutely Fantastic --- Always something to do A girlfriend and I recently took off for a week of sun and fun in the Dominican, leaving our husbands and her children at home for a girl's week away.There is absolutely nothing negative that I can say about the premises -- they were immaculate, we stayed in the newest, building number 7), the spa services were excellent (I had a massage, and my friend had braids put in her hair, they lasted 2 weeks.) I'd heard horror stories about other all inclusive places, and how the food is terrible .. not true in this case. I have a very sensitive stomach, and I was not sick at all. The food was fabulous, make sure that you try eating in the a la carte restaurants as well as at the buffets. The drinks were free flowing, make sure you go to the Umbrella Bar for Karaoke, and see Alcide, the bartender. All of the staff that we encountered were friendly, attentive, very accomodating, professional and eager to assist in any way possible. The animation team was fantastic, they worked tirelessly every day, leading water aerobics, putting on Latin dance lessons (meringue, pachata -- sp??), performing in nightly shows, then dancing with the guests of the resort late into night in the discos. I'm not much of a dancer, but they taught me how to dance, and we laughed so much every single day. To name names, Koco Loco, Desidero, Eduardo, Anthony, and Evelyn were lots of fun, and unbelievably talented. If you are thinking about a trip to the Dominican Republic, I would absolutely recommend this particular resort, and I would absolutely return without a second thought.  
<Date>Nov 28, 2007

<Author>PRIME_EVIL
<Content>Not bad, not great Stayed for a week. Food was just ok. Set up reservations in the speciality resturants. Windows (buffet style) was average but the staff was VERY friendly and helpful. Our room was a suite, HUGE room, very nice. No water problems except first night when the hot water heater went out, fixed the next morning. Nightly entertainment was ok but VERY annoying when you are trying to sleep (starts at 920pm, ends at 1130pm). LOUD!! Maids are very helpful especially when you leave a tip and a note of what you want (bottled water, beer, etc).  We were actually near that LOUD, annoying family of 19 who wrote a review below. Hard to get away from them, one drawback. You never know who you will end up near.BRING AN UMBRELLA!! It rained pretty hard at times and it isn't always ok to get wet. Beached are VERY sea-weedy. Beach towel exchange is strange and not very easy. Vendors prices can be talked down if you have the time and patience. Enjoyed our visit. Staff was very friendly. ORLANDO made GREAT burgers!!!  
<Date>Nov 28, 2007

<Author>OasisFan
<Content>Loved It! Our family of 19 visited this resort for the third time in 4 years. We were once again thrilled with our choice! Our party consisted of 7 children from 8 to 14 years old and 12 adults. I would like to begin with our rooms. All of us, except my in-laws, were located in building 2. The rooms were spacious and clean but could use a bit of renovations. The bathrooms especially. The shower ran extremely hot and had very little water pressure. The door frame needed repair and the tile looked old. The beds were quite comfy except for the worst lumpy pillows ever! The absolute best part was the pool in our backyard!! Our sliding door opened to a wonderful lazy river pool. The kids loved it! The food was so plentiful that an hour didn't go by without us eating something! We ate at all the restaurants and we had no problem finding something we liked at each one. The service staff was awesome! Every waiter, maid and bartender were always smiling. Communication never seemed to be a problem, actually we enjoyed trying to speak our minute amount of Spanish and get our point accross. I can't finish this review without mentioning the entertainment staff. Fernando, Coco Loco and the rest were the key to our fun. These men made us laugh and play every day. They got us to play: darts, bocci, water polo, volleyball and olympics constantly. Every night one of us stood on the stage to receive a diploma! All the shows were great! The Michael Jackson, Circus and the Staff shows were my personal favorite.None of this fun would have been possible without the extraordinary efforts from Caren. She could not have been more wonderful! She greeted us upon our arrival complete with a huge banner hanging in the lobby welcoming our family! Whatever we needed she was there to help! Not only was she there for us but we spoke to other families whom she gave her immediate attention to and serviced all of their needs. She is a warm and fun person to deal with and it was such a pleasure to see her once again. Our family can't wait to come back for many more visits to our favorite spot in The Dominican Republic!  
<Date>Nov 27, 2007

<Author>Tammy_Chris
<Content>Watch out for the beach vendors Well lets see..... It was my 2nd anniversary and after 2 calls to the resort to confirm a suite for my wife and I they over booked the resort.....This is only the begining toa bad start...Then after we got settled in our room not the suite we comfirmed on twice we got swarmed with pushy vendors that dont take no for an answer.After that the staff were helpful in getting us our suite only after 3 days of complaining at the front desk...and 2 days after my anniversary...After those 2 issues we had a wonderful time... The grounds were exceptionally clean and the bar staff were awesome...The buffet as good with a differnt theme every night and the ala carte well the are slow...the shows were good and the drinks even better..lol...The accomidations were average but the suites in building 7 are georgous...We hope to go back in April but not sure about this resort because of the pestering vendors.....Best Regards Chris

<Author>cocoloco99
<Content>Had a fantastic time - not 5* but more than acceptable! my friend and I are from the UK and just returned from a week at the grand oasis yesterday - had an absolutely great time. The hotel is huge and theres lots to do if you want to join in the fun run by the amination guys (resort entertainments team).Room - we were in building 6, very nice, spacious. Cable tv was a bit fuzzy and water was luke warm the whole time, figured out you have to let it run for 15 min first before you get it so its warm! sheets did smell a little manky on one day,Food - the main buffet restaurant is great, the food is VERY nice, freshly cooked, tasty and there is so much choice that im sure everyone can find something they like. Its also different everyday so you dont get boared. There is also a beach garden restaurant open all day for you to pop in off the beach and get some food - again, great food! there are 3 posher restaurnats, tex-mex, italian and seafood - we ate in all 3 and the food was fantastic - highly recommended. the beach garden kitchen is open 24 hours so they can knock you up a burger, pizza chips etc throughout the night. everything is safe to eat. we ate everything, salads, rare meat, seafood, fruit and drank the filtered water available everywhere and we both had no problems at all - its all fresh.Night life - the main pool bar is open till midnight, the beach bar is open 24 hours! theres also a piano/kareoke bar and a disco. the disco is ok, its best to go with a huge bunch of people and get drunk and just have a laugh, the dj played house/hip-hop when we asked him too so that was cool. This resort is very quiet though and mostly old people, couples and families. so its not the best place if you are young and want to party - we were the only people at the bars past 12pm! if its a quiet time, chilling with some nice cocktails then this is the palce for you.beach - beautiful, it does get a lot of seaweed washing up on it though (they do clean it daily). if you walk up the beach to the end, that part is much nicer and the water is amazing.entertainment: theres stuff going on at the resort all day that you can join in with, salsa lessons, pool games, aerobics, bingo, beach games. on the beach you can do non motorized watersports for FREE and also do parasailing, speedboat riding, snorkelling, horse riding, quad biking  more! - just haggle with the sales guys for a good price! theres a movie everynight at 7.30 and a show put on by the ents team everyday at 9.30 - we saw the spoof comedy show and a dance show which were so much fun!top tips: bring stuff to do if it rains, boardgames cards, a laptop for dvds etc - it did rain a bit on every day we were there and there isnt a lot to do when it rainsbring only US dollars, everything inc. trips is charged in dollars, you wont even need pesos or any other currency at allyou need to pay $10 when you enter at the airport and another $20 when you leave. Learn a few key prases in spanish, the staff dont speak much english - but we didnt speak spanish and got by just fine!DO go here if:* you want to chill out* you want a quiet relaxing time enjoying food and drink* you want to chill on a beautiful beach or relax by a great pool all day* you want a holiday tropical/spanish experience - salsa music is the backdrop here* you want to meet differnet poeple - mostly from Europe thoughDont go here if:* you have kids - there wasnt many other kids around so they may get bored* you are in your 20's or a group of singles - its full of old people and couples who go to bed early!* you want active night life - there isnt any in this resort, you just eat and sip cocktails until the early hours* your looking to meet people of the opposite sex! its not that kind of place* you only want to meet english poeople  listen to english music and expect that everyone should speak english. * you want to get out and about - theres not much life outside the holiday village. Overall - highly recommeneded resort if you want some RR, a great beach and are looking to relax and enjoy some time eating and drinking and being merry. Dont expect 5* service or standards its not - more like 3.5- 4* (uk official standards) but its very clean and is very nice!  
<Date>Nov 24, 2007

<Author>rebray
<Content>Had a great time! I just returned from a great week in DR. The beach was gorgeous and the staff was great. The food was ok. I was always able to find something I liked. Breakfast seemed to be the only meal that was short staffed. We often got our own silverware and coffee. We ate at Demario's (Italian) twice. The steak there was very good. The Tex-Mex was okay. I liked my meal, but another in my group ordered chicken kabobs that weren't cooked all the way. We stayed in building 5. The rooms were a bit dated and in need of some minor repairs, but the maids worked very hard to keep them clean and our fridge stocked. The night life was a bit too organized for my liking: show at 9:30, karaoke 10:30, discotheque 12:00. Most of the music was in Spanish. If you want to leave the resort for a day I recommend the Safari. We had a great time learning about the culture and the boogie boarding was a blast! For the money this resort is worth it. If you don't expect 5 star dining and you want to relax on the beach then you'll be just fine.  
<Date>Oct 31, 2007

<Author>gabbyindy
<Content>Enjoyed our stay-Need new chefs! Dining Services were 'slow' Sad thing is. This resort was recently purchased by Oasis a very popular hotel owned organization. I can only hope they hire good chefs and get new waiters in the Windows dining area. Worst service I ever had. I tipped one continually and he did work hard his name was David. The breakfast food was good. Rest of the waiters were rude. It just wasn't because they could speak our language. Mexican and Italian nights in Windows Dining area was great. You need to not wait till we go get our meals to offer a beverage. Please make sure your milk and OJ juices are really cold. They were always just chilled. GEtting refills were horrible. We gave that one up. Also, they were chort staffed in the Dr. and they had about two coffee pots in the whole dining area. Cock roach on ice cream bar....It was alive. Never ate the fruits or salads, or ice cream once after I saw one of those critters.Tex Mex was okay. But, don't say you have a steak house if there is no steaks. Seafood restaurant? Not the best. Also, they charged you $35 per pound of lobster should you desire to taste real seafood. Not good. Just not good management there.*On Thursday: Travel agents came and we saw shrimp, various food for the first time that was tasteful. Don't wait till travel agents come into your facilities to wine and dine those who worked hard all year and paid for this vacation like everyone else! Kudo's to Amy from St. Louis who woke me up on what was taking place!*We sat over at the pool bar. What I noticed was that we kept missing a bar tender. He would run into this room and close the door about half. I then discovered. He was running to the bar on the other side and waiting on others there. He had to work his tail off. This was not right. I felt sorry for him. He never would smile. I knew why. At first I labeled him as Mr. Personality until I realized his situation. It reminds me of local nursing homes who are always short staffed and nobody smiles because they are overworked and underpaid. Next, don't even get me started on the hounding sales people on the premises who try to sell you things. It made that part of the trip...Very sucky! They would sell more things if they left everyone alone. Your hotel MUST do something about this! Not only do you have a cock roach on your salad/ice cream bar....You have ants running after you when you do your best to get by those sales people. I have traveled many carribbean places. Salespeople will leave you alone the first time when you tell them no in an abrupt way. You might as well say...We were abused to no end with those vendors on the Oasis Property. They all need fired. They will only hurt your business. *I would come back if these things changed. Finally what really made the vacation nice. Meeting great people. (Vacationers) Our room was to die for. It was a master suite. It was clean. All of our housekeepers took great care of us. So, did the bell boys. The front desk people were fantastic. So was Luis. Refrigator had all that we wanted. I just didn't like the beer. The beach was gorgeous and clean. You must put a bar on the beach. Most newly renovated places have them. It was old running back and forth. The water was awesome. We always had loungers. The dive shack staff was awesome....Even though the girl and the dive guy told me not to touch those green berries...Luckily one didn't break open! LOL I was very curious. On our last day there...It was the beginning of a tropical depression. We laughed and laid under a thatched hut on loungers and slept and didn't get blowed away. It is all of what you make of it. *The beach being more of a European style didn't bother me. It was just the food. I didn't mean to be critical. I am in management and it does involve everything from customer service, business, housekeeping, food, programming and activities. I would like to come to Punta Cana again and experience better food, dining services and less Vendor Terrorists as I called it. I went to the Michael Jackson Show. It was good. It was outdated for most of us in the US because Michael does not perform here any more. He was awesome in his day. The dancers were great. *Nicolas was great at the Adult pool. It seemed like he was there 12 hours a day. He told us he would be off on Thursday. Another guy worked and sat and flirted with a vacationer and he even closed down at 4:50 pm for the day. Nicolas worked until atleast 7:00 pm daily. For the price, the beautiful weather and room....You couldn't beat it!

<Author>Abby83
<Content>Can't really complain I read so many reviews of this place before I went so thought I would add some comments for anyone else travelling to this resort....We stayed in Block 7, we upgraded direct through the hotel as it was much cheaper than doing it through Thompson. Although we emailed  confirmed our upgrade with the hotel the week before we travelled, our upgraded room had not been reserved for us when we arrived. Not a problem though as once we explained the problem we were given a room in Block 7. The room was very nice, well worth upgrading as I did get a look at the other rooms  am glad we had upgraded. We had a jacuzzi bath in the room as well as a big four poster bed  a lovely large walk in shower. We also had an ocean view if you leaned over the balcony a bit!! As said in previous reviews, the bathroom wasn't exactly ideal. The toilet had a frosted glass door  ours didn't shut properly so wasn't great when you got a bad tummy...which we both did get....The food was okay. The buffet did get a bit boring after two weeks but luckily as we went off peak there was no restrictions on how often we could eat in the a la carte restaurants. DO NOT eat in the American Grill!! The service was awful  the food wasn't good, we were both ill the day after we ate in there. The Da Marios restaurant was very nice, good selection on the menu  Marinero was also very nice  had a nice ocean/beach view from the restaurant.I thought the grounds of the hotel were beautiful  the area of the beach by Block 7 was nice  peaceful. You did need to get up faurly early to reserve sun loungers with some shade but also not a problem for us.The vendors on the beach  in the centre of the hotel were a real pain in the bum They wouldn't leave us alone  in the end we just had to take a route where we would avoid them!!Like I said, we were both ill for the duration of the holiday which did spoil it a bit as we had to watch what we were eating  drinking but I think that if you go to an all inclusive then you have to expect to get sick at some point.Although we won't be going back to the Dominican for a while as we went last year as well, I would go back to this hotel  I would recommend it as long as you don't expect The Ritz!Enjoy!!!

<Author>mak-oh
<Content>OK - but needs polishing Just returned from a week at the Grand Oasis. Stayed in one of the upgraded 'Master Jr. Suites' - really just a large room - in building 7. I believe this is the newest building. Good:Very nice room, good housekeeping service. If they were short on anything when making up the room, they would return with it later. Strange thing about the room is a little lack of privacy in the bathroom. The head was in a small cubicle with a frosted glass door like a shower. The shower is large, polished stone, and has a glass door. Both open on to the main room, so if one person uses the sink, you're a glass door away from the toilet. Not a major problem for us, but some might not care for it. Check-in and check-out was smooth and quick. The property is big enough, but not too big. Beach itself is clean with soft, white sand and calm clear waters. The weather was very warm, with afternoon rain most days, but plenty of sun earlier. Never swam in the main pool, although it looked nice and was large. The pool next to our building was very nice. Staff was helpful, and language wasn't a problem. (I know a smattering of Spanish, but you could get by without.)OK:Grounds are nice, but could use some cleaning and sprucing up. I thought it strange that the maids picked flowers from the grounds to put in the rooms. They would have looked better on the grounds! Food in buffet and theme restaurants was OK. We always found something to eat, but nothing that made us say, wow. The shops on the resort have mostly tourist merchandise - souvenirs, cigars, etc. - plus some snack food and HB products at the usual inflated prices.Poor:Service in the restaurants was inconsistent. One time you'd get immediate service, and the next you'd be asking for someone to bring water and take a drink order. There are shops on the beach adjacent to the resort. Supposedly this is because the beach is public. However, I didn't see any shops by the two resorts just north of ours. The vendors are constantly hawking their wares, even at the shops on the property. (Beach vendors aren't allowed on the property, but there are the time-share guys, cigar shop guys and a few others on the grounds.) It wears a little thin after the first day or so. We couldn't use our own phone cards. We bought a 20 min. card from the Apple rep. for $15 that worked. I think this is by design. Other calling methods are very expensive. I never got my ATT international cell phone to work. It detected two networks, but wouldn't connect.

<Author>wrldexplorer
<Content>Good Deal for The Price My boyfriend and I stayed at the Grand Oasis the first week in October. It was our first trip the the DR. I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews of this resort. We are not picky travelers in anyway and went with an open mind.The resort itself is rather small in comparison to others in Punta Cana but this was rather appreciated by us. The grounds were lovely and well maintained. I personally would not consider this a five star resort in anyway but for the price we paid, it was very comfortable. The room itself was large and spacious with a king size bed and a nice balcony. We were in building four in a corner room overlooking the main square. We had a chance to upgrade but knew we wouldn't be spending that much time in our room. The room was in need of updating, fresh paint, etc but was more than comfortable for sleeping, showering, etc. We had no issues with hot water and most of the time, it was too hot. While it is all inclusive, tipping goes a long way! I purchased a few small gifts to leave the maids as well as tips for wait staff, bartenders, etc. The maids were very appreciative and by the second day were leaving us cases of bottled water outside our room. One of our waiters in the buffet actually presented us with a bag of Dominican coffee to take home. We were very touched by his thoughtfulness.The food was surprisingly good to us. Neither of us felt sick at anytime during our stay. The desserts were unbelievable and the ala carte restaurants were excellent in our opinion. We never had a problem finding things we could eat. The drinks were not so good. The alcohol was all domestic and most of the mixed drinks were far too sweet to enjoy. The beer, Presidente, however was surprisingly good. Nightlife is rather non-existent.The beach was lovely and the water, though not perfectly clear was warm and inviting. We took our own snorkel equipment and were amazed to see several sea snakes in the seaweed beds just off shore.Now to the cons of this resort. There is definitely a language barrier if you are English speaking, both with staff and guests as most of the guests are from Spain, Italy, Germany, etc. A little Spanish knowledge goes a long way in communicating but we still felt somewhat isolated on the resort. We did meet a very lovely couple from Ireland and spent several days with them but overall, it was difficult to converse with others. For this reason, I much preferred my stays in Jamaica and Mexico.My only real beef with the resort was the number of vendors, time share people, and people selling excursions on the beach. The beach is the one place you want to relax and not be bothered and this was just not the case. We were lucky to have booked this trip during hurricane season as the resort was pretty empty. Though it rained a few days, the weather was generally lovely and we had no problem securing beach chairs. I could see this being a problem during peak season as the best chairs are reserved by rude guests the evening before. A side note, if you travel left of the beach passed the Allegro and Natura Park resorts, you will be treated by a long stretch of undeveloped beach where the water was clearer, very few guests except for those walking along the beach, and very pretty scenery could be found. If you snorkel here, just be careful as boats run along the shoreline pretty close.All in all, we had a lovely vacation though I personally would not book this resort again. We passed by other resorts further up the coast and was surprised at the shopping areas and restaurants outside of the resorts. You won't find that here as, other than excursions, there is nothing outside of the resort. For the price, it was a nice resort though I could not imagine staying for more than a week.A few more tips we found helpful on our trip. Bring plenty of one dollar bills for tipping. We didn't bring nearly enough and found that you could not change money anywhere on the resort. Get out on an island excursion if possible. Seeing the local Dominican people and how they live was a very eye opening experience that I wish our kids could have seen. I highly doubt they'd complain about being bored or not having the things they want after seeing the island. The people off the resort were very friendly and it was a pleasure to meet the locals. Also, as others have noted, if you try your luck in the casino, stay far, far away from the multi-ball roulette. They attempt to lure you into playing by offering a few free chips to use. We saw the scam almost immediately but several unlucky guests along the way lost thousands.  
<Date>Oct 17, 2007

<Author>2monkeys
<Content>Wonderful week at Grand Oasis We had a very enjoyable week at the Grand Oasis from Oct 6-13. We flew with Sunwing and both flights were smooth and on time.The resort is very easy to get around and the grounds were beautiful and well maintained.Our room was in building 7,third floor above the lazy river with ocean view. The room was beautiful with king bed, jacuzzi, fridge,clock radio, coffee maker,ceiling fan,iron,ironing board and a safe that was included at no additional charge. It had the most closet and cupboard space I have ever seen in a hotel room. The fridge was stocked daily with water,beer and soft drinks.The beach at G.O. was nice. Not the nicest I have seen but he ocean water was very calm and warm. The beach activities included volleyball,soccer, basketball, ping pong, darts shuffleboard, badminton, trampoline and kids club. They also had organized beach games and tournaments. The pool area had scheduled dance lessons and acqagym. They also have a daily agenda posted there of the daily events.There are three a-la-carts.The American Grill which is tex-mex, Dimario's/Italian, and the beach garden restaurant which changes to a-la-cart for the evening -Marinaro's/seafood. The only one we tried was the American Grill which we very much enjoyed and Jean our waiter provided excellent service.Windows buffet was quite large and air conditioned. It was split up into a smoking and non-smoking section. We thought the food presentation and quality was very good and perhaps the best we have encountered to date with this being our 4th four star all-inclusive. And for us ketchup lovers, they did have packets of HEINZ ketchup.For those wanting a general idea of the layout, building 2 and 7 run along the lazy river which was a very nice and quite area for relaxing. Building 3 is closest to the pool area which can be quite loud at times. Buildings 4,5,and 6 are closer to the beach.The animation team was very visable throughout the day and did a good job keeping people entertained with beach games and vollyball tournaments. The evening entertainment started at 9:30 pm and was held in a covered theatre. The best shows being on Friday/majic show and Saturday/Michael Jackson show.The only negatives I have at this resort is that the beach vendors can get quite annoying by weeks end. I would also recommend to bring your own pillow because I found theirs smelled sour due to the humidity. I also found the fridge did not keep your drinks near cold enough.On a positve note I'm a picky eater and I always found something good to eat. I'm a light sleeper and I was never disturbed by any noise at night. So thanks to Grand Oasis for making our vacation a very enjoyable experience. Also, hello to Roger and Brenda the only english speaking couple we met while there. We enjoyed your company the last couple of days. I would not hesitate to recommend the Grand Oasis.  
<Date>Oct 16, 2007

<Author>bunny76
<Content>Worst Ever!!!!!!! We recently returned from our first family vacation at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana! Our trip started off on the wrong foot the minute we left the airport! Upon arriving at the punta cana airport, we went directly to the Sunwing Rep who had a booth set up, We asked her to get a taxi to take us to our resort, We went with the Taxi driver who was appointed to us, 5 mins outside the airport her pulled off the side of the road claiming car problems, we called another driver from his phone to pick us up which he did, when we arrived at the hotel, we noticed that the first taxi driver stole our laptop case which had a laptop, psp, money, medication and a few other valuable items, We reported it immediately to the front desk at the resort and asked for them to call the rep to see who the taxi driver was, the staff was very unhelpful, we were told we could call the airport, but it cost a $1 a min, we informed him all our money was stolen and he did nothing to help. We tried to get ahold of the Sunwing rep at the hotel and was unsuccessful, the front desk never told the rep of our problems and nobody contacted us. The food was terrible, the service was terrible, I booked this trip because of all the kids activities they claim to have yet when we get there, the kids had nothing to do!!!! We spent the whole week at the pool with the kids, not much of a vacation for anyone.. The rooms were not very nice, and to upgrade the room for the week was and extra $400...We were charged for all collect calls we made, I was charged for a fax that i needed to allow me to recieve money from home on our second last day so we could leave the airport, and i was charged 10% of the money i recieved as well, I was unable to use the debit machines, and the front desk told me our bank cards dont work on the island, yet the people on our flight were able to use their debit cards at there resort, SOOOO we had a family of 4, no money, no help, bad service, horrible food. Never ever again would i travel here and i would never send anyone here either, Our first family vacation has no good memories!

<Author>YardleyMan
<Content>The Honest Truth Philly Style My wife and I stayed here for 5 days and 4 nights at the end of September. We do travel alot but are not snobs. There is the backround and this is what you need to know about the resort. I hope it helps. 1. The beach and water are absolutely amazing. You will not be disappointed in this or the weather.2. The pools are clean, warm, and the pool bar area is awesome.3. Building 7 is new and the room itself is very nice. However our air conditioning did not work so there was a moldy smell in our room the whole time. 4.The food was not very good. If you go in with low expectations you will be ok. The breakfast buffet was good, the lunch on the beach was average and the dinners were awful. A previous poster said that the buffet pasta was better than the Italian restaurant and he was absolutely correct. The Tex-Mex place was practically inedible as the beef there is definately different than what most Americans will be used to so beware. We stayed at Excellence in Cancun last year and the food was 5 star. FYI there is an Excellence in Punta Cana.5. There is no top shelf liquor and your fridge in your room will be not so cold and stocked with only 2 beers and some cokes.6. The previous poster are correct in that the multi ball roulette game is a complete scam. Stay Away. Thank God I pulled the plug after losing only $200.00. Bottom line to this place is if your looking to relax all day at beautiful beach and/or pool on nice grounds this can be the place for you. However do not expect good food and just hope your air conditoning works. We had a great time here but would definately go to Excellence Punta Cana the next time.

<Author>amdspgh
<Content>Had a blast!! We just got back to the good ol' US of A from the closest thing to paradise we've ever experienced. We've never travelled out of the country other than to go to Canada and not fully knowing what to expect, we were very pleasantly surprised especially after reading other reviews. We spent the litle bit of extra money to upgrade our room to building 7, a master junior suite; it was worth the money; building 7 is the newest of the buildings. The room was stunning; always kept clean and the view from our balcony was beautiful (we overlooked the pool and could see the beach/ocean). The mini bar could have been colder; we did complain but didn't seem to get a resolution. The room was cooler than outside but not as cold as we would have liked; it was tolerable but we showered 2-3 times a day. Never had problems with hot water like others have said in reviews we've read. We were a bit disappointed because there were no ice machines within any of the buildings around us. It was only a short walk to the bar and they were willing to give you bags of ice but without a cooler it was difficult to keep the ice from quickly melting. Next time we'll take a fold up cooler. And there will be a next time!!Regarding the food, overall it was pretty good. The buffets offered a number of selections and the italian and tex mex restaurants were good as well. It's difficult to accomodate so many cultures and we thought they did a great job. Remember you're in another country; don't over indulge and your tummy should be fine. The grounds and pools were beautiful; well maintained and clean. Juan is the best bartender ever (he's at the swim up bar where we spent most afternoons). At first he was polite but not friendly; after a day or two and a few bucks, he'd see you coming and have your drink ready!! We enjoyed talking with him; teaching him more English as he taught us more Spanish. No communication barrier there!! Dos cervezas, por favor!!Tipping wasn't really necessary but we did find that leaving a few dollars for the housekeepers and for the bartenders went a long way!! It's a good idea to take some $1 bills for them; they are very grateful and appreciative. The beach was also well maintained. There were days when the seaweed was worse than other days but we thought they did a great job of keeping it clean (after all it is the ocean). The water was clear and refreshing. Plenty of fish swimming around you; take some bread and you'll wonder where they all came from!!It didn't take us long to find others who spoke English. We enjoyed talking with couples from Canada and Germany as well as the group of ladies from Pennsylvania.Be prepared for hot and humid weather no matter the time of day. Drink plenty of bottled water (in between the rum and beer of course) and absolutely use sunscreen. And last but not least STAY AWAY from the multi ball roulette game. It is a complete scam; fortunately we didn't take the hook but too many others that we talked with lost thousands of dollars. The dealer was very slick and spoke fluent English. We had a very relaxing and enjoyable vacation. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others and plan to go back (hopefully sooner than later!)  
<Date>Oct 7, 2007
<Rating>5	4	4	4	5	3	4	3	
<Aspects>

<Author>cgrg
<Content>Great time! BEWARE of the Roulette Game!!!! We had a great time!!!! If you go to the Casino STAY AWAY from the Mini Ball Roulette!! It is a total SCAM, we spoke to and heard of more than 8 couples that weren't warned and lost BIG. Obviously you sit at the table with the expectation of only playing the complimentary chips, however the smooth slick talking dealer is good at what he does and before you know it your only 1 point away from winning the jackpot but that 1 point doesn't ever seem to turn up. If you think you're not big gamblers and you won't be stuck in that position just be careful. We are not big gamblers at all yet we fell into the trap. If you do decide to give it a try make sure you count the numbers on EVERY single roll, the dealer counts very fast and we think he doesn't add them correctly.The resort has lots of things to do and there's always a bar open and ready to serve you. The food was great, we ate mostly at the buffet, however we did eat at the tex mex and italian style resatuarants which were both great! The beach is beautiful and be sure to take advantage of the snokling, you can see some great fish without swimming far at all! The rooms were ok... I would recommend upgranding your room... our room could have used a few upgrades but all and all the room was ok.

<Author>JBmaximus
<Content>The Good, The Bad, The Ugly Be prepared for the 10 dollar per person (cash only) tourist card you have to buy as soon as you get off of the airplane. Once you buy the card, you take 20 steps and hand it in at the next desk....Check in was smooth an easy. The room (building 7, Ocean View RM#7220) was very clean. The view was a panoramic view of the ocean which was stunning. The pool beside building 7 was clean and clear (as were all of the pools) and it seemed to be a few degrees cooler than the others.The beach is raked in the morning to remove the see grass. There are no waves. The ocean water is extrememly clear and warm. Also, even though I dont believe the beach is designed for topless, I believe I probably saw around 800 pairs of breasts on the beach while I was there. It seems no one cares to have their boobs out.The food was decent at all of the resturants. There is also a grill on the beach that serves deep fried chicken, grilled hamburgers and french fries. Very tastey. You won't go hungry here but you will probably miss American food.Cons/Warnings:Do not drink the water. The water is filled with bacteria. The maids provide you with 3 very large bottles of water to drink. If you run out, just call room service for more.Stay away from the Casino. They will give you free chips and drag you over to the multi-ball roullette table. We met 5 couples and they all got it down to 1 or 2 and the game ended. I don't know how they do it but the game is rigged so you can only lose. After coming home and researching it, it seems like many others say the same thing about this casino.There are vendors in this resort. Everytime you walk within 20 feet of them they will be yelling at you in 5 different languages hoping you will purchase some of their junk necklaces. They almost always show you the domincan republican stone necklace, bracelt, or earings and then ask you for $40.00 USD. These vendors get very annoying. You will have to learn to avoid eye contact and almost get mean with them because they will try to put a ton of pressure on you to buy from them once they have you standing by their stand or looking at their junk.The only beer they have is called 'Presidente' also known to the staff as 'Domincan Water'. Its OK, but you will be happy to come home and drink your own American beer again. We did shots of a drink called Mama Juanna and it made both of us very sick. After research, this drink is supposed to be some kind of an liquid viagra. I recommened staying away from it, all it tastes like is warm cough syrup.The Micheal Jackson show is ok. Some of the dancers can really move and the do a decent job of portraying and dancing like Micheal Jackson.Also, no one there, not even the guests, really speak a bit of English. We didnt meet anyone at all that spoke english until the 3rd day.The air conditioning (Building 7) was not very good. It was usually only about 10 degrees cooler in the room than compared to outside, and it's hot outside. We were without hot water at all during one of the days we were there.Room service is ok and it is included. They make their pizza with no sauce so be prepared for that. Also, the hamburger through room service is almost not even cooked. The room service people cannot speak english very well at all. Even if you ask for a well-done hamburger it will still come raw.OVERALL:We had a good time. The beach was nice, the couples that we met were great. The resturants were good and the staff seemed friendly. And karoke was a blast.I would recommend this resort to younger couples and for no more than a week.  
<Date>Oct 2, 2007

<Author>creegon1
<Content>Amazing Resort, Don't Play Multi Ball Roulette! Don't play Multi Ball Roulette!! When you go to the Casino they will give you chips to play Multi Ball Roulette and then they suck you into betting big. We met 6 couples who played the game and every one of them lost money, 2 couples lost $2500, 1 couple lost $4000 and a couple from England lost the most, $6000. The dealer is very slick and we assume is working on commission. We were watching one couple through the window at the casino and tried to warn them not to play and after they lost $4000 and walked out of the casino visibly upset we saw the dealer laughing with the pit boss. This game is a Scam! I work at a Casino and none of the pit bosses have heard of this game. Stay Away From Multi Ball Roulette!!The resort was amazing! There were bars all over the resort, one near the beach that was open 24hrs. The swim up bar Bartender, Juan, was amazing and had a great time with the customers. There is nightly entertainment, movies and live shows every night, Karaoke on Sunday, Tuesday and Friday and the Disco is pumping every night as well. The Italian restaurant was OK even through a lot of reviews said it was the best, every couple we talked to including ourselves would say the pasta bar at Windows Buffet was better then this place so don waste your time. The American grill was AMAZING and we ate there twice during our stay. The service was top notch and the food was by far the best on the resort. The food at the windows buffet was great, you had to pick through to find the stuff you liked but over all it was good. The theme changes every night so you always have a good selection. The beach is beautiful and over all the resort is well kept and a great place to spend 7 days. We paid $1500 for the two of us and we could not have asked for a better vacation.

<Author>americanwoman7
<Content>americans may want to skip this hotel My husband and I and our 2 close friends just returned from our trip here. Let me start with the good news...the beach is beautiful. The weather was fantastic. The water was clear and the fish were everywhere....really beautiful. OK, here's the rest....the food is really bad. I am not sure if it is bc as Americans we expected better quality, but it is just not at this resort. Honestly, breakfast was average but lunch and dinner were horrible. The choices were limited as far as restuarants, but even the Italian place which was their nicest, had terrible food. Just not what you would get at any decent place in the states.Also, as americans we were in the minority. This was not initially a problem for us, but as the days progressed we realized that americans were not being treated the way other guests were. This was by the Dominican people and by the other guests. This was sad for us, as we have travelled all over the world and have never been treated like this anywhere. The staff was not friendly. Don't expect anyone to say good morning, etc to you. It was a very different trip than Mexico, which was our last vacation. There, the people could not have been kinder and really were hospitable.Anyway, would not go back. Air conditioning did not work in our room all of the time and the rooms in Bldg. 7, which were supposed to be the newest ones, smelled. It was a moldy, mildewy type of odor.I would not recommend this place to anyone, but as someone from the U.S., I would tell others from here, beware.
