<Author>Walker1225
<Content>Beatiful Setting to Relax As with all trips and hotels this one had its very high points and it lows. Overall the value of the trip was well worth it! We stayed for 10 nights. The hotel room was very nice, much nicer than we expected since we had a standard and did not upgrade. The room was very large with vaulted ceilings, jacuzzi tub, seperate shower, marble throughout the room. The beach was very beautiful and peaceful. There was absolutely no problem finding lounge chairs at the beach. The huts were differnt story, people let their stuff on it overnight. It was actually really entertaining watching people fuss about the huts. They are nice to get especially if you are sick of the sun. The pools were all very nice. The main pool was hard to get a lounge chair until after lunch. The service started off poor but once they recognized you after a couple of days they were very helpful and extremely hard working. The food was good for the first two days, after that it got old since it is the same thing day in and day out for the most part. The buffet was more than adequate and we found something, none of the restaurants are gourmet by any means but adequate. There was always salad and fruit that was always fresh. I would recommend bringing a small container of seasoning if you like taste to you food. Everything was very bland in order to serve the masses better. Roomservice was good the first night especially after all the drink during the day that tasted refreshing in the heat. The room service menu is very slim and consisted of stuff from the buffet we ordered it late a couple of times and never got the same thing twice even though we ordered the same thing. The bar was ok if you are a beer drinker not so hot if you were not, The wine was terrible! Overall for the amount that we paid it was actually much more than we expected. this place is perfect if you want to just go to a beatiful resort and relax and soak up the sun, especially if you don't speak spanish since everything that goes on is in spanish. We would definitely go again but this time remeber to bring seasoning, snacks for the room and a couple of nice bottles of wine.

<Author>anewheartx3
<Content>amazing resort! We just returned from our stay at the Grand Oasis. In our group there was my parents, a 21 year old, a 19 year old, three 18 year olds and one 10 year old. Overall I would say our trip was amazing. Everyone there was so nice. The rooms were big (we stayed in buildings 2 and 7). Building 7 was incredible, my parents stayed in the junior suite there which was amazing. The Italian restaurant was the best place to eat; after we ate there the first night, we went at 8 the next morning to get a reservation for the following day. I wouldn't recommend the Tex Mex Grill restaurant at all. The buffet, Windows, was very good and always had a wide selection. You can never run out of food at this resort. For lunch we went to the beach garden cafe which was good. The server AMADOR was our favorite, he was always eager to help us out. We didn't see many people tipping anyone that worked there but we tipped them all a couple dollars everytime they served us and they were entirely grateful. We also tipped our maid 2 or 3 dollars a day. The beach was amazing, especially at night although it was pretty much empty since everyone goes to sleep or to the bars. Most of the people there are not American and speak very little English, but we didn't really mind. The shops on the beach are a good place to get souvenirs, much cheaper than the shops at the resort. I LOVED this resort and if I ever return to Punta Cana I would definitely want to stay here again.  
<Date>Aug 28, 2007

<Author>Itichyfeet
<Content>Not As Good As you Expect Grand Oasis Punta CanaJust returned after 2 weeks 11th Aug - 25th Aug 2007. We did review the site and it was rated by customers anywhere from 0 to 5 my husband and I would rate this resort 3. It has been bought over by Globalia and is having some teething pains. The food although plentiful was very repetative the buffet was boring. The rooms although clean were in need of updating and although you do not spend all your time in the room it would still be nice to have it painted. There are 3 pools the main pool needed to be cleaned. In the 2 weeks we were there we in it once and for the whole time it was cloudy not sparkling like it should have been. The adult pool was better but still not as clean as it could have been. The 1st week we were there our fellow guests except for the 6 others who arrived with us did not speak English most of the guests were from Spain, Italy and France. The second week some English people arrived so we did not feel so isolated. So be prepared to brush up on your Spanish or you will have a hard time making new friends. The staff all tried to speak English and did very well although we found that they could have been a bit more friendly.We are not Dominican virgins and have visited 4 times twice to Punta Cana and twice to Puerta Plata but this vacation was the worst one we have had in the Dominican.To end we would not recommed this resort and if you are going just 1 week would be enough.

<Author>jonnybbravo
<Content>Great holiday place We have just returned from our vacation, and we had a fantastic time. The food was great, the service was good, and the pool and beach were great along with the rooms being comfortable and clean. The one place where I would advise people to stay clear of is the Tex Mex American Grill, although the food was good the service was awful and in fact put a dampener on the evening. Apart from that I have no complaints what so ever with the fantastic hotel or restaurants. One piece of advice I give you, is to stay well clear of the tap water (even when boiled), I made a coffee in my room with the tap water and paid the penalty, I consequently became extremely good friends with the large white telephone, and by that I mean the toilet. Apart from the time I was ill we both had a fantastic time at the Grand Oasis Punta Cana, and would defiantly recommend the hotel to friends and family. This was our first time to the Dominican Republic and it is a very interesting island, you must go and see its fantastic county and its local way of living. I just love the RUM yum yum!!!

<Author>MarkandJack
<Content>Definitely a great place! M We stayed in this hotel for two last weeks of July and it certainly was a great place. It was not our first time in the Dominican Republic, so we knew kind of what to expect. The hotel itself was great! Rooms were clean and maid worked really hard to keep it this way. Our first maid Ciara excelled in making fancy shapes out of our towels and flowers. We were even laughing that if we stayed there longer she would have probably succeeded in making and Empire State Building out of our towels. We had some problems there however, but we have to say that they were dealt with so fast and so professionally in a matter of minutes. Our tour operator Melany from TMR ( Tours Mont Royal ) was amazing . Great hats off to Rooms Division Manager, Caren De Vries. We have never seen such professionalism, care about the guests and pleasant attitude. She certainly is to be commend and will be remembered. We are seriously considering going back there, knowing that Caren would be there. As for the food in the resort... absolutely fantastic, including the Thursday dinners on the beach. There was nothing in the buffet that we could complain about. As for the a la carte restaurants, there were three. The Italian was great, the service was fast and friendly and the food was great. The seafood restaurant was equally good. The only probleme we had was at the Texmex called American grill... Apart from the lack of AC that day, although the food was really good, but the service was extremely long and the waiter did not speak the word of English... I guess it would have been helpful to learn at least a menu. If you speak even a little Spanish it is certainly helpful there, but the main thing is to keep positive attitude and thing work out great. If you have someone like Caren there, you should be in good hands. If you go there you may give her the best regards with hugs from Jack and Mark. Overall, the resort is very good, way above average of what you may find. The beach is great, lots of activities ( maybe adding more water sports would be good like water bikes) , bars and other things. No matter whether you are a couple , single, family with or without kids you will certainly enjoy the place. You will however find around you many guests who seem to have come there only to complain without a reason and forget that they came to the Dominican Republic and not Ritz Carlton in NY. People, come on ! Have time off , relax and enjoy the weather and fantastic surroundings ( including the live pink flamingos) . This place is definitely where you can find it all.  
<Date>Aug 5, 2007

<Author>ChicaMississauga_ON
<Content>It was o.k. Punta Cana: Grand OasisDate: July 21, 2007Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Mississauga, ON  We just got back from the Grand Oasis Punta hotel. The resort was very nice, beautiful gardens and lobby. They checked us in, bellboy took our luggage to the room. The room was fairly nice, simple, but overall clean. The cleaning staff was very nice and efficient, at least our lady was. There was a small T.V with about 60 channels, with some english channels. They provided us with one beach towel card per person. There were three a la carte restaurants (Italian, Tex Mex and Seafood) and one buffet restaurant. The food was great at all the restaurants, the service, a little better some more than others. They had one main pool which was a bit crowded at times, and I believe two other smaller pools throughout the resort. There were always employees around cleaning up and making sure that everything was tidy. There were a couple of shops. The people working in the shops were not that friendly, infact they seem like they don't want to talk to you and if you question something they'd start to argue with you, but the stands out in the open have really nice people willing to bargain with you so try to bargain if you can. Make sure to take plenty of nausea and upset stomach medication as we met many people who got sick, including myself and my mother. Buy travel insurance, if they need to take you to the local hospital you will be looking at $400 to $700 US in fees, plus the taxi fair of about $20 US. The beach was nice, but not very clean, lots of seaweed. They have a beach party on Thursdays where they serve all kinds of foods and desserts, and have a show. It gets packed so arrive early, I believe it begins at 6:30pm. There are also many snack bars, those were o.k, some of the food just sits there for a while so it gets dry looses its flavour, and some of they people working there can be so rude, almost as if they don't want to serve you. I read a review from another traveller and he/she mentioned that the majority of tourists at this and possibly other local resorts are spanish. This is true. There were many spanish speaking tourists, and yes they can be rude, but I am spanish speaking and I did meet some people that were friendly. There were many tourists from other countries and backgrounds as well and they had the same attitude as well. But you gotta just see past that and just ignore them. I probably won't return to this resort as there are many others that I still need to visit and many other countrys that I would like to visit. But overall, it was o.k. Don't recommend it though.  
<Date>Jul 28, 2007

<Author>morenaOntario
<Content>hated this resort We are a family of 5. My husband and I with 3 children (one of them being disabled). We stayed at this resort from June 23-30, 2007. Our room was ok, but there were times where we did not have any hot water. Each time we had contacted the service desk to advise them, they would respond with an attitude. Most of the staff working in this resort looked as if they were not happy and therefore this reflected tremendously on the service. The food was terrible. We were all sick and I ended up in the hosiptal (only to beg the doctor to discharge me early due to my three children). The hotel claimed that no one else has been sick and therefore it was our imagination. Our rep suggested that we only eat bread for the week (nice suggestion). The hotel was well aware of my hospital stay as an ambulance had to pick me up from the hotel because the doctor's office was not equipped to handle my bacterial infection. No one from the hotel contacted us to see how we were doing, in actual fact they treated us as if we were garbage. Now the kids club. What kids club. My children who are very active and love to swim, play sports and interact with other children did not want to go to the kids club. Why, because they did nothing there with them. Also the kids show at night. Again what kids show. Every night they sang the same songs in a circle and that was that. It broke my heart to see my children not having fun as they should have. Every two years we go away with the children. Having to travel as a family of five is not cheap. Especially when it takes us two years of putting away money little by little in order to enjoy a week vacation. I was very disappointed in this hotel and would not recommend it to anyone unless you are young going with a bunch of girls or guys. They seem to like those types of travelers. I have lived in the DR and have travelled to the DR over 15 times but never have I been treated so poorly as I did here. I ignored some of the posting on the site warning us but figured these people must have been too picky. I now realize that there are some hotels in the DR that are just not worth it.  
<Date>Jul 27, 2007

<Author>cchack
<Content>Great Vacation Spot After reading reviews before our trip I was a bit anxious, but after arriving to this beautiful resort I was very pleased. We stayed from June 27 to July 6, 07. Overall our group, including 3 pre-teens, had a great time. The resort is beautiful, with lots of palm trees and flowers. What we all agreed made our trip was our room location. I had done some research before (much thanks to Candlemaker's suggestion) and had requested two rooms in building 2 facing the lazy river. Thanks to Caren Devries for meeting my request. We would go out to the beach every morning until mid afternoon (you do need to get up early to reserve shaded beach chairs) and then return later in the afternoon to enjoy relaxation in the pool. It was right out our doorwall!! The kids loved ordering room service each afternoon and the food was fresh and tasty. You can always find something good to eat at the Windows Buffet. If you don't like the first thing you try just go back up. The omelet station for breakfast is very good and so were the ready to order smoothies. We really enjoyed the Italian restaurant, DiMarios. Try the beef medalions. The food was excellent and the kids had fun ordering virgin Margaritas. The Beach Garden for dinner was also very good and the wait staff was very friendly. It is so beautiful eating outside under the thatch roof seeing the moon and the ocean. The American Grill however was very disappointing. The service was terrible, we waited forever for a drink, and the food was not good either. The Thursday night beach party was nice and they work real hard to set everything up. Bringing singles for tips worked out good (you don't have to tip, but they appreciate it, especially at the bars). We did three excursions. Deep sea fishing, (caught nothing and got seasick), parasailing and the glass bottom snorkeling. All of these are available for purchase right on the beach. The snorkeling was very nice, there is a reef with lots of fish and sea creatures. Floating in the ocean with our home-brought drink mugs was the best. Lots of fish to see and they do clean the beach. What's a little seaweed. All in all we had a great time. Go with a good attitude and you'll bring back great memories.  
<Date>Jul 25, 2007

<Author>rjssa
<Content>Worst vacation ever We just returned from a week's stay 7/11-7/18 at The Globalia. We are a family of four and my dad accompanied us. The resort was well maintained and the staff was mostly considerate. Our room's were in building 2. We had a problem with ants and the air condition didn't work for the first three days we were there. They finally resolved the problem for what it was worth. The air never really gets that cool. The beach is cluttered and we were disappointed in the water clarity. Also the swim area is small due to all of the boats surrounding the property. It's like swimming in a marina. The food was awful. This is my first day back to normalcy. We have been ill for 9 days. I got sick the fourth day we were there and remained sick until today. Four out of the five of us had severe diarrhea. We have had 5 trips to the doctor's since our return home and we were all treated with antibiotics to fight a bacterial infection. We spoke to many other travelers who were also sick and disappointed. We met another family on Sunday that had just arrived on Friday for a week's stay and they left Monday morning because they got sick the night before. It's not what we were accustomed to. I would definitely go to Mexico before I go here. For us, it was the first and last trip. We would never go back.

<Author>lrpattyperfect
<Content>First three days were great but then....... We traveled with a group of 8 (6 adults-2 teens). The resort is beautiful and well manicured with more palm trees than I've ever seen and I have traveled quite a bit to the Carribbean. There was a beautiful breeze nearly every minute of the day and night if you were at the right spot on the beach. The beach water was clean but not the gorgeous Carribbean color I expected. I didn't realize this resort is on the Atlantic Ocean side and, as a result, there was quite a bit of seaweed floating around with you. It was promptly cleaned by the maintenance men each day from the shoreline. The food by American standards was good and tasty overall, although we always found the meats to be very tough. Burgers are certainly not what Americans are used to (very mushy consistency). The food from Room Service on the other hand is horrendous (except the pizza). The staff was extremely polite and very accommodating with few exceptions. (i.e. the maid who stole my husband's gold and diamond ring from the night table while he was sitting right on the balcony-she also let herself into the room while he was napping on another occassion-hours after she cleaned the room to leave a survey on the bed) The security staff concluded their investigation within 2 hours (and without contacting her since she had already left the site) and said their investigation was negative, whatever that is supposed to mean. They suggested we contact the local police (yeah right). We stayed in the Suites in Building 7 which we paid a $300 USD upgrade for. The room was very nice and had a beautiful view but was invested with ants. We requested an exterminator from the same thieving maid who assured us that one would come but no one never did. We lived with an inordinate amount of ants for the week. The biggest problem of all was the severe vomitting and diarrhea that every person in our party and on our bus to the airport seemed to have contracted (at least 30 people). We all spent the last 2 1/2 days of our trip in our rooms taking turns on the toilet. Today is the 3rd day since we arrived back in the US and we are all still sick! 5 1/2 days later. Our local ER Doctor at the hospital suggested that it is a parasite in our digestive systems. It had to come from the ice or the bottled water. It was the only thing we all had in common. We could have made a fortune selling Imodium but even that isnt working. As we were leaving the lobby for the airport we met numerous other people both Americans and Europeans all complaining of the same thing. If diarrahea and vomitting for half of your trip doesn't bother you, then this is the place to go. The only other complaint is there is no live music at night for dancing. We left on Thurs during the day so werent there for the Beach party which I understand is alot of fun and has live music. That would have been a definite plus. It's a shame that we all got sick, if that were not the case, we would go back there, it was a great value for the money. However, we definitely will not go there again now. One more thing, if topless on the beach bothers you or your children, don't go there, there's plenty of it.  
<Date>Jul 21, 2007

<Author>kristtov
<Content>Very good resort I stayed there with my family from July 2nd to July 16th and it was actually a great vacation.We got rooms in building 5 which is not the newest one. The rooms were very large and comfortable. The bathrooms seem to be a little bit old and need some refurbishment but nothing dramatic. We asked to be on the second floor with sea view and they made arrangements for us.The beach is excellent but there are not plenty of places with shade. So it is tru that you may need to wake up at 6am to reserve a good seat. We stayed a few years ago at the Catalonia Bavaro and it was the same. What is really different here is that you can really swim in the sea. Almost nobody does it but the sea is deep enough. On the contrary the pool was a bit disappointing because the maximum depth was 1.25m... and a lot of people were just sitting in the beach and drinking cocktails.Her we come to the bars. The bartenders seem to be used to serving only beers. But there are very good cocktails : coco loco, caipirina.... There is no need to tip to get enough alcohol. Just ask them!The buffet was really amazing. It was different every evening with a lot of special themes. There was plenty of choice and the food was excellent.The animation staff works hard but they are only 6 and seem to organize the same activities everyday : stretching, shuffleboard and volleyball. The good thing is that you can win some bottles of rhum.At the water sports house you can borrow canoes, catamarans, windsurfs for free. They also give lessons for free whereas you have to pay in the other resorts. Scuba diving is also great with an ewcellent divemaster (Frankie).To sum up : do not hesitate to reserve, this resort is great even if it is not very expensive.  
<Date>Jul 20, 2007

<Author>ChrisandNigel
<Content>A Hidden Gem We stayed at the Grand Oasis from June 30 - July 7 2007. We too were a little worried after reading some of the reviews, please do not worry if you have booked this resort...it really is beautiful. This is the first time we have travelled to Punta Cana and it certainly will not be the last. The Beach was amazing lined with palm trees and the gentle breeze at night was breath taking...We stayed in building 7 - the newest building (they are currently constructing new buildings - 100 new rooms will be added to the resort along with a new marina) the weather was flawless between 90 and 100 everyday!!...bring the sunscreen if you tend to burn. The bartenders are ready to attend to your every need and bottled water is plentyfull...the buffet will please even the most pickest of eaters....burgers pizza and fries everyday at the beach grill...shopping is not great - prices are high on the resort..and all seem to be selling the same things..we met some fantastic people from the UK, USA and Canada..the adult pool is really great if you just want to chill and be without the activities of the main pool...The beach party on Thursday evening is amazing..the dinner, show and dancing are done on the beach..the wait staff work so hard..and are eager to please..it rained one night quite hard -...and there was a definate odour after the rain fall..but you must remember they do not have the same water systems we have - you are in a third world Country and need to take a few things with a grain of salt...we also lost power one afternoon for about 3 hours the buffet restaurant had candles everywhere what an adventure...the off resort excursions are also plentyfull...my Husband went deep sea fishing with some folks we met..$80.00USD for a 4 hour trip..they had fun...had a couple of bites...but did not catch anything...I would advise brining USD - small bills for tipping..also better to barter with...bring a book for the airport as they bring you there 2-3 hours before your flight leaves....but the airport is nice with shops and coffee stands..I hope you have as great a time as we did..Nigel and Christine  
<Date>Jul 8, 2007

<Author>Pickles1Canada
<Content>Great Vacation This is our 4th trip to Dominican we have stayed at hotels from one end of the island to the other end and in the middle . As far as this hotel goes the rooms and food were good compared to the other hotels and the grounds were beautiful and everything was a short walk which I like. We had an amazing room with a King size bed and ocean view which I have always asked or but never got. This ocean view was spectauclar day and night that alone was worth the trip. The only complaint I have was that I was not aware of the marina next door and I dont like the thought of boats being so close to were I am swiming and also breathing the fumes in. The seaweed didnt bother me and the water was very clear but I think the bavaro beaches are much better this one is situated in cabeza de toro. This hotel sets up a wonderful beach party barbecue every thursday night. The staff works very hard setting it up and all the restaurents gettogether and prepare the food and they even have the entertainment on the beach the only problem was that the clean was up was underneath our room so it was very noise all night while we were trying to sleep The shows we found were more proffesionaly done than the other ones we have seen . Tthe Michael Jackson show which we have seen in other hotels does not compare to this one this one was very good as well s Shakira. Overall it was fine and I dont understand why people complain about he food there was plenty to choose from every day and we have never gotten sick only my husband once but thats because he had too many Pina Coladas which can be like a laxative.P.S. We tried getting the Pallapas on the beach every morning by getting up at 6:00 to no avail we did manage to get one at 5:00 one day but it was the last one all the towels were on the chairs already so I came to the conclusion that people are puttting them on the chairs at night before going to bed.

<Author>choelscher
<Content>Nice My boyfriend and I took our first vacation together to Punta Cana. They resort was very pretty and very clean. We enjoyed the many pools and the beach, daily. Some Concerns:1.NO HOT WATER, and no water pressure (2 days)hen we inquired, we were hung up on by the front desk staff.2. No international Drinks, only Dominican Drinks3. You felt that you had to tip everyone for good service, even though it is all inclusive.4. Fridge was not refilled if we forgot to leave money.5. Food left little to be desired.6. One towel place far from resort.7. All extra activities cost $$$ ie. Tennis, snorkeling etc. when it is stated all inclusive. You have to pay for tennis balls and leave a non-refundable fee for taking snorkel equ. and kayaks out, etc.I know I have a few concerns, but the people were very friendly and I couldn't get over how clean it was.

17	9(service):1	16(food):1	23(little):1	34(feel):1	43(leave):2	63(drink):1	72(resort):1	80(money):1	125(towel):1	194(tip):1	318(fridge):1	397(forget):1	514(dominican):1	833(inclusive):1	903(international):1	1219(desire):1	1841(refill):1

<Author>sunshineday19
<Content>Fun Fun Fun heterosexual couple wanting warm tropical holiday. Booked via an Apple vacations rep. Stayed June 23-June30th, 2007. Had a blast, met great people and saw why this place was a 5 Apple hotel. 1. Bring $100+ in $1 and $5s for tipping. 2. Bring extra sunscreen. You will need more than you think. 3. Book tours with hotel. They will ensure you are with people who speak the same language as you. We did deep sea fishing off the beach people and there was no communication because 4 pple were english, 3 french and 2 spanish. wasn't good for a rough seas day. 4. Be warned the Beach and Adult pool allow for topless bathers and swimmers. remember this is primarily an European hotspot. 5. Try to speak Spanish to the workers. Most try to speak English, It is all you can do for visiting their country. 6. Food was good. Remember school food? Well it's better, but not much. Good variety. Hint for breakfast: Bread pudding is like french toast with the syrup already on it!!!7. restaurants: had better food quality than buffet, but not as much variety. 8. You will miss Iced Tea/Sweet tea if you enjoy these drinks. 9. You will miss a good burger, if you enjoy them--all we wanted was a whopper when we got home, and we don't really eat BK!!10. Don't make eye contact with the vendors if you don't want to be hassled. just keep walking or say no not today. Don't let them say they need to add $5 for commission, $2 is fine and fair. Those that don't push you to purchase something are those that will give you a good deal. they will say it is ok that you don't have your money, they will remember you and allow you to pay later. Don't accept this, it sounds too sketchy!!!11. Entertainment: cheesy but fun all in one. If you sit in the front be prepared to be put into the show one way or another, especially the lip sync show and the magic show, these are both shows that bring in outside companies for performances. 12. The Coca Cola is not the same as here, because it's not made with corn syrup, it's made with sugar, so it seems flat. But not bad. 13. Our mini fridge was refilled everyday, no questions. 14. Construction happening off the adult pool so it's somewhat loud but still relaxing (over by building 5). Nicolas is the bartender at the adult pool and will really pay attention to you and bring your drinks to you at the pool. he works hard for his money for his family!!!15. Excursions: we did deep sea and snorkeling. Deep sea was a rough seas day so it didn't go well for us due to sea sickness, the boat crew was awesome in helping us. Don't expect to go back though, everyone on the boat has to agree to go back, as it isn't fair for them to go back early because you are sick. Snorkeling was fun with the sharks and sting rays. you can see their pens off the beach shore from Globalia. Friends we made said they enjoyed the outback excursions very much. Others said Saona island was great too. 16. Saona Island: if you are contemplating on this one, here is something to know. It is a 1 1/2 hr bus ride, 1 hr catamoran, 2 1/2 hrs on beach, speed boat back than 1 1/2 hr bus ride back to hotel. Bus ride can be more than 1 1/2 hours and catamoran and speed boat can be reversed. While on the island you will enjoy good food, beautiful beach, huge living starfish, etc. 17. Staff: all are excellent and work hard for you. Don't let a language barrier decieve that. You work with them they will work with you. 18. If doing an Apple vacation Luis is the man. he will remember you and what destinations you did. He goes for lunch for 2 hours somewhere between 11am-2pm. he works all but one day. He is there for you no matter what!!!Loved the Grand Oasis Punta Cana  
<Date>Jul 2, 2007

<Content>What a great hotel!!! Just came back from Punta Cana. Stayed in Oasis Grand...and I had the best vacation ever. I dont understand how people can write bad reviews. It was simply a fantastic hotel. First the staff in general very friendly, from housekeeping to waiters. Try the a la carte restaurant . Great pizza in Da Mario ( italien) and Fajitas in the American grill.Animation was great...dont miss the Michael Jackson show!Over all, I would recommand this hotel to families, couples, single...anyone!!!! Sure there is 5star hotels...but quality / price can beat this one. HAVE FUN......

<Author>kjsunny
<Content>Just Got Back Just got back from 1 week vacation Jun.4 - 11, 2007 at this resort which is now called Globalia Punta Cana Grand. Traveled with a family group of 8 people which included 3 kids. Apple vacations rated this resort as 5 apples but I think 4 apples would be more fair. I am basically comparing this place with other apple resorts that we have stayed in in Mexico within the last year. I believe that reviews from people who stayed in a newer building such as #7 would be a much better rating than those who stayed in the older side including buildings #4 and 5. We were in rooms 4110/ 4112/ 4109 which are great locations near the pool, close to the beach and very close to all of the restaurants. The rooms were a bit run down but decent. If you go expecting a 5 apple place you will be disappointed. If you expect average you will be fine. Food was fair in general with the Thursday night Beach Party being the highlight. There is no beach or pool bar service. Room cleaning and food service staff barely speak English so be prepared to show them what you are talking about. I personally prefer the resorts in Cancun and Riviera Maya, Mexico because you get more for the money all around. But - to each his own.  
<Date>Jun 12, 2007

<Author>goldengirlMorecambe
<Content>WORST HOLIDAY EVER My sis and I arrived 1st May for 3 week stay. On entering our room in building 3 we were overcome by the smell, never did work out what caused it. We had no water through the bath tap and the drain was blocked with goodness knows what. We were standing in dirty water when showering. The a/c unit was encrusted with filth. We booked with Thomas Cook, and as their brochure stated that standard rooms only had one bed, we paid for a junior suite. We discovered that all their guests were in the same room as ours and nobody had paid the upgrade. BEWARE this is a con.My sis contracted bronchial pneumonia within 4 days of us arriving and although we have no proof, we feel the conditions in the room were a significant factor.Building work started on the floor above us and the noise was unbearable, no way my sis could rest. She ended up in hospital.There were RATS running on a daily basis between an open drain and the beach garden restaraunt, we saw them so often we named them!We informed our rep, Yo Han of all our concerns, but he was as much use as a chocolate fireguard! We did eventually manage to get moved to building 6, and guess what? That was the room we had paid the upgrade for! Unfortunately the walls are so thin in there that you could hear conversations through them. The behaviour of some guests was disgusting, resulting in security being called twice in 4 days.At the begining of our third week we had had enough,and told our rep he either get us out of there or get us on the next flight home. After offering us a refund of our upgrade fee, but insisting we stay at the hotel, we flipped out! Eventually we were moved to the Melia Caribe Tropical and what a vast difference. This is a 4*plus hotel, but compared to the supposedly 4* Punta Cana Grand it was no where near. There were at least 2 * difference.PLEASE don't think I am being a whinging brit here, I travel abroad 4 times a year and have NEVER felt the need to warn others about any hotel before. If you do decide to stay here, then you will need to bring your own sunshade, almost got to fights on the beach every morning as there just aren't enough umbrellas for the size of the hotel.  
<Date>Jun 10, 2007

<Author>rosevea1
<Content>Good time, cannot beat it for the $$ My wife and I, age 28 from Detroit, stayed at Globalia from May 13 through the 20th and enjoyed ourselves immensley. We went to Jamaica for our honeymoon 10 months prior, and paid over twice as much, for maybe a 15% better time.Getting to the DR was fine (except for the 6am departure) - straight shot Detroit to PC. The airport in Punta Cana is rather unique, pretty much a bunch of large huts with grass roofs. Customs was a snap, plenty of folks to show you to the right bus and you are on the way - 20 minute drive to the resort.We arrived to the resort at 10:30ish, so of course our room wasn't ready for a few hours. No issues there, just got into our suits and hit the pool.We stayed in building 2 - our room was right next to the meandering pool - ground floor. The rooms are not the best we've ever seen (remember what you're paying), and they obviously were not new. But who cares about the room anyway? If you want a nice room go to your nearest Ritz for vacation - you're supposed to be outside. Beds were fine, not great but you're so tired at night it doesn't matter. Fridge stocked daily with water, coke and beer (Brahma!). Shower was fine, we only got 3 towels a day which was good enough. Did not see one bug in our room the entire time, and no flooding issues. Biggest downfall is that the walls are very thin - you can hear people out in the hallway in the morning even if they aren't being loud.Food - we went to every restaurant at least once:Italian - was our favorite. Get the Beef Medallion or Chicken alfredo. Caesar salad was also quite nice.American Grill - Solid - had the steak, no issues.Mexican - Got the ribs, they didn't look great, but were very tasty. Wife got the fajitas, another recomendation.Windows (buffet) - If you like Mexican food, go there Mexican night! Awesome food! They have a different theme every night. We ate there the first night and it took a few tries to find something we really liked, but that's the reason it's a buffet, right?Breakfast - Best meal of the day. Omelet bar, fresh fruit juice bar, GREAT bacon, breads....Lunch - we just snacked on the outdoor grill every day. Burgers were bad, hot dogs were worse, chicken was absolutely AWESOME.Pools - we did not go to the adults pool, since there seemed to be more action at the family pool. They have activities throughout the day (we did aerobics every morning), but most people seem content to hang out on the sides or by the pool bar. Very clean.Entertainment - we thought it was solid - the shows are only about an hour long, so it leaves time to do other things at night. The Michael Jackson show was the best, and the dancing/lyp-synch shows are also quite entertaining. And if you don't like them, it's easy to come and go as you wish.Bars - They have a piano bar which is pretty much your typical dark hotel lounge bar, which we kind of liked to be at after a long hot day - they have karaoke 3 nights a week and a piano player the other nights. Nice little spot that you can pull right up to the bar at and get some mammuana from Juan. They also have a disco, which we only went to once and it was not very full, but it's a place to drink and dance to the latest dance/hip hop hits. We went to the casino once, pretty small with maybe 5 tables and 50 slots.Gym - about what you'd expect. Nothing great but good enough for a week. 6 cardio machines and a couple universal weight machines, a free weight set as well.Beach - Thought it was great. Nice sand, water is calm, everything you'd want. They have a marina to the right of the resort, and there are boats in the waters which you can go kayak around. You will not be able to find a spot under the shaded areas on the beach or the pool, but that's what sunblock is for, and there are plenty of areas to go to get out the sun if you need to. I never felt the need to be in the shade.Service - Never had an issue. Sure, some people come across as more friendly than others, but isn't that the case everywhere? Never had to wait a long time for a drink, to be waited on, etc.Excursions - We went on the Outback Safari and the Kon-Tiki snorkeling party boat and reccomend both. The outback safari will give you a good idea of what the Dominican countryside is like, and the party boat, well if you don't know what that is then get a life. But the crew on the boat really make it a fun time.For anyone on their way to this resort, a few tips:1. Bring $50 in one dollar bills and use them all on tips for one week. We tipped $2 at every sit-down meal, $1-2 a day to the housekeeper, and $1 to the bartender if he gave us say 3-4 drinks at one sitdown. This isn't one of those resorts that don't accept tips, and I go as far as to say they half-expect it. Don't be a cheap (--). On the other hand, I never felt like I received poor service if I didn't tip.2. Don't put suntan lotion in your carry-on bag. We made this mistake and ended up having to pay $28 for a bottle at the resort gift shops after it got taken at the airport.3. Bring a beach towel for each person. They give you a towel token to use but it seemed sometimes they ran out.4. Bring your own cup for drinks. At the pools they only have cheap little 6 ounce plastic cups, but bartenders will fill up anything you give them.5. Take it easy on the drinks - have your 1 or 2 pina coladas a day, but other than that stick to the old standby well drinks and beer.6. RELAX!! We had a great time, things will go wrong at times while you're at the resort, but why let it affect your vacation? I seriously think the only way someone would not enjoy this resort is if they went in expecting the world, or they just have an axe to grind. Remember what you're paying for. A week in Jamiaca at a 5-star resort cost us $4,500. This cost us $2,100 for the same length of stay.Enjoy, feel free to contact me for questions.  
<Date>Jun 6, 2007

<Author>BonkersGloucester
<Content>Sun, Sea, Sand and.......Sangria!!! Me and my friend stayed at the hotel from may 7th through to may 22nd and had a really good time. the flight was really long so by the time we arrived at the hotel we were a bit pooped but were warmly welcomed with a cocktail and quickly checked in. We were assigned to block three, the rooms were pretty basic but clean, tidy and had everything you needed. The shower was hot and the mini fridge was stocked, It was also great value for money. It was possible to upgrade our room to block 7 for $350 over the two weeks but we were happy with what we had even though we saw the rooms in block 7 and they were amazing.The actual hotel was stunning, from the lobby to the beach and was all very well maintained. The staff worked very hard to keep it all clean and tidy.The hotel had three restaurants plus a buffet. Our favourite was the Italian Dal Mario's. The food was out of this world and the service was impeccible, Mr Frank the manager couldn't do enough for us and was soooo friendly and helpfull. The American grill was also good with really friendly staff and nice food. Cant really understand the reviews where people say they couldnt find anything edible cos they had everything! Obviously your not gonna like all the food but i think some people are just too fussy.The beach was just beautifull, crystal clear water and white sands, who cares about a bit of seaweed?? They cleaned the beach every morning anyway. The pools were also really nice, especially the lazy river pool which was really chilled out and quiet.Night life was pretty good too. There was a nightly show which was always a laugh and you saw some really good dancing, especially in the Michael Jackson show, even if they were cr*p at miming!! The umbrella bar was cool and had a really nice barman who's name i forgot, they had Karaoke most nights which was good but most of the songs were in spanish so we didnt have a clue what they were singin about!! The disco was ok, played a range of music but got a bit boring after a while. They do a disco tour every night though if you fancy a change but we gave that a miss.They've got some wicked excursions too and i thought they were pretty cheap. We went snorkling, on safari and quad biking and had a great time on all of them. We also went kayaking and had a scuba lesson which were both free.The only thing i would complain about would be some of the staff especially the entertainment staff. Dont get me wrong, most of them were really friendly especially the ones at the front desk, beach towel hut and some of the barmen. HOWEVER as we didnt speak spanish some staff took full advantage of that and there were times when they seemed to be having a private joke on our behalf. ha ha, we have now taken up spanish lessons!! Us being two young women we found the blokes to be a little overly friendly (If you know what i mean.....) which became a bit annoying after a while.We tipped quite a lot, especially the maids and the room service. I wouldnt say it got us better service though as they tried their best anyway, i think if you smile and are friendly and use good manners then you are treated with the same attitude. Some of the spanish and American people were so rude to the staff though and treated them with no respect at all. The bar staff seemed to put up with it in case they got a tip which i thought was quite sad. There were very few English people around when we were at the hotel, mostly spanish and American but we still made a few good friends and had a good time.All in all we had a wicked time and would definatley go back again if given the chance but only if we spoke better spanish!  
<Date>May 25, 2007

<Author>daddypuss
<Content>worst hotel in twelve years to dom rep. just returned from this hotel and can honestly say this is the worst hotel i have stayed in twelve years of travelling to the dom. rep.if you want to spend your vacation on a construction site, well thats up to you.the so called quiet adults pool was yards away from a pnumatic concrete breaker working from 8am till 6pm every day and in and throughout the property, workmen banging and drilling ,with plaster and cement dust on floors in the corridors all day.each morning you were woken up at 6am to loud music from bars, but this was very handy, as this was the time to go to the beach to reserve your shade,(cause any later you had no chance).the so called entertainment at the theatre was a joke unless you were aged from 5 years to 7ish,and the highlight of the week, the micheal jackson show was pathetic compared to other hotel chains.to be fair to the staff ie. the maids, barmen,waiters gardeners etc.they did a very good job and deserve all tips they get.usually i dont like my vacation to come to an end, but after spending two weeks at this hotel, i was actually glad to be leaving, and will never return.

<Author>yveyEngland
<Content>brilliant brilliant brilliant myself,husband,brother and sister in law have just returned from a fantastic 2wks at the punta cana grand we were celebrating our wedding anniversarys and to everyone who have wrote bad reviews on this resort i have great pleasure in saying how very wrong you were.Having read bad reviews prior to our departure we strongly considered cancelling. how glad we were we didnt.Everyone working at the resort from caren the rooms manager to the gardeners were extremely friendly. we ate at windows all the time simply because the food and servicewere excellant,the waiters were very friendly and couldnt do enough for us[and not for tips as we didnt tip anyone until we left as we believe in tipping to say thank you not just because its expected] we got to know everyone by their first names and when we spoke to them in our brocken spanish their faces lit uo and readily spoke back. we stayed in building 5,caren gave us ajoining rooms which were very spacious and comfortable. the maid service were very good, fresh decorated towels everyday and the rooms kept very clean. the fridge was re stocked every day with sodas beer and water, again not for tips as we left her a tip when we left. On several occasions we saw caren walking around the resort and she always made the time to come and chat and ask if everythink was ok. the entertainment staff were first class very friendly[look out for olivia and chockolate] two very friendly,funny people] if you want to have fun and join in the activities. the evening shows especially the Michael Jackson show were second to none ,very very proffesional. we walked on the beach several times every day and yes at 6am they were some seaweed after all it is the ocean!! but by 7am it had been cleared away.we always managed to get sunloungers both at the beach and by the pool and the beach towels were always available. we would like to say a great big thank you to caren and her staff for helping make this holiday one of our best and if you are considering going to this resort, i strongly reccomend you give it a try, go and have a good time, you will have the best time ever,we did and were sorry to leave.

<Author>ttraniello
<Content>Globalia, Beautiful place with bad food and drink My husband and I went to the (Globalia) Grand Oasis Resort from 5/16/07-5/20/07. Upon arrival to the airport, you are expected to pay $10.00 (US Dollars) per person for a photo that is supposed to be some kind of country entrance ID. They tell you you can have it when you leave the country. What they don't tell you is that you have to pay another $8.00(US Dollars) for it! The Globalia itself was a very beautiful resort. We stayed in new building 7. It was very comfortable and clean. The beach and pools were great! If you want an umbrella at the pools or the beach, get one in the early morning . The resort employees are all very nice and work very hard to make you happy. We tipped even though it wasn't expected. This is a very poor country. They all speak English fairly well, so no worries if you do not speak Spanish. There seemed to be a black out with no power or hot water every afternoon for about an hour. It really wasn't a big deal. It became funny after a while. When the power finally comes back on, cheers are heard from all over the resort. I will say the the food and drink is terrible. Edible, but terrible. We just kept in mind that we were in a different country! Breakfast is okay. We never got sick or had any problems. We used bottled water for everything. We went on a day trip to Santo Domingo through Amstar/Apple Vacations. It was great. Angel, our tour guide was wonderful. It is about a 3 1/2 hour drive each way. If you have any kind of driving fears, it may not be for you. The trip was one wild ride! Probably the scariest drives I have ever been on! There are no real rules to the roads or driving. They all drive like maniacs! Dominicans are true professionals in defensive driving. It's a constant game of chicken with other cars and drivers turning small 2 lane roads into 3. It's very scary! On our trip, there were a lot of screams from fearful passengers on our tour bus! Nobody wears seat belts, and you will see a lot of motorcycles. It 's their form of a taxi. No helmets. No protection. I even saw a newborn baby on the back of one in the arms of their mother. It was a scary sight. For them, its a way of life. If you are grossed out in any way with meat, be prepared. The city streets have freshly killed meats hanging with the heads still attached. I guess they are killed in the morning. It's a frightful sight. We were told they hang there all day until 7:00pm. Yes... they hang there all day. Out in the open heat and air. Kind of gross. Its a real shock. I did not eat any meat while in the Dominican.  
<Date>May 21, 2007
<Rating>3	3	5	3	5	4	5	3

<Author>Four_Beachbums
<Content>Neutral Opinion We went to this resort April 20-27. We read all the reviews from various sites and found the resort to be a mix of the good and the not so good, all of which depends on your priorities. Reading the negative reviews made me want to post my own because we found the resort to be quite nice, although a few flaws noted.Beach had a lot of seaweed, although this apparently is not always the case. There were plenty of chairs but not many huts so we did set our alarm to reserve one. Unfortunately you had to.Pools at various locations so all buildings are relatively close to one. Topless bathers only permitted at the adult pool tucked behind building 5 which some families preferred. Any Pools I saw did not have a deep end which may be nice for kids. Worked well for activities and walking to the swim-up bar. I havent mastered the art of swimming with beverages in hand.I would advise the hotel to purchase more towels or puchase more washing machines - the pool and room towel rotation is very slow, we had to ask for extra towels and a face cloth and did wait almost daily for blue towels.Activities were well posted and organized, Playstation units were available in the core area with pool tables, current movies played each night in the theatre. Shows were good, many of us agreed the Michael Jackson show is the best resort show we ever saw. The Magician was really good as well. Dancers were fabulous, guests need to remember its not Las Vegas, there is a lot of effort put into these shows. We played volleyball, pool and darts. There is always something to do and it was never too busy.I received a rude attitude from one person at the front desk, but equally met two dozen members of staff who were exceptional. I meet rude employees at home sometimes too. That's life.We stayed in building 5, we did notice the room a little musty at first but just left the balcony open for a few hours and the fresh air and AC cleared it up. We had a few ants but nothing I bothered to complain about, the furniture is relatively new, the rooms are clean. We didnt hear anything about bad room experiences. I was annoyed about the late afternoon room cleaning because towels were arriving late. Building 5 was nice because the adult pool has a bar which is only attended by the patrons of that pool so the bar was never busy AND it is one of the closest buildings to all the restaurants AND it is partially right on the beach although no rooms face the beach.There was some construction taking place off property next to building 5 but they worked reasonable hours and never really disturbed us. Although I'm sure it may have annoyed the people trying to use that pool during the day. The pathway around building 4 to building 5 does pass something that is a little smelly (perhaps the sewage treatment I'm not sure) we did notice it but only while passing by. No other construction noted.I couldnt hear the people in the rooms next to me but I could complain that the noise in the hallway travels and echos. Luck of the draw whether you have quiet people in your building or not. Plus, the humidity must make the door frames shift because you had to slam your door to get it to close which was part of the hallway noise problem. I did find it inappropriate to charge for the room safe, that is typically included for free at other resorts I've been to.We found the main buffet to be the best resort food we have ever had. They make fruit smoothies, eggs to order, great pancakes, french toast, bacon, you name it. Fresh fruit selection could be a little better, if you care for that sort of thing. Al a cart restaurants were a nice change, we personally preferred the buffet.The beach dinner on Thursday is stunning. They close all the restaurants and set up all the tables and servery on the beach. The movie and show take place on the beach as well. Unique and a HUGE effort by the staff.We did the free guided bike ride which was something different and nice. We went through the side street of town so dont worry about the bus traffic. Then it goes along the back side of another resort's golf course, then a private trail for the excursions (ATV and horses were sharing our route). Then you stop at a beach area and head back. The tour is about an hour but he will take you longer if you want to. I dont know if the route changes but that was ours.I found the excursions a little expensive, but the resort is further from the main Bavaro stretch of beach so that may be the reason. We did the Tropical Storm which was great. Large catamaran goes near the ship wreck site at Bavaro beach, then to the largest inflatable slide, then snorkelling and a ocean area for regular swimming - the toss an inflatable bar in the water and you can stand around, pick shells, walk the beach. They provide lunch as well. Nothing fancy.I used the gym twice. It was adequate if you're not an athlete. Weights were ok, two treadmills, crosstrainer, rowing machine. A weigh scale which is off by a few lbs but that will impress you when you get home and realize you didnt gain as much as you thought!!They let you walk through the spa if you want to see it. It was very nice. If I went back I would definately book something there.The grounds were spectacular, lots of greens and grass.Did not hear of any crime or troubles.The disco is not very good but I found similar situation in another DR resort as well last time I was there. However, they have a disco tour where the bus will take you to the good discos at 11:00pm. two nights of the week. We didnt do it but it was available.There is a lounge behind the elevator where you can play cards or board games. We discovered it on our second last night (of course). There is a TV in there that gets channels you cant get in your room if you're hoping to see the hockey playoffs or special programming. The room TVs did get many of the North American channels - we watched a few of our favorite evening shows.Bring an insulated reusable cup - dont add to the litter of this world. Plus it gives you a larger drink that stays cold longer.Bring a mini container of hand sanitizer, I've heard that the easiest way to get sick at any resort is from sharing tongs at the buffet.. Use the sanitizer before handling your food.If you are the type of traveller to leave gifts for your room cleaner (many of whom were men here), bring ballcaps or baseball stuff for the men and fragrances for the ladies. We didnt really have an opporunity to give stuff to the kids in town but you can do that as well. They ask for school supplies. Gum was very popular as well. Bring $1 bills for tipping, the staff really appreciate it and they deserve it. Tip a variety of people, not always the maid or bartender. I gave a dollar and a pack of gum to a grounds keeper and he greeted me every day thereafter. There is a stretch of vendors on the beach to the left where you can buy items cheaper than the hotel shops. When you walk the beach, expect them to ask you to visit their store but they dont push you to. They may give you their business card or ask your name. HOWEVER, once you are in their store they beg you to buy anything cheapie-cheapie. I felt so guilty I bought something almost everywhere even if was just a $2. figurine. They always suggest a price to you which is way too much, I dont understand this but it is how it is done. Think reasonably what you would pay at home. I paid $3 sml coffee $5 lrg, $20 medium painting, $60 for largest painting, $6 necklace). The vendors on resort property have to pay a fee to the hotel to be onsite so they rightfully need to ask more. When I walked the beach later in the week and they approached me, I told them I was already in their store or I already bought a painting and they thanked me and left me alone, I should have thought of that strategy earlier in the week I suppose..Overall, I tell people to relax, you're on vacation in a remote location. You may see a bug or two, big or small (although we did NOT see any worth mentioning). You have them at home too, they are just hidden better. For the most part, this resort is great as long as your expectations are not over the top. This hotel is posted as a 5-star which is a little high in my opinion but it does deserve a 4-star. Food is great, shows are good, great for famillies or a quiet week. If the price was right we would go to this resort again. Hope that helps.

<Author>kmcecilia
<Content>Not Hot .. if You Can Avoid the Stay Please do so  We booked a room with two beds. Upon arrival, all goes well until my sister and I get to the room, this room only had 1 bed. We called the reception desk they told us they would bring a bed to the room, lord only know what they were going to bring us (a fold out?). During our wait we inspected the room, the bathroom looked old, the sheets seemed unwashed, the mattress was falling apart, the pillows didn't have pillow covers, discusting, there was one towel in the bathroom. We had a wedding to attend at the resort and to avoid being late, I went to the reception desk to try and speed things up. I got nothing but attitude and a reluctance to help, when I requested another room, the guy at the desk aimed his employee badge at me, as if that was supposed to scare me or something. The man's name Epilio. Epilio went over the the individual that set us up originally and told him, in spanish, take care of your own [--], i'm not fixing this crap for you. Knowing I understood every word. Juan, not sure about the name, he moved us to another room with two bed and pillow covers. At that point I had realized that if i didn't know the language, I would have been screwed. We got to the other room to find it tolerable, but did notice that the mini fridge had never been cleaned and the refreshments in it looked 20 years old. Went to shower and discovered there was no water pressure. I was forced to shower under a trickle of water.  I was happy I did not bring my son along on this trip.The beach is beautiful, if this is supposed to be a family friendly resort, I didn't understand why every one was top less. The hotel should post that kind of activity, since it is allowed around children. I know i didn't get the memo.The food was mediocre, We were careful on what we chose, there fruit selection was poor (no strawberry's, oranges, grapes etc) there salad selection was poor, all they had was lettuce. Whatever was at the snack shop was not at all edible. The activities were minimal, nothing to do, and what there was to do was an extra additional cost. The highlight of the evenings were the shows, Michael Jackson show and the Dominican show.I have always known the people of DR to be very happy and helpful, this is my first experience encountering the oppisite at this resort.

<Author>SavannahWanderer
<Content>Wonderful Relaxation My two friends and I stayed at the Globalia the week of May 2 through May 8. I must say that I was concerned about the booking after reading some of the reviews, but we decided to go into the week with no expectations. What I can say is that we had the most relaxing wonderful experience. The service we received was excellent....from the bartenders to the front desk guys to the maids. Everything we asked for was provided...and was provided with a smile. I think the most important thing to remember is that if you give respect to someone and treat them nicely, they will in turn, treat you with the same. The food was fine and the service in the restaurants was wonderful. No problem getting ill...just be smart about what you are eating and drinking. A previous review stated the house wine was not that good....I would definitely agree. So, just buy a better bottle or find something else to drink.I would also agree about previous comments made about finding a chair under one of the huts. We never made it out there early enough to grab one, so maybe the resort could do better with respect to this. I will say, that no matter when we went out - to the beach or the pool - there were always adequate chairs available. Not once was there not a chair for us to use.The beach is beautiful...a small amount of seaweed, but nothing that is terrible. I advise everyone to walk down the beach...past the shops and other resorts. The beach is practically deserted and the water is absolutely wonderful. Saw many fish and starfish. Oh, take your own snorkel equipment....the resort only allows you one hour with their equipment and you must stay on the resort to use it.My suggestions for a wonderful experience:1) Take an insulated mug/cup....cuts down on trips to the bar and keeps your drinks cold2) Take several dollar bills for tips....the staff really do appreciate the gesture3) Take your own snorkel equipment and beach towels4) And finally....take a good attitude. You are coming to the beach to relax.....try to let go of all the little things. Remember you are on a beautiful beach with cold drinks and good food. And, always, smile.  
<Date>May 9, 2007

<Author>belochka
<Content>The BEST vacation ever! I read 2 bad reviews and could not understand who wrote them. My family and I stayed at this resort for 7 nights at the end of April 2007. We absolutely loved it! The first day was a bit disorganized as the room was not ready on time however the rest was just absolutely above my expectations. The beach was clean and beautiful, the room was comfortable and clean. It was cleaned every day and decorated with fresh flowers. The food there is just a delight, especially desert. Fresh fruit and fresh juices of different kinds every day. The stuff was very friendly and made us feel at home. The resort area was very clean. I loved the activities so much: aerobics and kids club (I traveled with my son) during the day as well as movies and different performances every night. The performances were very professionally organized with beautiful costumes and special effects. There were also a lot of other activities available like boat tours etc. but as I was with my mom and a toddler we did not take any.We also met many people from Canada and US (including those who booked through Apple Vacations) and they all were happy about their stay in this resort.My mom visited Punta Cana Princess resort last year but after visiting Punta Cana Grand this time with me said that Punta Cana Grand was much better. We had the best vacation ever. I told all my friends about it and I am planning to visit it next year with my family and a couple of friends. I would highly recommend it to anyone, especially families with kids.  
<Date>May 7, 2007

<Author>PaPittsburgh
<Content>Definately not a 5 apple resort!!!!! OK where do I begin!!!! We stayed at this resort the 21st-27th of April...Before we left, I read the reviews...some good and some bad well I can see where the bad ones came from but not the good ones.We arrived around 11:30 from a direct flight from Pittsburgh. (Good Flight on time) When we got there our room was not ready so they gave us an armband and told us to go ahead and use the resort..We asked where we could eat lunch since we had been traveling since early am and they said that we could not eat until 1:30 at the main restaurant and 12:30 at the beach grill.( So we quickly found out you cant eat when you want to unless you want to eat the food on the beach that has been in the sun all day) .We went to the restroom and changed into our suits and headed to the pool to catch some sun...That is when it all began. We could not find one chair to sit in...They were all completely taken so we had to sit on the cement in the sun with all of our carry on bags, purses, money, etc....We went to the grill to eat and not a very good taste of food...French Fries and omelets were the safest bet...When our room was finally ready more than an hour after they said it would be...what a disaster we walked into...We were in building 3 on the first floor, the smell that came out out of our room was nauseating. It smelled just like the sewer system on a hot day....i walked in to find incense burning stuck in a crack in the wall to cover up the smell....had to put a card in the wall to keep the air on and 4 cockroaches greeted me also. I told the maid about it and she just smiled and said Hola!!!! We went to the front desk only to get no help from them and only rudeness!!!! We had been traveling with friends and were to be booked by them...well we werent!!! We actually had been booked in building 7 and them in building 3. We didnt know one room number from the other so when asked to be switched near them that was no problem cause they were happy to give away smelly dirty roach infested rooms...When asking to be switched to another room they said that it was my fault i was were I was because we were upgraded to begin with at no extra charge... and there were no rooms to switch to...I would have to deal with it...Who would no room numbers??????We booked our trip through apple vacations and when we found our rep..he was no help either...said they would try to get us out of the rooms but wasnt sure if we could move....At this point my relaxing vacation was Stressful.!!!!!! We were there for 5 minutes and met a couple of people who were just as dissatisfied as we were....Finally the next day we were moved and had to pay for an upgraded room for the rest of our stay which wasnt that great either....to sum them up..water on the floors....ants all over the room....hard to get clean towels.....maids wouldnt clean your room till 4 in the afternoon so forget about relaxing from the sun.....had to run the airconditioning so that you wouldnt wake up with damp clothes in the morning..Its a wonder we didnt have pneumonia. Maids do not knock so keep your doors locked..do not really clean your rooms and if you dont have your towels on the floor in a pile you don't get new ones...No matter if you tip or not.You need to be up at 5am to get a chair by the pool...so be prepared....early riser you will be..Service at dining areas is slow so if you want drinks with your meal bring your own from one of the bars cause you will be done eating before you get it...Service is very so at the Italian Restaurant so be prepared. We waited 25 minutes just to get waited on...We were warned no to eat at the beach party on Thursday Nite...You Will get sick...food is prepared and set out all day long before the party starts...We made the best of the trip.....only cause you are basically stuck there if you dont. No flights out even if you want to leave...We did enjoy the shows they performed at night...Michael Jackson is a Must See!!!It was great.....And if you want to do and excursion go on the Kon-Tiki Tour....The bus ride is long but it is well worth the money....You get to snorkel for an hour and then party for 3 more....Lots of dancing and Fun !!! we enjoyed this....This is not a 5 apple resort at all....They are fooling you by saying that it is.....We will not ever go back to this resort Ever...Make sure you stay farther up on the carribean...Iberostar resorts, barcelo...are ones that have been highly recommended by friends of ours who go every year..We were talked into this resort by our travel agent....(She definately got a phone call when we got back)We will never go back to this resort and this experience has left a bad taste in our mouth about Punta Cana....Just beware of what you are booking for!!! Read the reviews....5 apples arent all what they seem...We would hate to see what a 2 or 3 apple was like!!!  
<Date>May 5, 2007

<Author>unhappytraveler7
<Content>This is not paradise! My husband and I booked this trip through Apple Vacations. We were given false hope and was told this was a 5 star resort, I would rate it as a 2 star. Our first nights stay was awful. There was a horrible smell in our room, cockroaches and it was dirty. The bathroom door was falling off the hings and the iron did not work. Our Apple rep at the resort strongly suggested we use the safe in our room, which by the way they don't tell you cost and extra $15.  The next morning we decided to upgrade our rooms, the front desk staff could not have been more rude. Finally when they said they had a room, they told us it would be ready at 12:00pm. Wrong....we made several trips to the front desk only to be told come back. I feel this became a fun game to them. The new upgraded room was better,but the floor was constantly wet. Not damp, I mean soaking wet. When we asked the maids about it they just shrugged their shoulders. We were lucky if they would clean our room by 6:00pm and give us a clean towel. Our shower drain did not work. After each shower we had to use our foot as a plunger! The food was not bad, but the service is SLOW!!! One night we made reservations in the Italian resturant and waited 20 minutes at our table before anyone even brought us water.The pool was fun, although there is a lot of nagging to participate in games from the staff.The shows in the evening were good.All in all anyone we met at the resort felt they were given false hope of their vacation too. I may visit Punta Cana again, but I will NEVER visit this resort again. Be careful of the name changes. Our Apple rep told us they had just changed the name of the resort thats why it was such a good deal.  
<Date>May 3, 2007

<Author>Sponge_Bob7
<Content>Excellent resort for a great price My family and I stated at the Punta Cana Grand from April 23 to April 30th. I was a little concerned about what we were in for from reading some of the reviews - but was more than pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Our plane was delayed so we arrived late afternoon but were immediately made to feel right at home on this resort. The resort is beautiful - very well kept, easy to get around, well laid out. The staff are wonderful - so patient and kind and really seem to be interested in making your stay a good one. We were immediately shown to our rooms which were connected and on the second floor in building 3. The rooms are spacious and clean. We never had a problem getting clean towels, the air conditioning worked and the mini bar was filled everyday. The food is wonderful at this resort. We ate at all of the a la carte restaurants - twice at the American Grill. The pico de gallo and tortilla chips were a hit with my vegetarian daughters. They never had a problem finding something on the menu - and the staff were more than obliging to make them a special plate. Da Marcos is amazing - the food was delicious, the service was amazing and the atmosphere was classy. And yes, there is seaweed on the beach - it's the sea! But everyday it was raked up. It was a little frustrating to have to get up at the crack of dawn to find a beach umbrella - but this is the fault of the visitors not the staff at the hotel. I think that some people put towels on the chairs under the umbrellas in the evening 'just in case' they needed them. I noticed that many chairs never had any people sitting in them. In fact, the only drawback to our stay at the Punta Cana Grand had nothing at all to do with the hotel staff and everything to do with the people staying there who 'drank all day,' (and sang a song about it) sat around the pool bar and were loud and obnoxious. We were shocked at how rude some of the 'guests' were - perhaps these are the same people complaining about this hotel? The entertainment in the evening was really quite good. The magician was amazing and we really enjoyed the Michael Jackson show - great dancing and costumes. There is lots to do on this resort and Anthony and his coworkers are great at getting people involved. I started to wonder if they ever slept - they were there early in the morning and late at night - always smiling. There are people on the beach trying to sell you various items - but say no thanks politely and they walk away. We had some sun and some rain and some wind - not much you can do about the weather. It sure beats the snow we encountered when we arrived home! To sum up - I would definitely come back to this resort. Great food, great people, lovely beach - what more can you ask for?  
<Date>May 1, 2007

36	0(staff):1	3(clean):1	8(day):1	9(service):1	10(restaurant):1	16(food):2	22(pool):1	26(people):1	27(bar):2	47(eat):1	48(wonderful):1	63(drink):1	72(resort):1	125(towel):1	145(amaze):2	164(air):1	169(sit):1	225(la):1	263(condition):1	287(cana):1	289(punta):1	347(twice):1	365(grand):1	414(atmosphere):1	416(loud):1	448(mini):1	485(delicious):1	491(fill):1	605(everyday):1	629(grill):1	681(carte):1	1344(drawback):1	1488(classy):1	1668(sing):1	2474(song):1	3226(obnoxious):1
