<Author>beachbumsNovaScotia
<Content>Just the right size resort We left Halifax on the 7th of April traveling with Air Canada vacations. All was well, flight was on time, had to de-ice the plane, but that is normal this time of year. Had a good flight, warm breakfast meal on board, two choices. Arrived in Punta Cana, and when the doors opened, the heat rushed in, a wonderful feeling. As you arrive, there are Dominican girls dressed in costumes and they take your picture as you enter the airport. You walk across the tarmac from the plane and that is when you really feel the heat. When you leave a week later, the picture is waiting for you to purchase if you want it, at a cost of $8.00 American or $10.00 Canadian. It was good quality so we purchased it as we were leaving. Had a great flight back, on one of the new Air Canada A320 jets with individual tvs and bigger seats and choice of two hot meals. Flight went fast and was on time.The ride to the airport was a little bumpy. There is a new road, but it still a bit bumpy. Eventually it will be a 2 lane highway. We didn mind. We were in a mini-bus with the closed in trailer attached for our luggage. Only 8 of us going to our hotel, so we got on our way immediately. It was only about a 20 minute drive to the resort.No line up to check in, got our luggage, and we were given our package from the desk clerk, we were assigned Room 3202 in Building 3. Very close to everything, middle floor. We had the last room at the end of the hall in the villa and it had a wrap around deck. We were very pleased with our room. There is a separate vanity, sink area, and a door closes to the toilet, shower area. Large tub with nice large area to lay your shampoos and toiletries at the foot of the bathtub. Water pressure was great and we always had plenty of hot water for showers. We arrived at the resort around 11:30 AM and were told to leave our luggage, given tags to claim it, that the rooms were not ready until 2-3 and to go enjoy the resort. We had a few drinks, went for lunch and shortly after before 2 we got our rooms and were ready to hit the water.The room was very large with a large dresser, lots of drawer space, and an armoire, with 4 more drawers and enclosed TV, and mini fridge. A few cans of beer and lots of bottled water. Every day this was topped up if we drank anything and lots of water was left. There was also a coffee maker, ice bucket, and a table and chairs. Two night tables, phone. Very well equipped room. Hair dryer in bathroom that worked very well. Makeup mirror on the wall. And the best part was the quiet air-conditioner with the ceiling fan. Hardly knew it was on. It didn shut off either when the patio door was opened or when we left our room. Safe worked well. Lots of closet space and shelves for folded clothing. We didn have to put a card in a slot either to keep the air-conditioner running. Ice Machines in each villa building. Also, there is a nice seating area on each floor at each entrance with nice wicker padded chairs to sit in. There is always a nice breeze blowing in.Everything is close at this resort. The main bar, at the front and pool bar at the back is in the middle, just a few steps from the large marble lobby. The lobby has two staircases that go up to the second floor where the disco and piano bar and the tour operators have an office. There is a nice lazy river pool between two of the sets of villas. It was nice to go there in the afternoons as it wasn as crowded and the water was cooler and very clean. Nice steps leading into it. There is an adult pool as well, but we didn bother with it as it was a very hot week, and the adult pool is more secluded and you didn get a breeze. Very hot here in this area of the resort. Nice little bar beside it but we needed a breeze. The week we were in the Dominican, it was at least 35+ degrees, sunny everyday and not a drop of rain. We lucked in.The main pool is a fairly decent size. Ie seen bigger, but for the size of this resort, it holds everyone. The pool bar also gets some sun, which is nice because I have found many pool bars seem to be shaded and believe it or not, can get a little cool there. Drinks were great, and flowing plenty. We never had a problem getting drinks. The bar tenders were always friendly whether or not you tipped them. The language barrier wasn a problem either, a lot of the entertainers and the bartenders spoke very good English. At the main bar there is a hot dog machine all day and evening and you help yourself. Very good hot dogs and fresh rolls. Also a popcorn machine at night that you can help yourself.Down at the Beach Grill, you can either go inside or outside, and help yourself. They have lots of fresh salad fixings, fruit, a few hot dishes, hamburgers, hotdogs, pastas, desserts. Outside, there is fresh pizza, nachos with salsa and guacamole and cheese sauce. A Panini sandwich maker, with fixings for sandwiches, fried chicken, hamburgers, hotdogs. No shortage of food. Ice cream in all the restaurants. I can see how anyone could complain about the food at this place. If you didn like something there were lots of other choices. The beach is very close to the pool and to most of the rooms. Everything is close and handy. We had a great deal of fun with the Entertainers and found their English very good. They worked hard to keep people involved in the activities and it was fun to watch them as they were full of energy, no matter how hot it was nor how long of a day they put in. The shows at night were very good as well. We went to the casino once, spent $10.00 in the slot machines, had two beer and left. It was nice but we are not casino people.The food was plentiful, Windows is the main buffet. The beef is a little tough, if you got slices of it, but if it was in fajitas, or at the specialty restaurants, it was very tender. There was always a lot of choice of meals for anyone who wanted something different, lots of variety of fresh fruit. Good omelets for Breakfast, good breads. There was a Mexican themed night, and a Dominican themed night at supper, other nights, I can recall. The Beach party night is the best. They work very hard to make this a fantastic evening for everyone. Dancing on the beach, wonderful meals, the workers take all day to set this up. It a must for anyone at this resort. They close the restaurants that night (Thursday) and everyone attends the beach party. Good entertainment as well. We tried the Italian Restaurant and we had very good meals. The steak here and the pork were wonderful. Pasta was good as well as the soups and the appetizers. Desserts we chose were Strawberry Cheesecake and Chocolate Cake, and everyone said they were perfect. Best cappuccino as well, very creamy and rich. We met many people from all areas of the Globe at this resort. It was the break for teachers in the US, so we met people from Wisconsin and Newfoundland, plus lots of other places. People were very friendly. Being at a smaller resort, you saw the same person more than once, and it made it nicer as you got to have conversations with the same people on a daily basis. We had a lot of fun with everyone we met. We would not hesitate to recommend this resort to everyone. I too had read the reviews about the resort prior to going, and can figure out what people were complaining about. We loved the size of it, the staff were great, the place is clean, well cared for, beach is nice, well groomed. The workers are always fixing up the grounds, and cleaning. They could use a few more chairs around the pool area and beach or some rules about saving chairs. You did have to get up at 6:00 AM or so to get a chair. I think they should implement a policy that you cannot put towels on your chairs at night to reserve them. Many resorts stack the chairs at night, so you have to put them out in the daytime. Perhaps this would work so that people didn reserve the chairs after midnight and more people would be able to use the huts at the beach or pool. Carin, the manager, is great to deal with. She cares about the travelers, and wants to solve any problems they may have in a courteous manner. If Globalia staff read these reviews, I would highly recommend that they seriously consider changing your house wine. The white house wine is not drinkable. The red is drinkable, but not of very good quality. We have traveled to All Inclusive resorts for the past 12 years, and this was the first resort that we could not drink the wine, which we really enjoy with our meals. This is not a complaint, and did not change the way we felt about the resort. There were lots of other drinks, but I do enjoy wine with my meals, and missed having it especially at supper. You do have the option to purchase bottles of better wine starting at $25.00 US Dollars, but being at an All Inclusive, I didn feel it was worth the extra money to upgrade the wine when I was only there for 7 days. I could do without. Otherwise I think Globalia is doing a great job with this resort and consider it definitely a 4+ star.

<Author>goffyluv1
<Content>Nice Grounds But that was it Travel from April 22nd to 29th........Ok I read all the reviews before I left but thought how bad can it be... well I didn't know what I was getting into. First I booked with Apple Vacations in which they have it as a 5 star... this hotel is not 5 star it's more like 3. I see good and bad reviews and all I got to say is I'm happy to hear some people have a good time at this hotel we didn't come across anyone when we were there that thought highly of it.The only good things I can say about this Hotel is that it has a wonderful beach and the grounds are kept up. They have shows every night and most of the people are friendly. We took a trip to Saona which was the great. I would recommend this plus they have a lunch that was so tasty.Will I return not a chance. I would say if you are going to go to this hotel just be aware and not to expect much.When we were there 1 out of 5 people was sick for at least 3 days and we heard of many people getting stuff taken from their rooms. For some reason maybe we went at the wrong time but in talking to others at the hotel I don't think anyone there will return. People say to tip well we did but it did do any good once you gave a tip they just walked away and you never saw them again. There is construction going on around the Hotel so relaxing at the adult pool was not possible unless you like Hammers going.Here are some of the issues we had:Check In: Is suppose to be at 3 if you get there early they will give you a band and let you use the grounds. If they give you a time your room will be ready forget about it. It won't be ready till an hour after they say.If it rains water: If you get a room on the first floor and it rains make sure you have nothing on the floor because water will come down the hallway and into your room. If you call the front desk they will do nothing but say they will come by after the rain stops.Towels: If you enjoy taking baths or washing up don't think you will get any towels. And if you think your going to call the front desk and they say they will bring you towels forget about it. You will have to go to the front desk every day to request towels and don't think you will get them before 5 pm. Mostly they just hand the dirty ones. Oh beware they don't know before going into your room.Room getting clean: If your a person that enjoys a break from the sun in the afternoon don't think you will enjoy it in a clean rooms. Rooms don't get cleaned between 4-6 pm. Sickness: There is a good chance you will get sick. So bring medicine with you. If you need to go to the doctor just know that the visit will cost $150 just to see the doctor plus what ever medicine he gives you so total around $280Service: You like to have water or pop when you eat your meal you can forget about this. Waiters are very slow and most of the time we just got up and got our own drinks. They have more fun talking at the bar then helping you out.Food: One thing that was good was the room service. Don't eat the burgers because they are not done and make sure you check everything you eat. They have a way to cook fast which means not all the way done. Not taste to their food at all.  
<Date>May 1, 2007

<Author>alansophia
<Content>How it's changed since Sunscape ownership On our return journey from Sunscape Casa del Mar in February, my wife  I were informed (by the senior Thomson rep at Punta Cana), that the Oasis Group had now taken over running Globalia Punta Cana Grand, formerly (when we last stayed there in 2004  2005) Sunscape Punta Cana Grand; now known as Grand Oasis Punta Cana; and that Thomson were to market the resort in the UK. So we decided to book a week in April to check it out, to see if the resort had declined or improved:We have to admit that, overal, the resort has improved in many areas. Our pre-arrival contact with Caren de Vries (one of the Managers who stayed on after Sunscape), resulted in our being afforded a welcome back suite in one of the various new blocks, which are fantastic. If you go to the resort, try and get room 6207. It doesn't have a sea view, but it's a fantastic suite and close to the adult pool.The service, friendliness and attention to detail afforded by all the resort's staff has noticeably improved, and they are really great.Felix (the Resteraunts Supervisor; still there from Sunscape days) continues to do everything he can for you, whichever resteraunt you go to. Rolando (at the Beach Cafe lunchtime; at the Italian evenings), always ensured there was a chilled bottle of wine on the table as you rolled off the beach for lunch.The beach squad were on the beach every morning clearing the overnight seaweed invasion. HOWEVER, since we were last there in 2005, the lagoon itself has become overun by seaweed and is constantly floating loose in the water, making it not very enjoyable to swim in. It's not a problem if you're a Pool person, but my wife  I are Beach Bums so I have to admi thatt the seaweed is a downer in our books.The food is the standard you come to expect at any Dominican resort. It has depreciated in quality and variety since Sunscape, but it's still mostly enjoyable whether bufet or a la carte, usually helped down by (in our case) chilled white wine or, on Managers cocktail night, by champagne.In all, it remains a very good, well run resort. It's intimate; not big and overcrowded like some of the other places. It is still far better than Sunscape The Beach, but not quite as good as Sunscape Casa del Mar.By the way, Sunscape are bowing out of Casa del Mar in October 2007, and the Barcelo Group will take over the reort.  
<Date>Apr 30, 2007
<Rating>4	5	5	4	5	5	5	5

<Author>nicci_1
<Content>The Best Ever Holiday- (please read) I want to go to the same resort every single year every month if I could.I loved it so much I cried when I left it.I have never ever wanted to stay somewhere for more than two weeks but this hotel I could live there.I have read some of the reviews and alot of you are picking on little things like the food.the food is really good I think:American grill- get given margarita's to start and you have a choice from a amazing range of food from starter through to dessertBeach restaurant- this is the same sort of way as the American grill except you are over looking the sea under a large cabana.Demarco- is a very posh Italian and again it has a very good variety of food.Windows- this is a buffet that you don need to book for and it has a lot of choice of food for you to choose from and it isn the same all the time it had different night like a Spanish night etc.Beach party- this isn a restaurant but it us the night that all of the above restaurants are closed and all the staff spend all day preparing for the part very Thursday it is amazing fresh meat being carved, home Dominican stew simmering in a large cauldron above the ground, the entertain ment is amazing.The rooms are immaculate and very clean they get cleaned every day and are done to a high standard when you first go into your room it is presented beautifully with towels made of swans and decorated by fresh flowers. The mini bar gets filled every day and you get more coffee if needed. No need to bring a iron or hairdryer as they have one there, the room has plenty of storage, and the entertainment in the room is given by a large TV which has a number of channels in different languages. In the room they have a laundry bag if you fill it up and seal it then you get it back the following day. You can have room service from anytime you like and it will reach you within 30 minutes.There are three pools:Adult pool- over 18s and it has its own bar and Jacuzzi.Main pool-family pool which has a swim up barSide pool- for everyone too.The beach is seconds away from wherever you are in the hotel and is stunning.It is alright saying all about the hotel but I am missing out the best part if the hotel this is the people. They are so caring, friendly and so fun to be around. The staff made my holiday and are the main reason why I would like to return I am missing them all already and I have only just got home.thank you for readingNicciAge-14xx

<Author>esemaan
<Content>Great resort, but will not be back We have just returned from a week at the Globalia on April the 24th very nice and tropical. Check-in time was 3:00pm we had to wait 4 hour for our room to be ready. The room was nice on the 1st floor, clean but noisy as it was on the gound level in block 5 and close to the beach,high traffic. After complaining they moved us to the 3rd floor with side ocean view great rooms.Buffett dinner at the Windows resturant had variety and was good. We ate at all 2 of the a la carte resturants, but didn't enjoy them had to return to the buffet resturant to finish dinner. My daugther is vegiterian and there is nothing for her at the a la card resturants, Make your reservations early. Lunch was usually the same everyday at the beach resturant, Pizza , chicken  rice. But we sat outside and viewed the ocean while we ate, beautiful  relaxing. The beach was beautiful, white sand, but lot of sea weeds on the ocean and the beach side. never took more than one dip., get your lounge chair early arround 5 am or you will not be able to get one. My wife and i walked on the beach every morning  all lounge chairs under umbrellas at beach  pool were taken. The weather was not that Great! rain some times and Sunny  warm another. Water sport is a joke , you have to be there by 9 am sharp to put your name on a list for a free lesson , not one minute before, even if you book, you will never go as its always to calm (no wind) or to windy cant go, they want you to by insurance to take the katamran out $ 5 for 30 minute. We had some problems with the rooms, no towels, air-conditioning leaks. All of this would not have been much of a problem, except when we reported these problems it was looked after but after some time. Our kids had a great time as this was their first tripto the Dominican. What upsets us most is the harrasment you will get at the resort and on the beach when you go for a walk. On the resort sales people want to sell you trips, water activities etc. and the photographer will walk arround alomst ever hour with some exotic animals and ask you if you want to have your picture taken with the animanls. Money grab $ 8 for a 5X4 print or they could put it on a CD for $5 a picture minimum 6 picture. The shpos on the resorts are not better than the beach they are hunders time more expensive and you will still be harrassed once you pass infront of them. I would not return to this hotel again nore the Dominican there mentality is that you paid for this trip so you can afford to pay for other things too. There were just too many inconsistencies in service.  
<Date>Apr 26, 2007

<Author>brigbill
<Content>Some Problems We checked into Globalia on March 8th very pretty and tropical. Check-in time was 3:00pm we had to wait an hour for our room to be ready. No that much of a problem as we had lunch, but our kids (10  13), wanted to go to the pool. Our room was nice on the 3rd floor, and clean. We proceeded to the pool, there were not enough pool towels. When we asked at the desk for towels we were told they had to go to the laundry to look for more, after some more excuses we were finally given 3, there were 4 of us. We went back to our room to take showers  dress for dinner, we only had 2 bath towels, there were 4 of us. Once again we had to go to the front desk for towels.  Buffett dinner at the Windows resturant had variety and was good. We ate at all 3 of the a la carte resturants, and enjoyed all, make your reservations early. Lunch was usually the same everyday at the beach resturant, chicken  rice. But we sat outside and viewed the ocean while we ate, beautiful  relaxing. The beach was beautiful, white sand, clear carribean water, but get your lounge chair early or you will not be able to get one. My husband walked on the beach every morning at 6:30  all lounge chairs under umbrellas at beach  pool were taken. Unfortunately people would claim spots and never use the chairs. Do not walk past warning signs on beach. The weather was Great! Sunny  warm. Snorkeling from the beach was OK, not that much to see, but fun anyway. We would go to the pool at about 4 pm for coctails before dinner, had a fun time talking to other guests. We continued to have room problems, no soap, towels, air-conditioning, refrigerator, and TV,(we just wanted to see the weather for our return trip). All of this would not have been much of a problem, except when we reported these problems to the front desk, we were given excuses instead of the supplies we needed. I understand they were short staffed  completely booked, as it was Spring Break week. But the staff is only as good as the supplies given to them by management. I would have to look for maids on other floors for help. We were not the only family complaining of inconsistent service and supplies. Everyone seemed to be having diffculities.Our kids had a great time, and meet other kids from Canada  France. They all exchanged e-mail addresses. We also meet some very nice couples. We went on the OutBack Safari excursion. Had a great time and learned alot about DR culture. We asked our guide about hotels. He liked Iberostar. Stated Globalia was going through new management, and looking for more employees. Make sure you drink alot of bottled water becuause it is so hot, and use plenty of sunscreen, can burn very fast. Also use bottled water to brush your teeth. We even took bottled water to dinner, you can get as much as you want at any bar. None of us got sick while we were there, or when we came home.I would not return to this hotel again. There were just too many inconsistencies in service. Sorry my photos are not ready they do show how pretty everything is.  
<Date>Apr 18, 2007

<Author>whiteChicago
<Content>Don't even consider Unfortunately we have had our first horrible trip out of 10 wonderful ones we have taken. The Globalia Grand in Punta Cana looks good on the surface but it truly became an unacceptable, nightmarish experience. The room looked beautiful but never even had luke warm water for showers. The ceiling leaked, streaming down over the tub and coming from a light fixture. The room smelled so stronly of mold that we became sick. The smell of mold penetrated our suitcases (which are now ruined) and was on the sheets, towels, and pillows. Beach towels smelled and looked as though they were not washed. We asked for these issues to be resolved but were not understood or lied to telling us it was fixed. Food was of such a poor quality, we struggled eating anything other than potatoes. We are adventurous, easy-to-please eaters but could not eat the main entres wandering what mystery meat we were consuming. And finally ,we spotted one rat near the walkway; and the last day found feces floating in our pool. Communicating with staff was near impossible. I have contacted Apple Vacations and Carols Travel in Orland Park.....will update you with their response.

<Author>tgrand
<Content>Horrible Place!! I read previous review and should have listened. Even my travel agent warned me about the overall quality of this resort prior to booking. It was a group of eight adults that went on this trip and thank goodness for the comfort in friends...we would have booked a flight home shortly after arrival. When the transfer van pulled up, my stomach fell. The outside is old and run down and this only radiates throughout the entire resort. We stayed in Building 3 and constantly had problems. Our other friends experienced the same headaches. There is only water pressure if you take a COLD shower, water trickles out when switched to hot/warm. Mini-bar was hot...if you are used to hot soda and beer you will be fine. The room was awful!! By far, the worst accomodations I have ever stayed in. Furniture was chipped and very old, the bed posts were broken, cracked/dented lamp shades, smudges on sliding glass door, A/C would NEVER cool beyond 74 degrees, rust/mildew covered bathroom, shower curtain was molded, mildew in grout, tiles did not match, shower head was barely stable in wall, door frame entirely rusted, water would be turned OFF during evening for repairs, out of beach towels everytime I asked (3-4 X day), no alarm clock, the entire resort would be without electricity (even in the restuarants at night---kind of scary), tile work around the resort missing and crumbling, pond for flaminagos was puke green, fence around that thing was broken and falling down. Frozen drinks were NEVER frozen always watered down and tasted like syrup. Nothing top shelf even available if you wanted to pay extra. ONLY Classico brand liquor and El Presidente beer. We were so sick of this place, we could not even drink enough!! That is pretty sad!! Need I go on????On the positive side, the food was edible. You will not look forward to dinner for the food, but another day almost over and closer to departure. This resort is about ready to change its name to Grand Oasis Punta Cana and I am familiar with the Grand Oasis resort and they are of poor quality and taste. The bartender Nico was great. The orange juice at the Windows breakfast buffet was good, that is when they did not run out!! Hey, the old saying is true...YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!!  
<Date>Apr 16, 2007

<Author>TouristWestVirginia
<Content>Good Time at Globalia Overall we had a great experience at Globalia Punta Cana Grand. The airport transportation was excellent. We were transported from the airport to our resort in an air conditioned van in just about 15 minutes. Check in was a breeze. The people behind the counter were extremely friendly and helpful. We arrived at noon and check in is not suppose to be until 3:00, but our room was ready for us when we arrived. Our rooms were excellent! Building 7 is a must. Marble floors, large walk in shower, ocean front balcony, two jacuzzi tubs, canopy king size bed, safe, and a stocked frig all made for an excellent room. One jacuzzi tub is on the balcony overlooking the ocean, very romantic at night. We did have a problem with hot water though. We only had HOT water for one evening shower. The water was warm, but not warm enough to be enjoyable. Our friends that traveled with us and roomed next door to us had hot water everyday, so I guess it varies from room to room. The food was good, nothing exceptional and not as good as a fine dining restaurant in the states, but good. They had a large variety in the Windows buffett. However, the options were the same everyday. The salad bar was great and the egg station for breakfast was wonderful. Refills on drinks were hard to get. You receive a small glass with your meal and have to chase a waiter down to get a refill. My husband walked up to the bar after waiting 5 minutes for his drink, which resulted in the bartender shouting at him to sit down. The desserts were great at all the restaurants. This was the best part of the entire meal. Service was extremely slow at the Beach Garden restaurant. We could not get a reservation until 9:00, so we were very hungry. The tropical salad was great; I highly recommend. And once again desert was great. The day you arrive make sure you schedule reservations to the restaurants to ensure a decent eating time. We scheduled ours the morning after we arrived and the only times we could get were 9:00 and 9:15. We ordered room service one day to hold us over. Room service is included so take advantage. The food was good and service was quick. Pizza and sandwiches were great. All of the pools were nice, however getting a chair is difficult. We never laid by the large pool with the swim up bar due to never finding 4 chairs together, we couldn't even find 2 chairs together. People would put their towels on the chairs to save them, but were never around. This was very annoying. One day there were about 20 people at the pool and no chairs. There are probably 100 chairs total, but most were empty but had towels laying on them. We had no problem finding chairs at the adult pool however. The bartender at the adult pool was excellent. The drinks were great and his up beat attitude was a plus. He would walk around and ask if we wanted a drink and then would bring it back to us, very nice! The beach was nice, seaweed is a problem that can not be helped. However, if you walk to the left of the resort about 10 minutes there is a beautiful secluded beach with clear water and no seaweed. I highly recommend taking a towel and walking down there to tan and swim. We used all of the non-motorized water sports and had a ball. The catamarans were so much fun. We also windsurfed and used the kayaks. We purchased additional excursions. We went snorkeling one day and did the shoppong excursion the next. The snorkeling was a big disappointment. They take you out about 100 yards from the resort and have an area that is fenced in to do the snorkeling. There were several sharks and stingrays, but the guide had to swim down and pull on them to get them to swim around. No tropical colored fish. Overpriced and a big let down. The shopping excursion was great. We went to a cigar and rum shop, an expensive shopping center (Hard Rock cafe), and a flea market type center. We bought a lot of stuff at the flea market, but check the prices on the beach first. Cheap Charlie gave us a lot better deal on our shirts. Overall we had a great time and I would recommend this resort and may even return myself.  
<Date>Apr 16, 2007

<Author>darthington
<Content>Truly Fantastic place. I stayed at the Globali punta cana grand in march 07. I went to the Hotel to write a review on this resort, that is now complete and has been passed onto many travel agents. I read over 100 travelers reviews on this hotel before i left and i was so surprised at the variety of good and bad reviews, so i looked forward to visiting myself. I am going to tell you as much as i can and hope this will help many of you when reading these comments to pick the holiday to suit you.Transfer to hotel =20 minsCheck in= Quick,polite The reception is lovely and grand with its double marble staircase and glass lift. All the staff where eager to help and all smiles!Bell boy's very polite and quick to please.The overall feel of this hotel is one of peace. I would say it is more suited to couples young and old or families. The grounds are wonderful and immaculate. The variety of landscape, pond's, tree's,and grass area's provides a tranquil setting for this beautiful hotel. It is big enough to have a nice walk aroung but not too big to get lost or need a buggy to get to your room. All restaurants and the beach are minutes away from the room's.There are 3 pool's. The largest in the middle of the resort with the swim up bar and another bar above with covered seating area's overlooking the pool and beach. This is lovely in the evening when all the pool and beach lights are on. The choice of spirits here are excellent. With popcorn and hotdogs all inclusive on the latter bar in the evening. Great for the kid's or peckish late night drinkers! Then you have the adult only pool open till 11 pm with its own bar and hottub lovely idea. You also have the lagoon pool that winds its way in front of block 7 and down right to the white powder beach. THE BEACHThe beach is wonderful with its fine white powder sands. There are a variety of shop's along the beach front just to the left of the hotel offering hairbraiding $20 T-shirts $7 beach wraps $7. This is a nice place to have a little shop when you are bored of sunbathing.There are lots of sunbeds on the beach but they can get reserved early in the morning.WATER SPORTSThe water sports are all included you get a 30 min lesson and then you are free to sail once a day per person for 30 mins. This is well worth doing. The snorkleing is ok the water is clear and warm but you have not many rocks in front of the hotel which is excellent for swimming but if you want to find marine fish you can easily 5 mins to your left where ther are more rocks.The RESTAURANTS are all superb most all inclusives i have stayed in over the years have not come close to this hotel. I cannot understand how some people have not enjoyed the food. The chioce is huge and every taste covered if you cannot find something you like then there is something wrong. THE ROOMSThe hotel at the moment are upgrading its rooms, redecorating and adding new lighter furniture. Some of the rooms still have darker older furniture and older bathrooms but All the rooms come with 24 hour room service with a menu in each room for meals around the clock that are all included in the price. They also have a daily stocked bar of beer and soft drinks included at no extra cost. These features are what makes this resort a 5 star resort. Some of the older rooms however are perhaps not up to 5 star standard at the moment as with the rest of this wonderful hotel but this is soon to change. Dont let that put you off. If you are really not happy with the room you get dont go home and give the hotel bad press contact the room division manager whilst you are at the hotel Caron de vries she is wonderful and will do all she can to make your stay perfect.  If you are truly wanting a full top class 5 star holiday then i suggest you pay the extra supplement and upgrade to block 7 rooms. These rooms are to die for and are spectacular. They are marble throughout with jucuzzi baths, large marble shower, kingsize 4 poster bed ,lovely seating area with vanity unit overlooking the laggon pool and some the beach. You can upgrade at the hotel on arrival. I feel this hotel is very competative compared with other 5 star hotels along punta cana. Even if you pay the upgrade to block 7 you will still pay less than most other 5 star resorts making this a very good choice of hotel for all travellers. ENTERTAINMENTThe shows are good they are the usual carribean show's the venue is great with a huge roofed open air area with a long bar a good stage and a movie each night before the show. In the day time there is entertainment in the main pool only. Members of staff come around the pool asking you to join in but they are not pushy which is nice, if you say no they walk on by. There is a playground with slides swings on the beach and also a trampoline and badminton vollyball net.CHILDRENS CLUBI cant say enough about the girls that run this club. Fedalena and Rosia are fantastic. They are based in an airconditioned play room on the beach. It is in a great place handy for the pool and beach. They have games and a tv with console, toilet, drinks etc. There have daily activities for the children and these 2 girls look after the children as if they are their own. They even have horse riding and a trip to the animal park included.Thank you to all the staff that made our stay so enjoyable its lovely to be able to write such a favourable report on such a wonderful resort. Thank you to Caren de vries for looking after us so well and for the lovely meals on the beach at the chefs table. This is such a great idea of your's for welcoming special guest and returnee's. I am hoping to be a returnee! next year, so please reserve my room caren.... :-) and hopefully we'l meet up with you and sandy and her mum and have another wonderful holiday.All the best Vicki and daniel  
<Date>Apr 15, 2007

<Author>mtingey
<Content>Michelle and Jamie kick it at the Punta cana grand This was mine and my friends first time in Dominican Republic and we had the best time. Most of the staff were very friendly (but single girls beware of how friendly you are it may be taken the wrong way) and the resort itself was absolutely beautiful. The weather was perfect, I've never had a better tan! The food was great but we did not try all the restaurants. The disco was a lot of fun, it was full every night we went and the rec/dance staff also were there working long hours to make sure everyone had a good time. Mr. Paris, Thanks for finally teaching me some rhythm, on the dance floor that is, and don't be shy, come to Canada and look us up!Thanks Punta Cana Grand for the excellent time away!

<Author>bellaandoliver
<Content>What a Blast! - Loved It! I would highly suggest visiting the Globalia Grand on your visit to Punta Cana. The people were friendly, resort clean, entertainment awesome and food excellent!The people are extremely helpful and friendly. I didn't pass one employee that did not greet me or smile to acknowledge me. Mnay of the employees know a good deal of English and some also know French and German. Communicating was not a problem.The resort was very clean and well mainained. Our room had clean towels left each day and the cleaning ladies put new soda, beer and bottled water in our room each day. We left a $2.00 tip for the ladies each day. Each day you can turn in your towel to recieve a new towel. Make sure to not leave your towel lying around or forget to pick it up at the end of the day. Thsi did not happen to us, but another couple forgot their towels and then had to pay $20.00 for new towels. I would suggest getting up early (7 am) to put your towels over chairs so you can eat breakfast and then go back to your chair. Also, if you are not traveling with children under the age of 17, make sure you frequent the adult only pool. It is off in its own little area and there is no noise. This pool has beach chairs, palm trees and a bar. Very relaxing! The entertainment offered was fabulous. This resort truly caters to the adults as well as children. Each day, there is a shedule of events the visitors can participate in. Some events include dancing lessons, water aerobics, bingo, beach volleyball and the lisst goes on. Each night, there is a movie shown in a big theater. This theater also houses events such as magic shows and other kid events.The food at this resort was great. When I was reading some of the reviews before my husband and I went to this hotel, I noticed some people were saying that they became very sick from the food and told people to avoid the resort. Then I looked at their pictures they attached to their review and realized why they got sick! Just keep this in mind, be aware of what you are eating and don't drink the water. The fruits and vegetables are washed with filtered water. I don't eat much meat so I was a complete vegetarian on this trip. My husband did eat soem of the meat but was careful with what he chose. He avoided the seafood and hamburgers. The three restaurants to choose from are good but we highly recommend the italian restaurant (de Mario's). If you want a superb meal, here's what to order. For the appetizer get the sliced tomato with cheese. For the soup choose the minestrone. Get the pasta trio for your main course. Finally order the chocolate lasagna for dessert. It's like the dessert they used to have at the Olive Garden only much better! Order this and you will not be disappointed!So I think I managed to inform you as best I can about the Globalia Grand. Make sure you check this hotel out. It was fabulous. We will be back with the whole family next time! Enjoy!Sarah and Kyle from Wisconsin  
<Date>Apr 5, 2007

<Author>margaretta
<Content>best holiday yet we have just returned from a two week holiday at the globalia punta cana grand and i cant praise this hotel enough.Went with family ages 4 to 67 and i must say this hotel had something for everyone.The location was perfect lovely white sandy beach we could snorkel and sail most days this was inclusive in our holiday cost ,We stayed in block seven it was the most luxurious room i have ever stayed in and as a retired travel agent i have visited many hotels all over the world but this topped it all.Our stay was enhanced by the attitude of the staff who all seemed to be very happy to be of service to all the guests, and to Caron who invited us to dine at the chefs table on the beach what a beautiful memory to take home with us .The restaurants had a good selection to suit everyone and with such choice we always looked forward to our evening meal and for those who wanted it a good entertainment program every night,but all good things must come to an end so thanks to Caron and the friends we dined with ,Sandy and her mum Fran for helping to make our holidaya memorable one . <Author>Tenman9
<Content>Great Time at the Grand Met our group from last year ( Ocean Bavaro ) Mike  Janice, Brent  Boomer and us Sandy  Cam at the Punta Cana Grand. Our group expanded to include Tim, Ross  Gail, Ken  Mary, Jeff  Melinda, Frank  Penny, Rick  Val and George. The hotel is rated 4.5 stars and I'm sure that everyone agrees. We were in building three, third floor with a cathedral ceiling which was really nice and handy for everything including the beach, pool, bars and restaurants. All the restaurants combined provided a huge selection of food. Also you were never far from your next drink! Thursday nights all guest were served supper on the beach. You can only imagine the looks from the Manager and all vacationers when our group put on the fake nose, glasses and moustaches along with the hillbilly teeth. The beach party provided the perfect setting to celebrate Boomers birthday which included a pair of serengaudi sunglasses. The Karaoke Bar provided Sandy with her chance of stardom on Dominican Idol. The pool bar also provided Mike with his first job in the Dominican, beertender! Our excursions included four wheeling, speedboat/catamaran ride to Saona Island, and snorkling. I personally did the flying zodiac boat ride down the coast for twenty minutes getting an aerial view of many resorts. The staff was very friendly and provided an nightly show which included a great Micheal Jackson show. The Casino even co-operated with me and paid out one night. The only negative was the flight times by Sunwing, leaving at 2am and landing at 6:45am made for a very tiring drive home from the airport. Hope to see our group next winter at the next destination being????? We'll review it next year and let everyone know the good  bad.

<Author>lynnfrsk
<Content>Great Place to Stay Just returned from a glorious week's stay at the Globalia Punta Cana Grand. We were in Building 7 and cannot say enough about it. The rooms are outstanding, with the hot tubs both inside and on the balcony. The Ocean Front view is absolutely beautiful. We could not find one thing to complain about!!! We have never encountered such friendly and helpful staff. Caren, the Rooms Manager, Adriano and Francisco, from the Windows Buffet were the best. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome and took wonderful care of us. The language was not an issue at all. We had such a good time with all of them!The food was very good in all the restaurants. We had no issues at all. We were pleasantly surprised to see such a variety of food in the buffet. The desserts were amazing!The beach was pretty good overall. There was some seaweed in the water at times but not so much that you couldn't go into the water. The water was warm and very clear for the most part.We will definitely return!We would like to extend our sincere thanks to all the staff at the Resort for making our vacation such a wonderful experience.

<Author>dianne1997
<Content>Would definitely go back After reading some of the reviews right after I made the reservation I was really afraid that I had made the wrong decision but boy was I wrong. The resort was wonderful. I don't know what some of you were complaining about! The white sand beach was clean and beautiful. Yes, there was seaweed that washed up everynight with the waves but the guys at the resort raked it up every morning. Some of the resorts down the beach had it much worse and it didn't look like it was raked up as often as our resort. What a job! There was no liter or bottles or cans laying around on the sand. There were plenty of beach chairs - we never had a problem finding one (you might have to drag a chair to where you wanted it but there were chairs available).We had an oceanfront room with a wrap around balcony in building 4. Our room was clean and and very well kept. Our bed was comfortable, Our shower worked well and we always had hot water. Our mini fridge was always well stocked with water, pop, and beer. Our balcony was in good condition and cleaned everyday as well.We dined at all (3) restaurants that we needed reservations for - the Italian Restaurant, the Seafood Restaurant and the Tex-Mex Restaurant. I made reservations the first morning we were there for all 3 of them. Our reservations were for 6:45 each night. You need to be flexible about times but you can get reservations. You can adjust what you eat for the day to accomodate any dining time, have a snack or an extra filling drink! Remember you are on vacation...We ate at Windows the other nights and there was plenty to choose from. You certainly will not go hungary!The dinner on the beach is romantic and alot of fun. Candlelight on the tables with tablecloths and wine glasses set up on the sandy beach. Tiki Tourches everywhere, Food stations with every kind of food and a delicious dessert bar as well as entertainment and music. These people try to please everyone by trying to include foods for all nationalities. Remember there are guests from many countries visiting these resorts..The drinks were good and we never had to wait more that a minute to get a drink at any of the bars. Each bar tender had their own special drink and I tried them all. Have fun and don't get all hung up if they don't have what you usually drink at home!You are there to have fun and relax....I'm sure you wil find something you like as there is alot to choose from. Bottled Water was available for the asking from any of the bars or restaurants and it was always in your room.The staff at the resort mostly speaks spanish but I didn't have any trouble communicating (I only speak english). I always got my message or request across. The staff at the front desk speaks english well so you should not have any problems expressing yourself to them. We emailed the resort with a request for an oceanfront room and indicated that we were celebrating out 40th wedding anniversary. When we arrived there was a bucket of champagne and a large fruit basket in our room - a nice added touch that I did not expect.The shows at night were entertaing and the casino is big enough to have fun. The main pool had activities to get involved with if you wanted - arobics, pool games, spanish lessons, fruit cutting  presentations. You could be busy if you wanted or just lay around and go from beach chair to the bar to the restaurant and then to the adult pool then back to the bar and the back to the restaurant etc. Excursions are also availble from the resort and we talked to many people we did those as well. They all seemed to have a good time.We travel every spring to the Carribean and it's our second time to this resort. Whatever you do - remember you are on vacation and have fun. Things are going to happen but make the most of it and make it part of your memories...good  bad. That's what makes every vacation untique!  
<Date>Mar 26, 2007

<Author>MLMR
<Content>Great Little Place I went with my wife, two kids, aged 3 1/2 and 16 months, my wife's parents, sister and her family (10 of us in total) from March 12 - 18, 2007. We stayed at the Melia Caribe in Punta Cana last year. We wanted a smaller hotel where we wouldn't have to take a tram to get to the restaurants and where everything was nearby. Globalia fit the bill, and the food was actually better than average for this type of all-inclusive. We stayed in Building 7. The staff was friendly and everything went very smoothly. The kids loved the mini club, the trampoline, and of course the beach and the pool. They could use a few more bartenders by the beach to minimize waits, however.Overall, I would recommend this place and go back.

<Author>7369
<Content>Amazing Block 7  While I have been in the Dominican before, this was my first trip to Punta Cana. While we had a very good time, there were a few things missing. We had our room changed from the original room (block 5) to Block 2 lower level the second day. While in the second level, the A/C was broke, we had no towels and no maid to be seen for the 2 days and when I spoke to the Manager of HK, Caren DeVries, I cannot tell you enough how incredible this woman is. The first most important thing is that she spoke ENGLISH! It was beginning to get nerve wrecking the fact that not only the Dominicans didnt speak much English, neither did about 80% of the vacationers! She was right on that phone getting things done immed. While the A/C was permanently broke, I asked if I could upgrade to block 7. She was able to get us in and I cannot tell you how INCREDIBLE those rooms are. It was nice to see that Caren really cared about us. The wait staff in Windows were also unbelievable. In the mornings, our cappacino was waiting for us..they work so damn hard and get little acknowledgement from vacationers. The Italian restaurant was really not that great unless so I hear, you like fish. The tex mex American restaurant was amazing, we ate there twice only problem being lack of air. God was it hot! All in all I would have to say the resort itself would rate a 4 1/2 but the rooms definitley a 3 at most. Would I go there again...if I am in block 7...for sure! The customer service is this place is AMAZING!!! Thank you Caren for honestly caring about people!  
<Date>Mar 20, 2007

<Author>joesharon
<Content>You'll like this resort! Stayed here Feb 18-25. Upon arrival at airport girls in native costume greet you and take your picture, which cost $8 to get when you leave. Nice airport, everything is expensive, though, bring your own snacks if you're waiting for return flight. 20 minutes to Globalia, check-in a breeze and $10 U.S. to the desk clerk got us a room in 7 block with a jacuzzi, alll marble interior, 8 x 6 foot shower, large balcony, etc. Dominicans love U.S. dollars, bring plenty! Leave maid a dollar a day for great service. Breakfast buffet a real treat, don't miss it! Lunch buffet was fine everyday, no complaints. RIU lunch buffets were awful, so this was quite an improvement. Restaurant reservations were taken once for all 7 days, not like other resorts where you stand in line everyday at 11 am waiting to reserve. Dinner was fine, American restaurant a little hokey, Italian was excellent, dinner buffet was superb! Beach party a feast on Thursday, don't miss it. Best steaks at this resort compared to all others I've been to, and endless Champagne at Managers cocktail party, where dancers entertain in costumes that don't cover much. Pools all over, my favorite the adult pool with jacuzzi, where kids are asked to leave, tasteful toplessness, and this resort is 70%European. Easy enough to get used to. At the adult pool bar is Nicholas, who doesn't let you come to the bar, insisting on serving you poolside. His drinks are STRONG, best I've had, and he keeps the place clean. When the staff is knocking down coconuts, ask for them to cut a hole at the top so Nicholas can fill it with your favorite! Great guy, we gave him $5 when we left. Beach is perfect white sand, a little seaweed, but why complain, it's in the water and very little. Staff cleans up beach seaweed all the time. Get use to aggressive souvenir salesman, if they quote $25, tell them $5 in the U.S. and go from there, you'll pay probably pay $10. I've been to resorts all over the Caribbean and Mexico, and this was one of the best, and just $1,089 with non-stop air all inclusive. For the money, some aspects matched the $10,000 a week resorts I've been to. Come here and you should enjoy it!  
<Date>Mar 17, 2007

<Author>XAVXAV
<Content>This hotel is a 5 stars for facilities but 2 stars for service I was in this hotel from the the 05 march 2007 till 12 march 2007 and i will give you some comments of this hotel.First of all, the hotel has a colonial style as everything is made in wood and infrastructure is very good has there 2 swimming pools, tennis courts, etccc and the rooms are big.and clean. The activities are also well organized.But of course there are some very serious problems for a 5 stars hotel like :- the food is bad, be careful at what you eat as they repeat the same food everyday. For example : day 1 : normal chicken day 2 : the same chichen with sauce day 3 : the same chicken but fried day 4 : the same chicken in salad and so on; I had 2 times belly problems. Be careful also because they want to give tap water on your glass, so ask always bottle waters.- there is no enough parasols on the beach. If you want one, better wake up at 07.00 in the morning; put your towels on the chairs and go back to sleep.- the service on the restaurant is very slow. You can wait till 30 minutes before they bring you your glass or it never comes. Also if they need to repair something in your room, it can take 3 to 4 days (we did not have hot water for 4 days). - the doctor cost s 80 dollars a visit - there are shops int hotel which do not stop to call you and annoying you in order to try to sell you something. Even in the buffet, the waiters try to sell you necklaces and so on. This creates that there are some areas in the complex you want to avoid.etccc..In summary, the hotel facilities can be a 5 stars but the service is really 2 to 3 stars maximum. -

<Author>aetsen
<Content>Wonderful vacation My husband, myself and our two daughters aged 17 and 6 stayed at the Punta Cana Grand from March 3rd until March 10th. We had a wonderful vacation. This was our 2nd time in Punta Cana and you just cannot beat the beaches here. We were in Los Cabos last year and the beaches were hard to walk on and you could not swim for the powerful undertow. Punta Cana has powder sand and beautiful warm salt water. The resort was great, although I don't think it was a 5 star. 5 star to me, means perfection, and although I have no serious complaints to me it is a 4 plus. We stayed in building 3, facing the flamingo's and the bar. It was never overly loud, and when I suggested we move for my daughters sake, they said they liked falling asleep to the music. Their is a lot of Europeon people at this resort, a lot of different languages and a lot of different temperments. Just go with the flow and make your vacation what you want it to be. You must reserve your chairs early or you will not get any. A lot of people don't like it but it is just the way it is. I was down every morning at 7 to get chairs under a hut, so that we could have shade. I used the beach towels and also my bathing suit wraps so I could tell they were mine. There was some difference of opinions while we were their among other people who's chairs were who's. The pool area is quite active, always something going on. We didn't go the the lazy river pool or the adult pool, but others we talked to loved it. They have fun games and aerobics and the animators work so hard it is unbelievable. We ate at all of the restaurants, Beach Garden for dinner was our favourite. The beef tenderloin is fantastic. We enjoyed the Beach Garden for breakfast and lunch as well. We found Windows a little bit more chaotic. Service at Beach Garden was faster in our opinion. My 6 year old who is very picky never had a problem finding something to eat and thank goodness for watermelon juice because that's all she drank along with bottled water. Water pressure in our building was terrible. Not that is ruined our vacation, it just took a longer time to get all the soap off, the water wasn't hot, but you get used to it. All in all we had a great time, last time we stayed in Punta Cana it was at the Bavaro Princess, and this resort is much smaller. Please go and see the show's they are a lot of fun and the people work so hard in them. We thought the magic show on Friday night was amazing. The interactive show's are pretty funny although a couple of time's I wondered if I should have taken my 6 year old out, as the games between the adults were a little -- over the top, but in the end she just thought they were funny. Have a great vacation  
<Date>Mar 13, 2007

<Author>amtorresdale
<Content>Nice place to stay The area is beautiful, the hotel rooms were okay. They need some work. But over all they did keep clean. The food is different and you need to watch what you eat. No raw veg. or salads. Do not drink the water use only bottle water even to brush your teeth. It is very layed back so if you are looking for a night life not here. But you just want to relax and sit by the pool or ocean and read this is the place. We did go on a horseback riding trip in the country side and the was great we were on horses for about 2 hours and saw so much. Well worth the money. If you bring children which we did you will see alot of topless women even at the pool were it is not allowed. That can get to you after awhile. Make sure you have lots of ones and fives they love american money and it goes far. They are not credit card happy so make you sure you have alot of cash. Do not go to the Beach Grill For dinner not very good. The American Grill and the Italian was much better.

<Author>lovethetravel
<Content>A Nice Surprise! It was our first visit to the DR and Globalia, so we were nerveous too... but the place and the country, the climate, most of the people, the nature surprised us in a good way. The Hotel was neat, employees helpful. The entertainment was o'right. We saw the Michael Jackson show, of which the acrobats part was so entertaining. The food was good too... We went one night to The Beach Club I thing it was called, and we had to get up and leave, because the staff around us was busy, seemed frustrated and the selection was for someone who had no other choice of place. We got chased first by the hostess, then by the manager and begged to go back to the table. That felt so uncomfortable, so we promissed to eat there next night, of course we never did. Instead we went to Da Mario - GREAT FOOD, that's all I can say. Definitely try Windows, the buffet there is honestly outstanding, compared to any other All inclusive place we've been to so far - we were so stuffed we couldn't walk..:)One last thing - The vendors on the beach and the ones in the hotel were just so anoying. Don't buy anything, unless you are prepared to dig deep in your pocket, get into a fight, or literally cursed out. Example: My husband needed new sandals for the beach, and went to see if they will have any in their little sheds on the beach. The guy was asking $40, for something you get at the Dollar Store for a buck. But when I showed up, the show was over. I talked him down to $15, then finally completely changed our mind, because he asked for cigarettes and beer on top, didn't buy them, and the vendor made a rough comment about my nationality that was hard to swallow - almost ruined my vacation mood there. A trip someone offered for $110/pp, we got for $70.Overall, we had a great time and lots, lots of beer...

<Author>eastcosttraveler
<Content>Wonderful Experience! We arrived at Globalia Punta Cana Grand after Riu Bambu had given away our reservation. (See my comments on Riu Bambu site policy regarding overbooking their resorts).Our first impression was that this was a much quieter and less crowded resort than the Riu Bambu. When we arrived at 9.30 p.m. there were painting scaffoldings in the lobby as they were redecorating this area.The check-in service was friendly and prompt and we were told to have some dinner first while the restaurants were still open. We thought that this was very considerate and nice!Our room in building 3 faced the activities hut, flamingo pond and pool/bar and had particial ocean view. The check-in person told us that we could change the room if we found it too noisy. We were fine, even enjoying the flamingo calls at 6 a.m. as well as late night bar hoppers singing and talking. The resort is very well maintained and looks as if it has undergone recent renovations. All staff (with the exclusion of the watersport hut staff) is very friendly and hardworking.The food was good for an all-inclusive, comparable to the Club Med in Punta Cana I had been to before. A good variety and the layout of the Windows restaurant makes for easy traffic flow.We enjoyed the beach which had some sea weed due to storms during our stay. We took out one of the Hobie cat sail boat every day and found the watersports staff difficult to deal with. They have three boats, but would only rig two and were reluctant to accept reservations for a half hour sail.The nightly entertainment (Lipsing) was outstanding, especially the dance group which has incredible talents! The Michael Jackson Show seems to have had a technical mishap when we saw it as Michael had no singing voice, just great moves....We had a wonderful time and can wholeheartedly recommend this resort!

<Author>LM77
<Content>Wonderful Vacation - Hope to Return Next Year This was our third trip to the Punta Cana Grand (PCG). The first two times, in 2004  2005, the property was owned by Sunscape. It is now owned by Globalia. Globalia has made many upgrades to the property that we really enjoyed. They built a new building on the beach - Building 7, which is where we stayed. Our room was 7322, our friends stayed in 7323. We had ocean-front rooms with hot tubs on the balconies and in the room between the sleeping area and bathroom.We had e-mailed manager Caren DeVries before we arrived and she made sure we had ocean-front rooms, DVD players and restaurant reservations made in advance.We arrived at the resort around 11 a.m. and one of our rooms was ready although check-in is not until 3 p.m. The rooms were the nicest of any all-inclusive resort that we have ever stayed: in Mexico - the Iberostar Tucan, IB Pariaso Del Mar and in La Romana - IB Hacienda Dominicus. There were fruit baskets and a bottle of rum sent to each of our rooms. We had bath robes, DVD players, coffee makers, irons and ironing boards, hair dryers, refrigerators stocked with beer, soda, water . There was plenty of closet and storage space for clothes. In addition, you receive up to 20 minutes free internet access daily by staying in this building. The only problem we had is the ice machines did not work and the first day the resort had no hot water in any of the rooms until early evening, after we already took luke-warm showers. The other six days we had no problems with hot water.Globalia has expanded the outside deck for dining at the Beach Grill. The Beach Grill is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner with outdoor dining, right on the beach overlooking the ocean. They have also switched from an ala carte menu at breakfast and lunch to buffets for both. The food was excellent with many choices. In the evening, the dinner menu is ala carte and the steak is excellent. Juan Ramon and Vincent took good care of us here.The second night we ate at the American Grill, which is casual, fun and Tex-Mex cuisine. We reunited with Sergio, our server, who we recognized from the Sunscape. We had excellent service here and returned a second time for dinner.Windows is the main buffet and is opened for breakfast, lunch and dinner. We went for breakfast and Sergio was there to wait on us again. We had excellent food and service here and returned for dinner. We had dinner twice at Da Mario's. The first time the service was slow, but the second time it was perfect. The food is very good, but my husband and I liked the food and menu better at Da Mario's when it was owned by Sunscape. There seemed to be fewer choices and the quantity and quality was not quite as good as previously. The steaks here were excellent though - and this is what the wait staff recommended we order. And the desserts were excellent as well.Of all the pools, we enjoyed the Adult Pool the most and Nicholas, the bartender there (My name is Nicholas and we're opened till we close) was one of our favorite employees.The beach is beautiful and the best maintained of the resorts within walking distance of the PCG. If you walk to the left you can walk for about 1 - 2 miles, past two other resorts and then beautiful, empty beaches which remind us of the movie Castaway.Overall we had an excellent experience here and look forward to returning. We highly recommend this resort.

<Author>travelwith5kids
<Content>5 kids had a blast! We arrived on 2/5/07, and left 2/10/07 with 5 children aged 12,10,8,6,and 4. The main pool was accomodating for them all,. which was very cool for them. Our check-in was very expedient, and our rooms were as we expected. We had asked for ajoining rooms due to the kid factor, but we we in building #4 which was booked for the duration of our stay. This was our first time travelling with the kids, but as a watching parent, I would definitely reccomend this resort for those who are looking for the additional trauma of hauling them along for the ride! All the activities are centered very close to the complex, and allow them to have a blast!. The rooms were very nice, we brought along $500 in fives for tipping, ($1 works, but a 5 is golden!) for room service and for the additional staff.I am in the casino business, and found the table games adequate for play. The cards in use were not what you would expect, but the house rules for blackjack, poker, and roulette is what you should expect in the states. We actually took over a table, me and the wife, making a few hundred bucks in the process, betting $10 a spot x7. I don't know about the slots and how they pay, but tables are OK. Watch out for a ringer at the hold e'm game, he is decent and brings in his bro's for a quick kill. He stayed away from me, knowing my ability, but beware!With 5 kids in tow, we only journeyed out for the outback excursion. Eddie was our guide and he was the Bomb! go for the half day trip, it was long enough for your needs. The main pool fit our children perfect, many times I looked for their location, and nothing sweeter than seeing your kidsplaying volleyball in the pool and seeing your 4 and 6 year-olds sipping on a coke at the swim-up bar!Room service is OK, limited menu, Make reservations for the three restaurants when you check-in for a quality dining experience.Plenty of diversity w/ the crowd, euros and canadians. The hagglers will take 1/3 asking price, just tell them your final and walk away,. It works. They acutally put a purse on my daughter 's arm that I wanted for her, but I put it back, and the vendor came around! 1/3!!! period.. Again, with 5 kids, I would go back. Our parents never did this for us growing up! have a blast, and respond w/ any questions. gnvspot@wctc.net

<Author>lanasmom
<Content>Great resort if you like alot of activies To start I have to say that the service we received from all the staff was as good as any service we have received at a Ritz or Four Seasons Hotel and far surpasses our last stay at the Palm Desert JW.The airport is very nice with it's thatched roof and open feel. They take pictures of you with women in native dress as you arrive. When you depart you can buy these photos at the airport.On arrival at the resort (10pm) we were given a choice of 2 rooms, one was a basic first floor room, the other was on the third floor and was one of the 8 rooms in the resort that looks directly on to the ocean. The ocean view building decor was much nicer and newer. We opted for the additional $100.00 per night and got the incredible view. We enjoyed the room and jacuzzi hot tub on the balcony. 25 minutes of internet time at the internet room is included in the price. The first day I left a note in spanish that we would need lots of bottled water each day and a one dollar bill. That night we had 5 bottles of water. I left a one dollar bill each day after that. We always had plenty of bottled water and the room was cleaned very well each day. One complaint is that the pillows were not very good.The resort is very clean. Maintanence is being done everyday early till late in the evening. My only complaint is that the public toilet facilities tend to always have issues, broken doors, clogged toilets, wet floors and such. It just might be the people that use them. The beach is fabulous. A little seaweed but nothing ridiculous. The ocean bottom is silky soft sand. The water is warm and clear. We found the lounge chairs to be very uncomfortable. You can not lay flat in them. Each time I would doze, I would wake up when my head loped sideways. Take a travel neck pillow and you should be ok. The topless issue is real. When we were there you couldn't not see it. All around the pool and all over the beach there were women in bottoms only. We had no problem with it, but I want you to be aware.The food is fine. At the non reservation restaurant they have such variety that I can not believe you can't find something to eat. Kelvin one of the waiters in the nonsmking section is so friendly and happy that we looked for him each morning. He greeted us with a smile and coffee. We ate at the three reservation restaurants and the only one we would recommend is the Italian.Bring lots of sunblock!!!!! I would be wise to pack bug spray since some people were being bitten. Also I recommend you bring a nice big insulated mug. I wished I had one lots of times.We are a couple in our 50's so like things a little quiet and relaxed. So the constant loud music was too intrusive for us. I felt like we were on a cruise ship. If you want people constantly doing activities and giving lessons this is the place.We both had massages and felt that these were not trained individuals, just people we paid to rub us. So don't bother. Give the money to your honey and have them rub you.I played at the Casino on property each night and had a good time. If you know how to play BJ you can win but do not sit at the tables with other players. I sat at tables where players were splitting 10s and all other crazy moves that are done by the amateurs. The casino will open a new $5 table just for you if you ask. I did and left the place with double my money each night. (I had one dealer that couldn't add and she would never know if she should pay or not so always count your own cards) I'm not sure how she got the job. LOLWe rented a car and drove to Casa de Campo. That was quite the trip. All traffic signals are suggestions only. We were almost wrecked twice by cars going full throttle through their red lights. We were honked at incessantly at red light by drivers behind us wanting us to run the lights. Casa de Campo is gorgeous. I would stay there next time. It is very upscale and quiet. The only issue is that you must get in your vehicle to get to the complex the beach. All in all it was a great vacation and we would most definately go back to DR but to a less noisy resort.  
<Date>Feb 16, 2007

<Author>puntacanafan
<Content>Best hotel, out of this world!!  I would certainly reccommend this hotel to everyone who would enjoy a luxurious stay at a 5 star hotel!!!! Our family was treated like royalty!! The staff were 100% comitted to making our stay as enjoyable as it could be. I think the manager tries soooo hard to please the guests. They have wonderful games, shows and movies which are played and shown daily. The food there is excellent! They have a number of restaurants of different cultures that offer an excellent variety of food. The rooms were very nice, I definately enjoyed staying in our room, the beds were comfortable, the washroom was kept clean. The maids did a fabulous job. The drinks there were nice. They had nice fruitty flavours, soft drinks and authentic concoctions. You can choose if would like alchohol in your drink or not, for your child's sake. Mentioning your children, they have a place were your kids can stay during the day called the Kids Club, which has a very nice nanny who looks after all the children throughout the day. They go and play in the pool, go inside and play with the lot of toys they have or go and dance with the staff who will show them alot of dances which they will remember. I know I will!!!! They have a tremendous snorkeling trip, where they take you out in the crystal clear ocean, on a nice boat, and will assist you in and out of the water, so you can swim with all the colorful fish which will swim around you. They have parties on wednesdays, thursdays, and on the weekend. There is the manager's cocktail party, where you get to dance with staff or your wife/husband. They have a lovely beach party where they set up tables on the beach, and they also set up a buffet. There is live music, dancing and games to play. I give my full support to this hotel and all the staff that works there. I hope you will take this reccommendation to your own advantage. I also hope you will take a chance on this hotel, because you will not be dissappointed!!! I am definately coming back next year for an extra week!!!!!!!  
<Date>Feb 10, 2007

<Author>DrCrew
<Content>Nice place to stay After reading all reviews I did too had some doubts regarding the hotel and the grounds, but to my pleasure it was real nice place. The grounds are well kept and they are making all kinds of renovations to the place, so its kind of busy and noisy at times, but the end result will be GREAT. The Food is good, and will introduce you to some of the local food. but there are 3 choices (need to reserve) to have dinner at different venues. The beach is not too deep, but it has some seaweed washed in the AM. but the cleaning crew always take care of that, this is a good place to take a long walk if you like, Not a place to go if you are the kind that likes to see the local culture, the hotel is isolated from the bavaro town and public transportation is scarce. Also if you are the kind that gets tickle out by people speaking anything but english at your side (not me I do speak Fluent Spanish), this hotel has an appeal for Canadians and Spain nationals. in short ... you wont regret your stay there.  
<Date>Feb 8, 2007

<Author>ralphOntario
<Content>Wonderful Week at Punta Cana Grand My sister and I left our husbands at home in the snow and enjoyed the last week of January at Punta Cana Grand. I can't say enough about how much we enjoyed ourselves. Everything from the beautiful grounds, the beach, the food and especially the staff was beyond any expectations we might have had. Our room was large and spacious and kept very clean by the housekeeping staff. The beach was beautiful and the water warm and yes there was seaweed but it was easy to just walk out into the ocean beyond it (staff were constantly raking it up)People did reserve beach chairs by putting towels on them and so did we....but there were always empty chairs...sometimes just single ones here and there but they were easily moved.The food was excellent and the beach party was our favourite evening. I can't believe how much work the staff does for their guests and all with a smile. We are already planning next year's visit....oh....we did see a little mouse....he was living in a wicker pot on the outside deck of the Beach Garden cafe and would come out now and then to nibble crumbs that had fallen. All in all a dream vacation...Penny....Ontario Canada

<Author>lindaace
<Content>Globalia Punta Cana Grand was just OK My mother and I just returned from a week at the Globalia Punta Cana Grand. The travel agent at Apple Vacations recommended it to us because it fit within our budget of $1100 per person for a week. This was our 5th trip to the Dominican so we are very familiar with the way the all inlcusive resorts are run. I must say I was a little dissapointed. I had read all of the reviews, some terrible and some were encouraging. I believe the reason for the broad spectrum of reveiws must be because people have very different standards. Apple rated this a 5 apple and I definately disagree and would have rated it a 4 apple. The check in was quick and easy although the front desk employees were not overly friendly. the bell hop took us to a room that smelled moldy and the very small bathroom was very old and had a chipped sink, broken toilet seat and had mold in the grouting of the floor and walls. After a few minutes in the room we returned to the front desk and said the room was unacceptable and that my mother fell off the broken toilet seat. They moved us to a room that was much newer and nicer and quite acceptable, although the view was awful. You looked directly at a tin roof of a smaller building. we had asked for building #7 which is what the reviews said you should do, but they told us it would be an additional $50 a day for building #7. The maid service was excellent.The biggest thing that stood out to us the entire week was the fact that this was a very old resort that needed a lot of updating. the food at the main buffet was overall good although the food at the beach resturant was awful. We were always able to find somehting we liked at the main buffett and the wait staff was very accomodating. We did see a little rodent twice, once in the diningroom and once in the theater. I am not sure if it was a mouse or small rat, but it definately freaked us out. The seaweed that I read about was also an issue but it was not only at the Globalia it was at the Allegro and Natura Park and that entire little stirp. We walked the beach each day and I noticed it was infront of all three resorts. The maintainence guys did a great job of cleaning it up all day with rakes and removing it with wheel barrows. The entertainment was what I had experienced at all the other resorts but some of the games had too much of a sexual overtone to it and I was a bit offended and embarrassed at times. I guess I am somewhat of a prude and I was with my 76 year old mother. the drinks were awful - very poor selection, no vodka, whiskey or gin, just rum, beer and wine and the pina colodas and frozen daquries were watered down and syrupy sweet. Overall it was Ok but I think you get what you pay for and although it wasn't horrible for $1100 a week, next time I will pay an additional $400 and go back to the Iberostar or somewhere a little more upscale.  
<Date>Feb 4, 2007
