<Author>belyj78
<Content>Upgrade to Building #7 Room: There are only six ocean-view rooms with TWO jacuzzies. The asking price was extra $50/night. Negotiate and tip the guy at the front desk to get a better deal. Ask for free Internet with the room upgrade.Room Service: 24/7, nice selection, pretty fast. Use it.Food: good selection of mediocre food. The food at the specialty restaurants was a lot better. You need to make reservations a few days in advance. Da Mario was wonderful. Beach: very nice and clean. Some seaweed in the morning but the staff tries to clean it up.Pools: get there early to get a good spot. Adult pool by building #7 was nice and quite.Casino: Nothing special. Watch out for the $2/5 NL Poker game. I saw the same people not staying at the resort play all the time. Staff: very friendly and helpful. Tip right and youl get anything.Entertainment: don miss the Michael Jackson and the Dominican shows. They were great.Shopping: the shops don belong to the hotel. The owners are very aggressive. Better to stay away. After five days of negotiation I bought a paining for 20% of the original asking price. So bargain.Nigh life: not much going on but who cares if you got a jacuzzi on your balcony:)  
<Date>Jan 30, 2007

<Author>azzurriToronto
<Content>Great Vacation This was our very first time in Punta Cana. My friend and I had a fantastic time. We were at the Punta Cana Grand from Jan 16 until Jan 23. Our accomadations were excellent, check in as you are told is at 3:30 and the room was clean and very spacious. As for the restaurants there are two buffet restaurants available as well as three a la carte restaurants. Make your reservations when you arrive at the front desk to guarantee an evening. The weather was hot during the day and the evenings were cooler but very comfortable. The beach is beautiful, the sand is white, the water is warm and yes there is seaweed but thats nature and it was spectacular. You can walk the beach and feel safe. The vendors do come up to you and ask to come and see their shop, just be friendly say OLA and if you want to go and see what they have to offer make them happy. There is no harm in looking. The people and staff at the Punta Cana Grand are extremely friendly and accomodating. They are always smiling and available if you need anything. The waiters and bartenders are fantastic, even though english is not their first language they really attempt to make themselves understood. The beauty of vacation is to learn and communicating with these people and getting to know them is what makes our travels so memorable. The ANIMATION staff was excellent. What a great group of people. Their goal is to entertain and they do that indeed. From 9 til 12 they are there to make you laugh and enjoy yourself through activites and games. We really had a good time. We would like to thank Mike, Willy, Anthony, Santos and the girls of the group for making our trip great. Travel with an open mind and if you are friendly and appreciate culture your experience at the Punta Cana Grand will be as fantastic as ours was.  
<Date>Jan 28, 2007

<Author>paradisevacation
<Content>Upgrade to Building #7!!! We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks. Upon return, we were curious to read other peoples reviews and were very surprised to see low ratings and negative comments about the food.The hotel is great and although we are pretty picky eaters, we had so much choice that we couldnt even try everything. The buffet was great with a lot of excellent choices. We had the Romantic Dinner on the beach (for an extra charge) and it was marvellous. Personalized service with a candlelight dinner. Every couple should indulge - it is such a romantic experience!My biggest piece of advice would be upgrading to a room in Building #7. It is like a completely different vacation - gorgeous room with marble floors and a Jacuzzi inside the room. When we arrived and inquired about the pricing for the upgrade, we were told it would be $40/night. After negotiating with the clerk at reception, we were able to reduce it to $20/night!! We also asked for lower prices at the spa, and got significant discounts. The spa is great - clean, with beautiful facilities.The service wasnt always amazing, but you have to remember that the staff works crazy hours in an incredible heat. Everyone is human and for the mere pennies that they get paid, I think that they exceed expectations.  
<Date>Jan 28, 2007

<Author>ScarbroughDiamond
<Content>Love the People March /April 2006 the Punta Cana Grand 4-4.5 star resort. I don know where to begin ?.this trip did wonders for me, I needed to get away. I was unsure about going and I did not want to pay the amount that I paid but apparently upon my return I got a really good deal and I CERTAINLY got my money $$$ worth. O yeah we went back again in JUnE2006. There are two things that I express to my friends before going on this trip. I NEED to be in a nice hotel and have GOOD FOOD! THE GROUNDS ?talk about clean!!!! When you see people raking the beaches and wiping the garbage cans. BEACH- AMAZING I loved it. The white sand was soft on your feet you could hardly feel that you were walking on sand. ACCOMODATION- The room was spacious exactly what is in the travel brochures. The room was clean and was clean daily. The beds we made daily and fridge stock daily even thought we didn use anything in the fridge. FOOD- Man, Man the food was AMAZING. Words CAN NOT express how good the food was. Put it this was I put on 6 pounds so what does that tell you , I ate 2 plates at the time because I was not sure we would gte to try it again . There buffet change themes everyday and there were some different food so I have to eat everything at the same time. Breakfast was the one meal take pride in when I am at home but the breakfast at home does not compare. We would go out to the club and get home at 5:00 or 6:00 in the morning and breakfast is served until 10:30 and we would set the alarm for 10:00 rushing to shower and get dress just to get breakfast. We look forward to lunch (our Dominican Markham Station - only if your from Scarborough/Toronto, Ontario you know about Markham Station) and dinner. I have to say I haven eaten 3 meals a day since I have been on my own for the last 9 years so you must know that this was like heaven LOL.  STAFF- was courteous and polite. It was hard to communicate with housekeeping but I I stuck with la?that works. They were friendly made you feel like you at home. Victor in the Di Mario A La Carte, Oswaldo and Humberto from the Tex Mex American Grille are our new friends. Front desk staff Siris - o my we gave them a hard time in a loving way but they were so accommodating. Paco was great he got us what we wanted. The Bell Guys ?Mr. Baseball Some other front desk we so by the book but I guest they are really doing there job but hey you just have to find they right person and at the en of the day it is who you know. And of coure the head Honshu herself KAREN ?you are the best and we miss you. POOL- Clean - had so much fun. I was looking forward to being on the bridge from when I saw it in the travel brochures. Love the swim up bar the staff at the bar was great. Travellers : Anesha , Martha , Latoya , Kixxs, Justis

<Author>newtongr
<Content>Martin Luther King Day Prolonged Weekend We enjoyed our stay at the Punta Cana Grand.We were a group of 10 guys, ranging in age from 42 to 78 who go on an annual soire to various resorts , on Martin Luther king weekend (5 days) for 25 years. We are a very diversified group. A Judge, college professor, plumber, stockbroker, etc.The hotel facilities were very nice. Excelent layout, clean rooms, adequate food. A great deal for the money. $1,000 for the entire package. 4nights, five days, round trip from Kennedy.The food at all these all inclusives is good , not great. I call it Diner Food. Nothing wrong with that as long as that is what you expect.This was our first trip to Punta Cana, recommended by our travel agent, Reko Tours. The one problem was service. We are generous tippers and hand out dollar bills very freely. That usually is magic at most resorts. Here, no waiter service at the pool. The staff seem to be confounded at out tipping. In Boca Chica we have a trail of staff following us.In summary, I would recommend this hotel. For the $$$ it's a great deal.Newt, the Judge.  
<Date>Jan 26, 2007

<Author>Dianne50
<Content>In One Word "Great" - Ontario, Canada Just got back from Punta Cana Grand Jan. 17-24! Weather, resort, food, people was great! Booked through Nolitours, great travel agent to deal with - great service! I had read and read dozen of reviews of this hotel and by the time I left on my holiday, I was a little nervous if we had chosen the right one? Our flight was smooth, our arrived time was perfect, transfer from the airport to the Grand was short, got to the Grand had to wait for l/2 hour for our room, but we told we could go have lunch, enjoy the pool, whatever until room was ready - good service! They were right, we got our room key in l/2 hour, room was clean, bright, nice view! All the food spots were good, Windows the buffet was great, no problem with the food. We were careful what we ate, just like at home! The beach was a wee weedy but we did survive, walked down along the beach, you can walk for miles, stop where ever and put your feet in, the water was very warm! The weather was perfect - 80-85 every day, a few clouds, no stucky stuff like we get in Ontario! Now the only thing that was a little weird for me, keep in mind I am a 51 year old woman, have seen better days, two kids, my husband 53, great guy, we are normal everyday hard working, average and I mean average people, the topless thing going on was again weird.By the end of the holiday, we were accustom to the sites! The grounds were well kept, people cleaning, trimming all the time. I can't say enough, I loved it, I go back tomorrow if I could! My husband and I are not travellers of the world, but I would recommend this spot to anyone!

<Author>World_Traveling_Girl
<Content>I wouldn't stay here.... Well after being bumped from our hotel to this place, we were very disappointed. We spent a month researching where we wanted to stay and we definitely didn't want this one. But low and behold, we were here and not by choice. Our room was not made when we got there. The bed wasn't made. The shampoo, conditioner, and lotion were half full. The a/c didn't work. The tv was maybe 13 with a broken remote. We mentioned these things to front desk, but they looked disinterested. Then every day, we would never have enough towels. Speaking of the towels, most of the beach towels were stained. Some even smelled as if they weren't washed. We hoped the food was decent. But it wasn't. I didn't know that you could screw up breakfast, but this place did. When trying to explain eggs over easy, they didn't understand. Thank goodness for cereal. The lunch was really awful. I don't think there was one thing I can say was actually good. Dinner, make a reservation at the Italian restaurant. But be prepared, what it says on the menu does not mean that is what you will get. So glad to be back in the states and just get a slice of pizza, which tasted better than anything they served. As for the service, if you like having ice thrown into your cleavage and then they talk about your boobs by a bartender. Or a cleaning woman banging on the bathroom door as your trying to go to the bathroom. Or being called a -------- by a shop (the ones by the front desk) owner cause I wouldn't go in. And the list goes on. Did I mention, no one seems to use the disco, casino, theater or piano bar. Don't stay here!!!!!!!!!  
<Date>Jan 24, 2007

<Author>dchenriquez
<Content>Loved it! My husband and I stayed at Globalia PCG in November for 3 nights. We loved it. We got upgraded upon check in because my husband new one of the guys working at the front desk which always helps i guess. So we got to stay in an incredible suite. Pools: We liked that fact that there were a few different pools to choose from. We spent a little bit of time at the main pool and enjoyed the swim up bar and music they had on constantly. But it was nice that if you wanted to go to have a more quieter, priviate time you could do that too. One of the pools is no kids aloud which is sometimes nice if you don't have kids. Another one of the pools off to the side (was right infront of our building) and was nice and quiet. Just depends on what your looking for. Entertainment: We thought that the animators did a very good job. We only saw two shows, one was a funny auidence participation and another was a domincan or tropical show. The dancers weren't very good, but it was nice to watch just the same. On the dominican night they had a small live domincan band playing the drums and accordian infront of the bar near the pool at night. We really enjoyed sitting and listening and dancing to their music. There is a lot to do at this resort. We are not really into gambling but went and checked out the new casino and thought it was beautiful. Restuarants: We ate at the main buffet for breakfast and enjoyed their selection and fresh juices every morning. We normally had lunch at the restaurant on the beach. Not too much to choose from but a nice change of atmosphere. We went one night to the American Grill i think it was called. It was kind of what i thought of a western place boarder line Mexican. they served Fajaitas and things of that sort. But it was quite good also. The buffet also had lots to choose from for dinner.We really really enjoyed this hotel and would reccommend it to anyone and everyone. Lots to do there for every age group.

<Author>Nathb
<Content>Punta Cana Grand is not that grand.... This was to be a special trip because we were bringing our nieces with us (11, 14 and 16 years old). So it had to be prepared in advance. So we booked with Sunwing with a travel agent in August for a Dec 30th departure for 1 week vacation. Because we have no kids, we never book at that time of the year or during the high season, so we were prepared for it to be very busy. On the day of departure at the airport, we went trough the VIP line (no wait) because we had booked the priviledge package for an additional cost and that was appreciated. Before we left, we had asked for 2 rooms attached to each other with a specific request for certain type of beds and that is what we got. It also went pretty fast. We arrived at the hotel at around noon and got one of the room at 12:30. The second room was available only later that day, but that was not a problem, at least we had the first one. This complex is very small compare to many hotels I've been in Punta Cana. So for a couple with kids, it was perfect. We always knew pretty much where the kids where at all time. If we did not, it would take us only a couple of minutes to find them. Also, the builing we where in was no 4. We where 2 minutes from anywhere, the beach, the pools (2 for all, 1 for adults), the buffet, the restaurants and the lobby. And that part was great. In general, even if this was a very busy time, we never really waited for anything, and never felt that we were packed like sardines and that was a relief.But lets talk about what was not: Yes this place is small (about 400 rooms very close to each other), so great for famillies, but if you like to walk around for more than 15 minutes, forget it. Also, the way the builings are made, very long corridors with all the doors to your room inside, there is a lot of echo. So if somebody pass by, or snores, or just talk somewhere in that corridor you hear it. Also because our rooms were very close to one of the retaurant, all the carts (made of metal) coming and going, where very noisy at all time, very early in the morning and very late at night. Because we were there for the Dec 31st celebration a lot of partying was also going on and that is understandable, but we had the misfortune to be close to a private party offered by the hotel owners' Globalia' to its directors. During that special party(Dec 31st), the very loud music was played till 4 am. We did call to complain many time to a least lower the music a bit, so we could sleep, but nothing really happened. The 3rd time I called at 3 oclock in the morning, the poor guy taking the calls told me that he could not do anything because it was his bosses having the party! I did make an official complaint the morning after, and got 2 baskets of fruits with their appologies, that we did accept. But again 2 days after the party, twice we had problems with noise at night. But this time It was fixed within the hour.As for the food, it was very average. and many time in the morning, there was no more glasses, orange juice or plates left. This was a very slow buffet. The kids where very fussy and ate pretty much the same thing every day. No big adventurers here. I on the other hand ate pretty much anything and it was not too bad. But nobody got sick or burned and the girls had a blast. It was their first trip to the Carribbean and they loved it. I on the other hand been here too often and have seen better hotels. But one thing cannot be beaten, the white beautiful beaches with the palm trees. This is one of the reason we came here. It is safe, beautiful and not too far from home (less than a 4 hour flight), and the people at the hotel pretty friendly.All and all, this was pretty much an very average trip for us. Only the kids really made it special. Globalia Punta Cana Grand is not the best but not the worst hotel we have been. If you are a couple with kids, go for it , if you are a couple with no kids, go but ask to have a room far from building no 4, if you want a little peace and quiet. If you do have a little more money to splurge go for builing no 7 which are masters suites and much more intimate and private. The construction of that building seem to be a little different from the others and of better quality. Maybe this would have been a better vacation if not for Building no 4.....  
<Date>Jan 22, 2007

<Author>norm6269
<Content>Punta Cana Grand by Globalia First off, when you take a cab, make sure you use the brand Globalia, the Allegro Punta Cana Grand is right next door, and by mistake was taken there, if it wasn't for a quick look at TripAdvsior.com before my flight, I would not have remember the name Globalia. Anyways, the entrance is very nice, marble floor with two spiral staircases that lead up to a nice piano bar. The room is what i expected, simple. TV, coffee maker, balcony with garden view, etc. No problems at all with the room, but I have been to DR before so I know not to expect gradois rooms. There were three seperate pools I beleive, one the main pool was very large and very crowded, but their were also two other pools hidden around the resort and it was a nice touch. The beach is covered with palm trees and lounge chairs which was fantastic. The one main observation was that there was a lack of peddlers roaming the beach. There were three small shacks on the beach that sold the usual, shirts and paintings. the resorts also hosted their own small line of shops which was quite different from what I have seen on my previous trips. New movies played every night and of course they had in house entertainment. The food is always good, so I won't elaborate, overall very nice, and would recommend defiently.

<Author>crysaylatte
<Content>Globalia was a Global Disaster!!!!! This was the absolute worst vacation of my life. Let me start off by saying that it was bad from beginning to end. Our front desk service person was in a hurry to get us out of his way when we first checked in. We entered our room and there were ants all over the bathroom sink. The tub was dingy and the housekeepers were hesitant to clean it again. They acted as if we were bothering them the whole entire weekend. The service at the restaurants was awful. Hardly anyone spoke English so we felt isolated and could never get anyone to understand our needs and requests. The food at all four restaurants was prison slop. Everyday when we went to a buffet, we saw the same leftovers from the previous day. We actually saw hair all over the french toast one morning and the employees had an attitude when we told them about it. The beach was not clean; there was seaweed everywhere and the sand was philthy.The only part of this resort that was nice was the spa and entertainment. They presented a Michael Jackson impersonator who was excellent.

<Author>CocoFantastic
<Content>You need a really good attitude to make this work... I stayed at the Punta Cana Grand from January 11th to the 16th with my husband and was thoroughly disappointed. I don't consider myself a particularly picky traveler but the place was at it's best mediocre and at it's worse just plain bad. Here's the negative: -Housekeeping was spotty. Some days I got a full set of towels, some days not. When I used the coffee maker in the room, it was often not cleaned. As an aside, the water in the shower was rarely hot. Be ready for some cool showers.-Food was bad (other than the desserts). It was nearly impossible to get a hot cup of coffee in the mornings. Usually it was warm or lukewarm. The traditional Dominican dishes served were not made well. The a la carte restaurants were not very good either. I ordered Beef medallions at Da Mario's and was served a big slab of beef. Aren't beef medallions small cuts of beef? It was hit or miss with the beach food as well. I often got a hamburger that was burned on the outside and red on the inside.-The grounds were not well kept. No one came around during the day to pick up cups and plates from the pool and beach. This is probably why I saw cups floating in the adult pool section and styrofoam plates on the beach during a night stroll.-Prepare to fight your way for a spot on the beach or by the main pool. You have to get up very early in the morning if you would like a spot with a shaded cabana. Like before 8AM early since people take them nearly at the crack of dawn. Also, you have to get tickets to receive beach towels by the pool or exchange your towels at the towel stand. There were shortages of towels and my husband and I had our towels stolen twice in one day at the main pool. You're better off by the adult pool by Building 7.-Avoid the spa. My husband and I got massages that were little more than someone rubbing oil on our backs. These were not massages at all.-Don't bother to call the front desk with problems. You have to go down there in person. They rarely answered the phone or the phone rang for a long time before someone answered.-Staff is not really bilingual.The positive:-We were locked out of our rooms because the battery went out on the card lock on the first night there. The staff resolved the issue pretty quickly.-There are no roaches or rodents in the rooms.-Some of the staff was cordial and helpful. -The nightly entertainment (shows) were pretty entertaining. I really enjoyed The Dominican Show.-The desserts were quite good. Overall, I would not reccommend this place and I wouldn't go back.  
<Date>Jan 17, 2007
<Rating>2	2	2	3	2	3	2	-1	
<Aspects>

<Author>Tabbycatmom
<Content>College Winter Break Just returned from trip Jan. 4-11. Traveled w/husband and 20-yr. old daughter and her college roommate. Not sure what to expect after reading mixed reviews, but here's what we experienced.Check-in: Arrived about 3:30 and room was not ready. We were greeted with drinks and directed to the buffet. We came back about 1/2 hr. later and room was ready and bellhop took our bags to our rooms.Rooms: We were assigned to 2 rooms in Bldg. 2. Rooms were clean, but sheets were not the new; a little threadbare. After tipping the maid the next day, she put new sheets on the bed, rugs on the tile floors, and flowers in our bathrooms! She was an absolute doll who worked very hard and very long hours. Our Apple rep told us the average wage the workers make is only about $100/month. So sad. Beach: Clean but small. You could walk for miles along the shore though, so no problem. White sand and so beautiful. Resort needs to add more lounge chairs, though. Ran out quickly if you did not claim yours early in the a.m.Staff: Very friendly, never encountered a rude or surly person at all. Our girls quickly made friends with many of the younger staff and had a lot of fun at the disco at night and during the various games during the day. The staff had yoga, aerobics, water aerobics, volleyball, games, etc. scheduled during the day, along with a movie, and a big show every night at 9:30 p.m. The shows were very good....one night it was a magician, dominician dance shows, lip sync dance show, etc. Very entertaining.Food: Not very impressed with the two speciality restaurants; the Da Mario Italian and the Beaches but the American Grill, which was a Tex Mex was very good. the Windows Restaurant was the buffet and you could always find something good. Overall, it was a fun time for the girls during semester break so they could work on their tans and relax before heading back to school. The resort was clean, food was good, staff was fun and pleasant, and we had a nice time.  
<Date>Jan 14, 2007

<Author>xxxx888
<Content>Not exactly as illustrated The two main problems:1. Food - I was sick from the food Dec 26 through 29th, 2006;2. Beach - Too small and crowded for the number of people. Approximately 200 meters wide - which sounds big until you see how many people they cram onto this area. There were fights on the beach over the lounge chairs. Have a look at the beach photos supplied here in TripAdvisor - You don't see the small roped-off swimming area, outside of which you risk being run over by power boats pulling tubes etc. The stink of the gas exhaust from all the power boats wafts over the beach all day long. Everyone had to sit within 4 feet of the next group of tourists on the beach - Kinda like being at a mall just before Xmas. The beach is not as depicted in the photos at all.I'm careful about the food I consume especially when travelling - I'm a vegetarian for starters. That means when travelling I eat vegetables, rice, eggs, bread. I never consume anything new and I don't eat spicy food. If I get sick, there's a problem with the food. (What can they do to boiled potatoes, eggs?) By the way, I was not the only person sick during that period. Two kids in Building 3 were sick too.The room and associated amenties were not deluxe. I paid for what is described as a deluxe room in a 4plus star hotel. The view from the room of the building next door was not inpiring. The electrical shock I received from the table lamp kept me alert. The 6 small jets coming out of the clogged shower head made me glad I was not in a hurry to shower. No tissue in the room etc. Not all of this concerning the room is really serious (except the lamp) because I don't go down south to spend time in a hotel room, so as long as the place is clean, I'm usually OK. However, the building I was in (Building 3) was extremely noisy all night. Not just because of the other guests - they were doing some work on the plumbing or whatever (one half day there was no water in the building).Conquest Tours misrepresented this hotel.

<Author>lemberg1965
<Content>The worst vacation ever!!! First let me state that this is my 8th. vacation in the Caribbean, but 1st time in Dominican Rep. with Apple vacation. I traveled with my wife and two kids 12 and 11. We all had high expectations for a relaxing week and decent weather.On arrival at the hotel I asked for a quiet area since my kids were tired 3:00 am. wake up for the flight. We were placed in a room literally next to a beach party with the band playing a max vol. past midnight. The room was small, old furniture, shower did not work, and water leaked from the ceiling in the bathroom. I asked to be moved to another room in am. The room was only marginally better next to a bar with music playing past midnight alternating with rowdy screaming in variety of different languages. THIS IS NOT A RESORT FOR FAMILIES LOOKING TO RELAX! It is more suited for couples and singles. None of us could sleep and my kids could not wait to leave. The final straw was when my daughter got sick either from water or the food. We were booked for 8 day stay, we left 4 days after arrival on the only flight that day into St Louis and paid for the additional flight into Chicago.The food was abundant but mediocre in quality except for the fresh fruit. There was constant shortage of utensils, clean plates, service was OK. Most memorable was the seafood dinner serving what was clearly rancid shrimp. Cleanliness also an issue at some of the outdoor buffets.The grounds were nice and generally well maintained, beach was clean but crowded, towels were in short supply at certain times of day. European topless attire at the pool and beach may be an issue for you.Staff tried to be helpful but because of the max capacity (winter vacation) could not be very accomodating. Prices were another nuisance, phone calls locally were outrageously expensive 27.00 dol.for 30 min. Sunscreen lotion 25.00 dollars for small tube etc. Needless to say I will never go near this resort again, this may have been an exception to the generally positive experience expressed by others but I am glad that there is a forum such as this one to tell others what to expect. We are not spoiled travelers who expect only the best, I do understand this is a 3rd. world country with a different standard of living but we have traveled extensively in central Amer.and Asia and this trip was a huge disapointment.  
<Date>Dec 31, 2006

<Author>Cindi13
<Content>Get With It Globalia!!! Review for Punta Cana GrandTHE GOOD, THE BAD AND THE UGLYWe traveled with the author of the true review and I may have more to add but basically dido her review!!!! My husband and I are frequent travelers - Mexico, Cuba, Panama, Europe and now Dominican!!! So please don't think I'm a first time traveler dissing an all-inclusive resort! Before traveling to Punta Cana we read the reviews and laughed at those that nitpicked minor details ?until we experienced the same minor details ?the fact is several small things start to add up and definitely cause frustration.We traveled with SUNWINGon BOOK WITH THEM EVER. They have terrible security ?a couple fighting as we landed were disrupting the entire plane, the lady pulled her top up, tried jumping over seats, and mouthed profanities with children aboard ?FLIGHT ATTENDANTS DIDN DO A THING. They barely tried to stop her from lighting a cigarette on the steps of the planeello jet fuel!!! Once off the steps she began beating her mate ?no one did a thing!! Security actually found it to be quite amusing ?now that safety for you!!The return flight was safer ?no crazy domestics ?but they didn have enough pillows or blankets and were very inconsistent in offering drinks. The airline also BUSTED the wheel off my luggage and didn bother returning ANY phone calls or emails in regards to this!! The rep at our resort was a SUNWING employee (Luis) ?so it pretty much explained why you could never find him!! They obviously hire whoever walks in the door and provide little to no training! FOOD: While evening meals were definitely edible and sometimes enjoyable the wrath of the after effects makes me ill just thinking about it. Buffet sucks for breakfast and lunchsually left overs from the night beforeakes me gag thinking about it!!!! ROOM SERVICE: What a jokeou call and if they understand you ?your order may be delivered in 2 ?3 hours!!! THAT IS NOT AN OVEREXAGGERATION!!!PLEASE KEEP IN MIND...this is a review about the Punta Cana Grand not PUNTA CANA!!! I absolutely love the beach, weather and people (bar, waitstaff and housekeeping ONLY). RESORT: gorgeous - great pools - adult pool was way too boring, no music and the water was extremely warm. The main pool was enjoyable but I wouldn't stay near the pool bar for too long - at times it was warmer there than in the Jacuzzi - GROSS!!!The restaurants were also very nice ?food wasn great, but to be expected I guess.The resort is REALLY clean, beautiful grounds and spotless!! HOUSEKEEPING: Angela was the BEST!!! Our room was spotless, she even checked in on our ill friend to see how she was feeling ?WE LOVE HER!!!CIGAR LOUNGE: awesome spot to relax with great staff and drinks!! We love Rudy  Benjamin ?YOU GUYS ROCK!! Karaoke was also fun, however, it was supposed to run Saturday  Wednesday ?Saturday was a no go because the machine didn work ?go figure!! The Wednesday Karaoke was a ton of fun but didn last long enough :o)DISCO: Was what you made it to be!! We had a blast, as the DJ was quick to play any tune you requested. Out of all the resorts wee traveled to we had the most fun at this Disco!! Benjamin even tried to teach me his moves..LOLSWIM UP BAR: Nice feature but as mentioned earlier ?try not to stick around that area, I didn see one person make a move to use a restroom :o( Juan the bartender always has a smile and he was super sweet!WATERSPORTS: available, free of charge and my cousin enjoyed the kayaking. We missed the catamaran lessons because they were only once a day at 9:30 am - I guess they had to spend the rest of the day hitting on every single woman with a heartbeat.SHOPPING: Don't be fooled by all the scammers on the beach, don't listen to their sob stories and definitely don't pay their asking price they punch crazy figures into their STUPID calculators and promise it is a deal - whatever. We paid $60 from the original price of $170!!! BARGAIN, BARGAIN, BARGAIN because it's all useless junk they swear is genuine to the Dominican - half of the junk broke when we got home!TOURS/DAY TRIPS: There are a ton of excursions available, although quite pricey in comparison to other holidays and as mentioned before LUIS our Sunwing rep was NEVER available to book or discuss these day trips!! I only saw him once when he was able to locate our friends (hospital) ?which we were thankful for, but still he really should be MORE visible and AVAILABLE for all the problems we had to work through ?especially since he told each of us his schedule and that he was always available.NIGHTLY ENTERTAINMENT: We went to two shows ?they were fun ?Saturday is Michael Jackson night ?great job!!! Check this show out! And for those who love to get involved check out the nything Can Happen Night?I participated in the s. Punta Cana Grand?contest ?absolutely hilarious!!We also took a bus (supposed to have a shuttle every 20 minutes ?yeah right) to Catalonia Resort to visit their Casino!! STAY HERE IF YOU ARE GOING!!! This place was so beautiful!!! The Casino took our $50 quick, no big deal ?we had fun :o)ACTIVITIES = BUST!!! What was the purpose of having an entertainment team if they can't even get an activity going!!! Thank God for my cousin who rallied at the microphone to get the guests involved ?they were all waiting for Entertainment, they would have still been sitting waiting if he hadn been proactive in organizing some games!! And what with the idle trampoline lying face down on the beach!!!?? I was excited to see it on the beach although it was never used and when you asked about it they shrugged you off. I was also disappointed one afternoon when my husband jumped in the pool and lost his sunglasses. I searched the whole pool, filters and all. Two lovely ladies sitting poolside informed me that they were placed at the side of the pool and Entertainment Staff picked them up. Only when I asked nobody had a clue ?until the one staff member ason?pulled them out of his fanny pack ?QUICK FINGERS!!! FRONT DESK STAFF: DON GO TO FRONT DESK, DON CALL FRONT DESK ?THEY DON CARE!!!!! They are truly the most ignorant, unorganized, carefree (not in a good way) staff I have ever seen!!! We had charges to our room that didn even make sense ?I didn pay either because it was a total SCAM!! They charged me $5 for the Internet for one hour and they charged my cousin $5 for 20 minutes??? Front desk couldn even program our room key correctly, or send maintenance to have our toilet fixed ?VERY DISAPPOINTING. The toilet and room key issue sound so minor but let me tell you it was EXTREMELY frustrating and a true nuisance! We had to enter through our friend room because NOONE came to fix this issue after at least SIX ?TEN REQUESTS ?both in person and over the phone!! The woman concierge even walked up to our room to witness that it was not working ?AND STILL NOTHING!!! The toilet ?URGH!!!!CONCIERGE: To the TALL DARK MAN working oncierge??what a joke ?I hope you were happy making me cry in the lobby!!!! VERY shocked at the way you treated people...what a disappointment! GLOBALIA GET WITH IT!!! Looks like youe running this resort into the ground!! IN CLOSING, please treat the wait staff, housekeeping and bartenders well ?TIP!!! They earn very minimal for the hours they put in!!! They treat you like Gold and are very appreciative :o) HOWEVER, your best bet is to stay elsewhere!!! Don let the price fool you! You get what you pay fornd we got too good of deal ?it jaded us!!!

<Author>assyta
<Content>The Best holidays of my life I'm Portuguese and i was in Globalia Punta Cana wth my Husband (Honeymon) at 20-27 Nov.It was fabulous! It was everything perfect: people ,room, food,sports, beach, weather, etc.We were in Building 7, big room with jacuzzi and we had fruit and a bottle of champagne in the room!Everyone was wonderful, friendly, and always going out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The food and drinks are good, great taste and selection. I love banana mama and mamajuana. The shows were very good. I love the sports (free): Kayak, Catamar, windsurf, snorkeling( we saw corals and a lot of the fish, we give them bread and banana!).Thursday was the best day,with a beach party, everything(food and drinks) and everyone were in the beach!!!I will return....!!!

<Author>Maineacs
<Content>Punta Cana Grand - Excellente!!!!!!!!!! November 29 - December 9, 2006My girlfriend, Cyndie and I, (The Maineacs), just returned from another super fantastic vacation to the Dominican Republic, this time at Globalia Punta Cana Grand, Nov. 29 - Dec. 9. This was our seventh trip to the DR. First year at the Iberostar Costa Dorado in Puerta Plata, second year at Bavarro Princess in Punta Cana, third year at the Iberostar Hacienda Dominicus in Bayahibe, fourth year at the Iberostar Punta Cana. Fifth year at Casa del Mar. Sixth year at Sunscape the Beach. Read on to get some pointers on the resort.Flight/AirportWe are from Maine, and our trip departed from Boston on American Airlines. Our vacation was booked through Vacation Travel Mart, and Beth Miller again found us the best deal anywhere, for the seventh straight year!!!! No one has come close to their prices, plus you accumulate mileage, which we will use next year for our 2nd free trip!!!!!!! We drove down to Boston the night before, spent the night at a Park  Fly motel (cheaper than parking at Logan), and then left at 7:00 AM for San Juan, and then on to Punta Cana. Only took 45 minutes to check in and go through security. Flight was great and on timeArrival in DRArrived in Punta Cana, got our picture taken, and we were met by our tour representative from Turinter. Loaded up into a van and off to the Punta Cana Grand. About a 20 minute drive. Roads were no worse, actually better, than La Romana or Puerto Plata. They are building a highway from Punta Cana up along the coast towards Secrets, and it is supposed to cut the travel time in half. Wel see. Always an exciting car ride. Check-inWe were the only ones in the van, plus no large tour (Apple, etc.) was checking in. Greeted with drink - nice touch. Room wasn't quite ready so went to bar and had a drink. We were upgraded to the new Bldg. 7 with a jacuzzi in the room!!! Thanks go to Beth Miller, Anna, and Karen. No charge for room safe - yeah!!! We were on 3rd floor of Bldg. 7 facing the resort next door. Mainly garden and palm trees. Fantastic room and view. After only 10 minutes wait at the bar, our luggage and us were whisked away to our room.RoomRoom was fantastic. Fruit and a bottle of champagne greeted us in the room. AC worked great, always on - no card in the switch hassle. Hot water and water pressure fluctuated from good to bad throughout our trip. Really no problem. They are working on the problem. Coffee pot in room. Iron. Bath robe. Everything was perfect. No bugs.  BBeachYou can walk for miles to the left and about a mile to the right. Not as calm and clear as CDM, but always kept clean. First few days the wind was wild so the water was murky and somewhat grassy for a few days. Then the wind died down and the water was nice. You can also walk north (left) and find some great deserted and clear beaches to swim at also. Did miss the snorkeling somewhat, but again we became ool Maineacs?for this trip at the adult pool.PoolThree pools: A lazy river type between Bldg. 7 and 2, mainly for swim out room. Main pool with swim-up bar. Adult pool. Small but intimate with its own bar. Fantastic bartender (Nicholas!!!!!!!). After the first few days, as soon as Nicholas opened the bar at 10:00 AM he would bring me over a Bloody Caesar!!! Brought our own floats. Only used them a few times this year. FoodThe best food overall that we have had to date. Buffet was the best we have had. Great taste and selection. The ala carte restaurants: American Grill - Good. Mainly Mexican. You can have tequila shots. We did.. Beach Grill - Good - Had great seafood platter!!!!--At lunch they had a small buffet at the Beach Grill and also a place with burgers  dogs.DaMarios: Great. Had steak. Cooked perfectly. Nice relaxing mealHad a great beach party on Thursday.. Vegetable sushi at buffet on Wed.!!!!!  DrinkWhat can I say. Anything and everything you want - just ask. Caiprinha and Bloody Caesars!!!!!! Had any drink or liquor that you could think of. If you thought the drinks were too weak, just ask for more on? They will give it to you with a smile.We spent most of our evenings at the piano bar with the fantastic bartender Rudy Dias!!!!! We can't say enough good things about Rudy.Beach bar made fantastic Manhattans!!! Sadly or luckily ;-) we didn't find this out till our last night. Bar by pool was also great.Casino was fun. Went in and did some slots. This year we didn't do any shows, but heard that they were good.StaffEveryone was wonderful, friendly, and always going out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. Maids were great. Fridge always restocked each day. Sorry I didn't get to meet Anna and Karen. They are the best, and see to every guest needs. Hope to meet up next time we are there. Maybe next year.Hola to all the people we met from Canada, Michigan, and Virginia.Flight backNo problem at the airport. So sad to leave.Overall it was another fantastic trip to the DR. We highly recommend that you go to Punta Cana Grand!!!! Next year we can go for 2 weeks, and we were tentatively thinking of 1 week CDM and 1 week Iberostar Hac. Dom. Now we have Punta Cana Grand on our list so maybe one week there. We may change our minds. As usual, please e-mail or PM us if you have any questions. Photos will be up in a couple of weeks on Webshots. fike@yahoo.comMike  Cyndie - The Mainiacs

<Author>Veevers
<Content>Had a nice time, but might have gone elsewhere My husband and 2.5 year old daughter just came back from the Punta Cana Grand (Dec. 15-19). We had a nice vacation, but I had some problems with the hotel. I did plenty of online searching before I booked it, and based on all the reviews, decided to go with the Punta Cana Grand. We got a good deal, and overall, had a great vacation. But I would not go back.Pulling up to the hotel, I had a great feeling. The grounds looked nice and I was anxious to hit the pool and beach...and start relaxing. I was told that Building 7 was the best, so when I asked to be placed there they said it was an extra $50/night. For that amount I knew I could have booked the whole trip at a different higher class resort, so I didn't upgrade. We were placed in bldg 3. I was NOT happy with the room. I didn't mind the furniture being older, but the room had a dank smell, and the bathroom was terribly below avergae. The tub plug wasn't working, not that I would have given my daughter a bath in it anyway, and the fixtures were all rusty. The fridge and TV weren't working. So I went to the front desk and tried to get us changed. No luck.I decided to be a sport, and just enjoy the other elements of the resort. The grounds were great and we loved the pool, beach, and facilities on the sand for the kids (trampoline, playgrounds...) By day 2, I was getting more frustrated with our room and couldn't relax. They fixed our fridge, but replaced the TV with a tiny one. The pillow cases were too small for the pillows and I couldn't shake the feeling that the sheets were not properly clean. The second night we awoke to some craziness at 2:30 in the morning. Two doors down, a French man was beating his girlfriend up!!! We got up to see what we could do, and after the whole issue was sorted out with security, and all the guests on the floor had gone back to their rooms, we decided it was all too much. Granted, the hotel is not responsible for the very unfortunate domestic violence, but it was the last straw for me. (PS: the hotel wouldn't call the police and the woman just wanted to go back to the room with her boyfirend. The next day, they were as in love as ever, holding hands with her head wound covered by a strategically placed scarf).The next morning, my husband went back to the front desk with our laundry list of complaints, and got us upgraded to Building 7. Alas, our vacation began. Bldg 7 is like being in a different hotel. The room was beautiful, and everything brand new. We were on the ground floor, so our porch was right off the second pool. It was gorgeous, and very relaxing. It honestly felt like we were in a different resort. I loved everything about it. We were even able to put our daughter down for a nap, and still enjoy the day by sitting on our porch and jumping into the pool while she was sleeping. I think if I would have seen the room in Bldg 7 when we first checked in, I would have paid the $50/night without hesitation. As for some other elements of the resort: the staff was very nice and accomodating. However, the shopkeepers in the resort shops were very harassing, and turned rude as soon as you indicated that you weren't going to buy anything. The entertainment staff was great- they worked so hard and really seemed to want you to have a good time. I was very surprised by the quality of the nightly shows. The theater area is beautiful and the shows were entertaining. We didn't love the food, but didn't so long as we had a drink in hand, we were good to go. In summary- we had a great time on vacation and found the resort OK. For the extra $50/night for Building 7, I would have selected a different resort, but it turned out OK for us.  
<Date>Dec 20, 2006

<Author>advisoradvisor
<Content>Beautiful grounds and good service at the Punta Cana Grand As a travel agent who has been to the Dominican Republic once before and who loved it, I was very excited to be returning to a new area of the country, Punta Cana.My family and good friends just returned from a too short four night stay (Dec. 9-13) and must say that we were all thrilled at what we got for the money. For less than $750 per person (including insurance) we found a wonderful resort which I would not hesitate to return to. As a travel agent, I will also recommend it to clients.We were in Building 3 which is one of the older parts of the resort but it is very centrally located. We were just steps from the beach in one direction, to the pool and bar in another direction and to all the restaurants.The only problem we encountered was with the water pressure in our shower, or lack thereof. The sink had plenty of pressure as did the toilet but the shower was iffy, at best. One of the girls in our party who has unbelieveably thick hair, carried her shampoo to the beach showers and washed her hair there! It got the job done and besides a few strange looks, worked fine!The furniture was old in our rooms but the place was clean and the maids were very accomodating. I took little $1 gifts like razors, toothpaste, makeup, crayons, coloring books and stuffed Christmas animals/Santas which we gave out each day. My husband took two of the stuffed animals to the bartender at the adult pool . The adult pool is very small and the hot tub didn't appear to be hot but the bar was never too busy and the bartenders were very nice. We saw him walking around hugging those two animals for an hour after we gave them to him!The adult pool is supposed to be for topless bathers but there were topless women in the family pool, and on the beach so it really just provided a nice area for those who didn't want to be around kids. That wasn't a problem either while we were there since there were very few kids at the resort and the ones who were there were very well behaved. The third pool is between building 3 and 4 and is more like a swim out pool for those rooms which face it. There were few people using it while we were there.Those who have written about Americans being pushed to the back of the line at the bars, etc. must have had different staff than we had. We carried our own insulated glasses and a tray to carry drinks on and everytime we got refills for the eight of us, we tipped a dollar. The staff seemed to really appreciate it and, for heavens sake, $1.00 is a good deal for eight drinks!The food was generally good. Like most all inclusives, breakfast was the best but we got reservations the first night for the three specialty restaurants and found the food in all three outstanding. We had no problem getting reservations for all three nights. The American Grill served TexMex food which was good and we even had tequila shots included. The Da Mario restaurante had very good food but it seemed more like average dishes written in Italian; not Italian food per se. The last night we at in the Beach Garden restaurant and it was a seafood dinner. Very nice but nothing great. There were couples on the beach having anniversary/honeymoon dinners which was very romantic.Lunch was good at both restaurants, Windows and the Beach Garden which served a buffet as well as burgers, chicken and hot dogs.We only encountered three American couples at the resort and found most of the Europeans to be standoffish. It was not a friendly group there when we were there but the eight of us managed to have a ball.The casino was new and the staff was new at the job. It is not the place for a professional gambler but we loved it because the staff helped us and each other when mistakes were made. It was a fun place to visit for an hour or so at night.We didn't go to the nightly shows but just became beach bums. We spent our time between the pool which was clean and comfortable, and the ocean which did have a lot of floating seaweed (not like Ambergris Caye in Belize which has the stuff growing on the bottom so that you have to walk through it) The staff raked it away several times a day but it still would clump up on the beach. No big deal. No smell, you didn't have to walk in it and the worst part was that it floated into your bathing suit so that the shower floor became littered with it. Again, no big deal.Our trip did not include transfers and I found them onlline for $50-$60 per person each way. I decided to wait and was glad I did. We asked for a taxi at the airport, got a new bus just for us and paid $15 per person. The hotel arranged the return transfer and we had an older van with a really BAD driver but we made it with no problems and paid the same fare. Feel free to contact me if you plan on visiting this resort and I will gladly answer your questions.Betty Woodard  
<Date>Dec 18, 2006

<Author>little2
<Content>Loved it! Just returned from Punta Cana Grand on 12/13/06. This was our 5th trip to DR. My friend  I go on vacation just to RELAX! Nothing more but to relax. This hotel was our favorite  we will return. Check in was a breeze. We stayed in Bldng 4 and would request #5 next time. Bldng 4 was fine but right in the main line of people walking by or bringing food to beach bar/rest. Not a big deal but a little more quiet would make this perfect vs just about perfect. The room was fine. Spacious  well attended every day. Beach was great  had no problem getting a hut every day but could be the time of year since there were not many people staying at the hotel. There is a seaweed issue I've read about, but honestly, it was not a big deal. There is an army of people removing this all day, everyday. It appeared to me that there was a lot more seaweed further up the beach to the left because of the prevailing wind and prob current. Punta Cana Grand had the least amount  it was never a problem to us. Food was really the best we've had in the DR or Punta Cana. We found the staff to be very gracious and knowing at least a bit of Spanish helps a lot. I know a little, (muy poco), but enough to converse w/limits. I would give this resort very high marks  we have been very happy w/other resort hotels as well.

<Author>goodfoodrocks
<Content>Amazing facilities, OK food An overall amazing trip- its purpose was well needed relaxation from jobs  a family member illness. We (DH  I, late 20) wanted to do nothing but have tropical cocktails, stare at blue water, and be away from all contact from the eal world? This is a huge change for us, we are usually the people that have to see everything in a destination we visit. For me not to have a guidebook or any maps ?well, I didn think I would know what to do with myself. But oh how the Caribbean seduced me quickly?Our room on the third floor in building 7 was so amazing I don't even want to tell the general public about it - it was seriously that good. Beautiful marble floors, HUGE shower room, and TWO jacuzzi's- one on baclony, on in room! Our first meal... Room Service... We were starving and ate every bit of it, but I can actually say it was good. This was the food theme across the trip, nice presentation, nothing wrong with it, but nothing outstanding. DH and I decided that we are ood snobs?and that it wasn the resort fault we were underwhelmed. The good report is that I never heard of anyone being sick while we were there, and everyone I know who has been to the DR has seen sick vacationers. Overall: if youe a serious foodie, don vacation here, if youe not SO worried that every meal be perfect, everything else about the PCG is fantastic. Our only complaint is the dinner reservation system, you could only make reservations for the 3 restaurants for two hours in the morning, and for 2 hrs in the afternoon. One very friendly (read, took forever with everyone!) man did all the reservations and you had to wait forever to see him! We ate in all 4 restaurants across four nights, so it worked out for us, but it was a PITA and we never got to pick what time we ate. We enjoyed the piano bar 2 out of 4 nights, the Michael Jackson show the first night, and the disco one night - perfect resort for our duration. An overall fantastic vacation - 5* facilities, clean, vast drink/eating choices, well kept, great staff, amazing weather  scenery. If I wanted this type of relaxing vacation - I wouldn't hesitate to book here again! Say hi to Ruddy (Rudy) in the piano bar for us!

<Author>MonicaAndNeil
<Content>Great Place, Clean, Nice Staff, Well Tended Grounds, Food...Ok... My Boyfriend (36) and I (33) satyed at PCG Nov. 30 to Dec. 4 2006. We loved it. It was our first trip to Dominican and our first all inclusive. I am completely aware that we could have stayed in a more luxurious place with gourmet food....for $300+ per night. We feel that we got a great deal for $130 a night! First of all, the grounds are so well tended, always people cleaning and sweeping....while they sing! The beach is kept nice and free of seaweed. ROOMS: The rooms are big, clean, and in pretty darn good shape (loved the balcony). We were in Bldg. 5, floor 2, away from kiddies. We didn't have a washcloth or water in our room upon arrival, but one call and 5 minutes later...Poof! The water and washcloths appear. BARS: The bars were all nice and the bartenders are friendly. (Get a Banana Mama! YUM!) We broght lots of dollars and tipped here and there. It goes miles...as it should, I never waited for a drink, never...soo worth a few bucks a day. They bartender also knew me by name and my three most favorite drinks. Again, pull out a buck, these guys work hard. One bar drawback..only local Presidente beer. No beer selection. Sorry fellas! Again, try a banana mama...wow! Oh, bring an insulated mug with a lid. Wind+Sand+Sun=warm gritty drink. LANGUAGE: Most of the staff speaks Spanish, Duh! This is a Spanish speaking country. Learn a few words of Spanish, they appreciate the effort. Even if a staff member didn't understand my English they would try. What more can you ask for? I tried to recall all of my high school Spanish, and when you add lots of hand gestures and a big smile you see Americans are treated just fine. FOOD: Lots of selection in Windows (main restaurant) and great presentation. The food is OK. Will you write home about it? No. Will you starve? No. There are gems to be found. Try a few things and go get more of the one you like best. Pretty simple. The Tex Mex is actually really good, the beef medallions were yummy. The food at the Italian place is ok, it's a very pretty restaurant, kinda fancy. Fried chicken at the beach is yummy. As for people who have reviewed this place and said they got sick...same rules apply here for Americans traveling to any LDC (lesser developed country). Don't drink the water, no salads, no uncooked fruit or veggies. The fruit is great, but just know that eating it may give you the runs. I had a little here and there and was fine. Do make your reservations for the restaurants that need them when you arrive, and make them for your whole stay. Makes life easy. ENTERTAINMENT: Honestly we were just looking to enjoy the beauty of D.R. and have time together. So we could care less about this part, but...the casino was nice, and the Michael Jackson was good. Really, really good. Seriously. They had dance lessons, and cooking lessons (we had a good laugh about that, given the food we had so far) I found the topless europeans entertainment enough. Old men in speedo suits...yuck. But funny! If you have kids, they may see boobies. I doubt it will scar them for life (the Speedo suited old men may scar them however!). Take them to the kids pool if you are worried. All in all, what a deal, what a nice place, what a way to spend a long, romanitc weekend.  
<Date>Dec 5, 2006
<Rating>5	5	4	4	5	4	4	-1

<Author>tah2269
<Content>Globalia Punta Cana Grand (formerly Sunscape owned) Before I begin my detail review of the Globalia Punta Cana Grand (herein I am referring to as PCG) I just wanted to let people who are simply skimming reviews to know up front that this experience was very positive one and that you have no need to fear that PCG is a bad place. Six people in my party experienced all that PCG has to offer and are walking away convinced they would stay there again. If you want to read alot of detail please read on. I will give you as many helpful tidbits as I can. If I can answer any deatiled questions, please feel to email me anytime with your questions to: tahewitt at comcast dot com.Our stay was from October 28 through November 2, 2006. We are 3 adult couples (ages 48 - 52) from New Jersey, USA. We booked this vacation back in July on Orbitz.When we read the prior reviews by other members, my wife and I became a little nervous on what to expect since we were the ones that chose the resort for the other couples. We had stayed at Sunscape the Beach (STB) last October and rated it a perfect 5 stars in everything. Our friends experience with Punta Cana or an even an all-inclusive was nil as this was their first time for both. We chose PCG because money was a little tight for everyone this year and it was several hundred dollars cheaper than STB. However, my wife  I kept comparing everything during this stay at the PCG to last years STB.Result: While not as luxurious as STB, the PCG was not as bad as some people made it to be. You can trust me on this, while the 6 of us do have high standards as to what quality really means, we are not prudes about realizing that we are in a poor third world country and you have to relax your standards just a bit. However, we will not except poor quality when we know high quality may be sitting right next door.THE DEATAILS:Airport Arrival: We left Philadelphia airport 6 am and had a lay over in Miami until reaching Punta Cana at 2:20 pm. The airport is a thatched roof open-aired airport with no connectors from the plane to the gate like everywhere else. Your plane will park on the tarmac and you will get off on on by those old fashioned step ramps. The walk outside to the entry point in the airport. (Pray it is not raining when you arrive or leave or else you are getting wet.There is the typical photo taking welcome as you enter the airport with two preety girls in full Dominican costume. You buy them on your way home if you want them. The first desk you MUST stop at is the Travel Desk where you must pay $10 per person for a visitor visa that you hand in further down the line before you get to your luggage.O Then you go to the desk where your Passport is stamped. Then hand in your tourist visa to the man at the third desk. Then you get your luggage. After the luggage, you stop one more time to show your Passport and that is where the airport bell boys try to take your luggage from you and to your taxi ir prepaid travel tour. Either hold on tight to your luggage and say no thanks, or let them take it and be prerpared to tip $1.Our pre-arranged limo service was Viator Limo and cost us $15 per person (each way) for a total of $60 per couple round trip. I had paid for it before we left home on my Master Card. They emailed me two vouchers to print out and hand to the driver each way. The only money I needed was for a tip. They were standing there right after baggage claim with a sign with my name on it. The man spoke english that greeted us and introduced us to our driver who handed us all iced water bottles. The van was fairly new and air conditioned worked great. Compare this to the taxi we took last year, well the taxi was old, bald tires, very unsafe and cost us $50 each way to the hotel for only my wife and I. No way could 6 people use a taxi as they are too small.HOTEL CHECK IN: Arrived at the hotel at 2:50 pm and the bell captain took our luggage and spoke great english and was very friendly. We went to check in and again, all help behind the desk was super friendlyand our rooms were ready. A girl came around with welcoming drinks in a cham[agne fluted glass and it was great. No problems at all with check in and everyone spoke english, some better than others, but you would have no problems communicating. The bell captain had someone take the luggage for all 6 of us. and showed us around the complex, explaining everything we would need to know as we went to Building 4. Our rooms were all together on the third floor. They do not have an elevator (except in the new building 7 which I will get into later) and the bell boy had to walk the heavy luggage up to the third floor for each of us. Well worth the $5 tip per couple that we gave him.THE ROOM:Not as nice as the Sunscape Beach rooms but then again, the STB rooms are only 2 years old! This building was refurbished but it was not like the rooms we would have received had we been able to get into Building 7. We requested it at the time of booking but like everything you request at any resort, they cannot guarantee you will get it since I did not book and pay for the more expensive building 7 swim out rooms which are only available on the first floor, obviously.Just as in other reviews, the tird floor has very high vaulted wood ceilings. All rooms have ceiling fans, mini bars, Cable TV, in room safe and seperate bath tube  toliet combo room and sink  make up room. Pretty standard the world over. One of your room keys must be inserted into the little slot on the wall to make the air conditioner work. If you open either the room door or the slider at all, it kills the air conditioning until all doors are closed again. Now my room (4317) I did not need to insert the room key into the slot. It worked tyhe airconditioning without the need of the key. I will be posting some pictures of room 4317 so you can see the room.Next to building 4 is building 5 which sits next to the Adult pool. Expect it to be open much later than the main pool and expect to see topless bathers. Not a place for kiddies at all. It has a little bar with limited alcohol selections.ROOM TVThe TV in the room is cable. There are 62 stations on their cable system and there are 21 English speaking channels. The rest are spanish. Not too bad when you consider that 80% of ther guests are spanish and only get 66% of the stations!!In english will be these TV station highlights:Nick CartooensThe WBFilm Zone Movie TVMGM ClassicsTBSSuperstation WGNHBOE-NewsAXNAEMTVTHE MAIN POOL The depth of the pool is 3.5 feet by the swim up bar and 3 feet at the opposit end where the activities take place.Everyday starting around 10 am the activity crew (5 or 6 people strong) get people around the pool to get involved in the mroning water arobics program. They speak english, too. They had strong participation the entire time we were there. Then they have dancing classes on the area right by the pool. The Dominican music has a fast tempo and great beat, and again, a lot of people participated. They organize water volleyball, and other pool games all day long. The music does not stop even when the activity people go to lunch or breaks.Your main bartender at the swim up bar is JUAN. He can make any drink you can think of although the selection of liguor is only the house label brand called NORMANDY. If you want top shelf liquor like Stolichnaya Vodka, Dewars Scotch, etc you must go to the 24 hour bar located near the beach entryway.Pool is always clean, and thatched palapas are plentiful. Never had a problem getting on around the pool. And there are so many on the beach, you will never have a problem getting one, it just might be furhter back from the water, that's all.BEWARE: TOPLESS BATHER ALERT!!. The Spanish speaking tourists have no problems with baring their tops on the beach or at the main pool. I would think Globalia Management would better control where they can be since they do have small children there. But then again, the spanish tourist at Globalia is 80 % at least and their culture allows it and considers that behavior normal. Obviously the Canadian friends I made and the few other Americans were somewhat shocked. THE BEACH: Beach sand is easy to walk. And if you walk along the part of sand where the waves roll onto, the sand is very compacted which means, you dont have a sinking problem as you walk. Very nice. The sand itself is not a super plush sinking sand like Cancun Mexico has, either. In Cancun, it is actually hard to walk on the beach because each step you take, you sink! In Punta Cana, the sand is not as white as Cancun, but it is soft and easily walkable.Water sports that are included in the all inclusive is standard for A-I's. yellow sea kayaks, Hobie Cats, wind boards. Pretty standard.THE SEAWEED Yes, there is a seaweed problem around all the beaches of Punta Cana. But you cant help it because that is what Mother nature gave them. But as it washes ashore during high tides, it leaves a small little line of seaweed along the beach. It is not a big deal. Is it spotless like Cancun? NO. Cancun is the worlds best beach for a reason. Is Punta Cana bad? NO it just has some seaweed, thats all. The water is very clear all the way to the bottom. It has a slight greenish tint to the water, so it is not a crystal clear as Cancun water. The reason for the slight greenish tint is because Punta Cana is situated where the Atlantic Ocean and the Carribean come together. So depending on storms in the Atlantic or the Carribean and the tides of course, that magic line between unclear green Atlantic Ocean Water and clear Carribean water will meet somewhere up the beach from the PCG. I know last year at STB the water was not clear at all. STB is about 45 minutes north of the PCG. So you guess where the line will be on any given day.NIGHTLIFEThe new Casino is open at 8pm until ??? There are about 50 slot machines at 5 and 25 cents. The roulette table and Blackjack table were $5 minimum bets. Can't get that in Atlantic City or Las Vegas no more!The Shows on the big stage are really pretty decent. Hey, they are not Broadway shows, but they are very entertaining and they try so hard to deliver. I give them a big congrats on all their shows. The MIchael Jackson show should not be missed.The piano bar opens at 9:30 and join in the fun for Karaoke on Wednesday and Saturday nights. You will have both english and spanish karaoke people performing and the large crowd will cheer you on even if they dont know the language! A lot of fun. trust me, And be brave and daring and get up there and do a song. You will be so glad you did.The Disco is not much to write about. Pretty bad. The younger people go there, but three times this week I looked in on it and no one was dancing at all. Just standing around drinking.OTHER ACTIVITIESYes, for a fee with different travel groups, you can go snorkeling, visit a Manati=park, 4 wheel ATV's are for rent, dolphin swimming, helicopter Tours of the island, James Bond spead boats, Horses on the beach. I didnt use any of these, but they are available. I almost did the spead boat. It was 4 hours at $78 for the 4 hours.THE SHOPS AT PCGHere is where PCG gets low marks in my book. The shops are nothing more than a repeat of the same native beach shacks you will see between the PCG and the next hotel The Occidental Allegro. The salemen are hucksters who will try to gang up on you and pull you into their store and try to sell you anything at any price. Save your negotiations for the beach shacks becaus eyou expect to haggle with them for a deal, not the resorts shops.The Restaurants  Food (I am posting some pix of the menus at the ala carte restauarants to look at)WINDOWS BUFFET: Very nice indeed. much better than I had imagined. They changed the food every night except for a few staple items. They always had a big pasta bar. Pasta was always cooked al dente and the choice of sauces or gravies were very tasty. On Wednesday, they offered a freash sushi chef that rolled the shrimp, articoke, carrot, or raw salmon rolls in front of you. AMERICAN GRILL. Tex-Mex food offered here. The steak fajitas were very good. Yet the hot wings were not for real hot wings as I know hot wings. These are small chicken wings in barbeque sauce. They aint hot, crunchy or that meaty.THE BEACH GRILL (or what ever it was called) is an open air retaurant under a big thatched palapa. The ambiance is great and very typical of a carribean sinner with the beach in back of you and the breeze keeping you comfortable. The food was EXCELLENT!!! The onion soup was true gourmet and the steak was cooked to perfection and tender as can be. The Cardon bleu was okay but if you like steak, get it here.DA MARCI Italian restaurant. Typical gourmet Italian food. Excellent. and the ambiance was extremely nice. Very gourmet.That is you only dinner choices here at PCG. There was much more at the STB so I was a little dissapointed in amount of restaurants offered. But the resort is only half the size of STB.BREAKFAST  LUNCHBoth are offered at the Windows Buffet and the area by the beach behind the 24 hour bar. You can use the umbrella tables to have you lunch or breakfast if you take from the smaller buffet at the 24 hr bar. The Windows Buffet you cannt take the food out, and the selection is and vasriety is larger. Both are good.WARNINGThe ceramic tile floors are constantly being mopped up which makes for a very clean look. HOWEVER, if you are barefoot or wearing certain types of shoes, you will slide and fall. I did and cracked my head against the wall going into the bathroom. Well, the wall didnt stand a chance but my head still has a lump on it.Be careful for wet tile floors. The main pool has painted brick that is not slippery when wet, so you dont have anything to worry about there. Just the ceramic tile floors.Well, thats about it. And remember, communicating with any of the help other than the gardener or maid was no problem at all. All of them spoke english. And to rectify the maid problem, we had pre-printed english to spanish sentences made up on little pieces of paper to leave out for the maid everyday along with a $5 tip. Such as asking for extra hand towels  bath towels. Never a problem. I would even have a paper for the mini bar saying in spanish to leave extra water and beer, no soda. Just Google on a english to spanish free dictionary and a whole bunch of sites pop up to use. It's great and free to use to prepare yourself.I am available to help if you need it.

):1	1359(mother):1	1367(hey):1	1402(trust):1	1408(nervous):1	1442(seaweed):1	1443(broadway):1	1474(usa):1	1497(culture):1	1515(wing):3	1520(communicate):1	1559(e-mail):1	1570(topless):2	1677(anytime):1	1693(jackson):1	1750(voucher):1	1783(baggage):1	1806(volleyball):1	1821(bet):1	1847(plush):1	1860(vegas):1	1866(stage):1	1908(michael):1	1949(yellow):1	1953(participate):1	1986(nature):1	2003(brick):1	2124(minimum):1	2177(cat):1	2194(canadian):1	2217(cancun):2	2462(kayak):1	2474(song):1	2494(atlantic):1	2763(perform):1	2857(slippery):1	2943(rectify):1	3009(behavior):1	3075(cheer):1	3248(jersey):1	3275(dare):1	3472(karaoke):1	3544(introduce):1	3628(alert):1	3702(blackjack):1	3753(gardener):1	4004(dot):1	4119(roulette):1	4316(participation):1	4677(brave):1	5825(kiddy):1	5958(com):1	6085(pray):1	6229(hobie):1	7596(bather):2	8087(sentence):1	9438(8pm):1	10319(globalia):1	11128(congrats):1	12793(tidbits):1

<Author>Duttchie
<Content>Not much to write home about My husband and I chose this resort based on location and price.Well ya get what ya pay for! Arrival was simple,off the plane smile for a picture with the ladies that don't say welcome or anything.Proceed down the line to paying your tourist fee.10.00 per person.Baggage and getting to your transportation was very easy.We used Prieto Tours to get back and fourth to our resort.Check -in was very simple.they did bring us the fruity drink.Oh the drive to the resort was very simple.They are building a new Highway,if you were wondering where your 10 bucks go that's what there doing with it.We where taken to our 1st room.Horrible it was in building 3 on the 1st fl.We choose the deluxe suite,which is pretty much the standard room.The first room was sooo tiny and moldy and damp.We called front desk and asked for another room.They took us in 5min to a new room.3rd floor,look out to the main pool and grounds.We were very happy.I looked out and say a bunch of men walking around this huge empty pool w/ swim up bar chipping tiles and re cementing.Just our freaking luck!Well we stayed for 5 days,they got the pool open on our last day there,water was very cloudy and dirty.There is no way cement sets that quick and chlorine is at the proper levels .We made the best of it.We met some nice people that spoke english.They were hard to come by so anytime you would hear someone speak english you would strike up a conversation just to hear the english lang.Here's the rundown-Drinks-anyone that says the drinks were weak I'd hate to see what your liver looks like.SOO strongFood-Im not a picky eater but the food was not so good,what was suppose to be hot was cold and vice versa.Thank god for the fried chicken stand.Windows was good for lunch and dinner,we ate at the american grill nice setting,was nice to hear shania on the radio,Italian was good but not too much Italian food on the menu.Room-Was soso clean,we tried to have the maid come once the second day we where out of the room until 4;30 and maid servicenext day she came and just remade the bed and gave new towels.Yes I did tip 3.00 each day.No towels designs or anything special.Oh yeah our air never worked!!! we didnt want to complainb/c we already changed rooms.It wasnt that bad at nite.Entertainment- was horrible,catered to spanish and french.Had to listen very closely for the english translation when they bothered.I feel the place was not as bad as some reviewed but it was what I expected from the reviews.Staff was very friendly,beach was beautiful,seaweed that people complain about was so barely seen.Just don't answer when someone says 'Heh Lady,we did attempt the 'stores' on the beach,we payed 35 us when at first the wanted 115.The casion was nice,we only played 10 bucks in the slots and left.There was noone in there.The layout of the resort is very nice and they are doing updating on the facilities.Take bug spray,lots of bugs I did not get too many I wore bug spray every nite.I would not return to this resort,but I would go back to the D.R.
