<Author>sagitar23
<Content>Wonderful vacation at the beautiful Punta Cana Grand! Hi, we just got back from the Punta Cana Grand and I must say that after reading other reviews, I was a little nervous but was soon put to ease. The hospitality is unbelievable and they do a very good job at accomodating you. They are very happy and friendly...a day doesn't go by where atleast 20 staff members say Hola with a smile! They are constantly cleaning, landscaping and preparing to make the place top notch. I had also heard bad things about the food, not so. The restaurants which require reservations but are still included as free are really on top of their game, especially the Tex-mex and Italian ones. The Seafood restaurant atmosphere is a little more casual outside overlooking the beach, but still very nice. The breakfast buffets could use a little help keeping things fresh and maybe covered so the bread/pancakes doesn't get hard, but still has a great variety and is good. I do agree that washclothes weren't immediately available, but I brought some just incase. As soon as the maid saw ours out, she brought some and continued to bring them daily. She also had sweet little touches like folding towels into animals and leaving them around the room as well as fresh flowers and petals. The spa is really nice (very modern)...and well priced (cheaper than home). There are 3 pools and none of them were crowded, just perfect. The music they play around the resort is great combination of American and Spanish and is tasteful, with a little caribbean hip hop upbeat thrown in to get the body moving! Being a international destination, ladies do take their tops off on the beach and it doesn't seem to be a big deal to anyone. The sun is very strong (obviously), and there is usually a constant breeze so you don't feel the burn so wear sunscreen to prevent burning. They have shady huts on the beach but you have to grab them early because they go fast. Also, there are small mosquitos that come out at dusk, so bring your bug spray to ensure comfort. I had to buy some at the convenient shop there and it was $15 for a small bottle of OFF. The sun lotions there are also very expensive ($15-33), so bring it with you. The best way to barter there while shopping is the tell them the price you think is fair right off the bat and stick to it...they will try to negotiate up, but stick to the price you think is fair and walk away if you need to...they have many stores and huts along the beach with the identical stuff. They can definitely be overbearing with trying to get you in their shop...just say 'NO' firmly and ignore their questions, where are you from?, etc. I made the mistake of trying to be nice and answered their questions and looked in their shops and you get very tired quickly! Brushing up on your Spanish or taking a translation book can be fun to look through and helpful. Most of them know enough English, but sometimes it can be challenging (fun though using body language and pointing to things). =) Just about everything is all inclusive, but take some $1's for the people who really make your stay enjoyable. I hope this review has helped, and if you chose to stay there...enjoy! We are definitely going back! =)Kim H.,30, Virginia, USA  
<Date>Oct 17, 2006

<Author>Treem
<Content>Amazing Hotel Myself and 3 friends (23-32 yrs of age) stayed at this resort from Oct. 8-15. We booked last minute and got an amazing deal. Because of the price we paid we weren't expecting to stay in the lap of luxery. Well let me tell you when we got there we were thrown for a loop. Check In was fast and simple. Luggage was brought to our rooms quickly. No waiting around for a room to become available even though the hotel was fully booked. The grounds were beautiful, nicely manicured. The pools were big and clean. A separate pool for kids and adults. A great activities team that constantly had something for guests to do. (Although not everyone participated). Now the food. Oh my. I travel quite often and can honestly say that the food at this resort is the best I've had. I gained 5 pounds by the end of my trip. There are 3 a la carte restaurants to chose from. Plus the buffet has a great selection and they are constantly bringing out fresh hot food. The rooms in the hotel were big and clean and not once did I even see a bug.After reading previous reviews of people that went at the same time as me I must agree yes there were a lot of people from Spain that spoke Spanish. This time of year is when they take their holidays. Hence the vast majority of people in the resorts being Spanish. There was a bit of a language barrier but if you're patient you'll find that you can communicate with the little Spanish you know and the little English they know. I found then to be quite fun people. I will definatly go back :)  
<Date>Oct 17, 2006

<Author>Ferlicog
<Content>Can you speak Spanish? If so, you will have a wonderful time! My husband and I stayed at this resort Sep 17-24/06 and found it to be the worst of the 5 all-inclusives in the Caribbean we have stayed at. First for the bad, tips tips tips=excellent service for those of you not speaking spanish (we have never been made to feel like outsiders, the hotel property owners need to address this with the staff). The beach was so-so, the white sand was nice but the extra seaweed washing up on shore and in the shallow water was terrible....walk down the beach or take a water taxi where the beach is much much nicer and cleaner. Upon arrival, we had to wait for 3 1/2 hours before our room was ready. Our flight did leave Toronto on time and arrived at the hotel just before noon......then they tell us that check in is not until 3:00ish. After a flight and a very early morning people were cranky and just wanted to go for a short nap.As for the good, the food was the best that we have had in the Caribbean.Overall, we will never stay at this resort again....we will look for the resorts were there are more North Americans.

<Author>jakekells
<Content>Going Back 2007 Surprised by the bad reviews I've seen on this site. We had a fantastic time. The help was very friendly and helpful. All employees went out of their way to see that we had a good time. The food was super. The beach with pure white sands, palm trees almost to the water's edge, and numerous palm shelters was the highlight on the resort! Sailing cats, scobba, drinks on the beach...I could go on and on. On a Sunday, we asked about going to church and they brought in a priest to say Mass just for us. My wife and I and the general maager along with the local priest the only ones present in a make-shift small chapel at the resort. What can I say. They just bent over backwards to take care of a couple of American Tourists. We are going back with family next time.

<Author>IndustryProfessional
<Content>If you don't speak spanish expect to fork over the money! Beach- Atlantic side- not very apealing for a beach lover.Service- Resort Staff DOES NOT favour english speaking guests. Guests being brought in from Spain seemed to be favoured. It may have something to do with the GM being from Spain. English speaking guests are served last at the bar regardless of how long they had been waiting. You would have to actually show money at the bar in order to be served. Food/ was good. Lots of variety. Rooms-be very careful in ground room floors. Sliding glass doors open from both sides. Not like in North America. Ensure both sides are locked and check every night before you leave your room. Although your representative may ask you to check out the night before your flight...this does not mean you have to give back the key to your safe. Take extra precausion on this night. Our room was robbed as was the room next to ours. We had a digital camera stolen and a bottle of perfume stolen. The room next to ours had 400.00$ USD stolen. Another passenger also had a camera stolen. We filled in reports but have yet to hear anything. The problem is that they make us pay 15$USD for a safe which should be manditory if there is so much theft going on in this hotel. I believe this hotel has gone down hill considerably since the change in ownsership. It was much better as the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. All the pools with exception of the one located by Block #7 were dirty and warm. There was a frothy foam in the adult pool. Check in/front desk staff should be able to speak more then one language considering the diversity of guests. I'm not racing to go back here anytime soon. If I do I wil lhave to learn how to speak spanish.

<Author>dansewithme
<Content>punta cana grand was so-so Me and my wife just arrived back from the punta cana grand Sept.18th. I pretty well knew what to expect since i read the reviews about this resort before we arrived. The reviews were pretty accurate. First thing i would like to say is we are seasoned travellers, we travel 8-9 weeks a year all through the Carribbean. We only enjoyed our stay at this resort because of the Canadian people we met from the Toronto area and 3 very nice ladies from Austria.Good points- Resort- Very well layed out with well groomed grounds and several pools. The pool by building #7 was the best. Always refreshing and quiet. Rooms- We looked at the room in building #2, it was big enough with cathedral ceiling, nice furniture and clean. But we decided to upgrade to building #7 which had all suites with jacuzzi. They were large and beautiful. Well worth the money. Staff- Most of the staff were courtious and polite. Restaurants- All the a-la-carte restaurants were very good. We enjoyed the Italian the most, and our waiter Robinson was fantastic.Bad points- Main pool- Hot like a hot bath and filthy. Beach- Not very good , too much seaweed. If you walk to the left of the resort for about 10 minutes you will find a beautiful beach that runs for miles. This is where we swam. Entertainment- Not very exciting. The Micheal Jackson show on saturday was the only good show. This is a very quiet resort in the evening with not much to do. They have no band playing in the evenings for dancing. It is a long wait till 11:30p.m. for the disco to start getting action. Tourists- 80% Spanish and very rude so if you are from anywhere else be prepared because nobody speaks English. This resort caters to the Spanish tourists mostly.Overall this was not a bad resort but i think poorly run since they changed ownership in Jan.06. Would i return? NO.  
<Date>Sep 20, 2006

<Author>dockta
<Content>Not A Diamond, but a definately a Gem in the Rough My wife and I just returned last night, and I must say reading some of the reviews we almost did not go. First of all this is not the Ritz Carlton, so don't expect to get that kind of treatment.We got there Tuesday around 1:30pm, check in is usually 5:00pm but our room was ready and were allowed to check in early. The bellhops brought our bags to our rooms within 15 minutes.Ok, the room was clean an efficient, no molds or bugs, stayed in building 5 on the third floor, not really bothered by any construction. The place could use a bit of a cosmetic make over but the entire place served its purpose - somewhere to rest.The maid service was very good, they were there in the morning usually when we go to breakfast, they take the used towels daily have them washed and returned in the afternoon. Wash cloths are rare so yes bring your own if you can. They also have turn down service at nights, we would go to dinner leaving the room not in shambles but not neat, only to find everything put back together bathroom cleaned and fresh washed towels in place.My wife broke a bottle of rum, and we called them for a mop and they were there within minutes, the mopped and disinfect the floor to get rid of thr smell of the rum.Food, well not so good, but we came prepare with Pepto Mismo and Alka Seltzer, and that did the trick. The upset stomach could have come from all the drinking we did the night before. The rum is very weak, so just ask for extra rum. The buffet at Windows is ok if you get there right at 6:30 when they open; if you get there late the food is sitting out too long and gets too dried out or too cold. Had dinner at DaMario, did not like it even though the ambience and the service was excellent. We did like Sea Garden, the seafood dishes they served was excellent and they we very attentive to our needs. We did not eat at the American Grill since we ran out of time, but have heard mixed reviews about them; I did hear though that they make a nice piece of steak. The food beach fiesta, was the absolutely best, I think they should serve the food like this instead of just one night.To get reservations for dinner, you can't make it for the day of, the best way to do it, is on the day you check in, make the reservations for the length of your stay, you can always cancel if you don't need it. They stagger the schedules at the specialty restaurants so they aren usually full at one time so to give you that individual service and attention.Ie walked the full length of the beach, looking at the adjoining properties; a PC Grand was the cleanest. They were the only one that had a full time staff dedicating to cleaning the sea weeds. There is nothing that you can do to stop nature from dumping weeds on the beach, the only thing you can do is to clean it up, and this they have done through out the day.We had no problems getting beach towels, the young lady or the young gentleman was always courteous. Obviously with very limited english/spanish, it is very difficult to have a conversation, but service was fast and proficient.Discrimination? I did not see it, did I mention, that I am a Jamaican, who has been living in the Sates for sometime now.The highlight of the trip was the night life. Every night there was a movie, a sing along for the little kids and then each nit a different show at 9:30 for the grown ups. They include, a magic show, acrobatic, lip sync show, and those were the one we saw while we were there. After that there was the piano bar, one night we had karaoke and then you we finished the night off at the disco which goes until 2:00am. The amazing thing was with especially the disco, there was young and old working up a sweat. You hear the same music every night, but that's just a part of the club atmosphere. The Animation teams goes all out to make sure that we are entertained and that we all have a good time, especially Mike, who did a duet with me at the Karaoke, he was Lionel Richie and I was Diana Ross, we did end less love, Rosa and I danced every night and Vlade and I did Bob Marley no woman no cry.Over all is this the nicest resort I've ever been to? No but it's the bet vacation I've ever had Thanks P.C Grand  
<Date>Sep 3, 2006

<Author>Mom4kids
<Content>Go With Friends! If you are staying at this hotel please don't worry about the really bad reviews - the local people do not hate Americans but I will say most of the staff were indifferent. It is true about the wash cloths and about the maid service having no real schedule. Most days our room was just gotten around to around 5:00. No bug problems at all either. Also, we stayed in Bldg. 5 and it was actually fantastic - first floor, literally steps to the beach. We were not bothered by any construction. Overall the room was fine.FOOD: Average - skip the American Grill/Tex Mex. The Italian was pretty good as was the Beach Garden. Windows was also okay. Service at the restaurants was always very professional but unfortunately really slow.DRINKS: Always lots to choose from - never had to wait very long either. The drinks are very weak though so you can pretty much drink all day. Also, they serve everyone - Get the Banana Mama, very tasty! Ask for extra rum if you're a real drinker.POOLS: Clean and well maintained. Very warm, however. Cool off by standing under the cool showers nearby.BEACH: Beautiful - cooler and breezier than by the pool. No trouble getting lounge chairs at all - You get to know who puts towels down and never show up - we just moved them to another spot.TIP: Bring your own wash cloth - brings singles and fives. Bargain with the vendors. Try to vacation with another family - it is very true about this particular resort. Very few Americans so it is hard to find new friends.Have Fun!!!!

<Author>HollyW
<Content>Mediocre  Our stay at the Punta Cana Grand started out confusing; the front desk did not give us any detailed information about the place, but instead just rushed us through check-in and got us to our room. In the room there was no booklet that described hotel amenities, restaurants, or local activities.The food in the restaurants was mediocre. We never knew how it was going to be. The chef just did not cook international food well. The food had either the wrong spices or the wrong consistency or both. It was very dissapointing!The rooms were very stripped down and the beds were very hard. The housekeeping staff was not on any particular schedule so we never knew when the room would be made up or when towels would arrive. The staff themselves seemed as if they were instructed to be friendly but it was not genuine.The best part of the vacation was the beach and the pool. My only complaint is that they did not have a large enough supply of towels so at times we would have to wait 1/2 hour or longer to get beach towels. While the main pool area needs updating, it was pleasant and the beach was very nice.I would not go back!  
<Date>Aug 27, 2006

<Author>cherryhillmom
<Content>Good value for the money but some problems We are from Cherry Hill, NJ and just returned from Punta Cana Grand Sun- Fri Aug 20-25.  A mixed experience, mostly good except my husband and I both had upset stomachs. We have visited other island all-inclusives and never had this problem before.   Highlights of the trip: Our 14 and 16yr old teens had a free 1hr scuba diving lesson in the pool and of course we booked a beginner's dive for them afterwards for $75 each. It was about 20'-25' deep and saw coral and many fish. A great first experience. My husband and I (certified divers) accompanied our 14 yr old son, for $55 each including equipment (my first time in 5 yrs and I enjoyed it too). The resort is beautiful and clean and staff worked very hard, providing activities and cleaning up and serving.  There were three pools, spent most of our time at the main pool where the activities were. My son had a great time playing water polo and volleyball and beach volleyball and getting sodas from the swim-up bar. My 16yr old daughter and I enjoyed the water aerobics and I liked the brief meringue and samba dance lessons at the pool. The lazy river pool (coolest water and refreshing) was outside our building (#2 second floor 2201 and 2203). Went to the adult pool once which was very warm, but quiet and there is a bar there. We usually managed to get at least one lounge in the shade, by the main pool, but that can be a problem because people reserve them with their towels and don't show for a while.  We enjoyed the beach, too which was cooler due to the breeze, than the pool area, and we all snorkeled in the green ocean (but not much to see right by the resort). I was told that for $18, guests can go out with staff in a small speedboat to snorkel at a reef a few minutes from the resort. The snorkel equipment is free for an hour at a time. The sea grass is no big deal- cleaned up constantly by staff. The guys also enjoyed glancing nonchalantly at the few topless bathers that scattered the beach and occasionally the pool (altho they were supposed to contain that to the adult pool). The resort does have many european tourists.  Our 16yr old daughter's biggest thrill was being handed drinks with alcohol at every meal. She realized quickly that she would have to specify without alcohol for any drink she requested and we could trust her to do that. I wasn't crazy about them just handing her drinks without asking but that may not be uncommon at all-inclusives... The activity staff there were very good and there were lots of activities available all day if desired. Also there were security guards patrolling frequently and we never felt unsafe anywhere on the resort. We let the teens come and go easily. I will add, however, that my $30 watch did disappear which I thought I put into my pool bag, but since my money and other possessions were intact, my watch may have just fallen out at some point.  Our rooms, altho in the older bldg, were adequate. Some problems with the maid not leaving enough towels, but if we called for them, we did get them. Washclothes seem to be available only upon request! Also there were annoying little ants by the bathroom sink. Once I removed the plant from the bathroom, and sprayed a bug repellant, they mostly disappeared. I did not notice any other insects-not even one mosquito! The downside was that I was a bit disappointed that there were few English speaking tourists there. I usually like to meet people and socialize. It was also a little challenging to speak with some staff who knew only a little English. Others were better. For example when I asked for bottled water at breakfast and it was poured over ice, the server seemed to be insulted or annoyed or didn't understand, when I asked if I could have another glass without ice. She disappeared and never returned.  There seemed to be mostly adults and few families, so our teens were a bit bored at night. There was no teen disco altho listed at one site. However, that meant the resort was less noisy and more relaxing too! I am sure that varies at any given time, of course. The food was only fair, very bland and as noted, my husband and I both had stomach problems. After this, I tried to drink mostly the bottled water, but since it was from a spring in D.R., I wasn't sure how helpful that was. Also, since it was so hot there, it would be tepid immediately without ice, but using ice kind of defeats the purpose of drinking only bottled water! However, I did feel better after my one 4 hr episode.  The Italian restaurant had nice atmosphere and service and better quality food than the Windows buffet. The Beach garden restaurant and american grill were just ok. They did make efforts to present the food nicely and refilled drinks quickly, but the fish was usually overcooked. We did not eat shellfish or meat at the resort.. Grouper was the main fish available. Make reservations when you arrive because there is limited seating at the 3 restaurants. The Windows buffet has a large variety of food, and is nicely displayed and no reservation is needed. Also, food is available at almost any hour. There are cookies and coffee by the pool and a server brought skewers of cut-up fruit to the beach one day.  Another negative which we don't know if we can blame on the resort is that our 16yr old daughter woke up with some slight (?) version of pink-eye which is why she did not go on the beginner's dive as planned. She then spent most of that day and the next in the room watching tv and reading! We were given a hard time about a refund and finally received $25 of the $75 back. My husband was too disappointed in the certified dive he took earlier, in addition to not feeling well, to consider using her credit for himself and disliked the mode of transportation to the dive shop and then to the dive site- a small motor boat that was a very bouncy ride. This was the most minimal dive operation we ever utilized. Since there was no ladder on the small boat, you have to hoist yourself over the side after the dive. Not an easy exit for a 47 yr old diver.  The other weakness here was the entertainment. They mostly used the audience to have them come up on stage and do silly things. Since the banter was all in Spanish we missed any humor there, other than the silly event.   Other helpful hints-bring $1's and $5's to make additional purchases and for tips, since it is difficult to get change in dollars. The resort takes pictures of guests if desired with iguanas, monkeys, and parrots and charge $8 each if you like the picture. They take pictures at the pool and on the beach and at the beach barbecue dinner on thurs night. Vendors were slightly annoying by handing us gifts which of course, made us feel obligated to politely look at their wares. There were a few on the premises and others on the beach, but there was no contact there unless you walk over to their huts. They were doing some renovations on building 5 so you may want to avoid that building until completed (we could smell fresh paint) .  An insulated big mug might be helpful even just for keeping water and sodas cold and of course to limit trips to the bar.  We will probably never go back to this resort (but we have not repeated any of our vacations) and would only consider Punta Cana if we stayed on the Caribbean side where the water is probably bluer and we may be able to snorkel right from the shore and see some more plentiful fish.  It was a very inexpensive vacation $2600 including trip insurance and airfare and airport transfer (about 20 mins from airport) for 4 from Vacation mart online, so we felt that we probably got exactly what we paid for! If we had not gotten sick we would have thought it was a great week.  
<Date>Aug 27, 2006

<Author>empierson
<Content>DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!! THIS HOTEL IS TERRIBLE!!!!!! If you are American, do not stay here. They do not like Americans, but LOVE the US dollar. We spoke spanish most of the time, but still were treated with complete disrespect. Everyone is rude, with the entertainment staff. We had no hot water, broken hair dryers and a leaky roof. It took sometimes a half an hour to get a drink at the bar, if we got served at all. They just skipped right over us. When we asked the waiters for things, they just ignored us. Forget about eating at any of the restaurants...you need reservations in which the lady working is a [------]. It took two hours to check in. Check in time is at 3PM, but did not get a room until 5PM; however the day of checkout they are quick to call your room to let you know. NONE of the info on any of the travel sites is true about this place. The kids club they offer is 5 and up and it only runs from 9AM - 12PM and again from 3PM to 5PM. The discoteque [---]There is nowhere to go off of the resort. We booked a Swim and Snorkel with the Dolphins trip in which the guest services man said it was three hours and it was swimming and snorkeling with the dolphins. It turned out to be about 20 minutes of going into a pen with two dolphins in which we could look and get a little feel of them. At the end of the trip, we asked to speak to a manager in which the front desk staff would not tell us who one was. Finally, one of the staff lied and told us some guest services guy was a manager. Make sure to bring plenty of dollars, euros or pesos because for a large hotel, they NEVER had any money to change out traveler's checks. The only relatively nice part was the entertainment staff....but I only think they were nice because the guys wanted to hook up with my sister and I. I have been to over 15 countries and have never experienced anything like this. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO A PIG!!!!!  
<Date>Aug 16, 2006

<Author>pswann611
<Content>Just relax and enjoy the view!! We just arrived home after three nights and four days at the Punta Cana Grand. I wasn't sure what to expect after reading the reviews on this website. Now after our brief stay, all I can say is that for what we paid, the hotel exceeded our expectations. Was it perfect? No. The food wasn't the greatest. Reservations are needed for all of the restaurants except Windows, the buffet. We checked into dinner reservations on our first day and were told that there was nothing available for the next three nights!! We managed to get into the Beach Garden on our first night due to a cancellation, and into The American Grill on our last night because the hostess took pity on us. Imagine our surprise when each time we went into these booked restaurants, there were only 5-8 full tables. I'm not sure why they do this, but they do. If food is very important to you, don't go here. The sit down restaurants were disappointments, and the buffet had a great selection but the food was below average. I decided on the first day that if I had to survive on mangoes and bread for four days, that was cool because of the fantastic view. We ate breakfast each day at the Beach Garden. I could have been eating sticks and rocks and I wouldn't have cared. I had my coffee and a beautiful view of the sun rising over the blue waters of the Carribean. As for the rooms, the beds were hard, the blankets and towels were far from plush, and our air-conditioning rattled and hummed all night. Again, if I had paid a lot for the room, I would have grounds to complain. As it was, the room served it's purpose, plus it was very clean. They mopped the tile floors daily in the rooms and continuously in the common areas. The grounds were lovely and the beachfront was gorgeous. However, probably my favorite part of the whole trip was the wonderful staff at the hotel. Everyone was so polite and kind. They were genuinely happy to have you as a guest!! (This is something that is lacking in most US hotels.) Even if there was a language barrier, the staff went above and beyond to help. They were all so wonderful!! This trip was for me and my family, a brief respite from our busy lives.The atomosphere and service at the Punta Cana Grand were all we could hope for. I hope to return again someday soon!  
<Date>Aug 6, 2006

<Author>lnlemmon
<Content>It was okay We spent a week at the Punta Grand. We only paid $1650 for the week including airfare so I must say the week was definitely worth the money. Airport: The majority of the airport is not air conditioned so standing in lines can be somewhat hot. There is a $10 charge per person to enter the country. Have your money ready. Punta Cana Grand does not provide transportation so we had to take a taxi. We paid $25 plus a tip and the drive was about 20-25 minutes long. Room: We were in building 1. We had a third floor room with the high ceilings. The room was okay. The walls are very thin and we could hear everything going on around our building throughout the night. The theatre and casino were right next to us and could become very loud at times. If you like to turn in early building 1 is not for you. The water pressure trickled out some days and was sufficient other days. We had no hot water only one day. Our sink area had an ant problem. Luckily I brought some mosquito repellant and that seemed to work alright. We always had plenty of towels in the bathroom and the fridge was always stocked. The electricity including the AC runs off of your key card. We liked to leave to the AC on while we were out to keep the room cooler. This was fine for the first few days. However, by the middle of the week the key card was taken out and gone. I went to the front desk and got a new one and was told that the maid will take it if you leave it. I did not like that. I kind of understand that they might not want you running up the electricity while you are out, but I didn't understand confiscating the key card. I would reccommend to anyone that is goingt o Punta Cana Grand to upgrade to Building 7. They are much nicer/newer than the other buildings and only a few hundred dollars more. Pools: The adult pool was very warm and not refreshing. The main pool was very crowded and had tons of kids running around it. People also left their used cups all around it. The best pool was by Building 7. It was calm, peaceful and the water was cool and refreshing. Food: It was okay. Nothing to brag about. More european catered than american. Don't drink the water! Trust me!!!!! Carry bottled water with you to meals. Also, at the buffet, if you prefer a soda it will be easier and quicker if you just bring it with you from your fridge in the room. We went whole meals at the buffet with never receiving a drink. Beach: There was a lot of sea grass, but it wasn't bothersome. The Grand had people cleaning the beaches constantly. Bring a raft with you if you would like to float around. There are none at the resort and you will pay about 3x more if you buy one at the gift shop. Nonetheless, the beach was very nice. We brought our own towels from home and it was worth it. We went snorkling one day and it was beautiful. The fish ate from our hands.The resort itself is beautiful and for the money we paid I can't complain. I think though, that the next time I plan a vacation I will spend an extra $1000 and go somewhere else. I would like better service, better food, and a room without ants.  
<Date>Aug 4, 2006

<Author>brgid
<Content>A great expirrience at Punta Cana Grand!! Our Family's excellent experience began when we arrived at Punta Cana Grand Hotel on July 12th to stay for a week.We arrived at the hotel early that afternoon and the two connecting rooms that we had reserved were ready.The rooms were beautifly decorated, and clean. We were guided around the hotel, had lunch and our vacation was off to a good start. We had been to Dominican Republic, and nothing was this smooth. The grounds of this 7 year old hotel are excellently kept.Three pools with plenty of lounging chairs. The Palapas are scouted early in t he morning. It has three restaurants with great service and good food, if you don't want to eat at the buffet. The personel is very polite, friendly and eager to please. The Spa was very relaxing and reasonably priced. The shows every night were also very well done with the exception of one; where the audience is enticed to remove personal items of clothing. Over all we had a wonderful time! Great service, great place and great People!!! We will return to Punta Cana Grand to have another Grand vacation in the near future. Atlanta Ga.

<Author>Smoothgem
<Content>Been There...Done That I stayed at the Punta Cana Grand for 6 days. Upon arrival, I was given a room in Building 2. I asked to be moved to Building 5. I was told it was being painted. I asked Sandy,, at the desk, if I did not like my room could it be changed. He said if I had any problems feel free to contant him. Unfortunately, I had to contact him.ROOMS: The first room was in building 2, second floor. It had a king sized bed as I requsted. When I entered the room, it had a moldy and musty smell. The tiled floor were not attractive. They needed work. There weren't any towels in the room. I called Sandy, at thr front desk, and told him that I was not pleased. He said he would send someone over with a key to another room. He said because I requested a king sized bed, this is all he had. I told him forget about the king sized bed, just get me a room I could be happy with. While waiting for the new room, I called for some towels. I was brought two towels. The next room I was given was in Building 1, third floor. This room did not have a foul odor and the ceiling was high. It was a much better room. It's a good thing I took the towels from the previous room, because there weren't any towels. The room was clean, the ac was on and there were some beverages in the fridge (no water). It was adequate. Tip #1: Bring your own washcloth. I forgot to pack washclothes and the resort did not have any. One day, I had to wash my body with a hand towel. A couple of vacationers told me that they did not have any washcloths either. It seems there was a shortage because previous guests stole them. After numerous calls to the front desk, two washcloths were left in the bathroom when I went to dinner the second night there.Tip #2: Learn basic Spanish because most of the staff do not understand English and most of the vacationers are Spanish speaking as well. I speak enough Spanish to get by, however, I could see someone having difficulty if they did not know any Spanish.POOLS: There are 3 pools. None of them are deeper than four feet. The adult pool by Building 5, is quiet at night. It has it's own bar until 5 pm. However, the water was always warm. It was the same temparture as the hot tub. Although, it was supposed to be for adults, no one enforced it. The main poool had all the going ons and the swim up bar. I went in there once. I was not impressed. The best pool is by building 7, the new bulding. It was beautiful. The water was always cool and refreshing. There isn't a bar over there. It was calm and quiet most of the time. I spent most of my time here. This is also the only pool where you can walk down stairs to enter and exit the pool. The other two pools you have to use the ladder.FOOD: I have had better and I have had worse. At Windows, the buffet, you could always find something that you liked. Dominican night was the best. I ate at Beach Garden, twice for lunch. The food was okay. Most times for lunch, I had a hamburger from the grill on the beach. Make sure they cook it well done. This is where your basic spanish could be of help. I also ate at The american Grill once. I had the beef medallions because other reviewers recommended it. It was good.BEACH: It was nice. There was sea weed but they tried to clean it constantly. Yes, rude people left their towels in cabanas even though they were not there. Usually, I could get a cabana about 1 or 2 pm on the beach. If not, I would move a chair under a palm tree until the sun moved and the shade shifted. The cabanas closest to the Water Sport building were the ones to become available in the afternoon. I had great naps at the beach. Yes, there are fish swimming in the water. The water was a nice green and the sand white.Service: I left a note for the maid in spanish requsting washclothes and water for the fridge. She brought at least 5 bottles of water. She did a great job. Thanks Isabel! Sandy, at the front desk, was very helpful. The service at Beach Garden was mediocore. When the waiter came and took our orders, he never returned to ask if we needed anything else. This happen the 2 times I dined at Beach Garden. The workers at the American Grill, worked hard. Beach Papi, the bartebder, was always so much fun. Tip #3: Tip the staff. I know it is all inclusive but this is a poor country and the staff works hard. The waiter at the American Grill which is only open for dinner, is also a waitstaff at Windows during breakfast and lunch. Most people there worked throughout the resort during the day. You don't have to tip everyone all of the time but there were some outstanding workers who I felt deserved a tip. I ordered room service one morning, the waiter was so suprised and appreciative when I gave him a tip. He deserved it since he walked with a tray from Windows, up three flights of stairs and arranged the plates on the little table.All in all, I had a good time. The hotel needs some work. The casino is nice but no one goes in. I will not stay here again. However, if you are on a budget, it's an okay place to stay.  
<Date>Jul 19, 2006

<Author>cassidy528
<Content>Good time for the money we spent My husband and I just got back from the Punta Cana Grand Resort. It was ourfirst trip to the D.R. and we didn't really know what to expect. We arrived atthe resort about 4pm -didn't get greeted with drinks as promised- and got sentto the bar until our room was ready. About 30 min. later we were able to checkin our room and Given, from the front desk actually took us to our room to makesure we would be happy with it. It was OK, seemed very warm but he promised itwould cool down after awhile. Unfortunately after about 3 hrs we realized theA/C was not working, just sounded (very loudly) like it was so we decided to askfor an upgraded room and were told none were available that night but Givenwould call us at 10:00am and have us moved to an oceanfront master suite for anextra $80 per night. After being woken up at 9:00am to the sound of workerssawing into concrete and hammering non-stop in what sounded like the room nextdoor we headed down to the front desk anxious to move rooms. We were told Givendidn't come in until 3:00 so we explained to this person what Given had told usand that we were ready for our new room and he said nothing would be availablelike that until mid-July. We walked away disappointed but decided to make thebest of it anyway.We hung out on the beach - which actually is probably the best on that strip, asthey are always cleaning up the seaweed. While standing at the beach bar waitingto get a refill on our drinks, who shows up but Given! He told us our new roomwas ready, although not oceanfront, but at least in Builiding 7 (the renovatedbuiliding). We were so surprised and it was wonderful and very much worth theextra $50 per night! Thje A/C was COLD and did not require a key card to be putin...it was on all the time! We got a king bed, vs the 2 doubles in the firstroom, as well as a HUGE shower with great water pressure, a jacuzzi tub, doublesinks and overall just much nicer! I would highly recommend upgrading if it'savailable. For the maid we bought items like makeup, scented lotions and hairgoods that we left for her in a little gift back and a note that I made up aheadof time in spanish, thanking her for taking good care of us and our room. Inreturn, we always had lots of cold drinks on our mini-bar and fresh flowers onour towels.We mostly hung out on the beach and figured out that in order to get a good spotwith shade you needed to be on the beach no later than 6:30 to save your chairs. We brought a couple old beach towels from home that we used to do this that weended up leaving. We never had trouble with anyone moving our towels or gettinginto our stuff while we weren't there. We never went to the pool, it was tooloud for us, much quieter on the beach and again, it seemed a little cooler aswell, with a breeze coming off the water. We saw people snorkeling, kayakingand sailing, but we opted just to chill out and do nothing...after all we wereon vacation to relax!See Pedro at the Beach Bar. We brought our Bubba Mugs (32oz) and were the onlyones there that had them. I would HIGHLY recommend getting these (at Walmartfor less than $6) They keep your drinks cold for a long time. The first time wegave them to Pedro we also gave him a dollar and he would always wait on usbefore anyone else. We never say anyone else tip him, so we usually gave him$2-$3 each per day depending on how many times we had to go refill. He wasalways very friendly and helpful. Didn't find that at the main bar and theymade the drinks weak. Pedro would keep pouring until you had to tell him tostop!Water-never had a problem. They had plenty of bottled water at the bars and inthe room and didn't even worry about rinsing our toothbrushes after brushinglike other people have said they have done.Food was OK. We found things we liked better than others, but nothing really towrite home about except in the American Grill - get the Beef Medallions - theyare incredible!We tried the Itailian restaurant one night for dinner and it was pretty good,but not spectacular. We ate twice at the American Grill and the rest of thetime at Windows, which is buffet style and also we had lunch at the Beach Cafe. The service there was terrible unless you speak spanish which brings me to mynext comment.If you don't speak Spanish you will have trouble communicating with some peopleat this resort. Other than Given and one other guy at the front desk, everyoneelse was rude and ignored us unless we got loud. None of the maids speakEnglish, nor the grounds keepers. The majority of tourists there are ofHIspanic origin and non-English speaking. The few (and I mean FEW) people wedid run into that spoke english were from Canada and they all had the samefeeling we did about this. We felt that because we didn't speak the language wewere being slighted and they would go out of their way to make sure the spanishspeaking folks were taken care of first, even if they arrived to lunch/dinnerafter we did. It's very unfortunate that this goes on and because of it wewould not stay at this resort again. I think the Dominican Republic is abeautiful place, and I think for what we paid for staying here it was fine, butI would rather try one of the other resorts next time.  
<Date>Jun 30, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A Perfect Week!!! My wife and I went to the Grand on our honeymoon from June 4th through 10th and loved every minute. We read some reviews beforehand and were a little cautious but as soon as we got there our worries turned to delight. Some people will always find things to complain about no matter how good their situation might be. We were given a room with an ocean view (4223), which was always kept clean and well stocked with beer and water by the cleaning staff. The A/C was great, the water pressure was just like home - no complaints about the room at all. The food was just wonderful. There was no way to hungry at the Grand. The buffet was well stocked at breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and the theme restaurants were cozy with nice menus. There were three outdoor bars including one swim-up, and an outdoor patio which served lunch and dinner as well. The beer was good and the drinks were made well (if you know what I mean). There's more I could write about. We took two tours off the resort including a countryside tour which we recommend to everyone. Additionally we met some really nice people from here in Canada and abroad. If you choose this resort you'll have a great time. We're going back next year again.  
<Date>Jun 29, 2006

<Content>Great Resort We went to the Punta Cana Grand at the end of May this year. I was a little worried because the price was so cheap! The hotel and staff were awsome. We had a great time. The hotel was Beautiful with plenty to do. The food was pretty good with lots of selection. The italian resaurant was our favourite. The drinks were great and they topped them up nicely if you ask them to! I loved having the fridge in our room with bottled water and pop as a few beer at your diposal, replenished daily! I have no complaints about this resort except next time we will be bringing our kids along! I recomend this hotel and would return in the future!

<Author>deanomoses
<Content>Punta cana Grand definatly a great Hotel Ie just returned from my visit to the Punta Cana grand, so I thought id write my review for all you travellers who are planning a visit in the near future. We were slightly delayed, lost a couple of Hours on our first day which was annoying, but when we arrived at the Hotel the check in was quick and trouble free. The only small complaint which i have is, I had requested a room in Block 7, (these are the suites that feature a Jacuzzi and marble flooring) the guy at reception , Osiris, wouldn acknowledge my request but said if wasn happy with my room , they would change it. We didn bother as we had no intention of spending our holiday the Hotel room.Rooms: The rooms are decorated in traditional Dominican dcor, and at first appear quite dark. In my honest opinion I think the rooms serve the purpose it should; they provide a comfortable retreat from The Hot sun. The rooms are kept clean and were always cool. The Water pressure was as should be and the air conditioning was great. Our room was 3206 and had a view of the main evening bar?There was minimal noise after midnight and throughout the day there were no noise heard from the pool. I would suggest that you should try to get the Upgraded Block 7 rooms; they come with extra features, like a Jacuzzi and marble floor.Grounds: Kept very tidy by the Gardeners, who worked everyday from very early till late, trying to keep it looking beautiful, and at the same time were always very friendly to everyone. , The hotel is smaller than some hotels in the Dom rep; however they utilize the space by creating walkways and seating areas, designed Bridges over ponds with ducks in and fountains. The Hotel grounds were beautiful and I wouldn fault them in anyway.Food: There are 4 restaurants in the Punta Cana grand, and also room service, 24 hours a day. The Main restaurant ,Windows buffet restaurant is the serve yourself , breakfast , lunch and dinner, standard restaurant you get in most hotels, However they did make each night a theme Night and serve on you adequately, the next a Italian styled restaurant , serving Italian dishes . The American grill served western American dishes and Mexican style food. And also the beach garden restaurant which serves fast food type foods and sandwiches or salads, again they serve on you, always with a smile.The food in general in all the above restaurants was of a High standard for the Dominican Republic. However some people may struggle to adapt to some foods and ways that they cook and prepare foods, our stomachs can take it? this is not a criticism in anyway, more like an expectation you come to realise when you travel and eat the local cuisines, anywhere in the world. Also I would like to mention the Beach party which they prepare on Thursdays for you, the bar and waiter staff start early , clearing the beach they put out tables and chairs , build stands which later acts as a bar or a food stall. They entire evening revolves around this beach party, with live singing and dancing, the evening show and the night movie all taking place on the beach, this is an excellent evening and very enjoyable. The next day it all gone as though you had dreamt it, this is how hard these people work for youBeach: The beach is stunning; with white sands and palm trees you really get the idea of the Caribbean. The sea is clear with lots of fish to look at; if you feel adventurous you have the option to participate e in numerous water sports and activities.Pools: There are three pools one which is an adult only pool the main family pool with a swim up pool bar and last but not least a beautiful secluded pool situated near block 7. This pool is open till 11pm where as the main pool closes at 7pm. In general the Punta Cana Grand is a great hotel. It accommodates to every need possible weather it making great drinks and constantly refilling your glass in the restaurants or trying to involve you all in the activities. With this hotel under new management , Globia, some huge operators don feature it yet and as soon as they do this will become one of the more popular hotels due to its excellent standards offered by everyone working there and all the facilities on offerThe holiday was truly enjoyable and I hope everyone whose considering this hotel chooses to go. .  
<Date>Jun 20, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very pleasant stay at the punta cana grand Me and my husband stayed at the punta cana grand in april 2006. We were having a break without the chidren which was nerve racking but thoroughly enjoyable. We had a few teething problems with the room we were initially given and the concierge swapped our room the following day. This room was much nicer as it was better maintained. The reception staff were not particularly helpful and seemed as though they had too much work on to deal with us. We seemed to get a different answer for the same query from each member of staff. The cleaning staff however were fantastic. It was very warm and they carried on working away very hard, regardless of the heat. Our room was cleaned and mini bar restocked every day.We weren't very far from the thatre where the entertainment is on an evening but everything quietened down at around 11 every night. We only tried the entertainment towards the end of the week, as we were happy enjoying the lovely food on the evening and having a quiet drink. We had quite low expectations of holiday entertainment but have to give the punta cana gran 110% for this. We went to the Michael Jackson show on the Saturday evenng because we had read so many reviews saying we shouldn't miss it. It was way beyond anything we were expecting. Definitely the best show we've seen!!The food at this hotel on a whole was very good. My husband's mother is an extremely good cook as she is Italian so he is very hard to please. He enjoyed the restaurant on the beachside the best and rated the Italian as the worst, for obvious reasons! It just wasn't authentic at all so we only visited here once. The seafood at the beach though was to die for. They also have a beach party on a Thursday evening where they spend the whole day preparing, making bar areas with palm leaves and carving pineapples etc. They really do put a lot of effort in to this evening and there are different types of food for everyone. There are things to do all the time. We tried snorkelling, kayaking, wind surfing all for free. There are also some excursions you can buy through the hotel. We made the mistake of buying from one of the locals on the beach which we wouldn't advise. We went horseriding in the neighbouring village which was very scary! They brought us two very under nourished horses and rode us down a dirt track with a man at the end with a shotgun. He was the security guard for that stretch of uninhabited beach which I'm sure we shouldn't have really been on. The man smiled though but we still felt very uneasy. If I was to go anywhere like this again we would definitely stay inside the complex as sometimes ignorance is bliss. We had taken some of our girls shoes for the children there as we were told they were very poor but we didn't dare give them to anybody in case they took it offensivley.To finish off we will say that for our first time in the Dominican the Punta cana grand was very nice and relaxing and would definitely reccomend it.  
<Date>Jun 19, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best holiday in D.R. yet I read alot of bad reviews and I have traveled extensively. There is no need to insult a country and it's people. My advice is that preparation is everything. Take the time when you are at home to plan what you need and you will much better in the end. In fact, you may be able to help others less prepared.My holiday exceeded my expectations. The people were fantastic, happy, friendly, and genuine. They worked very long hours and yet were always accomodating. The hotel was great, the rooms were average so I upgraded to a spa suite in building #9. Usually very stressed out by the time I get a holiday, I needed the extra comfort (back injury) and quiet. Don't cheap out...treat yourself, it's your holiday. Make it the best you can.The grounds are beautifully manicured. There are natural sea grass beds growing in the water at the beach (not sea weed), but have you seen the hotel efforts to keep the beach clean? It is being trucked out constantly. There were always plenty of food choices. It was about 30 C and I didn't have much appetite anyway. I always enjoy the fruit and salads and lose about 10 pounds when I go to DR. There is so much to do, I don't focus on food. The water was amazing warm and I cannot wait to return, I would go in a heartbeat to this resort again. My third trip to DR and first visit to PUJ. DR is still the best deal out there, one of the reasons I keep going back, mostly the value, the people and the beauty. Incredibly clean all the time, I gave my maid some days off plus I tipped her in addition to the little gifts from home I brought. I also tipped other staff for good service, and I noticed quite a few other Canadians doing the same. It made me so proud to see the Canadians really care about the local people. Sometimes they didn't want to even take the money. We tip at home so why not there. A tip of $1 here and there makes a huge difference in their lifestyle. They cannot afford the basic things we take for granted and so many are single parent families. Sneakers or jeans for their children are luxuries they cannot afford.I suggest that you take in one of the fabulous spa treatments to help you relax early in your visit. There were just as many men coming into the hotel spa as women. Or there is a wonderful little spot for an outdoor massage that is private near the beach. Just remember paradise in a 3rd world country means it is not the same as home. Prepare yourself for your travels, research your destination and hotel, bring bug spray, medicines, etc. and you will have a better trip. If you go off site the standards are very poor, so be prepared, take some tissue from your room before you leave. (I have seen worse facilities in Italy that they call bathrooms..just a hole in the floor.) Antiseptic gel for disinfecting your hands is good to have too for travel in general. I did get sand flea bites on my legs when I forgot to spray before an evening walk, and they are nasty but they are not bed bugs. Tropical climates are great for bugs too. You can take traps for bugs to keep them away too. Take a small flashlight..power can go off in the DR. Polysporin cream and drops and a well equiped medical kit are a good idea. I always ask my doctor for antibiotics for my trip in case I need them. Sometimes getting sick on holiday can be prevented and it's just good to have this insurance as well as purchased travel insurance.Don't be too quick to complain, ask for what you want or need. Stay away from the complainers, it taints your outlook. There are plenty of small Spanish/English traveller books that allow you to learn the very basic words..it's not hard to try to communicate in their language. It can be a laugh. They are learning English at a rapid rate and as always their English is better than my Spanish. It is our responsibility to be understood not theirs. Be kind and thoughtful, they work hard, and are paid dirt wages to make our holiday a good one. This should be a joint effort. Be appreciative, patient and polite. If their world was the fast paced one that we live in we likely would not want to holiday there. Most of all, they are people and deserve respect, they are not our slaves as I've seen some tourists treat the staff (not Canadians though!) And they know the difference too, so be proud if you are a Canadian traveler because we are welcomed around the globe. Usually, I account for one morning or even one day to get a comfortable room. Priority #1. Evening arrivals seem to be the worst for getting stuck in a room you're not happy with. Next morning, be persistent but polite and you will be moved even if you have to wait for the room to be cleaned. I checked in during the day and I was taken to two different rooms but both were near the pool, so I opted for the quiet building #9. The rest comes pretty easy, deal with it right away if something comes up..and there are often small inconveniences. My balcony door didn't lock so I called front desk and it was fixed within minutes. For first time travelers, you have alot to learn anyway about traveling and being away from home so it doesn't really matter that much where you go. Most of all be happy you are on holidays and enjoy yourself. Soon enough you will be back to the rat-race.  
<Date>Jun 10, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great relaxing time at the Grand Check-in: after our short 20 minute shuttle bus ride we were greeted by a friendly employee with drinks. The process was friendly and quick. The busboy took our luggage to our spacious and very clean room (#2210). The staff at the front desk were very helpful and patient, in particularly Melvin. We were there from May13th to the 20th, 2006. Room: Initially we had requested a room on the second or third floor with a view on the main pool. Instead we were given a room on the second floor in building 2 overlooking the gardens with a partial ocean view. We were given the option to change to a room with a view of the lazy river, but we opted to keep our room. I guess you can not please everyone, but this room was very adequate, spacious, clean and well decorated by our hard working maid. The water temperature and pressure was great, even at 05:15 am.The grounds: Well they are just fantastic, everywhere you look there is flowers, cactus of all types, palm trees, flowering bushes, narrow pathways leading to quieter shaded areas. The gardeners work very hard to keep everything looking so manicured and lush.The beach: One of the best beach Ie seen, palm trees and huts everywhere which provided decent shade. The quality of the sand is comparable to Cancun. The water is clear with some plant form growing away from the shore, which provided habitat to a variety of fish. There are a few small reefs close to the booay line. Seaweed or seagrass, only very little, and SO WHAT, the hard working crew picked it up around 07:00hrs. The food: indows?provides service for all meals and was the very best with theme diners every night except closed for the Thursday night BBQ on the beach, which was memorable.a Marios?is an Italian restaurant with a romantic atmosphere, professional service and great food.ex Mex?is a south western type restaurant with a ranch style ambiance. They start you up with excellent nachos accompanied with their homemade salsa sauce. The beef medallion plate was done to perfection.he Bar Grill?outdoor covered patio restaurant, served great burgers, pizza, clubhouse sandwichesThe entertainment: Let me tell you, the members of the entertainment team are just the most friendly and hard working crew on the resort. They are up by 09:00hrs and still going at it with the evening show. They go around the pool/beach and take the time to chat and inquire if you want to participate with their various fun activities. I would like to thank Anthony who made our vacation that much more enjoyable. There are family oriented movies at 19:30hrs, and the very entertaining evening shows which starts at 21:30hrs and last one hour.The resort staff: everyone there, from the gardener, maids, restaurant and bar employees, front desk, busboys, entertainment staff, maintenance to the managers are the most friendly hard working people we have ever met in all the resorts we visited. All we can say is keep up the good work and wel be back with our two teenagers next year.

<Author>beachgal333
<Content>There is better out there..... Flight- loved sunwing, 1st time flying with them as unfortunately we always get stuck with sardine service, er I mean skyservice...... Nice meal with wine, champagne to start.Hotel- quite nice, really no problems here. Pools and grounds are well kept. Entertainment is the usual dominican fare. Would really be nice to see some authentic local dancing, instead of too loud lip singing. The karoke bar upsrairs in the main lobby was fun, go early to get a seat. The drinks here were more premium that at the outdoor bars.Food- this is where we part ways. I would not return here because of the substandard quality. This was my 3rd trip to the D.R., so I've definately had better. To those who say, well there's always burgers, if I wanted that, I would of never left home and headed to the local McDonald's for dinner. Shopping- went to the mall in Bavaro thinking it was an indoor enclosed shopping mall as we were told at the front desk that it was. It is all open air . And ladies there's a real treat for us in the banos. No toilet paper and better yet, no toilet seats!. Also no soap or towels, enter at tyour own risk! Don't waste the cab fare. They basically have the same stuff as you can get on the beach out front.Beach- there is a lot of seaweed on this beach, and weeds in the water. Though the saving grace is about a ten minute walk up the beach to beautiful clear water where if you bring a bun the fish will almost eat out of your hands. On the down side- the motor boats come very close to you as this is their pathway between the coral, so be very careful especially is you are snorkelling. Summary- Nice hotel and grounds, but needs huge improvements in food quality.

<Author>Lee29
<Content>Great Time Punta Cana Grand by Globalia former known as Sunscape Punta Cana GrandCheck in: No problems from airport to hotel it's about 20 minutes away when we arrived we were treated with drinks as we waited to check in. The bell boys brought our stuff up to our rooms.Hotel: The Hotel is a smaller resort (about 8 buildings 3 floors) but I found this to be nice everything was close, there are some renovations taking place as older building are getting a face lift and a casino is being completed, there were no problems with the construction and it's close to being finished but it was not disturbing at all. We were in Building 1 on the second floor. I would not suggest this building as it was the furthest from the beach and the entertainment stage/theatre was very close the shows started at 9:30 and went until about 10:30-11:00pm it was very very loud at this building if your at the shows it doesn't matter but if your trying to rest it can be annoying. Pools/Beach:There are 3 swimming pools the main pool with a swim up bar and two adult pools. The adult pool by building 7 was really nice the water was always nice and cool and it was very quiet and relaxing over there. The Beach was good can't understand what the seaweed problem was that i had seen complaints about it was more like a few blades of grass and the beach was not covered in it as said by others the hotel staff was always cleaning up the beachfront. The marina was very close to this hotel and when we were there a fishing tournament was taking place so there were more boats that usual, but I found the beach to be great, there was lots of chairs out and you can walk down the beach for a good way. There were some vendors selling stuff, and hotel staff going around asking if you wanted to participate in activites, some paid (parasailing, bananna boat) and others were free. They had beach volleyball everyday (team Canada was robbed, that ball did not hit the tree) Horsehoes, bacci ball, shuffleboard right on the beach, snorkeling, windsurfing, sailboats and kayaks all for free.Activities by the main pool, areobics, dancing etc. Lots of fish to be seen they swim by you in at the beach take swimming goggles if you have them, tehy also like bananas and breadRooms:If you want a really nice room ask for building 7 those rooms are new and really really nice with a jacuzzi on the balcony and swim out rooms right to the adult pool also very close to the beach, also building 4 was close to the beach. Our room at building 1 was nothing to write home about standard hotel room 2 dbl beds furthest from the beach but we were not there for the rooms so we didn't care as long as we had a place to sleep. They had free room service and a fridge in every room filled with water beer and pop everyday this was also free. You cannot drink the tap water only bottled water. There is a safe in each room for 15$ US for the week also you can request late check out the day before you leave, we did not leave for the airport until late afternoon and wanted to keep the room past noon, They say there is a fee of 35$ US for late check out but they never charged us for it.Staff:  Wow what can I say, I have never seen such happy people, and I have never seen such happy people who work so many hours. We would go for Breakfast at about 8am and the same host would still be there when we went back for dinner at 8pm still smiling really really great people. It was also nice that alot of the staff speak great english I always attempted to speak spanish to them but when I got stuck there were no problems as their English is better than my Spanish. They were always smiling and singing. I have read other reviews about leaving treats and gum and whatever, this is not necessary just leave them a tip for their hard work, a couple dollars goes a long way, how would you like to be rewarded with a pack of gum for cleaning a room everyday?...they can take a few dollars further than we can. They are also big big baseball fans down there if you have old baseball caps that you don't want take them with you they love the Red Sox but we did see some toronto maple leaf hats on the tour guides Trips: We went out on the snokeling tour which is right beside the hotel and we went on the Island tour to Sonora. The snorkeling tour right besid ethe hotel was great it was about 4 hours and you went out on a large two level glass bottom boat you went snorkeling with giant rays and sharks, Nurse sharks so they are not dangerous it was amazing to see them so close, then they took you over to an amazing beach to swim and drink then back to the hotel it was about a 4 hour tripSonora Island about an hour bus drive, then you went on a speed boat out to a natural Ocean swimming pool to swim, drink and see star fish, you then were taken out to the island for swimming drinking and bbq lunch which was amazing food, you relaxed and did some swimming then you took a catamaran back to the bus it was about 1 hour on the boat more drinks were served along with fresh fruit absolutely beautiful take your sun screen!! This trip was 85$ US per person, take a banana or piece of bread with you the fish go nuts for it and will eat it right out of your hand.Weather:Not a drop of rain all week it was about 30 average all week just perfect perfect weather not a cloud in the sky on any day beware of the sun take lots of sun screen or tanning lotion with you I ran out and they charge 20$ US in the gift shop for it.Food:The food was great every night the buffet Windows had a different theme, Japaneese, Italian, Mexican ect. there were a few other a la carte resturants you do not need reservations to eat there just go. On Thursdays they have a beach party it was really nice the buffet and everything is set up right down on the beach it was just beautiful. Entertainment:Everynight there is a different show the shows are pretty good dancing singing, magicians, they also have a piano bar thurday nights is karokee and they have a disco, they also show a movie on a big screen outside everynight, they have tennis courts that are open in the day and evening and the adult pool is open until 11pm.Overall it was a great place had a wonderful time this resort was worth the money spent. It was a great vacation. Anything else you can send me an email

<Author>Sunisamust
<Content>Punta Cana Grand - A Grand Place to Stay Finally getting around to writing a review of our latest trip to the DR. We had been to Bahia Principe Tulum in February for a couple of weeks and had found the place too big and impersonal. This time around we decided to try a smaller hotel to see if this was a factor.Flight: We flew Sunwing from Ottawa, a new player in this area, and boy were we pleasantly surprised. More leg room, better food and free headphones (compared to Skyservice or cattle service as I refer to them). Will definitely fly with Sunwing again.Beach: Very nice and to be expected in PC. Plenty of chairs but people do play the towel game. Activities and equipment easy to access and plentiful. Little shops are located right next to the hotel and the prices there are reasonable if you know how to haggle. Towels are plentiful and can be exchanged by the main pool near the beach.Food: Very good and plenty of choice. The Italian restaurant was sublime but be warned its first come first served as there are no advance reservations. Don even try to buy your way in as someone tried it and ended up looking really dumb (this was great for the people already in line ?. The drinks were good and you can ask they to double up on the alcool. Rooms: The Deluxe Master Junior suites are great for couples and for those with 1 small child but are not good for 3 adults. We were switched to a deluxe ocean view with two queen sized beds and these were fantastic. Try and get a room on the third floor of the buildings as these have the roof as ceiling and the height gives you the feeling of a lot of extra space. Maid service was fantastic and they will try to accommodate any requests.Grounds: Well manicured and they were building extra amenities such as a Casino and places for more little shops. The shows at night are very good and are given in a new facility they have built. The shows were among the best we have seen and the Michael Jackson spectacle is not to be missed. All in all we really enjoyed this hotel, the concierge was very, very helpful in retrieving shoes we had misplaced and he went out of his way to ensure we had a great time in the hotel. We met a lot of new friends and are now convinced that the size of the hotel does matter?smaller is warmer and encourages social interaction a lot more.  
<Date>May 27, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fun trip, but manage your hotel expectations... We had a great time on our vacation, but there are some things about this hotel that you will want to know. The hotel is old. It has everything that you need to have a great time, but the wear and tear is evident in almost everything.Rooms- The rooms are very spacious with four poster beds. However, our linens were old and this was evident in the lint balls all over the sheets/pillowcases. Additionally, the flooring throughout is tile. Not a problem, except that it almost has a cave effect in terms of sounds from the hallway or wherever echoing. If you are traveling with children or are a light sleeper, I would try to get up on a higher floor to avoid the late night hall traffic.Food- Manage your expectations. If you are envisioning a plethora of fresh seafood, you will be disappointed. The only fish we saw, and the catch of the day everyday, was grouper (heavily buttered or sauced), despite fishermen carrying around 4 foot long mai mai on the beach. There are plenty of options for food, and the a la carte places were good, but everything kind of blends together. It was fine, but if I would have ordered any of the items at a real restaurant where I was paying, I wouldn't return.Gym/Spa- You will not need to use the sauna at the spa, just go to the gym and try running in there. The gym was lacking: one treadmill, one stairstepper, one spinning bike, old weights. It was very uncomfortable to be in there with the heat and humidity. We never used the spa. The facility was decent, but the prices were the same as a nice place at home so there wasn't much of a point ($65-80 for massage, $75-125 for facial). The tennis courts and equipment were very nice and up to date. Staff- I cannot say enough about the staff. They were fantastic and did everything that they could to make you comfortable. Great, friendly people. I almost feel bad writing bad things about their hotel since I enjoyed them so much.Bars- There are plenty and getting drinks is not a problem. The drinks are great, also. The disco, piano bar, kareoke are all the same room, rotating themes depending on the night. They were fun. There is an outdoor bar/patio in the center of the action, right near the pool, that is very comfortable to sit at in the evenings.Overall, we would probably not go back to this hotel. However, it was a great deal for the money.  
<Date>May 22, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Amazing:) This resort was absolutly amazing!!The beach was VERY clean, many chairs for everyone ( meaning you did not have to wake up at crack of dawn to get one) haha, lots of huts.The pool was also very clean, swimming to the bar was GREAT:), there were always aerobic exercises in the pool, volleyball and entertainment rite beside the pool. which was fun, the music was awesome!Hotel rooms were very nice and well kept! always fresh drinks braught to us and clean towels! (flower pedals spread throughout the washroom/sink) that was very cute:) Always got hot water- no complaint with that. thank god! hahaStaff was very friendly except a few at the front desk in the lobby. But thats ok, we were a bit cranky because our flight kept getting delayed without any notice :s .. FOOD - i cant even begin to tell you the variety of food provided. The windows buffet is incredible! none of us got sick. The food was fresh and very good. Service was great!Nightly entertainment was great! Anthing Can Happen nights are hilarious! and very enjoyable haha. Aswell as the Michael Jackson show. All the shows in general were very entertaining. Also the night club was good. Good music. I didn't enjoy the piano bar to much. but thats ok!The entertainers were a pleasure to be around and chat with.ANTHONY and SPAGHETTI (jason) were hilarious. Very nice guys! i miss them:(Shopping was great. Of course get expected to get hounded, but hey they got to make their money somehow! just remember. BARGAIN BARGAIN BARGAIN! :) lol.. (DANNY's shop was great!)Overall I would recomend this resort to anyone. The people are very friendly, the atmosphere is great and very intimate. Its good for familes, couples and friends. Definitly staying longer than 1 week next time! Anyone deciding to go.. Enjoy. U'll have a blast!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Interesting experience The resort itself was really nice. Do do most of the really fun activities like quading you had to pay on average 100us per couple and most actitivites were a 15 minute drive away or more. Take lots of cash! We found it almost impossible to get any. ATM's wouldnt take our cards and we finally had to pay 10 % to take out from front desk in pesos and then we paid more to get it in US from the shops on the beach. Be prepared to be harrassed at the shops too, they will try to rip you off so badly and they push push and push. I know all about being ripped off becuase ive been to other countries but never this pushy. I would definatly go back to the dominican just not this particular resort. Our room was less that impressive, for our honeymoon is was not the kind of room you looked forward to coming back to.
