<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Gospel on the Punta Cana Grand scale 1-10 1= useless 5= average 10 = excellent the grounds- 7 lots of plants and trees. very tropical looking. showing some were on concrete around the pool area. nice looking buildings all one color-cream color, not that multi color Jamaican crap like some others resort up the beach.the pool - 6 OF 10 not deep enough for diving, paint chipping in some areas, size good temperature good, swim up bar pretty basic,the drinks 9 out of 10 could be a 10 if they were more consistent, at least 15 different drinks that they have on a list and different feature every day. the only place that i can say i can feel the alcohol in the all inclusive drinks at any resort so far. the food 5 out of 10 some days better than others, do not waste your time standing in line to get into any of these restaurants not worth it. you want to try, just walk in at the right time otherwise go to windows buffet. mexican night was the best for me at windows buffet. watch closely for problems with cross contamination with the bbq grill serving raw meat at the windows buffet. they just don't understand how people could get sick from this. we paid attention to this, avoided lunch meats and salad and never had any problem at all. highly advise to pay close attention to the utensils they use to serve from the bbq grill in windows. American grill you can have better food at taco bell or your local pet store. Italian restaurant get the stuff polo it's actually good. beach restaurant or grill stick with the cheeseburgers pizza is the worst i seen anywere. overall other have said that this resort is better than others in Dominican. i believe them, but i have had way better variety at the rui resorts in mexico the beach  7 out of 10 awesome area for sun hogs because of the constant breeze with this region comes from the north atlantic. the sand is white powder never gets hot. for swimming 5 out of 10 simply put too much seaweed for my standards, in fact some days worst than others but constant. if your looking for pristine perfect beaches this punta cana area is not your place. but lots of shade from trees and great sandy area for beach people very clean and lots of chairs and huts. the rooms 5 of 10 . as this hotel is only 8 years old the rooms are getting worn a little some more than others. i stayed in building 4 3rd fl recommend this or building 7 more money, but totally different class of rooms mable and jacuzzi tub, with there own swim out pool around the building. no good ocean view from this building though. tile on floors and bathroom walls looked like the person was just practising how to install tile very pooorrr quality work and equal to a super 8 motel in decor not the marble and granite like in mexico. clean and sufficient with no problems with a/c, smells or hot water in my building. mini bar is usless not much other than beer or pop and they don;t keep very cold at all.room service 24 hrs had great experience ready in 10 minutes only tried it once though could be a fluke, but it's nice to have for sure. Entertainment 3 of 10 not even close to the entertainment that i am used to yes the Jackson is the highlight but again i seen a better one.daytime pool area entertainment is there but not enough variety. beach area has better than average for games and sports and kids area.the check in and staff 8 of 10 checked in around 2 pm had great service and quickly to the room. dont'; expect this all the time if you arrive at 12 to 3 am forget it you will not get the same level of service at that time of the morning. overall i found no problem with the staff only the maids have a problem with English but who cares, all you need is the servers bartenders and they are better with English than most places ive seen in Mexico. trip excursions 8 of 10 - lots to do on this island if you don like to sit around bring a pocket full of money. only took one trip to sanona $85 us island highly recommend it for fun not for snorkeling. for that see sonya at the beach house and for diving. you really don't need any peso's just bring us $$ and that all you need forget that Canadian money they don't want it.OVERALL RATING7 out of 10 if your looking for great value and can get 7days for $1100 to $1250 then this is your type of place FOR PUNTA CANA nothing wrong overall, other than things i mentioned. if your looking for 4.5 to 5.5 star resort move on and pay more. recommend the Iberostar down past barvaro beach.this resort is 8 years old and currently under new ownership and now being upgraded with new casino and gift shops and spa area. on a average day it is a 3.5 star resort and a good day a 4 star. in the future with some maintenance and a few tweaks and upgrades it could be a 4.25 start resort.would i go back not right now other places want to check out on other islands. but definitely in the future years would like to explore more of the Dominican area.shopping go to barvaro beach area take taxi $15 each way. rainy day activity go to manatee park $25 like good shows.flew sunwing out of London ont best airline ever flown on.. any other questions jeffc@porchlight.ca

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Blame yourself if you didn't enjoy your stay! Just got back last Friday night (May 5th) from our week long stay and the Grand Flamenco. My wife and I went for both RR as well as some exciting experiences as well. We got both without any problems. We read all of the reviews, even back to 04 and became very nervous about what to expect. We even upgraded to the Royal Club 2 weeks out in fear of a bad experience(See below Royal Club). I have one thing to say if you heading here or anywhere else for that matter, the issues/problems you're reading in these review primarily stem from the vacationesr themselves. Too picky, absurd expectations, FAILURE TO PLAN, poor attitude, and so on will easily destroy a vacation. Don't listen to the negative. Just do your due diligence, KNOW where you are going, and KNOW what you're purchasing. It's that easy. Enough of my preface.....Without getting into details, I'd like to mention some of the things I wish I knew prior to arriving in Punta Cana as well as the resort itself. I'll also mention things we did that made a world of difference in making our trip SMOOTH! See above: FAILURE TO PLAN!1. You will need $14.00/USD/person to get through the airport; it is a DR entry fee.2. We booked through Expedia and arranged our Airport - Resort Taxi fair for $20.00/person. Screw trying to wheel with the locals or pray they'll be on time. Our boys were polite, on time, drove fine, and even sang us some tunes! 3. ROYAL CLUB: If you're cheap, don't complain about anything when it is not up to your liking. I'm sure you've hear the old saying... You get what...... yada yada. We freaked out and paid an extra $500.00 total for our Royal Upgrade. In hindsight, I would've done without question knowing what I know now. Why? Private buildings with thier own water heaters, great rooms with nice bathrooms. Ours even had 2 showers! Private check-in with champagne. Private conceirge service to make your a la carte reservations, room needs, or whatever. The resort is so big, the front desk can't give you that kind of service. Private restaurant!!! This really made it worth it for us. The main eatery/commons is more or less a massive feeding lot and nothing less. An earlier review said it best, the food is there to keep you alive while you're on vacation. Someone who critiques a massive buffet common isn't being realistic about it. The Royal restaurant was perfect. There was never more than 6-10 people there and there were about 3 waiters! Mimosas, Smoked Salmon Scrambled Egg Tower, Shrimp Omeletes, Nutella!, Tons of Awesome pastries! Lunch and dinner were great although we tried to get out to the a la carte's and empanadas stand. Shrimp skewers, Tenderloin, Duck, and lots more. Food was never an issue! The club also has a private area on the beach. I could hit the beach at anytime and ALWAYS get a shade hut or chairs. The Royal Club gives you a way to escape the madness of people when you need it! ... Oh yeah, free internet in the cigar room and unlimited towels all day long. No checking in and returning towels! ... and there is also a saftey deposit box included in your room, very handy and a necessity!4. Dinners: The a la cartes are fun and a way to change things up. We only did Mexican and Chinese so I can't speak for the others. I'm from Iowa and don't need to know what Dominican cattle tastes like, I'm sure it's fine though! Both Chinese and Mexican were great. We preferrd Mexican because of the salsas (nice and hot). Food was great as well, not sure if the Fajitas are all they're cracked up to be, but it is all opinion. I really enjoy the Rock Bass. One weird thing is that they kept serving everyone wine at the Mexican which doesn't really work out. Get on with the Margarita and tell them you don't want wine!Three of the nights we ate empanadas for an appetizer and then walked over and shared a pizza. Both are really good. Empanadas are great! Plenty of food too!5. Excursions: If you are looking for great day with food and cocktail (plenty of them!), go to Saona Island! Unbelievable day that we are still talking about. Get ready though, it really is a long day. Bring plenty of snacks and water for the bus ride in the morning, we didn't and suffered a bit. When you stop at the ancient city around 9:30am, eat some pizza if you plan on drinking. We didn't and paid for it later! You'll get on speed boats, party in the blue lagoon, relax and eat lunch on a private  georgeous beach, and then sail  dance on a catamaran all the way home. Great chance to meet different people too! Got home around 8:00pm and my wife put me to bed early that night. Had a little to much fun and wore myself out! Get the pizza!We did the VIP fishing trip too! We nailed a Mahi Mahi, a couple of Tuna, and our partner boat caught a massive Blue Marlin! We were back on the beach at the Flamenco by1:00pm All of the excursions are around $50-$100 USD/person. Get out of the resort and have some fun!6. The market outside the resort is rediculous. Bad. It is about 20-30 stores, all with the same crap and the same salesman saying, Let me ask you one question? Waste of time and very annoying. 7. Tipping: I didn't see where tipping would get you much more of anything except for a few employees and with room service. I left $5.00/day for room service and never needed anything. She left me more Rum than I could drink and even left me a bottle of Dewar's one day! Outstanding! You'll know the employees around the resort who deserve the tips. They're the ones who smile, make you feel welcome, and converse with you! They are very enjoyable! 8. Seaweed is not a problem: For crying out loud, it is the ocean and guess what?, there is sea-weed in there! ... and guess what happens to some of it? Yup, it washes up on the beach. I can't believe what some people complain about! FYI: There is a lot in the morning, at about 9:00am. It is cleaned by 10:00pm and slowly builds up the rest of the day. There is not much at all. It's natural. Some complaint make it seem like there are piles of it. Nothing but BS from those whiners! Personally I thought the beaches were absolutely beautiful and relaxing. Breezy, sunny, great sand, and warm waters.9. Cigars: If you really like cigars, as you probably know, buy off of an authorized vendor and not the market folk. I've never seen so many fake cigars of all brands in my life. Bring your own if you want to be safe. I even tried a few out fron the resort store and I didn't think they were anything to write home about! Very overpriced too! There is a great store in the airport on the departure side that is authorized and had some great sticks! I bought my keepers there! If your going to pay a premium price, be positive you're getting the premium product!Things to bring with you(or not too bring): Plenty of sunscreen! 15, 30, 60! , leave jewelry and valuables at home(wear a fake wedding ring, watch, etc.), camera, snacks, crackers, mouthwash!!!, hand soap/wipes, we crought CIPRO just in case, goggles/snorkling set up, plenty of $1.00  some $5.00 bills, othe cash for personal spending we brought ($400 total and brought $210 home). A great place for families and couples and not really a singles or party resort! Many different nationalites, but that is part of what is fun about it! Have fun with it and relax! I'd be happy to go back although I would like to see other places! Who knows, I probably will be back because I know things will be fine!Enjoy yourself, relax, and watch out for the amounts of rum they pour in drinks! You'll be looking at 3 Atlantic Oceans instead of one! If you ask me, that's just more bang for your buck! Salut and try the Mama Juana! Kind of like the Dominican Jaeger! BZZZZZZ!Out!

72	8(day):2	10(restaurant):2	16(food):4	20(look):2	26(people):1	41(city):1	43(leave):3	47(eat):1	51(enjoy):1	63(drink):3	69(tell):1	72(resort):1	73(etc):1	74(perfect):1	77(buffet):1	117(dinner):2	122(stop):1	141(home):1	158(plenty):2	160(relax):1	161(change):1	174(serve):1	176(fun):1	194(tip):1	205(ocean):1	212(club):1	221(plan):1	225(la):2	238(bottle):1	245(watch):2	251(wine):2	252(lunch):1	253(tried):1	265(issue):1	353(instead):1	406(snack):1	434(wear):1	444(stand):1	492(private):1	576(yourself):1	604(wed):1	608(employee):1	666(amount):1	675(mexican):1	678(pizza):1	681(carte):2	704(opinion):1	716(cocktail):1	734(excursion):1	753(royal):2	830(common):1	1072(deserve):1	1084(rum):2	1150(ring):1	1329(massive):1	1411(crack):1	1601(escape):1	1611(weird):1	1646(camera):1	1764(pour):1	1935(valuable):1	2261(jewellery):1	2494(atlantic):1	2965(fake):1	3055(margarita):1	3294(cracker):1	3356(ancient):1	4323(fajitas):1	4455(madness):1	4824(realistic):1	7009(mouth wash):1	7737(critique):1

<Author>toddbtfd
<Content>Great time at Punta Cana Grand, nice resort, just relax! It truly amazes me the vast differences of opinion from one review to the next about the same place. Personally, I believe the holiday that you end up with is what you make of it. I have travelled to many resorts, both all inclusive, and non, and I found the Punta Cana Grand to be just fine. First of all you must bear in mind, you get what you pay for. The resort is according to the travel magazines a 4+ star resort. It's really probably more like a 3+ star. We paid $878 + $275 tax, and for that price, the resort is fine. I did see other travel deals to PCG earlier for approx $700 plus tax, that would have been a great deal. For that price however, we did fly into LaRomana airport, which is about an hour and a half by bus to the resort. (not an unpleasant ride however, a real eye opener to what Domincan life is really like. Just be thankful you are from whereever you are from, and just visiting a nice all inclusive resort).Resort; Lovely grounds, beautiful lobby, nice pools, (shallow however, all 3 feet deep, therefore by late in the afternoon, the water in the pools are not very refreshing, and get a bit skanky with drinks spilled, sun tan oils, and whatever other fluids might have found there way in there!). The power did go off about 5 times throughout the week, but only briefly for the most part. Thursday evening, just prior to the beach party, the power was out for about 15 minutes, and then there was no water for a shower for about an hour. Oh well, have another drink and wait! Rooms; stayed in room 4311. Large room, high vaulted ceiling. Bathroom was adequate, small shower with lower than average water pressure, and some hit and miss hot water. No question, when you look at the pictures of the rooms, and compare buiding 4, to the new building 7, there is a vast difference. I have read that you can upgrade to the new building for $350US for the week? I'm not sure of that, it was never offered to me, and I would have refused.As I mentioned, this resort was budget priced, and to pay an additional 50% for a nicer looking room, just wasn't that important to me. Food; Overall the food was fine. No question, some meals/dishes were better than others. Everyone has different tastes. We enjoyed DaMario's restaurant the best, and went to dinner there 3 times. You can NOT make reservations, it's showand go. Some good pasta/seafood dishes, and a couple of good appetizers, (and yet, one nite really enjoyed the ceasar salad, the next nite, way over powering taste of anchovies, with a whole anchovie on the side). Same restaurant, same salad ordered, completely different taste. But overall, you know what? No big deal! The American grill, Tex/Mex restaurant was our least favorite, but again, maybe just what we ordered that nite. The ribs were terrible, very fatty, with little meat. Oh well. Enjoyed lunch at the beach garden daily, fine burgers, pizza, fries, sandwiches, etc...no problems at all. I will take issue with the wine however. Red wine is usually my evening drink of choice, and it really was barely drinkable. I'll admint I'm a bit of a wine snob, but usually I can drink swill with the best of them, once I get a few glasses down. Again, even though it was the same wine every nite, I did manage to drink it better some nites than others. Oh well. They do have a reserve wine list, but I'm not going to pay $30-$40 US for a $12 bottle of wine, when I'm at an all-inclusive resort. If that were the case, I should have paid $500 more, and gone to a truly 5 star resort with better wine! Oh well, no problems! Staff/Service; The staff were just fine. I don't know how people could have a problem with the staff, unless they themselves are walking/lying around with a sour face, and then I'm sure the staff can read that from their face, and return the expression. A few noteable top notch staff were, Paco, at the front desk, Jacqueline from the entertainment team, Pedro at the beach bar, (excellent breakfast Ceasars!) and Beachpapi at the main bar, YA Man! We spend most days at the main pool, sunning, drinking, just relaxing, and it was great. You do however have to get up off your butt, and get your own drinks, no big deal. We tipped the housekeeping staff, $5 the first day, then $2 or $3 per day, but I don't think it really mattered, they did an adequate job. Same with the bartenders, tipped sometimes, $1 or $2 for the round, then not, didn't really matter. They appreciated the tips for sure, but it did not seem to affect the service/drink quality. If you wanted more booze in your drinks, then just say mucho rum or vodka or whatever, and you get it. No problems!Beach; the beach was nice, and no question, there was a lot of sea grass washing up on shore, right in front of this resort, but they were cleaning it up all the time. And I say sea grass, instead of sea weed, as it wasn't the slimy, stinky stuff like in Ontario. If you were inclined, you could just walk up the beach about 15-20 minutes, and there were places with no sea grass at all, and the water was clearer. Plus, it was a nice walk.Overall, the resort is just fine. There are nicer, but for the price it was completely satifactory,and I would not hesitate to reccomend the resort, or go there again, provided the price was right. Relax, have fun, that's what you should be there for, Austa Luego!  
<Date>May 6, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Resort!!!!! I have travelled to Cuba, Mexico (twice), Punta Cana (last year), Florida, Portugal, and Spain. This trip by far has been the best trip in a long time for me. I was in Punta Cana last year and stayed at one of the Riu resorts and got robbed, the year before that I went to Mexico and came back with shigella which is a strand of e-coli. My boyfirend and i decided to give Punta Cana another try because i absolutely fell in love with the beaches when I was there last, and I am glad we did. Punta Cana Grand was a breath of fresh air. I know that some of you have written some bad reviews about being sick, bad maintenance, or whatever and I totally understand what that feels like to have something crappy like this happen to you on vacation, but I have come to see that you can have good and bad everywhere and anywhere you go, even if it's a five star!! My boyfriend and I stayed in building one which is right across from building seven. I was quite impressed with our view of one of the pools. Our chamber maid cleaned our room immaculately everyday, we also left her a dollar every day along with a small treat of some sort once in a while (granola bar, hard candy, whatever). Remember these people work hard everyday and unlike you or us the vacationers, they have to work all day in the heat. Therefore I highly recommend that you tip here and there for your services, whether at the buffet, a la carte restaurants, or the bars. These people do not have the money or means to live like we do and they could use the cash.Some reviews that I have read have said that the people at this resort were not very friendly or accomodating. First of all, you are on vacation and a different country (which means the culture is different) what's the hurry anyway, also don't expect the RITZ, YOU DIDN'T PAY FOR THE RITZ!!!!The service at times may not be what we the fast food mcdonaldization society are used to but don't forget this is a third world country and these people work long hours everyday and sometimes don't get paid for all the hours they have put in, they watch us have fun and lye around with our drinks all day--HOW HAPPY WOULD YOU BE!!!! I found the service to be good for a place like this and the people were always friendly and you know why???-because no matter what I was always super frienldy to them and got to know them so that there was more of a personal relationship with them. Do not go there with the attitude that you are above them and do greet them with smiles and kindness everyday and you will get the same in return.The food was great, just what I wanted. My boyfriend and I didn't eat dinner at the buffet, so I can't comment about their dinners, but the a la carte restaurants were very good. If you are not picky then you will enjoy what this resort has to offer. Drinks are great!! Don't forget your themos mugs though, the slushy drinks do melt fast if you don't have one. The pools and beach were nice. If you go at a time where there happens to be more seaweed than normal, a five minute walk down the beach and you will find a public beach with less seaweeed and gorgeous water. The shows were really good, and funny, but a little short.Must see the Michael Jackson show, the costumes and choreography were excellecent.Disco was good, closes a little early, but they play awesome music!!!My boyfirend and I did go on a excursion, not with sunwing though, it was with the other rep at the hotel, which even though you flew with sunwing you can go with the other rep company if your travel rep isn't around when you want to book. I highly recommend taking the country (Jurassic tour). You get to visit typical Dominican home, schools, drive through country and learn about their economy, see city centres, go to a country ranch and ride horses, they also have other animals that you can take pictures (parrots, monkey, snakes, etc. ), visit a shopping district, where they also show you how to make cigars, and finally you visit a beautiful beach on the caribbean side and go boogie boarding. Well worth the all day trip. Very informative, and nice and at the same time you can drink the whole time.Maybe some of you with all these nitpicky complaints about this resort should have taken this excursion and maybe you could appreciate the people and their culture a lot more!!!!All in all, a good resort with lots to offer, or not if you're like me and the type to read a book while sipping on a pina coloada in the sun, enjoying the breathtaking view of the beach. Just so you know I am 28 yrs old, and my boyfirend is 33 yrs old, and we found the resort to be good mix in age groups, as well as most of the vacationers at this resort during our stay were Canadian--EH!! Therefore we had a great time!!!!!!!!!!!!!  
<Date>May 3, 2006

<Author>soah
<Content>Real paradise! First of all, thanks to Megan, Michelle and Brianna for their advise on this hotel.We stayed at Punta cana Grand from april 23 til 30. Hotel:The hotel was very clean and the check in was fast for us. We arrived at 1h00 pm and it tooks us 15 min to get our room. We were about 20 couples arrived at the same time. The satff at the reception were very nice, they gave us a nice room as our request. In fact, we reserve the building 4 ont the 3rd floor because you have hot water and a beautiful view on the resort and on the beach. The guy at the reception tried to sell us the VIP room, which cost 35$ US a night. It's not worth it because you spend only a little time in the room. Room:The room is ok. I mean, it's really clean and big. We had the 3rd floor so the ceiling was high which is nice. We tip the maid everyday, so we had our mini bar full load and new towel. And perhaps because we tipped she did our room first around 10h00 in the morning... some people had their room done only at 4h00. We also paid for the safe. It's 15$ US but it's worth it. We kept our passport, camera and money inside all the time. Restaurant:There is 3 a la carte restaurant on the resort. Beach garden is the one on the beach were you can have lunch and dinner. The american grill was one of our best! A western atmosphere were the steak is awesome! The Da Mario's restaurant is an italian speciallity. We had a beef medallion, which melt in the mouth! Excellent! And the window restaurant is a buffet were the food is also excellent and has a different food every night. The food in general is a 5 stars! We went to cuba last year, and the food at punta cana is way better than what we had!Beach:The beach is nice, but not very large. there is 2 other resort next to ours. The water is clear, and there's not a lot of waves. If you go to the deep blues side of the sea, it's a little dangerous because we heard that some water snakes with poison was living down the water. So be careful if you do some snorkling. there's also a lot of little gray and yellow fish. They are cute and you can bring banana or bread for them. People reserve the hut and the chairs in the morning, but we never did. They were plenty chairs available. Animation:The shows were excellent! We enjoyed all shows and especially the one on saturday which is the Micheal Jackson presentation. On thursday, they was a beach party. all restaurant are close and there's a huge barbecue party directly on the beach. After the dinner, there a nice show on the beach. We had fun that night! Drinks:the drinks are delicious! There's a drink of the day, so if you don't know what to drink beside pina colada and sex on the beach, the barman will have the pleasure to offer you an exotic mix! You'll like it! You don't need to bring a mug, because the drinks are enough for one person. And at the restaurant a la carte, they don't wait to give you a refill... they are not cheap on that. So we will go back for sure in a few years. For now, we have other place to visit.Feel free to email me if you have any questions on this resort.  
<Date>May 2, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Good, The Bad, The Ugly!!! This was our second visit to the Punta Cana Grand. Last year this resort was under other management and we had a great time. The new management seems more concerned with construction than customer service. Additionally, the new management seems more concerned with their bottom line ($) than the happiness of their guests!The Good- The Spa staff is excellent. The housekeeping staff is excellent. The View from our room (4324) was excellent.The Bad- The food has taken a turn for the worse at DaMarios, (we loved it last year, but really nothing special this year). The food at other resturants was rarely hot when it should have been, especially breakfast. The room was still the same old run down room with the added bonus of ANTS, we requested an upgrade to building 6 or 7 (offering to pay much more) but were told they had nothing available, that was hard to believe since the resort was no where near as busy as last year and there are now 2 additional buildings. The staff (other than spa and housekeeping) have very poor attitudes. Last year there was a great resturant host, Johnathan who made every guest feel special, always remembering names, etc. Sadly, Johnathan is no longer there, and the familiar faces were ones that were miserable last year and seemed to be worse this year. The rooms electricity is now run with your room card/key, so when you are not in the room your a/c and minibar is turned off, so your beverages are never cold. The all night bar, (11pm-6am) was right below our room and the more the bar crowd had to drink the louder they got and the less we slept. The new management did away with the fresh fruit cart on the beach, that was something that we really enjoyed last year. The Ugly- If the first person you were to meet was Elismo, at the conciere desk, you would have a very bad opinion of the Dominican people. Lucky for us we already knew what wonderful people the Dominicans are and we did not have to deal with Elismo until the last day of our trip. Elismo is the most disrespectful person we have ever met, he would not even look at us when he was talking to us, and he was lying about a situation we had with him to his manager. Between Elismo and the man working at the gift shop you would get the impression that the resort is a bit shady, asking for money for things that were not required to pay for and not returning money that was due to be refunded. This raises some RED FLAGS about who you can trust at the resort. Be aware that if you do an excursion and they make a DVD of your day, and tell you that you can watch it before paying the balance to make your decision, and if you don't want it you get your deposit back, you may not get your deposit back without a fight and the gift shop/public relations desk may try to get you to pay more money just to watch it. Vacations are for unwinding and refreshing and when it ends with Elismo all that is erased!!! After all that did we ever even get an apology, NO!!!! So STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!! This is the way we were treated and the resort knew that we were returning guests.  
<Date>May 2, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Hotel- Amazing spot! I would have to agree.... I do not understand the bad reviews. I went down to Punta Cana for the second time with another couple, the first being a horrible experience at the Occidental Grand Flamingo where I swore never to return thus this time around I was very sceptical about what I was going to get and to my amazement, the GLOBALIA PUNTA CANA GRAND was one of the best vacations I have been on thus far. The weather was cooperative to boot! not one day of Rain!The look of the hotel for starters was very pleasant and the rooms we stayed in were very nice and kept fairly clean. The in room bar fridge was always kept full and we were never without supplies.The food at the resort proved to be excellent and we all agreed that we could not complain about it as we were always stuffed and wanting more.The beef medallions at the Tex-Mex restaurant proved to be the best dish at the resort, second to the fajitas!! For lunch the chicken sandwich was so good I had it every day!The 24hour bar and snack bar were also very good, the lunch menu and 24 snacks where always very tasty and there was plenty of variety to choose from. You would have to be super super picky not to find something you liked.The staff was super nice, mostly the Activity Team, which always kept us laughing, smiling and with plenty of things to participate in. Sexy Spaghetti, Mr Mike and Jacqueline definitely go out of their way to make you feel at home and also ensure you are having a good time,,the best entertainment staff in all the resorts i have ever been too, and i have been to many.The only thing was that the beach was not the greatest, but this was due to alot of seaweed being washed ashore the first few days but the last 2 days the water was beautiful.All in all I Highly recommend this resort to anyone... all ages. I will definitely being going back to this place the next time we plan our vacation.SR,MC, JR, JG ~ from 4 very happy travelers!  
<Date>May 2, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A True Review First off let me say that I am very well travelled, I have been to Alcapulco twice, Cozumel, Mayan Riviera, Panama (central America not Florida), Greece, Italy, and now Punta Cana. I am 26 years old female and my fiancee and I decided to go to the Punta Cana Grand along with another couple from April 21 to 28th. I'll start off with the positives,The weather was awesome, not a drop of rain until night time and even then only lasted a few minutes. The resort itself is very pleasing to the eye and kept relatively clean. The beach and ocean are beautiful and you can walk quite a ways down for even clearer water. Our maid was great and the room we had was very nice and we had a huge balcony.Ok now onto the negatives.....We chose Sunwing (canada) for the first time, the only good thing I found about this was the movies in the plane and then constant T.V. shows afterward to pass the time away. We had our rep Luis at the resort who was NEVER AROUND even though he claimed his only day off was Thursday!!! So we could never book any excursions through him as he mentioned at the orientation. The FOOD was horrible, I am not a picky eater in the least and the second day of vacation i ended up being rushed by ambulance to the hospital for 2 days. They said it was a tropical virus but the hospital was jammed full of canadian/americans with the same problem as I. Later that week after finally being able to leave my room I spoke to others at the resort and every single person had been sick as well for at least 1 day. Out of all the places I have been (even Mexico) I have never been sick ever or have seen so many people from one resort get sick!!!The ACTIVITIES suck, my fiancee is not like me, he is not content to sit around on the beach all day, he likes to play volleyball/soccer any sort of game outside to keep him occupied, there are beach volleyball nets and a soccer area on the beach but NONE of these were EVER USED!!! As well as a trampoline that never even got flipped over to use. Finally on our second to last day, my fiancee took it upon himself to go on the microphone and organize his own games!!! And everyone responded and were so happy to see some sort of activity. He did it on the last day too and everyone was sad to see him go because now who is going to get the games together???The couple we were with, thank goodness we had adjoining ROOMS, because for the whole trip their toilet DIDN'T FLUSH!! It wasn't clogged, it was just not working. After calling numerous times FOR DAYS no one came to fix it!! They used ours the whole time...but what would of they done if we weren't with them?? WHo ever checks into the room next will unfortunately have a nasty surprise...SORRY!! Their key also after 2 days didn't work to get them into their room...after taking it down to reprogramme it they were told there is nothing we can do....and to go through our room to get theirs...WHICH IS WHAT THEY DID THE WHOLE VACATION!! After being sick i wasn't allowed to have any meat or anything like that just toast...and they wouldn't accomodate me they kept bringing my hamburgers and fries saying just pick off the meat and eat the bun!!!! Isn't toast easier to make?? The last thing i wanted to see when sick was a hamburger!! My fiancee finally flipped out downstairs and they brought me toast...once! Upon checking out, they tried to charge us for phonecalls that were never made! We bought an internet card....and the funny part is i was in the hospital when the phonecalls were made!!!! haha must of been a ghost. One lady on our bus with her 2 boys said she had been travelling to Punta Cana for 10 years and her husband was so upset over this resort he left 2 days early!! She would never be back either.The nightlife is what you make of it...the disco was fun and the DJ will play anything you request...the kareoke was fun...and the beach party was nothing to write home about, they will tell you it's all night but it's over by 9:30pm. The waitstaff are polite and funny if you take the time to get to know them and are polite to them...no need for rudeness they work 15 hours a day for 25 days a month!!! So please have patience. The drinks were yummy...even though I wasn't allowed to drink after getting ill...the one day i had them they were good. There is much more I can say...but I'll leave that to my friends the other couple we were with.......please if you want good food...a fun time...and not to get ill don't go here!!!!All in all...I definitely WON'T BE BACK TO THE PUNTA CANA GRAND!!! Too bad I couldn't have seen it when it was Sunscape..now another company Globalia owns it..and the stuff you see in the pics are not there!! Friends of mine stayed at the Bahia Principe Punta Cana at the same time and loved it!!! I will not be back to Punta Cana for a long time....but if I decided to go...I would spend an extra few hundred bucks for a 5 star resort...like the Bahia!! I never complain ever!!! I n fact before going on this vacation I made fun of all the people with their little complaints saying they were high maitenence....but now I understand.....it's not one little thing it's all the little things every single day that add up to a major thing by the end of the vacation!!!!! Well at least if nothing else....I have a great tan to show for it!!  
<Date>May 1, 2006

<Author>DeeOntario_Canada
<Content>Loved Punta Cana Grand My wife and I just returned from a week's stay at the Punta Cana Grand hotel. It was great! In reading some of the negative reviews of this place, I find it hard to believe those people are talking about the same resort. We have been to five other hotels in the Dominican Republic, a couple in Cuba, and one each in Mexico and Barbados. Punta Cana Grand was the nicest by far. The staff are quiet but friendly and our room overlooking the ocean was to die for. A big four poster bed and no need to use the air conditioning with a lovely soothing breeze blowing through the patio doors. Fantastic food was offered in 3 a la carte restaurants and a wonderfully varied buffet. The beach barbecue offered yummy burgers and some days a huge paella. Emi kept our coffee cups full in the morning and Antonio kept our wine glasses full in the evenings. There are three lovely pools but our favorite spot was the beach where a steady sea breeze kept the temperature just right for Canadians. The water sports were a lot of fun and you can walk forever up a powdery beach with turquoise water.There is a small market for crafts and souvenirs but the vendors are not pushy at all. I even learned to dance a little meringue, salsa and bachata which isn't bad for a gringo with no hip action. The price was quite reasonable and we highly recommend Punta Cana Grand.  
<Date>Apr 26, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Punta Cana Grand -- loved it!!! I don't understand the negative reviews of this hotel. I travel quite a bit, and the staff at the Punta Cana Grand was the friendliest of ANY property I have stayed in the Caribbean. They were wonderful and continually went out of their way to please us. All I can say is when we visited, there were MANY guests (I won't say from where but they were NOT from the US or Canada) who were extremely rude to the staff. If you treat the staff like that...how on earth do you expect to be treated in return?? We had EXCELLENT service he people were always helpful.Our room was beautiful (we stayed in building 7 -- the newest one) and the maids did an impeccable job. We didn even tip until the end and they took excellent care of us. The bartenders were great, and the staff at the Italian restaurant was wonderful.The beach was nice and clean, the pools were extremely well-maintained and the food quite good for an all inclusive. Excellent value!!!!Sonya at the dive shop sold me on my first dive and I absolutely loved it. The dance instructors were friendly and funny.Absolutely no complaints. If you can't have an enjoyable vacation at the Punta Cana Grand...it's your own fault.

<Author>cessarra
<Content>relaxing and friendly we went to the punta cana grand for our anniversary. it was very romantic and friendly and beautiful. we will definitely be going back! the food was great, the drinks are top shelf and plentiful, the resort was clean and the staff was sooo friendly and helpful. there was a stocked mini-bar in our room with sodas and local beer--included in the price--bonus! the a/c in our room was not working to capacity, and we reported it, but never had any resolution. beware of the guys at the beach shops--they are like vultures once u visit them, and they will try to befriend u and ask u to bring them food and drinks from the resort. we took a trip in to the town of Higuey--we hired a local guy to drive us and show us around--definitely a good look in to the culture of urban dominica. there was a great mix of ppl at the resort--ppl from europe, us and canada, and all ages young and old. enjoy!

<Author>Cindy18
<Content>You will be dissappointed...don't ruin your vacation by staying at this hotel. My boyfriend and I have been down south several times for the last couple of yrs and as always we did our research about this particular hotel....and we were both kicking ourself as soon as we got to Punta Cana Grand (formerly known as Globalia Sunscape).It started with a very arrogant Orisis front desk rep at check in and it went down hill from there. Only few staff could speak English and actually had a smile. We booked a deluxe room with ocean view - and yes we got a room with a view of a wall..fantastic!!!Service and Food at 24 hrs snack bar were terrible. We waited for about 45 mins to actually get our order in and had to leave empty stomach because food was so horrible. Buffe at Window restaurant was alright some days but a most of the week we stuck with bread and fruits. We had to rush out one morning to catch a bus to the Saona tour and forgot to leave tips for the maid - we came back and our room was half cleaned. We didn't have any kneenex and my boyfriend called down the lobby - of course noone answered. So we went down to the front desk and ask for a box of kneenex. Their response was: can we get it for you tomorrow? And we still haven't got our kneenex deliver to our room as promised. Oh well...there isn't much to expect from this hotel. Not only it's a small hotel, service and food were terrible, they also got very arrogant and rude employees. Be careful with the guys at front desk because they quote prices for safety deposit box and late checkout fees as much as they like. We asked 3 different guys about late checkout charge and they all told us different prices. Things kept getting better in the week...Hotel didn't have any hot/warm water for a couple of days - yes no shower a day or two. We asked front desk and they said : it should be fixed today - dominican time. That's means just wait because we take our sweet time.Overall, we are extremely dissappointed with this hotel and perhaps would never return to Punta Cana.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>value priced vacation Ola;We have been to Cuba the last 4 years in a row since getting married, my wife wanted to try something different.The beach is nice but as others said get there early if you want a decent spot to sit. The beach to the left of the resort, past the vendors, is even nicer.The hotel and grounds are well kept. Even though our room was clean, the decor was weathered. The bathroom and furnishings felt like I had rented a 200.00 cottage in Northern Ontario.Being a picky eater, i found the food to be good.We toured during the day and hung out at the adult pool in the late afternoon, we found the most normal people there and the servize great.Two Gripes: Too many rude french canadians. I was one of the few guys on the beach without a speedo. Pushy Dominican vendors/tour guys on the beach.We heard Punta Cana was The Place to Go, I wouldn't go back. On a budget sure..but we would spend more to go elseware.

<Author>drdrbr
<Content>It was gross! My family, 2 adults and 2 kids, stayed 3 nights of our 8 nights in Punta Cana at Puna Cana Grand. We stayed the first 5 nights at Sunscape the Beach, and we realized we made a mistake coming to the Grand upon driving through the entrance. The only reason we stayed at the Grand was because we met some friends there who were too cheap to pay for Sunscape. Anyway, just to let you know, we all think Punta Cana Grand was a dump--even my 3 year old wanted to go back to the other hotel! The main problem is the rooms. They are old, smell musty and have had no updates in FOREVER! I was afraid to walk barefoot and would not think of touching the bedcovers because they had stains and holes. The food was so-so tasting but both my husband and 3 year old had diarrhea and vomiting the 2nd day. The pool's okay, the beach is so-so. We stayed in building 1, so maybe some of the other buildings are newer--i'm not sure. But I am sure that I was ready to GO HOME when the time came. We will never return. P.S. My husband is a Dominican living in the U.S., so we are VERY well traveled in the Carribean and are not snobs nor do we not know how to have fun, as some people may say to try to make this place sound better.

<Author>sunnin&sippin
<Content>Average with some disappointments!!!! Stayed at Punta Cana Grant from April 2 to 9th. We really enjoyed our week but there were a couple of things that i was disappointed in. I didnt feel the animation team or staff were as friendly as other resorts in Punta Cana we have stayed at. They were totally different from our experience at two other resorts. Not friendly at all except for bartender called BeachPappi.....He was a riot. The entertainment (except for Michael Jackson show) was not as good either. I also found the swimming at beach not as nice as up the coast at Bavaro Beach. The food was good (better than both other resorts) and the rooms were really nice (third floor with high ceilings). Water pressure extremely poor and no hot water, but it is a beautiful place to spend a week. The palm trees were to die for. Could use more palpalas on beach for shade. Flew with Sunwing and were delayed both ways.....Kind of tiresome.

<Author>turbox99
<Content>Great vacation at the Punta Cana Grand Punta Cana Grand April 9th to the 16thMy boyfriend and I had an awesome experience at Punta Cana Grand. The service was excellent, the facility was immaculate and the grounds were beautiful. The atmosphere was relaxing, and this even extended to the staff who at the same time maintained organization and grace as they served (we really liked their tasteful uniforms at the  la cartes). The different drinks were spectacular (and strong) and we suggest you do as we did and bring an insulated cup to keep them cool. The pool was large and clean and the swim up bar was a neat treat. The adult pool however was less impressive, we would have liked it if the hot tub was a few degrees hotter than the pool! Nonetheless we liked the idea of an adult only bar and we appreciated the thought.There was a pond designated to some beautiful flamingos that were left to frolic freely. You could get your picture taken with a couple of toucans, an iguana or by yourself with a lay, so that was neat. The pictures are then posted in a glass bulletin board by the indows?restaurant, and you can choose which ones to purchase (7 dollars each, and they are of great quality).The food was excellent and we were impressed with the selection of restaurants and the selection of food within each one. There were 4 restaurants in total: Windows (buffet style, open for every meal), Da Marios ( la carte, open for supper only), The Beach Club (restaurant overlooking the beach, open every meal) or Tex Mex American Grill ( la carte, open for supper only). We liked the seafood and the steak (especially at Tex Mex). Breakfast, lunch and the dessert table at Windows provided a delicious spread of both North American and traditional food. Good eating was one of the most enjoyable aspects of this resortust watch the milk- it really watery looking and just doesn taste right. We loved how the buildings (like the lobby) were all open without doors. Our room was pleasing and roomy for two, with 2 queen-sized beds, a dresser and armoire that housed the TV and mini fridge (with beer, pop and water). There is a phone in the room and an optional safebox (costs 15 dollars when you check out). We were on the bottom floor of building 4 and we had a small ground balcony. We never experienced any issue with lack of hot water. Our room was well air conditioned and we were about a 30 second walk from the beach.The two night clubs, Sneakers and the Cigar bar, were cozy but the dcor and atmosphere seemed a bit fake and americanized. We also got the same feel for the nightly entertainment (especially the Michael Jackson show) though there still a lot of talent to behold and it still worth attending.  The beach was where we spent the most of our time. It was beautiful white sand and not too much seaweed (our resort was crazy about raking up the seaweed in the early morning, and u could definitely notice the difference when compared to the neighboring resorts). The water is clear blue and relatively warm (though my boyfriend says it warmer in Cuba). We had fun snorkeling and kayaking, but most of all we sunbathed. Getting a hut for shade after 7h30 am is an impossible task so get out there early and lay your towel down on a corresponding lounge chair. Don fret if you can get one though, the palm trees provide adequate shade if needed. The beach has a topless option so beware. We were also a little freaked out by a couple of old men in thongs- yikes! lolThere are people advertising for tours and water sports that will approach you while youe lying on the beach, so if youe not interested, have a good story ready. You can also get harassed while walking down the beach by the vendors of the souvenir markets. They are however friendly and will insist on shaking your hand so you will stop to talk. You must negotiate prices since they start with an astronomical cost. For example, I got a set of wooden dominoes that started at $65 for $18. We paid around $7 for a quart of Brugal rum, $4-5 for earrings, $4 for a small package of coffee, $7 dollars for t-shirts. All in all we really loved this experience and we would definitely visit again.  
<Date>Apr 21, 2006
<Rating>5	5	4	-1	5	-1	4	-1

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good all-round vacation General Comments************************************My wife and I are regular caribbean travellers, and generally fairly easy to please. However, in some ways we were pleasantly surprised by this resort. Entertainment was so-so, and the rooms weren't great, but face it; if the room is clean (and they were), who cares about the room? You're in the Caribbean to be outside and enjoy the beach and the weather.We were there with Sunwing, and I have to say that the Sunwing reps were good; service was good (we flew out of Halifax), and the Sunwing rep in DR was at the hotel every day. We didn't run into any problems, but I definitely got the feeling that they were ready to help.Food************************************I thought the food was good. I definitely preferred Da Marios, and we ate there 4 times in our 7 days there. The buffet (Windows) had theme nights, and several times we ate dinner at the buffet. They put on a lot of effort, and the Mexican Night at the buffet beat the Tex-Mex grill hands down.The Tex-Mex was so-so. People have different likes and dislikes, but as a fan of mexican food I wasn't impressed with the offerings. Oddly, there was no guacamole the night we were there, although there was lots of it at the buffet Mexican night a couple of evenings later.The Beach Cafe was standard convenience food, pizzas, sandwiches, hamburgers and the like. They usually set up some kind of bbq next to the cafe for lunch, and sometimes they had pasta, rice, etc. I didn't really try it, but friends who did said it was good.Breakfasts were good, lots of variety, and (for those who like it) the standard north american breakfast fare. Good selection of fruit.I've beein in Cuba three times, and the food definitely beat Cuba. Probably not as good as I've had in Mexico, but close.Rooms************************************The rooms were clean, but a little dated. I think you have to be careful with the patio doors, since they don't seem to close very well, but that would be more of an issue on the ground floor. Service was good, and we left a little something for the maid every day. I noticed that the maids used to come in the evening and turn down the beds, which was nice. Lots of towels, and the room bar was stocked every day. I noticed that as the week went on, the maid was leaving more and more beer in the fridge!A/C is a little weak, but once I figured out that your patio door needs to be firmly closed in order for it to work, no problems.We used the room safe (a $15 charge), but had no problems with other things left around the room (watches, cameras, etc).We saw the rooms in building 7 (the new buliding), and they are very nice, jacuzzis, nice walk-in showers, larger, etc. Friends we met moved over there at extra cost. Someone mentioned that you could pay abou $100 pp and stay there, and depending on how important the room is to you it might be worth it. We considered moving once we saw them, but ended up staying where we were.Beaches************************************The beaches were nice. As other people have mentioned, there is a lot of seaweed around; staff at the hotel told us that this was unusual, and is probably a reflection of the hurricanes and windstorms that have happened this year. I was usually down on the beach at 6 or 7 am, and could see the teams of workers who raked up the seaweed and hauled it away every morning (and during the day). Not much they can do about Mother Nature, but they definitely worked at it.No bar service on the beach. Closest is the beach cafe, just up from the beach. Good service.Lots of kayaks, windsurfers, sailboats etc on the beach. We were told that you had to do a $25 course in order to be allowed to take the catamarans out, but the guys at the aquatic centre just asked me if I knew how to sail, and let me take the Hobies out without any course. I noticed several people who didn't seem to have a clue about sailing (including one guy who kept trying to point the boat directly into the wind to get off the beach), but they seemed to graciously get those people back on shore and out of the boat. Only allowed one time a day, but several times other people booked boats and I went out with them since they didn't know how to sail. The Hobies are in good condition, and usually a good breeze. One day they took the boats off the water because it was too windy, but they usually let people go even in a stiff breeze. I gave a tip here and there, and although the service was good anyway, they definitely seemed to remember me a little more after a tip or two.Some snorkelling right off the beach, and I could usually see a few fish by the rock outcrops out along the ropes. I was a bit nervous about going farther out, since the powerboats sometimes come in close to the roped-in area, but I noticed several people did venture out further.Pools************************************Three pools; the main pool, an adult pool, and another pool over by building 7. We didn't really spend much time at the pools, with the exception of one afternoon at the main pool. Usually a bunch of drinkers around the swim-up bar, who seemed to get louder and more obnoxious as the afternoon wore on. Pools are very clean and well-maintained.Entertainment************************************The entertainment was hit and miss. Due to weather we didn't have the weekly beach party, so they seemed to put something together on the fly. Several of the shows were a little racy, and I noticed some parents taking their kids out at some of the shows. The Michael Jackson show was very entertaining.Not bad, but I've seen better, although perhaps at larger resorts. This was the tail end of the season, and things might have been winding down.Excursions************************************Didn't do any. Friends we met were trying to go on the catamaran trip, but after being cancelled three days in a row they gave up. They said it was cancelled due to weather, but I think it was numbers. Would have gone on the snorkelling trip, but the water was kind of churned up while we were there so decided not to.Service************************************Service was generally good. I tipped (usually $1) and the servers appreciated it, but service was pretty good regardless. Some of the bars get very busy, especially the theater bar during a show, but they are pretty efficient.Drinks are good, and they will try and mix anything you like. If you ask for it they usually have premium liquor at most of the bars, especially the poolside bar. My wife isn't a fan of the local vodka, so I used to ask for the good vodka when ordering a drink for her, but once the guys got to know me they used to do it automatically. No extra charge, but I used to tip a little bit to whoever was pouring the drinks. I drank the local liquors and found them to be fine. Drinks are a little strong sometimes, but they will tone them down if you ask.Overall************************************We liked the place. I would go again. If anyone has any specific questions, feel free to email me.  
<Date>Apr 20, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best service ever My wife and I travel very often and had the pleasure of staying at the Punta Cana Grand. The sevice at this resort was the best we have received in many years.Although we did encounter a few minor problems they were soon over come by the condition and service.The first problem was a very slow check-in about 1 hour. The only other issue was that we had to get our room moved due to the construction noise, they are doing some new buildings not far from the lobby.As I said previously the service was great, windows( the buffett restaurant) the food was fantastic, say Hi to Pedro the best waiter I have ever seen, he could not speak very much english but had the universal language a great smile. The beach restaurant was a little slow but not too bad.The resort was beautiful and very well kept. The beach was great.My wife and I are in the Hotel industry and are usually very picky, But there were not many things to be picky about. If you decide on going there I don't think you will have any complaints.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fabulous Vacation My husband and I just came back from a week at Punta Cana Grand (April 9-16, 2006).We departed from Halifax and our flight was delayed by 3-hours (not a good start - we were scheduled to leave at 7:15 pm and didn't leave until 10:15 which meant it was 3:30 a.m. (4:30 our time) before we got to our room). Check-in at the hotel was fast and smooth. Our room was in Building 4 on the third floor, king size bed, nice room. Only complaint about the room was we had no hot water on a couple of occasions which I wasn't impressed with; but overall very pleased with the room.Property - this is a nice property, it is kept very clean and their staff are always working to make the place clean. The grounds are so green with lots of flowers. You'll even see live flamingo's in the pond. The lighting in the public washrooms is dim, but otherwise there is always a maid tidying up.Beach - the beach is beautiful and you can always find a lounger.... sometimes it was 10/10:30 before we got to the beach and had no problems finding a lounger, but if you want a hut, you have to get out earlier. We always took plenty of walks on the beach, lots of beachfront and you can walk a long ways. Though you should be aware when you leave the secure area, as there will be no security pass those lines.Food - we always found something we liked with lots of variety. There are 3 a-la-carte restaurants, beach BBQ daily and a buffet. One day they had seafood jambalaya at the beach BBQ and it was delicious. The steak medallion at the American Grill was amazing.We have been to a few resorts and this is one that we would definitely recommend.One thing people got to remember that you are in a third-world country and if you go with an open mind and not expect to much, then you should have a great time.  
<Date>Apr 20, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Only OK I used this site to read reviews on the Punta Cana Grand so felt I should add my own two cents.Bottom line: if your main reason for going to DR is to enjoy some beach time, this resort is fine. However, if you're looking for good food and nice accomodations, this resort is probably not for you.Pros: 1) excellent beach - and the seaweed wasn't bad! 2) nice adult pool with afternoon shade 3) beautiful grounds - well landscaped. 4) friendly maid serviceCons: 1) rooms smelled damp/musty, ants in the bathroom. low water pressure, only warm water 2) noisy - forget an afternoon nap unless you were in building 7 - lots of construction. 3) unfriendly staff (except maids) - the tall thin girl who worked in the giftshop was perhaps the rudest person I have ever met!!! (and i'm pretty easy going) 4) food was only ok - not much variety and service was terrible - took over an hour one night to get a menu in the beach hut. 5) dull night life. shows were ok, but the disco and piano bar didn't liven up until quite late.I wouldn't recommend this resort to anyone, although I would return to Punta Cana.  
<Date>Apr 19, 2006
<Rating>2	2	2	-1	2	-1	1	-1	
<Aspects>
27	2(night):1	4(nice):1	15(recommend):1	22(pool):1	38(lot):1	39(return):1	45(beautiful):1	57(water):2	72(resort):1	135(build):1	217(noisy):1	236(warm):1	285(ground):1	287(cana):1	289(punta):1	364(afternoon):2	397(forget):1	405(unless):1	426(life):1	513(low):1	556(adult):1	583(construction):1	686(pressure):1	795(shade):1	1496(landscape):1	2092(nap):1	2689(dull):1

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good for the price, but go to Cuba or Mexico instead for much better service My boyfriend and I just returned from a 7 day holiday at Punta Cana Grand. I have found this site to be very helpful and as such have decided to post my experience as well. Here it is:**Food: Average. About two years ago we stayed at Grand Flamenco in Punta Cana and if you want to visit Punta Cana I definately recommend this one as the food was amazing there..**Service: Below average. I found staff to be very disconected from the people and they often took too long to clear the tables and to take your order. Even when they were serving you, I found that they would engage in conversations with other employees which often made us feel neglected. I am only saying this because I have been both in Cuba and MExico and I have never experienced anything like this before. **Beach: Very nice however the water was full of sea weed. I am not a picky person at all and one of the main reasons that I go down south is for the beach. I found water too dirty. However there is shade and the sand is white which was beautiful..Please note that you have to wake up at 5:30am to get shade...**Pool: Nice, however I do not go to an exotic country to swim in the pool, therefore I cannot comment on this one..**Entertainemnt: Average. Compared to Cuba and Mexico, I found very difficult to understand Dominicans. They spoke in Spanish most of the time. The entertainment is pretty much standard at all these resorts and the shows are almost the same. **Rooms: They smelled and they had aunts. We also did not have water pressure nor hot water for few days.Personally it is well worth adding another $100 and going to Mexico or to Cuba (4* and up). I have been to Cuba 7 times and even thought some resorts were better than the others, service was excellent each time and the beaches are beautiful. Overall for the amount we paid it was expected what we got and at the end we still had a great time. I do not mean to be so negative but I think it is important that people know what to expect. Good luck !!  
<Date>Apr 17, 2006

<Author>alan_b1
<Content>Excellent value but..... Do not expect luxury, there were many excellent aspects to our 12 day stay; food, bar service, entertainment, the Jurassic Safari is a must {Monchie and Damian are a brilliant double act} and the cleaners and bell boys were brilliant and deserving of a generous tip.Front desk were unhelpful, made excuses to the extent of deliberately lying and completely failed to take any responsibility regarding any problems; Block 5 had no hot water, assured it was a one day thing on each of the first three days, assured that someone would be along in 30 minutes or so...yeah right! Had other little problems with the room but after 8 visits to front desk everything was resolved. Beach had lots of seaweed on the shore and in the shallows, but nearby Bavaro beach was absolutely stunning but not really within walking distance.The brochures do not mention the ongoing building work but the progress made during our stay would suggest the workmen could build a completely new hotel in just a few weeks, the noise was not a problem but the spa and casino were certainly not finished.....Overall excellent value, but we felt a few hundred dollars more would get you a much more luxurious stay.  
<Date>Apr 16, 2006

<Content>Best Week Of My Life It was a wonderful vaction mostly cause i didnt have to do ANYTHING! I went with my family (mom and sister). We stayed in room #3311 and it was very nice! The only thing wrong with it was that in the shower there was hardly any water presure and the water was cold. Another one called Windows also open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and then there are two only open for dinner an Italien and an American Grill. All very good! We went on one of the trips and I highly recomend it! We went out and saw the contrey side and see how they live. WOW very different it makes you really think!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Family Vacation Our family has just returned from a week in Punta Cana and we loved every minute except the Punta Cana Airport( or a few huts with planes).The Punta Cana Grand was about a 20 minute drive from the airport.Once we arrive we had a drink served to us within a few minutes at the reception desk.Check-in was friendly and prompt and we were in our rooms within 15 minutes of arrival.The rooms,which were adjoining for our teenage daughters were quite spacious with balconies with a view of the ocean.The resort was clean with friendly staff.The restaurants offered a variety of food from buffet to fine dining ala carte.(Say hi to Victor in the Italian fine dining.)We had to get up every morning at 6:30 to save some lounge chairs by the pool for some shade.There were lots of lounge chairs, but not many under shade.It is worth getting up to save some.Everyday the poolside staff had games to play or dances to learn and there was always something to do at the pool or by the beach.The beach was beautiful with a market right on it(Say hi to Simon and bring him a beer and you will get a great deal.)If you get a chance go into the Bavaro Market.It is 20 minutes by taxi which is arranged right at the resort.You get a chance to see some of the countryside and the local vegatation such as banana trees.You will get some good deals in the market if you barter well and walk away from them if they won't. There is always someone who will.It was everything we wanted for a family holiday and more.There are lots of tours to go on if you want , or there is lots to do if you stay on the resort.We felt very safe letting our teenage daughters move about the resort on their own.We would and have recommended the Grand to anyone.We would definately go back.  
<Date>Apr 14, 2006

We were in building 3 and the construction never botherd us at all. The only downside is the people who put their towels on chairs at 6 in the morning and you never see them use the chairs.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Above average (with some problems) April 2006We recently visited the Punta Cana Grand Resort (April 1 ?April 8, 2006), this was our first trip to the DR but not our first trip down south. I will tell you a little about the flight, resort, atmosphere, staff, food and entertainment.Flight (Pearson Airport): We traveled with (Nolitours) Air Transit, may I just say something to the passenger of flight TS560 who missed his flight and to the rest of us who waited. Thank you dear sir who left the rest of the passengers on that flight waiting and delaying our vacation by  hr. May I suggest for the next person who decides to do the same thing to let the flight attendant know you will not be coming on board so that people will not be looking for you. Other then that the flight was pretty good, seats were a little to small even for someone like me who is 5? and med built. I personally do not understand how my poor husband sat there not complaining for 3.5 hrs he is 6? The meal on the flight was a sub 6?sandwich veggie or turkey and a cookie. Check-in: The check-in was very comfortable and was a breeze; we arrived at the resort at the resort just before 10pm which was great. Building: We stayed in building 5 third floor which had a beautiful view of the adult pool and the beach. We were pleased with the overall look in the room it had 12?ceilings full body mirror in the bathroom. However, the first night there was NO HOT WATER, so we complained and the problem was fixed for the rest of the week. Just a quick note about the buildings, you might know from reading the other reviews that they are expanding their resort by adding a casino and a spa, these people work from morning to night pass 10pm. So if you are in building 4, 5, 6,  7 you are far enough from the construction that you will not here the construction. Buildings 1  3 are right beside the construction so good luck sleeping there. Also building 7 is the up dating building, it cost $60 or $70 extra a night it also has a Jacuzzi in the middle of the room, however you should note that the room may have a Jacuzzi but it doesn have a clock and some people who we met that stayed in that room didn know what time it was, which can be a good or bad thing. You can bring your alarm from home because they use 110 volts just like in Canada and/or the USA. Hotel Service: The people here are very friendly, and happy to help you, however I asked for a wake-up call the first morning, and I am still waiting on that call. Also if you have fare skin and burn easily and require shade, I suggest you get up between 6-6:45a if you want to get a good bed, and canopy, or else you will be left out in the sun. This is a good tip if you are going to the beach or pool area. We also found that the workers spoke pretty good English, and kind of laughed at you when trying to speak Spanish. Restaurants: Windows: Is their main restaurant where they serve breakfast, lunch  dinner. The food there was edible, I am a very picky eater and I could always find something to eat. DaMarios: is their Italian restaurant which says on their door that they are open for dinner at 6:30p however, if you arrive their pass 6:05pm you will not be able to get a table. I suggest you go here at least once good, food great atmosphere. This is also the only restaurant where men are required to wear pants. (i.e. Jeans are ok).The American Grill: This one my husband and I disagreed on. My husband loved it, he had the stake and according to him it was really good. (I just think he was really hungry). I had the chicken fajita and didn like it at all. Thank g-d they gave chips with salsa when you arrived or I would have been hungry. However, the atmosphere was terrific, expect for the people sitting next to us who were smoking like a chimney. The Beach: This was great the atmosphere was terrific, the food was great; however the service here was very, very slow. However, you are on holidays relax, enjoy the great view you are in no rush to get anywhere.BBQ Stand: The BBQ stand was quite good; we had it almost everyday for lunch. The Beach Party: This was probably one of the best nights; the trouble these people go through for that one night is unbelievable; I can believe they do that every single week. The food and atmosphere were incredible. Beach: The beach was nice, however, there was lot of see weed, which both my husband and I didn like. However, I was told that apparently this is the season for see weed in DR. There is also a private beach which is to the left of the resort about 5-10 walk, where there is a beautiful white sandy beach with the bluest water I have ever seen. One thing you should note that when you go to this private beach you should not bring anything with you or if you do keep an eye on it. Pool: We stayed mainly at the beach, but around 3:30 -4p it usually got cold for me so I moved to the pool area. There are 3 pools and we only went to 2 of them. The main pool area had lots of kids, and people drinking, playing volley ball, and working out in the pool; we went there twice for about  hr. However, we usually stayed at the Adult pool which had a Jacuzzi which was the same temperature as the pool, and it was usually laid back. It also had a bar, with the guy walking up to the pool and bringing you drinks, try the Banana Mama it really good. The adult pool is behind building 5. Entertainment: The entertainment staff really does work hard they work from morning to night. The shows are all right, I hear that the Michael Jackson show is the best; this show is Saturday night, so unfortunately we missed it. The other shows were all right, the Tropical show was also good, and the audience participation shows were a hoot. Check-out: If you have a late check out like we did, you can go to the front desk the night before around 9pm (not earlier) to find out if you can keep your room and get a late check out. This will cost an extra $25-$40 depending what time your departure is. However, you can also get a complimentary room for  hr only this is for free. We did this because they had our room assigned to someone else for 3pm. They provide you with the towels, and room, you just have to make sure you are out in  hr because someone else will have the room after you. I have to say that I never got ready so fast in my life, and I don think it will ever happen again.Punta Cana Airport Departure: I have never seen so much kayos in my life. Even Cuba was better organized. All I have to say is Thank G-D we were not flying to the states, because the check-in counter were going through all of their luggage per person. Back to us for a sec, we got to the airport just after 7p, and our flight was at 9:40p. It took us until 8:45 to go get our flight tickets, and go through customs. This left us with 20 minutes before they started boarding the plane.Would we stay at the Punta Cana Grand again? Absolutely, but not for a while, because we like to travel a lot, and there is so much more of the world to see. Also remember when you are bargaining with the beach venders the price is usually 1/3 of what they are asking for. Shirts you can get for $6-$7 and don be afraid to walk away. Also if you are going to braid your hair bring your own brush, because you don know who used the brush before prior to you and what they have in their hair.  
<Date>Apr 12, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best deal in Punta Cana I just got back from a five-day stay at Punta Cana Grand and I can verify all of the positive comments that were published on this board. I definitely was not expecting all of the perks that came along with this vacation--somehow it seemed to good to be true--but in fact, everything was totally included in the price and worked out as I had hoped.Positives:* Activity staff - a crew of people dedicated solely to making sure you have a good time. They work non-stop from early morning until late at night entertaining all of the people at the hotel with games, exercises, activities, entertainment, and everything else inbetween. They also play great music by the pool all day.* Price - this hotel was in good condition and provided all food, drinks (all the alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks you can ingest!), non-motorized water activities (boating, kayaking, windsurfing), beach, pool (with bar in the pool, too), disco at night, four restaurants to choose from, a piano bar, beach games (shuffle board, bacci, etc), nightly dance performances (really fun!), large screen movies every night as well, and a staff of multi-lingual people to provide you whatever you want during your vacation at an incredibly affordable price.* Beach - well-groomed in front of our hotel (much better than in front of the others down the beach), plenty of chairs, and several umbrellas for shade.* Pool - also great! Only, if you like a deep-end, you won't find one here. The whole pool is about 3-5 ft. deep, probably to protect all the drunk people from drowning.* Good for kids - I didn't have any kids with me, but there were lots of activities specifically for kids all throughout the day and night. The activity staff really made it a point to have fun with them. * Didn't get sick from food - I had heard that some people got sick from the food here. We were careful (didn't brush our teeth with the tap water, didn't eat lettuce, etc.) and we were fine throughout our trip.Food/drink favorites: Banana Monkey (alcoholic drink), chicken fajita from the American cafeNegatives:* Food wasn't good - the food choices, while various, were really not good. Even the pizza was bad. They cooked everything in oil or deep-fried it, even the fish, and this is definitely an area they could improve on. They would have done better to offer more local food fare and more seafood, that was not drowned in oil.* Waitstaff was out to lunch - this is an all-inclusive deal, so obviously you shouldn't be looking for great service, but the waitstaff often moved really slowly to take your order, were sometimes kind of rude, and sometimes messed up the orders they did take. Just don't expect anything grand in this area.* Great for couples or families, not for singles - if you're looking for love here, you're looking in all the wrong places.I would recommend this place and would potentially go again because the value was good. Good weather guaranteed for a good price and a short plane flight.  
<Date>Apr 10, 2006
