<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beautiful Beach...awful food! My husband  I (in our late 30's) just got back, we were there from 4/3 -4/7. We went to the Punta Cana Grand because it was cheap and most of the reviews were favorable. We just wanted to be able to spend some time together, get some sun and RELAX. Mission accomplished, we had a lovely time. I'll just make mention of a few things: The food is AWFUL. No seriously, it's not good. Breakfast was really the only acceptable meal of the day. You can get yogurt, fresh fruit, croissant, boiled egg  there are lots of different kinds of breads. Lunch  Dinner were tough and if it wasn't for the frozen Banana Mama's that filled me up I'd of been really hungry. Don't eat from the grill, the burgers don't look like burgers and aren't cooked through. We were pleased that we were only there for the 5 days because we were really starting to get hungry!Because of the reviews I read here I got alot of helpful hints like: You must get to the beach early to save a hut or else you will not get one. Each morning I went down to the beach at 6:15 and was able to get the same hut. Don't turn in your towels at the end of the day or else you won't have anything to save a chair with. The activity center was opened before 8:00 each morning so I was always able to exchange our towels for fresh ones. I requested a non-smoking room, 3rd floor in bldg 5-7. We got a non-smoking room, 3rd floor in bldg 5. The room was ok, the location was perfect because you're away from the construction which we heard during the day  night when we walked around. I wasn't too concerned about the room because we were only there to shower and sleep. (Oh yeah, don't expect a hot shower you'll only get a warm one with little water pressure). Bldg 5 is close to the beach and the adult pool. We asked for the key to the safe and we got one without paying extra, it was a standard key that probably worked on all of the safes so during the day we carried our passports, camera  ipod with us. Only at night AFTER our room had been cleaned did we leave our stuff in the safe. We didn't bring mugs for our drinks but we sure saw lots of people with the biggest mugs I've ever seen. We left $2.00 each day for our maid. Our fridge was always stocked but since there isn't electricity in your room when you're not there (your room key needs to be in the slot on the wall to get power) the drinks are only cold in the morning, oh well. One more thing: this resort is filled with lots of Canadians so get ready to hear EH morning, noon  night :) Well, we really enjoyed the beach and the perfect weather we had. Don't forget your sunblock because the sun is very hot even though the gentle breeze makes you think you're not getting a sunburn. The resort grounds are well kept and you can always find a nice quiet place for a drink or a morning tea. The people who work at the resort are very friendly and they work very hard. A little hola goes a long way.Good Luck  
<Date>Apr 10, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Relaxing Vacation We booked last minute on-line and were happy with the choice. Only draw back was the fact that we flew into the La Romana airport instead of the Punta Cana. This was a 2.5hrs drive to the hotel instead of the .5hrs drive that was advertised. The other draw back to the drive was that we were in a van with a total of nine people plus luggage. Which would not have been too bad except we had two gentlemen that were very drunk and very obnoxious. It made me ashamed to be a Canadian. Our trip was bookended by these two individuals... had to be in the van with them to the hotel and on the return trip to the airport. We have been to the Dominican before and found ourselves better prepared to evaluate our vacation. We liked the food, the American Grill has great Fajitias and Windows has plenty of variety (great desserts). The rooms were nice and we had a view of the beach. Weather was ok... rained at 3pm every day but at least it was warm and we didn't have to shovel. Santa Domingo was Fabulous... If you like history and meeting the people of the island. Great Hotel to relax in, there are many places to go and read, relax and plain get away from the stress of work back home. Like the Adult pool and beach chairs (get one early). All and all it was a good vacation, I would recommend this resort to anyone on a budget but look where your flight arrives. Make sure you fly in to the Punta Cana airport!  
<Date>Apr 9, 2006

<Author>2weeksnextyear
<Content>OOOOOOLA! Ughhh..I'm so depressed. Back to reality...Just returned from the Grande and let me tell you, it was an amazing vacation! I went with 5 of my best girlfriends ( all in our 30's and 40's )and we had a wonderful time. The resort is awesome. Our room was perfect, third floor, bldg. 3. The view of the flamingo's, pool and bar was awesome! No complaints here, the food was great, the drinks plentiful and the staff was fabulous. The waiters and bartenders went out of their way to make us feel welcome and special. The beach is gorgeous, what up with all the seaweed talk? They work hard to keep it pristine, and if yer from Nova Scotia, just wade thru it Ladies! LOLThe staff work constantly, trying to make your vacation perfect. Everyone is very, very friendly. Remember, it IS Dominican time, have a drink, relax, it will all get done. The Michael Jackson show was wicked good, really these guys could be in Vegas! Don't miss it. Book your horseback riding tour thru Andrei on the beach ( in the red shirt )with the Dominican Ranch, just an awesome experience of the real culture. Visit Simon in the flea market on the beach, first hut you come to, a very interesting person that can give you Canadian's a great deal!. Certainly visit the Italian restaurant and enjoy the experience. It's delicious food and wonderful service. It's all in what you make it, People. The disco is small but rocking and they play a nice mix of hip-hop/dance and local music. Ladies....make sure you try a merenge with a staff member that can show you how. It's hot, hot, hot and I felt like I needed a cigarette afterwards! Thanks Felix, I'll never forget that dance! LOLSo, all in all, my vacation was just what I wanted it to be...good friends, good spot and good fun. This resort is wonderful, go and relax and enjoy! Please, feel free to email me ( Michelle ) for any info you might need. PS...Mike from Barry..I owe you 5 bucks, Buddy..can't believe you were still standing at 11:00!  
<Date>Apr 4, 2006

<Content>OK Just got back yesterday.I want to stress to all of you this is not owned by sunscape anymore, although it is in all the books. We paid for an upgrade to delux only to find out that we never got it. There is not such thing as a standard room anymore. Since Globalia has bought this company they made the delux room the standered room. I'm now caught between my travel agent and signature to get maoney back. As far as I'm concered if that is what is advertise that is what I should hgave recieved. I never found this under anything but sunscape on all the web sights, so be very careful with this. You also do not want to be anywhere near the fist half of units23 as there is plenty of construcxtion going on. That also was something I found out on my own from my sister who was there the week befor. My travel agent looked into it and said there was none. So another disaagreement between agaent and signature.This hotel is not a 4.5 star. More like a 3.5 or 4.can't decide.The food was great.Weather not so great. 4 days of rain on and off last day all day and cold.They can't help that though.What ever you do, do not buy anything from anyone other than your vacation rep.We bought from someone from the pool area and when Pedro called us (Signature vacations) to see if we were still going he told us they could not ensure that nothing would happen were as if we went with them would be. They said not to worry they would get them to refun our money next day and they would rebook with thiers. Didn't happen. I spent most of my vacation waiting up stairs to get my money back on our visa. Finally got it on the 4th. day. Way to much worry about that. Not to mention all the mornings we waited to go on our planned trips to hear that they were cancelled. They called us on the 6th day to say try the mediteranian it never gets canceled. Half Hour later we got a call. So sorry cancelled. My husband and I were very lucky to go on the safari trip. I highly recomend this it was a great way to see the country and the way they live. Our guide Little Willy was great we had a ball.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved it  My stay @ the resort was in Aug 2003, but I  my husband absolutely loved it! We took a day trip away from resort, which was very nice. We also visited the closest casino (not on on site). Comparing this resort to the one with the casino, I would pick this one over  over again. We had an end room with a wonderful view of the beach. There was seaweed on the beach, but only at night  the workers would clean up the beach very early every morning. There are little vendors on the beach daily  the resort also had vendors that came in selling different items. These vendors set up on the sidewalks around the main building. I do not recommend this resort if you don't like children. There are alot of families that stay here  there are alot of European guests also so you are constantly hearing other languages. Quite nice.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beautiful Hotel...Had a Blast The Punta Cana Grand is beautiful, nicer than I expected. The landscaping is immaculate and they are always cleaning and fixing things up on the grounds. They really do care about this place. I enjoyed the food very much. The restaurant service is slow for the most part, but I did expect that here. The bars had great service and the drinks were great. The room I stayed in was nice, but could have used a little bit of updating. Of course, I was barely in the room as there is so much to do and see outside. I have been told that Building 7 is newer so you should try to get in there if you can. The construction is limited to one area near the lobby and theater so it doesn't affect most of the resort. I enjoyed the nightlife as you have a few different options. For loud music and dancing they have the Sneakers Diso. For a more relaxed bar and music they have the Umbrella Bar. Also, the outside bars remain open until midnight I believe so you can socialize outside as well. I definitely recommend the Punta Cana Grand as a beautiful resort and an excellent value.  
<Date>Mar 27, 2006

<Author>missm_blondie
<Content>Mixed Reviews My boyfriend and I just returned from a weeks stay at the Punta Cana Grand (today!) Although, we had a fabulous time with the weather and such, we were a little disapointed when it came to the actual resort. First thing, we thought when we pulled up to the resort was it looked awful because it was under construction. When we did check in and look around a bit though, it didnt seem so bad. We were put in room 3218 and we HATED IT. We had two queen beds when we requested one king or something like that. We got past that though. But what I didnt get past was the awful smell from the shower. It smelled like dirty feet. It was beyond awful and I complained everyday for a week and no one did anything for me. I also requested fresh towels at 7am a couple mornings and nothing came all day. I think its awful that at 7 in the morning no one can grab me a fresh towel.I do have to mention one thing though. If you want good food, order room service. It was awesome fresh good and it didnt take long to get to your room. We just found alot of the staff took advantage of serving us to the fullest because we were young and on our own on. I would only return to this resort again if I saw it on a cheap last minute and it was reasonably priced.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Viva La Punta Cana! WOW! ----- That is what you will be saying when you come back!I went to Punta Cana Grand on my March Break with my dad and my little brother. Im 18, so it was no difficulty finding people to hang around with. At the end of the week i was friends with people ages 16 to 65 - believe it or not. Food:Im a picky eater so i think to tell you the food was terrible would be wrong. But it is nothing that will sotp you from having a good time. The breakfast runs till about 12 at the latest and is usually fully stocked. At lunch you can go to the basically 24 hour resauraunt - if you can call it that. You can get great pizza, big hamburgers or hot dogs, tons of fries and club sandwidges as well. For Dinner you have the choice of the buffet which comes wiht a slow but amazing pasta cook. You can also go to the fancy italian restaurant or the Steak house on top of the lunch place, its kind of hard to find so jsut ask.Room service is available, i never got it but when my friends did - well, i wen tto go eat and when i came back - it still was not there.Hotel (Look, Quality, Staff, Service):The hotel is beautiful... trust me it looks better then the pictures. The lobby is enormous and filled with a disco club which is good if you are completely intoxicated and if alot of poeple decide to go. It also had a cigar bar where kareoke and some live music take place (more for the older crowd)The hotel has 7 enormous buildings (i suggest buildings 4-7 as they are the newest, nicest, and away from casino construciton)Try to get a room where the ocea is in site, its magnificent waking to the swishing of the water...thats what makes vacation.The doors in the hotel have rust, the buildings have not been painted in some time, but nothing is to expressive in its fatigue in color, you will only notice these imperfections from a close look.The gardens and trees are well cut and the entire resort is always cleen, with staff always available.The staff are AMAZING! Tip-tip-tip, and you will have faster service, dollars get it done. Even packs of gum do the trick. My dad and I tipped out maids every other day, sometimes wiht cash sometimes with a box of stuff they can us. (remember these people make around 100 dollars a month, anything they get extra is greatly appreciated) They are all good people... ladies, the men CAN get touchy but its nothing to ponder on.The TV is okay, depending on your room, everyone gets the same channels, majority of them spanish, but if you need a beach break, there is some TNT and TBS for you.The beds are pretty comfertable and the rooms are in good shape from what i saw. Thankfully i got the 3rd flore which i most definitely recomend, because you get the high ceilings which makes the room look large and lovely.Activities/Night Life:You wake up - eat - then jsut chill pool side at the splash bar or stroll along the beach for a few hours, catch some tan, read your book, blast your i-pod. If you need more you can go banana boating,- kayaking-sailing-parasailing (really cool)- volley ball, tennis, large chest-board- if you go in the town, get a cab to take you to the go-karts which is fun or you can rent ATV's and even go horse back rideing.-Snorkeling, Scuba Diving, Swim beside gated-off sharks and sting-raysAt night time really there is not much to do other then get wasted, meet people, skinny dip, disco club, and piano bar. But if you are one of those lucky people going after April the Casino will be ready. And if you are not lucky, there is the Flamingo and a coupple other resorts with casinos and large nightclubs.DONT WORRY PEOPLE, HAVE ALOT OF MAI TAI'S,77'S AND BANANA MAMA'S AND YOU WILL HAVE A BLAST AT NIGHT!Also they put on shows, there most recognized one which was really good is there Michael Jackson inpersonations.The beach can get packed, this doesent mean you wont have room to walk, it jsut means there is not many long-chairs to sit. Especially if you want some shade and a cabanna, you need to wake for around 6 30 to reserve one with your towel. Its quite annoying there, people leave there stuff from morning to night time giveing others no chances to have a decent spot.I had an amazing time, i knew only my family but left with many friends whome i am going to party with soon. Teens, you will have a blast, jsut be open, confident, share where you are from and you will beaccepted, EVERYONES IN THE SAME BOAT AS YOU!Punta Cana Grand is gorgeous so there are many couples who are just there together having a wacky good time.Many families go with their children and they all say they have a great time as well.It's truly ana amazing place, no rain, no excessive heat, perfect weather, palm trees with endless shadows and water which matches the sky.--VIVA LA DOMINICANA!P.S THERE IS A 24 HOUR BARP.P.S GET READY FOR BEACH PAPI

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Would have been a five if it weren't for one incident.... I wasn't going to write this review as I didn't want to give the hotel a bad name but I thought that it was necessary to warn other people. My boyfriend and I stayed at the Punta Cana Grand from Feb 26th to about March 5th. The hotel itself was amazing. The food was excellent (Iespecially reccommend the omlettes in the morning, the staff was friendly and the weather was beautiful all week long. I have stayed at too other all inclusives (one in Panama and one in Cuba) and this was by far the best one. NOw for the bad part.On our second night at the hotel we were partying till about 12:30am and when we arrived back in our room we relaized that we had been robbed.We were in building one on the first floor. We figure that they got in the back door because the lock was not very secure. They stole things such as an IPod, running shoes, 2 pairs of sunglasses etc. Luckily the camera, money and passports were in the safe. Now, I don't really blame anyone for what happened (although the hotel didn't really seem to care to much that it happened.. we had to actually fight them for a room change, it is something to keep in mind. When you get to the hotel (or any hotel) fiighting for a room that is not ground level is well worth it and if you do have ground level make sure the lock is secure. But as I saiid before other then this our vacation was FANTASTIC and highly reccommend the resort!If anyone has any questions feel free to email me!  
<Date>Mar 17, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Awesome resort We are just back from the Grand on March 15th. Very Nice resort, nice size, able to walk anywhere within three to four minutes. Rooms very nice, grounds kept very nice, the staff were very pleasant. Bathrooms nice, even the common baths were kept immaculate. Food was very good. Water pressure in the showers was a little below what we are used to. Drinks are domestic only, but quite a variety and very good. Don't plan on single malt scotches or JW black. The casino is currently under construction, but will undoubtedly make this resort even better. We did not have a single problem the entire time there. While talking with other guests, as well as overhearing others at the resort, all were very impressed. I would return to this resort in a minute. Simply put, we had a blast. If you leave this resort unhappy, perhaps you need a doctors review:)  
<Date>Mar 16, 2006

<Author>Jeanniechief
<Content>Not Bad Just got back from on week at the Punta Cana Grand.  Like to say the people that work there are the best ever.They work very hard and always try to please you. As far as our room, I was not happy. we were in building number 3 close to bar and lobby, the room was too dark for me and could hear the music at night. We upgraded on the our third day to building number 7, wow they are beautiful.Didnt have hot water most days though and power did go out at least 3 times while we were there.But moving to this building for me was worth the 50 dollars a day extra, They will show you the rooms if you would like to see them.  Food is ok nothing special, the main buffet is a dark place to eat and is not a open air, We ate most days at the beach garden close to the ocean.My favorite was the Italian. Beach is real nice, you can walk forever, but like mose places you do need to get a hut early in the morning, not a problem up early anyways.  Its a nice resort, we enjoyed our vacation. The Michael Jackson is excellent, you cant miss it. The new casino that is being built is going to be unreal. Grounds are clean and pools are nice too. So have fun.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Absolutly Amazing Punta Cana Grand was the best resort I have ever stayed at. The only complaint I have is the food was too good and I spent too much money for tips, because the service was too friendly and excellent. The shopping along the beach was good, and most prices were good if you knew how to barter well. For those of you who are going to go shopping bring soaps and toiletries to trade, as the people here have limited supplies. The beaches, and pool were amazing. The beaches had cozy huts to sit under, and it was always clean. The pool's swim up bar was a lot of fun and the service was very friendly.The beaches were a bit windy, although it was nice to get a breeze, for the weather was scorching and gorgeous.As for the weather we had amazing weather. It rained once in the morning, before everyone was up and it was almost a misty rain that lasted 5-10 minutes max. Overall, I don't understand why this resort isn't a 5*. If there is something better out there I'd be shocked. We were spoiled rotten, and the food and drinks were to die for.  
<Date>Mar 15, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A few problems... We just got back March 12th from the Punta Cana Grand. Overall, I would rate it a 3+, not higher. The biggest aggravation was the noise, and I noticed several other reviews that mentioned the Spanish kids. They checked in at 3:30 am, and the rest of the duration they were noisy and rude, and late at night all week long. The first night we had a lengthy checkin at 11:00 pm, and then could not sleep because our room in building 4 was closest to the disco. We moved to the other side of building 5 the next day, and that's when the Spaniards moved in. That and incessant barking from the dog kennel just outside the resort prevented us from getting much sleep all week long. There was no hot water for showers, and frequent power outages, a nuisance for sure. The food was okay, but we both got sick one day from who knows what. But you have to watch what you eat, they are not always as vigilant at keeping foods chilled or adequately heated as we are here.The rooms were very nice, but little things broken; the first room had something stuffed down the sink drain, and the second had a broken side mirror. The housekeeping was pretty good, we did tip regularly, the fridge was minimally stocked, but there was water and beer in there every day. Beach was very nice, weather was great, staff were very nice too. We didn't do any excursions, not into that, but we took out a catamaran and that was fun. The disco did not play a variety of music, so we didn't go back. The Italian restaurant was very good, well worth the wait. The Tex Mex was a waste of time, my food was cold, not a good experience. Our flight time out was late: 10:20, and the tour company was picking us up at 6:40 pm, but check out time was 12:00 pm. You have to pay for the extended use of the room, which considering our check in was after 11:00 pm didn't seem quite right. We did get 7 nights, but not 7 days, included.A few pitfalls, an okay holiday, but we wouldn't go back to that resort. The Bahia Prinicipe in Pueto Plata was a better resort, better layout.  
<Date>Mar 15, 2006

<Author>HELENKATH
<Content>What a Disappointment!: We (4 of us) were very late arriving (3am) and were shown to rooms with broken lamps, one towel, a very dingy bathroom with all sorts of broken tiles and a tub which may have been clean but was grey and scratched.All night young people partied which echoed through the halls like a megaphone. The next morning we went to the front desk and paid to upgrade to Bldg.#7. It is very beautiful and much newer. The a la carte restauants were good but the buffet did not offer the selection we experienced in 2005 at the Barcelo Bravara Beach Resort. By the end of the week there was no WOW factor to the buffet at all. The last night we were there, at 3am a young couple decided to use our patio hot tub. When they turned on the motor the noise in our room was very loud. We called security three times over the next hour and a half. They never did come. As there were a lot of young folks partying, drinking and whatever, we were reluctant to confront this nude couple. Finally we banged on the patio door and yelled at them to leave.I wondered if this drunk couple had drown in our hot tub if security would have shown up. When we were calling for security, the front desk basically laughed it off saying it was just kids. Well these kids didn't pay for our hot tub - we did.We would return to Punta Cana without thought, but you could not pay us to stay here again. It is a shame that we work so hard to be able to take a vacation and that the negative things overshadowed the whole holiday. Punta Cana has beautiful beaches and the weather was perfect.  
<Date>Mar 15, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>AMAZING!!!! This resort was totally amazing! The resort itself is pretty small in comparison to other DR Punta cana resorts. The food was soooo good! The Italian restaurant was our fav! The lunch at Windows was fab as well. The beach in front of the hotel is nice but a short walk down is so gorgeous! we have been to many other places in the carribean and this resort defintley left a smile on our faces. The rooms were big, spacious and very clean. The hotel was very well maintained. All ages would find this resort fun. The shows were really good as well...the Michael jackson show was so good! The staff at the resort work really hard! I recommend doing day trips as well. We loved it!!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great realxing holiday! We just returned from Punta Cana Grand on March 10th. We had read many of the trip advisor reviews over and over before deciding where to go and we got exactly what we expected at this resort. We went with Sunwing. The aircraft itself was quite cramped but it was one of the best flights I have had in terms of staff and what they offer free of charge(beverage, snack, meal with wine, headphones). There was a movie and they also showed a couple of sitcoms. The time passed very quickly.We arrived at night. Our check-in was quick as we had booked a junior master suite ahead of time. You got to check-in off to the side from where everyone else was. We got everything we requested (king size bed, 3rd floor-high ceilings). Whatever you do, stay in building 7. It is well worth the few extra bucks per person. It is brand new and gorgeous. The safe uses a code (costs $15 for the week)..I heard that other buildings had to use keys and carry them around all the time. Maid service was great and friendly. Mini bar was always stocked and many clean towels. I asked the maid for extra water one day only and I had 4 to 5 bottles in the room every day. Our air conditioning did not work a couple of nights but we went to talk to guest services one morning and we we got back later in the afternoon it was working again. If you depart late in the day you can either book a hospitality suite to shower and change or you can extend your room until 6pm the day of your departure for $30 US. On the day of our departure there was a power outage and the water was off. It power finally came back on at 5pm and the water at 5:30pm. No hot water though...we ended up having a cold shower very quickly then went and caught our bus to the airport. We had a heated discussion with the desk clerk about not wanting to pay the $30 since nothing in the room was working. He finally agreed to taking 50% off.There is construction that is actually near building 7 and 1. We were in about the middle of the building and it didn't really bother us but I think if your room was the farthest away from the beach (near the theatre) it could have been a problem. Beach was really nice. Well maintained, water was warm. You can walk a long way down the beach past other resorts to an natural park. Something nice to do on a cloudy morning. We were gone for 2 hours.There are 3 pools. A lazy river type pool between building 1 and 7. This pool is very clean but very cold. We didn't venture into the large pool with the swim-up bar. Our favourite and where we spent most of our time was the adult only pool. It was quiet (expect for the Spanish kids a couple of days that you will read about in other reviews) and very protected from the wind. Meet lots of friendly people (80% are Canadian and you feel right at home). The bartender Nickolas was great. Get to know him and he'll serve you right at your chair! Ask for the Nickolas special!!!Food was great! We liked the Italian restaurant the best. We also went to the American Grill. It was ok, if I had more time I would have gave it another try. The nice thing was that you didn't have to make reservations at the a la carte restaurants. It was first come first serve and you can go as many times as you want to each one. We heard that the beach party on Thursday night was amazing but unfortunately we arrived and left on Thursday so we didn't get a chance to go. The basically shut everything down and you have dinner and a party right on the beach. We were so tired from drink, food, and sun everyday that we only made it to one show, Michael Jackson. It was really entertaining. We also did one day excursion to Saona Island. You go to the Carribean side and take a speed boat to this natural swimming pool in the middle of the ocean where there are starfish. Pretty cool. Then they take you to Saona Island. This place was gorgeous. The water was shallow, warm and so aqua blue!! You spend the afternoon and have a BBQ. Then you take a 2 hour catamaran ride back. It was a nice day.I don't really have anything bad to say about this resort. We got what we expected!  
<Date>Mar 15, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great time at the Punta Cana Grande Just returned from the Punta Cana Grand and we had a great holiday. Have been to several other areas-Mexico-Bahamas-Cuba, but this was by far one of the best. The weather was great the whole week. The food was the best I have ever had in an all inclusive (would suggest losing a bit of weight before heading there) both quality and quantity. Windows restaurant (buffets) unbelievable selections and the staff great--amazing service. The Beach Party was a blast.Beach was great (a few seaweeds) but very well maintained! If you want a hut you should be down by 8:00 a.m. Although there was plenty of lounge chairs available they went very quickly.Our room was cleaned every day and well stocked. Hint - bring a few gifts or leave a tip for your housekeeper and you will get the little extra service! But hey this happens in Canada!There were plenty of activities all day long by the pool. Horsebacking riding, bike tour and parasailing nearby. Great walks along the beach! Little disappointed in the gym however. About 11 vendors are set up next to the hotel. Great little gifts to be found. They start high but will go down in price -- fun negotiating with them. Everything is CHEAPY CHEAPY and JUST FOR YOU. We were their during college Spring Break so the place was a bit noisy students partying! But what do you expect during spring break anywhere! There was a group of spanish students from Spain there for a few days and I would say they were the nuisance! Very inconsiderate - loud, left their garbage on the beach. Apprantly there was a holiday for students in Spain as well. I would not hesitate to return to this resort --however perhaps at a different time period. ENJOY!!  
<Date>Mar 9, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Noisy Noisy Nights We just returned, we were there from Feb 25 to March 4 - great vacation - good food, excellent choice and presentation - excellent service - clean rooms, nice pools, good beach, some seaweed. We always got a chair and some shade. However....... the noisy nights - the students did not sleep at night, the students partied all day and the loud party got louder at 11 pm and went to 4 am every night - no sleeping during those hours - they partied in the common areas, in the rooms, on the balconies, they had absolutely no respect for anyone who wanted to sleep - they were obnoxious - sad to say - some of them were Canadians - in the satisfaction survey we indicated we would not be back as a result of the noise at night. Neither security or management did anything about the noise, they did not try to contain any of it. Great resort, great people, little sleep.

<Author>redgirl1264
<Content>Greatest holiday yet What can we say? Its the nicest place yet! I have travelled to a number of places within the Caribbean and have yet to stay at a place this nice. Granted there is plenty of construction going on, but its throughout the day at the front of the resort. So unless you sleep through the day, it shouldnt bother you. Afternoon siestas went a problem either. The resort is immaculately kept. The third floor rooms are the nicest, so make sure you request one. The food is top shelf! Niether one of us got the typical illnesses that you would normally get from tropical food. And there is no limit on A La Carte dinners! The beach and pool are busy, so if you want a hut make sure you get down there before 8am to reserve it. Not to worry if you are a late sleeper, just run down there early in the morning, leave a towel or two, and no one will bother it. This is the most beautiful beach I have seen yet. The water is crystal blue, and goes for miles and miles. There are numerous water activities as well as inland activities. The Parasailing was phenominal! Talk the locals down in price, and you should get a great deal. There is a market beside the resort for gifts. Buy there, and not at the resort (way over priced at the resort). The locals at the market are pretty good. They will start really high in price, cut that price in half if not more and they will more than likely take it. A good tip for all you drinkers, bring travel mugs along on your trip. The drinks are great, but because of the hot, hot days they get warm way too fast. And the bartenders will fill up any cup with booze, no matter the size. It keeps those frosty drinks cold, cold, cold! What more can we say? Fabulous trip, great people (not as friendly as most caribbean destinations, but oh well) oh and getting engaged on the beach was great too....:)Have fun, we certainly did!  
<Date>Mar 6, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Awesome resort!!! ... Skyservice sucks This was my fourth time to the Domincican Republic. I am 23, I travelled with my girlfriend(21), and my friend(23) and his girlfriend(23). We stayed at the Punta Cana Grand from Feb 19-26. This resort was really enjoyable and there was very little to complain about (Besides the 9.5 hour delay on the way down as well as an unexpected stop over in the Bahamas becuase of the worst airline ever... SKYSERVICE!!The positives; Resort- the grounds are kept very clean and there is lots of vegatation and palm trees. Buildings are very nice. The resort is the perfect size. Its a 2 minute walk to go anywhere. The employees work incredibly long hours for incredibly low pay. For those people who complained about service or wait times at the bars, courtesy goes a very long way. It made me sick when I saw people treat the employees badly becuase they had to wait 2 minutes for a drink or food, you are there all week, relax the whole resort does not revolve around you. Juan Cruz at the pool bar was very hard working and this guy does not stop all day. We never waited for drinks from the pool bar even when it was packed, like I said, common courtesy goes a very long way.Lenin at the Theatre Bar was a blast and really made our evenings at the theatre fun. There is some construction going on that i did not find too loud or disruptive. When the renovations are finished this resort will be even more AMAZING! They are adding a casino and a few other things.Food-Best food out of any of the previous resorts I have been too (Riu Merengue (Peurto Plata), Occidental Grande Flamenco(Punta Cana)and the LTI (Punta Cana)). There were Unlimited A la Cartes (3 of them, American Grill, Italian, Steak House), what more could you ask for?Food was amazing and service was excellent.Beach Party was unbelievable!!Rooms-Very spacious and clean, the maids cleaned our room everyday and our fridge was always stocked. For those people who complained about the construction I dont know what your problem is. Our room ( Room #1112 in building #1) was right next to the construction and you could hear it, but that was only between 8 am and 5pm and it didnt bother us becuase we were never in our rooms between those times. These rooms basically the same as any other resort.Beach- Very nice, not as nice as the Bavaro section that is a little further north. However, there was always lots of activities going on and it was still absolutly gorgeous. I cant believe people would actually complain about the seaweed on the beach, except for some that washed up on shore it was basically non-existent. Remember people, the OCEAN as amazing as this sounds, is not a pool. You are bound to get some weeds wherever you go. Entertainment- Very good, we did not make it to all of the shows due to excess alcohal consumption, however the Michael Jackson Show was awesome and the other shows we saw were also very good, similar to the other resorts I have been too. - The disco was a decent size and fun as well as the piano bar.Now for the Negatives;- The only negatives i can think of from our stay has absolutly nothing to do with our resort. There was a group of students from Spain (I think...)that showed up the frist night we were there. They had no respect for anyone and they were incredibly rude and disruptive the whole time. Dont get me wrong, I am 23 years old and I love to booze it up and party hard, but not at the expense everyone else at the resort who are trying to enjoy their vacation. These guys should have had the maturity and courtesy to know their boundries.If you are in the process of planning a vacation, I highly reccommend this resort!!! However, DO NOT FLY WITH SKYSERVICE!!!! I REPEAT DO NOT FLY WITH SKYSERVICE!!!! We had a mechanical problem with the plane on the way down which in turn, delayed us 9.5 hours and added a stop over in the bahamas. During our 9.5 hour delay skyservice told us absolutly nothing and kept telling us 20 mins, 20 Mins over and over again. After 9.5 hours of no answers people got pretty angry. On the way back it took us almost 3 hours to get our luggage off the plane becuase of another mechanical problem with the plane. The Skyservice reps were rude and never had any clue about what was going on. My friend who was on a different flight back home from Punta Cana still has not recieved his luggage. There was another skyservice flight that were delayed 19 hours which caused our delay as well. This airline is very unreliable and seem to have a a ton of mechanical problems with the planes. I dont know about you, but I like flying in planes that dont have alot of mechanical problems.... but thats just me. I never really felt safe on the plane and I love to fly.DO NOT FLY WITH SKYSERVICE!!!! I REPEAT DO NOT FLY WITH SKYSERVICE!!!! But besides the terrible experiences with Skyservice our vacation was still amazing and i highly reccommend the Punta Cana Grand.  
<Date>Mar 3, 2006

<Author>dulibanz
<Content>mostly good but.....Feb 19-26 Ok lets start, check in went well, until we found out we had two double beds instead of the king we asked for when we booked the trip back in nov.Not a big deal.The room was clean, lots of towels ,a/c worked all good there, though it would have been nice to have a newly renovated room like some were, but for the time we spent in the room it wasn't a big deal either. The restaurants were all good. The pools were very clean, but you had to get up at 5am to put your towel on a loung chair or you wouldn't get one by the pool or under an umbrella. There was some construction going on while we were there it was a little distracting to the eyes.They are building a new casino on site looks like it will be nice and when everthing is done it will look awsome.Only one complaint, and that it was very disturbing was there was a large group of students that arrived the day after we did and they had just completly took over everything in the resort the pools, the restaurants the pool mats the bars they were loud and roudy up all thhrough the night singing banging on peoples doors in the wee hours of the night wasting the drinks by throwing them on each other just a lack of respect for everyone around them including the staff and other guests. When complaints were put in about this absolutly nothing was done!!!! therefore pretty much ruining our vacation along with many other peoples.Bottom line is I will never return to this resort simply because management did nothing to correct this problem. A t-shirt and a bottle just dont cut it when you spent so much to come and relax!!! Hi everyone by the adult pool! All you good people.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The good the bad and the construction.... Ok so my boyfriend and I just got back from a week at the Punta Cana Grand. (Feb 19-26th) We had a wonderful trip although not everything was as we thought it would be. I thought it best to do the basic pro and con list as everyone looks for different things on vacation.Pro:- Food was great! Seriously, best I have ever had on vacation. Definitely gained a few pounds. Love the merican grill?br/>- Very clean. Our rooms and the rest of the resort was spotless. We had no problems with bugs of any kind. Beach was also well kept, no seaweed.- Hotel staff was very friendly and even though we spoke almost 0 Spanish, there were no communication barriers.- Lots of shade by the pool and beach. I did not have to get up early to find a spot. At any given time ppl were leaving for trips or going for food and they generally took their stuff with them so other ppl could enjoy the shade. Not everyone was an umbrella hog.-Also, there were great floating beds (6 of them) in the pool to lie on and float around (favorite thing to do) ppl were great for sharing those as well. With the exception of one rude family who would take 2 or 3 of them at a time out of the pool and put them beside their lounge chairs or lay on them on the deck so they could use them again when they felt like it. THIS IS INCREDIBLY RUDE. If your not using the loaty?please give it to a kid or someone else who could use it. If we all share we can all enjoy.- Lot of activities. Both included and not. The kayaks, wind surfing and catamarans were always available and you could take lessons (9am) if you have had never done it before. Try the catamaransot of fun! We took one day trip. Snorkeling with the sharks (70 USD per person) this was a wonderful trip and I would definitely do it again. The staff was fun and informative. It was not just a party boat so the kids will have fun too. We took one night trip to the casino, that was great too.- Beach party on Thursday was good, the staff spent all day setting up and the food was amazing. Nothing like having a candle lit dinner on the beach followed by a movie (yes on the beach) Don miss it.Now for the con list?.- Yes this hotel is under construction?not a little?a lot. We were in building #1which was beside the construction and it does disturb you. Large CAT machines tearing down the old theater. They are building some shops and a casino. We did have our power and water go off from time to time but only for short periods of time. But it is still a little annoying. On our 3rd day they gutted out the spa so if you plan on using any spa facilities you have to go to the hotel next door. This did not ruin our trip but it was disturbing. I talked to the contractor while we were watching them tear down the theater and he said they are scheduled to finish in approximately 2 months. I have pictures, if you would like to see the construction and decide for yourself I would be happy to send them to you. See email address at the bottom.- Room was not up to par on what we were expecting. I pretty sure we paid for an upgrade but we got the very basic room and the bathroom door would not closet all.The hotel was overbooked so we could not switch rooms (apparently they had to send several ppl to other hotels because they could not accommodate them) - There is no internet connection available at this hotel. If you want to use the internet you have to walk to the next hotel. It not far but definitely inconvenient. Cost of the internet at that hotel is 3USD for 15 minutes or 5USD for 30 minutes. -This is a very small hotel, only 300 rooms. This might appeal to a lot of people, however I like larger hotels with more space to walk around and explore. Depends on your preference.- There was one large group of kids running around at 4am every night yelling and waking everyone up. I know this is not a direct complaint about the hotel however hotel security did not seem to do anything to stop them which would have been nice.That it. If you had any questions about this hotel or the Grand Palladium Bavaro Resort  Spa (I stayed there in June *amazing*) please feel free to email me. I am always happy to help. jennstar2@gmail(-)

<Author>DR_Rocks
<Content>Agree with Glass Half Full I have to agree with Glass Half Full Although the resort was beautiful there were definate things that just should have been better.The food quality, taste and presentation was great. I must say the best food I have in DR yet. The Al La carte dinners were even better. I noticed Felix the Food and Beverage Manager around at all times. And the waiters in the buffet were always quick.The Pool/Beach were both great. We too could never get beach towels and we sat next to the hut everyday starting at 7:30... when you did see them come out you had to run! Pool was good tempature and was cleaned every day. The same Spanish students (as we were there on the same week I would think) threw all the lawn chairs and giant chess peices in it one day at 6am and then saved 20 lawn chairs and went to bed. I was up getting the lawn chairs and saw it happen! I felt bad for the cleaner that day. (yes u have to get up early to grab those chairs, but I think that is the same every where)The evening entertainment was ok. They have a beautiful new theatre built that was opened our first night there. I think though (or I hope) due to management changes the animation crew is going through some changes because it seemed to lack compared to other places I have stayed. They hired many outside entertainment companies for the theatre presentations instead of performing thier own. Again not awlful just not A+.Rooms were clean, and maid service was fine. Always had clean towels and stuff... (but we tipped well)The rooms are looking old but I think that will improve as much improvements are going on. But with these ongoing improvements we too had no hot water/shower while we were there. When you pay for a 4* resort (I know it is a different standard then Canada) but I do expect Hot water. All the stuff in mini bar was replenished daily and was included.Drinks and Bars were good and plentiful. Liked the option of the piano/Karaoke bar or Disco at night. If you wanted a quiet night the pool and Beach bar are available.The best part of this resort is thier beach party on Thursday nights. Not to be missed. They work all day to set up so you can eat Buffet on the beach. On thurs only one ala carte is open and so most attend. It was one of the highlights.Checking in was ok. We we delayed by one day. Sunwing did nothing for us. Not even a taxi voucher to get home when they cancelled our flight. On top of this they gave the rooms we paid for that day to the others that were stranded, so like glass half Full said when we finally did arrive our rooms were not even ready for another 4 hours. Unacceptable. So Loved Punta Cana Grand below... I hope you enjoyed your extra night in building 7 cause I paid for it and got nothing in return. I blame sun wing for that not the hotel or the stranded visitors. If I was stranded I would hoped my tour operator would have helped or compensated me. But I do believe the ones stranded in Ottawa should have been compensated as well.In the end, we had a great vacation and did not let the little things ruin it, but would I go back... probably not until the renovations are complete and definatly not on spring break when young rude students are hollaring and screaming until 6am.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Glass was half full... OK, before I get hate mail about being unreasonable... the 3 stars has some reason to it. The weather here was AMAZING. Just what the Dr. ordered. From an aethetic perspective, this is a 4 or 4.5 star spot. The resort is beautiful. Stunning. Extremely nicely kept-up. Flowers are everywhere, the grounds are impeccably groomed. The beach is manicured each morning, and the ocean is gorgeous. The pool is huge and there's a wicked swim up bar. The food is very good - there is a great variety and everyone should be able to find something very tasty every nights. I mean with options as extravagant as roasted boar, chuchuro, spicy local fish to options as simple as pasta, pizza, coldcuts and salads, there should be no complaints about going hungry. The rooms themselves are spacious, clean and have new modern furntiture. So from a visual perspective, this place rocks.But... despite some very nice employees, the attitude of too many staff members was completely uncaring and inhospitable. We tipped over $15 a day in total to various employees and really didn't think they cared.But there were never any beach towels - even at 8am!! No biggie, but this became really annoying after the 4th day of being told that the laundry facility is broken. But no biggie...But there wasn't hot water (none for us 5 of 6 nights) ... ah, who cares right? Afterall, with too much sun, a nice cold shower may feel pretty good, right?But the Check in people were beyond rude and unhelpful... our flight was delayed from getting in at 1am until noon the next day (which is why we only had 6 nights) and our room STILL wasn't ready until 17:00/5pm!!! So we had to watch all our things all day. But your vacation is what you make of it, so we moved on...But this was reading week, but there were Spanish Students everywhere causing havoc, at the enjoyment of other guests. These kids partied until 6am everynight and kept eveyone up, hollering. When complaints came it, the resort did nothing!! Why weren't they told to respect the resort rules or else get tossed? Trust me, this was way over the iop. Where was security?But the smoke shop tried to charge my wife 6,500 dominican pesos for a pack of smokes. When she realized that this was apporox CAD200 she inisisted on cancelling the transaction... when I complained to the front desk and concierge they just asked my room number and looked down. Nothing!But the first hospitality room I had booked 2 days into our vacation wasn't booked according to a real piece of work at the desk. Then, I was issued a key for a room that actually had guests in it!!! Imagine, 2 hours before you leave for you flight and want a shower, you open a door for a room with guests in it!! They were as confused as we were. After being invited into someone's room by a chambermaid to speak with the front desk we finally received a key to a grungy room for freshening up... this place was filthy! My wife didn't even want to use the shower, and thankfully we had brought our own towels from home or would have had none.Too many buts...Overall, this place has sooo much potential. They are constructing new facilities and this place will keep getting nicer. It's too bad that the beauty of this spot couldn't be remotely challenged by the attitudes of key employees who constanly challenged us to see the glass half full.We totally recommend Punta Cana, but overall, can't recommend this place. My folks stayed at the Barcello and loved it...  
<Date>Feb 26, 2006

<Author>Lordphilth
<Content>Great Holiday We just came back from a week at the Punta Cana Grand.Feb 17-Feb 23. What a great time !!! Staff is excellent. If you go look for Lenin the bartender or Daniel the bartender, both work nights and are a lot of fun. Resort is a good size with everything close by. If you couldn't find anything you liked at the buffet or the other two restaurants then you had a problem. The nightly shows were really well done and the dancers were very talented. The new stage opened up the second day we were there, so we were the first to experience it. Sure the place is under construction, but it is not intrusive and from what i can see they are continually improving the resort. The new wing Building 7 is the place to be. Rooms are huge with Jacuzzi tubs and marble and ceramic throughout. Third floor have vaulted ceilings with an overhead fan. Loss of power and hot water was an occasional disruption,but then again you are in D.R. Cleaning staff very good and tips go along way to getting those little extras in your room.The beaches are great and walks along the beach early in the morning were very nice. I rate the resort very good, but I did hear some complaints from the people we met. I guess it depended on which building you were in.Phil Maggie

<Author>roadrunners_beebeep
<Content>Loved the Punta Cana Grand We went Feb. 10-18th and had a great time. Staff are excellent and vendors don't bother you on the beach. There is a little flea market on the beach so you can go shopping if you feel like it. Pink flamingos reside on the property...cool!Bartender Beachpapi is the best; always happy and singing and he does cool things with bananas!! We got to stay an extra night because of the storm in Ottawa and they put us in Bldg. 7..WOW! What a treat! The only complaint I have is that security did not respond to our 3 phone calls during the night when our immature neighbours were partying and fighting at 4:00 a.m. Other than that, great place, great food. Don't worry about the construction, it does not affect you at all. They are building a casino at the front of the resort - the beach and bars are at the back of the resort near the beach. We never heard a saw, hammer or drill the whole time. The entertainment is good but the Michael Jackson show was the best. The beach party is awesome; what a memorable event. I recommend this resort and if you can afford the extra $50/day, get a deluxe room in Bldg. 7, it's well worth it.Warning: don't take the Country Safari excursion. We spent most of the day on the truck driving through and into pot holes and by 3 p.m., I thought I was going to puke! Our tour guide fell asleep and our driver took 3 wrong turns. They gave us a partial refund because other people complained. Advice: bring a can of Lysol Linen spray to get rid of the smell in the rooms and bedding; this is normal there. Also, when the cleaning lady puts fresh flowers around your sink and on your bed, it carries little black bugs so a quick spray always killed them on the spot - no big deal!I would love to go back next year to see all the improvements made to this resort.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Had it's ups and downs Just got back last night.In general it was good. I asked for bldg 4 upon check in and was ignored so we got bldg 1. No air conditioning. By Friday (arrived on Tuesday we managed to get moved) again there was no air but it was close to the beach so we had a breeze at least.I also got sick from the food and was down for 24 hours.The Michael Jackson show is amazing. I found the resort was very crowded and felt like a sardine on the beach along with listening to the continuous hammering from the construction outside the beach restaurant.Food was good and service was excellent. Really liked the staff (except reception)All in all it was worth the last minute price I paid.

<Author>Doggies2
<Content>Great Holiday, lots of fun. Stayed from Feb.10 to Feb. 17/06: We travelled 2 couples with Sunwing. A last minute deal came up for us to stay in Suites which was bldg. #7.The room: WOW!!! the room was fantastic: King size bed, Jacuzzi tub, very very big bathroom, the room decor was beautiful but the floors are ceramic titles (a bit cold on the feet). If you take a regular room we will be dispointed because the are terrible, we saw them. So make sure to get a suite. Sunwing also gave us Golf-shirts and bottle of rum in our room. We paid $1450.00 tax Included each, it was worth every dollars.The Food: The food was all good, no complaints for the quality. But the portion at A la Carte restaurants are a bit too small, even for me. My husband had to order double portions to satisfy him.The Night shows at 9:30 every night were good, do not miss the Micheal Jackson Show it's fantastics.They are 8 bars at this resorts. As far as food, if you go beside the pool bar there is food there from 5:00 to 6:30, all the other restaurants are close during that time. To get ready for supper. No you will not be out of food like people stated.The Vendors: Do not pay the price they tell you. Cut down the price from 2/3 or 1/2. We got lots of t-shirts they wanted $18 US, so we got them for $6.USThe Constructions: Is beside the bldg. #1 and #7, why do people complaint it's not that bad. They are building a Casino and it will be finished in 3 months. The Service: No complaints, the staff are very good and pleasant.My husband and I have travelled a lot, yes we do recommend this resorts. We never go back to the same one.

<Author>Ruca
<Content>Good Vacation! I just got back from this resort and overall, I had a pretty good time. I went with just one girlfriend, both of us in our early 20's, and that did cause a few problems. We found that basically all the male staff would ogle us, make comments or lewd remarks, often in Spanish too so we couldn't really understand. At first it may have been flattering and funny, but by the end of the trip we were getting very frustrated and kind of disgusted.But anyway, that didn't ruin our vacation! The first five days or so were perfect! The weather was beautiful, we went parasailing on Valentines Day (definitely worth it), and we met lots of friends, many from the GTA like us. The Disco was pretty fun most nights, a lot of people went to Mangu, this huge all night club on another resort, but we didn't want to have to go somewhere where we would need to pay for drinks.The food was decent. I'm super picky and I didn't starve. Windows was good, if a little repetitive. The chicken fajitas at the Tex Mex Grill were very good and the Three Cheese lasagna from Da Marios was amazing, it's under appetizers but they bring you twice the size if it's your main course. The Beach Garden was good for pizza, we ordered burgers there one day and they were kind of pinkish/greyish, I didn't even bite into it.We were in building 1 on the third floor which was nice, but we were also right beside the construction which was not so great. We liked being by the entertainment stage though because if we didnt feel like watching we'd just hang out on our balcony and listen, they only run until about 10:30 anyway. Antony, an entertainer, is the coolest guy ever. My friend and I became really close with him while we were there, he's tons of fun! Luis is a very nice bartender as well. It seems as though the staff never stops working, we'd see them at night, and then again first thing in the morning.The last couple of days we ran into a few problems. Friday the power kept going out and we had no electricity from about 3-10 and no running water for a large portion of the day. It was kind of annoying when we got back from the beach and wanted to get ready. It went out again a couple of times on Saturday. We had to check out at 12 but we didn't leave the resort until 7 so we booked a hospitality suite. We didn't know, however, that it was some guys office and him and another man would be in there the whole time we were showering and getting ready, that was a little creepy!Overall though, it was pretty fun. I didn't get sick at all which was my biggest fear, I brushed my teeth with bottled water but had ice in my drinks (they asured us it was purified). I don't know if I'd go back to this resort, maybe after visiting some other areas first.  
<Date>Feb 19, 2006

<Author>WLSToronto
<Content>Nice Time-helpful hints We stayed at the Punta Cana Grand Feb 5-12, 2006.The resort is very beautiful but small, which we didn't mind.Some Tips:I called the hotel directly to book our rooms. We reserved 4 in total.Our room was 4313 which is adjoining to 4315. The rooms on the top floors are much nicer because they have vaulted ceilings, however, when it rains it is quite noisy. I recommend earplugs.Buildings 1,2 and 3 are near the theatre and can be loud until around 11pm. Building 7 is all suites. They have been newly built and some even have bathtubs outside on the balcony, but they cost extra.The food was quite good. The American Grill wasn't that great but we really enjoyed the Italian Restaurant. The shrimp and Steak was great.Bring lots of bug spray just for the evenings.Get your towels in the morning because they tend to run out before noon.I found the DR to be more expensive for souvenirs than Mexico or Cuba.Bring lots of small bills because it's hard to find change. Don't bother with travellers chq's.My husband went on dune buggies one day. He had an amazing time. The only thing to keep in mind is that the 4 hour trip only consists of 1 1/2 hours of actual riding. It takes about an hour to reach the site and then stops part way for a brief tour of a sugar cane field and coffee field. He highly recommends it. Just be careful. Some of the vehicles lost wheels or broke down.Because our bus was leaving at 6pm on our last day, we had a hard time finding food for dinner. The restaurants are open most of the time but they all seem to close for an hour at 5pm for cleaning. We couldn't call room service because checkout was 12pm. I went over to the Windows buffet restaurant, although closed, for some help and they arranged for food to be brought to us. Overall we had a nice time. The resort needs a bit of updating and TLC but the grounds are lovely. It lived up to our expectations. We probably wouldn't go back simply because we would like to try out different resorts.We have been to the Xcaret in Mexico and to Cuba twice. I think Mexico is your best bet, but for the price we paid for the Punta Cana Grand, it was worth it.Hope this helps.  
<Date>Feb 17, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved the Punta Cana Grand!!!! We just got back from the Punta Cana Grand. We were there from Feb 4 -10th. It was amazing! The hotel and the grounds are beautiful. The staff never stop working and are the most wonderful people. The beach was beautiful - the men were out at 6:30am raking the seaweed every morning. All the people we met were mostly Canadian! There is always something going on, we took our 3 daughters with us aged 12, 14 and 18. They had a great time. They are building a casino but you would never know it as there was no noise due to the construction. We read some reviews before we left and were hesitant to book but went with our gut instincts and am so glad we did. I would highly recommend this resort and would return in a heartbeat.

<Author>beachbum2006
<Content>fantastic resort We stayed at this resort during the week of jan 29,2006 for 7 days.Bad PointsYou couldnt drink the water from the tap so it was a little worrying just washing your hands or showering but we knew about it before going.Some construction going on during the day but we were on the beach so who cares.1 couple went deep sea fishing with a guarantee to catch something-180US later and no fish.You had to buy a lock for the safe which meant you had to carry your key around-an extra 10US as well.That was all that was badThe good pointsThe buffet was excellent. Everyday there was a different selection and plenty of it. There was even ice cream during one lunch.Plenty of bottled water was available to bring to your room. Bar fridge with 2 beers and 2 bottled pop everydayThe housekeeping staff was great and the room was very clean. we lucked out in getting a 3rd floor so we had the high ceilings.The ac always worked!!The outback safari was worth the whole trip. By lunchtime most were feeling quite happy as the host was serving dominican champagne from the back of the truck.We tipped the right waiters and they always smiled when we arrived. The airport was very comfortable and spacious on departure and we waited for just an hour.Mostly Europeans and canadians on site-a very friendly crowd for a small resort.Nightly entertainment was great as each night had something different.Would we go back-without a doubt.Please have the idea in mind that this is a 3rd world country and they did a fabulous job!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic vacation!! I vacationed at the Punta Cana Grand from Feb. 5 - 12, 2006 and loved every minute of it! Our party consisted of 3 couples (6 people) and we all enjoyed our stay very much and would all return in a heartbeat! The food was very good (no one got sick --except for a small case of dehydration so please remember to drink lots of water!!) The best restaurant was the Italian place, the dinner menu at American Grill was excellent also (although we thought that portion sizes were a bit too small -- but just order seconds!) You can get pizza/fries/hamburgers/hotdogs at all hours of the night -- which is also pretty tasty -- we took full advantage of that. The beach is beautiful, but go early because it's difficult to get a hut/beach chairs by 11:00 am. The water has a little seaweed -- but it's the ocean so itsn't that to be expected? The pool is nice also -- the water aroebics is fun. The rooms are also nice -- always kept clean. The king size bed is very comfy. We found a few small ants in our sink one day but it's nothing a little water could not get rid of -- no biggie. The grounds are beautiful -- be sure to cross the bridge of love. The nightly entertainment is excellent too. The shows are fun to watch. Although so many things made this trip great, the one thig that stands out above all others is the staff. The staff are so friendly and really make you feel at home. They are very helpful and kind. Their level of service is amazing and they will do anything in their power to accomodate you. I have been to a few other places in the Carribean and I have never encountered staff that are as friendly as the staff at Punta Cana Grand. There are only 3 negative things that i will tell you about this resort. One is that sometimes you had to wait 10-20 minutes for beach towels -- this is not a huge deal but its enoying when you swim and dont have a towel to dry off on. Second is that i felt they could have more staff working at front desk -- especially at check-out hours. We were waiting quite long to check-out and this was enoying since we wanted to spend our last minutes on the beach. Lastly is that we had no idea that hospitality rooms must be booked ahead of time. We were never told this and therefore, did not have a room to freshen up in before our flight. Word of advice -- book your hospitality room right when you get there so that you dont have to shower at the pool like we did. Other than that stuff, great place, great vacataion and would definatley go back!!!  
<Date>Feb 14, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Overall great vacations 8 of us including 2 kids at 12 just got back from this hotel (2/6/06). We have been in Punta Cana 2 years ago but at different resort.Overall we did have a very great week of vacations: nice weather was in rendez-vous (few scattered showers in late night) and we will definitely recommend this hotel despite a bit windy locationGood things:Food is very good with large variety and theme nights, beef is so tender comparable to Angus AAA, besides Windows restaurant the main buffet, make sure to try The Italian and American Grill (beef medallions and shrimps camparis), build your own shakes with fresh tropical fruit at breakfast.Beach is spacious and clean, enough shades via coconut trees. Pools are clean and fed with constant fresh jets (lazy river is my favorite). Accomodations, stay away from building 5 due to mosquitoes. Try to ask for 3rd floor for high ceiling = spacious room but no elevator (good for exercise and digestion). For deluxe lovers, try building 7, the newest all suites with double jacuzzis (indoor and outdoor)and marble tiles in bathrooms but try to book through your travel agent or get the upgrade at purchase time online or expect to pay extra $US 90/night at destination. In-room safe is extra for all rooms $US 15/week.Excursions: beside the ones offered by tour operators, if you like to discover the local life style and do some city sightseeings, try to catch the public bus Sitrabapu to visit Higuey (45mns) with fare @ 60 pesos/person ($US 2.00). Points of interests: Basilica, Calle de La Libertad close to Bus station (moped taxi from Basilica @ 20 pesos/person) with variety of stores for local handcrafts (cut asking price to 50% and settle to max at 75%. Don't be shy to haggle back and forth, the locals get used to it and love to make you feel bad), at 500m behind the Basilica, you can shop at IBERIA, their local Wal-Mart style (Santo Domingo coffee and Brugal Anejo or Extra Anejo rums are good price).Merchants on the beach within the hotels resorts will ask you double for same items. Rule of thumb, always bargain to 1/2 asking price first or try to shop out of resorts facilities and at day light it is pretty safe.Staff members are so friendly: Guillermo, grilled fresh fish cook, Julio the bartender and juice shakes man, Steven and Victor the restaurants greeters, Angel the nautical club man, Paco the front desk clerk.Bad things:At reception, especially during the week, there is only 1 clerk at your service so don't be in a hurry and they always try to buy time and will ask you to come back a few hours later.Check-in is at 3PM, rooms are not always ready at your arrival (before 3PM). We had issues with our first given room (strong humidity smell, no hot water, tabs not working properly, bathrooms ceiling leaking and dripping, air conditioner malfunctioning. The next morning we had to wait and insist to talk to the hotel manager Milton, he was very courteous and with an almost full capacity, he managed to move us to another room in the afternoon.Tips: request in advance a courtesy room on your departure day (you have 1 hour to shower and get changed). Lock your luggage before leaving them at frontdesk on departure day, we read some previous reviews stating there were some reports on lost/stolen items or money. Luckily we did not have these bad experiences. To avoid the headaches, you may want to arrange a late check-out instead of 12PM(they ask $US 45/room but you can try to bargain at 11AM for $US 20 or 30).Hope this will help. Happy vacations!  
<Date>Feb 9, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great time at the Grand We stayed at the Punta Cana Grand from January 29 - February 5, and had a fabulous time. Before heading there, I was a little worried based on some of the reviews I had read. Don't listen to the people who complain about trivial things! Remember, you are travelling to a third-world country, you shouldn't go there expecting all the comforts and amenities as home.We had no problems with the room (second floor, Building 3). It was clean and very spacious. We left little presents and tips for the maid every day and we always had the amenities we needed in our room, including lots of bottled water.The beach was great, the seaweed is not that big of a deal! Pool was great too. It was always busy, but never felt crowded. If you like it to be a little quieter, sit on the opposite side from the Actiities Hut. And reserving chairs with your towel is a fact of life. We just did it in the morning on the way to breakfast and always had chairs.The food was what you would expect at an all-inclusive in this price-range. The buffet had lots of variety, although things were a little bland. For lunch, go to the beach restaurant (the ham and cheese croissant is really good) and the a la carte restaurants for dinner.I will admit that this resort doesn't have the best nightlife, but that's true for all of Punta Cana because it is isolated. That said, my friend and I, both 25, managed to have fun at night. We would either take in the entertainment or sit at the main bar before heading to the disco. We met lots of fun people this way, which really made the trip a lot more fun.We also took two day trips, both of which I would highly recommend. We went to Saona Island, which is the most beautiful beach I have ever seen in my life. We also went on the Outback Safari which is the best way to see the real Dominican and how the people really live.Overall, this was a great trip. Punta Cana is gorgeous and it's growing extremely fast. Don't be put off by all the construction going on -- they're just trying to make it better for us! By far, this hotel (and Punta Cana in general) has the friendliest, most helpful staff. They always have a smile and an Hola for you, and if you're friendly in return, you're guaranteed good service. I found I tipped less here than I have in Cuba and other parts of the Dominican.If you're looking for a safe, clean and enjoyable hotel to relax and soak up the sun, go to the Punta Cana Grand.  
<Date>Feb 8, 2006

<Author>Canada2006
<Content>Great Place To Go The Grand is a great place to go. This was my fifth time to Punta Cana, Grand being my 4th different place.(and I have been to Cuba). The Grand was fantastic. They are expanding, did not hear any construction noise, was in building 3 on the third floor facing the pool. They do everything in their power to make your vaction the best ever. The rooms are clean, no bugs, but one Gecco :), They now have a building 7 that has jacuzzi's in the rooms and they are more like suites. I was happy with my room. The food is very good. The main buffet had lots of selections to choose from, if you are going to the Italian get a group, even people you dont know. If you have 6 or more you usually get seated right away instead of the 30-60 minute wait. The American Grill over the beach resturant is good, the ribs are fatty, but the chicken is great. Daniel is up there, great guy. The best bartender in the resort is CASTRO, and the best entertainment is FERNANDO, he runs the activities, he was so great we gave him our portable DVD player when we left. The burgers are great that they cook on the beach, but they tend to under cook them but just ask and they will keep it on until you are ready. They all work so hard so please, just be really nice to them, and they will give you the world, unlike what other people say that they only work hard for tips, this is not true, we tip after we get to know them. If you are tipping, dont forget the lawn and beach maintainance people, they make the least amount of money and are always forgotten. Trips: The Dolphin Island is $85 american. Cheaper than other places, but still a lot of money. We were told that we would snorkel after, but did not. They take you by bus, 15 minutes, boat ride, 2 minutes to the pen that they are in. They have the dolphins kiss you then shake your hand. They sell the pics for $8 each. Have them record your time on disk, you can buy it for $45 after. I would have paid but did not pre-request it. When they put you in the middle of the pen with the dolphins dont stand back and watch, pet them, they keep moving so you need to also. DONT touch their heads for fins! Rub their belly softly, they will roll over and sing for you. We thought when we got there we were ripped off (even our boys 13 and 16), but after we left we had a perma grin for hours. There is a snorkling trip offered for $18 and it is worth it because there is no snorkling off the resort beach. This is the only thing that disappointed us because we like to do this everyday after breakfast so we misssed this alot.The only complaint is that water is not available when you want. They can actually get in trouble giving you bottled water, you get 2 bottles a day in your room and they will give it to you by the glass only. I like my bottled water, espically after a LOOOONNNNNGGGGG night. Go to the beach bar and have CASTRO make you the OLIVES, they are SOOOOOOOOOOOO good. Have a great time and your holiday is what you make it.Canada  
<Date>Feb 8, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Alright but I probably wouldn't go back We stayed at the Punta Cana Grand from January 28 to February 4th. When we first arrived checking in was a little slow, but nonetheless we got our room. Immediately I was not happy, we were on the first floor in building two, the sliding doors did not have locks on them (remember we are on the first floor here), there was a gecko on the floor, the bathroom had water on the floor and the handle to flush the toilet was hanging off the toilet. I called front desk and they sent maintenance. He was able to fix the sliding door and installed a new lock for the door. I did not want to stay in this room for all the other problems and requested to move. Milton at the front desk moved us the next morning to the third floor, much better. The rooms on the third floor are much nicer and have higer ceilings so they feel more spacious. After getting our new room I was happier. The food was good, buffet had several options, the a la carte restaurants were better. If you are going to the Italian restaurant go early or expect to wait a while, the food is good. I preferred the Tex-Mex a la carte restaurant, it was much more relaxed. If you go to the tex-mex Osvaldo is the best server there, a lot of fun and great service. The beach was fine, water a little cloudy but there is a lot of seaweed which gets annoying, it was also very breezy so we tended to stay at the pool more. There is an adult pool and if you want to relax and read a book that is where you should go. The main pool is filled with daily entertainment, but it also tends to get loud and crowded. In general the resort was fine, nothing to write home about. They are renovating, and adding a casino so I imagine it will be much nicer in time. If you are staying there ask to stay in building 7, it is the newest building and much nicer than the rest. My main complaint was that there is no night life, if you want to watch the shows, which are pretty uneventful that will keep you busy for an hour or so, but other than that nothing else is really going on. Probably a nicer place for families as it is casual and nothing fancy. Like I said in the title, alright, but I probably wont go back.  
<Date>Feb 6, 2006
