<Author>TennisGuy27
<Content>Not a 5 star or a 4 star On Arrival:- You were greeted by a cocktail - nice - but they ran out of rum.- I asked our agent for second floor away from the construction, and was put on the first floor next to the construction. It is noisy and totally wrong for a guest to be placed there. They did move us to a room with an ocean front view (Thank you) after we phoned our agent and talked to the front desk about 3 times.- The bell boys were very nice and expediant.Food and Drink:- There is no substantial food to eat between 4:00pm and 6:30pm other than room service. Other resorts I have visted, usually have snacks, fruit bars to visit and eat through out the day. Punta Cana Grand (PCG) had some stale looking Pizza by the bar. This is not a 5 star feature.- The dinner buffet is ok, there is a lot to choose from, but some hot food items were cold when the should be hot. The breakfast buffet had standard stuff - not bad, and lunch was the same as dinner.- The Tex Mex Place - the portions were small, the meat was cold, the service was very slow.- The italian place was very nice - good food, good service- The grill on the beach served hamburgers and hot dogs - the hamburger I ate was still red.- The beach front cafe - the pizza I ate was stale (sitting out for a long time), and the salad I ate was small and wilted.- Beverages - good selection- room service - expect to wait 1 hour for basic food (burgers, salad) - not good.- Overall - the food was well below par for a 5 star or even a 4 star.Rooms:- As noted we were in 2 different rooms. For the first 2 nights we were by the construction, on the first floor. The construction starts at 7:00am. the TV in this room, was 13 and had no remote. This is not even 2 star as far as I am concerned.- the second room had a 27 TV (Much better) and was on the ocean - a very nice room.- Both rooms were spartan in terms of amenities, they had hair dryers, and ironing boards, but they did not offer a lot of hand towels, they offered one bar of soap. The tiles had some black mold in the seems, and the joints to the doors had rust - this makes the place look run down - again 3 star.- the worst thing was the water pressure - often no hot water, or low pressure. Again - I have been to resorts all over the world, and have not had this problem day in and day out.Activities:- the beach - was fantastic - water was warm, and sand was great. Seaweed was a daily issue - but never a big one in terms of my enjoyment.- the pool - the water was a bit cool - but a very nice looking pool.- the hot tub - well it was under repairs.- water sports, they had boats and the usual fare.- tennis - very good - clay courts - good pros.- shows/movies - very good variety.Service:- The people were very nice - no complaints. The people of the Dominican - are some of the nicest people in the world.- I had a lot of $1 bills - it does make a difference in the service level.- I asked for extended check out - and we were able to get it till 6:00pm - they charged $30 USD.Overall:- this is not a 5 star or a 4 star resort, this is a 3.5 star resort. There were to many basic things that were not working to make the grade to even a 4 star resort.I would not go back for the 5 star prices I paid, if you paid 3 star prices - it would be worth it.

<Author>clydesowner
<Content>The resort was way above our expectations ! We went to the Grand on Jan 22 and returned on jan 29. Having done a ton of reserach in advance you are always a bit skeptical about how accurate everyones comments are. This resort which is rated by most tour companies as a 4 or 41/2, was exactly that. From the moment we arrived we were overwhelmed by the experience. Naturally there will always be small things here and there that may not meet your expecations, but overall they were almost non existent at the Grand. I have reviewed each section below.Check-inNo problems. Arrived mid-day, they had 3 or 4 behind the desk and we were the only bus at the resort. Check in less than 10 minutes.ARoomsStayed in building 2. Away from construction zones, centrally located with balcony on 2nd floor.Hight reccomend paying $ 15 for the room safe. It gives you added peace of mind in respects to your money and travel docs.Room was clean, standard. 2 Queen beds. The a/c worked excellent. All other ammenities would find at home where present. Stocked mini bar - you may have to keep on the maid service about keeping beer in it. Also bottled water doesnt get passed out a freely as it does here. And my travelling partner who is a diabetic, had a devil ofa time getting diet coke or coke lite. We tipped the maid at the end of the trip personally, and whenever they did a little extra ( leave beer as we asked ) we flipped them a single.AGroundsAbsolutely beautiful. Around the clock working non stop. The staff that work on this are the unsung heroes as each day when you wake up, everything is clean, tidy and ready to go. Great place to take pics, clean. The great thing about Grand is the size of the resort. It is not overly big so you can access everything with ease from your room and never have far to go. But you never find it crowded. You definitely have a chance to run into people you have met all week. Please alos dont be put off by the entrance on arrival as the casino is under construction and our bus had to back into the resort. Once you went into the lobby,any fears were gone. A+WeatherWhat ever you think about the forecasts calling for showers each day, ignire it. We had a shower on arrival day briefly, and on the Monday AM, but that was it for the whole week. The sun was out by mid morning, some days a bit of cloud cover, always a breeze. Likely around 88 each day - would be well over 90 with no breeze, evenings nice - 70-75 or so. What was funny is they post the forecast at the resort each day - always chance of showers 30% rain - it was hilarious, Dont worry about it all - it'll be perfect..A+PoolNo problems here at all. Plenty big enough to accomodate all guests. It kind of wraps around the middle of the resort and leads up to the swim up bar. As usual, pool chairs are at a premium, so if you want a prime spot, get don there early. I noticed on the sheet in our room about all services that chairs can only be reserved for a max 3 hrs - however this is un-enforeable. So dont stress out and get an early start each day and youll be fine. Temp is a bit chilly, but once the sun is out by mid-day, its comfortable. Take a look at the lazy floating pool behind bldg 2, no one uses it and its a bit missed by everyone.ABeachThe beach provided alot of shade and sufficent space to lay your chair without crowding. I must say things got a bit windy. Apparently a bit more than usual. The beach was clean, the resort beside us (allegro punta cana ) was always filthy. Again seaweed wont kill us people. The put the big iceburg back in the water by Thurs or so and i gave it a go. Lets just say its not as easy as it looks and hen u do get up, thats a long way up. But enjoy. The thing about the beach is that if you turn left and walk 15 minutes or so you will find a bout a 2mile stretch of uninhabited beach - no resorts, a few vendors, but awesome clean, turquoise waters. Absolutely a post card setting. If youre also bold enough you can walk an hr further to the bavaro stretch of resorts and check out that beach. Worth the walk...Grand Beach B+Uninhabited beach A+FoodNo complaints here at all. Great variety at buffet. Food always hot. Quick service. It amazes me at how many bad reviews this place got about food. But some people will complain about anything and do forget that thisis the DR, not Manhattan. Never had any stomach battles all week. The tex Mex a la carte was freat - never made it to the Italian- here service was a bit slow. The beauty thing at this resort is that no reservations are required. The beach restaurant was great- good north american selection, fast service except 1 day. The do a buffet on the beach each day ie - seafood paella - but the crowning meal is the weekly Thurs beach party - unbelievable, all food you can imagine, all decorated up with live music. They go to a ton of work and effort to pull this off and the resort and staff deserve high marks as this is a once in a lifetime type of nite. Enjoy !Also snacks during the day are a bit meagre - beach restaurant is open, but mainly youll find pizza and sandwiches at the main bar. Another a la carte restaurant would add much more variety also. Keep in mind that the resort has 24 hr room service, included with package.Overall- food service, quality, and presentation. Excellent.AEntertainemntAgain, Punta Cana doesnt rock at nite. But mind you after a day in the sun drinking and eating, most of us dont have much left to give. There is an adequate number of bars, there is a sports bar/disco ( not bad ). A piano/Cigar bar - apparently Karoke some nites. They have a 730 movie for the kids at stage, and 930 live show for all else. The team does a pretty good job at entertaining you.Otherwise we found after a good dinner, a walk, and a drink, that it was time to turn it in and prep for the next day.BTW - be sure to visit the adult pool tucked away at front of resort, small, with great bar service - Domingo - here is the only place you get cahir drink service. He was a awesome..BExcursionsDid 1 full day jeep excursion. Was a blast. Its a long day and we pretty much caned out the cooler, but our guide Santos was very gracious. We saw a lot of the countryside, had a great lunch, rode horseback, swam at a great beach. Note - if you thought you've seen a pothole at home- yur're in for a treat- ashphalt and road maint apparently isnt an issue here. Giant crater on most of teh roads on our safari trip. No complaints, but its hilarious.Did the 1/2 day Marinarium - great thing about this is that it departs next door to the resort. Its a 1/2 day/. Was great - snorkelled with sjharks, mata rays, had a nice cruise uo the coast, few drinks, got out for a drink in a shallow pool. Highly recomend it. Its nice and relaxing and only a 1/2 day.ASunwingKudos to Lynn who met us at the airport, very friendly, and to Franklin - who was our rep at hotel. Only think i didnt like was that if Sunwing is going to include bonus features in brochure - do it - as guests we shouldnt have to cahse and follow uo for what we we supposed to get. Never got our welcome drink, turn down service, beach towel in room, welcome letter - i didnt need this anyway - but it look bad on sunwing for not delivering. We did get our botlle of rum on day 5 or so but only after a bit of hunding to get it.Anyways, in anut shell. Read all the reviews you want, at teh end of the day its up to you to decide if the resort me your expectations. I think Punta Cana grand does, and if you stack it up against other resorts for the amount you pay - its well worth it.Enjoy your trip..

<Author>viperstile
<Content>Punta Cana....GRAND?????? We are a family of 4 with 2 children, this review will be aimed at young families. This resort was clean. A lot of the food tasted different than Canadian or American food. Milk is pretty thick and not like at home, not bad just not like ours. No one got sick in anyway. The pop is good and the juice fresh squeezed and very yummy. The sun is VERY VERY strong so grease up young ones with block. The beach is really nice and not too hot under a palm. The water was a little cloudy but you could still see bottom. Parents, there is a weak undertow, nothing that would bother an adult but may cause a problem for a young child. Keep them close and wear a floaty. There were a few european women who went topless (not that I am complaining). They covered up when they walked around. My kids didn't even notice. ONE BIG NOTE TO PARENTS...there are no laws to prohibit smoking anywhere. Several times we were seated having dinner and everyone was around us with cancer sticks lit and fuming. Very unpleasant. Very ignorant. Windows is a great place to eat smoke free. DADS...everything depends on tips, if you don't tip, don't expect to get service. It gets a little annoying after a few days. Keep a lot of U.S ones in your pockets and your wallet in the safe. Keep your eye on the house keeping staff. Little things tend to grow legs. I understand they are poor and really need what we take for granted but be aware of what you leave out. If you don't leave a tip everyday for the house keeping staff don't expect much. They are however very friendly. If you want extra pop or water just ask them and give them a few dollars. They will keep you topped up. Same goes anywhere, tips = service. Simple. MOMS...we met some friends at the resort. 2 females in their mid to late 20's. They told us that some feminine hygiene products went missing and some razors were used. Maybe leave out some razors and women stuff as a tip, they need it. Front desk personnel were not the most helpful but still not bad by any means. DO NOT stay in the buildings closest to the entertainment area. VERY VERY loud for kids. We were moved to building 4 and it was quiet. Construction noise is really not an issue. If any people with young families are going here you will have fun and it is safe. Security everywhere. Please email me with questions. rhilljmac2@mountaincable.net  
<Date>Feb 3, 2006

<Aspects>

<Author>proudmom19
<Content>Worth every penny!!!       View from balcony  
<Date>Feb 2, 2006
<Rating>5	5	4	-1	5	-1	5	-1	
<Aspects>

2	17(view):1	191(balcony):1

<Author>KL81
<Content>Lovely vacation! We stayed at the Punta Cana Grand from January 23-30, 2006. We were a group of 2 couples and some girlfriends all in 20s.We had read a lot of the reviews beforehand so we felt fairly prepared as far as what to expect on the bad side.We were served 2 drinks while waiting in line to check in- and the line was substantial. Patience is a virtue anywhere in Latin America and it is no different in the DR, no matter what star resort you are dealing with.Speaking spanish is also enormously helpful and since I speak Spanish fluently, my experiences may be a little bit different than those who do not speak any at all. While it wasn't a huge advantage, I did receive some preferential treatment from time to time. You will get the same if you are pretty blonde though too!We requested a room on the third floor and it is true- they are quite nice. We stayed in building 5. Unfortunately the construction continues on both sides of the resort- building 1 and building 5 and 4 on the sides closest to the lobby are affected the worst. I only heard faint bits of the construction starting around 9 am. And they definitely continued untill 11 pm or later. We noticed it little because we spend the vast majority of our day outside of our room. I was very happy with the cleanliness of the rooms and didn't see any bugs or cockroaches which was great for me (though most people wouldn't expect that). The maids generally came around as we were leaving in the morning (between 9-10) so if we needed something like extra water or towels, they were happy to accommodate after we asked them personally. There was three of us in the room and we tipped $5 US every other day and had a pristine room. One day, the maid even carefully lined up all of our shoes for us! The disco is kind of loud so expect to hear it from most places at the resort.The beach was great. Don't quite understand about the seaweed complaints. Depending on the weather, there is some but staff is cleaning it up all day long. Check out the resorts next door where there is ZERO seaweed clean up and it is quite horrendous! If you want a quieter, even more pristine area to swim, just walk left down the beach past 2 resorts and the vendors to the point. You can go out further into the water and the water is GORGEOUS!We rented kayaks one day and had a great time. There was never a shortage of water craft- no need to book in advance (we weren't allowed anyway).Beach chairs were often a challenge! I blame this more on silly stupid resort-goers than the resort itself. At any time, there is at least 50% of the chairs unoccupied but saved by people's towels. I am not talking about people who went for a dip in the sea/pool but people who are gone ALL DAY and save these chairs for whatever fleeting moment they feel like returning. This is really agitating! Don't do it. In any case, we often had to hike to other parts of the resort (adult pool etc) and drag our chairs down to the beach. Some people were not as kind and simply removed towels from these chairs and went on their way with the chairs! The main pool was nice- never too crowded and the water (pool and sea) was very refreshing, not tooo warm at all. Adult pool was mellow and a nice lagoon like pool next to building 2.I brought 20-$1 bills for tipping and that was more than enough. We were a group of 7 so we took turns going to the bar and fetching drinks and left a dollar or so each time and that helped. Beach Papi is GREAT! Since bottled water was hard to come by, we often greased a bar tender at night to get a giant bottle for the next day. Greasing goes a LONG way at this resort.Food: I found the quality was good but there are some tips. There is nowhere to eat between 10-12:30 in the morning and between 5-6:30 pm. Room service was not very good during the day and evening hours and so-so late at night. We tried to get it one day and were hung up on several times. Our friends ordered one night and they never came... Snacks are NOT 24 hours though during the day you can usually come by pizza at the bar and there is hamburger/hot dog/fries area near the beach.You cannot reserve at the a la carte but that would be helpful. IF you plan on eating after 7:30-8pm, you will wait an HOUR to get a seat in one of the restaurants. We didn't always understand the wait as there were always empty tables but oh well. Be nice to Carlos at Da Marios! So eat early or grab a bit beforehand so you can enjoy your a la carte. The portions at the American Grill were quite small (not really any vegetarian options) and the service at both restos was quite atrocious (as in slow, inconsistent, people running around not quite sure what to do). Da Mario's food was a lot better but again the vegetarian options were limited. The buffet varied. Breakfast was usually pretty good. Lunch at the garden restaurant is good and the service generally excellent and quick.Entertainment: Some of the night time shows were actually quite good! We really liked the Michael Jackson show and the Tropicana dance show was also quite good. Karaoke at the piano (actually a Keyboard) bar on a regular basis which can be fun but can also be really annoying depending on the crowd. You can get quality alcohol at this bar. The disco is open until 2 am and it appeared that they had one single arrangement of the same songs at the same time every night! We enjoyed ourselves when there were a lot of people around. We went to Mangu at another resort which is about 20 minutes away. The taxi price goes from $18-30 US each way depending on how many people are in (takes a max of 10 people). It costs $5/couple to get into the club and it includes one free drink. Thereafter drinks are about $4-5 each (ie. pre-drink at the resort). The place has 2 levels- one with more traditional latin music and upstairs is more euro-style (house, techno etc.). Fun animators and a good mixed crowd of locals and tourists. I went on a Thursday and it was enough people but not too crowded. A lot more crowded on weekends and a gross foam party upstairs with unhygienic water all over the place. Open until 6 am. Worth it if you are a group and are younger.Excursions: We went to Isla Saona and enjoyed it once we got on the water. We had to stand around at the beach waiting for a speed boat for a long time and it seemed really unorganized. We went with Hotel Beds through the hotel. You can get it about $10 cheaper a person if you book with another agency but do it in advance of arriving in the DR (can be done over internet) because making calls is expensive ($2 to make each collect call and like $3 a minute or more to call). I didn't find the motor boat to be rough at all and the Island was nice but not that much more extraordinary than the water 1 mile down the beach from the Sunscape. The natural swimming pool was cool but SO many people were touching the star fish and taking them out of the water. No one warned or asked people not to do that so I was being a ball breaker and going around telling people how bad it is to touch wildlife as if it weren't obvious how damaging that can be (not that the gas from the boats etc. is better but still, lets TRY to preserve the ecosystem as much as possible). The buffet on the island was okay and endless drinks simply means as much rum and beer as you can get. I really liked the catamaran. It was animated by a very nice, high-energy, young group of dominicans who kept our drinks topped up and danced merengue with us.I would definitely advise AGAINST doing the horseback riding, at least from the agency that sells tours from the resort (by the pool). They told us we would get 2 and a half hours of horseback riding alongside virgin beaches and time to swim etc. We got way less than 2 hours and the beaches were fairly unkempt and undesireable and the scenery not so great. We went through a damaged, half built hotel. Not so great. The one good thing was that my girlfriend and I went on the 10am ride and it was just us. I know how to ride and she trains race horses so we were allowed to go at our own pace (better than being stuck in a group of non-riders). My girlfriend was unimpressed with the health of the horses though she said they still had some energy and said the bits used for the horses were very cruel and unnecessary. The riding is not included at the hotel- it is simply a lesson which is a 10 minute loop around some bush area. Perhaps there is a better agency but this one was not good.Cigars: don't buy them at the hotel shop. You can bargain with them but you can get them at very reasonable, less expensive prices at the duty free shop at the Punta Cana airport! I was also very surprised how few Americans were at this resort. We are Canadians and I would say the 2 biggest nationalities at this resort are Canadian and Spanish (from Spain). After that, there is a sprinkling of Germans and Italians. A lot of older groups, younger couples and some younger groups of people. OVerall a nice mix of people.Overall we really enjoyed our time at the resort and in the DR. It is not a Cancun so don't expect it but I enjoyed the fact that we could have a mellow time and also go out to a club outside the resort if we wanted (at way cheaper than you would pay in Cancun). The beach was great, weather was great and the resort was very nice. Service can be so so but it is a different country and different culture and you have to understand that. If you want Americanized service then Florida or Hawaii are probably better options.

<Author>yeager
<Content>Great LOW BUDGET Resort I must justify my review (and title) by saying that my wife  I have travelled extensively and usually stay at 5 star Riu resorts or Palaces.If this is the standard YOU are used to, this resort will disappoint you in many ways.This resort just changed hands from Sunscape to Globalia and you can tell Sunscape let it run down until they finally sold it off.In General, the grounds are clean and maintained. The building are showing their age, but you can see the attempts being made to do repairs.In one corner of the resort the Casino is STILL being built, and on the other side of the resort another building for more rooms is being finished. You will NOT escape the sound of saws or hammering, but you can keep it to a minimum with the right rooms.Courtyard rooms are best if you don't want the noise from the 24 hour restaurant  bar during the night, and closer to the beach keeps you away from the construction. As mentioned by another reviewer the 3rd floor has very high ceilings and makes the room look larger. Thank to that review, our request made the holiday tolerable.Food was take a chance. In the Italian restaurant we found quality and service acceptable on the Tuesday, however on the Friday the service was hurried. Seafood soup was the vegetable soup with a couple shrimp thrown in. My lucky wife even had a centipede swim to the surface and bob around before swimming to the edge to climb onto the bowl rim and check out the room. The waiter called the manager who calmly took the soup away with out saying a word and disappeared. Guess its normal for them, but I prefer my soup to stay in the bowl. The angel hair pasta was normal spaghetti and the Ceasar Salad was made with greenberg lettuce even though the menu stated romaine.All is not lost though. Windows (the main buffet) offers a reasonable selection and there is something for everyones taste. Do not expect 5 star quality. Expect the same quality you would get at a company barbeque at a local park.Chairs were plentiful. Some people are saving chairs by leaving their towels and going off to eat or sleep. I usually gave 30 minutes grace, if they didn't return the chair was available. But staff would bring out more chairs if asked.Bar service was good. The people make the difference.They make em weak, they make em strong, they make em however you want, just ask.My complaint would be the absence of the International brand drinks as advertised. I could find no Canadian or American brands at any of the bars (and I asked). Maybe the International Brands are from Spain.English is the THIRD language here. The Entertainment manager is Spanish as is the General Manager and the country is primarily Spanish. Most announcemnets are in Spanish first and if they remember, English. Most of the maids, maintenance, waiters, and some of the bartenders do NOT speak english. I can see why Americans do not come here.One final item about food. It is billed as 24 hour, yet between 10  11 pm and 10:30  11 am none of the eateries are open.Pools are great, as is beach and most of the activities crew will keep you entertained.If you want a LOW BUDGET resort with all the trimmings this will be great for you. If you are used to 5 star resorts, you will be disappointed. The country cannot be used as an excuse, since we have stayed down the beach at the Riu as well.  
<Date>Jan 31, 2006
<Rating>3	4	3	-1	3	-1	3	-1	
<Aspects>

62	0(staff):1	2(night):1	10(restaurant):1	20(look):1	24(floor):1	26(people):1	27(bar):1	28(close):1	29(minute):1	30(beach):1	32(check):1	39(return):1	43(leave):1	47(eat):1	60(hour):1	72(resort):2	94(noise):1	104(sleep):1	125(towel):1	134(available):1	135(build):3	142(bring):1	184(wife):1	198(chair):4	200(corner):1	244(mention):1	261(swim):2	399(usually):1	409(sound):1	423(menu):1	425(save):1	435(courtyard):1	505(age):1	528(ceiling):1	538(casino):1	564(reviewer):1	583(construction):1	729(hair):1	772(finish):1	797(lucky):1	878(normal):1	909(salad):1	1039(plentiful):1	1119(attempt):1	1143(pasta):1	1190(edge):1	1366(bowl):1	1398(repair):1	1424(climb):1	1601(escape):1	2097(3rd):1	2124(minimum):1	2534(surface):1	2620(grace):1	3320(hammer):1	3667(angel):1	3683(bob):1	4921(spaghetti):1	4982(lettuce):1	8537(ceasar):1	9220(rim):1	11493(centipede):1	
8	22(pool):1	30(beach):2	357(activity):1	530(country):1	1045(entertain):1	1179(riu):1	1654(crew):1	1965(excuse):1

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>great time...sorry to leave!! we stayed at the Punta Cana Grand from jan 13-20 and had a fabulous time. anyone who has a neagative review is either too picky, or too opinionated. this was a great place and i would not hesitate to go back. The food was pretty good, not all things were great but there was enough variety for even the picky eaters. The italian restaurant was great, we had dinner there 3 nights, and the beach party was amazing. the entertainment staff (men in black) were very good at getting everyone involved in activities (especially Fernando....two thumbs up for him).The nightly shows were very well put together and entertaining. The Disco rocked until 2am every night and it was busy every night we were there. the piano bar was a fun place to hang out after the stage show for Karaoke and singing. Jairo the bartender was great, it was a pleasure to chat with him almost every night.Tipping - although i believe tipping was important, i found we received better service from the staff we actually got to know and showed an interest in there lives rather than treat them as our servants. Thumbs up to Pena, Jairo, Joran, Domingo and Fernando. we liked the fact this was a smaller resort and met lots of nice people who felt the same way we did about the place. Please do not hesitate to book this place, and if you do......bring Eyore an apple (during the day he hangs out by the new casino tied to a tree. he would appreciate it)

<Author>jimhughes2001
<Content>Very nice but under construction, great food! We Stayed at the Punta Cana Grand Jan 19th to 26th 2006, which is still building a casino... yes the resort is under construction... i.e. no water for one day and no hot water for two days...and is now operated by Global Hotels. If you are going here, do not stay close to the constructionsite near buildings #1 and 2. I was in building 4 and this is the place to be close to everything!!!!! Steps from the beach, pool, bar, food... shall i go on. This is an older resort and could stand with a few minor repairs but the place is kept very clean and this place has the BEST food that I have ever had at an all inclusive. I would go back... when the construction is done in about 2-3 months time.This is a place that you can really be alone or with the party. 4.0 stars from me Feel free to Email me should you have any questions! PS Get to the Thursday nite beach party...its worth it!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very Nice Resort You will not be disappointed with this resort.The grounds are very nice. Although the resort was full it was not crowded. No lineups for any of the restaurants including the a la cartes. Food was good. Service was good. Try and get a room on the 3rd floor of the buildings. They are the best (nice high ceilings). Only the pool bar and the piano room had the premium drinks.I would rate this as a 4 star. Although I am listing some bad points for your information the good far outweighed the bad.A Couple of Bad PointsI would not say that the beach was the best. 4 out of the 7 days there was seaweed coming on shore. If they did not get it all cleaned up in the morning you could smell it in the heat.Get a safe. 3 rooms which did not opt for the safe had their money stolen.We were to depart the hotel at 6:30pm and for some reason we could not find a place to get food from 5-6:30pm. Not sure why as it is supposed to have 24 hr snacks.It was the only day I was not impressed with the service from a couple of the restaurant staff. We had to eat at the airport.Some constuction going on beside buildings 1 and 2.You could hear power saws until after midnight.

<Author>TheConlins
<Content>Fantastic Family Vacation All in all this was the perfect all inclusive resort for our family. The staff was absolutely wonderful to our daughters (aged 21 months and 4 years). Our thoughts on each of the restaurants:1. The buffet was nice and quick - The omelette bar for breakfast, and the grilled steak tasted great for dinner. You could also get creative with the grilled seafood/pasta bar2. The italian restaurant had fantastic service and a great atmosphere. Food was not exceptional as far as Italian foods go, but was good.3. The Tex Mex Restaurant was nice. The beef medallions were great, and the music was entertaining.4. The beach restaurant offered a different food each day. Each was done well. We ate lunce there 4 of the 6 days we were there.5. The beach a la carte restaurant was nice and had things like burgers/hotdogs and pizza. It was open a little later than the beach pavillion.6. The beach party was out of this world. The best of everything with a lot of very nice touches. There was a cauldren of stew over a bed of coals - a cigar rolling man selling cigars - pasta buffet, a side of beef, seafood, and more. Since we were great to all the staff all week, they gave us the best seats in the house to see the show also.There were family movies each night at 7:30 that were appropriote for kids, with a show at 9:30. The shows were entertaining and again, perfect for families.We had originally planned a 4 night trip, and the hotel was very accomodating (and reasonably priced) in extending our trip/helping change our return flight. We originally had a Friday AM flight, and changed it to a Saturday PM flight to get two full days for about $300 US. The hotel manager also was helpful in sending to us via Fex Ex a picture fame our daughter had painted by the pool.Tipping the staff a few bucks went a very long way - we never had an empty drink, always got the best seats in the a la carte restaurants, always had a clean room with a well stocked mini bar and plenty of towels. We received first class service every minute of every day. Our kids were absolutely spoiled as well, and treated like princesses. A lot of Europeans dont seem to understand the benefits of tipping and I heard several complaining about slow service, ect. Bring a pocketful of $1's - I think i tipped out about $100 total, and it was well worth it.I did bring larger, insulated cups to drink from that were about 3X the size of those provided by the resort - drinks stayed cool longer and didnt have to make nearly so many trips to the bar. If you like cigars - do NOT buy any from the beach venders - they are pathetic fakes. Buy from the Tobaco Shop by the lobby. I especially liked the freshly rolled cigars they sell for about $4 US. I would watch him roll my cigar before I smoked it.The snorkel trip was nothing special if you've snorkled elsewhere. Maybe St. John USVI and the BVI's have spoiled me, but I wasnt over impressed with this trip. We did have a great time on the horseback riding trip. Jose looked a little 'rough around the edges', but was a great guide. He took pictures of us as we went along, and cracked open coconuts for us to eat/drink. I wanted to take the safari trip, but we ran out of time. I heard that was loads of fun.The unspoiled beach about 1 mile walk north was a great place to watch the sun rise if you like that sort of thing. In summary, it is a great family resort, and we can't wait to return. I did not get to the Disco or cigar/piano bar, so cant say anything about them. We will not hesitate to come back to the same resort on our next trip to Punta Cana. We've been on at least a dozen Carribean vacations, and this one ranks very near the top of our list.  
<Date>Jan 12, 2006

<Author>melsmorgan
<Content>Good time...(New Years Eve to Jan. 6th) New Years Eve:My wife and I just returned from the Sunscape. We arrived on New Years Eve, which was pretty cool. The main dining area (Windows) was decorated according to the holiday and had special food spread including lobster, filet mignon, etc. At midnight, champagne was served and they had a fireworks display. We were both impressed.(Below are some things from the rest of the week)Staff:As mentioned before on this board, they were all very nice and courteous. Most spoke English very well and if they didn they still tried their best to help you. Grade: B+Room:I've seen some pretty negative reviews regarding the rooms and I'm a bit perplexed by it. The room was nice enough and very clean. The bed was large (king size), but a little stiff. Satellite TV (in English and a few other languages) and mini-bar was supplied w/ a few cervezas and soda. Grade: B+ Construction:We were aware of the construction before arriving but they just so happened to put us in the room closest to the construction (5301)...and our balcony faced the renovations. To be honest, it was pretty loud and they started working around 8:30am. If you are a late sleeper or were hungover, you'd be hating life. We were able to get out of the room for most of the day so it didn't impact us too bad, but I could see how it could. Grade: C-Food:Obviously, the food on New Years was great. However, we weren't overly impressed with it the rest of the week. The Italian restaurant was below average. I actually liked making my own pasta dish at the buffet better than eating the chef Boyardee version at the Italian place. The American Grill was very good, unfortunately, we only ate there once. It was opened sporadically...prob due to the hotel running at less than maximum capacity following the holiday. My wife enjoyed the make your own burrito bar at the beach and the fresh ceviche in the buffet. Grade: C+Drinks:One review said the drinks were watered down. Not true at all. If you watch the bartender, at least one shot of alcohol was in each of our drinks. My main complaint was they didn't make the drinks very well. Mojito's were hit and miss (along w/ the other tropical drinks) so I mostly stuck to vodka/tonic, rum/coke, and beer. My wife enjoyed the Chi Chi Kakapuca- a coconut/orange juice/rum drink, but again- it was always made differently by each bartender. Grade: CPools:We really enjoyed the adult pool. My wife and I do not have children so we ventured to the adult pool (18+ yrs of age only) to relax. For the most part, it was excellent and Domingo (the bartender) was very friendly. The only negative was that on our last full day there, the pool had a really fishy, sewer-like smell. We ended up going to the main pool and enjoyed ourselves. Overall, very nice. Grade: A-Beach:The beach was okay, but we were a little put off by the seaweed on the beach and in the water. We knew it was coming (from many posted reviews here), but still preferred not to deal with it. But, the sand was nice and the water was pretty clear so that was cool. Grade: C**Beach sidenote: One guest was complaining to an attendant about the seaweed. The attendant told him the Caribbean side of DR didn't have as much.Beach Activities:The free rental equipment is pretty neat...just make sure you reserve the boat, windsail, etc. at least one day before you want to go. Also, verify the reservations the next morning. If possible, make the reservation for the morning/early afternoon hours. It seemed that the water got much more crowded in the afternoon (speedboats racing by you), which did make me a little nervous on the paddle boat. We also did the two hour snorkel excursion. Basically, there is an area marked about a mile out where they drop you off. It was a little crowded, but many a fish to see! Just make sure you bring a slice of bread from Windows to feed the fish. Also- you probably won see the nurse sharks and manta rays they tell you you could see, so be prepared for that. My wife was a little disappointed there. You'll be swarmed by the fish though! Pretty neat. Grade: BNight Life:The shows are pretty lame, but they do their best. Don't expect Vegas style entertainment (though they all are said to be from there). We went to the Piano Bar one night and Dave was excellent. Very adult humor in some of his songs so if that type of thing offends you, you may want to pass when he is playing. The best night was our last night there when they had dinner and a movie (Batman Begins) out on the beach. That was excellent.Grade: B-Spa:My wife went to the spa for a massage on our last full day there and really enjoyed it. The prices were ery reasonable?according to her- $75 includes a $10 tip for a 65 minute lymphatic massage. She said the massage technician seemed to be an expert at what she was doing. The only annoying part was that there was also construction going on near the spa, so when she was in the room she still heard lots of hammering and things like that- not very relaxing. Otherwise though, she said it was great. Grade: B+Overall:For the most part, we relaxed by the pool, read and had a few drinks. I'd go back again, probably for less time, though not sure my wife would. She was a bit bored, but she has more of an active personality. Just remember, this is a 3rd world country so don't expect it to be like the US. If that's what you want, go to Key West or something like that. Grade: B-*feel free to email me if you have any questions*  
<Date>Jan 12, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good time but will stay at The Beach next time! In Aug. 2005, I stayed at The Grand with three other people. Overall, we enjoyed ourselves. I cannot say enough about the staff! Out of every place I've been to in the caribbean, the staff at The Grand went above and beyond to make sure we all had a great time. The food wasn't too bad compared to some all-inclusive deals I've had. We did run into some problems though! The room was kinda run down. We literally fell onto the bed from being exhausted one night, and the bed fell to the floor! It took two days to finally be fixed. My boyfriend and I went to the beach and took off our outerware to go swimming. This included a dress, his shorts, and our shoes. We also had our digital camera rolled up in our towel and two drinks sitting there. After ten minutes tops of swimming, we went back and ALL OUR THINGS were stolen! Shoes, drinks, camera, everything. To make matters worse, we were CHARGED for our towels (you are given 2 towels with your towel card)! My advice to anyone is to guard your towels and leave all cameras in your room. We had no pictures of our trip! Other than that, had a great time. Going back in march but to The Beach.  
<Date>Jan 2, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>It was definitely not a 5A as Apple said it was! We stayed here from 12/17 to 12/24THE GOOD:Beautiful beaches and pools. Wonderful staff.THE BAD:Rooms are small compared to other 5 Apple rated resorts we've stayed in, even other Sunscape Resorts we have stayed in. The Resort is 'Under Construction'. The first room they gave us was constant hammering, circular saws, and construction workers yelling at each other. We were moved and that did get us away from the construction but there was no hot water for the first three days. The hot water started and then there was NONE. Hot and cold water was OFF for hours at a time more times than I can count.The food was good, well presented, but you had to be careful of what you ate. The hot food was not kept hot and the cold food was not kept cold. Even though my wife and I were careful we both got travelers sickness. Imagine defecating and vomiting in a toilet a dozen time and not being able to flush it. This was not uncommon, of about a dozen families we spoke to at least one of the family members in more than half of the groups were sick with the same intestional problems we had.My advise would be to avoid this resort until they finish with their construction.  
<Date>Dec 28, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>great trip My wife and I went the last minute. Greatest trip we ever took, especially for the price.The good:--good and friendly staff--nice grounds--excellent weather--food was unbelievable, especially the buffet--room was good but not a 5-star in U.S. standards, but it was clean and confortable.--family orientedThe bad: --they had the water on and off (due to new construction) without notice. Some --not us-- were very upset about it.--even though you did not have to tip, it was almost impossible to find small bills ($1.00) to give an excellent staff a tip.Recommendations:--go with the attitude that it is a third world country that does not parallel the U.S. Everything is in slow motion and the ammenities do NOT match that of ours.--take $1.00 bills with you to tip. The staff needs and, more importantly, deserve a little extra.If you go with the right attitude, relax, go with the flow, you will love it.Also, we would highly recommend the Outback Safari. It was very educational and well done. A very rough ride on some of the roads but well worth every penny.If you go, we certainly hope you can enjoy it as much as we did.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I Would Stay Here Again We stayed at this All inclusive resort from 12/13 to 12/20.--------------------------THE GOOD:The resort was very clean and it seemed at times there was more staff than there was guests...let's say the staff was highly visible. They took great care to make sure their grounds were clear of litter, kind of like Disneyland. The resort beach was also very clean, despite the fact they had beach food service.The food was very good, but not gourmet or what I would call outstanding. Let's say this...I gained 5 pounds during the week. The buffets have a nice variety of food, from fish to red meat to veggies to a nice salad buffet and dessert buffet (great chocolate mousse, almond pastry and mini custard filled donuts/eclairs). They had different themes every night with different decorations, alcoholic beverages and food.The a la carte restaurants had nice decor, great service and a higher quality of food. No reservations required and the wait was less than 10 minutes at the worst. The a la carte restaurants have many courses so it is expected that dining is leisurely, but one night we came late and wanted to catch that night's show and asked them to hurry...unbelievably they served us and we ate 4 or 5 courses in 45 minutes...so they are very accomodating.There were birds on the grounds (we saw a Green Heron, an egret, a duck, some Flamingos, and various other smaller tropical birds). There were fountains as well.The staff was EXTREMELY friendly and very accommodating. They have maid service both in the morning and at night.This resort had a whole bunch of activities during the day as well as a nightly movie and entertainment following. The entertainment ranged from fair to good, depending on the night. The majority of the movies were fairly recent releases to DVD.They had a caribbean market with local goods two of the seven nights with different vendors. The quality seemed higher than the stores they had on the beach.The beach is endless and it is a quick walk to two other resorts (the Allegro  Natura Park).The rooms were large.Check-out was very quick.------------------------------------------THE BAD: - Power went out three times during the stay, although not for long.- They left moldy bread in the baskets that was intended to feed the birds.- My balcony door would not lock, but we were on the second floor, so it was okay.- Somewhat limited menus at the a la carte restaurants. They weren't as expansive as you would get eating at a restaurant back home.- Mosquitos (large bites and very itchy)- December is one of their rainy months. January is the other. It was cloudy about half the time.  
<Date>Dec 22, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice Little Resort We just returned from a week at the Sunscape and I must say after reading some of the reviews we were pleasantly surprised. I titled this a Nice Little Resort because that's exactly what it is. It's not spread out like some where you walk long distances to get anywhere or take golf carts like some other resorts in Punta Cana. But small doesn't mean that it is not nice because it was. Check in was very smooth and we were greeted with drinks and in our room in only about 15-20 minutes. The room itself was nothing spectacular but we didn't expect that it would be. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. If you want spectacular then go to an upscale resort and spend the extra money. The beach was very nice and yes there was some seaweed as others have mentioned but it was never a problem and was being cleaned continually. Perhaps we were fortunate but unlike others we never had a problem getting beach chairs regardless of what time we went down to the beach. The same for the watersports, whenever we signed up for a catamaran we were able to get one without a long delay.  There were many complaints about the food in other reviews however we had no problems, no one got sick and we never had any trouble finding something we liked to eat. We ate at all the restuarants at the resort during our stay and enjoyed them all.  If you are looking for a resort that is non-stop activities then you will probably be disappointed in the Sunscape. There activities going on but not to the extent that some other resorts offer. This was fine with us as we were mainly there to relax on the beach. We can't speak about the entertainment at night as we did not go to any shows during our stay. We preferred to go to the casino at another resort. Sunscape is in the process of building a casino and a disco so in the future going off site will not be necessary.  We did go on a couple of tours and would highly recommend the Jungle Safari. Alex the tour guide was absolutely great and educated us about the history, culture, economy, and people of the Dominican. On top of that he kept the drinks flowing the whole day.  All in all we enjoyed our stay and would have no trouble recommending the Sunscape to others.  
<Date>Dec 19, 2005

<Author>cdld91
<Content>A Wonderful Place, A Terrific Time My wife and I returned on November 26, after spending Thanksgiving week at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. We vacationed with 2 other couples and we all had a great time. The grounds are beautiful, the staff very friendly, the food was surprisingly good for an all-inclusive resort and the weather was warm and sunny.Yes, there is seaweed in the water but it is an ocean, so anyone who is put off by this probably doesn't like that type of water anyway.I give a rousing endorsement to this resort and only hope it doesn't change too much when the new company takes over ownership in January. If you go, eat at the American Grill and say hello to Edison and Pena. They are the best.

<Author>JerzeyGrl
<Content>3rd times a charm!!! i really get aggrivated when i see horrible reviews about the Sunscape...I returned with my boyfriend and a few couples we met there back in January...We went in June and were there for a wedding which was absolutely gorgeous...this was my 3rd time back to the Sunscape and it was just as good if not better than the first two times i went...the only thing i would not reccommend is going in June...i have gone 2 other times in January and found the weather was a bit cooler and the pool was refreshing and didnt feel like bath water...our room was great!! when we arrived they had assigned us a 1st floor room in building 5...after being on the 3rd floor the past two times, we asked to be moved to the third floor and it was done without question...the 3rd floor rooms have an awesome cathedral ceiling and some of them have huge wraparound balconys....the rooms were very clean and comfortable...the pools were clean as well...we stayed by the adult pool to be away from the little kids and relax...the swim up bar is a great feature at the main pool though...the iceburg in the ocean was soo much fun (for all ages)...the ocean and beach were gorgeous...there was always someone cleaning up the seaweed on the beach every morning...never had a problem finding a place to sit...there were always enough chairs and shade...the food was great as well...we loooved the breadfast buffet at windwos and da marios was our favorite for dinner...the staff is always willing to do whatever they can for you, with or without being tipped....i found it particularly amazing that 2 of our favorite bartenders remembered us from being their 6 months before we arrived again...we love Andres and Ignasio!!...we did a snorkling booze cruise which was also amazing...they take you on a boat waaay out to the really nice coral and snorkel with you...then they take you to a shark pen where you swim literally a few feet above nurse sharks and sting ray...it was definitely an experience ill never forget!!...the shows are funny and i think you just have to have an open mind to enjoy them...the staff works really hard to make sure everything is perfect...if you have any questions feel free to email me @ mazda6gurrl@hotmail.com...i would stay at Sunscape again in a heartbeat but am very upset to hear that there are new owners...hopefully they will keep up the good work!!!  
<Date>Nov 18, 2005

<Author>westkygirl
<Content>Grand was all that and more! My husband and I just returned from Sunscape Grand yesterday. WOW! We were thrilled! From the minute we entered the beautiful open-air lobby we were treated wonderfully! We were immediately checked in, given our rum punch and lead to what I believe had to be the best possible room we could have imagined. We were in room 3330. A third floor, end room with a wrap around balcony overlooking the pool AND a perfect ocean view. We did no excursions or even left the resort(except for walks on the beach). We thought there was a great selection of food at each restaurant. Sure, it wasn't exactly what you might find in the US, but we loved trying the new things and always found something delicious. DeMarios's was even nicer than I had imagined. The American Grill was good and the Beach Cafe was great for poolside/beachside lunches in our swimsuits. Windows had a really good breakfast every day. The drinks were bottomless and great! I think I tried every tropical drink they had. My hubby who is a diehard Budweiser man, loved the ElPresidente! The staff was constantly working to keep things spic and span, which it was. We thought everything was very nicely kept. Clean and beautiful. No bugs, rodents, etc as I had read about. Had a great hour long massage on the beach-very relaxing, almost like I was in a dream!I can't imagine anyone giving this place bad reviews. It was a smaller, cozy resort which is one thing we were looking for. We had a memorable time and would love to return, but were told Sunscape Grand will be no more after December 2005. I just hope the new management company keeps us the good work.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I should have listened to these online reviews. Just returned from Sunscape Punta Grand 11/5-11/11. I must say the hotel lobby and grounds are gorgeous. We arrived at the hotel between lunch  dinner and the only available food was chips and salsa and ham and cheese sandwiches that were sitting out. This hotel is no way 5 star, the food alone drops it to 3 star. The night of the beach party, several warmers had died and the food was cold. We couldn't find anything decent to eat.Our room was in bldg 4 and had a nice view of the beach, but the furniture was falling apart and our bathroom ceiling was leaking. After complianing we were moved up a floor and the tub in that room didn't stop up. We had an ant problem in both rooms, by the 6th night, they were on our bed. The hotel lost power several times during the week and the water was constantly being shut off.The staff is great, very friendly. The entertainment could do with some revamping, but we went with 2 small children and enjoyed the nightly movie. My son loved the trampoline, but other than hanging at the pool, not much to do. Beach was full of seagrass. This resort has soured us on the DR, but if we were to return it would not be to a Sunscape Resort.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Honest review- please read! Would return to country and resort. IF YOU WANT A TRUTHFUL/HONEST REVIEW, READ THIS: This was our first trip to the Dominican Republic. I have previously been to Cancun and the Riviera Maya. We went with another couple and had adjoining rooms. I have read some of the reviews and I think some people forgot where they were staying. On tripadvisor.com this resort was rated #5 of all Punta Cana resorts. The grounds and pool were beautiful and GREAT. The food, I thought, put all-inclusives in mexico to shame. I don't know what people expected, but I was pleased. We had a beautiful balcony- opt for the deluxe room like we did. I will admit the entertainment was cheesy, but this is not America! The staff was friendly and that is even without a tip here or there which is not even expected. The beach was white and very little seaweed when we were there- they clean it also every morning. The water had small calm waves, this resort is in the carribean. If you are looking for larger waves, you need to look at the punta cana resorts that are farther north in the Atlantic. The water was very refreshing and clear. We snorkled at the resort, used the catamaran and ocean kayaks- it was all FREE! There are local shops just next to the resort on the beach which made shopping for souveniers very convenient. They have an outdoor theatre, shuffleboard, bacci ball, etc. The forecast was for scattered storms all week, I dont know how because I had to use 45 spf sunblock to prevent burning due to the wonderful weather. The worst part of our trip was flying with the airline and the problems they caused, not the resort. They have some type of food and bar open 24 hours. My parents were so impressed with the pictures and results that we had, that they are planning a trip there in April 2006. We looked for months at all the resorts on-line and were debating on sunscape grand and secrets excellence (which is a sister luxury hotel). After staying at the Sunscape, I could not see why or what you could need more for an extra $500 to go to Secrets other than bath robes! I recommend this place and suggest booking the airport transport with your package if you can. I hope you found my review helpful and try not to focus on all the negativity that some people spit out. If you look at the reviews- even the most luxurious and expensive resorts have people giving crappy reviews. YOUR VACATION IS WHAT YOU MAKE OF IT- RELAX AND DRINK PLENTY!  
<Date>Nov 5, 2005

<Author>Luis
<Content>Not a five star! Not even a four star! I just returned from Dominican Republic (stayed there from 24th to 31st October 2005).I booked Sunscape Punta Cana Grand because I was advised that it was a five star hotel. Well, based on my 30 years traveling experience (and also comparing it with two other hotels I stayed previously in Dominican Republic) I would rate this as a 3 star hotel... Of course, I feel deceived... and I will complain to whoever may be able to do something about this!Maintenance, particularly in the rooms, is lousy. This may have something to do with the ownership change that is taking place. Travelplan (Spanish) bought the hotel from Sunscape 16 months ago but management will only switch over to Travelplan in January 2006. Weird arrangement!Food quality is erratic. Service is friendly but happens when it happens!Entertainment was the worst I ever experienced in an all inclusive hotel.In short: stay away!

<Author>lilbuddy
<Content>Grand just ok.... We were at the Grand from October 1st to October 8th. 4 of us ladies without husbands, kids, boyfriends, work, etc....We went to relax and that's what we did. The resort itself is beautiful and the staff are amazing. Jean Allie, Fernando, Andre, Beachpapi, Jean Cruz just to name a few.Unfortunately, our weather while there did not really co-operate with us, so we had about 4 days of rain in total out of the 7 days we were there. It was still very hot when raining, so you could still float around the pool, but once the thunder and lightening started, you had to get out.Our main problem with this hotel was the food. Not that it tasted bad, it was just always cold, even when under heat lamps, and there was not much of a selection. We found that we ended up eating the same thing everyday all week long. If I ever see another pizza, fries and pasta again, I think I'll faint. LOL....None of us were sick and we never heard anyone else complain about being sick.The rooms are really nice and very clean. We had no problems with bugs or anything like that. We used the room safe, but there was a charge of $15 USD for the week for it. We also paid for a late check out, which was an additional $20 USD.Overall, I would have to say that I would not return to this resort. Mainly because of the food situation, but we think that might have been due to the fact that the hotel was only running at about 30% capacity. There is also not much to do at night, and we found the vendors very pushy and too willing to try and rip you off, but that is normal. Make sure you barter with these people.If your looking for a relaxing vacation and food selection is not a major concern to you, then this resort is for you.  
<Date>Oct 12, 2005

<Author>ny2pa
<Content>A Wonderful Get Away We just returned from DR (all 30 of us). We were there from 9/24-10/01/05. At least 12 of them were at the Grand 2 yrs ago and persuaded the rest of us to join them again, this year. I have been reading the TripAdivsor for a few months to get feedback on the Grand. As everyone else, I had mixed feelings about going.  The best way to sum of our stay was GREAT! The people in DR can not do enough for you because they appreciate the tourism to improve there counrty. Our dollars go along way there. As for the Grand, bartenders, Beach Papi, Pedro, Gloria...and so many more were excellent. They know you, what you drink and don't even have to ask. Fernando- the activities director is so personable and a fantastic guy! The rooms are immaculate and fridge always stocked. The grounds are clean and well manicured. The people there work very, very hard so we can have a wonderful vacation. To see smiling faces every day and greeted with Hola makes it all worth it.  The food is plentiful and the resturants are good. The food is to each ones taste. You are in a foreign country and not at your hometown resturants so please do not judge there food to your own. The buffet on the beach is Fantastic. They go all out with food, service, entertainment! If you decide to do a tour I do recommment the Outback Safari. I do hope you get Elvis for your guide. And yes, that is his real name! We saw his drivers license. He speaks 5 languages and gives the best tour ever!  The shops along the beach are great and fun to go to. Ulysis, Picasso, Antonio.. No pushy, push and cheapy cheap! As they say they are cheaper than K Mart  Target! You do make deals and it is fun. We had met lots of people at the Grand from Ohio- to the UK and the one word they use alot in the DR is family. When you finally have to leave the resort and waive goodbye to the staff and the new people you have met, Yes it felt like you were saying Goodbye to Family. We all agreed to return to the DR. The Grand is in the process of being bought and adding on a casino. We all hope it does NOT become another run of the mill resort but stays personable and very relaxing and not oversized. If you decide to go Relax, Enjoy and be thankful!  
<Date>Oct 4, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best holiday ever We travelled on the 28th July 05 as a group of 24. When we arrived at the resort our eyes lit up. It was everything we imagined and more. From the moment we arrived the staff were more than helpful. Our first night was definatly one to set the scene for the remainder of our holiday. The Beach party really made you feel like like you had just landed in paradise. The food was excellent from day one. Whether you ate on the Beach, at Windows or in one of the restauants you could not fault a thing. The bar staff and waiters were fantastic, friendly and efficient. None of our group are fluent in Spanish but the staff do appreciate it if you try the odd gracias or por favor, for SOME of our American friends manners help as much as a dollar tip here or there.The all inclusive was brilliant, far better than I thought it would be, the food was of a high standard with a great variety. There were some international drinks such as Baileys or JD included and you could not fault the staff. The activities both day and night catered for all so there was never a dull moment during our holiday.I wouldn't recommend the Dolphin Island trip or parasending. Dolphin Island is a waste of money for a glorified bus trip and well, health and safety wasn't a stong point for some of the speed boat drivers when it came to the motorised watersports.Definatley definatley do the jurassic safari, we had a truck to ourselves and amongst 17 drinkers and 3 non-drinkers we beat the all time record for the most bottles of rum drank in one day. It really was a great experience. (And I was a non-drinker). If you decide to do this trip ask for Alex to be your guide for the day, he was great.Finally we had our wedding at this resort and there is no way I would do it anywhere else but here. We had the best day of our lives finished with a candle- lit reception on the beach- perfect.If you have read the bad reports about this place, ignore them. I was so worried before travelling but it proved we had nothing to worry about. A holiday is what you make it.  
<Date>Sep 27, 2005

<Author>toyguard
<Content>Not a let down I just returned from the Sunscape PC Grand. I typically take mini vacations of 4 to 5 days in the Carribean. This is my 5th visit to Dom Rep. and it was much as I expected, lots of sun, food and drinks. The beach was great though there was quite a bit of weed both in and out of the water. The restaurants were great. No complaints at all about the food. The Buffet restaurant (Windows) was awesome, huge selection and everything was delicious--no I did not get sick, not in the least. The grounds were beautiful, the std room quite ample with balcony, the staff friendly. The entertainment was not as good as most other places I have been, but it was better than nothing. Though late September, it was still very humid, but the water cools you off. Found the Sunscape along with neighboring resorts quite low in attendance. Though in years past,I have also booked in hurricane season, crowds have been slightly bigger. With the smaller attendace you do not have to fight for a hut at the beach, at any time of the day, nor wait in lines for drinks or food. Though the atmosphere of the place is not as vibrant. All in all a great place and a great bargain. I would reccommend it to others.  
<Date>Sep 22, 2005

<Content>Great Fun A friend and I travel each year to a new place. The Grand was great, friendly, clean, food was wonderful, staff soooo compassionate and helpful. Take your own US dollars as they are hard to get, it costs alot for any medications or sunscreen so pack it.. The place was wonderful, pools clean, drinks and people great, 24 hour room service with a smile, 2 times daily the maids checked our rooms for the mininbar and towels or WHATEVER we asked of her, we did tip well and had rewards from the entire staff for it, we stayed a week and tipped about $15.00 and loved it. The beach was clean and the shops were fun to shop and dicker the prices, you get what you want in the end or go to the next shop. It was esay from the airport and check in and out was fast, no problems. we drank water and ate without illness, there is bottled water for an army so to speak, it was worth our time, it is on a return list we keep. I recommend it to all.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Feel at Home Punta Cana Sunscape Grand, Punta Cana, Dominicn RepublicSept 14th, 2005My husband and I spent 3 lovely weeks at this resort. We were well taken care of by the staff. The atmosphere was warm and friendly. Our room was very comfortable; nicely furnished, and well kept. The resort was extremely well-planned so that we were close to everything. It was very well-maintanied; kept very clean. The food at Windows, the buffet restaurant, was tasty and varied from day to day along with the theme. The Dominican Buffet was the best.They outdid themselves with dinner on the Beach every Thurs. night, which included entertainment, and it was terrific.Two of the other three restaurants were pretty good. However, we ate at the Beach Garden Cafe, which was open all night, and were very diasappointed. We had a Club sandwich that was made with stale bread, leftover cheese, and meat, and there was very little inside. We only ate the pizza there.The Beach was clean, and far surpassed the neighboring beach at the Allegro Resort. There was security on our beach at all times.We had no problem being understood by the staff.The water sports were sufficient, but they closed up shop a bit early.The rooms were well air-conditioned, but sometimes there was no hot water.There were plenty of planned activities all day, and a show every night.The explorer's club for kids kept them occupied, and it was well situated not to interfere with other guests without children.I did the bike tour, which was okay, but would have liked to have gone further.The gym was clean, and though small had enough stuff to work out with.I had a massage at the spa, which was not included, and I was very pleased. Unfortunately, my husband stopped in while I was there, and the receptionist was somewhat unpleasant.All in all, we had a great time, felt at home, and would go back to this resort again.  
<Date>Sep 14, 2005

<Author>lismo847
<Content>Just Wonderful! We just returned from a week at the Grand, it was unforgetable!We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary, and had never been out of North America.We arrived 3 hours before check in time, but were given a cool drink and a cookie, and asked to return to reception in about an hour, so we wandered around, had a bite to eat and returned to the main lobby. Our room was ready, and we were given our keys, towel cards, and room safe key.( no charge to use safe, but DO NOT LOOSE THE KEY)Our room was in bulding 4, on the third floor. It was large, clean and had all the ammenities. The staff were wonderful, very friendly, helpful, most spoke english (at least enough to get by), many spoke more than two languages.The beach was beautiful, yes there is sea grass, it is the sea...but the staff were up everyday cleaning up the beach. We wandered down the beach past other resorts, and their beaches were not as clean. Some do go topless on the beach, but I was not bothered by this.The activities staff were fun and encouraged you to join in, but if you did not want to, they left you alone. They had something going on ALL day if you felt like joining in. The food was pretty good, you could find just about anything at the buffett, they also had room service and a beach garden rest. open all the time.The food and bar staff were great, they were always around when you needed them. We never waited for a table or a drink.The grounds were incredible, well kept, clean and beautiful. There were 2 pools, one adults only( yes, they go topless), and they were clean and pretty. Yes, the water was warm, the pools were in the sun, and it is HOT in the DR!!!The beach party on Thursday night was fantastic. The staff worked all day to set it up, the best food and fun with entertainment right on the beach! It was a blast!They even set up a big screen on the beach for the NFL game.We got up early each day and saved a place in the shade at the beach, then after breakfast, off to the beach we went. The water was clear most days, one day it was a little cloudy due to a storm off shore. We had no rain, it was overcast 2 days.The only complaint I have is that we didn't always have hot water, but I understand this happens all over and wasn't that big a deal for us.The construction going on near the resort seemed to be all hand tools, we went to see it one day, we really did not hear it at all.We did take advantage of the internet service to e-mail home, it was nice to keep in touch with the kids...The resort let the beach vendors set up around the pool 2 nights. I did not like the bargaining process, I prefer to be told a price...but I did it.I felt the prices in the resort shops were outrageous! $2.00 for a candy bar... and we looked at cigars...A box of a brand we get here in the States for $50.00 for 25, they $20.00 each. (Yes, a Dominican brand). I thought this was a bit much! The beach vendors call out to you as you walk by, one even tried to sell my husband Ganja, but left you alone after a while...  
<Date>Sep 12, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>great deal! I had a great time. check in was easy, and my room was upgraded for free. but since i never spent time in my room, a garden view would do. maid service was great and a tip helps get the mini bar overstocked. rooms were clean and plenty of american tv options. the main pool was very nice and clean and the drinks kept on comming. bring your own mug if you want to make less frequent trips to the bar. the food is fine. the best nights are the outdoor theme buffets. very good! Everyone was friendly and spoke good english or enough english. also ignore the comments about not enough chairs. the security is key here. i walked down the beach past other resorts and their beaches had people trying to sell drugs all over, but sunscape has security on the beach. piano bar and disco looked nice, i was often too tired by then. the best part of this resort is the 24hr bar and food, and in room mini bar. book it you will like it. it is much cheaper than any american vacationwill return  
<Date>Sep 10, 2005

<Author>waterboy20794
<Content>Beautiful resort, great people, average food I vacationed at The Grand on Aug 22-26. This was my first time out of the US. I thought the whole experience was excellent. I traveled with Apple Vacations and cannot say enough good things about them. The resort was beautiful and super clean. There was always several people roaming the resort cleaning up and others working on the landscape. The rooms were super clean and roomy. I left the maid a note with what I wanted in the fridge and a couple dollars and he loaded it up everyday. The beach was beautiful. The water crystal clear and the sand fine white and easy to walk on. We went snorkeling and took some bread out there and the fish would swarm around us eating it. The employees were very friendly and helpful. Personally I thought the food was ok. We ate at the buffet mostly, plenty of choices and loads of desserts. Didn't like Damario's italian at all. Very small portions and a long wait. They tried but not my cup of tea. The American grill and the Beach garden grill were good. I would give this resort a 5 in everything but the food. A couple upset stomachs and a few squirts but other than that noone was sick. Juan at the splash bar was great and his Juan especial was yummy. The entertainment team works very hard and the shows were great and funny. I would recommend this resort to anyone and would definitely recommenend Apple.

<Author>3stooges
<Content>Great Experience My wife and I celebrated our 30th anniversary here 8/22 to 8/26. The weather was great each day with lots of sun and any showers were very short and only in the evening while we were dining. Like most other reviewers we found the grounds beautiful and the entire atmosphere very laid back and relaxing. We also encountered tiny ants in the room-seeking something sweet. We used the bug spray that we brought to spray along the edges of the sink and dresser and this eliminated their appearance.  Like most AI's there was a lot of variety with the food and we always found our favorites. We used Pepto tablets everyday to insure against stomach maladies. Any time you change eating habits your body will let you know.  The most impressive part of the Grand had to be the staff especially the work they do with children. Their Explorer's Club takes the children from 10 to late afternoon involving them in games, entertainment, and teaching them about the DR. They are very, very good and all the children really liked the attention. I'm sure the parents appreciated it too. There were also nightly movies (semi-current releases) followed by a show (about an hour). Then the disco and or piano bar would open. During the day there were all kinds of contests -horseshoes, shuffleboard, volleyball, baseball, dance lessons, bartending tips, flower and towel arranging, etc... Would definitely go back.
