<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Everything Great But the Food I stayed at the Grand from Aug 15-22 with my girlfriend. To give some background, we are both 26-year-old graduate students.Hotel Grounds: The hotel grounds were lovely, they were kept in wonderful condition and staff members constantly worked to keep them clean and tidy. There are lots of palm trees throughout and the main pool is in a good, central location. I would comment however, that the pool water in both the main and adult pools seemed to be extremely warm, more like a hot tub. This could just be the result of the pools being exposed to the powerful sun, rather than being heated to this temperature. We didn't really notice the construction, in any event it was on the other side of the resort near buildings one and two while we were in building four which I would highly recommend. The bars and restaurants are numerous and are easily accessible from all areas of the resort.Rooms: For the most part, I thought the rooms were nice and clean. Maid service was good and our mini bar was refilled every day. Unfortunately, the refrigerator did not work all that well and the beer and water from it were somewhat lukewarm. I know some reviews said the rooms needed updating, and granted I'm no Frank Lloyd Wright, but I thought the rooms were just fine. The television worked well and had about 20 channels, most of which were American and included among others ESPN, Discovery, HBO, Showtime and the networks (New York affiliates). One negative regarding the room is that the hallway outside was tiled and as a result the sounds coming from the hallway really echoed throughout and were fairly loud even inside the room with the door closed. All in all though, the rooms were above average.Beach: The beach was about what I expected. It is true that if you want one of the thatched huts on the beach you have to be there before 8:30 in order to reserve one by placing your towels on the chairs. This was annoying because oftentimes guests would reserve a hut and not actually sit in it at all. The hotel tries to limit the seat saving to three hours, but this guideline seems to be widely disregarded. In any event, I don't think the hotel could really do anything to stop this from occurring. Also, the water wasn't as blue as I expected. I was hoping for the clear, baby blue, transparent water of postcards but it was greenish in color near the shore and darker away from the shore. Not to say that it looked like the East River or something and maybe I'm nitpicking about this, but it was just a little different from my expectations. I thought the mountain and trampoline were fun and the temperature of the ocean water was great. Also the sea was calm while we were there which made for wonderful swimming conditions.Food: The food was the only thing that I had a serious problem with. It actually tasted pretty good for the most part, but the issues started after we had eaten. On the fourth or fifth day of the week long trip we both had stomach issues and this continued in some form or another for the remainder of the trip. Perhaps I have a sensitive stomach, but I have never had this issue before in travelling to Mexico or to numerous destinations in Europe. We ate at all of the restaurants and I never got sick from the food at the American Grill or the Tex Mex restaurant. My stomach gave mixed reviews of the Windows buffet and after eating at DeMario's (Italian) I became violently ill. I don't know if any other guests had issues, and like I said before maybe I just have a sensitive system so one should probably take this part of the review with a grain of salt. Guests: I would estimate the guests were probably 40 percent American 40 percent European (mostly Spainards, Germans) and 20 percent South American. I thought that most people seemed to be respectful of each other and the staff, which was a nice thing to see after reading some of the past reviews about this and other resorts in the area.Staff: In general staff members were friendly and helpful. Yes, they don't all speak English that well, but it is very ethnocentric to expect them to when we are visiting their country. All of the front desk staff had good language skills and we never had any issues at check-in or check-out. We went parasailing and to do that or other sea based excursions, one deals with Scuba Caribe which (I think) is an independent contractor of the hotel. Their staff was helpful and friendly and the outfit seemed to be fairly professional.That is all I can think to write, I have used this site many times to help in my travel decisions and I hope my first review has been helpful to others.  
<Date>Aug 23, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>All-in-All, A Great Vacation! Overall rating: 4.5We stayed at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand from August 12-19. We had an excellent vacation!HOTEL ROOM:The room was comfortable for the most part. Upon arrival, I gasped when I saw so many bugs crawling across the dresser area. I called the front desk and they took care of the problem, for the most part, although there were little tiny bugs crawling around the sink area all week. (I'm not good with bugs, although my husband and daughter had no problem with them.)MAID SERVICE:Maid service was good until the last day. There were not enough towels for all three of us and our pop wasn't restocked. When we called to get more towels, they brought us a few hand towels and a wash cloth after two calls, but never brought our large towels, as promised. FOOD:The food was excellent! We thoroughly enjoyed the meals we had at Sunscape. We most enjoyed the American Grill (Tex Mex) restaurant and also the Beach Garden, although De Mario's and Windows were both good restaurants, as well. The food at the Beach Party was magnificent! There was something there for everyone! The grilled out food was superb and this was a nice way to end our vacation.ENTERTAINMENT:The entertainment was wonderful! We enjoyed all the shows each and every night. We regretted missing the dinner theater. We had no idea they would go all out and set up tables by candlelight in front of the stage aera. The entertainers had a lot of energy and you couldn't help but tap your feet to the music! Fun!POOL:The pool was the largest pool I had ever swam in. We had so much fun swimming and relaxing on our rafts in it. The highlight of the pool was the swim-up splash bar! We enjoyed our virgin CocoLocos, Bahama Mamas and Pina Colatas! Juan worked so hard at getting drinks to everyone as fast as possible. My family and I couldn't help but notice his hard work.OCEAN:The ocean was nice, but there was a little seaweed in it. We didn't care though - we had a lot of fun! We were surprised to see so many topless women getting some sun and even walking the beach! I know many of the men enjoyed this scenery, but I think with all the kids around, topless should have been restricted to the adult pool, which I think Sunscape promotes.TIPPING:We tipped quite often when the service was excellent. We did spend a lot of extra money in tipping although the trip was all-inclusive, because the workers, for the most part, worked very hard. You get special treatment when you tip - they remember! We took a lot of $1 bills with us. My husband even handed out $5 bills.All-in-all, we had a wonderful time! I would have rated this hotel Excellent, but there were a few problems I thought could have been handled faster and could have been prevented. If we go back to Punta Cana, I wouldn't have a problem staying at the Sunscape again, but we would probably try out another resort just so we would feel like we're on a different vacation. Everything would become too familiar.  
<Date>Aug 20, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Absolutely Loved It We stayed at Sunscape July 24 - June 1 and didn't want to return home. We absolutely loved it. After reading a lot of these reviews, most seemed as though they took little things too seriously. I can say I didn't see any rats or cockroachs. My mom, friend, and myself had the time of our lives. I would go back in a heart beat. The food there wasn't the best, I did get sick a few nights but, the pasta was amazing. Your not in America so it's not going to be American food and its going to be their way. During the day we stayed at the resort and we would swim, play volleyball, play pool or ping-pong, or hang out with friends we had made. The staff was absolutely amazing, it's impossible not to meet anyone there and you really can't say they try because when we first walked in we saw like 5 of them in there bathing suits dancing around getting guests to join them. If it weren't for the staff, I wouldn't have met half the people me and my friend did. I must admit though when we first walked into the resort I thought it was going to be the worst vacation of my life, but after eating lunch I realized I wasn't giving the place a chance and a half hour later I knew I couldn't leave. Also during the day my friend and I (by the way I am 15) went banana boating with kids our age we went and it was so much fun. I would reccomend going for 20 minutes, it goes by so fast. We also went paddle boating, and that was free, it was hard work, but it was worth it to see the resort from the ocean. Everyday the staff also gets together either volleyball matches, or shuffleboard and dart matches. The winners at night are able to claim there prizes going on stage and winning from a variety of rum, t-shirts, or coffee. My favorite night though was when the staff put on the show. Many people said there was a language barrier, but I speak no spanish and I was perfectly fine. If you just talk with the natives a little you will fall in love with them immediately. They love to talk with you. We loved Andre, he always had a smile on his face and was dancing or doing something to make you laugh. I could go on and on but, I am not going to. Of the 20 - 25 people i met there, they would do anything to go back to sunscape. You just got to forget what you're used to and relax. Enjoy yourself and learn to except different cultures and ways of life. If you do this you'll have the time of your life.  
<Date>Aug 19, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Exceptional Value Dates stayed: July 26-August 2, 2005This was our first time staying at an all-inclusive resort, so how this resort compares to others, we are unable to say. Overall, we felt there was exceptional value at Sunscape Punta Cana Grand.Accommodations: We would recommend, as others, to stay in building 4 or 5. The shows at night were very loud and we could hear them in our room in building 4 across the resort. The room was spacious (king-sized bed) and clean. We were on the first floor, but our balcony still felt separated from the public walk outside. A word of caution about buildings 1, 2, 4 and 5, the upper level rooms are accessed by only one stairway and could make for a limited escape in case of an emergency. The maid was thorough and friendly with her limited English. However, most days our room was not serviced until 5:00, when were trying to get ready for dinner. Our air conditioning worked very well throughout the trip, which was a blessing in the afternoons.Food  Drinks: Despite the advertisements food is not available 24 hours a day. Breaks between meals to switch over the restaurants from one meal to the next caused them to close. These times could have been staggered to allow one restaurant to be open at any time. Each restaurant ran on Dominican time, which translates to not being open at the time posted, 6:00 could mean 6:15. The service was also laid back and in a similar manner, not that you are in a hurry for any reason ?enjoy it! In general, the food was good and the presentation was nice, but if you are looking for gourmet, an all-inclusive cannot provide that for you. A quick synopsis of the restaurants: Windows (the buffet) had breakfast, lunch, and dinner (most nights). It is a typical buffet, lukewarm food, and wide variety of choices to accommodate different cultural tastes. Tex-Mex had dinner ?chips are great, American-style food, order the brownie for dessert! Daario had dinner ?the most upscale dinning of the resort, nice atmosphere, but not authentic Italian food. Beach Grill had breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We enjoyed this most. It was relaxed, open-air, and had views of the beach.Each restaurant could use more variety. It is interesting that some deserts seem to appear at all the restaurants with just a slight twist on them to make them seem different. Most lunches we just ordered pizza and French fries from the grill and ate them at the pool. The pool bar was typically crowded, as expected, with young men never leaving their stools. The backstage bar was less crowded during the day, compared to the night crowd and it offers pizza, chips, and sandwiches during the afternoon. The Beach Grill Bar was open 24 hours and seemed to be staffed by the best bartenders. The alcohol used in most drinks is not top shelf and they seemed to utilize syrups in in lieu of more alcohol. Better liquor was available if requested. Not being big drinkers, this was fine with us. Again, similar to the food, if you are expecting lavish presentation and expense, an all-inclusive resort is not for you. Neither of us got sick, we stayed clear of all foods sitting out for who knows how long and didn touch the water. Bottled water was unlimited and readily available. There were questionable health practices noticed particularly at the beach party when we could see the preparation of the food.Entertainment: This type of thing is not our bag even when we are not on vacation. It seemed like others enjoyed it, but we found the shows to be cheesy and obligatory. We found the best entertainment to be the natural surroundings. The beach was clean, sand white, and water fairly clear. We enjoyed sitting by the pool each day and lounging under the shade of huts. Caution: the shaded seats are taken early, you must play this game, get up at 5:30 and put your towel our, go back to bed and get up for breakfast. We don see a way for the resort to control this; so complaining about it will only ruin your vacation. This was a trip to celebrate our five-year anniversary and was nice for couples and families. The resort appealed to our Midwestern U.S. sensibilities. We have never been so relaxed and overall thoroughly enjoyed this trip. Sunscape Punta Cana Grand excels at providing an exceptional experience for those looking to enjoy the Caribbean with little effort and relative expense.  
<Date>Aug 15, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>nice get away we stayed the week of July 24, 2005 .......let me tell you about the great things.... the staff is very nice. they will go out of their way to please you and entertain you..they are very hard workers, they put in 16 hour day 7 a week. The weather was awesome. It was sunny every day but one and it only rained late at night. the actually hotel was nice also. the grounds were kept very nice. the beach was great clear water. Yes there was sea weed but it was not like the seaweed at the jersey shore it was like straw....and some days there was a lot of it and other there was none at all. The hotel has someone pick up the seaweed everyday. Every night the staff would put on a different show they was all funny. Now let me tell you the not so great things...the weather was soooo hot and i went to go in the pool the first day and it was boiling..the water was too hot to cool off the only relief you got from the heat was the ocean......and yes you do have to wake up and 6:30 every morning to reserve a hut on the beach and if you don't the sun will get to you after a while...but i was worth it...actually the good thing is they were building more huts. and there was the food issue! the food was on the poor side. Breakfast at the ocean garden was doable the windows buffet was a total disappointment to me and the others i went with. Lunch the beach grill was okay only for hot dogs (that had a dominican pinch to them) and ice cream....the fruit stand was awesome and their fruit was not bland as mentioned earlier. The pineapple and mango were out of this world you could every get them here in the states.. The beach gardern did serve pizza at lunch which you could get to go and take on the beach. Dinner: the best restaurant was the american grill(tex mex) but be prepared the food is not like the USA. The italian restaurant was the second best but again be prepared the food is not what you are used to. I think they would have been better off serving traditional dominican food they trying to prepare american food. And of coarse the last night i did get sick. But over all the trip was a nice get away and i would return.  
<Date>Aug 14, 2005

<Author>kimober
<Content>Real Deal from a Realistic Person Hola All,This was my third trip to this resort, and I had a great time. It is landscaped and kept up extremely well. The resort is very clean. The staff are hard working and pleasant. The food was good, it is an all inclusive and I have never had absolutely fantastic food at any all inclusive and I have been to many in many different islands. The drinks are great and they will make anything you want or add more of something if you ask. The beach was very clean, seaweed? of course not - what do you think your at a natural beach or something. The seaweed was cleaned up everymorning bright in early. The water was clear and very pretty, it was sort of a light green. RESERVING CHAIR ISSUE - well, that's just the way it is. Actually I think it's like that everywhere...I even see it in Ocean City Maryland at the pools....get up - go get your chair and go back to bed - or get some coffee - or take pot luck, it's just the way it is...I don't see that changing, it shouldn't ruin your vacation. I did not see any furry creatures, except for the monkey they take pictures with. I did not see any roaches - which are probably just big waterbugs anyway. The rooms are very clean. Construction - wasn't a issue - did not hear anything, and unless your in building 1 and 2 you probably won't even notice. The pool - the water itself was clean, yes the water was warm, very warm, I love it that way. The tempature in Punta Cana averages about 90 degrees everyday so I think that may play a role.Some Honorable Mentions:Caren De Vries - Room Division ManagerFelix - Supv. of all ResturantsJuan Cruz - Splash BarPrince - Beach Garden/Tex MexEspraranza - Kid's ClubFernando - Kid's Club**They all were key players in making my vacation wonderful** A big Thank you to all of you!Can I tell you some negative things, yes, but I won't because I did not let those things bother me and ruin my trip. I was there to have a good time and that is what I did. If you have any questions I would be happy to answer them!Footnote - Apparently - after the construction is complete which will consist of suites and swim out units, the Sunscape Grand - will no longer be.....as of Jan 2006...No info on who is taking over the resort....and so I am sad to say goodbye....I love the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. ???

<Author>phlax
<Content>Where's "JOHNNY" :-)       Theater  
<Date>Aug 9, 2005
<Rating>4	5	4	-1	5	-1	5	-1	
<Aspects>

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Misleading Reviews After reading the reviews posted specific to this location, my wife and I had the impression that we were going to an all inclusive resort where our comfort would be a priority to the staff. Unfortunately, what we found was quite contrary to this.Let me break our review down into some important categories:1. Language barrier - I know that we are English speaking and admittedly speak no Spanish. The reviews on this site made the staff out to be at least proficient in English. The only English speaking staff that could understand our needs or that we could communicate with were the front desk staff. There English was decent but our needs were difficult to explain to anyone else. When my wife fell at the pool and needed medical assistance, it became a traumatic experience getting anyone that could help us. Just the simple request of a band-aid was nearly impossible. The waiters could not understand enough English to make even the simplest of variations from the menu. Yes, the staff says Ola everytime that you see them, but they are unable to answer ANY questions that you might have.2. Food - the food was barely adequate. If you have ever been on a cruise with any cruise line, you will be VERY dissapointed with the selection, quality, and availability of the food. They basically serve the same food in every restaraunt and it is in extremely small portions. My wife fought an upset stomach for the four days that we were there and even now that we are home.3. Things to do - If you want to go somewhere, lay at the beach, or lay at the pool, then maybe this is okay. Plan on getting up each day before seven to reserve a decent spot by ocean or pool. There were never enough floating mats and the pool is warmer than bath water.4. Drinks - VERY weak and not tastey.5. Excursions - DO NOT leave the resort. Even on a tour the outside world is extremely scary and impoverished. The tours are terrible and do not cater to anyone that does not speak Spanish. Our guide on our jeep tour would speak in Spanish for five minutes and then maybe 30 seconds of very broken English. There seemed to be a lot of inside jokes with the Spanish-speaking guests, possibly at our expense. There was really nothing going on that fun each night either. My friends warned me not to go here. They said to go to Mexico where they relish the USA dollar and cater to your needs. The DR loved our US dollar but they are not savy enough to have seen what true service is yet. Visit this place in about 10 years when the US developers buy the properties and infuse great service in beautiful resorts.One word for anyone thinking of going to Punt Cana and especially the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand - Mexico!!  
<Date>Aug 2, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Awesome Oh my god Sunscape was awesome. I went with my mom dad and my sister and we all had something to do everyday. The entertainment crew at Sunscape are CRAZY!!!!! THEY ARE AWESOME. First off they stay up from 10 in the morning till 2:00 in the morning pleasing you. Andres is the best if you are going he is the little short guy with a smile on his face 24/7. Then there is Nelly who was a Entertainment Trainee didnt know that much English but she was awesome (THEY CAN DANCE). During the day, they give you a piece of paper eevry morning of daily activities. I am going to tell you now to do all the activities because you can win Bottles of rum and shirts and hats and such. I played Beach Volleyball with my Dad are team won so we got two things of rum and two shirts. Then one day we played basketball....Dont play it is so HOTT!!!! But we won then and got rum. Then we played the activity course and my Dad got 3rd place and got Coffee beans, rum, a hat, and a shirt. So play the activities they are awesome. Oh yeah for the kids in the ocean they have a water trampoline which sometimes ladies go on to lay out because it atracts the sun. There is also a 2 story high ice berg what you climb on and slide down it is awesome. People are trying to make you do things all the time I went parasailing and Scuba Diving and Snorkaling. The Parasailing, we took a boat 20 minutes down the ocean which was good because we saw other resorts and none of them amount to Sunscape. Then we went up in a nice boat and it was beautiful there is a big mountain range you can see it is perfect. I mean it sunscape is the best along that beach and we saw at least twenty resorts even Breezes and it was nothing special, Sunscape is where it is at. The Scuba Diving we went if you look in the ocean where the bar is out in the middle to the right of it there was a place called El Nino where we dove and it was so beautiful. We went under a coral Reef. I only need two more dives to become sertified. The snorkling you can do that any where it was ok but i recommend Scuba Diving only 80 dollars dont go parasailing it was good but i think it is over rated. The rooms, They are clean nice they have a bar but ours was hidden in a cubby hole it was so cool. They refill it everyday. If people complain about the rooms then they need help because we only slept in the room and didnt really care about the room. But it was really nice. The night life is amazing, one night they had a magician he was ok, then they always have contests and entertainers who dance spit out fire it is pretty neet. Then the entertainment outside ends at 10:00 then the Disco and the Piano bar open up. Piano bar has Karaokee some nights and they have this Jamacan come in and he is hilarious. The piano bar end at 12 then everybody goes to the Disco and dances till 2 in the morning. You can still get drinks in the disco. Tips, bring ALOT of sun tan lotion, bring snacks i guess because i was so hungry for like doritos and they were exspensive in the gift shop, bring a water camera because they are 22 dollars there. Also the beach merchants try to get you to get them food and drinks, don't do it unless they give you deals. I got a guy a rum and coke and a pizza and he gave me a T-Shirt. Dont give in to them. They treat you like kings down there. If something is like 30 dollars say i only have five they will probably give it to you. The staff there is amazing always trying to help your needs. Water sports they have catamorans, kayaks, paddle boats, and much much more. Over-all this place is awesome and I do recommend it dont listen to the bad comments because they probably made it a bad time, you gotta bring people who you are going to have a good time with. My family and I are looking forward to go again in April or May of 2006. Oh Yea if you are from Ohio, Pennsylvania, New York, Kentucky, and Deleware please go because alot of people are from there. Have fun if you go.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Ignore the negative reviews My husband and two children (ages 10 and 13) just returned from a five night stay at the hotel. Before I even booked this hotel, I did extensive research using this website and others to ensure we had a safe and enjoyable trip. After extensive research I finally decided on the Sunscape Grand and was encouraged by all the positive feedback most people left on this site for folks to read. Yes, ocassionally there were negative reviews, but the majority were good. Of course after I finally booked the trip (through Vacations to Go -- highly recommend them), I began reading many more negative comments and was worrying myself to death. Decided to put all the negative reviews out of my mind and see for myself, since at this point the trip was already booked. We hoped for the best.We arrived at the hotel around 2:30 in the afternoon. Not only was there NO wait for checking in, it was done within 10 minutes of getting there. We were greeted with a cold drink and received a small carrying case filled with lotion, shampoo, conditioner, etc. The bell caps took our luggage right away to our room. We were assigned a room in Building 5 which I had requested prior to arriving, as I had read that it was one of the quietest in the evenings. The request was obviously met without my having to ask again upon checking. The room itself was clean with no musty smell, no bugs, no mold. It was in need of updating, but for the money I paid, I knew I wasn't getting a first class Hilton or Marriott. No bugs, clean sheets, clean towels, etc. was fine with us. We did have no hot water two days around 6:30 pm but we assumed most of the hotel was probably showering at the same time. Two of us had to wait 30 minutes and the hot water was back. Not a problem for us. We did have to ask for extra towels only one day and they were delivered within 15 minutes. The pool water was warm, but it was over 90 degrees every day and it sits mostly in the sun, is there anyone out there that can't figure out the water is going to heat up? Hello? The ocean water was almost just as warm. It did have a lot of seaweed, which isn't my cup of tea, but it was cleaned off the beach every day. I was disturbed to find glass in the sand on the beach. Thought it was a fluke thing, but then kept finding pieces. I finally asked one of the guys who had booked a snorkeling trip for my son and I and he said it was because of folks discarding bottles over the years (not sure what is wrong with people, but nothing surprises me any more). There were many people who couldn't even clean up their own cups and plates from around the pool. I assume they are the same people who wouldn't have a problem throwing bottles on the beach. In any event, the glass was not isolated to just the Sunscape Grand as I walked the entire beach from the Sunscape to the end of the public beach and there were several other hotels who actually had cylinders set up on the beach for putting glass shards in. As for entertainment, you could be there all day and do nothing or you could keep busy every minute of every hour. There is a daily list of activities that varies from day to day. Movie every night followed by a stage show. Twice a week the vendors come and set up and you can buy things with them. Make sure you barter with them. They start high, but trust me, walk away and they'll come down in price, considerably. The food was fine. I wouldn't recommend the hamburgers, they may be shaped like a hamburger, but they don't look or taste like one. Didn't matter to us, we can eat a hamburger at home any time. All the other food was good and plentiful. You could eat all day long if you wanted with a wide variety. Fresh fruit bar on the beach was a nice added touch. As for drinks, they too were plentiful. Our only complaint there was the number of bartenders manning the various locations. Each had only one to a station and for the most part, this wasn't an issue or a problem. It was annoying by 4:30 in the afternoon when everyone had had enough of the beach and decided to start quenching thirsts at the same time. One bartender at the end of the pool where people could sit in the water, just wasn't cutting it. Those sitting in the seats felt they deserved a refill before folks standing in the back could even get their first. We just got out of the pool and went around to the other side where there was another bartending station available. Won't bore you with any more writing. If you are going to Punta Cana, I would recommend this hotel. For the money, you can't beat it. After walking the beach and seeing the other hotels along side it, they all looked the same and I'm pretty sure, you will get the same type of food, service, room, and entertainment at any of them. I would also recommend checking Vacations to Go as they gave me a cheaper price than I got going directly to Sunscape's web site by a few hundred dollars.  
<Date>Aug 1, 2005

<Author>undertaker1955
<Content>An outstanding resort!!! We had the most wonderful vacation at the Sunscape. Last year, we stayed at the Allegro (next door to Sunscape). As my wife and I walked the beach, we continually commented that it looked as if everyone at Sunscape were really having a great time, and that we should try it sometime. Well, that sometime was this year and believe me, we can't wait to go back next year!! The staff was simply OUTSTANDING. I know most people say the staff was great, and so forth, but I'm here to tell you...I have never been as impressed as I was with this resort. We truly hated to see the end of the week show up!! Some of the staff were near tears when we left.....that's how much we impacted them, and they impacted us. My favorite was the piano bar!!!! Dave on keyboard was so much fun.....we karaoked almost every night until the wee small hours of the morning. We took our daughters (19 and 16) with us this year, and they had a blast, too. We met some folks from St. Louis and North Carolina and spent the better part of the week partying with them. The food was excellent, the service SUPREME. The rooms were great...very comfortable and clean. Trust me....if you want to have a great time, the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand is the place to go....we'll be there again next May!!!!  
<Date>Jul 31, 2005

<Author>jjf15626
<Content>Great coming in, bad leaving We had 11 people in our party, my son's wedding party on July 26th. Upon arrival we were treated like royalty, everyone was made to feel welcome. The concierge at the hotel was excellent. She did extremely well with the wedding party. The photographer was excellent, as were his assistants. One lady in particular did a great job handling the small children who were part of the wedding party. The all-inclusive aspect of the vacation was terrific, and Apple Vacations, with whom we booked with, did admirably well helping us with some of the do's and don'ts of local custom. The weather was wonderful, very hot and humid, but you expect that if you go that close to the equator. The food was very good, and the shows and entertainers all worked very hard to provide a great experience. The rooms were just average, one couple in our group had all kinds of trouble with their room, from having no lights to no water when a water line broke. In our room we found these tiny ant or spider type creatures that seemed to be attracted to moisture, if you didn't discard a plastic cup that had something in it, the next day or later the same day you would find these small bugs crawling all over it and the table it was sitting on. The rooms were not very sound proof so we could hear everything that went on all night long, doors slamming, people talking or running up and down the halls, and anything loud outside.. Also, I know you don't go on vacation to watch tv but the tv service in the room was poor at best. They advertise sattelite but there are only like 15 channels, and the main network feeds came from New York, so you couldn't even get weather reports for your area. It should have at least been from the network stations in Miami considering the location. When we arrived, we were advised by the apple vacations rep. not to do certain things or take part in activities that they didn't approve of because if something bad happened, we would not be covered by their travel insurance. However, the excursions and activities apple recomended were very high priced, as was everything you would want to purchase there. When you make a purchase there, you should use USA money, even though the stuff is expensive. On my last visit to the gift shop in the hotel, I used my bank card and I am still trying to figure out what I was charged in US dollars. When I bought the stuff, the charge slip read 2440.2 dominican pesos, and the clerk said it was 78 71 in USD. But my bank hit me for 85 dollars, and an exchange site told me the it should be 83 dollars. So, to avoid the confusion, use your cash, at least you know first hand what you are losing. When we checked in we were told by both the hotel staff and apple to hang on to the room safe key if we took one because if we didn't return it we would have to pay 100 dollars at check out. But they never told us that you have to return the towel card they give you or they will charge you 15 dollars per. They give you a towel card and you take it to a stand for a beach towel, then return it and get your card back. the cards get all wet and wrinkly and the writing on the card, where it says you will be charged if you don't return it, gets all messed up and illegible. Also, the towel booth closes early, before the pool does, so if you stay late you can't return your towel. It seems like a scam to get more of your money, and I had an unpleasant experience on my check out fighting with the clerk about that. He was very rude to us about it.All in all, given my good and bad experiences, I think it was an average vacation. If I go back again, it will be better because I will be more prepared.  
<Date>Jul 31, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>WHAT A VACATION! My family and I(all twenty of us) were on vacation from 7/18/05 to 7/23/05. We had a wonderful time. The rooms were clean, the food was good, the beaches spectacular, the pool a pure joy. There was always something to do, volleyball, horseshoes, bingo, dancing, exercise, Spanish lessons, and much more. If you idea of vacationing was to relax that was available too. The staff at Sunscape Grand were extremely friendly. By week's end they all know your names. My son (17) keeps looking at the website wishing he was back. Resturants were good, drinks plenty. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very nice visit! My husband and I were at the Grand from 7/16-7/23. We were in 3130, perfect location, first floor with balcony facing pool and on corner of beach. I, like many of the previous reviewers, was very worried about my trip after reading the several negative reviews, even considered canceling. However, we did not encounter any of these problems. This is a very nice resort. The grounds are very nice and very well kept. The staff is friendly and helpful. Though we speak no Spanish, there really were no communication problems. The food was great at all the restaurants. The person that complained of the buffet not being like it is in the city should probably stay in the city. This is the DR, not the United States! There are drinks and food/snacks available almost anywhere on the resort at anytime of the day (fruit stand on the beach, etc.). They worked regularly to clean this up. There was plenty of entertainment, and plenty for the children (though we don't have children). We went on the Outback Safari which I really liked. This is a great way to see how the people in the DR really live and a fun time. The driver and guide were attentive, knowledgeable, and a lot of fun. Basically, there is as much to do or as little to do as you want each day. We didn't do much in the evenings as we were tired from being in the sun all day, but there was plenty offered. There is a big movie screen and they show a movie nightly before the entertainment. This is a good way to relax. There was a magician show one night that was very good. Though this is all inclusive we tipped and I would suggest so. If you can afford to go on this trip, you can afford to tip. The staff work many hours (most from morning 'til late night) and some for two or four weeks straight until getting a day off, and they work very hard. They really appreciate the extra. Probably the only slightly negative thing I can say is the rooms do need updating. Our sink was clogged so the water took a long time to drain. The water pressure in the shower was bad and on two occasions there was no hot water. Both times we called the desk and that was fixed immediately. We didn't spend much time in the room so none of this was really an issue. Because someone had complained about the rooms being musty, I took a gel odor absorber and this worked wonders. Also, there were tiny bugs on the counter (I don't think this can be prevented because of the location). I sprayed Off on them the first night and hardly saw again. We saw no rats, roaches or any other creatures. Bottom line...the people that complained would probably complain no matter where they were. If you want to go somewhere that is like the US (or your home country), then stay there. Don't go to another country and expect things to be the same and certainly don't complain about things that nobody has control over (seaweed on the beach, which they work to clean up; warm water in the pool, etc.). We haven't been to any other resorts so have nothing to compare to, however, we'd certainly recommend this resort.  
<Date>Jul 28, 2005

<Author>islandsfree
<Content>Great Family Vacation We stayed at Sunscape Grand from July 18 to July 25. My entire family, sisters and husbands, son and wife, daughter and husband and my little granddaughter who is 22 months enjoyed a great time together. After reading some of the latest reviews I was a little worried whether we chose the right place or not. We were surprised at how great most of the things were.Room: We had a great room in building 4 on the third floor room 4322. My son and daugher had end rooms which were fantastic with a great terrace facing the ocean and beach these rooms were 4324 and 4224. The rooms were clean as well as the bathrooms. Had no problems with bugs or leaking ceilings. We tipped our maid everyday and received extra towels and extra drinks and coffee which was nice. She was a really sweet person named Maria and truly appreciated our few dollars a day.Beach: Beach was fantastic. There was seaweed on the beach but the staff work very hard to keep the entire grounds immaculate and the seaweed was cleaned constantly all day. We only went to the pool twice because we enjoyed the beach so much. The water was great and the snorkeling was even better right in the area of the beach roped off. We have a lot of snorkelers in our family and everyday they would follow the roped buoys along the small reef within the swim area and had a ball. Luis and Ramon strolled the beach almost all day to serve drinks and we were never thirsty. We also tipped them and they constantly came back to see if we wanted another drink.Food: Food was average. Did not care for the buffet Windows. Went to the Italian Retaurant and food was good but our favorite was the Tex Mex and Beach Garden Grill. Food was very good. We went daily to have breakfast in the Beach Garden Grill and it was great. We got to know all the servers and bartenders there and they treated us like a million dollars. Hats off to all the guys who work Tex Mex and Beach Garden Grill. Excursion: Only went on one excursion. Snorkeling trip with Ms. Sharkey and the Marinarium Crew with sharks and sting rays. Best time ever. Don't miss this, we had a blast.Conclusion: I would definitely go back to Sunscape Grand. Just a few comments that might help someone else. We did take a lot of one dollar bills and tipped bartenders, servers and maids. Even though this is an all inclusive a few extra bucks goes a long way and they really appreciate it. I took $200 in ones and didn't spend all of it. We tried to speak some Spanish whenever we could. They try to help you and by the end of the week we were really communicating pretty good. It's nice to try to speak the language of the country you are visiting at least give it a try but don't make fun. My only criticism out of the entire vacation was the front desk reception. They were very rude when checking in and this was late at night with a 22 month old. Checking out wasn't too bad but I had a manager to check me out so I was taken care of fine. I think some of the people at the front desk should be replaced by the great staff at some of the restaurants, bars and activity centers they could learn a thing or two from them. Lots of activities, shows were good, great kids program and activity staff were awesome. There is something for everyone so you could not get bored. My final comment is this: if you treat the staff with respect you will receive respect. I found some people to be very demanding and rude to the staff and I felt bad for them because they were trying to do their best. My granddaughter had a ball and all the staff were just super to her. She even went on stage at night before the show and danced with the Kids Explorer Club.Thank you Sunscape Grand for a great family vacation and to the people of the Dominican Republic for being so gracious.  
<Date>Jul 27, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best we've ever had ! May I congratulate the management and staff! Our stay exceeded our expectations. My wife and I enjoyed the most chilled, relaxing holiday of our middle aged lives.The staff were all pleasant and friendly with smiles never far from their faces.The daily cocktails were an inspiration resulting in the loss of one afternoon due to overindulgence.Our room was both comfortable and clean with plenty of space and the bed was sufficiently large that you could avoid your spouse! (I didn't.)The television caused a dilemma as it was sunny outside and the British Open from St. Andrews was available in English  Spanish.The choice of food was extensive from several on site resteraunts and the qualiy was excellent.Overeating and drinking could be a problem. I've gained 8 pounds and my wife wont admit her weight.The week flew by without us going off the Hotel complex.When we checked out and I went to settle my bill it was nil!What a great value all inclusive! We'll be back!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Feels like home I have now stayed at Sunscape 4 times and have never had a problem.The people are the most wonderful I have ever encountered at any resort I have ever travelled to.  For the record, in all of my visits, I have NEVER seen any rats on the premises, NEVER seen any cockroaches in my room, NEVER had any reptiles, rhodents or insects of any kind. As for the food, if you go in with an open mind and remember, you are not in North America and the food will not taste the same, you will be fine.Windows has many varieties of food every night. As for the person who could not find any vegetables to eat, you must not have looked too hard because they are at almost every station. Of course there is seaweed on the beach...it is an ocean! The crew tries extremely hard to keep up with the removal, and it is appreciated. When you are going on vacation to a third world country, you must learn not to expect the same quality as in Manhattan. The staff is why I return again and again. Milton at the front desk is the most attentive concierge ever. Gloria and Chocolate at the backstage bar are incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. The entire animation crew is awesome! They will go out of their way to make sure you are having a great time (even if that means LOWERING the music down). They are never pushy, if you do not want to participate in the acitivites, they leave you alone.  I will not hesitate to go back to Sunscape, it feels just like going home!  
<Date>Jul 27, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sunscape Punta Cana Grand: What a beautiful vacation!!! My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand from June 18th to the 23rd. We had a wonderful time! The resort is a mix of families and couples; it is not a wild, crazy, party place. We are both in our early 20's and had a great time! There was always something for us to do, or a place to just sit and relax if that's what we wanted to do. The reviews worried me about so many things, but I was not disappointed once down there. The restaurants are great, however you are not in America, keep that in mind. Things are not made the same there as they are here. The buffet was really good, as well as Da Mario's. Omelettes every morning, and a steak almost every night! One night they had an outside buffet by the theatre, the food was good there as well. We sadly missed the beach buffet, as we left Thursday afternoon. You never had to get up at crazy hours in the morning to 'reserve a chair.' There were plenty for everyone. We were in building 3, third floor and had no problems with bugs, damp sheets, or funny smells. Sure if you went out on the balcony, there were some ants, but what do you expect being OUTSIDE?! There were certainly no rats anywhere. I don't know what these other people are talking about. The staff was amazing, you saw them early in the morning, and late at night doing something else. They were always there to help you as quickly as possible with anything. Our favorite part of the resort was Juan, the pool bartender. He had new drinks for us before we were halfway through the ones in our hand! The Coco-Loco's were the best!! The little sandwiches by the pool were a nice afternoon snack. The pool was warm sometimes, but you are right next to the equator, it happens. The beach never smelled like gas, and didn't have a lot of seaweed laying around like some have said. It was fun to barter with the people in the huts on the beach. They can get pushy, but all you have to do is say no thank you.One word of advice I would like to pass along is.....do not book through Liberty Travel!!! They were not helpful or accomodating to us AT ALL!!! We ran into so many unnecessary problems because of them. I will never again use that travel agency, and will warn anyone I know not to as well. I cannot wait to return to Punta Cana, and I will definitely go back to the Sunscape Grand!!!  
<Date>Jul 27, 2005

<Author>rav4mom
<Content>Go Jamacia Dave! Just sat here and read some of the past reviews - doesn't sound like we were in the same resort! We found no: rats, roaches, mosquitos, mold, mildew and neither of us got ill. What we did find was a beautiful resort with well kept grounds. Our room (building 4) was very clean - we even spied the maid up on the sink cleaning the overhead light fixtures. The fridge was well stocked and when we asked for more diet pepsi - it was delivered to our room. Maids were very friendly. We had a wonderful plane ride in - a little wait at the airport due to a taxi strike but they had it cleared up shortly - some mix up over when the bus would come but it wasn't bad. Friends reported that their tv went out and they got a free bottle of wine for their troubles.We went to the Maya Riveria last year and stayed at sunscape which was a 6 apple. Other than the food wasn't as fancy here - we felt it compared very favorably with Mexico. Service is a little slower but as the local joke goes - you are on Dominican minutes not American! Slow down and enjoy yourself. My husband speaks NO spanish and I very little. We had no problem being understood or understanding them. We met two other couples(from Pa and NJ) and we all had a ball. Met a newly married couple from Germany, some girls from Pa, a family from New Jersey - talk with people and have fun. The couple from NJ had come last year. Since they had come back - they had robes and slippers and other perks for them and their name was in the daily activity sheet as returning.  Gloria the barmaid at the main bar was fantastic. She remembered all our drinks and did so for days. Drinks were very good and we asked for 151 rum which we got (sometimes got even though we didn't ask for it). She is very friendly and did a great job. The waiter at the beach was very good and was around often. The beach was beautiful - could use a few more cabanas but we just parked ourselves by a small palm tree and sat in the shade of it - just wonderful. There was such a nice breeze blowing - it didn't seem horribly hot. When we felt we had enough sun for awhile - we just went into one of the eating establishments. Yes - there was some seaweed - so what - it is the sea. They came and cleaned the beach every day. Not sure if I'd want to take young children as the Europeans at the beach seemed to think it was ok to go topless - in the water, up to the restaurants (not allowed in topless thank heavens) but if you don't have young kids - no problem. The water was beautiful, the sand was great - didn't need beach shoes as very smooth with no rocks, the big kid had a great time climbing on the iceberg. The shows that the workers themselves did were very funny and entertaining. Are they New York quality? Of course not - but very entertaining. But the highlight of the entertainment was Jamaican Dave. Go to the piano bar on the nights he is there for a wonderful time but ONLY IF YOU CAN LAUGH AT YOURSELF! This is definately x-rated. He is a gifted musician and we had a great time the 3 nights we went to his show. The crowd makes the show so the nights that there is a good crowd that wants to have a great time and will participate were great. The last night the crowd was blah so wasn't as good but it wasn't due to Dave. If he asks for 4 guys to go on stage - GO. It's a good laugh and a good time. Never in my wildest dreams would I think that my husband would get up on stage and sing - and sing Bob Marley - but he did - all 3 nights. The bar (Umbrella's) also had Jose Cuervo and top shelf liquor. If you go and see Dave - tell him that the white rastafarian from WV says hey!We found a great variety of food at the buffett. Calamari very frequently, something for everyone. We enjoyed trying the native dishes (pureed green bananas, yucca, name, etc.) Very good salads and wonderful avacado salad. Try the ice cream. Very good - especially the rum raisin and mango. Tex-Mex and Italian very good. The crab and olive pizza and the seafood pizza at Garden's rest. were very, very good. The Banana's flambe was also great. Beautiful deserts and wonderful coffee. Try the Coco Loco, the Miami Vice  Banana Mama. Heaven (espeically when made with 151 rum). The fruit stand at the beach had wonderful coconut, mango, papaya etc and the buffet always had fruit. Try the watermelon juice at breakfast. The shops beside the beach. Don't be intimidated - have fun. We liked number #2 (ask for Mario) and #5 (Danny Boy). Never, ever, ever pay full price. The more you buy - the better discounts you get. You should be able to get t-shirts for $6- $7 (they try getting $18) - even for Xtra large. Children's $3-$4. We got rum for $7.50 a 5th and 1 pound bags of coffee for $5. Nice long wrap for $10 (the guazy kind not the cotton ones) - hand made photo alblums (the large size) for $15. Wish someone would have told us the prices to expect. We did better the longer we were there. If you don't get the price you think you should - walk out - they will generally come down unless you are really out of line. If not - try one of the other stalls. The girls at the first stand do a great job with hair beading and braiding and are very interesting to talk with - take them non alcoholic pina coladas and bottled water - they are very grateful. They ride the bus 1 hour and 50 minutes one way to get to work each morning (around 9:00 a.m. or earlier) and get home 9 or 9:30 each evening - 7 days a week. The one girl has 2 children. Talk with the natives. Jewelry - most of the shops have the cheap stuff but some (shop #1) has better stuff locked in the case. Couldn't get them down past $28 for the larimar bracelet but probably worth it.Although we didn't have kids - they seemed to do a good job with them. Esperanda (I think that was her name) seemed very good. The kids we saw ran to get there in the morning. They had free horseback rides one day, had burro rides, did activities and got on stage each evening. We had a wonderful time. Maybe we were just out to have a great time but we felt the place was GREAT! (p.s. - go to the Managers Cocktail - very nice)  
<Date>Jul 25, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>great little spot... My finacee and I stayed at the Grand and had a great time. Most of the families that were there were busy scheduling day trips set up through the resort while we spent the day at the pool or beach. I had never been to the DR before and I want to go back tommorrow. The Grand is always on the move, from the staff and their organized events to the waiters to the grounds crew and house keeping yet through it all we easily managed to do very little at be waited on for the entire week.We would grade the food as exceptable with our best meal being at the Itailian restaurant Da Marios. Niether of us experienced any discomfort and did more than our share of eating and drinking. There are plenty to keep the kids busy and enough seclusion for the adults. Movies, dance shows and a stand up comedian from the US kept our nights filled until we were just too tired to go on.One caveat would be to bring everything that you need with you as the gift shop is way over priced and beware of the merchants...if you do not put your foot down in the first second of their pitch...they have you, for a lot of pesos.

<Author>reebic
<Content>Not too bad, but not too great either My boyfriend and I stayed here July 18-22. You get about what you pay for I guess. I didn't have a terrible time, but I wouldn't really recommend it to my friends. I'll try to do this in sections...GROUNDS: The beach was pretty. We never had problems getting chairs mid morning. I'm not about to get up at 7 to resereve a chair. I like to sleep in. Getting chairs in the shade was a tad more difficult. There was a bit of seaweed the 1st day, but Emily had just passed by. Not much you can do about seaweed. They cleaned it up well. We actually walked north on the beach and the other resorts there did not as good of a job cleaning the seaweed. The marina next door wasn't a problem. I never smelled any fumes. The pools were nice. They were on the warm side, but it is July. The area around the swim up bar was a little iffy, It looked like it could use some cleaning. However, Juan makes a mean drink at the swim up bar. Ask for a Juan Special! The adult pool was never crowded and seemed a little cleaner. The Hot tub did not. It also was no hotter than the pool water. It only bubbled. There is also a small bar at the adult bar.FOOD AND DRINKS: I've been to 4 other all inclusives in the Caribbean, and the food here is very mediocre. You aren't going to starve, but the choices are limited. Many of the foods are repeated at different restaurants. For instance, the pasta they served at DR night is the same pasta at the buffet and at windows. The fajitas at the tex mex restaurant are also served at the lunch buffett. They serve the same medallions of beef at every resaurant, just with different sauces. If you find yourself liking any of these, you are in luck. There is always the standard eggs, bacon and waffles at the breakfast buffet. The salsa at the texmex is pretty good, and they also have it self serve at the main bar by the pool during the day. The bars serve local brands of liquor and only one local brand of beer. It's presidente from a keg, and it is cold. My boyfriend liked it, but I didn't. If you look hard you can find some standby liquours. I saw Tanqueray, Jack Daniels, Stoli Vodka, and Bacardi Limon (until they ran out) When you go to Demarios they will give you a wine list for wines you can purchase by the bottle. They do not tell you that there is also a house wine by the glass that is not extra. We heard another couple asking. The red wine was suprisingly good. I can't say the same for the white. Also when you go to Demario's and The Tex Mex, which are the best restaurants, be prepared to be hot! I know you are in the Caribbean, but let me tell you. .. It takes a lot to make me uncomfortable, and I was past that. They don't open the windows in those 2 restaurants for some reason, and there is no breeze. The american grill is always breezy and cool, and the buffet is air conditioned.ROOM: The room was standard. The air worked great and there was a ceiling fan. The bathroom was fairly large. The mini bar has various drinks, and if you leave your empties by the bar, they will restock it. The main problem with my room was the noise factor. I'm a flight attendant, so I've stayed in my share of hotels, and Im used to noisy hallways. This hotel was the worst. I guess it's the layout of the bldg. The halls are open on both sides and are tiled. Every sound is magnified greatly. On the 1st day I was trying to nap, and I got up to check the door because I thought it must have been left open. The 2nd day, I heard what I thought was a small elephant, but it was only a 5 year old. (I know a 5 year old can probably sound like an elephant on occasions, but at this time, she was being good) The maids are on no schedule either, so there always seems to be commotion in the hallways. They aren't exactly quiet in their duties either. AIRPORT FEES: We paid $10 each on arrival for tourist cards, and were told if we lost them we have to pay $10 again on departure. Then we were told it was a $50 fee to replace the card. Luckily we kept up with the cards so we never found out!! We weren't charged any fees to leave. Apparently most tickets to and from the US already have a fee included. Check with your airline if you aren't sure. The Transportation guys that dropped us us off reminded us not to pay anything, so I guess there's a problem with people getting charged when they are not supposed to!SUMMARY: Everyone spoke enough English for anyone to communicate with them. I still tried to talk in Spanish and learned some pronunciation! I never took Spanish either, but I had no problem. Also here things aren't always as advertised. Many restaurants have marked on their door and in your room guide book what nights they are closed. They don't exactly go by this. Also one night we were to have a beach party and they said all but one restaurant would be closed. The beach party never happened and all restaurants were open! It wasn't so much of a problem as it was comical! They blame it on Domican Time. Two things really bugged me. One was that on severeal nights they had vendors set up on by the pool area in the middle of the resort. I felt like I had to go through through an obstacle course of attackers to get to the buffet. I said no politely but the next one would jump out in your path with the offer of a deal. Now if you want to buy something this is fine. I just wanted to relax and not buy anything. There were several people buying like crazy, so I guess it just depends on what you like. You could always walk around the pool to get to the buffet. The other thing that bugged me was the charge I received when I checked out for the use of my phone. In the book in your room they tell you that even if you use a calling card you are charged for minutes and to avoid confusion, use the phone at the front desk. When I went down there they told me I had to use the phone in the room Ok. So I did I made 2 short calls with my calling card to my dad and 2 local calls to a transportation company to arrange pick up from the hotel. I was charged $22 for these calls. I think that's a little much, but when you have to get in touch with someone what are you going to do? Then when our transportation had not shown up 20 min after our scheduled pick up we asked the front desk if we could call them. They told us we had to go back to our room to call because there was a fee. This maDe me laugh since I had just paid a ridiculous fee, and had just checked out!! We told them that our transportation was late, and he laughed and said Dominican Time give them a few more minutes I'm all about Dominican Time, but I don't think my connection in Miami cared what time I was on!! Luckily the van showed up only 30 minutes late and we made home safe and sound with tans and hangovers!! ON A SIDE NOTE: If you like the Domincan Republic, I think you would love Negril, Jamaica also. So far I have like Jamaica the best out of all my Caribbean holidays.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Did not enjoy!!! A group of friends and I went this month and we would not go back ever! The food was odd and we all ended up sick at one time or another. The facilities were old and run down. We have been to other resorts and this does not compare! Our rooms were dirty. The ceiling leaked and the bugs were bad also. I was so upset and disappointed with the entire package. All activities, etc were closed by 6:30 p.m. The night life was not exciting after the second night there. People saved chairs and you could hardly ever get any shade! The pools were almost uncomfortably warm by mid afternoon. The adult pool was not clean at all. The one positive of the trip was Luis at the adult pool. He was fantastic. Juan at the swim up bar was not impressive at all.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>My experience I could go on and on about the expereinces I had in Punta Cana and at sunscape. But I won't bore anyone with the details....you can only experience it for yourself and have a good time. There seems to be something at teh hotel for everyone. Lots of activities, day and night, kids and grown ups. Theres lots of places for quiet relaxation. Lots of places for gaming and socializing. The staff is outstanding; friendly, helpful, above and beyond. Loved that they deliver a Miami Herald to your door, and love the Sundial, the bulletin they delivered that informed you of the hotel's daily activities. I have my complaints, but i just laugh at the them, because i had such a great time that they dont even bother me. First off, what i feared worst....my boyfreind and i got sick. dont know what from. The fried fish? Brushing our teeth with tap water? Too much sun? The adjustment? I dont know. It doesnt matter. We threw up, got better, and continued to have ourselves a good time. Our phone broke. We told them our last night there, so they never got around to replacing it before we left. Big deal. Our room wasnt ready when we first arrived. We arrived really early; check in wasnt until 3, we were there at 10 30. We got the next room available, in building 5, on the third floor, beautiful ocean view. The beach had sea weed.... but it is the ocean afterall.The adult pool water is warm. It sits outside all day. The sun is hot. My favorite aspect of my vacation was teh Saona island trip. First you drive through Punta Cana, Higuey and arrive in Bayahibe, where you board a speed boat that takes you to your catamaran. You can drink, dance, lay in teh sun, or do wahtever, for the catamaran ride to Saona island, which lasts about, geez i dont even know, a while. Maybe an hour or so. Then you board a speed boat teh takes you to the island. OH MY GOD! BEAUTIFUL! No hotels. Its great. The water is so crystal blue. Theres lots of palm trees, lounge chairs, picnic tables and hammocks. You stay on the island for three hours. You can swim, play volleyball, listen to music, dance, drink as much as you want, and eat. The food we ate on the island was the best food we had while we were on vacation. It was the best barbecue i ever had. They make chicken and pork chops, loster tail, two kinds of spanish rice, green beans and potatoes and they have a delicious fruit spread (pineapple, mango, papaya, cantaloupe). After the three hours are up, you get back in a speed boat and head ff to a spot in the ocean where there are star fish. You can get out of the boat and swim and check out the star fish. After about 20 minutes you get back in the boat and vruise along the coast until you get back to Bayahibe. Then you can buy a bottle of rum with your picture on it, (they took yuor picture before you left) We paid 10 for ours. You can buy all kinds of stuff here. You can go to the bathroom and/or change your clothes here. Give something to the bathroom girl, please. Then you load back on the bus and ride back to Higuey where you can get out and stretch and do some shopping in a pretty successful local business. You get to see some beautiful country side, some intersting town life, and the most idylic coast line. Someone's review said that alot of the time was wasted on the bus. I loved the bus ride. We got out of the resort and got to see Dominican towns from the comfort of our air conditioned bus. It was really interesting. Theres plenty to drink from beer to rum to water. Our tour guide, Raymond, was great. He really made the trip fun and interesting. I really recommend this tour. It was a more pricey excursion, i forget exactly how much, more that 70$, but i think a good value for an all day trip, from 7 40 am to about 6 30 pm, and teh day flew by becasue iw as having a blast. You can hang out the the other tourists youre with and get t know them, or you can break away from the group and find a nice romatic secluded spot. You can ask any questions you have about the DR, and get to see more than the resort. TipsBring a hat. I didnt, but im glad my boyfriend brought an extra one. I never wear hats, and i never thought i would need one, but the sun is so powerful that sunglasses didnt cut it for me. Bring peroxide or some kind of disinfectant for cuts. Bring lots of sunblock. I mean lots. i had to reapply at least every hour. Use the bottled water when brushing your teeth, better safe than sorry.Dont over indulge on anything...food, booze, sun, ocean....Don't be condescending when you speak to the staff in spanish. Dont make up spanish words by adding an o on the end of a word. (Ei: Water-o, or El Beer-o. Arent some people wild?) Do not reserve a chair in the shade with a towel and assume its fine to go off to eat, drink, shower, watch a movie, play shuffleboard, and have a massage. Someone like me is likely to toss your towel aside when you don't come back after three hours. Plus, why contribute to such obnoxious behavior?Tip. They deserve it.Relax, its the caribbean, pretty much nothing is THAT serious.  
<Date>Jul 20, 2005

<Author>Finhart
<Content>Pretty Darn Awesome! OK! So let me start by saying that before we left for our trip, I hounded this website in search of as much info as I could gather. Advice: Don't think about things too much and just go with the flow! Otherwise you'll be analyzing things the whole time you're supposed to be relaxing. My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sunscape Grand from July 1st to July 5th. We are both 24 years old and very much in love...Therefore, we pretty much have a blast no matter what we're doing as long as we're together! That said, I will break it down for everyone. THE BEACH: is amazing! I have been to Hawaii, but never the Carribean, so just seeing the water was a treat for me. Crystal blue! We always got a chair on the beach. And if we needed a break from the sun, we moved under one of the many cabannas. The palm trees are picturesque. I bought two beautiful necklaces at the tacky stores on the beach. Yes, they haggle you...but I've traveled all through Europe and it's the same kind of thing. Have some common sense and just ignore them if it bothers you. We actually brought our own towels with us, but did use the hotel ones a few times. No problems at all. EXCURSIONS: We did the Saona Island trip one day. It was cool, but I would not recommend it as it takes all day and half the time you are on a bus. If you crave CRYSTAL CLEAR water, then go on this tour. The buffet they served while on Saona Island was gross though! And there was no bottled water, so I was strugglin with the sun and the acholohol consumption. To be honest, I would have rather saved the $80/person and just chilled on the Sunscape Grande beach. Unless you are there for more than 7 days, I recommend going on the half day trips. The snorkeling trip with Mr Sharkey and the Marinarium crew was awesome! Definitely worth it! And you just have to walk down the beach to get to where the boat leaves from. Amazing time! After we snorkeled, the boat took us for a ride and stopped in the middle of the ocean at a sand bar. AHH! Bob Marley blasting while swimming with my honey in crystal blue water! They even brought around beer and cocktails on floating trays. Amazing! The POOLS: were cool, but the beach is more our thing. The adult pool was nice to wind down with at the end of the day. The FOOD: I am quite picky, as I don't eat red meat and don't eat milk products and am conscious about carbs/fat/calories blah blah blah. I had to let that go though. Basically, I stuck with the pizza and fries at the beach garden. Oh, and the tuna salad wasn't bad. The fruit is amazing either restaurant you go to. Windows was awesome for an omelette and coffee in the morning. Otherwise, I think Windows is nasty-(I hate buffets though.) The Tex Mex was pretty darn good. I stuck with the simple cheese quesadillas. Da Mario's was awesome. We went there twice. The chicken was on par with a typical chicken dish at a resaturant in Manhattan. The pasta is different, so it was a little weird. But it did the trick. Service at Da Mario's is awesome. We tipped constantly throughout our trip. Two bucks here, a five there. The GROUNDS: Fantastic. So cool! Well groomed and clean.I would recommend this resort if you want to just chill out on the beach and enjoy the surf and sun. If you want a lot of nightlife and a lot of people, this is not the place for you. NIGHTLIFE: I was totally into it. My boyfriend was not though. He thought the shows were lame and the disco was cheesy. I thought it was cool though. The thing is, we drank a few beers/mixed drinks throughout the day, so I didn't really want to drink at night. If I had, I would have had a great time at the disco/Cigar Bar. We did go to the casino one night. It was fun! I watched my boyfriend play black jack and roulette.Oh, and the ROOM: was great! I recommend building 5, top floor. I disliked the way that everything felt damp all the time--your clothes, your skin, the sheets. It did not make for a romantic atmosphere when you're always a little damp and smell a little different. But totally no big deal. Oh, and one last thing. And this is a bad note...well, I hate to say it, but we did see a rat while we were there. It totally bugged me out bigtime. It was bigger than any rat I've ever seen in NYC. It was the size of a kitten. And it was wet and looked sick. Ugggh. My boyfriend tried to convince me it was a breed of mongoose, but then we asked one of the staffers walking by. My boyfriend told him in spanish that we wouldn't be mad, but what exactly was this small creature. The staffer responded: Oh...Ratton! Ewwww! But sometimes you just have to let things go. Whatever, there are rats all over the world...especially in island environments. We saw it over by the adult pool in the evening time. If I had seen more I would have really bugged out. But then again, we also saw iguanas and lizards everywhere...it's all about your perception. You know what though? On the plane ride back we heard so many people complaining SO much about the hotels where they stayed. Saying they got food poisoning and that the service was terrible and no one spoke english. We felt like Sunscape was definitely the best choice. Unless of course, you have a lot of $$ to blow...but then you should go to Hawaii or St Lucia or the Greek Isles!BOTTOM LINE: Go to Sunscape. Bring a good book, your sunglasses, a little spending $$$ and some sunscreen. Have a nice, cold Coco Loco while taking in the breathtaking views of the palmtrees and the blue blue water. Then when the alchohol kicks in and you want some munchies...go to the fruit stand on the beach and get some juicy pinapple and bannana. Or stop by the breach garden and get a pepperoni pizza to go and enjoy it on the beach. Overall, RELAX, you're on vacay!!!Questions? Email me.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fair not a great as expected We stayed at the Sunscape Grand from July 2 to July 9, 2005 in building 4. The grounds were beautiful. Our room was ok nothing to brag about. I got up each morning about 7a.m to put our towel on the beach under a hut or you would not get one except in the back far end of beach. Beach was beautiful. The ocean water was great. We only spent a couple of hours in the pool one or two days. It was ok but we can swim anytime. The person who braged about Windows Burffet apparently has never been to a buffet in the city. There was no seafood and the service was horrible. I asked for Diet Coke and received it either when I was finished eating or half way thru my meal. They usually forgot and I would asked again. Our room leaked when we had rain, so we put a wastebasket under the leak and went about our way. No water pressure in shower. The shows were ok we really did not care for them. The staff was pretty good friendly and nice. Jackie at the front desk was very nice. The apple vacation representataive named Ceasar was not real helpful. He was great in the presentation but after that you might not want to ask for help. At the beach party the waiter ask if I wanted wine, I said yes. He ended up bringing me a bottle of wine and after the meal he gave us a ticket to sign for $18. So remember everything is not All Inclusive. Some Wines cost. We did not know this and the waiter did not inform me of this. Ceasar said Now you have bought an $18 bottle of wine. I would not recommend this hotel, there might be better ones at Punta Cuna, but we probably will not go back. Different ones we talked to on the plane said the same thing. We did pay an extra $20 to keep our room on the last day till 4:00 p.m. to shower and change in. This was worth it. Other than your room do not expect Air Conditioning anywhere else. Do not go to the free casino. It is a rip. Very small. Table games or 25cent machines. Not much.Cancun is much better. Also take an insulated mug for drinks.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I had a great time I read some of these negative reviews after having already booked my trip and thought my God what type of dump am I going to? I held my breath waiting to see what was in store for me.I was very pleasantly surprised. the room was lovely, (the mosquitos, liked it too apparently) and the room was very clean. The beds were very comfortable. Often when you go to a place like this you may find stains from visitors past on chairs etc. I found nothing like that at all and after having read the bad reviews I expected that and worse.The food was okay. Now if you're a fussy eater, maybe this isn't the place for you; I am not and I was well fed for five days with no stomach problems. I found the fruit unusally bland ( but I don't think that is the fault of the hotel). The italian restaurant was very good although the portions were somewhat small (but it is an all inclusive so go crazy, order two) the american grill was okay, but it was just a little off the mark. the buffalo wings were actually wings in bbq sauce (very edible, just not buffalo wings) the grouper was excellent. if you're a real tex-mex officianado, this is probably not the place for you. The buffet at windowswas good there is not a large vegetable selection, but you can get all the meat you want. I missed my veggies. there were some, but mostly the focus was not on veggies. overall i found the food to be edible and enjoyable.The service was a little slow, but always courteous and eventually you got what you needed. I had a little problem with not getting back a paper that was mistakenly taken from me at check in, I got it two days later. (but I got it). it took four hours for them to fix my remote (good thing I didnt go there to watch television). I had to ask for a fourth bath towel every time they changed the towels, even though they would take four, they would only leave three. None of it was a deal breaker.The entertainment was good and just that -- entertaining. the spa was lovely -- I had an excellent massage and you could not beat the price. Overall I found this to be a very relaxing and enjoyable vacation.If there was anything at all that was possibly not enjoyable, I would have to say it was the other guests. People can be extremely self-centered and inconsiderate, but you will find that at the very best places too.
