<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Rats at Sunscape Puntacana Grand The Sunscape Punta Cana Grand has RATS. Read on.... Travel dates June 27-July 4, 2005Monday June 27, 2005We arrived at the Sunscape Punta Cana Bavaro Grand after our 20-25 minute Apple Tour Bus ride from the airport and we had the standard check-in welcome of cocktail  cookies etc, front-desk staff were very friendly in-spite the humidity and heat and the 2 buses that they were trying to check in before us. Check-in did not go as smoothly as we anticipated due to overbooking and rooms not being available on time. Because as we found out much later they were under staff and the rooms were not ready until 5:00 p.m. After waiting 5 hours to get into our rooms we finally got our room keys and headed to our rooms in Building 2 /2308 and 2303.However the rooms had not been cleaned and the bellboys who had brought our luggage up left our bags in the room while we went back down to reception to let them know. Reception apologized and told us to get a bite to eat and the room would be ready in an hour, we said fine, no problems we can live with that. After getting some lunch-dinner (stale Pizza-Tuna, just awful) and exploring the place we went back to the room and it was indeed cleaned as we were promised however the smell of mould/mildew in the room was quite strong (there was mould on the bed covers) and we decided to ask to be moved, as it really was not nice. However we were told that the covers will be changed and that the room would be deodorized due to lack of availability of rooms since they were fully booked. We also encounter remodellers and painters along with a fumigation crew through the week for mosquitoes and rats.After the room was deodorized thankfully there was no smell of mould. Eventually the room was ready and we moved in and unpacked. The rooms were spacious but not half as nice (dated and worn furniture) the bed did not have a mattress and it I only had a box spring and it was very uncomfortable to sleep on. I kept asking the reception desk for a pad for the next three days and no response or any other accommodations were provided it seems that apathy rules in the Grand. We gave our maid a $2.00 and a handful of candy each day, and we found that our room was cleaned first thing in the morning and we usually had our refrigerator stocked (with bottled beer and sodas). You do have to give the staff credit. Thank God for the maid that gave me extra sheets and covers in order to pad my bed.Then it was time to use the restroom and then the toilet leaked and there were ants on the floor. However, these were minor things that could be overlooked after all we thought to be in paradise, lets make the best of it all. Not knowing what was coming and realizing later that we wasted three days of our vacation between waiting lack of sleep and making trips to the desk only to be ignored.We got some dinner later that evening in the Italian restaurant, which was very nice and had a few drinks at the outdoor bar. We went indoor to the Piano bar at about 8.30 p.m. when it opened, however we didn't stay long as the place was small and dingy, the decor was dated and the atmosphere was non-existent. We went back out to the bar outside and took a seat under an umbrella and had a couple of drinks while listening to Elvis, I noticed that most people seemed to be sitting quietly and there was a distinct lack of atmosphere. Even the bartenders seemed to have long faces on them! I also noticed that tipping did not appear to happen as often at this resort as it did at The Beach, perhaps this is why the bartenders didn't look happy. We decided later to visit the night club upstairs in the main building to see what that was like and it was pretty pathetic to be honest. For any English people reading this, I can only compare the nightclub to something out of Butlin; it really was a desperate attempt at a nightclub. At this point we decided to go back to the room to see if we could catch a late night movie or something that was at least slightly more entertaining than the nightlife of this resort. As native speakers and even for non-native speakers the experience of going to a different country is to experience the culture, food, people and music. I would have to say that Elvis and Motown along with Gloria Gaynor dominated this resort; Bachata and Merengue were practically non-existent. What a shame. Everywhere you went in the resort it was either Elvis playing at the pool, Motown music at the bar or Rap at the Disco. And this is how it went for the next 4 days and nights we were in the hotel.We decided to go on some tours the Outback Safari and the Santo Domingo Tours they were fantastic and actually made the trip tolerable. Tuesday We decided to do a bit of shopping at Bavaro Plaza and spent the rest of the day at the pool and beach what an experience. The daily entertainment team was virtually non-existent, except when you passed by their building, not like the Iberostar Bavaro where their entertainment team was awesome. I must say that the young man that called himself Minnie- Me was rude and unprofessional as observed by many at the resort constantly flirting excessively with the guest.The beaches were very dirty with trash and plastic bottles washing up from the ocean. The restaurant food in the beach was poor and the drinks were at poor quality I would venture to say that the bottles of rum were watered down before they were served from the bar to the guests. The beach was not what we expected. I have been to Punta Cana Iberostar Bavaro, Riu Palace, Secrets, Barcelo and Casa del Mar en La Romana in the past three years. At Sunscape Punta Cana Grand you have an abundance of seaweed (which yes they are working on cleaning up ALL DAY!) There were boats anchored just off your swimming area and they are servicing their boats and the waste is being dumped as you are expected to use the beach. NICE?Cabanas and beach chairs both at the beach and the pool it just seems like there are not enough at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. All are held by 7am. If you do find enough together you are dragging them to be together and not at your ideal spot. It seems like the staff would discourage this but they do not. The pools were gross. The water was about 90 degrees, it felt like bath water and wasn't refreshing at all. The pools also needed resurfacing, be careful because sitting against the wall will snag your bathing suit. We are divers and found that this was not a good place to dive. The waters are all fished out and the coral is nothing that you can't see off the coast of Florida. BAD if you are looking for crystal clear water, forget it on a scale from 1 to 10 it may be a 6 and please be careful when snorkeling there is too much boat traffic and the owners of these boats are un licensed I came within 1 to 2 feet from being run over. Now there is a reef only minute by boat but when we arrived to snorkel we found the reef to be dead and only a few fish to look at.This is just not the typical Caribbean water we were used to, again, not bad, but definitely not impressive. And you have the seaweed truck driving back and forth, getting stuck in the sand, etc. all day . . . There are also vendors right on the edge of the resort beach, so if you're walking from the resort to the beach you pass them and get harassed. Wednesday We decided to take the Outback Safari Tour. Which I highly recommend to EVERYONE that visits the D.R. Please remember to take some school supplies for the little kids you visit in the school. They are so sweet...Our tour guide was Omar, and except for the old people on the tour, we (with our Los Angeles and Canadian couple) had so much fun. Everyone is so nice and sweet. Omar is so passionate about his country and knew so much. We loved learning about everything, and experiencing everything too. I tried sugar cane! Fresh cocoa and coffee and some kind of really potent wine that is an aphrodisiac!!! The Dominicans are so happy you are visiting them. My favorite part of the trip had to be boogie boarding at Macao Beach -I am sending school supplies to the children come this September. They were so eager to talk with us. On night three upon our return to Building 2, we approached the entrance and heard some loud rustling in the bushes on the left hand side of the entrance. Out of the bushes came about 4-5 RATS and actually blocked our path until they scurried back from where they came. Needless to say, this was not something we expected to see at a resort such as this and to put it mildly, it freaked my friends out completely and one of them was in tears. After the incident was reported to the front desk the person on the phone actually thought it was funny he seemed extremely apathetic to our situation, he told us that the hotel was doing some building work behind our room and that the RATS were probably disturbed. He told us that buildings 1-3 were not normally used because of this building work but because the hotel was exceptionally busy at the time they decided to use those buildings!!! He really didn't seem to give two hoots that we had taken the extreme decision to requests to speak to the night manager or however was in charge in order to make arrangements to leave the hotel early and to incur large costs that we could have done without incurring. He didn't seem to care that most of the guests checking out had complaints. We thought we would have a nice quiet vacation. It turned out to be a vacation filled with slamming doors, kids running up and down the halls, at all hours of the night. Food was good in the restaurants at night but the restaurant by the beach and the continental breakfast were truly a joke. ThursdayThe next day we went on a Santo Domingo Tour and return approximately at 7:30 p.m.  We were not impressed with the food except at the beach party. All of us got sick for a least one-day. We heard this from a number of people on the resort that they also had gotten sick. Not surprising when meat sits in the sun for 3-5 hours before being used.Thursday evening we received a note placed under our door offering us the grand opportunity to move to the Sunscape The Beach on Saturday morning it asked that we be ready by 10:00 a.m. and that on Saturday we would be transported to the new hotel at their expense. We talked it over and went to the desk and decided to move to the other hotel. Yes. Due to rats, roaches, mildew, construction work screaming children because half of the kids that were there were bitten to death by the mosquitoes and were sick from the food they ate. The stench of sewage directly behind our building was horrid instead of waking up to the smell of the ocean one woke up to the smell of human waste.FridayFriday spent at the resort packing and looking forward to a better experience at the Sunscape The Beach. We decided to go to the Spa in order to get a pedicure that turned out to be an unsanitary experience since the employees did not have the proper equipment to do a pedicure such as clean clippers and tools to clean under the toe nails, add to that solutions and disinfectant products used in giving a proper pedicures. Needless to say after the pedicure experience we opted out in having a massage we cancelled it. SaturdayDuring checkout at the Sunscape Grand, I asked to speak to a manager who I was told is the Sales Manager at the hotel and who arranged our return to The Beach. He took about 15 minutes to be located and while we were waiting at the desk for him we were able to overhear other guests checking out making various comments and were extremely upset. They were approximately 35-40 people at check out not one person who checked out appeared happy, some guests were being charged for things they didn't know had charges (collect calls), other guests were being hit with charges for losing their towel cards even though they were never given towel cards at check-in, other guests were being charged for the use of the safe in the room while others in the same group were not. A quick read of the comment book at reception confirmed that other guests had the experience similar things to us regarding their experiences of the resort, although RATS didn't appear to have been mentioned until we wrote our comments! This appears to be the prevailing attitude in this hotel, apathy. It obviously comes from the top management down, as the attitude of staff at The Beach was the opposite, they were proud of their hotel, happy to help you and made sure that you enjoyed yourself. Of course, there were exceptions to this apathy at the Grand and some staff was very nice indeed (the pool guy who does the impressions was hilarious) but it is the overall attitude that I am referring to. I would not go back to this resort ever.I would suggest that anyone thinking of staying at this resort should reconsider and book the Sunscape The Beach resorts instead. Sure its a little further away from the airport (50mins), sure the road out is bumpy, but you'll be glad you did, as you'll have a much better holiday/vacation. It was such a relief to return to The Beach for our final 2 nights.Saturday We arrived at Sunscape the BEACH at 11:30 the rooms were not available until 5:00 p.m. Room 4318Once again we had wasted another day.Since we were told at the Grand that our rooms would be immediately ready upon arrival since we had so many inconveniences while we were there at the Grand. Well that was not the case. Not only there was a huge commotion dealing with the buses coming and going people at checkout and check in and misc. at the busy lobby. We were also worrying about our luggage since the luggage was not properly guarded at all times and we feared since a lot of the pieces of luggage look the same and the personnel does not look after the luggage properly unless you tip them heavily at least that was our impression we decided to speak to the guys and make arrangements for our luggage to be placed in the room outside the luggage area since we saw that pieces of luggage were everywhere and we feared that our luggage would end up at the airport or at another resort. I was told that my room would not be on the third floor and that it would face the pool since it was a deluxe suite that included a Jacuzzi. What a lie it turned out to be. Only to find out that we would not have access to our rooms until 5:00 p.m. because they were not ready and they gave me a room that was not what was promised on paper. I asked at the Grand before leaving what kind of room I would be getting since I had plenty of issues and had wasted a lot of time trying to communicate my concerns for the three of us since I was more fluent in the language as a native speaker. The room I was given at the Beach was located on the third floor and if faced rooms that were occupied by couples that were a bunch of teenagers from Puerto Rico and were extremely loud, drunk and horny as they were having sex right outside my balcony. WHO NEEDS THE PLAYBOY CHANNEL I had it outside my room,The room itself was new and clean but no coffee pot or clock. The beach was beautiful and the food great. The entertainment was nice and we manage to get some descent food after all. But only after much stress and wasted time at the other resort. I feel that my vacation was a stressful and worrisome vacation due to the lack of amenities at the resort and services that should be standard such as a bed with a standard mattress. I feel sorry for the people that wont take the time to write a formal complaint regarding their poor vacation. In my case I work 14 to 16 hour days as a School Administrator and I really look forward to taking my vacations and when I do I feel that I should not go through an ordeal as in this past 5 days spent at The Sunscape Grand at Punta Cana. They were nothing but GRAND. SUNSCAPE GRAND primarily caters to North Americans (ANGLOS) So if you are looking to have a true cultural experience in the Dominican Republic forget this resort because it won happen.The rating of a 5 Gold Apple for this resort is incorrect, I would say it would be more of a 3 Apple rating if that. It should be demolished. Please build a new one or remodeled the existing one.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A 5* resort ? I don't think so!!! First i would like to say that this was my 3rd visit to Punta Cana. I bought a package for a 5* resort in Punta cana from Travelplan ( Buyers beware ).This hotel is 3* resort.Rooms - Old furniture. Loaded with mosquitos and roaches.Very dirty.Restaurants - Lack of quality and quantity in the buffet. the a la carte restaurants are so so.Swimming pool - Very dirty and needs rebuilding.Beach - Lots of seaweed. Intense smell of diesel ( from the boats parked at the marina wich is nearby.In the day that we have arrived and after checking the hotel conditions my family and a group of 20 portuguese tourists asked Travelplan representative to change to another hotel. They managed to change 3 couples to a 4* resort (punta cana princess i think )with an increase of price of ?60 per couple.I would go back to Punta Cana but only for real 5* resorts like Melia, Paradisus, Catalonia and others.Ps: I kindly ask to the other Portuguese tourists that had the same problem to get in touch with me so that we can make a complaint of Travelpla's behaviour  
<Date>Jul 12, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>No Casino............But Sunscape PC Grand has no casino, but you will be gambling the whole time if you pick this resort! My wife and I just returned 2 hours ago, and I felt like i had been to dining hell and back in the last four days. the resort itself is beautiful and mostly clean, but in no way is 5 stars or 6 Apples like Apple vacations claims. More like a 2-3 if you factor in the food and food service.First, the positives: Close enough to airport (no 1.5 hours over washboard roads like Secrets, which we loved last year), all paved roads. Close to snorkling at the reef, parasailing, beach is awesome, FREE catamarans, windsurfers (which I used) the above people who paid got ripped off by someone. Entertainment, fun, cool piano bar with karaoke wed night. Room nice, clean, great air conditioning (building 4).Negatives: food immediately made me and my wife sick, and I eat sushi, raw shellfish and anything else that hits my plate in the states without a hint of problem. I brushed my teeth with bottled water, and avoided fruits and vegetables , yet still lost two days to the tourista bug. We overheard others with the same maladies, but with the added bonus of vomiting thrown in! Last year at Secrets Excellence, I brought 200 in ones for tipping, and due to the excellent beyond the call service and friendliness, I was totally out by the time the week was over. Here, sadly, I came home with most of it. I did tip the two maids who really did a great job. Everyone else was indifferent or just plain ignored us, especially at the Garden International under the Tex Mex. During the second day there, the roof at the foot of the bed started to leak due to the major storm. I didnt hit the bed, and fell on the tile, so no big deal. The next day, my head got wet while using the bathroom, just to add insult to gastric injury. At this point, we called the front desk,as the leaks were now in two spots, but they never sent anyone over in the next two days. This morning, as we prepared for our flight, the toilet stopped altogether. I tried to turn the water to it on, but we ended up having to use the public bathrooms on our way out. I try to go with the flow, and if you read my review from last year's Secrets Excellence vacation, you would think I worked for them (See July 2004 under Bill F. if its still up there). but after 2 leaks, an inoperative toilet, an indifferent staff and gastric problems, I seriously questions Apples rating system. On the plane back, I sat next to an apple employee who bragged about all the investment his company is making in the area. I have a suggestion. Instead of 10000 rooms, cut it to 5000 and put in a true water purification system and guaranteed American Food Service standards. Why in the world would anyone want to go to someplace that makes them ill for close to 2000? I shudder to think of the vacation I could have had driving somewhere in the states for that kind of money. LOok elsewhere---Sunscape Punta Cana Grand is not worth the gamble!  
<Date>Jul 8, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sunscape ?Great Family Getaway My Husband and I had a wonderful time at Sunscape. We visited May 29 - June 6th. We were joined by my parents, sister and her two children (1113). My husband and I are frequent travelers. It is hard to find a destination that satisfies varied vacation budgets, culinary tastes and activities. All-Inclusives have been our savior, and the Sunscape did not let us down. At first we were somewhat disappointed when we saw the beach and the limited equipment available for use. For those use to Beaches/Sandals properties, you may also feel cheated to learn that you will have to pay to snorkel, catamaran, waterski, and the like. The beach at the hotel also has seaweed. They will sweep it up from time-to-time, but it was present in the water, which did not make for the best beach swims. The hotel staff and activities exceeded our expectations. They had a wide variety of activities, for kids and adults alike. There is beach and pool volleyball, pool basketball, yoga, water aerobics, napkin /towel folding - - even horseback riding for the kids on Mondays. There is one big pool, one adult pool, and what I would call a mini-pool rather than a jacuzzi. The big pool has a fabulous pool bar...they keep the drinks coming all day. The kids enjoyed virgin pina coladas. My husband and I drank our fare share of Coco-Loco's. Our weather was perfect the entire week. Only a couple evenings of light rain and clouds on the day of our departure. Late May/ early June also seems to be favorable for vacationing, as the resort was well-attended but not overly crowded. We would place our towels on beach chairs to hold them around 9 am, and that was only because of the size of our group. No need to rush out any earlier than that. Pool mats are available, and some do tend to take ownership but there was always plenty to go around. We also enjoyed the food, and I am surprised to hear of some of the poor reviews. The Italian dining was my favorite. It's the fanciest. Great service. The portions are not large, but by the time you order all five courses you will certainly not leave filling hungry. The Tex Mex Restaurant was also very good. You have to like Johnny Cash, though (it's the only CD they play, again...and again...). I'm not too crazy about buffets, so I skipped it at night. However in the morning, I found them to have a better selection than I expected. I really enjoyed the beach parties too, and the entertainment. It's funny -- most people write that they like the beach parties but don't like the food in the buffet, which I find to be one and the same.As others have said, the rooms are clean but simple. Again, better than I expected. I was in Building 4 and there was no smell of mildew. Do turn down your air at night. I too got a sore throat. The nightly entertainment was great. They have movies right after dinner, nightly shows, and then for those whose have the energy to carry on either Karaoke / Piano Bar or Disco. The entertainers were great, friendly and funny. What I thought was nice was the variety available to the guests.We did only one tour -- Catalina Island - an all day trip, but I would recommend it, as mentioned before the snorkeling at the hotel is not the best. Catalina has an awsome beach, beautiful blue water and lots of fish to see while snorkeling - book thru Luis!Remember to bring cash (US$ accepted, small bills), lots of sunscreen and bug repellant (citronella candels also work good for your room). Beach vendors will barter for US items like toiletries, TShirts, etc.Give Sunscape a try...We did and we now have another week full of fond family vacation memories!  
<Date>Jul 6, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not worth the money To preface, we'd like to say that we have been to many of the Caribbean Islands and various resorts of all different ratings. To say this place is a 4-5 star resort is very misleading.First, the food might TASTE ok, but it really isn't ok. My husband and I both had digestive problems-and I ususally have an iron stomach. We aren't sure if it was from food, or maybe the ice isn't purified, but we went through some Immodium! The alcohol served wasn't top shelf as others have said, they only had their own rot got brand of rum, and nasty beer. The service is ok, some areas were better than others. The Tex Mex and Italian restaurants had good service, but the American Grill where most go for lunch was very slow. The bars, although we didn't drink that much due to our digestive issues, had good service. the front desk was pretty much worthless---we didn't find them helpful or courteous at all.The grounds were ok. We have seen much better in 3 star resorts on other islands. We came across a rat one evening---yuck! We also saw quite a few dead roaches in the halls where our rooms were located. The beach was nice, but they were much nicer (with less seaweed) as you moved north on the island. The pools were kind of gross. The water was about 90 degrees, it felt like bath water and wasn't refreshing at all. The pools also needed resurfacing, be careful because sitting against the wall will snag your bathingsuit.We are divers and found that this was not a good place to dive. The waters are all fished out and the coral is nothing that you can't see off the coast of Florida.The rooms were ok. We gave our maid a buck and a handful of candy each day, and we found that our room was cleaned first thing in the morning and we usually had our refrigerator stocked (with bottled beer and sodas).You do have to give the staff credit. The shows were nice and they really work their butts off. You see them when you wake and they are still there when you retire for the night. They were also pretty fluent with many languages, including English, Spanish, Portuguese, and French.We will not return to this resort, and definitely would not rate it 4-5 stars. Others that we spoke with recommended Secrets or Paradisius.We made our own flight arrangements through Pan Am clipper Connection, and really want to sway anyone from this airline. Our flight going to Punta Cana was cancelled and we ended up losing a day at our resort. Our rescheduled flight going there was delayed, and we were switched to another airline to get us to our connecting flight. Our flight was cancelled when we were coming home as well, and we ended up flying on another airline into a different city and renting a car for the 4 hour drive home.We are so happy to be home.  
<Date>Jul 3, 2005

<Author>ruebie
<Content>we all had a good time but My husband and I and our two sons, with five other family's twenty in all, spent seven days at the Grand. The hotel is very nice and the grounds are beautiful. We all were a little upset with the rooms. The bathroom in our room had a bad smell, even though I know they cleaned every day. the rooms needed to be redone, they looked very worn. We did not complain because we were out most of the time.The bar service was great, and the people are very nice and try there best to make you happy. We all had a massage which was great, highly recommended. Kids had a great time. There are games on the beach and they all loved the pool. Piano bar the best and the disco is fun. If you like snorkeling, go see Tootie fruitie on the beach were there are flee markets.He charges about 15 dollars a person but what a great trip. Do not sign up for horse back rideing, the girl walks around the pool with pictures.It was a nightmare.If food is important to you you may not like it here. All of us were on mostly a liquid diet that week. Only at the beach party was the food most enjoyable. And all of us could not understand. All week long we did not see one ripe tomato, they were all green, and the lettuce for salads was warm iceburg almost runny. But at the beach party we ate red ripe tomatos roman lettuce, fresh cheese, great veggies. Why only on one night ?, if they did this all week long it would be fabulous. I guess you only get what you pay for. If you are planning a trip here i would only go for 4to5 days, you run out of things to do. This resort is small. Would we go back? No  
<Date>Jun 30, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not what we expected at all My husband and I saved for 2 years to go on this trip. With 4 children thats a little hard to do. We booked this trip 6 months in advance and when we arrived we had to wait 1 hour for our room to be ready, we arrived at the hotel at noon. When we got to our room it was the wrong room we had paid for. no big deal we just let it go. We tried for 4 days to contact our children back home and were unable to do so, here our ringer on our phone was broken and when we told them about it they did nothing. Next, the adult pool has no bartender there to serve you, we had to walk all the way on the other side of the resort just to get a drink. Whatever you do dont go to the bank and ask for American money they dont have any? But they will give you pesos but you cant exchange them back for American money. The first 2 nights we were there we had no hot water, that was reported nothing was ever done. When we went to check out after 7 days I was already upset and had tons of anxiety about not being able to reach my children I found out they had left messages at the front desk for me that I never recieved. Then they had the nerve to hand us a phone bill for 3 phone calls 4 minutes a piece that totaled 159.00, NO way in hell was I paying this. If it wasnt for our apple rep helping us and trying to make things right I dont know what we would have done. I will say that it is poorly managed and the money that we spent to go there especially being a 5 golden apple resort was definately not what we expected, we will never stay there again.  
<Date>Jun 28, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>AWESOME Vacation Sunscape Grand My husband and I stayed at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand May 30th-June 6th. We went there for our honeymoon.What can I say, we had an awesome time. We liked that the resort was smaller then some resorts in Punta Cana. Everything was easy access and within short walking distance. We had seen on excursions and read some resorts there were so large, it would take a while just to get to the beach or restaurants.There was always things to do, or nothing to do if you just wanted to relax.We loved the nightly shows. The Monday night show, and the beach party on Thursday night were our favorites. The activities committee were great and very funny. The staff, waiters, maids, etc. were always friendly and always said Hola in passing. Beach was ok, not as tropical as what we had hoped for. The water wasn't clear blue, or green. But, in area's of excursions it was beautiful.We went on the Saona Island trip. It made for a very long day. We left at 7am and returned at 6:30pm. Was nice, but we loved the Outback Safari. Seeing the countryside, the people, how they live, the banana trees, coffee and cocoa trees was awesome and our favorite. We felt it made us truly see Punta Cana and part of the Dominican Republic, outside of just staying secluded at our resort and not really seeing the island. The countryside is beautiful. Got great pictures.The Rooms were fine. They are a little musty smelling, so bring some type of air freshner. You will find all your clothes will smell of it. But, for the price and eveything included it was of no issue.We ate at Windows most of the time, and enjoyed trying different foods.The pool is where we stayed most of the time. Bring at least 15 sunblock. With the sun so very hot, I still got a great tan.Tipping does go a long way. We took a lot of one dollar bills, and used most of them. It does get you preferred service. Not so much as it's the thing to do to get better service. Most of the staff there live away from their families to work, and are probably under payed for what they do.For early risers the beach garden grill is open very early to go get coffee.If you have any questions, please email me.All I can say, we had the most wonderful time, and will definitely go back again.  
<Date>Jun 12, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>perfect and relaxing getaway We just spent 7 wonderful days at this resort. Arrived May 31st and returned home June 6th. This was our first vacation in the Dominican and we were hesistant at first. We are very happy we chose this for our familiy vacation. The resort is beautiful. The grounds are very well cared for. Staff is so courteous and always willing to meet your needs. The food was above average for all inclusive I would say. Windows buffet for breakfast was one of our favorite daily activities.. Our 13 year old son loved the fresh fruit smoothie bar. The beach party on Thursday night is not to be missed. The whole ambience is what the Caribbean is all about. Plan to relax and enjoy!!! The weather was perfect, cloudy only 1 day. Take all of your toiletries and sunblock as things in the gift shoppe are very expensive, (ie: sunblock 18 to 20 dollars a bottle). No one in our group experienced any type of stomach problems. Go to the shops on the beach to get the best prices on stuff,( cigars, rum, gifts, etc.) Offer the vendors much less than they ask, (usually 1/4 to 1/2 of their asking price will buy the products. ) Be prepared you will see a few topless sunbathers on the beach but it is not allowed at the main pool. See Enricho at the beach for any water excursion needs. He will sometimes offer you a better deal. The rooms are nice and clean. Had problems a couple of days receiving our towel and washcloth supplies.. but asked the housecleaning lady and she gladly took care of it, restocked our mini fridge daily with bottled water, soft drinks and beer. Even though tips are not expected, a dollar or two goes a long way.Excellent vacation!! Can't wait to go back!!!  
<Date>Jun 8, 2005

<Author>hotwheels1
<Content>Simply The Best!!!! Fantastic time, the best what else can I say - well here goes.Travelled to the Dom Rep from May 16-01 June, ended up with an extra day due to our floight being cancelled - what a bonus!Brilliant rooms, we upgraded to a club room before we went however would recommend you actually do this when you get there. Fantastic weather except the first two day where we had a few downpours!Brilliant staff - look out for Gloria and Chocolate at the Bars. If your booking trips, then go through Lewis down at reception rather than your tour rep. They're an american co and we were the first on everything!Look out for Cecile the quad bike man - this was a brilliant tour and did this twice.Bavarao splash - driving your own speedboats and the Souna Islands visits are def woth booking.Good shops in the hotel and Bavaro Plaza only a twenty minutes taxi ride away. More than safe to go here, probably not on your own though.Pools great, we spent most of our time at the adult pool and the beach but would recomend the main pool for some seriously strong cocktails.If your going to the beach walk 10 minutes down the strip to where the orange sunbeds are = less seaweed - however beach cleared of this most days. Restaurants brilliant - our favourite was Windows the buffet restaurant where there was something for everyone. Don't miss the beach bbq on Thursdays or the dominican night on a Monday, however don't sit at the front unless you like to perform on the stage.Movies shown every night at 1930 and excellent for kids with the kids club etc.Spa is worth a visit, an extra cost but the jaquzzi's great for sunburn and stronger than the ones by the pool at $5 per person for 30 minutes.If you like Casinos then the best one is the Tower, great just for a change of scenery and again get the hotel to book your cab. Free admission and free drinks whilst gambling.Try and speak the spanish langauge, however poor that ours was it was appreciated.If we could change one thing it would be that the Beach Garden Restaurant would be open more than just a Tuesday night as this was the best! And be strong with the vendors on the beach if your into bartering then start as low as possible-they will soon tell you their cheapest price!It was the best holiday we have had and met four other couples to enjoy the trip with. If we can go back then we will!Beware we are generally ok with the sun wearing factors 8,4  2, however if your want to sunbathe here then we would suggest wearing factors 30,25,20 and the lowest being 15!A picturesque country with friendly locals and extreme value for money. Do not listen to any negatives re hygiene and tummy troubles, not that we did not exoerience twenty four hours of this however we know this was due to all the pineapple and coconuts in the pina coladas! You'll be a fool not to pick this hotel as smaller than most hence why the service is so great!  
<Date>Jun 7, 2005

<Author>juls2005
<Content>Nice Vacation We returned from the Grand back to the states on June 4th. We had a really nice 7 day stay. The weather was great...it only rained one time and that was at night...although it was a tropical storm I think! Make sure you take bug spray!!!! There were several people who did do this and had major bug bites. We had mosquitoes in the bathroom on a daily basis...but didnt have problems with our room other than that. Make sure to take pool snacks! I paid $5.00 for a bag of Doritos in the gift shop...I was craving normal food.....The food at the resort was good...but there are just some things you can't go without after a few days. Make sure to take a cup of your own so you don't have to keep going to the bar.Do NOT jump off of the Iceburg in the ocean...HAHAHA....somone in my group learned that the hard way!All in all, the resort is very relaxing. I took my 16 year old son with me and my husband...not sure if it's the greatest place for teenagers..I only saw 2 or 3 while we were there. Mostly small children. Very well behaved for the most part though. It's extremely humid!!!!! I'd also advise taking a spray bottle so you can put ice water in it and cool off in the afternoon. The pool get's really warm. Have a great trip! E-mail me if you have questions.  
<Date>Jun 6, 2005

<Author>outdorgrl
<Content>Great Vacation!!!! My boyfriend and I stayed at the Grand from 5/20-5/25. We had a great time. I was a little worried after reading all the reviews the two months before. Most of all I was worried about the rain. It rained the day we got there and then only 2 nights after. We spent most of our time at the family pool. We loved Jose!!! He was great to us, as was everyone else. It was very hot there!!! You have to have sunscreen or you will definately regret it!!!! For our first time in the DR we spent all our time relaxing and enjoying the experience. Food was good especially the breakfast at Windows. Expect to go through a period where your stomach is upset with the food. We brough Immodium and we were fine. We didn't do any excursions, so I cannot comment. But for relaxing and resting it was perfect. The resort was not crowded at all. I think because people were worried about construction. I would not have known about the construction if I hadn't read it on this forum! Don't always believe what you read. Your vacation is only what you make of it, and we had a blast. We stayed at building 5 on the 3rd level and it was beautiful. Hope this helps!!! Well worth the money!!!

<Author>lucylove_2001
<Content>What a Vacation !!! This place is where my boyfriend and I had the most magical vacation of our lives. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous, and helped out with all of our special needs. We loved the fact that there was a 24 hour bar and adult pool that was child free. The spa was even better than the pool and bar, and we intimately got to know every nook and cranny of the pool and massage areas that were seculed behind a fence.A vacation is what YOU make it. We found that the disco, the activities on the beach and the nightly entertainment provided by the resort was not our cup of tea, so instead we took the opportunity be our own entertainment. We met some cool couples and we created our own Plato's Retreat. The beach party was fair. it was the buffet restaurant relocated on the beach to serve you dinner. If you liked eating at Windows the bufffet restaurant then you will enjoy this, i personally just considered it the same buffet food, just now it included flies. We opted for a liquid diet that night. We found that money talks or you walk. Bring lots of $1 bills for tipping. Its amazing what kind of service you get for $2.There was a nicDollar for dollar this is a great vacation. People forget that this is the poorest island in the carribean and when i read other reviews trashing this place, i think the author forgot that they didn't pay for the Ritz Carlton. I couldn't personally expect more for $100 day all inclusive with people waiting on my every need. They staff truly aimed to please, even if it broke the rules.If anyone reading this was here from April 11-18, 2005......You might have seen me at the pool or walking on the beach with the body jewlery that probably caught your attention with the black bottom bathing suit. Everyone that was on the resort that week was so friendly, cool and fun.... i want to say hi, if you didn't get my name.

<Author>katekeat
<Content>Nice and Relaxing at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand We stayed at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand my husband and I from May 25-June 1,2005. We loved the resort. It was a samller resort which required no wrist bands and we loved the fact you didn't have to worry about making reservations at the restaurants. We stayed in building 5 on the third floor with a huge wrap around balcony as we were on the end. We had a view of the adult pool and you could see the ocean. No problem with hot water or the air. There was a king size bed and it was comfortable. There was a mini-fridge in the room stocked daily with bottled water, pop and beer. No problems with that at all restocked daily. We used the fitness center daily it was a nice place to work out as it had treadmills,bikes and some weights. We are more of the beach people so we would start the day at the beach no problem with getting chairs and usually we would get there after 11. The weather was great all week sunny and hot only rained one time in the middle of the night. The main pool was nice had a swim up bar and floating mattresses around. One night we saw some people taking the mattressess to there room. Whatever floats your boat. We never had any problem getting any mattresses. There was an adult pool which was quiet. The only problem was there was a bar but no bartender. There was pop and water set out but if you wanted a drink you had to go get it. I think because the resort wasn't that full which was nice for us. The staff is wonderful these people work hard all day long. The grounds are well kept and beautiful. Kudos to all that work so hard. We had a wonderful vacation. I think it was best that we ever had. I would go back in a minute. We exactly what we wanted to make our anniversary and my birthday special. The food was great better then we thought it was going to be. The beach and domincan night buffets were great. The only problem we had was being harrassed to buy things from the vendors but we just said no thanks and kept walking. The same as on the beach when you walk there is a group of shops and the people will come out and start talking to you. We just kept walking and said no $$$ with us. We did buy a some braclets , earrings and statue of a family which were nice. Don't forget any items as the gift shop is high priced. I paid $8 for a magazine. The sun is really hot bring lots of sunscreen. We came home with nice tans and my husband hair is bleached out people thought he colored it. Overall a wonderful relaxing vacation.  
<Date>Jun 4, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice place to Relax My husband and I just returned from a mini vacation at the Sunscape Grand and stayed from 5/25 through 5/28 and loved it. I was skeptical after reading the reviews, but I think a lot has to do with the time of year you are there. We were in Building 4 which is a nice quiet building but still near everything. We did not see a lot of children at the resort - maybe 10 kids all of which were very well behaved. Didn't see very many single groups ... mostly couples or families.The room we were in, 4118, was on the first floor and we had no problems with it. You MUST keep the air conditioning on otherwise the room will get very humid, very quickly. The beds were firm but comfortable. I caught a sore throat from the air vents blowing on the bed but we were able to redirect the flow of air...a little too late though.The pool was beautiful and at a very nice temp. Actually, in the afternoon it almost got too warm and really didn't cool you off. I had anticipated not being able to get chairs by the pool after reading reviews, but this was not a problem. We went out at 8:00 am each morning and there was maybe 1 or 2 other couples at the pool and no towels on the chairs. We did then reserve our chairs and then went to breakfast. I also don't think the resort was anywhere near full so this may be a problem when more guests are there. We stayed at the pool all day so I did not see a problem with us reserving our chairs early. Bring SUNSCREEN..sun is very intense and you could get a bad burn very quickly - both days there wasn't a cloud in the sky.The food was ok. We had been to the Dominican Republic before so we knew what to expect. There were the basics at breakfast and always found something I liked at lunch. Since we were there only 3 nights, we ate at the TexMex restaurant which was good, the Beach Party was fun (BRING BUG SPRAY) and the al la carte restaurant (can't remember the name) which was also good. Just watch what you eat and remember, you can't drink the water that comes out of the tap...ONLY bottled water. You don't have to worry about the ice or anthing like that. I only heard one gentleman at the pool saying that he had intestinal problems, but everyone's body is different and will react to the food differently. The only time we were a little hassled was the night of the beach party when some of the vendors set up by the pool and they wanted you to buy their jewelry. Just say no thank you, be firm if they are persistant and keep walking. We brought home some very nice pictures of me and my husband with parrots. Each day, two gentlemen brought different animals around the pool area and take your picture with them. These pictures are on display and there is absolutely no pressure to buy them. They are $6 each.Overall, it was a great couple of days of doing nothing but relaxing and soaking up the sun. Everyone we met was pleasant and greated you with Hola. Jose at the swim-up bar was great and you never had to wait for a drink. Just remember...your vacation is what you make it...just relax go with the flow, and have a wonderful vacation.  
<Date>Jun 1, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Didn't want to come home!!! We stayed at the Sunscape from 5/24-5/29/05. I was a little leary having never been to Punta Cana but all I can say is it was the BEST vacation I've ever had! First the Aiport was beautiful and the resort was 15 minutes from the Airport. Check in was a breeze and EVERYONE was friendly. We were greeted with a Welcome Home the moment we got there. We didn't even have to lug our bags to the room, they took care of it for us. The resort is very, very well maintained. We could see people working from dawn til dusk on the property. We have stayed at many resorts in Jamaica  Cancun and the food  service for all-inclusives left a lot to be desired so I wasn't expecting much. I was more than impressed with the food, Windows Buffet is not your normal run-of-the-mill Buffet. You had a lot to choose from a Pasta Station, Grill and they had different theme nites, like Mexican nite  International nite. The staff is very attentive. The Tex-Mex restaurant was also very good. There are no wristbands here, if you don't like something at one restaurant, go to another! There was a managers Cocktail Reception on Wednesday, and because we went with Apple Vacations, we also had another Cocktail Reception later that week. They had a Beach Party one night  then a Bar-B-Cue on Friday. O,Yeah there is a minibar in the room they keep stocked with beer  soda  the room service is INCLUDED! We had steak and grilled chicken one night, awesome! Top shelf beverages. The entertainment was also great, karoke was too funny. The staff always has something going on. Bring your own books, magazines, lotions etc. because those items there are 3x as much as you would pay here. Considering it was in the 50's, rainy  miserable in Philly, we picked a great time to go  an excellent resort to stay at.  
<Date>Jun 1, 2005

<Author>sunshinegirl83
<Content>Can't wait to go back Just returned from a wonderful week and can't wait to go back. First the negatives, believe it or not were Americans. We met some very nice people but since we were on our honeymoon, we did not appreciate the couple who invited themselves to dine with us or walk the beach. Careful who you become friendly with, they may end up being stalkers! Loved the Outback Safari tour. My wife enjoyed meeting the children at the school. The scenery was beautiful and we learned alot about the island. Did not think it was appropriate for the topless on the beach since there were many children around. Mostly exibitionist attention seekers, lack of class. They should have went to the adult pool. The food was good, enjoyed the American Grill the most. The staff was very nice and eager to please. Did not catch alot of the night activities (we were on our honeymoon!!) but enjoyed the beach party. Take thermal mugs, sunscreen, sunburn gel, hats, comfortable shoes (if you take any tours), and a couple swimsuits. We took lots of dollar bills to tip. Loved the quiet time with my new wife and our nightly walks on the beach. Can't wait to take her back.......

<Author>luvstotravel
<Content>Great people at Sunscape Grand We returned from Sunscape Grand on May 15th and we had a great time despite the weather. We will definately go back to Punta Cana but will try a different resort with a better beach as that was the primary let down. We happened to be there during a Marlin tournament and the resort is located next to the dock where all the boats come in to. We found the beach to be loaded with sea weed which could have been contributed to the all the boat traffic but it was enough to keep us closer to the pool rather than the beach. We didnt have great weather and actually as the week went on the weather got worse instead of better as we had hoped. I thought the food was excellent and actually the best steak I have ever had!! I loved the pepper steak in the American Grille and I cannot say enough about the staff there!! Hector and Robert at the American Grille are absolutely a couple of the nicest guys we have ever met. Gloria and Matias at the splash bar were awesome and we had a lot of laughs with them. We brought our insulated mugs but never needed to use them because we drank the drinks too fast and they didnt have a chance to get warm! The rooms and grounds were spotless and I didnt find the musty sheet smell that was previously mentioned but we could have just been lucky. All in all it was a great experience and a great value.  
<Date>May 30, 2005

<Author>Jackshouse
<Content>Cozy Resort We stayed at Sunscape Punta Cana Grand the week of April 17 to the 24th. The weather left a lot to be desired as we had about 2 days of sun and cloudy  rainy the rest of the time. Not what you would expect for mid april in the carribbean. The staff was friendly. The food was o.k. and we had no problem finding something to eat at buffets. My biggest gripe was the people staying at the resort. How obnoxious to put their towels down under cabanas and leave them the whole day and not even be there most of the time. Lets face it there was a lack of chairs and esp. in shaded areas. After several days of scrounging around to find lounge chairs, I got up the next day at 7:30 a.m. and couldn't believe that there was only a couple places left without towels. The next day I was up at 7 and again only 2 places left by the pool. This is absolutely disgusting. A year ago we were at Sunscape Casa del Mar and people did just the opposite. When they went from beach to pool they took their towels with them. Something needs to be done about this. Maybe someone should start picking up towels and see what happens when they finally get back late afternoon to pick them up and they are not there. The other thing that was lacking was there is no cover over chairs at show area. We missed 3 shows that were rained out. After about 20 min. of a show it downpoured heavy rain. So much for evening entertainment. You think that they would have some cover esp. with all the sophisicated lighting and sound system. On the plus side, they had shuffleboard, bocce ball, horseshoes and other games to play. There was a big trampoline and Sunscape ice berg to climb. They had a list of various activities but noticed that they didn't stick to the schedule sometimes. And sometimes evening programs got changed like beach party was cancelled and weather was better (no rain) late afternoon and no one knew it was on for next night. I can say that everything is close as it does not take long to get to your room and restrooms are very clean. Hotel room was clean but the furnishings look dated. We didn't mind after all we came for the beach and outdoor activities. Barring a few above mentioned problems and the hotel is not responsible for the weather, we had a good time.  
<Date>May 27, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>quite pleasant despite the weather Just returned from stay of 5-13 to 5-20 with my first husband of 26 years. Heavy rains and clouds the first 5 days although the temps were warm. The hotel is very clean and the staff was eager to please. We never had to wait for a drink or meal. The food was average but I discovered toward the end of the week it was my own fault for not trying more things. I thought the main buffet Windows had the best food and I'm usually not a buffet fan. Breakfast was great and lots of fruit offered. Don't miss the Thursday night beach party! I love the size of the resort as you get to know the staff and bartenders. The only beer, Presidente , was good and I am a die hard Miller Lite fan. They also had top shelf liquor. Absolutely no stomach problems with a sensitive eater!There was a prior review regarding musty smelling sheets and I have to agree, however, I believe it is because the storage is not air conditioned. I felt the sheets were clean. On the same note next time I will bring my own fresh smelling lifejacket for the watersports...The grounds, pool and beach were all beautiful and clean. Any room is a short walk away. Bring skid free shoes as the tile gets very slippery. The resort is comfortable and casual with lots of fun quirky things to entertain. This was our first experience with an all inclusive and we are sold on the value of this resort. (note: This is not a shopping destination. The cigars and coffee were great!)  
<Date>May 25, 2005

<Author>JustTRVL
<Content>Excellent We stayed at the Sunscape Grand in Feb, with my boyfriend and my parents and sister. The rooms were very large and atmospheric, however if you want peace and quite you need to get a room somewhere on the outer rim of the hotel. Each room has a very nice balcany, and the beds a nice and confortable. Be wearly of negative reviews of people who rated the hotel poorly because they went during hurricane season, and it rained the whole time- not the hotels fault. Do your homework, and don't go during the off season. Me and my BF are both 25, so I have to say there was not too much entertainment for us, but since this was a family vacation we weren't planning on pulling all nighters. The bar during the day was great, but most people went to bed early. This is more of a family place, with lots of people with little children. Also, if you don't like europeans, for whatever reason, don't come here either. Personally we were looking for a nice relaxing vacation, and that's what we got. The food was great (stay away from the cafe- nothing good there). Don't miss the thursday night beach party, I will never forget it, it was just spectacular. The restaurants are never too crowded, and the food was great. The staff was very friendly, and since it's a small resort they remember who you are. The pool was nice looking, but the water was way to cold, so barely anyone was in it. However you need to get up early and grab a chair by the poor, other wise they fill up.All and all, it was very nice. The ocean is not as nice as some places I've seen, but it's blueish, and very warm. We did the ATV adventure, and it wasn't what I expected, but at least you got to see how some of these people live, so for us it was worth it. Also there is not much tourist stuff here, no old architecture, or much to see. So be prepared to stuff your face for however long your there for, and drink by the poolWord of advise, if your looking for american standards, and your gonna complain about every single little thing (many americans were guilty here), why bother leaving home. Stay in bed, and order chinese good, and let the other wordly people go and have fun....to everyone else, go, enjoy.  
<Date>May 19, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved it! We just returned from the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. We were there from 5/04/05-5/09/05. We had a marvelous time! The weather was great, didn't rain once.The hotel's landscape was absolutely beautiful. The beach was great. They cleaned up the seaweed everyday, which I noticed other hotels on the strip did not. I did have to get up early to reserve a palm hut, which we needed for shade in the afternoon.The food was better than I expected. The only restaurant I didn't care for was the Tex Mex, but my husband did. My favorite restaurant was the outdoor Beach Garden. They had typical American sandwiches, grilled chicken, bacon cheese burgers, clubs, etc. This restaurant is open pretty much 24/7. They also have room service!The drinks were great, but definitely bring insulated mugs. They serve the drinks in 8 oz plastic cups normally, but will make them in any mug you give them. Our insulated mugs kept are drinks cooler and we didn't have to go the bar as often! The beer is Presidente draft, but they have Bohemia Especial bottles in the room.The service was excellent. The people are so friendly!Definitely go to the beach party, it was a blast.We also recommend the sunset horse back riding tour (It was beautiful scenery!) and the parasailing. We had a tremendous experience and can't wait to go back next year!Oh, bring bug spray because I did get bit one night.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Will never return This is a very long list of problems that occured.....One thing that we thought was terrible is the fact that everyday that we were there we could not find chairs together at the pool or under a hut on the beach. I believe it is due to the fact that people would hold their chairs by leaving towels and other belongings on them. Some of these chairs would be empty for hours. When you pay a lot of money to go on a trip and look forward to relaxing by the pool or on the beach and are unable to even get a chair it is very frustrating. The resort needs to do something to correct this problem. Another big issue that occurred was with a staff member. Because of rain one day we played bingo with a staff member. His name is Rico B. He was obviously intoxicated (we saw him drinking the night before at the disco). He was extremely unprofessional. He made a couple of comments to other guests calling them white boy among other things. Then after bingo was over I asked him if the beach party was still going to happen that evening and he replied Come on, be smart and Use your head referring to it being cloudy. Myself along with the people that I was with were very taken back by this. Referring back to the beach party we were upset at the fact that it was cancelled because it had rained early in the day. The rest of the day was fine. That was on Thursday. We were told it could not be rescheduled either. But then on the day we were leaving (Saturday) they were setting up for it for that night. That was something we were really looking forward to. I also could not believe the way they have these people set up on their beach and coming to the resort 2 nights a week to sell merchandise. I have never been so harassed. I can understand coming across that kind of thing outside the resort, but not in it. It was ridiculous. Then on our final day we were around the pool area when 2 men had a donkey there that they use to give donkey rides. When the donkey would not walk they began to hit the donkey in front of all the people around. They actually picked up my husband's sneaker and hit the donkey on his behind! I got very upset and told them to stop. We couldn't believe it. As animal lovers we were very upset by this! This resort also does NOT have ONE ATM machine on the entire resort. In this day and age I can't understand how a place like that can not have an ATM machine. We ended up having to borrow money from my Mother because we could not get any from our account. They do have a bank on the premises from which we were going to get a cash advance from our credit card. We called the front desk to find out the hours. We were told it was open until 9:00. We called the bank around 5:00 or so to ask if we would receive pesos or American dollars. We were told that she was leaving for the day. We said we thought they were open until 9:00 and she replied Yes, but she had to leave. What kind of service is this? On another day the weather was not good I wanted to have a manicure at the spa. I walked in and about 5-6 women were sitting around talking and I was told it was impossible to get a manicure that day. Then they continued to sit around talking. Service?? We tried to do the banana boat on our last day. Earlier in the day we asked if we needed to reserve it and we were basically told to come back anytime and it should be available. Around 4:00 we went to do it. We were told we couldn't do it that day to come back tomorrow. We told them we were leaving that day and they said Sorry. The rooms are not what any of us considered to be 5 Golden Apple. We noticed one of our glasses having a pretty large crack in it, and that same glass stayed in our room until we left never being replaced.Needless to say myself, my husband, and the 4 other people we traveled with will never return.

<Author>Ellen32
<Content>Enjoyed our trip to Punta Cana We just got back from the Sunscape Grand - went the last week of April.The weather was great, people very nice. Having been to several All inclusiives in Punta Cana, Puerto Plata and Mexico this one was average. We wanted a smaller resort and it was a perfect size. I read reviews that the food was bad, that was not the case for us - the buffet could have been better, but certainly something for everyone. We ate at the Italian and steak restaurant twice. We got there around 6:30 and no wait.The Dominicana night and the Beach party on the beach were wonderful, don't miss them. We went horseback riding which we booked where you get the towels. Very very nice!Also went parasailing and snorkeling. We booked through some locals on the beach. If you go over by the shops on the beach in front of the first set is where the people are to do this. I think the boat is called tuti fruiti, they were wonderful, no booking time, just walk over when you want to go. They gave a great parasailing ride and just my family went on the snorkeling so we could stay as long as we want etc.The rooms were fine and clean. We were in building 2, which was very convenient. Yes you can hear the music at night but it over by 10:30-11I would recommend this resort to families especially if you have small kids cause trips back to your room are not far, the beach and pool are close, it really is nice.I would say they should have music at the pool, the action is more on the beach and MORE bartenders - it is crazy to have one at the pool bar.People do save chairs and I noticed people saving the floats in the pool.That was new to a lot of us there. Unbelievable!Enjoy!  
<Date>May 7, 2005

<Author>romanwheat
<Content>Honeymoon at Sunscape, D.R. My now wife and I set forth to the Dom. Rep. Great time to be had!We were there for 6 days starting April 25th. We didn't know what to expect.We arrived at the airport--smooth transition in. Fast lines. Advice: bring a pen to fill out the entrance paperwork. Got to the Sunscape--greeted with a fruit drink. The room was excellent, but it was on the ground floor with foliage which attracted biting insects. Beautiful view of the adult pool and lounge. The room was large and the bed was ultra comfy. Mini bar was free--beer, soda, orange juice.Advice: get a room on the second floor. The doors have enough room on the bottom for snakes and hermet crabs. We witnessed a snake go into a room--a small garden snake variety.Food: B. Restaurant, Windows, had a large selection of food. The breakfasts were great. We stayed away from the milk products because sometimes they were not on ice. Freshly squeezed cantalope juice was awesome. The mangos were unbelievable. Restaurant, The Italian, was very nice. We went with a bunch of Americans we made friends with and the courses were over all good. However, to be warned, the two people who had the Shrimp Course, had pretty bad stomach problems the next day. The Garden Grill had decent American foods. The orange fried chicken was tasty. 24 hour free room service: they were quick but the food looked and tasted like it was made quick. The chocolate chip cookies were awesome.Note: there is no restaurants open from 4:00 to 6:00pm.Nightlife: A. The piano bar was a great time. All alcohol was included on our trip. Got up and sang to my new wife! The disco looked pretty happening--didn't spend too much time there though. There was a show every night outside. We saw two of them. They were pretty decent. Really funny at times.Bars: A+. Made anything that you could think of as long as they could understand you. All inclusive.Beach: B. The beach was really nice, but they did not have enough shade and chairs for the amount of people staying at the hotel. You had to get lucky in the afternoon to find a suitable seat. The beach was mostly adult but some kids were playing but not horrible. They brought you drinks and you could order them from the beach. that was nice. The water was about 75 degrees--perfect. the seabreeze felt great! Neighboring beaches, while walking past, had dozens more chairs and shade than the Sunscape.We went Kayaking in the ocean! that was easily one the best highlights of the trip. It was so much fun, and it was free.Pools: A. There was two pools; a large pool, more kid oriented, but with a swim up bar. an adult pool, where no children were alowed. That is where we met so many nice people from all over the world. The adult pool felt more free thinking. It also had a whirlpool.Bank on site: Did the job. Could get US dollars when they had them. The first time i went to get extra money, they did not have US dollars but two days later they did.Advice: do not misplace the towel card!!!!!!! it is 15 dollars per card if you lose them or if you do not claim them back from the towel lady and depending on who your check out guy is at the front desk, they will not let you go without paying. Their Fun Activity staff helped us out greatly to resolve the situation. Thanks to them--they are very helpful and will bend over backwards to help. the towel lady all the sudden did not speak english when confronted. The front desk person asks us for 20 dollars per card first, which was suspect. Watch out! This is a country who likes to haggle for price, and some times even the help will be aggressive salespeople. This added a considerable amount of stress at the end of our beautiful stay and this particular desk person did not care. We found out later from a person who was staying there, that they did not have their cards either, but the desk person who helped them let them go with a smile. Just make sure you bring your cards back to check out! Let it be known that no one explains to you that you need to keep the cards for check out.Advice: Do not use the water from the hotel room faucets. They are not filtered.Overall, we will be planning to take another trip to the Dom. Rep. And Sunscape is at the top of the list for all inclusive resorts for us. Chances are we will be back to the Sunscape! A Great over all time. It was a blast!  
<Date>May 6, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Really enjoyed ourselves The resort was beautiful. We walked quite a ways down the beach to see the other resorts and they weren't as nice. Very well kept grounds and small which I thought was nice as you didn't have to walk very far to get another drink, get to the beach etc.The rooms were ok - kept very clean but our room had a broken chair and was a little beat up if you ask me (the woodwork etc..). Also I was disappointed that we had to ask for water etc. as I was under the assumption that our room fridge would be kept stocked.The wait staff was very friendly and helpful (w/ the exception of Juan at the swim up bar - we read great reviews on him here and he was a bit of a sour puss and I don't think I ever saw him smile.) I was very disappointed in the food. Apparently they recently switched cooks and I thought the food for the most part was awful. I didn't like that the juices served for breakfast was warm. The Tex Mex did serve a great filet for dinner though. I would advise to stay away from the seafood and the pasta at the Italian restaurant didn't taste like any pasta I had ever had before - was more like chef boyardee...I got very ill our 3rd day there - not sure if it was from the food, water (we drank bottled water - but I have to wonder about the ice in the drinks) or if it was from the day long drinking that I did of the vodka and lemonade the day before. The first night we were there they had a managers reception at the adult pool. This was very nice - cocktails and appetizers were carried around by wait staff. There was also entertainment - some native dances, a fire blower etc. that I thought was excellent.The couples entertainment the following night was very funny and we really enjoyed that as well.Other then being sick that one day I thoroughly enjoyed myself. Some people complained that there were a lot of families w/ children there but it didn't bother me in the least bit. As a matter of fact I would go back and take my kids - I look forward to it.One thing I wish I would have done is take some toys or crayons/coloring books for the native children. I didn't think we would see any as we were taking a short trip and I didn't think we would be going into town but we saw several native children on the beach the day we took our long walk and they were thrilled to get ANYTHING. We gave them our empty cups and straws and a half eaten banana.Items you definitely want to bring - sunscreen, insulated cups as the drink cups are very small, a sun hat, extra bathing suit or 2....We also went parasailing which was a blast!  
<Date>May 5, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Will Definitely Return to Sunscape My friend and I stayed at Sunscape Grand from April 26-May 1st. We were VERY happy with every aspect of our vacation. We took US Airway direct out of Philadephia. The checkin was quick, and the flight was extremely smooth. The lines at the airport went fast, and we were greeted by our Apple Reps., who quickly took us to our hotel.I have stayed at several resorts in Punta Cana and Puerta Plata, but I have to say this resort quickly became my favorite. The Grand Flamenco is very close in second place.Check-In was smooth, easy and effortless. We were greeted with a little bag filled with shampoo, body gel and lotion. We were also given yummy drinks!Our room was on the first floor, in building three. We were close to everything... the lobby, pools, beach and BARS! The room was clean, neat and had plenty of towels.I am a very critical person when it comes to food. I must say, the food was outstanding. I especially enjoyed breakfast... and started each day with french toast (yum). I ate lunch at the Beach Garden (the grilled chicken sandwich was delicious!) twice, and the buffet several times, which was different each day, but equally good.The snacks at the pool bar were yummy too! I enjoyed the chips and homemade salsa every afternoon. The pizza wasn't like home, but wasn't horrible considering we were in a different country.Dinner was terrific! We went to the buffet on Italian Night, and the food was very tasty. We especially loved American Grill. The guacomole was so good! We went there two different nights. One night I had the grilled chicken, the other night I had the chicken fajitas. Both were very good! The frozen margaritas were yum! The Italian Restaurant was good as well. I had the salad (VERY good), spinach pasta, and shrimp. Thursday (beach night) was really special. Eating on the beach, while listening to the band play and watching the sunset was really special. What an amazing view! Friday afternoon the head chef prepared paella on the beach. It was delicious and fun to watch him make.Now for the drinks.... Pina Coladas were the perfect treat to a hot sunny day. The Coco locos were amazing! One of the bartenders, Chocolate, made mudslides to die for. He even drizzled chocolate syrup on the cup, and on top. SOO GOOD!!Shout out to Juan Carlos. He is such a sweet, hardworking guy who constantly went out of his way to make our stay special. :)The shows were cute, especially the one on Tuesday and Saturday Night. We enjoyed them. The cigar bar was a fun atmosphere, especially when it was karaoke night. The club was tiny, but really cute too.The spa was wonderful. The perfect relaxation that I needed! Yoga on the beach was fabulous too. What can be better than that??I know for sure I will be returning to this resort in the near future. I was VERY pleased with my stay. Thank You Sunscape! :)  
<Date>May 3, 2005

<Author>LeighAnnCapeCod
<Content>Worst trip ever ! Our plan was to stay 5 nights, we only last 48 hours there before leaving to go home. DAY ONE: Upon arrival, we were exhaused from the trip so we wanted to nap before heading to dinner. When we turned the comforter down, there were stains all over the sheets. Four phone calls, one personal visit to the front desk and four hours later they finally changed the sheet with major attitude I may add. They did not bother to change the pillow cases or blankets. They also neglected to clean the mini-fridge that had hair in it. When I asked it it would be possble to change rooms they said they would charge an additional $55 per night. Needless to say, the first dinner that night was unedible but we were still optimistic for the next day. DAY TWO: Breakfast was no better and you could not even have cereal b/c the milk was not warm but hot as they leave it out on the counter. So, we decide we are going to go home b/c this is just not what we wanted in a vacation but our phone does not work. The front desk promised all day that they would fix it and they did not. I asked if I may use their phone to make arrangement to leave and they were more than unhelpful. They did not care that we wanted to leave and did not offer any solutions. Everytime you approached them, they were so condesending and they just snickered at you. By that evening, we were feeling helpless and desperate. My husband physically brought the phone down to the front desk and demanded they help us. They front desk person told my husband he would be sorry he spoke to them like that. At this point I was considering calling the American consulate, as we felt very threatened and unsafe. Finally, we get a working phone and contact a charter company out of Boston that would fly us home. They said the flight was leaving in one hour so we packed everything we could within five minutes, got a taxi and ran for our lives!. This hotel was dispicable! I cant even believe that human beings can act in this manner.We have traveled some, and never came across such poor customer service or ignorance in our life! We are not your typical complainers and I would normally never go to this length to write something like this but that is how bad it was. That was the first and last trip to the Dominican Republic. There are too many lovely places/people in the world to waste your time there!  
<Date>May 1, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Twice in 1 year! Well, we loved this place so much when there in March 2004 with friends that we went back in Nov 2004... This time we took our kids (ages 13  16) and 16 friends and family members! We all had a blast. As this second time was over Thanksgiving, there were more families than when we visited in March. This addition of small kids changed it a little, but as we had our kids with us...it was great. Imagine...a full Thanksgiving feast on the beach....music on the beach...and a movie on the beach. What a GREAT holiday!We had an EAGLES cheerleader, old friends, new friends, family members and work associates with us. Everyone thanked us for letting them know about our trip and inviting them along. The only ones sorry...were the ones who did not make the trip!There was some work being done at the resort in readiness for the upcoming winter visitors but it did not bother us. The workers were friendly and courteous. And the rest of the staff...some familiar faces from March...were superb. I would definately visit again. And the kids...well they said it was the best vacation they have had (we've been to Disney World!)
