<Author>tootsie1
<Content>fantastic time I just got back from the Sunscape Grand and let me tell you what a awsome time I had. We were in building 5 and had a view of the adult pool. The rooms were very clean and that really is all you need on vacation because you really do not spend much time in there. Everyone was so friendly and always willing to help out. The beach was average, there was some seaweed depending on the day but I really did not hang out there because it was so fun at the large pool that has the swim up bar. We meet so many neat people from Chicago(Mo,Maria,Tammy, a BIG HELLO), England, Jersey(Hello Joe, hope you made it home ok) and a wonderful couple from Indiana and many more. The wait staff, front desk and bartenders were so fun and helpful. At night we just went to the piano bar(jamica man was awsome, its a must see) and then to the disco. There is not a whole lot of stuff to do outside the resort but in the resort you can make lots of fun! The resort was just a fun place to stay and it really just grows on you. We were only there for 3nts and it was not long enough. The only thing I would have like would have been more activities around the pool with music, it seemed alittle quiet at times we even went up and had them turn the radio up and they were more than welcome to do that. It was not a big deal but when you are on vacation you want to here that music to keep you going. The drinks were good. They even have name brand liqour.The lobby is gorgeous and the grounds were kepted very clean. The food was really good as well, the American Grill we eat everyday for lunch. At night we eat at Windows and for breakfast too.Well just alittle from me, but let me tell you we had a blast and were very happy with our choice, and will be returning soon and by the way the weather was 90degrees with humidity at about 92% so it was warm, bring lots of suncreen.If you have any questions you can email me at -----------.  
<Date>Apr 29, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not So Grand We took our honeymoon to this resort from april 20-27 and were quite dissappointed. Halfway through our trip we were offered, along with everyone else at the resort, the option to be transferred to Sunscape The Beach and it was the best decision we could have ever made. Here is an honest breakdown of what we experienced at Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. I will have a review of the wonderful Sunscape The Beach as well if you would like to check out the comparison.Grounds: The grounds were very well kept. The beaches were white sand beaches that had a decent amount of seaweed on the shores but not enough to really cause me to complain. The pools/restaurants/restrooms and so on were very very clean. Pools. Two pools-1 adult pool and one larger pool for everyone. I was dissappointed in the size of these pools as it made it hard to relax on a raft since you would constantly be bumping into to someone at the adult pool or getting splashed by kids playing at the larger pool. This is a resort for everyone so I am not complaining about the kids but it would have been nicer to have a larger pool for the amount of people visiting. Restaurants. After eating at all the restaurants we really found out that these restaurants didn't give you anything to write home about. The food was very poor and we seldom finished a plate. The best food that we had was breakfast which consisted of bacon and an omelete which is hard to screw up. Rooms. Our room was very spacious which was very nice with a view of the main pool. This room was not cleaned to a very good standard because immediately upon arrival we saw obvious hairs all over the bathroom and bedroom floor. We ran out of hot water one day and after calling the front desk twice never got fixed. Service. Overall the service was poor. We tipped our maids everyday hoping that it would make in a difference in getting towels, toilet paper, sheets etc. After three calls to the front desk and a visit as well we finally received toilet paper and then had to take towels off of the maids cart in the hallway. Overall without toilet paper for over a day! Needless to say Tipping did not help. The staff at the restaurants/bars and actaully front desk were very very nice. The Dominicans are very friendly people which made that part of the trip refreshing. Overall we did have a nice time but after reading the reveiws we and many others at the resort were very surprised in how high it was rated. In addition after getting to spend 3 full days at Sunscape The Beach we truly realized how dissappointed Sunscape Grand was in comparison.  
<Date>Apr 28, 2005

<Author>windbag94
<Content>We Loved It!!!! Hola....We stayed at the resort Apr 9- 16 and couldn't of asked for more perfect weather!! The sun was very very hot, but we brought plenty (12 bottles and you will need them) of sunscreen so we were ok. Some friends we met there were not so lucky and had some extremely sore sunburns and blisters. (right Glen??) ($29 for lotion in the gift shop)We were mostly beach potatoes our whole week and enjoyed yhe relaxation and calming breeze from the ocean. We walked the beach both ways for quite a bit. If you go to the right past the marina, it is mostly in the natives area, unraked and not taken care of, so you may encounter some garbage etc. but still a scenic little stroll. If you go to the left, you will walk by the other resorts which seemed rather large and crowded compared to our resort. Our beach was cleaned daily, and the grass and weed situation changed with the tides. Some days the water was crystal clear and other windier days there was grass floating, but was not a problem.Our room was spotless, spacious, and very comfortable. We were in building 3 3rd floor and the week we were there, they seemed to be replacing all the king size beds on the floor with new mattresses. The restaurants and bars were all very good and the service was great.(We liked the Tex-Mex best - the corny Johnny Cash music made it fun as we knew all the songs anyway:))Check in was a little slow but couldn't be helped as everyone on our bus was staying at our hotel, but it wasn't too long and we were on our way.Ladies - pack your monthly feminine products just in case - a pack of 8 was $10 in the gift shop.The resort is American owned, and the majority of guests seemed to be Yanks or Canucks, :) and the staff we came in contact with all spoke very good English.We loved the coffee there and brought home 5 lbs!! (kinda gave Timmy Ho's a run for their money in my book :) )We stayed at the Fiesta the last time we went there, and while very nice, the Sunscape was far more to our liking, in that it was smaller and friendlier.We will most definately go back to this resort again!!!! I am saving already for next year!!  
<Date>Apr 27, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Vacation Returned on March 14th. The resort was wonderful. We arrived at 1030 and room was ready. Greeted with cold towels and drinks. Great friendly service. Room was clean, hotel grounds beautiful, plenty of towels and great maid service. Food was wonderful especially the beach party. The beach was clean, water wonderful and we never had problems getting chairs. I read all the bad reviews about this resort and was worried prior to going. I don't know what people expect. There were 4 of us in my party and we had a fabulous time. We can't wait to return. We booked through apple tours and they were terrific. Charter flight wonderful and we loved the airport in Punta Cana.

<Author>kek
<Content>Depends on what you are looking for Just returned from a week at the Sunscape Punta Grand March 19-26. The things that were great were outstanding and the things that were poor were really poor. Here's a detailed synopsis.Grounds: The resort itself is beautiful, immaculate and well maintained. The beaches are clean and powdery white sand. Rooms: Not super luxury high end but very clean and spacious. See if you can get one on the 3rd floor, they have wood cathedral ceilings that are quite nice.Staff: Service ranged from mediocre in the Windows/Tex Mex restaurants to good in Da Marios and very good in the American Grill at dinner. The bar staff were great everywhere. The Piano bar and adult pool, had the best and made it a lot of fun. Tips do make a difference in getting seated at Da Marios (Italian restaurant). One night 8 people (4 groups) that very clearly arrived after my friends and I were seated before us. Complaints were not taken or listened to at the desk about this.Food: After talking to quite a few other people, this topic will differ depending on what you are used to as a frame of reference. My opinion,this resort had the WORST food of any all-inclusive resort I have been to in the Carribean, Mexico or Europe. I was disapointed at every meal. I would rate the restaurants as follows:Da Marios - about 2 steps below Olive Garden at best in qualityTex Mex - chips and salsa were good, rest was practically inedibleAmerican Grill - best at the resort. Mix of types of food. Bland but edible. This restaurant is not air conditioned and was quite hot the 2 nights we ate there.Windows - buffet style. Mix of different stations, fruit, deli, eggs to order, pasta etc. They tended to overcook everything on the grill even after being requested in Spanish to cook it as asked.Beverages - no champagne, house wine was swill, local beer (Presidente) only kind available and only on tap, liquor was name brand but not top shelf and not everything was available at every bar. Soda and bottled water was readily available everywhere.Noise level: Most of the buildings are tile, stone etc. Noises are magnified everywhere making it difficult to rest during the day. At night there was a fair amount of noise as well, mostly from people being loud. Tough to sleep really at any time of the day.Crowd: Ranged from late 20's to late 50's for the most part. Mostly American, Canadian, British with a mix of German and French as well. Mainly couples/families but I was pleasantly surprised at how many solo singles or singles that came with a couple friends there were.All in all not a terrible trip but I was clearly disappointed and would not go back to this resort. The Dominican Republic is a beautiful country with very friendly hard working people. I recomend the destination but I'd suggest another resort if good food and drinks are important to you.  
<Date>Mar 28, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic!! I travelled to the Sunscape Grand as a single mother (my husband had to work) and two young children, 8 and 4. We had a wonderful time! We were there from March 17-24th 2005.When I arrived, the check-in was quick. We were put in section 1, which, I have to admit, was quite loud. It is close to the show stage and also near the fitness centre so you hear the loud music at night from your room and also the loud aerobics music starts at 8:30am. We got used to it and used ear plugs so after the first night, it didn't really bother us anymore. It was nice to have a balcony. If you are going, ask for a room in either building 4 or 5 which were much quieter.The resort was absolutely beautiful with live flamingos in the fountains and beautifully landscaped gardens. The pools were large and well maintained. The swim up bar was terrific as you could keep cool and drink refreshments at the same time. The bars were very accessible from wherever you were and they never served alcohol to my children even when my kids said they were getting a drink for me. I thought that was very responsible of them. The food was fantastic. My kids ate more than ever and I had a terrific selection of tasty and healthy dishes. We ate fresh fish every night. There is a grill right on the beach so you could eat all day if you wanted. No need to bring bottled water with you. You can get one from several places on the resort and they are even stocked in your mini bar. We also brushed our teeth with the bottled water as the water from the taps is not good. My kids loved the kids club. Fernando and Esperanza were the absolute best! My youngest actually begged me everyday to take her there! All of the staff were very nice, smiling and helpful. I loved trying to speak Spanish to them, which made the trip a real experience. My kids also enjoyed the water iceberg which my oldest climbed every day and the water trampoline. They had a photographer who took pictures with your kids and live animals (small monkey, lizards and parrots). My kids loved it! We bought a few for $6/each which was not too expensive. It was nice to take home a souvenir. Some advice:1. It is very hot in the DR. Even at 9am I found the sun very hot. Bring lots of sun screen, even complete block in case you burn. Bring t-shirts or full-suits for the kids as they can easily burn. Bring wide-brimmed hats too as shade is a hot commodity there!2. If your kids like pails and shovels to play with, bring them with you. They are very expensive there ($15 US). Also bring your own snorkel gear as there is a coral reef near by. 3. You have to get up early in the morning to secure a seat under a grass hut on the beach or by the pool. I was up before 6am to put a towel under a hut on the beach. By the pool, I think I was okay a bit later. 4. Bring some of your own towels. As a result of reading Trip Advisor feedback, it is true that they are often out of towels even first thing in the morning. We wouldn't get to the towel shack until 9:30am and they were typically out. By bringing my own towel, I avoided the aggravation of having to wait for one.5. Bring lots of $1 for tips. While it is not necessary, the people certainly do appreciate it very much. All in all, our trip was relaxing and enjoyable. Absolutely nothing to complain about! We are planning to go back next year. Enjoy!  
<Date>Mar 28, 2005
<Rating>5	5	5	-1	5	-1	5	-1

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>relaxing My daughter and I went to the sunscape Jan.9,to jan16 2005. The first two days the weather wasn't tanning weather, but there was plenty of things to keep us busy. But when the sun came out the pool was crowded and we had a great time. The restaurants were excellent! Never had a bad meal! The staff were very friendly and helpful! Our glasses were always filled. They have staff walking around the pool and also the beach to take our orders. The rooms were always clean but we found that housekeeping was doing our room last about 4pm everyday but maybe that was because we were on the 3rd floor. We went on a Coco tours one day and I wouldn't advise it for anyone becasue the guys that took us out on the speedboats snockling were very rude to my daughter and myself. All they were looking for were there tip. They could speak English but they chose to speak creole. The Sunscape was so clean and very well maintained. The shows at night were also excellent. We loved the Sunscape so much I'm planning to go in the fall for two weeks.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>sunscape is an under-rated find just returned from 5 days at sunscape, travelled with my 12 year old daughter. we travel extensively both in us and abroad, first time in dr.after reading the big name guidebooks we really had our doubts going in. wow were we suprised. beautiful hotel, great room, professional, respectful service, gorgeous beach, good food in spotless restaurants, nice selection of recreational amenities for all ages.and very very safe.great overall value.(i know some of the websites have been critical of the food at the all-inclusives, but HELLO, you don't go to the caribbean to eat northern italian or greek or japanese. stick to the basics or try the local specialities.)

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Most amazing vacation I have nothing bad to say about this resort. It included more than any all inclusive I've been to, the facilities were imaculate, our kids 9-10-13 had a great time and there was lots for them to do. We felt extremely safe letting them roam the resort with friends. The staff were friendly and very attentive, the rooms were spotless, the food was spectacular, especially the Japenese restaurant. The ocean is a little rougher here but it is great for boogy boarding and the beach is beautiful. This was our first vacation like this with kids and I'd do it again in a minute. The drinks were readily available and there was never a shortage- the resort was booked to capacity while we were there but the service was still great. The pool is so big that you always felt you had it to yourself. Don't hesitate vacationing here, I would go back to this paradise in a flash.

<Author>lblade
<Content>impressive vacation After paying for our trip (early march) I have to say I was a little conserned, however the resort is wonderful and the staff, although they speak little english was fabulous. The rooms are fine. I do think they could use a little reburbishing of furnishings, but charming and most importantly, clean! I had concerns about bugs, and I am sure they too, have a time of year where this may be a concern, however, march is not. As for food, more than you could possibly ask for. The breakfast buffet has more than enough for all. Fresh fruit, eggs and more eggs, an omelet station and pancakes, french toast and waffles. To our delight, the buffet each nite, presented something different. Local dishes, interesting and very good. If you are looking for gourmet dining, just change your perspective, this place is tropical, and charming, primarily offering what you are there for, a taste of the Dominican Republic. No wrist bands and lots of common courtesy. They truely aim to please. The bartenders and hotel staff are more than ready to assist. We have been to many carribean resorts and this is most definitely one we plan to return to. Have a great time

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sunscape Grand - Wonderful Resort My husband and I just returned from Sunscape Punta Cana Grand on Monday 7 March 2005. We spent 8 relaxing, fun filled days! The staff is amazing. I did not meet one unfriendly person and most everyone spoke very good english. We have been to several AI resorts in Mexico and the Caribbean (2nd time to Punta Cana) and I found more people from the US at this resort than at any other we have stayed. We met some people staying down the beach at the Natura Park resort and they told us that the Americans were in the minority at that resort. There seemed to be an older crowd during this week. We are in our early forties and we were considered part of the younger crowd. :-) :-) However, when we were leaving there seemed to be a much younger crowd coming in. Room: Building 5 room 302. Very large room king bed. Maid service the best! I brought extra wash cloths but never needed them. We had three new ones each day. AC worked perfectly. Fridge stocked daily with beer, coke, water, sprite, and orange juice without us asking. I did pack half a suitcase with school supplies which I left a little each day for the maid with two dollars. She left us towel Swans, Hearts and flowers each day. :-) Food: Only went to the Buffet twice. Once for Breakfast, Once for Dinner. The buffet was small compared to other resorts but it is a smaller resort. The food was good and I never thought anything was bland. We had breakfast and dinner at the 24 hour restaurant near the beach (can't recall the name). It was not crowded, service was great and it was nice looking at the ocean while enjoying my coffee. For dinner they had excellent french onion soup and the filet mignon was prepared perfect. I had it two nights. :-) My husband had the Mahi Mahi with Shrimp. Also excellent. The second night my husband requested just shrimp and they had no problem with his special order. I tried a 'hamburger' on the beach but I'm not sure what kind of meat that was, if it was meat at all. I don't know, it was not good. The beach fruit stand was also excellent. That is what we had for lunch most days. Beach party: The beach party was amazing! The staff worked very hard setting up the beach and the food was very tasty. They had veal, beef, ribs, chicken, fish, baked potatoes, carrots, green beans, tons of desserts. We watched Pirates of the Caribbean on the beach, lounging in beach chairs. Beach: The stuff on the beach is not seaweed. It is grass. There is a difference. And it was not a real problem for us. Didn't seem to bother anyone else either. I did not smell anything bad from the marina. It was entertaining watching the party boats and fishing boats everyday. I thought the beach was beautiful! The water was very calm I believe due to the reef way off shore. The staff walks around the beach and takes drink orders which was nice. On one day, we could not find chairs. No big deal, we layed our towels on the beach and even when a chair opened up, we didn't bother taking it. All bars had top shelf liquor (Stoli, Bailey's, Jim Beam, Tanqueray, etc). I may have drank them out of Bailey's though. :-)Pools: Adult pool, very quiet. We usually went there in the evening before getting ready for dinner. Main pool with swim up bar is nice. The children that were there during our stay were very good. We barely knew there were kids in the area. Piano Bar: Julio is just too darn funny! :-) Karaoke and the Jamaican dude were very entertaining. I didn't expect the bar to be that much fun. Bar opened at 8:30pm entertainment started around 11:00pm. Julio's favorite song: I'm leaving on a jet plane..... Tour: We went on the Saona Island tour. Very touristy but we had a lot of fun. The island is beautiful. Lunch was also good (grilled chicken, pork chops, rice, fruit, pasta) Watch out for that rum! Very smooth but gets ya later. I tried the Manu uana. This must be their version of moon shine! WoW!Bottom Line: We thought this was definately a 5 golden apple resort. I really can't see what anyone could possibly complain about. Our prior stay in DR was at the Riu Bamboo and although we had a great time there as well, Sunscape ranked higher in our book.  
<Date>Mar 9, 2005

<Author>SMP2
<Content>Heads above the rest We returned from our vacation on Saturday, March 5th, 2005. I wanted to STAY!!!!!! We had originally been booked at Natura Park Resort a bit down the beach from Sunscape. When we arrived there, to our dismay, the resort was full of vacationing Spring Break kids from Spain. They all smoke non-stop, they're loud even though they are sitting right next to each other, they shout. We had no idea that this resort was going to be full of kids on Spring Break. This was exactly the thing that I told the travel agent that we wanted to avoid. NO SPRING BREAK CROWD. If I'm not mistaken, I thought they had a no Spring Breakers policy, Anyway, on day 4, I couldn't take it anymore and went to the lobby to voice my unhappiness with the situation to our Apple Representative Danelys, who was WONDERFUL, and by noon we were checked into the Sunscape Grand. WOW, what an incredible difference !!!! This place was absolutley beautiful. Everything was so much cleaner and so much more beautiful. The staff was head and shoulders above others that we have come across in our travels. So happy, helpful, always smiling, just all around so pleasant to be around. The food was great considering you are in a third world country. The drinks were fun and fruity. They would make anything that you wanted. The rooms were very nice, although our bedding smelled a bit musty. There are rafts on which you can lay on and float around in the gorgeous pool. There is also an adult pool (topless optional) which is more quiet. It has it's own bar so you never had to go far for anything. Convenient restrooms situated all over the grounds. One thing that I didn't realize going there was that the beach was topless. We only saw a few handful's of these bathing beauties, and it was a slight culture shock to me. After a day or so, you don't even really notice it anymore. All in all, after switching resorts and upgrading to the Sunscape, yes it was a huge upgrade from Natura Park Resort, we had a wonderful time. We will definitely go back again. I did find that going forward, we will not book anything less than 5 apple going through Apple Vacations. There is definitely a difference. We only go away once a year, and I will definitely spend the extra money in the future because it can make all the difference in having a good vacation and a GREAT vacation. The second half of our trip was GREAT thanks to the wonderful staff at Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. This resort is beautiful. One thing I might add is that I would request a room a little further away from the main entertainment stage and outdoor bar. At night, it can be a bit noisy.  
<Date>Mar 8, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>nice resort This resort should go adults only. This resort offers wonderful beaches, good restaurants and pretty grounds. The Island offers very little and it isn't recommended to venture out unless on a tour. We flew to Santa Domingo with a tour and enjoyed this very old cityThe rooms are large but they need upgrading. We found the food to be quite good and the service was always friendly. Our room was clean and the water and beer in the fridge (as we requested upon arrival) was restocked everyday with the amounts requested. We stayed 7days and enjoyed a Mexican Night, candle lit barbecue on the beach and a very good Italian meal in the Italian restaurant. The adult pool is hidden between buildings and becomes very hot and stuffy as the day progresses. The swim up bar is better used in mid to late afternoon when the kiddies are napping.The vendors have a beach mall and unlike Mexico do not pester on the beach. This is a big plus. A few venors are allowed into the resort two nights a week and that is fair.This resort is for relaxing and enjoying sun,beaches, music, good food and as much to drink as you want. If you don't want to watch the shows-leave and walk the beach and enjoy your wife or your family. The good far out weighs the bad at this resort.

<Author>tump21
<Content>Paradise found Like others, we were concerned about the bad reviews posted. Our trip was fantastic. We visited the DR February 17th through the 25th. I cannot say enough about Apple Vacations. They truly have their act together. Everything went extremely well. We flew out of Pittsburgh on USA3000. Anyone that flies any other airline after flying USA3000 is nuts. The resot itself is beutiful. The grounds are very well kept and they are constantly cleaning. The rooms were much bigger than expected, although in need of updates. The food was okay. We did not starve by any means. Some of the food was just plain weird. We are not picky eaters and didn't have a hard time finding something to eat. Be careful of the chicken, some of it was raw. Noone got sick. The beach was nice. Seeweed was definetly a problem but they did a good job at cleaning things up. Compared to the other resorts in this area, the Sunscape definetly did the best job at cleaning up the seeweed. We expected the water to be a clearer, but again I think it was more a seeweed issue than anything. The ocean water was cold, so was the pool water - almost too cold. They may want to consider heating the pool, but we were there in February. Some reviews complained of fumes from the marina which as next to the resort. This was not a problem. My husband didn't even know the marina was there until I pointed it out to him. I would recommend the Outback Safari. It was wonderful. Our tourguide, Louis made the trip. They take you to a beutiful beach to boogie board - it was a blast and well worth the money.The only bad thing I can say about the entire trip is that we have to wait another year to go back. My two boys (ages 12 and 14) had a wonderful time and cannot wait to go back. We highly recommend the Sunscape resort, however, when we go back next year we would like to see another resort.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very pleased! There were 7 of us (adults) and we all agree that we had a blast! Some details: From the plane to the resprt, MAYBE 45 minutes. Apple Tours is very organized and efficient. Our rooms, very clean, no musty smell that I could tell and I am VERY sensitive to odors!! My sister didn't have hot water but I didn't know about it and our Travel Agent said we should have INSISTED on a room change, they showered in our room. Another friend's refrigerator didn't work, but they brought a new one to their room. The Staff: If you want to go where people speak ALL English, stay in the United States, it bothers me when people complain about the staff. They were ALL lovely people, some spoke better English than others and we learned that our Spanish was darn good. That's all a part of traveling internationally, if you're too uptight, it's gonna be a hassle, we went to have a good time and we did!! The Resort: I had no problems going into the public restrooms with bare feet and let me tell you, that is BIG!!! There was never any water or sand on those bathroom floors, immaculate!! The staff works very hard...appreciate that. The Restaurants: None of us (7) ever got sick and we ate at all the restaruants. Windows definately the winner,this is a HUGE restaurant. They serve 3 meals a day, buffet style and they must serve thousands a day. I loved the food! We all thought it was good. 5 star good? No but LOTS of choices and very well done. They are catering to many different nationalities and I was impressed! The Italian restarant: they ARE trying. Real Italian? no, but a nice change of scenery, I still enjoyed it, we all did. The Mexican: same as the Italian. We had fun with the appetizer size, we took a picture of the buffalo wings because we got 4 of them, all the appetizers were like that, but who cares, just order more of them. We had lunch at the Tex-Mex once and didn't go back, lunch at Windows was to die for!! They also have 2 places outside all day that you can get nacho's, pizza, sandwiches, so if we didn't want to go eat we just grabbed something and ate at the pool or on the beach. One point to make at Windows, you may stand in line for a personal omelet or chicken cabobs or whatever they cook on a grill in front of you, depends on the time of day. The deserts were awesome. The Beach: We had no complaints about the beach, water or seaweed. Yes there was some seaweed but not a lot and not any in the water. The water was bluer farther down the way , but also nastier at other resorts we walked by. Getting a beach chair: If you REALLY want a chair, put your towel on one early, again there were 7 of us and nobody did that, we managed fine! We went to the adult pool and used rafts in the pool or GASP! a towel on the beach!We also had a blast playing volleyball and soccer! We were between the ages of 25 and 45 and we just had so much fun. There were always people who were looking to play volleyball. This is a very busy resort, if you want something quiet, private and peaceful this is not the place. We met greatpeople from everywhere. Our goal was to have fun and we absolutely did just that!!!

<Author>Ames31
<Content>The staff was great! and I am hooked on Coco Locos! We just returned last night from Sunscape - I will give them a big kudos for working on the resort. While we were there (2/20-2/25), we saw them painting the resort, re-doing a couple fountains, adding activities for the kids and laying out plans for expanding restaurants. I was impressed that Summit Group is looking to continuously improve.The beach - yes, tons of seaweed. But the staff cleaned it up very diligently. Interesting note - the beach is not owned by the hotel - it is federally owned and the hotel is not responsible for any incidents on the beach.The food - the food was good. My chief complaint was that the buffet food doesn't stay hot very long after you get it. Breakfast was great and I enjoyed trying new dishes.Excursions - we did La Saona, ATV's, Outback Safari and Manati Park. Swim with the dolphins was fantastic - I am a huge dolphin lover. The park is what it is - I do give credit to trying to establish a zoo type atmosphere with something for everyone. La Saona is OUTSTANDING! The beach is gorgeous and we got great buys on coffee and rum. Outback Safari was also a great trip. You really saw the country side and how people truly live. I did take a bag of school supplies, toothbrushes and toothpast to a local school while on the tour. NOTE - it is ILLEGAL to hand out candy and money to children in the Dominican. The boogie boarding was great and my boyfriend is determined we are going back to that beach when we go back. ATV's were very cool - we ended up being the only couple out during that time slot. Seeing where the Atlantic and Caribbean meet is incredibly beautiful. Drinks - try the coco loco's! I even got the recipe from the bartender! The staff was all great - we didn't meet anyone who was not willing to help or smile and say hola. Will we go back? Honestly, no. but not because of the resort. We are beach/ocean people, not pool people. The sea was pretty choppy while we were there and I admit, we did not realize we were on the Atlantic Ocean not the Caribbean Sea. We will go back to the Dominican though, just on the southern tip. We did meet the folks a couple reviews down who had a party of 25 getting married. Super nice folks! and we also meet 2 couples from Philly who we exchanged emails with. Feel free to email me with questions or to see photos!  
<Date>Feb 26, 2005

<Author>FromNJ
<Content>Wonderful After reading some negative reviews on this resort, I had some concerns. They couldn't be farther from the truth. Sunscape Punta Cana Grand was a lovely resort. Not too big, not too small. The grounds and landscaping are breathtaking and so well kept. The staff is constantly perfecting them. Speaking of the staff, they cannot do enough for you, they are warm and friendly and always have a smile on their faces. The rooms were ample size although may be ready for a little updating, especially the bathrooms, however, they are absolutely spotless. Housekeeping service twice a day. Fully stocked mini-bar (drinks only), replenished daily. The pool was large and never too crowded although you do have to get up early to reserve your lounge chairs at both the pool and beach especially if you want shade which I promise you will need. There is a small adults only pool however we traveled with 3 small children so never had a need to get over there. If you are traveling with children I would recommend Buildings 1, 2 or 3. The Explorer's Club met our expectations and the staff was wonderful. My children would go there to get out of the sun for a bit and participated in a few beach games, donkey rides and camping night. We also enjoyed some of the organized adult activities...beach volleyball, shuffleboard, horseshoes, bingo, towel art, water aerobics to name a few. The food was okay. In the ala carte restaurants, the portions were small and the service was on the slow side but that may have been as issue for us b/c of the kids and our need to make it to the daily 7:30pm kids movie. (Great, on a big outdoor screen). Windows, the main restaurant, buffet style really worked out well for us. It had a nice variety and a different theme each evening. Do not miss Dominican Night. Fabulous! We booked through Apple Vacations and there were representatives on every leg of our trip. They were very helpful. One day they arranged transportaion to a local cigar factory for my husband to purchase cigars to bring home for gifts. (He was gone for only about 1 hour). The only negative was 1 week was too short. We loved it and would go back in a minute, next time for at least 10 days! Thank you, Sunscape, for an outstanding vacation! We hope to see you again!  
<Date>Feb 26, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Renewed in the Republic Hi! My husband and I just returned from Punta Cana. 2/12 - 2/19 We celebrated our 15th Wedding Anniversary. Sunscape made our special trip memorable. From the moment we walked thru the lobby (drinks  sweets) we expressed our satisfaction to each other. Our week stay was unbelieveable! The view from our room was spectacular. We were so excited! I liked the variety of food available. Wonderful presentation! The staff always had a kind word to share. They did a wonderful job trying to motivate us lazy vacationers (Games, dance lessons, How-to sessions- food, drink, towel art) We also enjoyed asking Chocolate for a Budwieser. He always flashed a big smile when he saw us. Our room was cleaned each and everyday. Better than home! Ha ha Our trip to Sonoa Island was EXCELLENT. If you have a chance, take advantage of this trip. The Apple Representatives helped make our stay very enjoyable. We would like to return with our children next trip.  I was worried after reading all those negative comments that were left by others on this website. I'm glad I didn't form an opinion based on their silly comments. I didn't find one to be true...........dirty beaches, stinky fumes, bad food, or terrible service. NOT!

<Author>khmedic1105
<Content>A GRAND Disappointment Our family recently returned from the Sunscape Grand Resort at Punta Cana, after a 7 night stay. Before booking this vacation, we became aware of the Golden Apple Five-Star rating awarded this resort through various reviews. We believed that our family had made a good choice for our vacation dollars. Unfortunately NOT! Compared to other Carribean destinations, this location was Fair at best. The beach was unkept with lots of Sea-Weed every day. Visitors should expect very breezy conditions and a rough surf daily. Off shore snorkeling was poor. The food preperation at this resort was poor. Frequently the food (especially at the daily buffets) was often served cold and the meat was often undercooked. In addition to our entire family, other guests who we spoke to, suffered from serious Gastrointestinal (Stomach) distress within the first 48 hours of stay. This resort needs much improvement in customer service. BEWARE, if you do not speak or understand spanish, there WILL BE a big communication barrier with the staff. Our room service was very poor for this level of resort. Our room was not cleaned and towels were not replaced until after 4pm every day! The Fitness Center-Gym had few pieces of equipment that were poorly maintained. The Fitness area was only open from 8am until 8pm daily, which eliminates any thought of early morning or late evening workouts. Nightly entertainment was nothing more than re-runs of old movies and group of locals who mastered Lip-Sync. There was a lack of things to do for younger individuals. The grounds and pools were very clean and attractive however. If your plan is to lay in a loung chair at the pool side from sun-up until sun-down and, you do not have a family to entertain, this facility will suffice quite well. I do not recommend this resort to families with younger childeren. We've been there, now we know!  
<Date>Feb 25, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Suncape Grand is a great resort We stayed at the Sunscape Grand from Feb. 14-21 and had a GREAT time. It is really hard to believe the last 2 negative reviews that have been written because they do not in any way reflect our experience. We have stayed at a number of different all-inclusives in Mexico and Cuba and this resort was by far the best. The staff simply cannot be beat - we found them to be equally friendly and helpful irrespective as to whether they were continually tipped (we tipped a few of our favourites only at the end of the week and received excellent services throughout our stay). The quality of wait and bar staff, housekeeping, security, front desk surpassed anything we have found elsewhere, including many hotels in Europe and the U.S.  The food, contrary to the other reviews, was great - the variety and quality were excellent for an all-inclusive. Although we have had problems at other all-inclusives we had absolutely no difficulty finding something good to eat at the Grand. The rooms are not luxurious (they appear to be in the process of upgrading some of the furniture) but they are very spacious, comfortable and clean. We will definitely return to Punta Cana and to the Sunscape Grand.  
<Date>Feb 23, 2005

<Author>FoxyRoxy32502
<Content>Very relaxing!! My husband and I visited this resort the 1st week of February. The weather was breezy but nice, with maybe a brief shower here and there. Not enough or long enough to head back inside. The rooms were fair but clean. Anything you needed was a phone call away. Room service was quick. Any problem we had (A/C not on) was fixed immediently. The only complaints I have re. the room were: Can be noisy. It's amazes me how many people think it's ok to let there kids act like animals, especially in the hall way. The other complaint was no water for quite a few hours one day, not a problem the rest of the week. The beach was nice, and the water warmer than the pool! There is lots of seaweed but so what you're in the ocean! We had no problem finding chairs on the beach and we didn't get out ther until after 9. The pool area was warm (less breezy) and was nice and clean. Any cups from lazy people that can't pick up after themselves was cleaned up rather quickly by staff. I couldn't believe the chair thing by the pool!! I can't figure how it's ok to reserve quite a few chairs in the a.m. and not use them until , oh, 1-2p.m. One request for pool area...play more latin music!! Restaurants were nice, food good. The only place I didn't like was The American Grill. It wasn't because of the food, the service was almost non existant!! I don't know how you can go wrong with the food, there's something for everyone!! The staff really do a nice job with presentation. I heard of no one getting sick. I'm not saying it doesn't happen. I can see one way it can happen....people need to use the serving utensils that are located at the particular station of food. I was shocked to see some folks using their hands to grab food, gag, and even one guy put something back after handling it!!! So watch how and where you take things from a buffet. We're not people that stay up late, especially after a day of sun and rum-runners!! We saw only 2 shows. They were funny, you can't go there expecting Broad Way. The staff work really hard and look like they have fun. Isn't that what vacation is all about?? We were there for the Super Bowl (we were 2 of 4 Pats fans!!). They showed the game on the big screen where the movies are. What a good time...a bar set up and snacks. We met alot of nice people from Philly....Hi Mark and Dawn!We found the staff everywhere to be friendly. I really tried to speak as much of my limited Spanish as I could. A little smile and a buenos dia goes a long way. Tips go a long way, too. Bring lots of small bills if you intend on rewarding good service. Walking along the beach during the day is safe. I didn't feel so safe walking outside the resort along the road..that expedition ended quickly!!!All- in-all a nice resort. Good food and people. I would go back in the future.feel free to email me with any questions.  
<Date>Feb 23, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Had an AWSOME stay here...... Stayed here Nov. 9 - Nov. 15, 2004. A group of about 30 ppl were here for my best friends wedding, and let me jsut say that everything was amazing. The wedding itself was outstanding, from the flowers to the cocktail hour reception. If you are looking to get 5 star resturants then No this is not the place, but everything else is great.When you arrive you are greeted with cookies and yummy rum punch, what a great way to start a trip. I had a third floor room with cathedral ceilings. The staff is very friendly and pretty much willing to do anything in their power to make your stay easyer. The main bar behind the pool has great drinks, and i recommend Chocolate, he is an awsome bartender. I tipped about $1 a drink and was treated like royalty. as soon as you put down an empty drink a new one is there in seconds. I reccomend the ATV tours. We all took one one day and it was great. Its about a 4hour tour that goes through the beach and the town. Its breathtaking the things you see, and it was only $40USD per person, well worth it. I dont understand how anyone could have a bad time here. Let me tell you that it is well worth the money and i would love to go back any time!!!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful Time Just returned from Sunscape Punta Cana Grand on Saturday (2-19-05). Traveled there with wife and 2 kids (ages 10 and 8).Room: Very clean and well maintained. No problems at all. Housekeeping was in everyday and cleaned and made beds. Don'tget me wrong, we didn't go starving but food is prepared differently. Drinkswere plentiful and very good.Beach: The beach had a lot of seaweed but that did not bother us at all. Workers out early in the morning everyday cleaning up the seaweed from the beach.Entertainment: Plenty of things to do for kids and adults. Kids really enjoyed nightly movie( 7:30 every night).Overall we enjoyed our stay at Sunscape and plan on another visit in the future.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Before you consider the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand, you'd better think again! Here it is - as fair as I can make it.1) My room was not ready on time. The receptionist seemed unsympathetic and spoke little English.2) When our room was ready, our bags were not brought to the room. I carried my own bags to the room because I was tired of waiting.3) The front desk initially forgot to provide a safety deposit key with our package. To fix the situation, they reached into another open room package on the desk and handed me a key. Obviously, the keys fit more than one room's safety deposit box, so be careful. 4) Mucho seaweed and debris in the water (cups, straws, plastic). 5) Also, there was a lot of debris on the beach (more than I have seen at other beaches). I even found a broken beer bottle. 6) Overall, the food was bad, bad, bad. Don't let anyone fool you. Some things were good (deserts) and some things OK (grilled chicken and lobster and the Italian restaurant) but overall, it was disappointing.7) Shortage of towels at the pool. Four of my five days there I went half the day without a towel and had to go back every 30 minutes to check. They keep saying the same thing 20...30 minutes. They should have a towel for every towel key but they don't and don't seem to care.8) It was a real problem if you showed up past 9am at the pool/beach trying to get a chair. Sunscape permits chairs be reserved all day - even if nobody eventually uses them. My advise is to wait a reasonable period of time and then claim the chair(s). 9) Even though it is advertised, the Cigar Bar is not open. The front desk person said he has never seen it open.10) The dancers in the show are high school caliber talented at best. 11) The resort seems older and not as clean as I'm used to (I've been to 8 other resorts in Punta Cana and Cancun). The shower curtain had mildew stains. 12) The service was not consistent. On 2 occasions, our drink order was not taken. They always seemed confused when you arrived at the buffet and had a difficult time locating a table.13) They closed much of the breakfast buffet down 1/2 hour before its advertised closing time. They tried to seat us in a smoking area because they were closing off much of the seating even though there was 30 minutes before closing. 14) Many topless sunbathers at the pool even though it is prohibited (I was not offended but a parent with a child may be).I could go on, but I think you get the picture.  
<Date>Feb 20, 2005

<Author>Jann1127
<Content>Very disappointing. I cannot believe this has been rated a five golden apple! It really wasn't a nice resort at all. RESORT: The resort is small, which I actually liked. But it is in no way as nice as other resorts that are ranked 5 golden apples. STAFF: The people who worked there, with the exception of a few bartenders, were very friendly. I had a small child with me, and they went out their way to be nice to him. FOOD: The food was absolutely horrible! And when I say horrible--I mean I wasn't able to eat the entire time I was there! I'm not sure if it's that way in all of Punta Cana, but the all-inclusives in Mexico were much better. DRINKS: The drinks were in no way top shelf. And if you happened to find a brand of alcohol that you recognized, they gave you very little of it. POOL: Forget about getting a towel at the pool. EVERYTIME we attempted to get a towel, they would tell us to come back in 20 minutes. When we'd come back in 20 minutes--they would tell us 20 minutes again! An hour later we'd get our towels. Ridiculous! And most guests like to get up at the crack of dawn to reserve their pool lounges with their towels, so it's very difficult to find somewhere to sit.BEACH: We really didn't spend much time at the beach, but it looked beautiful. And yes, there was a lot of seaweed as others reported, but I don't think enough for it to be a problem.ENTERTAINMENT: The entertainment staff was a lot of fun and very friendly. We also got a kick out of the audience participation skits. But the dancers were mediocre at best. There was also a lot of lip syncing, which was disappointing.BUGS: I was bit up pretty badly on my ankles--the first day we were there! And then there are the reports of Malaria in Punta Cana...Overall, it was very disappointing to us, especially because our expectations were higher due to the resorts' apple rating. And not being able to eat was a problem as well. Sorry--friendly people just can't make up for all of the negative aspects of the resort.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Horrible is an understatement Went to Punta Cana Sunscape Grand after receiving great reviews from travel agent promoting trip with Apple Vacations. HORRIBLE IS AN UNDERSTATEMENT. The hotel lobby is beautiful however the service is not so good.   FOOD - HORRIBLE - WORSE FOOD I HAVE EVER EATEN IN MY LIFE. I lived off of fruit from FRUIT CART on the beach for 5 of my 8 day stay. I tried different restaurants and the buffet but all was simply HORRIBLE. No variety at all. I would expect to  have some typical food from the country or island that I am visiting but you will not find that at this resort. This was the most bland (tasteless food I had ever eaten). I have lived in Miami and know what Dominican food taste like and it is not at all like anything at this resort not even on THEME night at the buffet.  BEACH - HORRIBLE - Could not get a beach chair or cabana on beach or at pool. Suspecting it may be a problem getting shade on  the beach (travelled with a 2 year old child) I decided to go to the beach at 7:00 am first morning at sunset grand and  look for shaded area (Cabana or Palm Tree) nothing available Went at 6:00 am second morning at sunset grand and again  nothing available. Third morning went to beach at 5:00 am NOTHING AVAILABLE. People put their towels on the chairs at the beach and pool area lounge chairs the evening before perhaps when they get out of the disco/club and dont even arrive at the beach until 12:00 or 1:00 in the afternoon. This I believe was not only inconsiderate of other travellers but should not be allowed by the resort.  CAN NOT GO ON BEACH AT NIGHT - It is guarded by  Security.  BEACH WATER - HORRIBLE - Merky, dirty SMALL SMALL SMALL BEACH I felt I was in a marina not a beach area. There were terrible fumes from the boats and the beach was not very clean   EXCURSIONS - JUNGLE SAFARI only tour worth taking. Food was horrible on that as well. (Lunch meat sandwiches) and that is it. Also took tour to SANTO DOMINGO. Four hours on bus they  stopped us at restaurant to eat (BUFFET) again HORRIBLE I dont know what it is but anywhere we went the food was just horrible. When you are taking an 8 day vacation and the food is so bad your entire stay is going to be miserable. Also, bus had to stop on way back from trip to have one passenger escorted to JAIL. He never paid to take tour however was with us entire trip with exception of 2 hours in end of trip. HE APPARENTLY WAS A LOCAL AND NO TOUR GUIDE CAUGHT HIS ACT UNTIL END.  ENTERTAINMENT - EVENING SHOWS - Can't really explain how they  call it entertainment because my 2 year old could have put on a better show than those shows.  CHILDRENS ACTIVITY CENTER - EMPTY, EMPTY, EMPTY, Nothing to do whatsoever, lady was very friendly but absolutely nothing to do because there were not crafts or supplies in the place. Went to playground only to find broken beer bottles in slides and under crawl area of LITTLE TYKES play area.  RESORT HORSEBACK RIDING - YEAH RIGHT. They have horses but you can ride about 15 feet by 15 feet area.  Dont be foolde either by the shopping at the resort. They claim to bring in reputable jewelry sellers, junk pure junk. Also when you take the excursion to Santo Domingo they let you go into the jewelry store and act as if they are going to give you a good deal because you took the tour - no deals at all.  OUR ROOM was always clean (we left daily tips for the maid) and she always made sure our minibar was fully stocked.  There may be a lot of negativity about this resort from this review however typically we do not complain but this was the worse 3000.00 dollars I have ever spent....................

<Author>Jillian
<Content>Total Paradise!!! My husband and I returned from Sunscape Grand last week for the 6th time and as always had a blast!!!  Check-in was great! Thanks Milton! Beautiful room overlooking the ocean and pool. When we arrived to our room there was a fresh fruit platter. Rooms are immaculate! Maid service is GREAT! Mini bar is refilled everyday, no need to ask for anything, it's always there..  Beach was very nice, all kinds of activities such as shuffleboard, soccer and volleyball court. The staff is AMAZING! Always smiling and having fun! There are always enough chairs and huts, there are huts to the left of the beach if you like to shop. Also a massage hut! ahhhhhh, so relaxing!  Pool area is so nice, again plenty of chairs and huts also floating mats. Swim up bar is great to meet people and Juan the bartender is AWESOME!! The Backstage bar has snacks such as pizza, nachos with salsa and sandwiches on rolls or crouissants, they are delicious!  The shows were very entertaining, audience participation night was so funny, lots of laughs. Magic show was great too! The entertainers work so hard and put on a GREAT show! After the show we went to the piano bar and visited JULIO!!!! So much fun! Dave Richards is a great entertainer, Karoke and he ALWAYS gets the audience going! We miss you guys!!!  Food at ALL the ala cartes (Tex Mex  DaMario's) as well as the buffet (Windows) were excellent with a large variety. Beach garden is open 24 hours! Dinner was great there too! No reservations needed! Service was excellent where ever you decided to go.   We want to thank Juan (splash bar) Julio (piano bar) Claudamir, Matias, Daniel, Chocolate and Humberto for making our vacation another memorable one! YOU GUYS ARE AWESOME!!! I'm sure I forgot a few names so this is for EVERYONE!!!! THANK YOU!!!!!  Special thanks to Caren for all you did for us and welcoming us into YOUR HOME!!!   This resort is the BEST OF THE BEST!!!  Feel free to email me if you need further info on this WONDERFUL RESORT!!!   Thanks again for another week in PARADISE!!!!  Chet  Christine

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Another wonderful vacation at Sunscape Punta Cana Grand We spent another great week at this resort from January 22-29, having been there also in March of 2004. We chose to return there with our 2 children ages 5 and 7 because it's an all-around excellent resort. My husband's parents joined us on this recent trip and they thoroughly enjoyed it. We are all planning to return next year. On our arrival we were greeted with a signature rum punch which helped to get our long-awaited vacation off to a good start. Our rooms were ready by 2pm. For the amount of time that we actually spent in our room (showering and sleeping), we considered the balcony to be a very nice feature. The surroundings are breathtaking. I've never seen such well-kept flowers, trees etc... on any other resort. The resort is one of the smallest that also caters to children. This makes the vacation more quaint and relaxing as all the amenities (food, room, activities, bathroom, lobby, pool, beach etc...) are never more than 2 minutes away. Hats-off to all the employees who work extremely hard to please everyone.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>depends on what you're looking for First, my husband and I have visited quite a few all-inclusives in the Carribean and know that it is what it is. We did not go to Sunscape with five star expectations, but were looking for a fun relaxing vacation. Sunscape was successful in some areas; unsuccessful in others. Hope my review is helpful to those of you looking into places to go:Check-in: Went smoothly. We were greeted with cookies and rum punch. Even though we got in way before noon, our room was ready. Room: The room and the bathroom were large and clean, typically Caribbean in feel and style. There was a small minibar with bottled water, a few bottles of soda, and beer. Also a small TV, but the channels were pretty plentiful. If you're expecting plush, you wont find it here. If you're looking for clean and fairly comfortable, Sunscape delivers. A special note: pillows are exceptionally large and plump. If you're used to sleeping on a flatter pillow, or have neck problems, you might have to either go without or bring your own.We tipped the housekeeping staff a few bucks each day, and they were very willing to help us with towels, bottled water, etc whenever we needed it. We also had an issue with a stopped up sink and it was addressed within 10 minutes of calling the front desk.The property: It's very pretty and well-laid out. No matter where your room is, its not far from the action. Our room faced the main pool, so on an evening we opted to turn in early, it was quite noisy. We also heard lots of noise in the early hours of the morning as the staff prepared for the upcoming day. But all in all, the staff worked hard to keep the property clean, and there were lots of exotic critters to look at, as well as tropical foliage. Also, lots of shade by the pool, which is something we havent always found at other resorts.We only went to the beach a couple of times (we're pool people) and weren't overly impressed. I realize that seaweed is part of being by the ocean, but the beach looked overly covered to me. There are a couple of vendors in huts to the left, who will accost you as you walk past. It was very hard to say no, as they were very persistant, but we managed to make it through our vacation only spending $20!Food: Here's the bad news. As hard as I tried to like it, the food was, at best, mediocre. We tried the tex mex restaurant and the italian restaurant and we were less than impressed with both. food was lukewarm and really devoid of flavor. There is a grill on the beach, which serves hamburgers and hot dogs, but I'm not sure what meat they were made out of, and after tasting one of each, opted to eat elsewhere. With the exception of desserts and a few salads, I found nothing that I could actually say was good. Please note that I am not a really discriminating diner and have always found stuff to eat at other AI's, but I really struggled here...with the exception of breakfast, which was OK. Entertainment: Only made it to one show...I thought my kids high school class could have done a better job, and my sentiments were echoed by our friends, but there were some who seemed to enjoy it. We attempted to go to the piano bar one night, but at 11 oclock it was still fairly empty, so we went to bed instead. The daytime activities were fun and seemed to engage a wide variety of guests.Staff: most of the staff were very friendly and willing to help whenever we asked for something. Having been at resorts where they actually know your name by the end of your first day, I sort of felt like that extra touch was missing here. Perhaps it was the language barrier, as I do not speak spanish.Weather: Our weather was a mixture of partly cloudy and an occasional 100% sunny day. It is chilly at night and in the morning, and I did wear a lightweight sweater or jacket every day. There were a couple of nights i actually wished i had brought jeans. I'm sure its different as you get out of the winter months and into the warmer months. Bring lots of bathing suits, as mine didn't seem to dry too quickly in the room.Other stuff: Dont drink the water. Everyone says it, but its so easy to forget and turn the tap on to brush your teeth. I guarantee you'll regret it. Also know that the coconut milk is a natural laxative and take it easy on it when choosing your drinks. Trust me on this one...otherwise you'll be feeling pretty rotten for a few days! Also, the tiles get quite slippery when wet. Be cautious! We had massages while there...a great deal for $30...and very relaxing (and adults over 18 get a free 15 minutes massage!).All in all, it was fun and I'm glad we went, but I dont think we'll go back. For us, food is an important part of our vacation, and it just didnt do it for us... hope this helps!  
<Date>Feb 1, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Vacation from Hell My boyfriend, along with another couple, traveled to Punta Cana in September. Before we left, we saw on the Weather Channel that Tropical Strom Jean was headed straight for Punta Cana. We were concerned and because we purchased the trip through Apple Vacations and we included the insurance, we contacted our Apple Rep., thinking we should reschedule. We were assured that if conditions were unsafe we would be notified at the airport the following morning and not even fly out. We were not completely satisfied with this response so we directly call the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand Resort to find out what information they had on the weather. We were told that is was beautiful and sunny and that Tropical Storm Jean would be missing that particular area. Well, he could not have been more wrong. Four hours after arriving at the resort, we were invaded by 60mph winds, heavy, intense, non-stop rain and flooded rooms. This tropical strom turned into Hurricane Jean 10 hours after we arrived. Now, granted, a hurricane is an act of God and can not be controlled. BUT, what could have been saved was the customer service that was horrible by both resort staff and Apple reps. at the resort. As for the accomodations- our rooms were flooded above-ankle high, our 2 bath towels were used to keep more water from coming in our room, our bed sheets were mostly wet and stunk like must but the worst thing, NO DRINKING WATER! When we went to ask for more of the mentioned items above at the front desk, we found many other guests of the resort asking for the same thing. They had a pad of paper sitting at the front desk going with a list of rooms that needed particular items. I only asked for the necessities (especially drinking water) and even by the day we left, not one single item was brought to us. I even volunteered to get them my self because of being short-staffed. No, they wouldn't allow that. Staff was completely stressed out, understaffed and therefore it was taken out on the guests. Anytime I asked for information, items for our rooms, etc. I never received a calm, honest answer.Because of the hurricane, for a day, none of the restaurants were open and when we finally got word they would re-open, it was only the buffet for limited times during the day. It rained our entire stay and we even left a day early because more storms were coming. Neither Apple Vacations nor the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand are willing to give ANY type of compensation for our early departure or our horrible amentites or absolutely no amentities in some cases. And neither Apple Vacations nor Sunscape will take any type of responsibility. I certinly do not expect either to take responsibility for an uncontrolable hurricane but I DO expect them to take it for their dreadful and unpleasant customer service. Since the incredibly awful vacation my boyfriend, our friends and myself experienced, we have not and never will reccommend either Apple Vacations or Sunscape Punta Cana Grand to any of our friends or family.  
<Date>Jan 30, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Overall, it was great but I'm glad I didn't pay the full price! My husband and I just returned from this resort a couple of days ago. We loved the fact that there was 24 hr room service as we checked in pretty late on Friday night and we didn't have to worry about what time the restaurants were open. We found this resort to be quite entertaining as there was always something going on or something to do. They have bike riding, basket ball courts, ping-pong and pool tables and more to keep you busy. Even a characature artist that you can stand around and watch for hours. The food was overall pretty good. It wasn't gourmet or anything but there was always something good to choose from the menu and it sure was a whole lot better than Cuba by far. We never got sick which is all we could ask for. The pool bar was a little crowded but the bar closest to the beach was quick and friendly. The pool area did not play enough music which was dissappointing. It was often too quiet and all you could hear were kids or rock music that American guests had brought themselves. I prefer to listen to Spanish or Caribbean music or I would have gone to the States. The staff was friendly for the most part and most spoke a variety of languages. The entertainment staff was fun and friendly and they had a photographer around the resort that would take pictures of you and you could purchase them if you wanted later as early as that same night. We did find that there were surrounded by a lot of older and more senior guests. It wasn't a party atmosphere and the disco was empty but the entertainment crew always tried to make the most of it with their great attitudes. The nightly entertainment was better than I've experienced at any other resort. The resort is small and more intimate so there would always be people around and it never seemed like a ghost town like other larger resorts. The beach had a lot of seaweed but they were always trying to clean it up. The staff was constantly cleaning the resort and keeping on top of things. The waiters were sometimes slow and some not that friendly. The beach area did smell like fuel from the boats which was not good at all but out of all the resorts in that area, we seemed to have the most beach room and it wasn't crowded at all. The pillows in our room did smell bad and it took us two days to get new ones after asking 4 or 5 times. We were out of the way to be picked up by most of the tour buses so we had to take taxis to a location in town to be picked up which I found inconvenient. Next time I'll find a resort closer to the main area of Punta Cana. Overall, we had a good time but when we go back to Punta Cana, we'll probably try a different resort. I would not recommend paying full price to stay here but I would definately suggest it as a last minute trip, definately!  
<Date>Jan 24, 2005

13	2(night):1	5(time):1	9(service):1	10(restaurant):1	16(food):1	32(check):1	40(love):1	70(overall):1	79(late):1	109(pretty):2	831(worry):1	923(friday):1	1464(hr):1

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Don't Expect A Lavish Vacation My husband and I just returned from the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. We were there for one week, January 14-21. The Internet and Apple Vacations led us to expect something Grand, but it is very average. The people are lovely, kind and helpful. I know some Spanish and this helped as they have few employees who are fluent in English. They were delighted when I answered their questions in Spanish, however poor my command of the language might be. We had no problems with maid service, plenty of towels in the room and at the beach, our room was cleaned early and they came back for turn down service and fresh towels every evening. When I asked for extra sheets, towels, coffee, soap and/or water they were brought to our room promtly.The beach was beautiful, we never smelled fumes from the boats, and anyway, we thought they added to the ambience. The beach was not overcrowded like some were, and Latin resorts always play loud music all day. If you want peace and quiet it can be found, we went to a quieter side of the beach or to the Adult Pool. The food was very poor. Fortunately, my husband and I aren't big eaters, or we would have been hungry. Don't get an omelette, they hand the same bowl to everyone to fill with their ingredients, we didn't get sick, but this is definitely not a good practice. The shows were excellent, we loved them and the staff are extremely funny. We also enjoyed the outdoor movies. We had one major problem, a bed that had been water damaged and smelled horrible. It took two days to remedy the problem. First they replaced it with a smaller mattress, and then they brought the original one back with a pad on top. The smell leached into all of the bedding. It was unbearable, but after taking a pillow to the front desk for them to smell, the problem was remedied quickly. The complaints about seaweed are ridiculous, it's a beach! Yes, sea life grows there. The people work very hard to keep the beach, walkways, rooms, lobby and the entire ground clean and neat. If you are looking for a quiet, relaxed vacation and don't care about good food it's a good place at a great price. If you're looking for The Breakers in Palm Beach, then stay in the states and don't travel to third world countries. These people have nothing, and Americans act like spoiled children, it would be nice to see the Dominincan people treated kindly by Americans.One final comment, we understand that the Summit Group has recently purchased the Sunscape Hotels. They seem to be more interested in profit than in service and quality. We made a second trip to one of their hotels in Tulum in the fall and the sevice and quality of the food were not as good as before. Perhaps we should all be writing complaints to them instead of to the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand.  
<Date>Jan 24, 2005

<Author>OBXBum
<Content>The trip of a lifetime........ We arrived home on Saturday January 8th and already I am planning our next trip. The hotel is fantastic. I am always amazed at the things people will complain about. I spent 15 years in the Hotel/Motel business as a front desk clerk to a General Manager. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. The lighting is a little dim in the bed area but I found it quite adequate for what I was doing...SLEEPING! The rooms are also a little on the damp side....HELLO.....you are on the beach! HUMIDITY! Bathroom was very large , shower was huge with excellent water pressure!The grounds and buildings are beautiful....CAUTION on the tile floors however. If your feet or shoes are wet you will slip. Just walk carefully. I would recommend building four or five if you are not traveling with kids. These are located away from the main pool and most of the activities and very close to the adult pool. The grounds were constantly being worked on. Pruning, sweeping, clearing away debris from the palm trees..........very well cared for.The food is average. Windows has a variety of foods on the buffet and I found most of it very tasty. Is it 5-star gourmet? No, it is buffet food. Di Marios (the Italian Rest.) was excellent. We waited approx. 20 min for a table. Shorter than Out Back! The snack shacks on the beach had burgers and hot dogs with fries and I found them to be just fine. My only comment would be on the warmth of some things.I did not have mixed drinks, tried to stay away from all the fruit juice type drinks as they will cause stomach problems when you drink them all day long for 7 days! The Cervasa- Presidente - is excellent. The bar service is superb. Julio is the bartender at the Piano Bar and he is a delight. German (pronounced Herman) and Ignacio at the American Grill Bar and Adres at the adult pool bar became INSTANT friends who I will never forget. Beach is very clean and spread out. We walked down the beach and found other resorts were packed in like sardines.The entertainment was great. The shows are very cute and plenty of fun is had by all. The Piano Player in the piano bar was a blast. I believe he is only there every other night so make it a point to stop by at least once. For the Gentleman...be sure to participate in Old McDonalds Farm!!!!!!A few pointers....bring plastic mugs with lids for your drinks. The cups are about the size of dixie cups and they will continually refill yours for you. Also bring soap....I had packed the shampoo etc...but never thought about soap. We were given ammenities at check in but a bar of soap (to go along with the body wash we were given) would have been nice. The bar is filled once a day with water, juice, soda and beer. Yes there are only two of each so if you want more bring it with you. Be warned also...if you forget something and need it it will cost you and arm and a leg. Everything is imported so the prices are double sometimes triple what you are used to paying.I could go on and on and on...but we will be back to Sunscape Punta Cana Grand.  
<Date>Jan 12, 2005

<Author>travel-a-lot
<Content>second-rate Actually, I blaim the Internet for the overblown expectations I had of this place: when I checked the reviews in December, it was rated #1 in Punta Cana, quite undeservedly so. Upon our arrival on New Year's day, my husband and I were surprised to find quite an average resort with shabby rooms. Among the disappointments, I can list a leaking bathtub, non-working AC (quickly fixed, but noisy afterwards), horrible food at the Garden-something cafe and the fact that the hotel's beach represents the worst stretch of the beatiful Bavaro Beach. While it is no problem to walk half a mile or more to better beaches (as we did every single day), it is also possible to find other resorts at better locations. Non-stop blaring music on the beach and by the pool was annoying, but we were lucky to stay in building 5, where it was not that bad. The distance from the pool did not stop drunk people from screaming in the middle of the night, however. An added pleasure was a $30 fee for late checkout, which was applied despite the fact that with the package we got, both arrival and departure were scheduled for around 9-10 p.m.In general, I totally agree with one of the more recent reviews: by European standards, we would only rate this hotel as three star, and very disappointing in comparison with previous trips - my sentiments exactly!

<Author>Zeldaralph
<Content>A perfect week! We are a family of 4 (kids are 11 and 7 years old) who have been to at least 6 all inclusive resorts before (in Mexico and Dominican Republic). We spent the week of Dec 19 - Dec 25 at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. This was by far the best all inclusive we have been to. No bracelets, no standing in a long line in the morning to book a table for one of the fancy restaurants. You were able to go back to all the restaurants more than once and get served instead of standing in a line at a buffet. Food was very good, great kids activites, an excellent manager - Hans from Holland- who was everywhere to make sure everything was handled properly. Great spa. Tennis lessons for $25/hour. 5 minutes from a golf course and only 25 minutes from airport. The resort was neither too small nor too large (If you forgot something in the room, you could easily go back to the room and get it and be back at the beach or the pool in 3 minutes). All staff very friendly. There organized plenty of beach and poolside activities, but (unlike many of the other all inclusive places) if you wanted to relax and read, you only had to tell them once. Nice size rooms and perfectly cleaned each day by the lovely maid. My only complaints would be the lack of light in public bathrooms and the hotel room. They need stronger lightbulbs. And my husband thought there was too much techno music played by the pool. Would we go back? Yes, in a heartbeat!  
<Date>Jan 9, 2005
