<Author>SherwoodSal
<Content>Not As Nice As We'd Hoped Looking at previous reviews of this hotel, it seems as though people either love it or hate it. We fall somewhere in between. Wee professional, Spanish-speaking Brits, aged 50, and are well-travelled in Latin America, especially Mexico and Chile. We visited Sunscape between 15 and 29 December, 2004. The hotel foyer was impressive and well-decorated for Christmas. The grounds are well maintained. The Entertainments Manager maintained a high profile and was visible several times a day doing his rounds. We agree with some previous comments about the rooms: ours was dark with a view only of a pathway and the next block. Everything certainly gets damp and remains that way (perhaps dehumidifiers should be installed?) and we thought it was a bit much to be asked to pay for use of the room safety-deposit box. We encountered the occasional mosquito and cockroach but the chambermaid kept the room very clean, especially the bathroom. The food is definitely poor: poor standard, poor choice and tasteless. Only the American style bacon is good. The dining room staff vary from unhelpful to surly, with just a couple of exceptions. We often had a long wait to get our first cup of coffee at breakfast and refills were very difficult to come by. It was very weak, American-style coffee, anyway. However, the hotel did pull out all the stops for the Christmas Day dinner on the beach, and Christmas Eve dinner and the themed Dominican nights weren too bad either. Congratulations go to whoever is responsible for the carved fruit and flower decorations in the dining room.We ate at the American Grill once and experienced a half hour wait for a table although there were plenty empty when we were shown in. It appeared to be understaffed. The food is second rate. The Italian restaurant serves better food, but my aperitif was snatched away before I finished it and our main course arrived before we had time to eat the starters which were then removed. I think they were trying to rush us. We didn go back. The Beach Garden Restaurant was a ghastly fried chicken and chips (French fries) type of place. Breakfasts were not available there during our stay, except for very early morning self-service coffee and rolls. Unfortunately there was no beach barbecue either, due to bad weather.There are absolutely no discernible boat fumes on the beach and the swimming area is cordoned off for safety. If anyone thinks boat fumes are a problem, they should either use the pool or walk half a mile or so along the beach where there are some lovely areas for swimming. There is sometimes a problem with seaweed, according to the weather conditions, but if it bad in one area you can often walk along the beach and find a clear spot, and it nothing like wee used to in the UK anyway. Activities were poor and badly organised, although the evening entertainment on the stage wasn bad for a hotel. It was also rather annoying to have to listen to two conflicting lots of loud music at the same time by the pool. The lyrics of some of the rap music were unsuitable for a family audience anyway. Drinks, especially the cocktails, were very weak and often inconsistent in the way they were made. The hotel should look at the timing of the (children) film that they show each evening. It seemed to us that there was more interest from adults than kids and the timing during dinner wasn convenient for anyone. The weekly programme doesn change either, so if youe there for more than a week, there nothing new and indeed, I see they were showing the same films back in May of last year. No wonder they break down from time to time! We went on two trips: Saona Island and Santo Domingo. The island trip was excellent and very good value. The capital city is not very interesting, but that is hardly anyone fault. On both trips, we had a very informative guide and guest safety was a strong priority. Two other points: Americans, please do not tip. It is not necessary, at least not until the end of your stay, if you really must. You will get far better service if you can manage to speak a bit of Spanish! And, to those North Americans who were having loud conversations in the corridor of Block 5 at 2.30 in the morning of December 18th, thank you for waking us up! You know who you were. By European standards, we would only rate this hotel as three star, and very disappointing in comparison with previous trips to Mexico and St Lucia.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very nice resort!! What a beautiful resort!! I've been to a few resorts and have never seen such a lush and beautifully manicured resort. Honestly, I spent most of my time by the pools, but the few times I went to the beach I found it very, very nice. I will break down the good and bad of the resort below.Food - This was hit and miss. The American Grill served great food and the waitstaff were a lot of fun. They even came to our table and did shots of tequila with us, great bunch of guys. Look for Santiago and Humberto, they love their tequila. The Beach Grill was also good for lunch with many American foods and Windows was also good for Breakfast. Other than that, the food wasn't up to the standards of US food, but the still did their best to offer a wide selection. Bars - The bars and their staff were fantastic!! The Pool bars are great with very friendly staff. Umbrellas, the Piano Bar, was a great time. Ya Man, the Piano player, is a lot of fun and the bartender is also very funny and a great guy.Front Desk Staff - This is one of my only complaints. They were very disorganized and not really showing much customer service. Accomodations - The rooms were average. Nothing to write home about but nothing that would stop me from going back.Entertainment - Great. The staff goes out of their way to make sure everyone has the opportunity to have a good time.Tours - We did the Jeep Tour offered by Prieto. This was enjoyable as I am a Jeep enthusiast and enjoyed driving in some rough terrain. It was humbling to see the way of life of most Dominicans, but the tour could have been done in a half day. The buffet served on a private beach for lunch was probably the best overall food of the trip. Connections - Our travel agent, Liberty Travel, booked us with Prieto for our connections to and from the airport. Neither went smoothly. Upon arrival, we had to sit in a van with 8 other people for a half hour waiting til they found one more person to fill the van. Not enjoyable. Our departure from the hotel to the airport was even worse. After a half hour of waiting for the van, we had to call a cab to take us to the airport. When we were about 15 minutes away from the resort, we saw the van coming down the road to pick us up. In essence, they never showed up and almost left us late for our flight. The Bellman said that Prieto does this all the time. I definitely recommend going with VIP or Apple, as most we talked to had no problems with either.Summary - The resort itself was beautiful. The service outside of the lobby was great. The waitstaff are incredible, tip them a few times and they will wait on you hand and foot. The food is average and the drinks are great as well. Overall, I would recommend it to anyone I would just do a few things differently, like using someone other than Prieto.  
<Date>Jan 5, 2005

<Author>Jessess
<Content>One of the best vacations ever! OVERALL: I'm not quite sure why anyone is complaining about this place, because we had an amazing time. I guess every vacation is what you make of it. Our group took full advantage of the activities the staff put on around the pool and beach...they had volleyball games, merengue and bachata lessons, water aerobics, yoga, olympic games for the kids, tennis, etc. If you're the type who likes to be active and have fun, this place offered plenty to do! But, it wasn't a party resort in the sense that you couldn't spend your time relaxing quitely. STAFF: Amazing. They are all such genuinely good people who want you to have a great vacation. Especially RIGOB, ANDRES, CHOCOLATE, IVONNE. These guys MADE our vacation! I have been on many vacations to the Carribean and Mexico, and this was one of my favorite places. From what I saw, the people here are not beggers. They are proud of what they have, but they are incredibly grateful to whatever they are offered. POOL: Yes, it was hard to get seats if you were lazy in the morning. But we always managed to get one from our group to reserve some by 8 or 9am. BEACH: From the reviews I've read, it seems like the water is always different. While we were there, it was beautiful! I don't know what gas people were talking about ?? Of course there was some seaweed in the water, but every morning the workers would rake up the weeds washed on shore. Also, you can walk for miles on the shore. We walked about 2 miles up and discovered a reef right up on the beach with a bunch of cool creatures and shells. FOOD: It was better than I expected for buffet. They definitely have a wide selection and all the restaurants are different. The Italian was my favorite...excellent presentation. The grouper was fabulous. They also have ice cream at the bar during the day and it's some of the best I've ever tasted. DRINKS: They will make ANY drink you want with whatever alcohol you request (if they have it). They had Stoli, Baileys, etc. If you're picky about beer though, they only have Presidente on tap and a couple of other bottles in the rooms. However, the Presidente is very good. Put a lime in it and it tastes just like a Corona. NIGHTLIFE: They put on shows/movies every night and will accomodate for rain. The best shows are the ones the staff puts on..they dress up and it's very funny. They also do a lot to involve the audience, so don't sit in front if you're shy! :)PRICES: Suntan lotion, medicine, candy are very expensive b/c of import taxes. But everything else is reasonable. There are shops on the beach to get souvenirs. Thank you to the staff for a wonderful time! I hope to return next year. If anyone has any further questions feel free to email me.  
<Date>Jan 4, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>MMM cookies I went with my family of four from the 23rd of December to the 30th. The weather was amazing...only with one day of rain that happened to be our last day there. As a twenty-one year old, I thought that going with my family was going to be pretty lame, but I met alot of MOSTLY cool people who were sort of my age. The beach was beautiful-white sand, and there is a cool natural pool you can get to if you walk a little ways. The nightlife could have been a little better, with not much to do but drink like a champ, and go to the discotec or piano bar. The drinks were strong enough that I had a great time every night, however. The food was alright..nothing to call home about, but the cookies they give you when you get there are worth the trip. Seriously, indulge all you can in those cookies. The staff were 9 out of 10 very friendly..did I mention that the cookies were AMAZING? Have fun!  
<Date>Jan 3, 2005

<Author>BarrettAvondale
<Content>Worst AI I've been to, try Mexico, its better!! You arrive after a two day delay and the lobby looks nice as does the pool area. Then the staff who check you in tell you that they haven't been advised of your delay and there's a problem. Although you've paid several thousand dollars, they were unfriendly and have a lack customer focus.You are given two damp rooms right by the beach on the ground floor. Only to find out these are the last rooms to go as the corridor floods when it rains!! The rooms are dark, cold, damp and miserable. Although this AI, there are parades of people trying to sell you photos, boat rides, zoo trips, etc etc. We had to pay the local agent to get a quick transfer from the Airport.I'll be constructive:Good things: Great beach and nice location. Pool area and gardens quite nice.Bad things:Room Towels were unavailable to late in the day most days?????? Maid service so slow. Food is absolutely terrible, we all got sick except by 5 year old. Stopped eating by 3rd day.Loads of exhaust fumes from boats. Our room was damp and had ants continually invading the sink area. No plug in the sink etc etc. Pillows smelt very bad without going into detail and the TV was the size of a portable.I've been to four AI's and this was the worst. Some of the staff are nice but others unhelpful/unfriendly.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>LOVED THE SUNSCAPE GRAND I will say that the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand was quite an experience. My husband and I went with 3 other couples and it was a riot! We are all in our late 20's-30's and had a wonerful time! When we got to the airport, we were a little confused as to where to go and what not, but found our way shortly after with a little help. They got us onto a bus which the driver was very funny and I was trying to speak spanish to him, and I had no clue! We got to the resort and they had a drink for us with cookies while we waited only a short while for our room. We got to the pool and unfortunatly i wanted a drink at the swim up bar right away and the bartender was away for a moment so I did the duty of hopping up onto the barstool and hopped back behind the bar to pour some drinks for the guests and myself, when he got back he was pleasantly surprised and told me you done here, you go now and I was on my way after making $7.00 in tips. The food was good, the drinks were good and the staff were all very friendly! I highly recommend it~ Have a good vacation~!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best Holiday I've Had My husband and I stayed a tthis hotel from 16th Dec - 23rd Dec. We went to Cuba in June and hated it and therefore very dubious about Dom Rep. Nothing could have prepared us for complete difference! The hotel was great with planty to do, plenty of choice on where and what to eat and drink. We also thought the entertainment was great, especially Dave Richards in the Piano Bar. The staff in Cuba were rude, surly and completely uninterested in offering a service even when tipped (and we stayed in a 5 star hotel). Whereas the Domincans were so freindly and couldn'y do enough for us even without the tips! The only complaint we had was the lumpy pillow and having to listen to alot of americans whining that 'it's not like this back home' You don;t say. Maybe thats because it's not home and you are in a very poor country yet we found everything outstanding. We didn't take our children but even so there were so many things for kids to do with their own play areas etc so we are in the process of booking up for same time next year.My advice is 1) Don't go to Cuba. 2) Ignore all the bad stuff the Americans have written. 3) Remember you have a sense of humour and lastly for good live entertainment go see Dave in the Piano Bar!!  
<Date>Dec 27, 2004

<Author>a2triptoo
<Content>Dec15-22 (2 adults in 30+, 3.5 year old toddler) Not sure where to start positives or negatives. Stayed in bldng#4 first floor facing pool, building between Italian and Beach Cafe. ROOMWe didn't have any problems with room or maid service or towels, on contrary, our relatives did. They had broken phone, air-conditioner was not working when they got there, not enough towels, water got into the room after afternoon storm and more...FOODWe prefer mexican style food rather than american style food and this resort was rather opposite. Avocado was not served a whole day long as we were used to in Riviera Maya. Salsa and chips were only available after 12.00 at Backstage bar. On another hand, sandwiches, burgers and french fries were available at Beach cafe and Backstage Bar lunctime thru about 4pm. Beach Cafe lunch service was nice if you wanted to sit down and get served. Also, all drinks including coffee and tea were served by waiters in buffet ('Windows') as well.No reservations required for dinner, no seating time or limit on how many nights. 3 choices - Seafood, Italian and American Grill. Seafood at Beach Cafe - NOT air-conditioned, open twice a week, horrible service, after almost 2 hours food came undercooked and barely warm. American-Tex Grill - air-conditioned, great food and service ( doors said closed Thursday but it was closed at least Friday as well). Italian - air-conditioned, great service, nice food and desert, closed Tuesday.Usually, Thursday is beach dinner party but during our stay we had storm on Thrusday so beach dinner party didn't happen.Buffet - less choices that one may expect but those provided were often of good quality. Morning - cottage cheese or such would have been appreciated. Also, 3 type of cheeses and 3 types of deli available repeated morning after morning. 3-4 types of cereals, yogurt selection. Fresh fruit/milk drinks could be mixed for you but fruit selection varied from 3-4 types available down to 1-2. No nuts or other toppings howerver. Fresh fruits were Okey so better other days. 4-5 Juices were too sweat and watery for my liking.Eggs and omelets could be cooked on grill for you as usual. Belgian waffles too dry. French toast and pancakes Ok.Lunch/Dinner - beef was rarely found. Pork or fish were usual grill selection. Few days only pork was offered. I think grilled beef and chicken was only offered once on Italian night, beef fajitas quickly run out another night, few nights before - grilled calamari were offered which was tasty variation. 2-3 types of Pasta could be cooked for you with 2-3 souces to choose from. Mash potatoes i think were only available once as well.Variety of grilled vegetable dishes were good. Usually, offered 1-3 during one seating. There were tempura style vegetables as well but I didn't try those as I don't like it. Few salads were unusual but good as well. Avocado was offered every 2-3 days only.DRINKS - bar service greatly varied. I would echo that splash bar (Juan Cruz) and backstage bar (Rafael) during the day by far had the best service and tastiest drinks made. Other places served me watery tomato juice and another time WARM tomato juice, in addition to making other drinks by what seemed to be inconsistent or incorrect recipies and no it was not compensated by smile or service.EXTRASResort is compact, you are close to everything. We like that. Resort has extras that we have not seen in other places. Amenities: donkey ride for children, once a week optional trip to Matinee park with kids club staff, dinner for kids at 6.30 with kids club staff, family movie at 7.30 before mini-disco at 9, camping night on tuesday that keeps children buzy until midnight, playground located on the beach and at children's club. Shaded area to play table games on the beach. Shuffle board, bocce and horse shoe play areas. Also, volleyball, soccer and badminton fields as well as area for baseball and basketball hoop. Fruits being cut for you on the beach, selection varied so. Few days fruit stand had Mango that was great, in addition to pineapple, watermelon and few others..POOLgreat size, area for aerobics and watersports (volley, basketball, waterpolo), pool was the same depth which i liked so i never had to worry while driving my son on yellow water matress provided by hotel. There were plenty of people just resting on those matresses in the pool and enjoying themselves.BEACHSomeone previously wrote about boat smell, i think it is true on many occasions. Resort is closest one to touristy fisherman place. Also, water next to resort was murky with a lot of seaweed on 4 out of 4 days. It cleared later in the week and we could see fish. I guess it depends on weather and wind conditions.If you walk about 15 minutes along resort shoreline to no-man territory, water is great - no seaweed and see-thru all days but beach is rather dirty there because territory doesn't belong to any resort.Last resort after which no-man land began was called Blau.We spend all our time on the beach so periodical smell from boats and murky water would be the biggest turn down for us.  
<Date>Dec 25, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not a nice place... The good: Freshly squeezed fruit juices in the morning. That's it for good...The rest of it: The beech is horrible. A lot of sea weed, dirty water, constant noise from motor boats and party boats. The smell of gasoline from the boats all day long. My daughter got stung by the sea lice on the second day and spent four days taking cortisone and steroid pills and shots and getting her wounds cleaned at the doctors office. I don't care about $240 in medical bills...the best part of vacation was getting out of there. She had spots that looked like 2nd degree burns and they mostly cleared only after 3 months. The resort management didn't want to take any responsibility because the beach is the Federal property and the resort is not responsible for anything that happens on the beach. Hmmm...according to their brochure they are displaying flags when there are jelly fish in the water. My wife and I also were stung by something in the water, but we had milder reaction, but it still looked like good burns for couple of weeks. The food is something else. It is hard to imagine how much effort they put into making the food inedible! The duck legs tastes like roadkill. The rabbit in sour cream tastes like...have no words to describe the taste....actually there is no taste. I'll eat about anything, but I can't understand where they get cooks who can make fresh fish taste like toilet paper. The only thing that they know how to cook is the bacon.The suggestion: If you enjoy spending your time in a pool with peeing kiddies and getting loaded - this is the place to be! If you enjoy dirty beach with who-knows-what floating in the water and love inhaling gasoline fumes - this is perfect place! If you enjoy resort management that doesn't give a hoot about your problems, unless you are represented by some agency that does a lot of repeat bookings for them - this place is tops, thought I doubt that other resorts are better! Make sure that you bring at least $200 in small bills for a 7 night stay - got to tip maid every day if you want your towels replaced. Don't forget to tip barmen for every drink, or you will become invisible very fast! And most important, stay away from fresh milk and tap water while in DR.Feel free to email me at pollitra@ix.netcom.com if you have any questions. I'll try to answert them as my time permits...I am a slow writer...it took me about 4 months to sit down and write this review.  
<Date>Dec 25, 2004

<Author>BK
<Content>Typical AI - Would go back if the price was right... Booked last minute deal to Sunscape Punta Cana Grand via Apple. Two from Chicago from 12/15-12/19/04 for $549.99 each. Stayed at several AI's in St. Luica (1), Riviera Maya (3), and this was our first time to DR. Flights - USA 3000 was alright. Condor Airlines impressed me. German based crew was very good and professional.Resort - Starting to show its age. Cracked stucco everywhere which may have been from the hurricane but am not sure. Little things here and there were either very worn or broken.Food - Typical AI food! Italian was good and the Tex-Mex was good but buffet is very typical with a smaller selection then other AIs. Presidente Beer on tap. Banana Mamas were excellent bar drinks. No cappiccinos, only espresso.Beach - Beautiful sand beach. Never had a problem finding a shaded chair. Staff did an excellent job of picking up the seaweed which washed ashore. No big deal! However, what did bother me was that there seemed to be a lot of trash in the water. Don't know if this is from the hurricane or from the locals, but it is a shame to see. Also, the pictures and staff will tell you that you can snorkel from the beach, but that is incorrect. There is nothing to see except sand and seaweed, only saw one fish. The boat that will take you to a reef off shore about 3/4 mile is US$17/pp and the reef is nice but is showing some signs of usage...Scuba - Both my wife and I are certified with about 30 - 40 dives. Shop was okay and the staff was fairly friendly, but the DiveMaster was very new. Stopped the dive at one point to surface to see where he was. Just not impressed at all... which is a major bummer since I usually do a dive a day. Only did two dives as a result. Pool - Nice pools, larger pool is kind of busy with all the kids. Adult pool is very quite.Guests - Lots of Europeans (some nice-some rude) but they are topless on the beach and adult pool. Rooms - Typical AI rooms. Stocked mini bar. We stayed in 5314 which is very quite and great view of the ocean. I tipped $10 to the clerk when checking in and I like to think that it helped. Only disappointment was that we tipped our maid $5 per day and never received any towel art! : (Bummer, but I am sure the maid appreciated the extra $$ especially this time of year.Staff - I was kind of disappointed. Perhaps it is just this hotel, but the staff seemed kinda rude or they had an attitude or maybe just a cultural thing, but both my wife and I thought that the Dominican's were not as friendly or nice as those in Riviera Maya. Not everyone spoke English, but we were able to get by with most of the staff.Overall, you make what you want of the vacation. I probably would not go back to this Sunscape but would give the DR another chance at another resort.  
<Date>Dec 21, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Poor Service Beautiful Resort, but horrible service. This is not the place for good communication. About 80% of the people do not understand you here and you can't understand them. When you ask them a question they will look at you with confusion, put up a finger (as in wait one minute), and not return... There was a moment that we were hungry after hours, I ordered a tuna fish sandwich and was told okay it will be 20 minutes, it went way over 20 minutes so I called again, they said it was on it's way up-another 20-30 minutes past, I called again  then they told me they don't have Tuna fish sandwiches-So I had to order another meal and wait another 20 minutes...This place is also bad as getting you things, it's always wait five minutes, and you will wait anywhere between 30minutes to 1 hour and thats only if the remember you.... The food was okay, but I've had better. Not much of a selection at the buffet, mostly the same food night after night..... The activities were fun! The shows were great!!! But I wouldn't come back to this resort ever!!!! I think I'd try the Iberostar or the Catalina....

<Author>lvsraber
<Content>Great Resort !! Great Time !! Just returned from the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand Monday 12/13/04.Traveled with two other couples. The resort was fantastic ! Stayed at the Catalonia Bavaro last year and there is no comparison to the Sunscape.The food was great, had no problems. The Shimp at the beach cafe and the Italian was the best. There was not one bad meal all the time we were there. The buffet had plenty to chose from. The staff was the best I have meet at any all inclusive we have stayed at, right up there with the Iberostar resorts we have stayed at in Mexico. The grounds were very well kept and clean. It is not a hugh resort, seemed to be just the right size, if you have to go back to your room for something not a long walk from the public areas. Room could use alittle upgrading, but very clean, air worked well. Nice beach, even had bar service while at the beach, a nice touch. Nice pool with swim up bar. Can't find anything bad to say at all about the resort. Talked to people from the Alegro (sp) the resort next to the Sunscape and the food was so bad people were checking out, some trying to come over and eat at the Sunscape. Will be returning to the Sunscape next Dec.. A great resort.You won't be disappointed.  
<Date>Dec 15, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sun  Our stay at Sunscape was in the begining of December. We traveled with a total of 22 people. The weather was wonderful and we had only a couple minor showers. The hotel staff was the best! They always went out of their way to make sure you were happy. We had a large, loud and crazy group and the staff made sure we had fun and allowed us to party like we wanted to. The hotel rooms could have been better. They did need some updating, but we were never in them! The resort was very clean and it was amazing to see how hard everyone worked there.We went snorkling right off the resort and saw some wonderful fish and coral. They allowed you to feed the fish, so remember to take bread with you. The food was good and most in our group liked it. I found the food much better here than in Mexico. It's not what we're used to in the US but you have to remember where you are.We felt very safe in the resort. The security was everywhere! We walked the beaches out of the resort during the day, but did not go out of the resort at night.Overall, we had a wonderful time and would go back again to the Sunscape.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice but.... We visited over Thanksgiving 2004.Nice place in general....Good service....Nice grounds (they seemed recovered from the hurricanes). Food was pretty good and so were the drinks.We went all inclusive so it was nice. Ocean was nice...lots of seaweed off the beach, but no biggie.Snorkeling was by boat from the hotel....$17 per person for an hour.Rooms were nice and pretty well kept.Negatives are the noise and the water area.I prefer to sleep about 11-12 PM. But they had a show every night til 1 -2 AM that was loud with lots of bass pounding music.In the AM, workers would wheel these loaded carts for work that sounded like they were coming into your room! lol But they were loud enough to wake me up every time.Water area is roped off to prevent all the boats that roar past from cutting you up.All in all, not a bad place.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved the Dominican My husband and I returned from the Dominican 23/11/04. It was our first vist to the Dominican and it was fantastic. We were there for three weeks, and had quite a lot of rain, but we do intend to re-visit, more towards end November beginning of December. The staff were amazing, friendly, helpful, happy and entertaining. Food was great, with plenty of choice. Gym and activities were just as described in brochure. Rooms were very comfortable. We went on 2 trips: Monster truck, which was great, bit sad at times when visiting poor villages, but would recommend it, and Saona Island, which was disappointing as the beach was no nicer than Punta Cana and the sea was full of rocks, so very difficult to get in. We met some wonderful people. The only complaint would be that if it does rain, there is nothing to do. All the daytime bars are openair, a few extra indoor bars would be nice. or perhaps shutters around pool bar for bad weather.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Grand time at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand! My wife and I just returned from this beautiful resort on 12/1/04. We absolutely loved it. The beach, both pools, the staff, the room, and all of the activities were first class. The only problem we had involved the Tex-Mex restaurant at the American Grill Restaurant. This restaurant had been closed for remodeling, and re-opened a few days ago. Perhaps this explains one of the worst restaurant experiences we ever endured. We were told to expect a 30-40 minute wait, which turned into 1.5 hours. When we finally got up to the restaurant, we were shocked to see so many empty tables. So why the wait? The food took a very long time to arrive, and they forgot my baked potato, which really didn't matter by then. Other than that, we loved the resort and would come back again some time. Hats off to Juan Cruz at the Splash Bar, and Juan at the Adult Pool bar for their excellent service and hospitality. The grilled schrimp at the Italian Restaurant was excuisite!! -Dave  Jean

<Author>cormo13
<Content>looked great before the hurricane hit having been to the dominican before and reading the reviews of the sunscape complex, i was really looking foward to this vacation. i'd booked two weeks from the 15th of september. but as we left england we were told their was a tropical storm/hurricane jeanne heading in that direction, the holiday reps reassured my party that it would be fine and they'd keep us informed if there was any chance danger. to cut a long story short my party (including my six month old son)arrived at the hotel eight hours before the hurricane hit. lets just say the next couple of days were close to hell. the only good thing was that the staff went out of there way to help my party especial my son. on the saturday when the complex was finally getting back on it feet, and we could look forward to our last week or so there. we were evacuated and sent home for our own safety. to make matters worse when we got home we were then told we'd only be getting 25% back of what we paid for this trip. i've nothing against sunscape and i am actually thinking of return there early next year when the weather a bit better (haha) but check the small print with the holiday company please.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good food, Great drinks and pretty grounds My boyfriend, Ken, and I just returned from a week at Sunscape Grand and overall we had a great time. The employees work very hard to keep everyone happy and the grounds are very nice and well maintained. Overall the food was good. We always found something to eat and I overdosed on the salsa during the day at the pool bar. Some people did get sick, but that happens to a lot of people in all THIRD WORLD COUNTRIES. Take precautions, drink a lot of water, get out of the sun sometimes and choose the chicken over the beef. It is hard to tell what does it to people because we all ate different things at different times and people's bodies reacted differently. The cheese is fine, I don't understand those complaints. Remember things are processed differently because you are in a DIFFERENT COUNTRY. The drinks are free flowing and they make them very strong. (Rum and Coke with a side of Coke please). The Presidente beer was just as good as any light beer that you have here. I think I liked it better! The only complaint I have is the beach. I thought from reading other reviews that the seaweed was an exaggeration and being from CT we are used to it. There was a lot of seaweed! The staff cleaned it up the best they could. Other islands have crystal clear water and no seaweed. But we don't layout at the beach anyway! From speaking to people I learned that the seaweed is because Punta Cana is located where the Atlantic meets the Caribbean creating stirred up water. Other travelers recommened to try the La Romana area which is on the Caribbean side of the island. My boyfriend, who has not traveled to the Caribbean before, was not bothered by it at all. I think most of the hotels in Punta Cana have similar water. Lastly, a big hello to Ed and Robin, Maddy and Jack and Kathy and Brian! Hope you are all doing well!  
<Date>Nov 24, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent Vacation We just got back from a nine-day stay at Sunscape. We left on November 10th from Bradley Airport in Windsor Locks, CT at 6:00 am, and arrived in Punta Cana about 4:00 pm, with a three-hour layover in Miami in between. As we entered the airport, our pictures were taken. We proceeded to another desk where we paid $10.00 per person for our declaration green cards, which are needed to exit the country. They gave us four cards, and although the sign says to fill out all four, we didn have to. We went to another desk where the officers took the four cards and our passports, took two of the cards, and returned the other two with our passports. Before we left the hotel the last day, we completed the other two cards. After picking up our luggage, we found the Prieto tour desk to get our transfer to the hotel. The ride was about 20 minutes, and we arrived about 5:30 pm. We were the only ones on the bus and checking in, therefore, check-in was quick but we did not get our welcome drinks or cookies. We figured because of the hour we checked in, we weren going to get them anyway. It was no big deal to us, as we just wanted to get to our room and change for the manager cocktail party, which started at 6:30 pm. The party is on Wednesday, and you are given champagne and appetizers. There is also some sort of entertainment.RoomOur room was located in building four on the second floor. Everything was in working order. The room was large, had a four poster king bed, dresser, two night stands, a television in a cabinet, which also had a refrigerator with soda, water, juice, and beer. There was also a coffee maker, and a large bathroom with the sink outside the bathroom door. The mattress seemed a little hard, but we had no trouble sleeping at all. It appeared that all the floors were available in our building, but we could see that building five had some floors shut down as they were putting everything back together from the hurricane. However, by the time we left, most of the floors were available.HousekeepingAll in all, the housekeepers were good. We did have a couple days where we needed to ask for towels. The room was always clean though. We do have to say, it may not be cleaned first thing in the morning. There were a couple days when we went back to the room after lunch and it still wasn done, but we didn stress over it. In the evening, while we were at dinner, they came back into the room and gave us fresh towels and turned the bed down. We always tried to leave the housekeepers a little something, whether it was chocolate, money, or pads and pens to write, to let them know we appreciated the work they did. We didn get special treatment, or weren expecting it; we just knew they appreciated the gesture.FoodWe thought the food was good, and plenty of it. For breakfast, the Beach Garden Restaurant did not have the continental or ala Carte breakfast as other reviews mentioned. Windows Restaurant was the only place for breakfast, and it was buffet style. There were eggs made to order, cereal, pancakes, waffles, French toast, fresh fruit, yogurt, and various hot dishes to choose from. There were lots of homemade bread, rolls, muffins, and pastries as well as several different juices to choose from. For lunch, we mostly ate at the Beach Garden Restaurant, which we ordered off the menu. There were salads, pizza, and sandwiches for the most part. The sandwiches came with fries, so there was more than enough to eat. The pizzas were also a good size for one person. We also ate at Windows a couple of times for lunch. That was buffet style with plenty to choose from. Hamburgers and hot dogs, which were made for you, pastas, a grill that they cooked the special of the day on, and also various hot dishes to choose from. There was a salad bar and soup, plenty of breads again, as well as a dessert table. For dinner, there were always three restaurants open. Windows was buffet style, and we only ate there twice. One night they had lobster tails, which are much different than what we are used to, and the other night was Italian night. Plenty of food, but we only thought it was so-so. We felt the lunch buffet was much better. The Beach Garden was open on the nights that the American Grill and the Italian restaurant were closed. We only ate there once for dinner. It had several items to choose from off the menu, and although the portions weren huge, it was plenty if you ordered an appetizer and dessert. We went to the American Grill two times, and the items on the menu included steak, ribs, and fajitas. As other reviews mentioned, the fajitas are great. We also tried the steak and ribs the other night we went. Again, not huge portions, but plenty for us as they started you off with tortillas and salsa, plus we ordered an appetizer and dessert. We ate at the Italian restaurant three times, and we were very pleased with that. The garlic shrimp and angel hair pasta is great as well as the veal medallions. The Caesar salad and buffalo mozzarella on tomatoes were great appetizers, and the tiramisu and canolli were great dessert selections. The canolli is more like a cream horn, and very light and tasty. We also tried the tortellini and seafood soup for appetizers, and the stuffed chicken breast for dinner. Those were good choices as well. The beach party, which is usually on Thursday, was cancelled due to the weather, but all the other restaurants were open that night. At the pool bar, there were snacks from 12-6 each day. There were tortilla chips and salsa, finger sandwiches, pizza, and popcorn. We usually headed over there about 4:00 for an afternoon snack. They also put out coffee, tea, and cookies about 4:00 on the upper deck of the pool bar as well. We did not get sick on the food at all, but because of the change in our diets we did spend a little time on the toilet. We look at it as less weight we gained, so not really a bad thing. The service in the restaurants and bars was great. We didn feel that anybody was looking for tips, and we didn tip all the time, but the times we did we could tell it was appreciated. WeatherThe weather was not the greatest. It rained for a total of two days. Our first full day was a wash out, but we brought travel scrabble to pass the time. It rained a half day two other days as well. Sometimes you need a break from the sun, so the rain didn bother us much. It was very windy while we were there, and we didn think it was all that hot. The sun was in and out of the clouds, so maybe that had something to do with it. We did get our share of the sun, and did come back with a little tan, despite the clouds.PoolsThe main pool is large, and it also where the kids are, so it can get very noisy. There are plenty of chairs, and we did not see where people held on to rafts either. Sure, some people got up early to hold their specific chair, but it wasn necessary. Our travel agent told us, before we left, that the adult pool was going to be closed for repairs. After a few days of being there, we went and checked, and it was open. It is much smaller, more shade, and not too many chairs. You really need to get there by 9:00 if you want a chair. The hot tub is also there, but it was not hot. The water was just a bit warmer in the hot tub than the pools, and the pools were chilly.ActivitiesThere are plenty of activities you can get involved in if you want. They did not push you to do anything. We went to relax, and that is what we did. In the evening, there is a movie at 6:30, which we did not attend, and a show at 9:30, weather permitting. The show lasted about an hour, and we thought they were pretty good, even funny at times. After the show, the disco and piano bar open. We walked into the disco twice, for about a minute each, and left. There wasn much going on at 10:30, but maybe later it got busy. We never made it into the piano bar.As for bugs, we did not get bit at all. We didn have to use any of the bug spray or lotion we brought, but it good to have in the event there is a problem. One night we saw them spraying for bugs though. The marina is next door, and as other people mentioned smelling the fumes, we did not. Maybe it was the time we were there, and maybe the wind helped keep the smell away. There was also a lot of work being done on the grounds, between building a new deck around the Beach Garden Restaurant, and painting in the lobby and around the pool. This did not bother us at all as we thought it was great that they were keeping the property clean and updated, however I am sure some people were disturbed by it.All in all, an excellent vacation, and we wouldn hesitate to go back again. Go, have a good time, and remember it is not the United States or any other country that you are from.  
<Date>Nov 24, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>vacation from hell Before going on our trip to punta cana we were watching the weather because of all the hurricanes. we called our apple representative to confirm our trip, hours before leaving for punta cana. We told him there is a hurricane going to hit the the night get there, and he said if you dont get on the plane you dont get a refund. So we got on the plane Sept 15. and arrived in punta cana around 12:00pm we had four hours of sun until it started raining and in the middle of the night hurricane jeane was hitting punta cana. our hotel was in better condition then others but it was not a vacation. it rained the whole time we were there. then they cut the trip short because they wanted everyone out. i think apple vacations owe me some kind of refund for risking my life in the hurricane, cutting my vacation shorter, not getting to use the facility at the resort because only one restuarant was open when there should have been four open, i couldnt work out at all because the gym was closed. we had to stay in our room pretty much of the time. and the rooms were flooded with water and there wasnt any air condition our room started to smell. no maid service had to go days with out clean towels. the only nice thing to say was it was beautiful the first four hours. and the staff was great the entire time. but this was truly a vacation from hell...  
<Date>Nov 20, 2004

<Author>anaconda
<Content>Best vacation ever, BUT NEED SOME HELP Hi everybody, me and my friends just got back from Hotel Sunscape and we had a blast. The hotel was amazing and staff was very nice.Food was good, nobody got sick. I agree about the Tex Mex restaurant ... you must try the chicken faghitas. It is delicious!There were great shows in the evening. We even participated in one and that was fun. The animation team was great. Always lots of stuff to do. We really liked those guys. Especially Rigob. He was the max. We told him we would stay in touch and we got his phonenumber. But the problem is: at the airport they stole our bag, so we lost everything. Question to all the people reading this review and who are going to sunscape: can you please give him the message that the Belgians lost his phone number and cannot call him. <Author>Kimgw
<Content>Survived Hurricane Jeane at Sunscape... My husband and I (along with another couple) stayed a week at Sunscape back in September. Our wonderful vacation was cut short mid-week when Hurricane Jeane decided to pay us a visit. Prior to the hurricane destruction, we found the resort to be beautiful. The pools were clean, the staff was friendly, and we had a great time. We really enjoyed the Tex-Mex American Grill....the margaritas were the best! The Italian restaurant was also very good. The swim-up bar was a lot of fun and the disco is a must. The night of Jeane's arrival we were told to prepare for a tropical storm. Being from Indiana, we had no idea what to expect! The winds reportedly reached 80 miles an hour and it was a little frightening in our top floor room! After everthing was over...it rained for days and days and days. We kept busy by playing cards and Scrabble. The resort staff continued to be very professional and they provided all of the guests with plenty of food and bottled water. We were impressed with Sunscape before the hurricane and after. We would definitely stay at this great resort on a future trip to the Dominican Republic. However, we plan to avoid travel during hurricane season!  
<Date>Nov 3, 2004
<Rating>4	5	4	-1	5	-1	4	-1

<Author>SweetSM
<Content>Very Relaxing! We just got back from Sunscape Punta Cana Grand on October 30th. We had a great time and great weather. Don't believe the weather forecasts. It was supposed to rain and thunderstorm everyday we were there. It did not even rain once. Everything was great at the resort mostlyFood - Awesome! I am a pretty picky eater, but I found so much stuff. You have to try the Chicken Fajitas at the American Grill a la carte. Yummy! The buffet was great too. Everything and anything you can think of.Entertainment - Always lots of good shows each night. Movies for kids(Nemo, Shrek, Pirates of the Carribean..etc) The shows are hilarious, always good for a laugh.Staff - Very friendly, awesome bartenders(Chocolate is awesome, he is cute too!) Bring them something from home, they really appreciate it.Activities - Tons of stuff to do to keep you busy. Water games, aerobics, shuffleborad, bocci ball, volleyball, soccer, baseball, snorkelling, boating, paddleboats, and the list goes on forever. Pool - Pretty good size, very clean and nice swim-up bar. Beach - Beautiful, although a little bit of seaweed and stuff because of the hurricane, it keeps washing up even if they clean it up all the time. Very fun trampoline in the ocean.COMPLAINTS:All the brochures say that horseback riding is included. It's not, they try and charge you $20 per person. Keep an eye on the people working at the front desk. When you need to make a phone call with a calling card, don't let them read the number off of it. They copied mine down, and called the USA and used up all my minutes.The bridge over the pool was under construction our whole trip. We had to walk all the way around.Other then these complaints we had a great trip and wonderful relaxing vacation!!  
<Date>Nov 2, 2004

<Author>johnny70
<Content>Relaxed and Entertained -Oct 16-23 It's very tough to follow a finely detailed review like that but here goes:The grounds were kept incredibly well. There was very minimal damage but no real signs in comparison to other resorts nearby.Try to find a dead blade of grass at this place. The plants and flowers are changed and cultivated regularly.The rooms were clean and the air-conditioning was running nice and cool. For those who care about TV's, you have your free DishNet stuff at your disposal for your movie and ESPN needs.room service - 24/7. Drinks - 24/7.Being the off season for resorts, this place was really quiet. Nice and quiet. It seemed like there were maybe 100 people at the resort tops.The restaurants were fantastic. DiMarios has nice elegance with great Italian food. I loved the bread, and the angel hair pasta.Don't be stingy on the wine, just because who have to buy them, doesn't make it a bad thing. There are some nice bottles on that list. Always loved the Ruffino.Tex Mex made me laugh. It's not my type of thing visiting an hispanic country and watching them act American but it did put a smile on my face.Make sure you tip them nicely for the tequila that's mandatory post meal. They really are nice people.My personal favourite, the Beach Cafe, nice in the day, very pimp at night. The seafood piella for 2 was amazing and don't shy away from the strawberry cheesecake.Windows food was nice as well, a decent selection and it's a buffet for those who like to eat that way. It doesn't have as much elegance as some of the others.The swim up bar was flowing. Thanks to Juan Cruz for keeping me topped up, or perhaps, tanked up.Chocolate and Rafael, thanks for the Bloody Caesars. You made them just the way I liked them.The disco was great for blowing off some steam. For those that like to shoot loose, order 100 tequila shots and hand them out to everybody.The piano bar has a nice, flavour to it, just to talk and mellow out.If you compare this to the Catolonia, which is pretty much why everyone reads this stuff, to compare to other resorts, the staff at Sunscape were more friendly, it's smaller, more intimate and the grounds are better well kept. It's only a 5 dollar cab to Catalonia so if you want to golf it's right there. Hope this helps anyone in need of an honest review.Special thanks to our American friends, Gary and Anne, that we met on our 3rd day. You are a nice couple and it was more than a pleasure meeting up with you and having dinner.Cheers  
<Date>Oct 26, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>It was terrible (to leave!) We truly enjoyed our stay at Sunscape Punta Cana Grande (Oct 18-21). Here's a lengthy run-down on our short stay.The staff-They make you feel so welcome. Now I understand why and how people who post remember the staff members names. Our favorites were Osvaldo and Pena (accent over the n) at the Windows buffet in the am, Adan and Milton at the check-in, Carlos at the Beach Garden (lunch). I'm sure that I'm forgetting a few. Martina and the guys at the towel handout palapa were great, too. Once they found out that we were Red Sox fans, we were always greeted with Ganamos! (we won!). It was amazing to see how into baseball they are and supportive of the Sox due to the Dominican players on the team.The food-You can't go wrong at Windows. I'm a choosy eater, but always found something to satisfy me. Local items that I loved were fried green plantains, yuca, chinola (a tart local fruit), and of course, the chicarrones (small fried pieces of chicken the night we went to the Dominican buffet). I certainly gained weight on the desserts, and again, I'm picky on that note, too. Da Mario was nice- though the dishes were just OK in my opinion. We're too spoiled by restaurants in Boston's North End. so. . . But the Italian cured ham (proscuitto) and melon was right on. I loved the tiramisu- they presented it with 4 thick slices of chocolate on the sides, which made it look like it came in a box. The flavor was pretty authentic. Cannolis aren't what I'm used to, I'd call these cream horns. They are filled with mousse and taste great.The Beach Garden is a great, casual place right off the beach. The burgers were savory, the cheesesteak sandwich literally is steak, cheese, onions, on a sub roll, sliced in 4. Don't expect a Philly Cheesesteak. I enjoyed the presentation. They have icecream cones at lunch, too. The Tex-Mex restaurant was a hoot- the decorations and the music were what you'd expect of that theme. I'm not a Tex-Mex fan so I'll spare you my opinion there.The rooms-Request a 3rd floor room and you'll enjoy a high ceiling. We got placed in Bldg. 3, though I wanted 4 or 5. 4  5 were only occupied on the first floor so in the end my choice wasn't an option. 1,2,  3 are close to the main pool and are noisier. Merengue is non-stop, so you'll have to love it. When we left, they were repairing bdlg. 4 5.The rooms were spacious with bright yellow flowered bedcovers. The safe deposit box is in room. They also give you a welcome pack of shampoo, body gel, lotion so you can skip packing those. The shower pressure was fine, as was temperature. They have Sunbeam shower heads and clock/radios in the room. No problems with getting hand towels though we brought extras. The bed was fine- we like slightly firmer mattresses. The sheets were OK too, though I brought one just in case. Some of these precautions I took based on previous complaints.You can also request an upgrade- we did at check-in, but nothing was available. They do have a VIP type package- no comments since we didn't use it. We did later at Secrets (we were offered an upgrade to Secrets later).The grounds-Clean, well-kept. They really care for the place. We got a kick out of the ducks near bldg 1  3.The beach-We didn't spend any time at the pool. The beach was fine. Yes, there is seaweed, but we weren't turned off by it. The staff was there at 7 am raking the little piles and they worked through the day until 4 or 5 pm. Hard workers!!! The marina wasn't unsightly to us, nor were the little shacks on either side of the beach. But if you want a rolling surf, no seaweed, no boats in your view (there were very few during our stay), go elsewhere (and save Sunscape for the rest of us!).Also, we didn't see people saving spaces at 4 am in the morning- possibly because it was low-season or most people favored the pool. We'd be out there all day and there would still be places to choose from. We also liked the lounge chairs better at Sunscape- Secrets had faded yellow pads which retained wetness and smell. Suncape has blue stretchy fabric over the chairs, which work out better.Tennis courts-They are well-maintained clay courts (better maintained than Secrets' courts) and the hurricane didn't destroy the lights, so you could play until 8 pm.Water sports-We took out a kayak and the next day the catamaran. You may not get any instruction, depending on who is there. We were find with the kayak, but had no experience with the catamaran prior to that. They will make you sign a waiver or purchase insurance ($3/ day or $10 for the week).whew! That's the long of it. We expected very little based on the complaints, but we nevertheless enjoyed the food. We'd stay there again as it was an excellent value. Go if you aren't going to hold them to an unfair standard, and you'll enjoy it. I actually missed the friendly staff after we moved to Secrets!!! Sunscape, we'll be back!Finally, we liked how we were never pestered by vendors. Sure, they tried, but for the most part if we said no, they let it be. The Dominicans are great people and I respect them for their level of service.  
<Date>Oct 25, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best vacation so far !!! We went Oct.16 - 23/04. The rooms were huge with 2 queen beds or a king bed. The food and service was superb. No reservations are required, just go and eat!! The only thing i didn't like was their cheeze. Dominican cheeze is different. The resort was very beautiful and well kept. They also had lots of good entertainment daily, including live shows at night and big sreen movies. A good place for kids as well. I've never seen people work so hard to please and always smiling and very friendly. We had no problem leaving a few bucks tip at restaurants, even though we didn't have to. We met alot of nice people there and they were also quite impressed. I couldn't find too many things wrong with this place. Overall, it was excellent. Heads up to Brad  Liz for inviting us on our 15th. Gracias!!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Oct. 14 to 19th My wife and I just returned from the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand last night after being there for 5 nights. The place is incredible! First of all, we were a little worried about hurricane damage prior to leavingf you are worrying about that as well, stop worrying, I would have never known a hurricane had gone through by looking at the resort. The Natura Park located adjacent to the resort was undergoing some serious repairs and was closed, but the Sunscape is perfect.FoodI thought the food was great, my wife and I had no trouble finding great stuff to eat. Windows buffet was our favorite for breakfast and lunch. We tried the beachfront caf for lunch and it was good, but the Windows selection was so incredible it was hard to justify going anywhere else. I zoned in on the fajita station for lunch and the made to order omelets for breakfastut we literally could have lived in Windows and been happyntil we found Dimario and the American grill. Dimario's was fantastic, really good food (Shrimp Pastammm), excellent atmosphere (it was our 10 year anniversary, so atmosphere was somewhat important), and pretty incredible service. (Service was phenomenal throughout the resort though, so you almost got used to it. I have never been treated so well by so many nice people, and have never experienced service that could even hold a candle to what I experienced at the Sunscape.) The American Grill was my wife favorite. They had some black bean soup that was fantastic, and the steaks we had were good. The only thing I will say slightly negative about the food is that the cheese we had, in all of the restaurants, was not like the cheese we have in the US, it was more like different flavors of velveta. After the first day I just kind of avoided heavily cheesy dishes, but I think most people would probably have no problem with it am a little picky about dairy products. Best guacamole, next to my wife, in the world, hands down.DrinksAnything you want to drinkeriously anythingnytime (unless you like beer, then you are kind of stuck with the Presidente, which everyone says is great, I never tried it, too busy drinking all the stuff I always wanted to try). We did see several people hauling cases of Presidente home on the planeou have to really like a beer to take it home with you on a plane.Beach/PoolsThe beach was beautiful, the water was warm, and the breeze was great. The water was a little deeper and a little darker blue than I was anticipating. The only other Caribbean destination I have been to is Aruba, so compared to Aruba, it is deeper and darker colored, but still incredibly beautiful. We kayaked and snorkeled. We took one snorkeling trip to the reef, well worth it, tons of fish.We spent most of our time at the pool, which was great. Lots of room and very clean. The pool was beautiful at night as well. We swam in the adult pool a couple of nights and had it all to ourselves. The only thing lame about this resort is some of the selfish people who visit here. The practice of laiming?a chair by putting your towel on it, then disappearing for the rest of the day is just rude, and it is unfortunate that others feel pressured to do it because they think they won have a spot. We resisted the selfish urge and still always had a spot to rest. Some people even laimed?the floating mattresses by folding them up and putting them on a chairIDICULOUS?never ceases to amaze me how lame and selfish some people can benough of that though. We still never waited much more than 20 minutes for a mattress when we wanted one. Pools and beach were great.MISCThe entertainment was fun, we went to the show every night, and enjoyed it. The piano bar was fun, and there is a great saxophone player who works theree never made a mistake, loved listening to him. The disco isn our thing, but looked fun enough. There is so much space to spread out and find your own quiet spot. I was a little concerned it wouldn be romantic, but it was, and still the people with kids appeared to be having a lot of fun. We talked about wanting to bring our kids there sometime. We made some friends from Philadelphia who said they would want to bring their kids there as well (hey Dave and Sandy!) Overall it was great. I would definitely go back to Punta Cana, and would definitely want to stay at the Sunscape.  
<Date>Oct 20, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A Nice Place to relax....... My husband and I just returned from the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand yesterday, October 16, 2004. We have travelled to different parts of the Caribbean, and the Sunscape was smaller than some of the hotels we have stayed at but this can be a plus...no huge line-ups at the restaurant, quiet spots on the beach,etc. The grounds were clean and well-groomed, our room was average, clean and a nice view.We chose to eat at The Windows Restaurant which is a buffet so I can only comment on it. The staff were very friendly and the service was excellent keeping on top of clearing away our used dishes, refilling our glasses, etc. I found there was a variety of food and never had a problem filling a plate or two. The desserts were amazing and I wish there had been a problem filling a plate!!!!The beach was average and could use a few more huts for shade, but clean and safe. Paddleboats, kayaks, catamarans, etc. were all available, however we did have a problem getting someone to show us the basics of using a catamaran. An hour lesson was offered for $25.00 US, but no one wanted to show us....not enough wind (people were out there using them!!!). After the third day, we finally ended up taking our chances and went out on our own had a great time and saved ourselves $25.00!!!! All in all, it was a nice vacation and I would not have a problem recommending Sunscape Punta Cana Grand to anyone.  
<Date>Oct 18, 2004

<Author>abfab1963
<Content>Relaxed!! We visited the Punta Cana Grand back in July this year and whilst most of these reviews are of relative quality, we are very disappointed to read of peoples problems with this hotel. Having travelled extensively around the Carribean, Africa and Europe, I think we qualify as well seasoned travellers! This hotel was mainly set up for Americans and we met a lot of lovely American people there during our 2 week stay. Unfortunately there were a few Americans who appeared to be unhappy unless they complained.......every other country is NOT the same as America!! Being there as a couple meant we had the choice of joining in with the Family pool entertainment or having a thoroughly relaxing time around the adult pool, were we found the staff (especially Domingo) very polite and accomodating and we especially loved the bar service around the pool, which you will not get in many places. At night, the entertainment was based on trying to satisfy a wide variety of people, children and adults alike, we enjoyed everything we did or watched, as you have a choice about what to do.....because its your holiday and you choose what you want to do!!! The entertainments staff were fantastic, (Especially Fredrico and Juan Carlos, not forgetting Mimi!!!) they all work very hard and always had a smile and a laugh with us, even when we made it to the disco and made fools of ourselves!! We did both suffer from stomach problems but......not to an extent were we had to remain in our rooms and then again, this is only to be expected when travelling so far from the UK! The choice of food was absolutely fine, although I would say it got a bit boring at the end of 2 weeks. We loved our room, which was very clean and a well stocked bar, made a bit of difference. From talking to others it appears that block 5 is the best....if you dont have children as its the quietest!! All in all, we had a wonderful, relaxing time and we laughed a lot..is that not what holidays are all about? I can therefore fully recommend this hotel for a wonderfully relaxing holiday where you actually have a choice for how you spend your time with the staff at Punta Cana Grand.  
<Date>Oct 13, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Honeymoon at Sunscape My husband and I went to Sunscape for our honeymoon on Sept. 6. Hurricane Ivan was heading in that direction but we decided to risk it. Fortunately it decided to go south of us. We had a wonderful time. I was a bit hesitant after reading the negative reviews, but it was a beautiful place. Our room was a superior grand on the top floor of the 4th building and we had the best view on the island-gorgeous!! The service was excellent, but it probably helped that we tipped a few dollars. Those people work so hard for so little. The drinks were plentiful and strong. The only big negative was the food. We both got sick. Be sure to bring Immodium. I'm also very picky about food and couldn't find much to eat. Most people did okay, though. Except for the food, we had a wonderful time in a beautiful place. Also, go on the Safari excursion. We went to the most beautiful beach and had Dominican food (beans  rice) to eat. Well worth the money.  
<Date>Oct 10, 2004

<Author>TropicalLover
<Content>Much more than we expected We got a great deal on Sunscape and then we read the reviews posted here. We headed off for our trip with very low expectations assuming we'd get what we paid for. However, we were pleasantly surpised by the quality, cleanliness, and service of the resort. We were given a partial ocean-view room which was beautiful. The staff was always pleasant and helpful and the grounds were beautiful. The food was excellent, too, with so many choices that we only regret that we didn't have time to try more selections. We drank the filtered water in the restaurants, ate whatever we pleased, and never got sick! When going to Punta Cana you have to keep in mind a few things: this is a third world country, it's the tropics, it's the beach, at the ocean, and it didn't cost you a fortune for a great vacation.  
<Date>Oct 1, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Holiday From Hell!!!! My husband and I took a holiday at the Sunscape from 15 July to 29 July last year (2003). We never realised until just recently that this Trip Advisor website existed but, having discovered it, we feel obliged to put our Review on. Before I go any further, we have to tell you that we have never complained about any other hotel we have stayed at before and that we are extremely well travelled and would not complain for no reason. We have been to the Caribbean many, many times, we've been to Thailand, Hong Kong, Singapore and all round Indonesia and have never had any problems. The Sunscape, however, for us was the HOLIDAY FROM HELL!! There was and, by reading the reviews, there still appears to be a major hygiene problem there. I went on this holiday perfectly well and two weeks later, after being admitted to the local hospital twice and put on IV, returned home 18 pounds lighter and very, very ill!! Fourteen months on, I am still ill, I have not gained any weight, I have not worked and I am still on medication and having to go to the Department of Infection  Tropical Medicine in the UK. Whilst we were there, everybody upon everybody was being ill, some worse than others! When we complained to the hotel, we were just told there is no problem here, you must have a weak stomach, it's the oil the food is cooked in! I had already been to the Dominican 6 years before and had eaten and drunk everything and had not even experienced a Spanish tummy! Whilst in the local hospital, I was treated for a parasite and I am still being treated for an exotic parasite back home! We took no risks while we were there, we never left the complex, we never drunk the water and we never cleaned our teeth in anything but the bottled water. Sorry, but anyone that says there is no problem with the hygiene of this hotel, has to think again!!I am sorry to have to be so negative but I really cannot say anything good about a hotel that makes you this ill. If anybody wants to ask any questions, please feel free to e-mail me anytime. It would be good to hear from anyone else that has also been ill from this hotel.  
<Date>Oct 1, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A great break from the winter blues I was planning my annual winter getaway and was thinking about the great time I had at Sunscape this past Feb. ( 2/7 to 2/14) After reading these recent reviews, it got me to thinking that I should offer my thoughts. I am a male in my late 40's and travel alone. The staff made feel very welcome and comfortable.My room was on the first floor of building 5 facing the managers homes which was next to the adult pool. I might just be easy to please but I thought the rooms were great ( no bug problems), room service was great, and never had a problem with running out of clean towels. One thing to remember, they put bottles of water in your room for a reason! Don't drink the tap water. There was seaweed on the beach but every morning they were out there raking it up and loading it on to trucks. I didn't ever smell the gas fumes that have been mentioned.Having a pocket full of singles goes a long way in making the bartenders happy. Most of the guests were friendly and there for the same reason I was, to have fun. Of course, as always, there were people that just couldn't be made happy. I did see several people get sick and then hear them blame the water, food ect. However, they somehow didn't remember the 20+ pina colatas they enjoyed the day before. Whoops!!Luis at the adult pool bar will keep you laughing until your sides hurt.There were a lot of kids there and seemed like there was always something going on for them.I like to get up early, eat and then hit the beach and pool bar so I didn't really go to the disco or piano bar but heard they were fun.I only ate at Windows but I had plenty of things to choose from and the cooks all remembered meeach meal. Also, there was food all day at the Backstage Bar and at a grill set up on the beach. Simple but good food. (Burgers, dogs, chips and pizzas.)I would highly recommend Sunscape for a great time. I will be returning Feb. of 2005 only this time I'll have several friends along that can't wait to have as much fun as I did.

<Author>Jeneffer13
<Content>Best Service. Simply heaven. I have recently returned to Chicago from a short stay at Sunscape Punta Cana Grand (Sept 10-14th). Fortunatly we left the morning before Jeanne arrived. I sure hope that the staff and everyone is allright! Especially Boris!~My fellow girlfriend and I travel to a different country every year and have stayed at many different All-Inclusive resorts. This resort by far exceeds my expectations of Customer Service! In my travels I have never seen the employees bendover backwards for you and every one is smiling all the time. Most of the employees have learned basic French and English. I was so impressed that a resort will take the time and energy to do this. The guests that come here are also fun and entertaining. (I think it is the stiff drinks! But at least it is a better quality liquor than some resorts that I have stayed at.)My girl friend Tina and I we happy that there were other people from the States many resorts have been mainly european (no offense) but there was always some friendly to talk to.The food was excellent in the ala cart resturants. It was also great to be able to not have to make reservations for the resturants and you can go to each ala Cart Resturant more than one time per stay. De Mario's is excellent, the shrimp pasta was amazing, I am willing to come back to this resort just for that dinner.Well If anyone has any questions please feel free to email me. jkildew@nchmarketing.comThis is a resort that I will be coming back to in June 2005!

<Author>Steve0762
<Content>If Paradise is half as nice... ...as Sunscape Punta Cana, then Paradise must be a fantastic place! Put simply, we had the best holiday of our lives at Sunscape - the place was just faultless. The gardens were beautiful and immaculately kept, the rooms airy and spacious, and the staff couldn't do enough to help; they always had a smile and were sincere in every effort to ensure you enjoyed your holiday to the full. (Special mentions must go to Luis, Otto, Boris  Michael, who were a credit to the place.)The variety of food was excellent, with a choice of four restaurants: Tex-Mex and Italian (American Grill and De Mario's) were available, plus Windows which offered all manner of menus - best place for breakfast was the Beachfront Bar (Steak  Eggs rule!) As for drinks... well, the waiters rarely let your glass go dry.The main pool was a little too noisy for our tastes, but an alternative was offered at the quieter Adult Pool/Plantation Bar (where Luis worked); there's also a jacuzzi there. This was a real oasis of calm relaxation (apart from the odd over-noisy American!)As for excursions, avoid Dominican Discovery which is overpriced and sadly doesn't live up to its potential, and the trip by catamaran to the so-called deserted island of Seona which was just jammed with fellow tourists and all a bit of a let-down. But... the Marinarium just along the attractive beachfront offers the opportunity to swim with sharks and stingrays, simply one of the most amazing experiences ever!! Also, don't listen to the rep's downer on horse-riding: the animals are very well looked after and our ride along the coast was simply wonderful.Our holiday ended on a sour note when Hurricane Jeanne tore through the resort, causing terrible damage - it was so sad to see all the wreckage on the morning after. But the hotel staff continued to do all they could for us, even under the most trying conditions (which is more than could be said of our rep, who was a disaster... never mind, that's not Sunscape's fault).All in all, just brilliant - and we will return, although hopefully without Jeanne!!  
<Date>Sep 25, 2004

<Author>coconut9
<Content>Holiday with a wild ending Just come back from sunscape Punta Cana, having been delayed a day due to Hurricane Jeanne which hit our Hotel Thursday morning at 2.00am. It was devastating to see the damage it had done, ruined beautiful gardens, both swimming pools and tore roofing off. This happened on the last day of our wonderful holiday. The hotel is execellent and also the staff, They will do anything for you. The bar staff and waiters in the restaurants are so friendly, they want to serve you all the time, anything you want they get for you.The food is execellent, especially in the Italian. American Grill and the Seafood Restaurants. The main Restaurant Windows was ok but got a bit crowded and you had to queue especially at breakfast. Recommend to go to the Beach Garden Restaurant for your breakfast ( waiter service) having Steak and eggs for breakfast, over looking the beach and sea. Once a week they put on a beach BBQ party,(weather permitting) that was fabulous.Went Horse riding along the beach $20 for an hour. The horses are in good shape very well looked after regardless of what the reps tells you. Trips such as the Dominican Experience and Sonia Island were not really worth the money the day is too long and very tiring. Swimming with the sharks (its ok as they are only nursing sharks and vegetarian) is the best trip, its only half a day and you can walk along the beach to get the boat that takes you out to meet them. In all it was a brilliant holiday and the Sixth time we have been to Dominican, but the first time in Punta Cana.  
<Date>Sep 21, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great People My fiance and I went down with some friends 10/10/04 - 10/17/04. We thought the place was great and the people were even better. In spite of Ivan out to the west, the weather was beautiful... up until Jeanne came through. Punta Cana got hit pretty hard and our resort had sustained a lot of damage. Even with the chaos that the hurricane had left, the staff really came throught to assist all the guests. They had plenty of food and alcohol (most importantly) and the staff stayed in great spirits. They were even still running room service! We heard horror stories from one of the other resorts, Secrets (supposedly one of the nicest resorts on the island). Apparently Secrets was really damaged and then the security guards started looting the place and they had guns!! Even worse, the hotel management wasn't doing anything about it. Someone at the resort had to call the US Embassy to get help. The guests had to be taken out of there by military helicopters and had to leave most of their belongings behind. Hearing those stories made me even more thankful for the staff at Sunscape.  
<Date>Sep 21, 2004
