<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great vacation Hubby and I went for a relaxing 8day-7night stay at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand Resort (Sept 4-11, 2004) First time wee ever done an all inclusive package and love it . The Dominican people in general are very nice, food on site was very good, and is a nice selection beach day/meal.Drinks ?little strong, but I guess that the Dominican way. Beach ?seaweed is there due to being on a coral reef, but they clean it up many times each day. Water I expected something more crystal clear, but if you walk about a mile or so down the beach ?there is nice clear water with no sea weed and bath tub warm. The beach itself clean, white sand with no shells to cut your feet, and Oh My.. TOPLESS beach, there are some sites!The resort in general is very nice; the shows they put on each night are every entertaining and funny. The resort is very family friendly and has activities all day, such as water aerobics, beach volleyball, and tennis, bike riding. The resort even has their own donkey family onsite.While there we did an excursion ?Outback Safari - $75 per person an entire day event, and very nice, and educational. Makes you really appreciate what we have at home. We would enjoy coming again in the near future and bringing the kids this time. The Dominican Republic is a very beautiful place to visit and the Sunscape Resort is a nice reasonably priced place to stay with your family and friends.  
<Date>Sep 16, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Dream Honeymoon at Sunscape After cruise plans fell through for our honeymoon a couple weeks before our wedding day, I had my husband call some local travel agents to look into all-inclusives. Sunscape was very highly recomended by our agent; who also got us a wonderful deal. I must admit, landing into the Punta Cana Airport gave me some reservations as to how our trip was going to go. But once we got through the non-english speaking airport and the bumpy ride to the resort I was just astounded by the beauty. From the moment we stepped in thier doors all of the staff was so pleasent. Our room was very clean with promt maid service ( almost a little too much so), the maid knocked on our door around 8:30 every morning. She had no problem waiting until we were ready to get up and go on our way for the day. She kept our mini-bar well stocked every day of our trip. The food was exceptional, very wide variety, it ranged form the usual cheeseburgers and steaks that my husband prefers to numerous types of seafood dishes that I enjoy. We couldn't ask for better service from the waitersPatricio and Angel both went well out of thier way for us. My husband is in a wheelchair so we could not visit the American Grill restaurant becuse it is on the second floor with no ramp or elevator so,they brought the American Grill restaurant to us. Once a week they have a huge beach party dinner. With it being on the beach, I could not get my husbands wheelchir through the sand. Although we declined, the staff offered to carry him in his wheelchair through the sand to accomodate us. They offer endless drinks, although they do make them VERY strong even if you ask them not to put too much alcohol in them. Every evening a movie is offered, as well as contests and comedy type shows.I can't imagine the type of service people that speak negatively about this place are accustomed to. Everything was exceptional and we would highly recommend Sunscape to anybody that wants a nice relaxing, laid back vacation, and do plan on visiting again. Next time we plan on making it a family vacation with us and my parents. My only real suggestion would be not to travel ANYWHERE in the Carribean in August or September, since it is hurricane season.  
<Date>Sep 15, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Had a Blast! We stayed at Sunscape Punta Cana Grand along with our 2 girls 4 and 2yrs and my mother 8/26-9/1. We all had a blast!!!The grounds were beautiful, clean and well kept. The food was quite good especially on the Dominican Night, the food was traditional and delicious. There was always something for everyone and we were always happy.The staff was great! They were always smiling and very helpful. We took $75 in singles and lots of $5 and it gave us great pleasure to tip for wonderful service. We also took along crayons, pencils, notebooks, gluesticks, etc. and gave them to the staff we got to know had children. They were so grateful especially since school was to start the following week. The Dominican people are very hard working and you would never know they were tired because they just always had great smiles on their faces.Overall the resort is a small wonderful family friendly place. Our girls had a great time, made great friends (Elena, Ashley, Melissa Kyle) and are still asking when we can go back.Thanks again to the wonderful staff...Paulina, Yahira, Andres, Juan Carlos, Osvaldo, etc.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice Place but very small. We spent 1 night and 2 days at the Sunscape due to a flight cancellation. Coming from the Palladium Bavaro Grand Resort, the Sunscape was a bit of a let down for the tail end of our trip.The Sunscape is a very nice clean well kept resort. Its also very, very small. The rooms are Okay but are motel style as opposed to villa style at the Palladium. I did not like the motel style room set up at the Sunscape. Its like a motel at a travel lodge along an interstate highway. The pool is small and gets abit crowded. The beach is also very small, maybe 250 yard stretch. The sea here is not carribean like. The sea is dark and there was a lot of sea weed in the water and on the beach. We did not see anyone in the sea swiming. The grounds are very well kept and tropical. Food selection is limited even at the buffet, but seemed to be very good quality. The drinks are great. Very good quality drinks and good booze.The lobby area is very appealing and very well kept. There is a disco and an indoor a/c piano bar.Although this is a very nice place, We would never go back to stay at the Sunscape. Its way to small of a resort with a poor beach/ocean and to many other negatives. We prefer the larger resorts like the Palladium. The beach at the Palladium is one of the best in the world and its about 3/4 of a mile long. There are tons of things to do and things to see at a larger place like the Palladium.  
<Date>Sep 8, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Paradiseo My family of 4 2 adults, 14 and 2 year old stayed from 8/29-9/3. The grounds were as reported in several write ups- fabulous. The Food was great! I had rib-eye steaks every day for dinner. There were several options every meal-buffet  al acarte. The beach was nice, not spectacular. They had a kids club for ages 4-12. The drinks flowed 24/7. The entertainment was nice. The Sunscape or Punta Cana is not really a night life mecca, so if you have asperations of partying all night long, the resort is not the place to do it with others. Remember that drinks don't stop flowing-ever! If you are with a crowd you can create you own party on the beach-no problem! There is a disco on site for 18 and older, but there is another club called Mangos in town. If you have specific questions, I suggest that you call the resort directly. I went through apple vacations and they have an english speaking rep on site all day. Call the resort and request to be transfered to the rep. I called ahead and found out that laptop computers could be connected to the web in the room for $2 per connection. My connection was for 3 days, 19hours and some minutes. I never disconnected, so I never had a phone line. Call ahead! My bill was $2 for the internet. The computer saved our asses because I was able to track Francis live via the web and finally I found out that our return flight was cancelled really early because of the web and was able to be re-routed VIA JFK to Seattle with the family. We left a plane load of passengers behind. Thanks to the technological advantage we are home! We have been to a few all inclusive resorts and the Sunscape, with the exception of the beach appearance, is nearly tops. We have been to Couples in Ocho Rios, Crown Paradise and the Cancun Palace in Cancun. Bring a big cup if you like a lot of volume and dont want to walk to the bar too much. Bring 100 1 dollar bills for tips- you will be the queen/king, and remember that this is the third world. Vorizon cell phones work, but us phones will be roaming. The apple rep told us that the cell phone is the cheapest way to call off the island even with roaming charges. Incoming calls only have to pay roaming plus air time. I don't have Vorizon so contact them directly if you are a Vorizon customer. Sprint and Quest phones did not work at all. If you have any questions, please ask via email. Frank  
<Date>Sep 7, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The shower **** The Sunscape was fantastic. The ocean was calm, the food good, entertainment great, everything was wonderful....except for one thing...the shower. We thought that there was something wrong with the shower in our room, as there was absolutely no water pressure. We complained and were put in a different room. Alas, the same thing there. It may seem such a small thing to some, but I need a good shower! Because of the overbooking, guests were offered an upgrade to Secrets Excellence. We decided to take advantage of that and just loved Secrets. However, the ocean there is quite rough and I nearly drowned! If it weren't for my husband, I may not have made it back to shore!

<Author>Mikel_Arteta
<Content>Club Tropicana drinks are free Yes, my caribbean knowledge before our holiday to Punta Cana was limited to the lyrics of the Wham song. But I have listened to it a lot, so I do know what I'm talking about. If you really tried, like some people seem to, you could find probably find a couple of petty problems to moan about. If you want to have a wonderful holiday, it's very easy to do that at Sunscape. The week my wife and I (early 30's) just spent there was amazingly relaxing. The white sands, clear Caribbean Sea, palm trees...I have never felt so chilled out. However, the best bits for us were the activities. My advice is to have a Catamaran lesson (20$) early in your holiday, once you know how to sail it you can take it out for free every day. The other free water activities like kayak, pedalo etc are also fun. I can't overemphasise though, how amazing the snorkel on the coral reef was. Snorkelling on the beach is fun, but for $20 you get taken on a 2 hour trip to a world that I thought only existed on the BBC. Our other extras are also recommended: a $30 relaxing massage and a $70 trip to Manat Park including swimming with dolphins.I personally don't go on holiday for the food, so I won't go on about it - suffice to say in my opinion it was fine. The room and service were absolutely top notch. Cabaret entertainment isn't my thing, but the majority of the guests seemed to be delighted every time the country's national anthem (The Vengabus Is Coming) was played. And if you don't fancy joining in, there are plenty of other things to do. One quick question, which I would love to see answered in future reviews: if you are one of the people who takes photos of yourself with the resort staff: why ?Overall, my wife and I were absolutely delighted with our holiday. And as Henry Ford probably said one summer: If you think you can have a fantastic holiday or you think you can find things to complain about - you're probably right  
<Date>Sep 2, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best vacation I have ever had I just finished reading a lot of the reviews and I can't believe why people would give this resort anything less than a 4 out of 5. Maybe it's because I'm young, that I enjoyed it so much. I'm 18 and was in Sunscape this April (2004) with my mom, my friend, her sister, and her mom. We had the best time, and couldn't have asked for more. The only bad thing, I agree with everybody on, is the seaweed in the water. But it's nothing you can't handle. I made lifetime friends with most of the staff, Rico, Andres, Michellet, etc.. all the entertainment/staff. Wendy, Juan, etc from the bars. The food was also great, and even the chefs would remember you and always have time to say hello, how are you?.. the night entertainment was good, it always made us laugh and the little disco on the 2nd floor of the lobby also kept me and my friends quite entertained well into the night. my mom and my friend's mom had a great time also, but not as much fun as me and my friends. Basically, if you're young and you want to have fun and get to know people, go here.. if you're a bit older you'll like it too, but maybe not as much as the younger crowd. It all depends on your taste. If anybody has any other questions you can email me and I'll be glad to give more details.. I'm going back there again this novemeber, and in April 2005!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>We all had a great time My husband and I and two of our kids 15 and 12went to Sunscape from July 23rd to July 30th 2004.We had a great time. We have been to 2 others resorts in Punta Cana, the Melia and Secrets.Sunscape was better than the Melia, but nothing beats Secrets (Secrets and Sunscape are ownedby the same company). I have to say after reading some of the reviews on here I was a littleafraid of what to expect. Seaweed was never a problem (but hey, it is the beach). Shade was scarce. We learned to put our towels out before we went to bed.The kids had a wonderful time. We barely saw them :). There was a lot of kids and they allseem to hang out together which was nice. The food was okay, I wouldn't say great.Service was slow in the American Grill and I do mean slow!Nothing is on ice (fruit, juices, lunch meat ect)so I can see where people could get sick althoughno one in our family did. We ate smart!You do have to remember you are in another country with different food safety laws.Our room was great. Building 3, third floor,with a view of the ocean and pool. We didn'thear any noise at night like some reviews.Our room was clean and well stocked. We even asked for extra sprite and beer one day and each day the maid remembered and stocked the extras for us. We didn't receive the night turn down service that was advertised. The maids did come back again around 7 pm with extra towels and drinks though.Check in was quick and our room was ready when we arrived around noon. When you arrive they welcome you home with cookies and rum punch or just punch. (a nice touch to start your vacation) Check outwas another story. You can have a late checkoutfor a fee if your room was not requested. Ours was because of the view we had. The staff at the desk was going to give us a hospitality room since our plane didn't leave until later in the day, but they only were going to let us have it for a half hour(4 people showered in a half hour, I don't think so).We talked to our vacation rep and he was able to get us the room for an hour. It was a regular,clean room in another building which was nice.I had heard from reviews that they give you a room that everyone uses and the towels are not replaced that wasn't the case with us.The beach is beautiful with plenty of activities for those that want. The pool is nice, but it is showing it's age.Never a wait at any of the bars for drinks and they sure do pour that liquor with a heavy hand!As for the airport, yes they do go through your luggage very a lot. But hey in this day and age I want that!Again we all had a wonderful time, with plenty to do for those that want and plenty not to do for those that don'tWould I go back? You bet, in a New York Minute!  
<Date>Aug 28, 2004

<Author>pappaspike
<Content>Just loved it. Hola! We can't say enough good things about this resort. My husband and I along with our three children, the grandparents and friends just returned on August 26, 2004. The grounds were beautiful as was the beach. We enjoyed the beach also during the morning hours. We did not have any trouble getting seats in the shade. The food was great. We especially would like to thank the entertainment people including Fernando, Andres, and Rigo for keeping us all entertained. We are looking forward to going back not for a week but two!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Family Reunion Travel Dates: August 16 to August 23, 2004. My mom took all of us, our spouses and/or boyfriends/girlfriends, and our children to Sunscape for a little family reunion. We had a total of 19 in our group, ages ranging from 50+ to 4 months old. Each family group had their own room on the first floor of Building #5.The resort was completely amazing, there was something to do for everyone there. The grounds were absolutely gorgeous. And the beach itself, compared to the other 3 resorts, was the cleanest.My children are 6 1/2 and 9 and enjoyed the time they spent with the Explorer's Club. My youngest performed in two of the kid shows (you all would know her as Madonna ahahaha). They even had dinner with Raphel one night at Windows while we enjoyed a child free dinner at the Italian eatery.I was not too impressed with the Beach Cafe for my first lunch nor my first night's dinner at the Tex Mex. My Ribeye was over 3/4 fat. Our last night there I did try the Beef Filet and it was absolutely much better. I noticed that at the sit down places, service was difficult, but what do you expect when you have so many people...a few orders got mixed up, forgotten etc, but was correctly in a timely manner. I absolutely LOVED the Window's International Buffet. My favorite waiter was Francisco. I found all the food there (breakfast lunch and dinner) to be the most enjoyable, tasteful and just simply great. The beach party and dinner was probably my favorite evening during our week stay.The nightly shows we all enjoyed as a family and looked forward to them every night (yeah to my sister and her boyfriend for winning The Ideal Couple). My only complaint with the shows is that because children are there, one couple that did perform in The Ideal Couple show could have toned it down a little and probably should have worn a pair of panties that night...The rooms were very comfortable, air conditioning help up just great, maid service was an A++, beds were a little too hard, but my back didn't seem to mind after a few nights. They could please fix the ice machines in each building's little lobbied area.The workers there are truly amazing, very helpful and extremely pleasant and upbeat. All the workers there treated everyone with the upmost respect and really made the week fun and enjoyable for all. Baby Ann is only 4 months old and had the pleasure of learning one of the dances, Rico was a good teacher.The bartenders I really didn't get to know that well, but my youngest daughter was a regular at the pool bar and they usually had her favorite virgin drink waiting for her when they saw her coming.I would definetely go back to this same resort if I ever get the opportunity to go back. I would also recommend this resort to anyone, especially with children, to go to Sunscape.  
<Date>Aug 26, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Can't wait to go back! I just returned from an amazing vacation at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand (8-13--8-20). I have to admit I was pretty nervous about the country, the hotel, etc. based on reviews I had read, but I was pleasantly surprised. The Sunscape was a tropical paradise.First of all, the resort area is absolutely gorgeous and well-maintained. The pool is warm and clean. Water aerobics are very fun.The beach area is excellent, although it's a good idea to wake up early and stake claims on chairs in the shade. The water is pretty, but not the most fantastic Caribbean aqua color. The staff was great. I had read many complaints about how some did not speak good English. My response to this is that you are going to a foreign, Spanish speaking country. What did you expect? Most of the staff speaks good English. They were extremely friendly and accomodating. I would suggest bringing at least $75 in singles to tip the housekeepers, bartenders, and servers even though the resort is all-inclusive. These people work long hours in high heat for little pay. Tip the ones who give you good service. They will remember.The food was very good overall. You really could find anything you had a taste for. The Beach Garden and Dimario's are fantastic in the evenings if you're looking for classy, sit-down meals. The American Grill and buffet are good for casual dining. The bartenders are excellent, and the Coco Loco's are amazing. I will admit that a few of us in the group got a little sick, but add lots of tropical fruits, alcohol, and extreme sunshine to your daily life all at once, and it's bound to happen. There are many free activities at the resort, and the Activities Team will encourage you to get involved (salsa lessons, volleyball, etc). Take advantage of these activities, and don't worry about looking like an idiot. You're on vacation. Also, if you are traveling through Apple Vacations, I would highly, highly recommend the Saona trip. It is a one-day excursion to the uninhabited Saona island. You will sail on a huge catamaran, spend a few hours relaxing on the island and eating a fabulous lunch, swimming in a natural pool with starfish, and racing speedboats back to the marina. I cannot even describe how beautiful it was. The folks at Apple are great. Attend the meeting on the first day; their advice will make your vacation much more enjoyable.This is not the resort to go to if you're looking for a party-filled nightlife. There is a movie on a big screen each night, followed by a performance. The nightly shows were entertaining, and I would suggest attending them. Afterwards, you can try out the piano bar, the outdoor bar area, or the disco. The disco is not your typical American dance club; the DJ plays a variety of American, Latin, and European music. Have a good time even if you don't understand the lyrics.Be firm with the pushy venders next to the resort. They will ask outrageous prices for items of dollar-store quality. Do not be afraid to offer them $5 for something they ask $60 for. You can get some good deals if you are confident. The rooms were very nice. Your bed will be hard, but you will be very tired by the end of the day. Each room has a balcony, and you can get free room service any time. Don't drink the water from the sink; bottled water only. Stay hydrated!Overall, the Sunscape was fantastic. A few improvements could have been made here or there, but nothing that stopped us from having a great week. Our vacation flew by, and I can't wait to go back! We started planning our next trip before we even left the resort!  
<Date>Aug 24, 2004

<Content>Sunscape was OK My family and I loved the people, hotel and grounds all were very nice. The food was just OK. My words of advice for anyone traveling to Sunscape would be to bring all of your own medicines because they are extremly expensive if bought from the hotel shop. If you go on this trip wear water shoes, the island that you go to has about a three foot area of broken shells and large rocks and is very difficult to walk on without shoes. I met wonderful people at sunscape and we exchanged emails but I misplaced mine, if anyone of you that I met reads this please email me.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>WOW! Could Not Have Been Better Just returned from a 7 day trip to Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. My entire family agrees that it was the best vacation we have ever had. There were eight in our party and we had 3 rooms. When we first arrived 2 rooms were next to each other on the 1st floor and the 3rd room was in another building on the 2nd floor. The party placed on the 2nd floor had a 3 year old with them and we were fearful that she would fall thru the railings. We went to the front desk and spoke with Sandy, who immedately resolved the problem and move the them across the hall from us. We found that the Dominican People are extremely friendly, love kids and do everything possible to make your stay at their hotel an enjoyable one. The food was very good and there was a wide variety to choice from. 24 hour room service was great. We brought singles and fives to tip. Although tips are not expected they are greatly appreciated. The grounds were beautiful, the rooms were very clean and well kept. Our maid left flowers and towels folded in different animals every day. Every request that was made of the staff was fulfilled. Our kids, who ranged in age from 15 to 3, all had a great time. I highly recommed this resort to anyone with children. Every night a family movie is played at 7:30 followed by a live show at 9:30. There is plenty of activities for adults also. The piano bar is fantastic! The bartender (Hulio) is a hoot and the entertainment was outstanding. Franklin the sax player/ singer is very talented and puts on a great show. Also must try a mudslide made by the bartener, Chocolate, who works evenings at the pool bar! The only problem we ran into was my son got an ear infection, from swimming in the ocean. There is a doctor on site who did a fantastic job of getting my son well. We had no other problems with illness. We loved our stay and are planning on returning next year.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>LOVED SUNSCAPE  Myself my husband, my 3 yr old daughter, my sister, brother-in-law, their 10 yr old son, 15 yr old daughter,  a close family friend all stayed at the Sunscape during 8/13-8/20/04  we all had a blast! The food was great, the entertainment was great  the staff was absolutely phenominal. Upon our arrival we were placed in bldg 5 on the 2nd fl  the rest of our crew was placed in bldg 4 on the 1st fl, we didn't like the 2nd fl w/a 3 yr old daughter so we went back to the lobby  spoke w/Sandy who was able to have our room switched over to bldg 4 across the hall from the rest of our crew w/in minutes. Sandy could not have been more accomodating. The people that work at the resort are the best people that I have ever encountered. One of my favorites was Franklin who plays the saxophone  can sing just about anything that you request. If anyone knows someone that is in the entertaining business, please send them out to listen to Franklin, they will find that he is someone well worth listening too. Franklin will be a hit one day. He has the talent to make it far in life. Julio at the Piano Bar is a total comedian  he keeps you laughing, he is just too wonderful. Julio, Claudio, Damian,  Chocolate all make the best drinks  are as friendly as can be. Cecelia who also works at the resort was wonderful. She made you feel at home each time you encountered her. The maid that was assigned to our room, Viscuella, I believe is how you spell her name, did a phenominal job w/keeping our rooms maintained. She would make doves w/the towels, leave petals all over the sinks  she always ensured that we had beverages  clean towels. Angel  his staff were great as well, they were able to seat the eight of us together  were always on the ball. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if they have kids. We brought down a few hundred one dollar bills to use for tipping  they were all extremly gracious of the money. A dollar to the people of the Dominican Republic is worth 40-45 pesos. If your looking for a friendly, fun, family vacation, then Sunscape is the place to go. They even have movies every evening at 7:30 for the kids w/the staff doing a show following the movie @ 9:30. Myself  my family were reluctant to go to this hotel because we had heard some stories about people getting ill from the food, but, none of us from our group got sick  the people that we met at the resort were all ok as well. My nephew however, did get an ear infection from too much swimming but, the doctor at the resort was able to accomodate him. If you have children, I would just recommend bringing down ear drops. We will be back next year w/even more people visiting in our party. If your staying at the Sunscape you will not be disappointed...

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fabulous family resort...nonstop fun with R 8-1-04 to 8-5-04: Totally surpassed my expectations for a family oriented, all- inclusive resort. My 10 yr old son said Sunscape was more fun than Disneyworld and wants to revisist Sunscape. The food, service and staff were exemplary. We met guests from many other countries-- which was a great experience for my son. The nightly stage shows were comical  a must to see--no matter how tired you are. If you have time, visit the Metaphorphysis Spa for a deep tissue massage.... Of the many excursions, definitely do the Outback Safari--say hi to Nacho-- Sunscape Punta Cana Grand Resort gave us a vacation but we made it a memorable adventure. Next time, we plan to stay longer.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Outstanding Service August 2004- We just returned from a great vacation at Sunscape, Punta Cana Grand. We were so impressed with the outstanding service. The people were genuinely nice and went out of their way to greet you. The bartenders, waiters/waitresses, buffet servers, cleaning crew, entertainment crew, etc. were all excellent.I was so glad I brought singles to tip - they deserved it. (I recommend you bring $75 in singles to tip. Also bring $5s and $10s. The ATM machine only gives you pesos and you cannot exchange pesos for dollars. It is very difficult to get change for $20s, $50s  $100s.)*The rooms were beautiful. I loved the tile floor. The beds were a little hard, but you survive.*The food was pretty good. Marios was the only restaurant that enforced long pants for men.*The pool was fun. The beach was OK. There was a smell of gasoline from the boats that was a little strong at times on the beach.* We had a great time parasailing,snorkeling, horseback-riding, riding on the banana boat, and riding quads. (all cost an additional fee)*Stay away from the deep-sea fishing. Four hour boat trip, twelve miles out, caught nothing but upset stomachs.*My family loved the water trampoline, kayaks, ping pong, tennis, paddle boats, catamarans, and shuffle board. (all included with your stay)* You do not have to wear a band on your wrist like most resorts.We had a wonderful time. I would highly recommend this resort for families with children.

<Author>usatraveler7878
<Content>Sunscape was the perfect choice My mom and I had a girls' week at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand 4 August -11 August, and we loved every minute of it! Our check in was easy and quick - there was a server waiting for us in the lobby to give us drinks while we checked in. We arrived at about 12:30 and were able to get into our room right away to begin our vacation. When we entered our room, we were amazed at how nice it was. The cleaning staff even decorated the sink with flowers and placed flowers between the towels in the bathroom. Every day our room was cleaned by mid-afternoon, and when we returned to the room at night, the beds were turned down and the towels were replenished a second time. We asked for Diet Cokes in our refrigerator once and then got them every day after that. We read some reviews of the hotel before we left, including complaints about the nearby marina, but we thought the beach was absolutely gorgeous! We were there to be in the sun so finding shade wasn't an issue for us, but you do have to get towels on shaded chairs early or you won't get them. The water was clear and beautiful, the sand was lovely, and the weather was gorgeous. We had short showers in the evenings, but nothing to interrupt the lovely daytime weather. The watersports place on the beach has a few free things like paddleboats, catamarans, kayaks, and snorkel gear that we took advantage of almost every day.  The Italian restaurant was really nice, and we enjoyed it so much we went there three times! I recommend the garlic shrimp dish, lasagna appetizer, and the mozz  tomato salad - all delicious! When you are seated, you are treated to a cosmopolitan while you peruse the menu. The atmosphere is elegant. Windows (the buffet) had a different theme each night, and there was always something there that even the pickiest eater could enjoy. The dessert table was overwhelming in a good way! You just can't go there expecting everything to taste the same as it does in the US because you're not in the US. the staff in all of the restaurants and all over the hotel were incredibly friendly and helpful. One night my mom was sick, and our waiter even made her a big plate of mashed potatoes to take to her room. Some people have complained about a language barrier, but the DR is a country that doesn't just cater to English-speaking people. Almost all of the staff spoke great English, and even if someone didn't understand what we asked for, they were so nice about it and usually asked someone else to translate. We picked up a pocket-sized Spanish-English book to learn a few important phrases before we left so we could at least make an attempt to speak a little Spanish. The nightly entertainment was really fun, and the bartenders at the bar next to the pool (I think it's called the Backstage Bar) were fantastic! They even began to recognize us and remember our favorite drinks. There was only one negative thing about our visit. The Spa at the hotel is managed separately, and while I did enjoy my session for the most part, the woman who was doing the massage got a cell phone call, answered it, and talked to the caller for about 5 minutes while continuing the massage with her one free hand. I should have said something but I was so surprised, i didn't quite know what to say! The spa does have a lot of great options though, and the Island Recovery Treatment that I chose was fabulous. Our vacation was excellent overall and we would recommend this resort to anyone - we already have. I would go back there in a minute. Thanks to all the staff at the Sunscape for making our stay so enjoyable! If anyone has questions, feel free to email me.  
<Date>Aug 18, 2004

<Author>ivortickle
<Content>One of my all time favorite vacations! Just got back from a 5 day trip to this incredible resort. You get so much for your money at this place. The grounds are paradise; the architecture absolutely stunning. The beach could have been a tiny bit better, but it is still absolutely beautiful. We saw smiling faces every where we went. Don't pay any attention to the grumpy people complaining about this place; it is not perfect but you are not paying for perfect.Some of the food was incredible (grilled lobster with garlic sauce); some of it was quite ordinary. The drinks were wonderful. It was so much fun to sit on the beach and have a waiter walk up and ask you what you would like!There is quite a European crowd there. The largest group leaving the airport with us was headed for Madrid.The Apple vacation staff was very accomdating and anxious to make everything perfect. We loved our room; fortunately we were on the end next to the beach and the view was stunning.I just can't say enough about this place - it is paradise!

<Author>CherieM1
<Content>Had a wonderful experience! I am a semi-seasoned traveler so I have several experiences to compare to. The grounds are immaculate. The food was better than all 3 of the Mexico resorts we've stayed at and the beach party was fantastic. None of our party of 4 got sick, but we watched what we ate (no salads, limited fruit). The staff was great, no language barrier at all. The bartenders became so familiar with us, just after the first night, that they knew what we wanted before we even asked.There is tremendous competition with the shade, however. I believe some were leaving their towles over night instead of getting up early to reserve a spot. I did not agree with letting the children take up the spaces at the swim up bar, but it is a family friendly resort. Another potiential downfall is the hard pillows and beds. However, if you bring your own pillow, you've got 1 of 2 licked!We had heard so many complaints from others traveling to the area that stayed at other resorts that it made ours seem like a gold mine.The Dominican Republic is by far the most beautiful island I've seen thus far and this includes St. Thomas, St. Lucia, St. Croix, St. John, Belieze, Mexico, St. Marteen, Ocho Rios, Grand Cayman. But to experience it, you've got to travel AWAY from the resort. The highlight of our trip was the Outback Safari. Here we saw breathtaking scenery. Remember Jurasick Park (spell?) It was filmed on the island!In summary, we had a great time, enhanced significantly by the staff, food and excursions.Feel free to contact me with any questions!  
<Date>Aug 6, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sunscape was Amazing! Stayed at the Sunscape from 7/28 - 8/5 with my husband and two daughters, age 18  2. A wonderful time was had by all! My husband was reluctant to travel to the DR and didn't think he would like it (he puts a very high priority on good food!) he is now a convert! Unfortunately, upon arrival I found out that my luggage was misplaced somewhere in Miami. Eleanor and Carin kept on top of the situation and were able to get me my luggage by the first evening. This is definetely a family resort, and if your looking for rollicking nightlife you may want to look elsewhere, but there was an incredible array of things to do for most people! My older daughter quickly made friends and got certified at Scuba Diving, learned to windsurf, and snorkled every day. Even though the explorers club is for ages 4+, the wonderful staff welcomed little Melissa to join in their nighttime show! Watching a movie in the open air each night was really neat. The room was fine, and kept very clean by our friendly maid! (who also left me extra towels, coffee and water each day!) The staff was amazing and most that had direct regular guest contact spoke very good English. The restaraunts offered a wide variety of foods. The buffet restaraunt, Windows, had a different theme each night, and you truly could not begin to eat all that they offer, even if you only ate there all week. The first night we ate at Windows we were offered a glass of champagne as we entered, and proceeded to be amazed at the quality of food. The fried lobster was heavenly, the desserts were beautiful and it almost seemed a shame to cut into some of the cakes (my daughter particularly loved the cookies topped with strawberries and vanilla). My husband and I were able to pry my older daughter away from her new friends one night to babysit her sister so that we could go to the restaraunt DeMario's for dinner. It was exellent, I would highly recommend the buffalo mozzarella as an appetizer, even though this is actually fresh mozzarella on top of a nice sliced tomato, drizzled with olive oil and herbs even my husband had admit that it was great! We then went to the cigar bar, which was quiet, but elegant, for after-dinner drinks. Of course, there were dishes that did not appeal to me (some type of goat stew for example), but I just didn't eat it! There was so much more to choose from! The pool was beautiful, as was the beach. The water was clear and clean. The irridescent green color didn't extend as far out into the water as some would like, but that is due to the depth of the water, not to it's cleanliness! There is a natural breakwater in front of the hotel, and a channel for the boats to pass through to get to open water. This is why there are several boats moored to the right of the hotel. The boats are primarily fishing boats (extremely expensive one's at that) as that is how many of the natives make their living. My husband went on two very reasonable priced sport-fishing trips for Marlin, Mahi Mahi, etc. This is a great resort for someone wanting to deep-sea fish! Each morning we would sit on the balcony, drinking yummy Dominican coffee and watching the fishing boats leave for the day, and each afternoon we would walk to the pier and see what they caught! One day we saw a spear fisherman walking in the surf trailing along a 6 foot shark! (as well as about 100 tourists). To each his own is how I look at these helpful reviews. For example, I too was searched repeatedly at the Punta Cana airport, but I was glad to oblige. We were flying into New York after heightened terror alerts, I just hope they search everyone as thoroughly! We were somewhat careful about what we ate, but not overly so. We ate alot of seafood. Neverthess, not one of us got sick, and neither did anyone else that we spoke to at the resort. There were a few changes that I would make next time (for instance staying in building 4 or 5, instead of building 2, which was too close to the vendor's huts), but live and learn. No resort is perfect, and there are possible criticisms for even the most elegant establishments. However, I have to say that I had one of my best vacations ever at the Suncsape, and would highly recommend this resort to anyone (particulary families) heading to beautiful Punta Cana!  
<Date>Aug 6, 2004

<Author>Cocoa1
<Content>Could have been better!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I just got back from Sunscape, after spending a week 7/28/04-8/03/04. The people were very friendly, the grounds very well kept. If you're looking for excitment after 11pm then this is not the hotel for you. My husband and I are 28, and it was very boring, their's a Disco Club nothing but 80's and spanish music. My husband got sick the second day there, alot of people that we met from other resorts were also sick. DO NOT DRINK THE WATER!!!!!!! The day leaving the resort my husband , my son , and myself got sick and we're still sick. The beach was o.k. Food was o.k. Drinks o.k. The rooms were very dark, we stayed in building 4 away from the stage. We went on two tours, Crazy Wheels was the best you get to drive your own RV it's about 3hrs, it takes you to two private beaches that was the best. $85 one person,$56 two people kids half. The other was Bavaro Expedition not worth it at all. This trip was 8hrs takes you to the village of the Haitian people, see how they live then to a private beach for lunch. It's a very long drive on a dirt road, I sleep to and from. If you do the Crazy Wheels which you get to drive your own RV don't even bother doing the Expedition it's the same thing. Crazy Wheels do not wear sneakers, dress very light you will get Very Very Muddy!!!!!!! buy it was fun. When we got to the airport they will search your bags as if you're a criminal. They open everyone suitcase take their clothes out then want you to repack. DO NOT BUY BARCELO 151 OVERPROOF RUM!!!!!!!!!!!!! ITS ILLEGAL AND THEY WILL TAKE IT AWAY FROM YOU. If you pack it in your carry-on, if they forgot to check it with your suitcase, they will check it again before you get on the plane so they're no hiding anything at all. We went US Airways, never again. Overall I did not like the treatment at the airport, the hotel was boring, I would'nt go back there. I travel every year and this is the frist time I had a complaint about any carribbean Island. Go to Jamaica (Negril)$1 is $40 peso in Punta Cana. If you have any question feel free to ask.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Potential but Poor I found that the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand has beautiful grounds, mostly friendly staff and much potential, but there are some major things about the place that need to be addressed. (I do want to preface my statement with the fact that we have traveled to the Caribbean 6 times and are not complainers.) All of our other experiences have been enjoyable, some more luxurious than others but enjoyable. Many people that we spoke to had become ill due to their stay at this facility. My daughter was very, very ill and it was suggested that she be hospitalized with a bacteria-dysentery infection. It has been 5 days of treatment and she still is unable to keep anything but liquids down. In those few days she has lost 10 pounds. It is accompanied by severe cramping, weakness, dizziness and lethargy. We did not take any risks by drinking anything but bottled water and eating only cooked foods not raw vegetables or fruit. The illness alone will prevent us from ever booking this resort again. There is limited shade around the pool and beach. I needed to get up at 6:00 am to get a chair and then sometimes they were already taken. One family told me they get up at 4:00am to reserve their chairs! The staff setting up for the beach party on Thursdays need the East end of the beach for the set up which limits where the guests may sit during the day. We were treated rudely on the beach, set up day. In an attempt to get us to move, the staff began to encircle us with tables, so close that it was difficult to get out of our beach chairs without having to move the tables. It was an intimidating and rude action by the staff. I did look for a new place to sit that day after the intimidation, but nothing was availble. It made for an upsetting most uncomfortable day. Most days our rooms were clean by 4:00pm but one day upon return to our room at 7:00pm the beds were still unmade and there were no clean towels, for which to shower. That is unacceptable.The beach is not as clean as the other beaches we have been to, and the marina sits just beyond the swimming area so the water has gasoline floats. The place has potential with the proper owner/manager but we will never return and I will not suggest that anyone else go there with so many other options that also have good deals and without the risks of rude treatment, illness, limited shade and pool/beach chairs, and better efficiency in the cleaning of rooms. On several occasions when we used our beach towel card to get a towel they were out of them and told us to wait or return. They know the number of guests that have checked in and should have ample towels for the guest. If you want to ask me further questions do not hesitate to contact me ; cwatte@aol.com P.S. It has now been more than one month since we have been to this resort and my daughter is still sick and has seen the doctor 3 times. She is just now beginning to have an appitite and eat without pain or other side effects.  
<Date>Jul 29, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sunscape Punta Cana Grand was truely awesome My family and I just spent a week at the Sunscape Punta Cana grand. (July19-26 2004). It was one of the best vacations I have ever been on, and we have traveled and tried many different things. This resort was beautiful and the staff was amazing. Everyone worked hard to make the guests happy. The employees were always in good moods no matter what they were doing or what time of day it was. The pool was great, it was large enough to where it was never over crowded and u could always find a float within 5 minutes. There were always seats to be found around the pool, yes it is true that the seats in the shade went fast and people did get up early just to save them..but if u really want the shade then wake up early too. There is seaweed in the water. It is cleaned up everyday a few times. It really isnt bad at all. The water isnt as amazing as some might hope, but it truely isnt that bad either. There was always room at the bars to get a drink because there were so many of them. The bartenders could make any drink you ask them for without a problem. You hardly ever had to wait for a drink at all. There was always food to be found somewhere. The food was my only complaint though. It isnt because it wasnt good. I am just a very very picky eater so a lot of it just didnt appeal to me..but even for people like me they had pasta hamburgers and hotdogs and french fries..so there was something for me to have. Otherwise, if you are into trying things there is such a selection there it is to die for. They serve anything you can ever imagine. Most people I met there thought the food was amazing. The room was nice. It was always kept clean. It was nice and cool and the water pressure was great. No matter what you asked for they brought it for you if they could. The service was phenomenal there. The entertainment was awesome. Every night there was a different movie for the kids to watch but anyone could watch it, they had activities all day for kids to do, and adults as well. There were games and contests all day to play and prizes to win. The activities crew was great. They were hilarious. (thank you Andres, Rigo, Robert, Michelet, Minimi, Juan Carlos and anyone i may have missed) The nightly show was great. Some nights was a dancing and singing show..and other nights it was audience participation. Great Great Great. The dancers and singers were so good. they really worked hard to put on a quality show. (Carlitos, Moreno, Erika, Sadie, Irene, Vanessa, Miguel, and Cassie Lindo--awesome job!!). I would recommend this hotel to anyone going there for sure. I cannot wait to go back. I plan on it as soon as i can. The weather is great. Its hot, sunny, and nice. Mueve la Colita Mamita Rica, Mueve la Colita...(Clap clap clap)...go there to find out about that...Enjoy!!!! ~CARMELA  
<Date>Jul 28, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Didn't want to leave Well, first and foremost I'm not a staff member and I'm not getting paid for this review I'm just writting to give my opinion on the Sunscape. This is not my first all inclusive and I have traveled to different locations through out the world.On July 16th we arrived at the Sunscape and stayed for 5 nights and had an incredible time. The staff were more than pleasant and helpful with requests. FOOD- Average for an all-inclusive resort. Tex-Mex and the Cafe are the best.Beach- One would beautiful. Yes, there are boats and seaweed in the water. However, your supposed to find boats and seaweed in the ocean.Activities-The sunset cruise was great if you ask they will take you to where they have sharks caged in the middle of the ocean so you can snorkel right next to them. The speedboats were fun, but I don't know if there really worth $60. Horse back riding was awesome the 2 hour sunset. The massages are great on the beach. Parasailing is short but you can see the whole island it's breathtaking. The banana boats were fun for $7.00. They do have activities on the resort to keep you busy however we did not participate. Pool- relaxing, It is true that you have to get up in the early morning to get a shaded chair, however we found a chair and rafts every day and who wants to be in the shade when you go to an island for the sun.Shopping- bargin for what you want one of the guys wanted $75 for a ring I paid $25One last note remeber to bring one dollar bills this is very important because knowone has change and if you use the ATM it will give you pesos and they won't exchange them at the resort.

<Author>namiuc
<Content>Absolutely the best vacation spot for families My family and I all enjoyed our time at Sunscape Punta Cana Grand during the second week of July. We stayed in building 3 with a great view of both the ocean and the pool . I found the variety of food was fine. (If your in a hurry just go to windows). My children thorougly enjoyed the kids club and the mini disco,oh, and let's not forget the donkey rides on the beach. Rafael, Michelle, and Paulina are absolutely wonderful with the kids. There were times when the kids didn't want to be with us. There are great events for them to participate during the day like the volleyball games, little olympics, just to name a few. There's also a wonderful kids area right by the pool on the beach with a make believe sunken ship and a swing set. The Sunscape staff does a great to outstanding job making your stay as pleasant as possible and even though your not required to tip please be considerate and think how many hours these people work a couple of dollars means a world to them. My suggestion is to bring at least $100 in singles (very difficult to get change in the resort) and fives in order to tip. If you want great service be kind. We tipped well and received the best service every single day.I do recommend that if you want a shaded spot, you will have to get up early or put something out before you go to sleep.But the most memorable events are the ones I had in the company of the entertainment staff Mini Me, the MC, Andres, Fernando, and Juan Carlos. Absolutely the most energetic happy people I have ever met. They work all day from the morning excersice activities to the disco at night. These people work 12 hour day for twelve days straight and then get 3 days off. What spirit! God Bless. They are absolutely funny. You'll love the shows produced by them and PLEASE, participate in the suncape dance the COLITA. We purchased the cd and do the colita every day. What a great group of guys. For the ladies, if your interested in getting braids, don't get it done at the hotel it's $40 just walk to the sencond hut on the beach and ask for MARGARITA she'll charge you $25.00 and won't rip your head off or make them to tight. I enjoyed the braids but please remember: PUT SUN BLOCK ON YOU SCALP or were a hat.As for stomach problems, the only problem was my mom who ate tooo much fruit after being forwarned and drank too many pina coladas. Otherwise NO ONE had stomach problems. Just stay away from the fruit and limit the tropical drinks.I can only say that the only mishap was listening to all the rude American guests. Remember that this is a Latin country where the language is spanish. The staff does speak English along with several other languages, but be respectful. There were many guests who were complaining about everything from the rooms to the slow service and other minor little things. Come on, your on vacation. If you want it to be perfect and glamorous then don't go. I can not wait to go again and HIGHLY RECOMEND this resort. A great vacation for the price. If you have any questions just contact me.  
<Date>Jul 27, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sunscape was nice We just returned from the Sunscape on July 21st. We had a really good time, we kept busy doing all sorts of water activities. Please only go through the hotel for any water sports, the salesmen on the beach are a little bit shady! The horseback riding on the beach was fun. The food was okay most of us had some stomach problems but we were also drinking a bit!! Our room was nice, building four third floor. The bed however was not so nice, very uncomfortable!! My husband and I always ask for an upgrade in our room but this time it was not necessary. Our maid was wonderful, so thankful for the crayons and coloring books I brought along, Please if you have time, go to the dollar store and get some, it really made her day. The drinks were good and the service always friendly. The beach was clean but you really have to get up early to get a good spot. We really enjoyed the pool and pool bar and had no trouble getting a raft everyday. I was a little scared after reading some of the reviews on the Sunscape but was pleasently surprised! Try the Sunscape we are glad we did!  
<Date>Jul 23, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very Good Time My fiance and I spent a week from July 9th to the 16th at the Sunscape. We had spent a week at the Riu Bambu two years ago and the Sunscape was very comparable. The BeachThe Riu had a much nicer beach. For anyone that wants a beautiful beach and very nice clean water than the Sunscape may disappoint you. I think that was the one downfall of the place. The water was not carribean turquoise blue. There was a Marina just to the right of the Sunscape and there were approximately 30 boats harbored right in front of the Sunscape. When they would go out to start one up (mostly in the mornings) it would smell like gasoline for a short time. To the left was the shacks that the locals had to sell items. They weren a problem but just took away from the overall view of the area. The seaweed was cleaned up every morning and then by the afternoon a small amount was on the beach again. This wasn a real problem but some may not like that. There always seemed to be enough chairs and finding shade usually wasn a problem.The PoolThe pool was very nice. The only problem here was that people really did get up at 4:00 or 5:00 im the morning to stick towels on the chairs, especially the few that were in the shade. Then most of the day nobody sat in them. If you can handle not having shade by the pool then you would need to get up early to get a spot. The RestaurantsWindows Buffet: The breakfast buffet was very good. We ate the first two nights at the dinner buffet and really thought it was awful. We are not very picky eaters either. We ate all 7 nights at the Riu Buffet two years ago and thought it was wonderful. I heard other guest complain about Windows. It was usually very hot in there as well.American Grill: We tried this place next since we didn care for Windows and it was much better. I had beef fajitas twice and also tried a steak. I enjoyed all of the meals. The workers were all great and very friendly. The food was good and it was very comfortable.Italian: The Italian restaurant I thought was also very good. I had Grilled Shrimp on Angel hair pasta and it was great. The service was excellent as well. This is the only restaurant that men have to wear long pants. There is also garden restaurant next to the beach that didn have as good of service but we ate breakfast there at an outside table right on the beach and it was very nice.All the bars had great service and some made drinks stronger than others but they would get you whatever you wanted. The RoomOur room was very nice. We stayed in building 4 on the third floor close to the beach. It was a good room. The air conditioner worked great and kept it very comfortable. The bathroom was fine with good water pressure. The only bad thing was we were located right across from the American Grill and the Garden Beach Restaurant and at 4:00 in the morning you could hear them banging dishes and they were quite noisy. We had requested building 4 or 5 to be away from the noise of the nightly shows but the noise was loud from the show over there also. It was over by 11:00 and then was quiet after that. I would recommend requesting building 5 to be a little further away. OtherThe Service was great throughout the resort. I thought in general the work staff was nicer than the Riu. Our maid hugged us every day. We took $1 bills to give and they appreciated them. The bartenders and waiters seemed to get a lot of tips but we also would give a couple to a grounds crew person or a bus boy that seemed to be busting their butt and they would be so thankful it was worth it. We often would see them at breakfast at one restaurant and then at dinner at another. They work long days and work very hard.. Although we didn have a child with us it seemed like they had a lot to do for kids. The nightly movie was a lot of fun for them.The beach party on Thursday night was very fun. They played music and had dancing and it was very enjoyable.I would definitely recommend Sunscape for a vacation with one caveat, if the beach and Carribean blue water are the most important thing to you then consider somewhere else. If great service, very good entertainment, a good pool and decent food are more important then the Sunscape will be great for you.  
<Date>Jul 18, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I Wanna Go Back Ok, this is gonna seem really late since my husband and I were there in October 2003 for our honeymoon. We stayed for 8 days. Reason I am on here is because there is serious contemplation of going back for our anniversary. We absolutely loved Sunscape and wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else!! First, I must recommend to ANYONE going that has EVER WANTED TO SWIM WITH DOLPHINS - YOU MUST GO TO THE MANATI PARK. I have always dreamed of swimming with dolphins. Well, we did - FOR $75 a PERSON!! People in our travel group couldn't believe how cheap that was. One woman had done it in HAwaii and paid $200 a pop. It was the most beautiful experience ever - I didn't want to ever get out of that pool. Manati Park was, by far, our favorite part of the trip and we don't even have children yet. We got four pictures taken with them. There is a male and female dolphin. The female is trained to come up and kiss you. The male then pulls you around the pool. Talk about amazing and feeling nature at its best. We also did the Marinarium trip to swim with the sharks and rays. That was really awesome but I agree - watch your toes on the coral - OUCH. But what beautiful pictures you'll get. Take an underwater camera for sure.As for the resort, yeah - we got a bellyache or two. Honestly, people here who are complaining about rude service - the only rudeness we encountered at all was from the travelers to be blunt. There were some people whose behavior really made it obvious why people think Americans are quite borish. Our room was by the adult pool - heard and saw things that made me embarrassed that those people were obviously from America. However, the staff was amazing. Everywhere we went, we got friendly smiles and help with anything we needed. At checkin, we mentioned we were honeymooners. They upgraded our room and we got flowers on the bed. WE got to know some servers by name. Yes, if you tip, they remember you and will go above and beyond. But, let's face it - those poor people are really busting their humps to do what they do and deserve respect. We fell in love with the children outside the resort who were swimming near the pier and with the vendors. They all tried to make you smile in one way or another.Our room was nice enough. Yes, I freaked out over the bugs and had a hard time sleeping soundly without worrying about being bitten. The halls are loud but alot of the disturbance also came from the tourists being loud and obnoxious themselves. Our bathroom was a little ancient but who cares? We weren't there to tour toilets - we were there to experience a lifestyle and culture different than our own. Isn't that what the purpose of vacation is?? I laugh at the people who go and then complain because there is little American music and food? Then why the HECK are YOU GOING TO A FOREIGN COUNTRY?? If you want that, go to a FLorida or California beach silly. I was loving the Spanish flair. DR is definitely more Spanish influenced than Caribbean. But no less wonderful. I agree that the nightlife was a little boring - I felt too old for the disco and too young for the piano bar so we were stuck but the food, the music, everything else was great. Now I am not a seasoned traveler by any means so take my opinion for what it is worth. However, I left there with the warmest feeling I have ever had for any place I have ever visited. I was actually sad to leave. I have never found a more beautiful culture of people than the people in the DR. And other people I know who went agree with me. We plan to go back at some point and go on the excursions we didn't get to do - like the safari. But, I will definitely swim with the dolphins again and sit back and smile when I see the happiness around me.  
<Date>Jul 16, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic time in Punta Cana A group of us (18) along with small children went to the Sunscape Punta Grand from June 21 - 28, 2004. We loved it. The food  drinks were great. There were great restaurants to choose from. We all had a ball and would go back again in a heart beat. I highly recomend two tours that an Apple Rep can set you up with. One was a snorkeling trip (from the 2nd pier by the hotel) - it was great - we swam with sharks and they had a food and drinks on the boat. The other which was fanstastic was a day long trip to a secluded island - well worth the trip. On this you swim with starfish and have an uninhabited island to yourself for the day where they cook up a fabulous lunch and drinks. The water here was crystal clear. The water at the hotel is not crystal clear but it is pretty and we were all in it. No one in our group got sick but at times we did have stomach cramps. It's truly a great, friendly beautiful resort that has it all. Write if you have any questions.  
<Date>Jul 10, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Hated Sunscape I just want to tell you my experience at Sunscape. I came back on July 2nd 2004, and I do not intend to go back to that resort. First off, my reservation was never made. I had paid for a VIP upgrade package through signature, and it was never taken down. The room was very damp and cold. Any paper we had in the room was wet, and damp, do not know why. Every morning, while we were sleeping. Housekeeping would come into our room to clean it, at 7:30 in the morning. The first night we were there, our plane came in at 10:30 p.m. We were told that the Beach Garden restaurant was the only restaurant open at this time to get food. When we get there, they tell us they are closed. Even though they were patrons in there. Being pregnant, and traveling all day, and being hungry did not add to the pleasure. The staff told us that we can get burgers. Fine, but to be ignored, and not being offered anything to drink, and waiting 45 minutes for a burger, did not give a great first impression of the resort. Why were there so many boats parked by the resort, it stinked of gasoline. And there was too much garbage around the beaches. The only thing that was good was the pool was heated. One night I needed to have some tea. I called room service to order 1 coffee, and 1 tea. And a half hour later, the person drops off two plastic cups with hot water covered with saran wrap. No tea bags, sugar, coffee or milk. Asked him for the other stuff, and said he will be right back. Another  hour late, shows up with 1 plastic cup of hot milk with saran wrap on it. But still no tea bags, or coffee or sugar. Needless to say I gave up. Why are there no English speaking people in the bank? They wouldnot give us money in Amrican $, only pesos, which we did not need. Also, on the last day, we got food poisoning from the undercooked burgers served on the beach. That good for pregnant people, isn it?Well at least I had fun on the marinium trip.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Absolutely Awful, Huge Disappointment! We arrived Sunday night, June 20th with the bus dropping us off at the lobby and to the surprise of the Apple Rep (that was on the bus), nobody from the hotel was there to take our bags. We proceeded on to the front desk to check in and they refused our request to be in the same building as our friends. As we were heading to our rooms one of the hotel staff comes running out of nowhere to give us punch and cookies. As we finished that we proceeded on to our room and the same hotel person runs back out with a bottle of rum asking if we wanted some in our drinks that we had drank long ago. That should have been our first clue. It took us a while that first day to find out that they make all of the drinks non-alcoholic (that was a first) unless you specify that you want some, very backwards from any other Caribbean vacation that wee been on. They advertise premium liquors but will not pour those unless you ask for them by name and when you do, they seem very irritated and a lot of times had to go to another bar to find that one bottle they have on the property. There is only one beer available (Presidente) which I have had in the past and liked but this beer that was on draft was awful and may be what made everyone but my wife sick (she doesn like beer) from the 2nd day until we left that following Sunday, the 27th.The room my wife and I stayed in was 5319 in building 5, 3rd floor was an adequate room unless you were planning on sleeping at all during your stay. The room was the noisiest hotel room Ie ever been in, it had a tin roof and when it rained at night it sounded like the roof was caving in and the sound of water leaking in the room which it fortunately wasn, the walls are paper thin as we could hear every conversation and movement from our neighbors on both sides, the local disco next to our building went from midnight to 4:45am every morning along with the rooster going from 2:30am-6am and constant noise from the kids running up and down the halls. The beds had to have been the hardest most uncomfortable mattresses we've slept on. The maids would constantly knock on the door and then just walk right into your room before you had the chance to answer them.This was not a resort that was geared for American tourists as all of the music, day in and day out was nothing but Salsa/Latin music. The disco was a total joke because it was all of the hotel staff from this hotel and all of the hotels in the area and they partied and played all Salsa/Latin music. You definitely didn feel welcome. The resort staff was less than friendly towards us and they always seem to act as though we were inconveniencing them. The pool was extremely warm and needed painting very badly. Kids everywhere diving into the pool and the hotel would only allow about 6 rafts/floats in the pool. The hotel staff around the pool were more interested in picking up the tourist women than actually getting some activities going.We saw our Apple rep (Mark) one time in 8 days and that was during the orientation. Mark was very informative but it would have been nice to know where he was the rest of the time. We would go to the Apple desk at the times that were stated when somebody would be there, but to no avail. We ended up booking our excursions through another travel rep in the hotel lobby. The food was very bland and unimpressive and not sure if this could have caused us to get so sick. The tomatoes (green) in the salsa and on the hamburgers weren ripe which was a little odd. The 2nd night there we put our name in to eat at the American Grill and for some reason the host kept giving tables to people after us. We told the host 4 times that we were standing right there and yet he continued to seat other people. My wife and I made the mistake of sleeping in one day and missed breakfast. Well we tried every restaurant and snack bar between 10:30am ?12:30pm and they all just pointed to their watch and said not open until 12:30pm. Ie personally been to Cancun 8 times, Cozumel 3 times, Aruba, Bermuda, Jamaica, Dominican Republic(Luperon and Puerta Plata), St Lucia, Bahamas and Costa Rica and I would say this was the worst of all the hotels and Ie never been sick on any of these vacations. We love the Caribbean and the beach and will continue to travel there but we would never return to Punta Cana or this hotel.  
<Date>Jul 1, 2004

<Author>hwatte73
<Content>Warning: Do not go to Sunscape I want to start off by saying that I am not a chronic complainer, and in fact, have not found one thing wrong with any vacation that I have been on through Apple Vacations. I am not picky, not hostile, and not, in any way, a miserable person. So, you can trust this review as fair and honest. When I read most of the reviews before going, I assumed that the people who bashe the hotel would have found something wrong with every hotel. But, I realized that the reviews were accurate. If you have another option, take it. I would never go back to the Sunscape.The grounds of the hotel were very pretty, and check-in was a breeze. Even though they said check-in wasn't until 12:00, a room was ready for us at 10:00, and our luggage arrived within minutes after checking in. I found the rooms very cute and very clean. The hotel is smaller than most resorts, which was good in one respect because you didn't have far to walk to the beach and dinner, etc. However, every night felt like a frat party because it was so loud. The noise carried on until 1:00 and 2:00 in the morning -- and not just noise: music, screaming, etc.The beach was very small and there was not enough shade. People were getting up at 4:00 a.m. just to reserve their chairs and palm trees. We got up around 6:00 a.m. and still found some, but by 7:00, everything was taken. The beach was full of seawead and the water was very dirty. A marina was right next to the hotel, and boats were docked in the water. At times, it smelled as if gasoline was being released into the water. I went in the ocean one time, and refused to go back in after that.Every week they hold a beach party and they begin to set up at 9:00 a.m. Becuase of this, we were told by employees that we couldn't lay on the beach, and were told to move our chair into the sun. When I refused, they began to throw tables around me chair, and I was blocked in by tables. When I went to management, I was told to go to the adult pool to lay out (which is topless and there isn't any shade). We ended up laying out by the main pool and it was nice, but again, not enough shade. The pool was nice and the swim up bar was great to have. However, when the guys were cleaning the pool in the morning, we observed then throwing the used drinks that were laying around the pool into the pool, which I found extremely discusting.The staff by the pool was just fabulous, probably the best part of the trip. they constantly came up and tried to get people involved in different activities, and were always upbeat and friendly.The food was just average. I am not a picky eater by any means, but I had a hard time finding food in the buffet restaurant. The a la carte restaurants were very good, however.Ok, here is the really bad part. Everybody got sick. Everybody we talked to had at least one person in the group that got sick. We were told that the chef was baffled by the number of people that got sick. I was so violently ill when I returned to the states that they doctors wanted to hospitalize me. I have lost over 10 pounds in the 3 days that I have been back, and have to go in for weekly blood tests to determine whether the parasite is still present in my body. I cannot eat any solid foods for at least a week, and will be out of work for another week, at the very minimum. Now, I know what some people are thinking: this is a third world country, its a risk that you take. I have been to the DR several times, so have my parents, and we never got sick. I have been to mexico over 5 times, and I have gotten sick occasionly there, but never this severe. This time around, I didn't drink the water, didn't even brush my teeth with the tap water, didn't eat the fruit or any raw vegis. I did everything I was suppose to, and still caught something. If I was the only one, I would think it was a fluke, but honestly, so many people got sick at this hotel that it has to be a hygiene issue with the food and/or the stafff. I would never go back to this resort, and while the resort is cheaper than many others, It is worth the extra money to be safe.  
<Date>Jun 28, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved It Here I recently took the vacation to the DR in June of 04' at the Sunscape Beach Resort and I absolutly loved it. The Hotel was beautiful and all the staff was extremely friendly. I have read others complaints about the place before going, and was a little nervous about my high expectations which were surpassed. I cannot say enough about how beautiful it is in the DR and how nice and informative the people were. The food was better then expected as well. I know for a fact that we will be back to this wonderful money friendly vacation.If taking some of the tours I would recommend the ATV tour and the snorkling w/ the sharks and rays. Me and my girlfriend did not however get the opportunity to do the speed boats (something that I heard was great).

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved it We, my husband, 5 year old and myself, just spent 4 nights at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. The people were extremely nice, the grounds are kept up beautifully. the food is varied and very fresh.If you want shde, get up before 7 am and leave your towels at a cabana at the beach or pool.It only rained at the night of the beach party, after the guys had been working all day setting it up. Others told us they got sick but we didn't, but I guess too much sun, alcohol and fruits you're not used to are a bad combination!My only complaint is with the kids club, the canadian woman was unfriendly and gave both me and my husband the feeling that she didn't want to be bothered. She also didn't adhere to the posted schedule, my daughter never had a donkey ride.Overall, I like Punta cana better than Cancun.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>What a great time!! This resort was amazing. My husband and I visited Sunscape May 16 - 23 and it was a great time. We were married at Sandals, Ocho Rios in 2001, so we were a little leary about going to another resort other than sandals. We were amazed by how beautiful this place was and a $1,000.00 cheaper which was nice. We were greeted with punch and you can add rum if you choose. We went straight to our room with was in building 5 on the 3rd floor and the room was great. We were overlooking the adult pool and you could see the beach past the pool. We had heard the bugs were bad but we didn't have any problems. I woke up with some red bumps on my legs each morning but they never itched or bothered me. The beer, Presidente was pretty good. I'm a budlight drinker so I was a little nervous about the beer but it was actually pretty good. You just have to watch how much you drink cause it will get you the next day. ha ha We spent most of our evenings at the Piano Bar and that place is great and Julio, the bartender was awesome. He's a little quiet at first but once he starts warming up, he's a riot. He loves the Green Bay Packers too so if you really want to warm up to Julio, talk about his packers... Eyyyeee yiiiii yiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiii............. his favorite saying.. Gloria is awesome, she brings you drinks while your sitting outside at night. Everyone here is very nice. The restaurants are nice and the food was great. We had the picture guy take our pics a couple nights so we had some professional pics to take home. We didn't get to have the beach party which was a real bummer so hopefully next time. Don't worry about the seaweed because that is not a problem like some other people say... Also, as far as the water goes, you CAN brush your teeth with it (our apple rep told us it was fine) and we did so and were fine. The only time we got sick was when we drank too much and that was our own fault. The shows are ok, nothing like they were in Jamaica. Overall this place was a great time and I would recommend it to anyone. You can hang out and meet people if you want (Hi Bob and Tanya from Pittsburg) or just be alone. If you go, tell Julio from the Piana Bar hello and Osvaldo from Windows hello too. They really go out of their way to make your vacation wonderful.  
<Date>Jun 15, 2004
