<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>My best vacation yet!! I just got back from vacationing in Punta Cana, Dominican Republic...I stayed at the Sunscape Resort from May 22 thru May 29, 2004. Like many of you I had read many conflicting reviews about this resort. I have been to Mexico twice, Cayman Islands, and Jamaica a couple of times, but have never been as pleased as I was with visiting the Dominican Republic. When we arrived at the airport in Punta Cana it was somewhat confusing. There wasn't really anyone there directing you where to go, but first off you have to pay your $10 tourist card fee and then go thru customs. After that you will collect your luggage and then locate what company you are with...we were with Apple Vacations. Then you get directed to the correct shuttle van. It was about a 30 minute drive to our hotel. At first you might be wondering what type of place you have come to...there is trash all over the roads and in people's yards...much worse than I have seen Jamaica or Mexico. I had e-mailed Sunscape a few days before our arrival (I went with my mom...I'm 30 and she's 47) and requested 3rd floor in Building #5 since all the reviews suggested it. We got there around 3:30 p.m. and to our surprise got checked into a 3rd floor building #5 room. Everything went very smoothly...we went to our room and the bellman brought our luggage up about 20 minutes later. There aren't any elevators at the resort except in the lobby. So keep that in mind when you are given a room, however the 3rd floor is so nice because of the very high vaulted ceilings. The rooms are very adequate. Definitely not the best I have ever stayed in, but probably equilavent to a Best Western. You do have a mini fridge in your room, quite a few cable channels if that's what you like, and the bathroom is pretty nice...the sink is separate from the shower and toilet which is nice I think. About the only complaint I ever had with our room was the beds being pretty uncomfortable (basically almost like laying on a box spring), and the lighting isn't the greatest. The ceiling fan was definitely an added bonus though. I never had any water pressure problems like some reviews. I would have to say one of the best things about the trip were the people. I did not run across anyone who was rude. It seemed that everyone truly loves their job there. The beach was absolutely gorgeous. Not a bit of problems with seaweed. There was plenty of fine sandy beach area. The water was a little cold, but you appreciated it after laying out for a while. The water was perfectly clear. I didn't have any of the vendors come and bug me on the beach. You do need to get up pretty early to get the spot you want on the beach and at the pool. We got out and about around 8 a.m. and all the shaded and partly shaded spots at the pool were taken and quite a few spots on the beach were taken too. A lot of people get up really early and take a towel or book to reserve their spots and then I guess go back to bed for a while. Because lots of spots were reserved, but not many people around. The dress code at Sunscape is very casual. I never had to get more dressed up than a pair of shorts and a T-shirt. Evan at the Italian restaurant at night we wore shorts (needs to be a sleeved shirt and guys do need to wear dress pants). The food was good, but almost too fancy of an atmosphere for me. We ate at Windows Buffet for dinner only one night and weren't very impressed at all. The only place we saw open for breakfast was the buffet and it was pretty good for breakfast. They would make omlets, waffles, french toast, pancakes, all kinds of pastries and bread, several varieties of fresh juices, bacon, eggs, cereal, fruit bar, and even would make a smoothie for you. For dinner we ate at the American Grill a couple of nights and were pretty pleased with the food. They have American and Mexican dishes. I had the steak fajitas and the steak another night. Both were really good! They play country music. The Thursday night beach party was absolutely fantastic. They literally spend the entire day setting up for this. The food choices are unimaginable. Just being able to eat with the sand under your feet was an enjoyable experience. The nightly entertainment was pretty good. In my opinion pretty much like a cruise ship type stuff. We only made it to 3 of the shows, the Tribute Show, Latin Show and the Beach Party show. The 1st two were dancing with different costumes and music and the Beach Party was audience participation.We went on 1 excursion...the Outback Safari. I highly recommend it to anyone wanting to experience the real Dominican Republic. You get to visit a school, a house, a market place, and then the most beautiful beach I have ever been to. We left at 8 a.m. and didn't get back till around 6 p.m. Definitely bring sunscreen and I would bring some kind of hat if I had it to do over again. My face got pretty burned riding around in the big jeep type thing all day.This review has ended up being a book and I know I have left lots of stuff out. But, if you have any questions at all I would be more than happy to answer whatever you want to know about the resort or Dominican Republic itself. I am already planning my next trip for December!  
<Date>Jun 7, 2004

<Author>soccerman22
<Content>Amazing Place. The best small resort we've every stayed at. We moved from Catalonia Bavaro after three days because Catalonia wasn't the 5 Star resort we were promised. Sunscape was. We took the 5 Apple Square Deal and didnt know which hotel we would be at until we checked in at the airport. DO NOT DO THIS - especially when your taking such a major vacation. I think it's best to know where you are going to stay but we were promised a Five Star Resort. We spent 3 days at Catalonia before finally giving up and moving to Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. The 2 places were like Night and Day. Catalonia only had domestic drinks except for one bottle of Absolut that only ever seemed to appear when we tipped. The place was really old and dirty. The final straw came on the 3rd day when we sampled the mexican restaurant. If you can't get mexican food right...... The resort was old, dirty, poorly kept, the food is awful, the pool is dirty, the plants on the grounds are dying, the AC in the room doesn't work and leaks. 3 days in we had had enough, and we moved to Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. At first, The Apple reps at the Catalonia (locals) refused to move us wanting us to pay addition $$ to move to a cheaper resort. We called our travel agent who contacted Apple. They waived the $25 transfer fee. We still had to pay $13 each more for each night, but it was totally worth it. Top shelf liquor, juicy steaks, beautiful clean, new resort, amazing staff. We also found 10 other people that had moved from the Catalonia. And to top it off... who did we see on the last night in the club........ the local Apple Reps from the Catalonia. We would go back to Sunscape anytime. One of the best things about Sunscape is the size, it's smaller than most resorts so it's very easy to get around and you're quick to meet people. Also once a week, there is the Manager's Cocktail party. The manager of the resort comes out and introduces all the main staff. It's a really nice touch and proves how committed they are to making sure the resort is the best. I can't recommend this place enough.   
<Date>Jun 5, 2004

<Author>laurabeth
<Content>Best holiday ever. My boyfriend and I came to Sunscape Punta Cana Grand on 12th May for two weeks and it was our first time in the Carribian.We were both very suprised at the quality of service, food and accommodation that we received.The staff were really friendly and done everything they could to make our stay as pleasurable as possible. The food was excellent. There was a wide choice of places to eat which was all very enjoyable. There was not one meal that we ate on holiday that we did not enjoy.. The American Grill was particularly nice. Osvaldo and Pena who work there were great waiters and done everything they could to make sure that we were happy. I would have to say that the Umberella/Piano bar was the best bar there. It had a very relaxed atmosphere. The bar man, Julio was very funny and made us feel very welcome.The rooms were very clean with maid service about three times a day to fill up the mini bar..This has got to be the best holiday that we have been on and will not hesitate to come back again next year! I would definatly reccommend this place to everybody.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Unforgettable effort by them to make our stay special We have never visited the islands, so we are coming at this review with nothing with which to compare our experience. The resort is beautiful, the staff is completely dedicated to providing guests with wonderful food, atmosphere and experience. The staff members pat your children on the head, and always return your smiles. They work long long hours, and maintain an incredible cheerful demeanor. They work hard and live simply, but they have joy; the rest of us could learn a lot from watching their joy.We enjoyed Windows buffet, with theme nights every night; in and out in 12 minutes flat for one breakfast (kids get tired of sitting in a restaurant when there's fun to be had). Da Mario's was classy and delicious, but we only went once because it's a long time for kids to sit. American Grill is a fun reminder of home; Garth Brooks playing, steaks cooking. I recommend eating early (close to 6:00) to avoid crowds. Beach Cafe has good food, but it's loud-- you can eat outside. A simple room service menu is available 24/7, and various food items are available throughout the resort (self serve ice cream bar, pizzas, popcorn, nachos, etc.) BE CAREFUL WHAT YOU EAT! Three of the four of us became ill-- two of us, it ruined a day. No puttiing our finger on what did it, as we all ate and drank different things, but avoided the tap water. This is definitely an issue on the island-- seemed especially prevalent among the 11 year old kids-- too many Shirley Temples? Be smart-- don't do too many Pina Coladas, and perhaps ask for drinks without ice. The Explorer's Club was different than I imagined. Only about 7 or 8 kids in the entire resort participated at one time; which seems low for a 300+ room resort. My 6 year old loved it; my 11 year old rarely participated. This was a little disappointing as we had planned for both kids to busy themselves with this program. The staff was apparently kind and cheerful; but there was one day that we met the kids on the beach and they were being watched by who I think was a guest because the camp leader was trying to find someone to give donkey rides. It's just very casual and loose and although my son enjoyed it and looked forward to the activities every day, it's not as put together as you might expect. I recommend the Outback Safari as well as the Marinarium. These are extra cost, as they are not a part of the resort, but they are wonderful activities that show you much of the area's land and sea. The guests we met who were more well traveled than us, we picked their brains and they spoke very highly of Sunscape. They agreed it's beautiful, well kept, and the food is better than most other resorts.We took this trip through Apple Vacations; the representatives at the resort are there to help and they really know their stuff. Take full advantage of their knowledge!! Finally, it's a beautiful place, the Dominicans are beautiful people, and our experience, though different than I thought it would be, was truly unforgettable. I'd say, Go with an open mind. You are going to another country, and it is real, and beautiful, and you should do everything to make your experience authentic. Speak a little Spanish, see the island, and just enjoy. Oh, and if your pillows are too flat, use your Spanish/English dictionary and a dollar, and you'll surely score some fluffy pillows and as a bonus, extra beer for your minibar!  
<Date>May 24, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Vibrant, friendly good value for money We went last July for 2 weeks, a family of 3 with a 3 year old. We had a truly wonderful time. Weather was glorious, room big with ocean view if you crane your neck from the balcony! It was great, my son especially enjoyed the outdoor kids cinema each night (Shrek, Scooby Doo etc) and we loved the food, snacks and cocktails(!). We all had upset stomachs but we've been to the DR before and had the same. It was mostly populated by Americans (as you can tell by the reviews) and sometimes Americans can be a little loud (sorry! but true!) so we tried to get the restaurants etc early to avoid the crowds. We absolutely LOVED the catamaran trip and would recommend to all. It was very loud in our room at night but having said that we had to get back in for 9pm as my little boy couldn't stay up! Excellent value for money, i'm looking to book somewhere else in the carribbean this year but can't find anyway to match the combination of price and quality.  
<Date>May 20, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Immaculate and SO Friendly My husband, parents, daughter(14 months) and I went from May 1-8, 2004. The resort is absolutely immaculate and beautiful. Small but homey. The staff was fabulous with my daughter who was less than well-behaved at times. Food was great, beaches clean. I can only complain of one thing and that is sometimes there is quite a wait in the restaurants from sit down to dessert. This was only a problem for us because my daughter is so young and has a VERY short attention span. G0 to Sunscapes. It was beautiful.

<Author>Fedman
<Content>You will love it, We did I know this is a little late, we stayed from 4/17 to 4/24 and all I can say is this is the best place we have been to in the Caribbean, we have stayed at Grand Lido Negril, Breezes Runaway bay, Hedo II, and Grand Sport Villa Ocho Rios. Over the past few years we thought that Jamaica experience was not what it was, so we gave Punta Cana a tryAnd we are glad we did. When we got to Sunscape we were greeted with cookies and rum punch, we arrived before noon and our room was not ready, no big deal, I bought a cigar and hit the pool bar and we were greeted like we had been there for weeks,After about 2 hours one of the desk staff was walking by us and ask if there was anything she could do, I lightheartedly said we could use a room, She stopped what she was doing and walked up to the front desk with in seconds we had our room, and the wait was worth it, form our balcony we could see the beach and the pool bar. I cannot say enough good things about the staff. My girlfriend and I have never had service like this in our life. Every worker we ran into would say hello and the bartenders would stop us to ask us how we were doing, even when they were off duty. I tipped a buck when it was my turn to get the drinks not because I'm tipper, because they deserved it, at times we would just be sitting around without a drink and Nicolas (Rum and cookie greeter) would stop what he was doing and go get us drinks.The food?.let me just say I have spent a lot of money for less quality, we did not have one bad meal, and the beach dinner was A1 food in a A1 setting, I over heard people complaining that the night of the beach dinner they closed the other restaurants and they had to eat on the beach?.HELLO why did you come to the Caribbean if you did not want to enjoy a vary nice dinner on the beach. The burgers on the beach were not a Wendy's but they were not a White castle, it way worked for me after 4 hours in the Vary hot sun, drinking beers.The rooms were ok nothing to brag about, bed was hard (beers will take care of that problem) and speaking of beers if you put a few bucks under the empty beer bottles every day, the maid will load up your frig with beers for you, I never opened the frig with out seeing at least 5 beers in it.Also one day I left my safe key in the lock, the maid found it when she was cleaning the room and took it to security,I called down to the desk and they had the head of security come to our room with it, he had me make sure all our stuff was there and gave it back to me. Nothing was stolen and I had a few hundred bucks in the safe. If you like Lobster you must go to the Green Parrot (located on the beach) you will have to pay for it but you cannot beat a grill cooked lobster on the beach to end the day. I have only a few minor negative things that bugged me. The first, kids at the swim up bar, I do not like waiting forThe bar tender to get me a drink because someone's brat is playing motorboat while the bartender is making a drink for them, The kids should have there own pool away from the swim up bar.Second is the slime ball rude lazy bums that feel the need to get up at 5:00am to go down to the pool or the beach put out towels on chairs and go back to bed or to breakfast, every day we had a hard time finding chairs, there were no people in sight, but all the chairs were taken, we ran into a person that put towels on chairs down at the beach at the pool then went on a 4 hour off resort trip?Rude! The third is the adult pool does not have a swim up bar, is void of music and is stuck on the backside of the resort where you get no wind and no view of the beach.And the last is, if you have a room near the Tex Mex it does get noisy in the early AM. The staff uses carts to move the food to the restaurant and you will hear every crack in the pavement it hits?but then again if we got up early this would not be a problem.Bottom line you will get your bang for the buck and have fun doing it.  
<Date>May 19, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Just Returned I've been reading these reviews for a couple of months in anticipation of our vacation. Some reviews were great and some made me very nervous. So.......now I decided to write my own review. Oh.......by the way, none of us got sick while we were there - I was really worried about that after reading some of these reviews!Me and my husband spent a week at Sunscape, May 7th thru the 14th. Sunscape is a beautiful property. It's a small resort, which I kind of liked! We stayed in building 5 which was really close to everything.....beach, restaurants, etc. (I think the best buildings to stay in are 4 or 5 because they are so close to everything). Anyway, the resort was spotless, I never even saw a piece of paper or cigarette butt on the ground (smoking is allowed at all the restaurants, except Italian - or at least I didn't see anyone smoking in the Italian). I can't say enough about the cleanliness and manicured look of the grounds......very nice! Our room was a nice size but not luxurious, however, kept very clean and stocked with plenty of soda, beer and bottled water. We really were only in the room to sleep anyway! The maid's carts were a little noisy at times, but this can't be helped because there is no carpeting on the floors. They come into your room a few times during the day and evening so if you don't want to be disturbed, be sure to put the sign on the door. They give you a safe key (free), but if you lose it they will charge you $100 - it's best to just wear it on your neck. There was an ironing board, iron and hair dryer in the room.The waiters, bartenders and basically all of the staff were wonderful! I think we had only 1 waitress during the week at the buffet that was not friendly (she didn't even speak to us - just kept coming back to pour coffee, but never even broke a smile). All the others were always smiling, trying to teach you Spanish words and just really trying to make everyone relax and have a good time. Tips were included in our Apple package, however, we felt we still wanted to tip.......these people do not get paid very well and they all work sooooo hard!Buffet was varied........some of the foods we did not recognize, but it was fun to try some different foods. Breakfast buffet was great! They had everything you could want......egg station (any way you wanted them), pancakes, waffles, french toast, plus all other things some of which I tasted and others that did not look appetizing - at least not for breakfast.We got great service at the Italian Restaurant, they were very attentive and we definitly tipped there - we actually ate there 3 nights! (grilled shrimp over linquini was very good and so was the tortolini appetizer as well as the mussels. American grill was fun.......the staff dress up with cowboy hats and they play country western music at the restaurant. My cousin has been at Sunscape 3 times and he told me the steaks were a bit tough and he said to order the medallions of beef because it was filet mignon.......so.........that's what we ordered and it was very good.........very tender and definitly tasted like filet mignon to me.We absolutely loved the fruit stand on the beach.....we made a stop there at least twice a day for fresh pineapples, watermelon, cantaloupe, honey due, mango's, coconut, etc. It was sooooo refreshing and she cut it right in front of you and it was the sweetest fruit I ever tasted. Pool  Beach: Pool was very nice. I'm not really a pool person, but the pool was always spotless so we did use it. We usually started the day at the beach because there's a great breeze there (some days a little too windy, but it feels good in that hot sun). Even with the wind I was surprised how the sand did not blow all over you like it does at our beaches. Anyway, we usually spent most of the morning and part of the afternoon at the beach and then we'd move over to the pool and just float around on large comfortable mats. They have a swim up bar that was fun in the pool. We even brought our cigarettes in the water so we could sit on the stools at the bar and have a drink and cigarette........LOL They did have activities going on during the day.......you can do them if you choose.......no one harrasses you to participate. They play pool volleyball, basketball, bingo, games, dance lessions, exercise classes, stretching classes, etc. Most of these activities take place around the pool and we were mostly on the beach.They also have an adult pool where topless sunbathing is allowed (this is behind building 5). By the way, topless sunbathing is also allowed on the beach but not at the main pool. Beach was very clean.........yes, there was some seaweed in the water, but they do a great job of removing it each morning.......they work so hard at this that it is amazing to just sit and watch them in the mornings. They do this all by hand too! They actually had a screen and 2 guys were in the water using the screen to collect seaweed and then there were a bunch of them raking the seaweed with an ordinary rake and making small piles on the beach....then a truck comes and they throw it in a truck and take it away. It's like a never-ending job! Like I said, the beach area was very well maintained, plenty of lounge chairs (you just had to get up early to save them if you wanted to be under a hut for shade, although there are plenty of palm trees for shade). We never had a problem finding a lounge chair on the beach, although they were harder to find at the pool........seems people saved their pool chairs from early in the morning and they were still empty when we went to the pool at 2 p.m. (all saved, but no one sitting in them). I just think that's plain rude! The only disappointment I had with the beach was the choppiness of the water (and Sunscape has no control over that). We had taken our snorkeling equipment and the water was just too choppy for good snorkeling- this could be because of the time of year that we went - I was told by a dominican that this is their rainy season. We did end up booking the Marinarium Tour, but the water was very choppy for that too and the current was very strong......we had a very hard time trying to swim to the various reefs so that was a disappointment. I thought that tour was way over priced too at $70/person. We've done way better snorkeling tours for a lot less money in Cozumel, Grand Cayman, Aruba and St. Thomas and the experience was way better!By the way, we did take long walks to the left of the resort (pass the vendors) every morning and after walking by some of the other resorts I realized that Sunscape did have the nicest beach area......the other resorts looked worn and torn. There are some boats in front of Suncape just like other posters said, however, I never smelled any fuel from those boats and I thought they were pretty to look at.....I mean water should have boats in it......LOLVendors: We decided to do the shopping thing so we went to look at the goods on the beach. We went in our bathing suits and without any money....we figured this way they could not harrass us and if we saw something we wanted we'd ask them to hold it and go get money. Well, they were amazing.......I actually did find things in 3 of the huts (you do have to wheel and deal with them, but they were all very pleasant). Anyway, I spent $21 at this one hut and asked him to hold it for us and we'd be back with our money - he just told us to take it with us and come back with the money later. They did this at the other 2 huts too! This just blew me away that they trusted us to take the goods and come back in the next few hours to pay them! This really left a great impression on me! I said to this one How do you know I'm going to come back and he just said I trust you. Of course, me and my husband went right to our room to put our stuff away and went right back to pay all 3 of them. Don't forget, you do have to wheel and deal with them, but it was a way better experience than I had when we were in Jamaica! I mean for $21 I ended up getting 4 lbs of coffee, a magnet and a Caribbean print button down shirt for my grandson. They originally wanted $19 just for the shirt! So......don't be afraid to deal with them.It seems like they had a very good program for kids. All the kids seemed to keep busy at the kids club. Every night at 7:30, they showed a movie on a large screen right outside and they had a show every night at 9:30. The theatre is outside so I don't know what would happen if it rained - guess there would be no show! We were lucky, we only had a few showers that did not last long.They gave us an evaluation form for fill out and they asked for suggestions, etc. The one thing I did put down on that form was that I thought they should have more to do in the evening. The only choices after the show were to go to the disco (which was really full of young adults - 20ish - and it was a pretty small room too and very loud with strob lights) or to go to the Piano Bar (entertainment alternated every other night in the piano bar - one night a saxophone player was in there and the next a piano player that had us do Kareoke). So........for us middle aged people it ended up being the Piano Bar, but after seeing the same entertainer the entire week.......it got old. My suggestion was that they needed another lounge.....maybe with softer music and some dance music for the middle aged people that wanted to dance. I mean we were there an entire 7 nights and the only time I heard a slow song to dance to was when the Saxophone Player played some. There was an outside bar too that a lot of people tended to just hang at after the show. By the way, we enjoyed all the shows........the dancers are great and work really hard and the audience participation shows were hilarious. Most days after the show we were really pretty tired anyway (being in the sun all day really knocks you out), but it would have been nice to have at least one other option for something to do after the show.Bartenders were all great and by the way, they do have brand name liquors - if you want them you just have to ask for them. The Dominican people are very warm and humble and definitly left a lasting impression on me.Overall, we had a very good time and were very satisfied with the resort. We usually take cruises for our vacation and are kept very active on those cruises, but we wanted to just go away and relax this time and we definitly got that at Sunscape! If this is what you are looking for you will definitely enjoy the resort!  
<Date>May 18, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great place...will go back again definitely.  My wife and I went to the Sunscape Grand the week of May 3 - 10th. What a marvelous place. The grounds were spotless, well maintained and absolutely gorgeous. We loved the fact that the resort was smaller than the others. We tried all the restaurants and DaMario's was fantastic. To be honest, we mostly ate at Windows and we were extremely happy with the food and service. We brought some one dollar bills for tipping and we did so most of the time. Don't let anyone tell you that you have to tip every time. That is simply not true. We were in building number 4 on the main floor and we were very happy that we were. It is away from the stage and noise. However, by 11 p.m. the shows were all over and noise was not a factor. The beach was very nice and our resort was the only one that continously raked the seaweed. There was some seaweed on the very windy days, but it was not a problem at all. I strongly remcommend this resort and would definitely go back again. A big hello to Daniel (my buddy) who always had a smiling face and was eager to help at any time.  
<Date>May 16, 2004

<Author>TheCOPirate
<Content>Fantastic!!! My wife, daughter, son-in-law and I visited the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand in February 2004. We had some concerns because of some of the reviews we had read before going. WE ALL HAD A FANTASTIC TIME!!! The people were great, the food was delicious, the rooms were fine although we could hear the staff getting ready for the next days events in the night. There was very little seaweed on the beach or in the ocean.I would definately return to this resort without hesitation. The property from the grounds to the rooms was very clean and well taken care of. I have traveled to Jamaica, Puerto Rico, Mexico, and Hawaii. For the price, the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand can't be beat.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Really a 4.5...but rounded up to a 5. The Sunscape in Punta Cana is outstanding! The resort is small enough so that you feel at home, but large enough that it has everything you could ask for and more. The people that work at the resort are fabulous. The week of April 24-May1 was a slow week (I estimated less than 40% occupancy) so the Beach Garden Cafe was not open for Breakfast or Dinner, limiting your dining options. Also, the big beach party was cancelled mid-week because of stronger winds and with no attempt to re-schedule (which they had apparently done the week before).Weeds are a problem at the 2 resorts down the beach who do not diligently work at this problem like the Sunscape does. Only 1 day out of 7 the Sunscape had a weed problem. Find a bartender that you like and take good care of him...it will pay dividends like International brands and fast friendly service. I took $100 US in singles just for tipping maids, waiters and bartenders. The rooms are big and clean, but not luxurious. The food at the Italian restaurant was great for dinner and the Tex Mex and buffet were good. All in all, this family of 4 enjoyed our time there and if returning to Punta Cana would choose the Sunscape again.  
<Date>May 10, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Pleasantly Surprised Visited April 29-May6/04My husband and I just returned from a very relaxing stay at the sunscape. From the time we stepped off the plane and walked into the Punta Cana Airport we were pleasantly surprised at how warm and friendly the people were. After staying in Mexico last year and experiencing , to say the least, a not so memorable time, this was Amazing. We were very sceptical about our choice in resorts, but our worries were soon put to rest upon arrival. The lobby of this resort is beautiful, as is the rest of it. They work very hard to maintain the beauty of this place. I can't stress enough how friendly, and helpful the people at this resort are. The service was perfect, the food awesome, and we're fussy eaters too!! The American Grill was fun, the Italian classy and delicious!! Windows was awesome too .Especially having a chef like Fernando! He's the best,. Everything fresh.  The Beach was beautiful. Yes , there was some seaweed, but we're from Canada eh! You haven't seen seaweed until you've visited the Atlantic Beaches! The nice thing about the beach too,is that there is always a beautiful breeze. So, no matter how hot it got, the breeze made you feel like you were in heaven! The entertainment was fun and they always got the audience to participate which was a blast! I think some people had too much Presidente!! Eh Paul!The beach vendors that were on the beach were very amusing with the way they approached people.At least they were to us. It's there job and the way they were trained in their country to make a sale. Don't knock til you've lived there. We are very fortunate to live in Canada. They are only trying to provide for their families. I would have to say the only negative that I can think of is their internet access. It was very slow. I tried to e-mail home and by the time that computer actually got to my account my time was up! So bring a lap top if you must do anything on the computer!All in all our experience was awesome and we will definately go back to this resort !  
<Date>May 8, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Average, but beyond average When we first arrived, I was disappointed. The kid's pool is very small, the rooms are dated and the beach was mediocre. However, the longer we stayed, the more we liked it. The staff goes overboard to be friendly. I was traveling with a 3 year old, so she didn't fit into the kids day camp, but she still had a great time. The food does get tiresome after a few days, and there are no other dining options, but we survived. Would I go back -- no. I'd go one class up.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Paradise My boyfriend and I and another couple went to Punta Cana 7/2-7/8 2003... I know this is late, but it might help some of you make decisions about summer travel. COME HERE! Our trip began rocky with a plane problem and we were delayed. Apple gave us a credit which we are using to come back to the DR in a month. That was our only problem, everything else was amazing! The grounds are breathtaking, the resort is just the right size with everything being not too far away. Our room was lovely and was kept lovely by the maid. We overlooked the kids area with the 2 donkeys. It was fun to take them apples from the fruit stand. (mmmmm- fresh fresh fresh)  The food was great! You have lots of choices. We liked the Italian restaurant and the cowboy themed place too. Pizzas, burgers etc for lunch. Dinner can be formal or laid back. Free flowing drinks.  I have to say that the people here are incredibly hard working. The animation staff play games, teach aerobics, etc then they put on a wonderful show at night and then they party with you in the disco! You'll always find a smile on their faces too. The bartenders take care of you, suggest things, and are entertaining.  The excursions were great. If you only pick one, go to the Marinarium. Snorkeling, shark sightings (nocturnal sharks) a party barge, dancing... its just wonderful. The nice English lady even hooked me up with a wonderful stable, El Pat. I was able to fullfill my dream of galloping on the beach just like the movies! (they let me ride english saddle too!!)  We took the trip to Santo Domingo as well. If you are into history you will love it. Also, it is neat to see the country side.  There is so much to say! If you are thinking about going I would encourage you. We enjoyed our time there so much we want to move there!  The 4th of July party was wonderful. They threw us a huge beach party with barbeque, dancers, a rock band (flown in from the states) flags, balloons the whole works!  The adult pool is the place to make friends. I found the guests to be friendly too. We met people from all over and ended up accumulating dining companions over our 7 day trip.  I really didn't want to go home.  We'll return to Sunscape again and again!  
<Date>Apr 21, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Relaxing time at the Sunscape We stayed at Sunscape 4/10-4/17. The resort is very clean and well cared for and the workers are constrantly cleaning. THe housekeeper was awesome-they clean your room 2-4 times a day. We stayed in building 4. It is close to adult pool and far enough away from the stage to get some releif from the noise. The rooms are comfortable. The food is just okay--We are a bit picky but there was always something that we can find that was decent. The meats at Windows were tough at times. The best meal is medallions of beef (fliet mignon) at the Tex-mex american grill. The american grill has the best food. Stay away from the fish stew. Windows is great for Breakfast and lunch! The hamburgers from the outside grill are gross! It is mystery meat! The drinks are awesome and Luis at the adult pool is absolutelu fabulous. You dont even have to move off your chair. It can be near impossible to get a chair at the beach with a hut cabana. They are gone by 6 AM. And the sun is REALLY hot! I mean sunscreen is a necessity even for dark screened folks! The disco is fun and the staff is wonderful. Beach can be stirred up at times with seaweed but is pretty. Our major problem was that we did get sick as did every single person we met at the sunscape. Major stomach cramps and impending time spent on the toilet is the common experience. We spoke to others from other resorts and they did not get sick at all. Every person we met at Sunscape got sick!! This place is great for a completely relaxing vacation spent by the pool or beach! I may go back some day!  
<Date>Apr 20, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>So Relaxing! My boyfriend and I just returned from the Sunscape and overall we really enjoyed it! All-inclusive resorts are so easy..put the wallet away and forget about it! We brought about 100 dollars in singles on the advice of another review and boy did it make a difference in the level of service we got! We tipped the chambermaids every day and they overstocked our mini-bar with juices and extra beer and water. They also left us a case of water, which was definitely needed. Don't drink the tap water! We noticed if we tipped the bartenders right before they poured our drinks they were nice and strong. The staff remembered us wherever we went and made sure we were well-taken care of. It was so much fun to speak what little Spanish I know with the staff, we even had a sailing lesson that was mostly in Spanish. We stayed in building 5 on the third floor, I would advise everyone to request building 4 or 5 so that you are far away from the late-night noise of the pool bar and shows. The beach was soft and beautiful and I didn't mind the seaweed that others have complained about! Come on, it is the ocean after all! We learned that you have to wake up before 7am to reserve chairs or a palapa (beach hut). Shade is at a premium! Being from Manhattan, I have to admit that we are quite spoiled when it comes to food. The food at Sunscape was pretty good, though a lot of it was kind of heavy and oily. Don't even try to stay on a diet there. My low-carb high veggie plan went out the window! Windows, the buffet retaurant was the best for breakfast and dinner. We usually had burgers for lunch from the beach bbq. Our favorite feature was the fruit bar on the beach...any kind of tropical fruit was cut for us and we sure ate a lot of it! The Beach Garden cafe kind of sucked so we avoided it and American Grill was just ok. Da Mario's the Italian place was pretty good though we both got a bout of stomach upset after eating there for the second time. Overall, we had a great time resting in the sun away from the noise and craziness of New York City. The resort was spotless, quiet and a very happy, upbeat place. The staff work really hard and deserve all tips they get. We used all the water sport toys and went horseback riding and enjoyed ourselves every day! The only negative was that we had trouble getting a palapa more than once during the entire week and that two of the restaurants were nothing exciting. However, I would go back to Sunscape again because it was clean, quiet and comfortable. There were no annoying crowds or wristbands. We walked over to the other resorts next door and there were so many people jammed up against each other on the beach and by their pools. Plus they all had those ugly plastic wristbands! Definitely check out Suncape if you visit the Domincan Republic. Please email me with any questions! I'd be happy to help!  
<Date>Apr 13, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Bring the kids!!!! Just got back from Punta Cana(March19-22,04).This was my 2nd trip to D.R. Sunscape was EXCELENT! I went with my friend for a little mini-trip from our husbands and kids. I however felt guilty when I seen all the things for kids to do at this place!!!! They had staged shows FEATURING the kids..(like run-way models!)They had ceramic paintings, tables filled with legos, a huge ship filled with sand, playgyms, and even a teen center! The staff even plays ball with the boys and volleyball with the girls! If I go again, the kids must come! But just because there were alot of kids, it doesn't stop us adults from having fun! Right after the kids staged shows were the regular shows which were awesome! There's lots of audience participation things there. FUN FUN FUN. Our room had 2 double beds, very clean. The only problem any of us had there was that when it rained HARD, there is no doorways to the stairs .....its all open, so on the 1st and 2nd floors, the rain would sometimes come into peoples rooms. (we were on 3rd floor, so no problems) The staff was extremely nice. The whole resort was clean. The beach did have alot of seaweed, but it was only due to the big tropical storms that they have in the spring. I was there last fall, and there was no seaweed at all! Depends on the season. The crew is constantly cleaning it up as soon as it drifts in. I went on the outback safari tour ($84)..it makes you appreciate how lucky we are. Went on the Saona Island tour.....it was beautiful.($70?)well worth it. It was just mainly a place to relax and eat....got togo to a place where they let you get out in the open sea and swim with starfish. Went to the Marinarium. (GO THERE!)got to swim with nurse sharks and stingrays. The snorkeling was incredible. After that they take you to a spot in the sea where you can get out and walk and the tour guide walks through the water with rum and coke. Sunscape, and these tours ......want to see you have a good time. They are CONSTANTLY giving you beer, rum....you name it. And trust me, they are not shy on the amounts! I spent one whole day sick from all the liquor I had the day before.....not because of the food! The food was so good. Food was available any time you want it. All kinds of food. People who complain about this hotel must be the richy, spoiled people b/c I'm a normal average person and to me, this was true paradise. BUT, I'll bring the kids and hubby next time!!!!!  
<Date>Apr 12, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Food No Good Every thing is Deep Fried Well, we stay at the resort from March 27th through April 3rd 2004. The staff was great, the grounds were beautiful. The beach was nice. The entertainment was great. Thumbs up to HANS. However:My personal opinion on the food and the opinion of my party is everything at this resort is FRIED and reapplied with more oil and then some more. They should invest in a BBQ or a grill. The selection at Da Mario's and American Tex Mex was not great and I ate only once at each location. The buffet was the best resturant with a better selection. But once again very oily. I would not go back to this hotel because of the poor selection of the food and because of the way of the food is prepared.I stayed at room 1310. Very high ceiling. <Author>sabaali
<Content>Resort Good - not the Beach Resort Facilities:- The food was the average buffet variety, was okay. The fresh juices were great (esp the chinos). The breakfast smoothie stand where you could pick the fruits you wanted was good.- For a resort, the pool was small. The main pool had a lot of people all the time. The adult pool was small too and not too clean. - The grounds were very nice. So were the rooms. We had three rooms, two in bldg 2 and one in bldg 5. Have to mention that we paid for a ocean view room in bldg 5 but were dissappointed with it. What we could see were these rickety beach huts, where one day, I actually saw a local taking a shower with a bucket (with his shorts on - thank God)!- Entertainment: Was good, I felt sometimes it was a little too adult oriented while the kids were there. I think one of those contests were act like a gigolo etc.- Staff: I though everyone was great and worked hard to make everyone's stay pleasant.Beach: My big problem was the beach. I have been to Turks  Caicos (TC) twice (once at Beaches and once at Club med), and I have to say that the beach was a big dissapointment. I don't know if this is because I have seen TC which is known for having one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. The beach was not at all blue in front of the resort (as shown in brochures and post cards). I did not step in that water, but did go for a long walk and noticed that the quality of the water was much, much better if you walked a mile up. There were a lot of people trying to sell time shares right outside the resort. Also, there were locals with their boat coming into areas where people were swimming and there was no one to stop them, my nephew almost had a close call, he was snorkling and the boat went right past him.Apart from the water, the sand was good. The palm trees were very pretty and there was always a good breeze. One thing I really liked was a sunscape fruit stall at the beach. They had the most exotic fruits, like cheeko, sugar cane, papaya etc, cut write in front of you. Many topless bathers were at the beach.One thing to mention was that we did receive a note from management after 3 days of our stay stating that we had a choice of going to their iberosatr 6 star resort ( i think that was the name) if we agreed to empty our rooms, supposedly they had over booking. We chose not to do that.In summary, I think the resort was very good for the price. Unfortunately, I could not enjoy it because I hated the water at the beach, I was expecting it to look like the pictures and it was not like that.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Recommendations Just got back and wanted to added a couple comments (dont misinterprete - we liked sunscape).1) Bring a light sweater - sometimes there is a nice draft if the wind blows from the ocean. 2) Bring a large mug - the cups are only 10 oz's. It will save you a trip or two to the bar 3) Bring loads of singles or ask the bartenders for change in a worse case 4) Stay away from the red meat - stick to chicken. 5) If snorkeling - cheeese in a can works better than bread for feeding fish - but do so at your own risk - not most places dont let you do this and for a good reason - Scuba Caribe had a dont care attitude - not lectures abt stepping on coral (etc.) 6) For lunch - its better to ask them to prepare a sandwich for takeout vs waiting at the table. 7) Re getting a chair in the morning - best to check your towels at night and be up by 7:00 if you want chair by the pool under the umbrella.Any questions email -   
<Date>Apr 3, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>great trip we arrived at sunscape march 17 for a week stay. we are a party of 4 adults with 2 rooms with connecting doors.building 5 1st floor. we were greeted in the lobby with cookies rum punch and a very friendly welcome home. the lobby is amazing. the rooms were very nice, and clean. the adult pool was very nice with a bar, the main pool was gorgeous with a great swim up bar, lots to do from, laying on a raft for a little nap, dancing along the pool with the staff. the staff is amazing from the service to the nightly shows they put on. they made me tired just watching them. theres lots of sun and shade. the beach was beautiful, lots to do, paddle boats, sail boats, banana boats, kayaks, or just lay under a beautiful palm tree. we did 2 trips, first one was driving a 2 person speed boat out to a reef to go snorkeling with a tour guide. and our 2nd trip was the outback safari, which we rode on a truck to see how the dominican people live, and visited the childrens school, and they took us to a beautiful beach to go boogie boarding. the resort gives you a free 15 massage, which is nice, food was very good, very kid friendly, even babys were having fun. 2 couples got married during our stay. sunscape is a very friendly, fun, relaxing way to go. please feel free to email me for info or questions.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>You Must GO!!!!!!! Visited Sunscape Punta Cana 3/19 - 3/22/2004 - Loved the property! Arrived without difficulty from BWI. Greeted in check-in line in lobby by three Sunscape staff .... one bearing freshly made chocolate chip cookies, one with a tray of fresh punch drinks and the third with the bottle of rum to pour into your drinks. Awesome!Check in was easy but we were given paperwork for wrong room. Required Apple rep to work it out. Language is a problem here so if you truly need anything, find those Apple reps and use them. That's what they're there for. They make it soooo easy.Our room, once we got there, was smashing. A nice size king premium room (upgrade if you have the chance) with a two-sided balcony over looking the beach in building #4. Out of this world views of the beach and water. I know it's an all-inclusive but tip the staff if they deserve it. Believe me, some don't so tip the ones who do.We left our maid something every day and she realy took care of us. Chocolates during nightly turn down service, fresh robes and overstocking in the mini fridge. We wanted for nothing.About the food:Windows: Table serivce from male staff was almost non-existent. Female staff was warm and friendly .. and we tipped them. Breakfast buffet was awesome, awesome, awesome! Lunch and dinner were o.k. We thought food was fancy and not to our liking but we were always able to eat a little something.Tex Mex - great fajitas but waited 30 minutes after ordering for food. Male server never returned for additional drinks etc. Friends got sick from the mushrooms on the steak.Beach Garden Cafe/Grill - good food. Club sandwhiches are the best. If you ask, they'll make your order to go and you can eat on the chaise lounge on the beach. Supposed to be open 24 hours but there are times during the day they are completely closed so note the hours posted on the door.The only reason I rated this resort above average instead of excellent was because of the lack of food we prefer. Beach and water are awesome. Tons of palm trees but lots of sun and shade. We set our towels on chairs before we went to breakfast. Towel area opens at 8:00 so instead of turning towels in each night, simply exchange them so you can pick your chair before the towel man arrives in the morning.No pestering from beach venders on Sunscape property. Walk off the property though and you are fair game. Just say no thanks and keep walking or they will pester you. ONe right after the next. Easier to not talk than to get away from them once you start.Can't figure out the seaweed complaints by some people. We were there four full days and only a small amount of sea weed floating in the water, NOT growing from the bottom. Mostly in late afternoons. Seaweed trucks in the morning remove the stuff and are done for the day. Walk down the beach to the other two resorts and THAT'S where you'll find seaweed. On the beach not that well cleaned up and all thru the water. Continue down the beach passed the resorts and you'll find deserted areas. Only people walking the beach. No resorts etc. Swim where you want. IT's wonderful.Beaches are guarded though. Sunscape had armed guards (pistols only) on 4-wheelers. I think it helped keep probelms away after dark and the beach vendors under control during the day.As far as entertainment goes, I heard complaints it wasn't that great. We aren't much into anyway. Two small kids at home and our idea of vacation is parking it on the beach 10 hours a day relaxing. I don't care too much for the shows or whatever is going on. Salsa lessons on the beach, pool aerobics, the staff themselves are entertainment without any real shows.Bartenders are also great. My husband tipped very well in the morning and was taken care of all day long. Advice: Bring some $1 bills for tips. Yeah yeah I know it's an all-inclusive and you shouldn't have too tip and personally I think they shouldn't be allowed to accept .... but some of these people work hard and do go out of thier way. So tip them and be sure NOT to tip the slackers. You'll learn fast which is which.Hospitality Suite: After checking out, you may sign up for the hospitality suite (hotel room) so you can shower before your flight home. Do this early as possible as spots fill up quickly. You have only 30 minutes for your entire party. NO, repeat NO amenities are supplied. No shampoo, soaps and we even had to chase staff for towels, which bit into our 30 minutes and there was no maid service between uses.IMPORTANT: Upon entering Punta Cana airport, you'll be required to by a green tourist card at $10/pp. Make sure you keep this card or you will have difficulty departing the Country without buying another one. The DR immigration agent took our card and Wellington the Apple tour rep was required, along with a meeting with the top airport brass, to allow us to leave without a hassle. KEEP YOUR TOURIST CARD!! It's not just as easy as buying another one!This is a nice resort. Book a premium room, drink bottled water only (even with brushing teeth), tip the people who help you and have a great time. This is a wonderful place!  
<Date>Mar 24, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Everything was Perfect!!! We were at Sunscape 2/13/04-2/20/04. The trip from start to finish was awesome. We were married on the beach 2/18/04. We could've been marired on the beach or in a gazebo. The beach is by far the best choice. Sandra took care of every detail, including decorations on the beach to the flowers and reception after. Sunscape has their own photographer. He took about 115 pictures of the wedding and all turned out awesome. They also video taped the wedding, we paid for it before we left without seeing it. It couldn't have turned out better. The employees at Sunscape are all very helpful and friendly, occasionally hard to communicate, but that was part of the fun. Outback Safari with Eddie and Nico was a blast. Plenty to drink and lots to see. We had 25 people in our group and everyone loved it. We plan on going back someday...soon!  Val  Jamie G.

<Author>kksox
<Content>Great Trip Just got back from Punta Cana (March 6-13). The Sunscape is a truly great resort. The only two real things that were negative for me...well I was traveling with my mother, and our room only had a king sized bed. We asked for a room switch for two double beds and they told us they would work on it, and never got back to us ever. The other thing is that it is pretty noisy, the halls echo loud, and people are up until way late. OK, with that aside. The staff are about the nicest people you could meet. Very friendly, always smiling and ready to help. Not everyone speaks english, but the ones who didn't tried real hard! There are two pools, one for adults only, which has a jaccuzzi with cool water! it was nice. The main pool is huge. Get there early to put your towel on a chair if you want something shaded (the sun is really strong). There is a swim up bar in that pool. The alcohol is free flowing! drink up! It seemed like there were bars every corner you turned, and the resort is huge. The beach was great. At first the water at our end didn't seem that real pretty blue, but it all has to do with the sky, clouds etc. So a few days into the trip the water was very blue. Lots of seaweed though, but the water is nice and warm. There is a water sports place on the resort so you can use a catamaran, kayak, paddle boats, and snorkel gear. The boat traffic in that section of the beach is active, so there were some boat fumes. They have lounge chairs at the beach to lay on. I read another review here and it is accurate about the reef that was built way out in the water. It breaks the waves so there are no real waves where you swim. I guess the surf got pretty mean at some point in time and some people were hurt, so they built it. There were some little shops on the beach, but the people hound you like mad to buy, makes it annoying. No other shopping on the whole island though. Most of the stuff is junky. I actually came away from Punta Cana with no souvenirs, ha! There is a spa there. I got a massage and body wrap which was very nice. Cost about $80, well worth it, and they do go over to the beach and give massages there too. They have all sorts of games and activities for adults and kids scheduled through out the day. It seemed very kid-friendly. We took a jeep safari tour. That was a total disappointment. Just a long (all day) drive with other jeeps with no real sites to see (cows, sugar cane, poverty). We did get to see a school, and go inside, and a house and go inside. The little dominican children swarm and beg. SUGGESTION; bring food to give to the kids because even though they beg for dollars, they have no way to get to any market to buy anything. Some ladies from another hotel had a ton of food, and it worked out great. The end of the safari was the best part, a nice private beach where there were nice waves! awesome blue water, a beach buffet, and horses to ride. This safari cost $84, and the concensus of the others we went with all decided...not worth it. Just stay on the resort. We asked, and they do have a bus that goes to the nearest big city, which is $1.00 a ride, and an hour away, no a/c of course. So, just stay where you are, it doesn't get any better then Sunscape! The food was ok. One reviewer said not much of a choice, well I disagree. There are 4 restaurants. One is a huge buffet every day with plenty to chose from, and different stuff every day..... breakfast lunch and dinner. There is a small Italian place, with a limited menu but it was good. There is a Tex-Mex place that had a killer tenderloin, and there is a Beach Cafe that had breakfat lunch and dinner....we ate breakfast there one day, but ate at the buffet the rest of the time. There dinner menu was limited too. We did eat lunch there, they had a nice salad. There are carts on the beach, one with fresh fruit all day, and one with hot dogs and burgers for lunch. There is a snack bar with nachos, pop corn etc. Essentially there is food coming out your ears! The thursday night beach buffet was beautiful. What a set up. Great!! This was a really nice vacation and I would definately go back without hesitation!  
<Date>Mar 15, 2004

7	4(nice):1	30(beach):1	96(worth):1	175(cost):1	730(massage):2	1352(body):1	2085(wrap):1	

<Author>suejoy
<Content>Great Time, Great Vacation Just returned from a week at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. (March 5,2004 - March 12, 2004). My husband and I both enjoyed the vacation. I would say that the only disappointing aspect was the room. We were in Bldg. 3 (even though we had requested Bldg 5). The room was clean and was kept clean, however the bath need refurbishing. The bath just looked tired and old. Also the mattress was very, very hard. Also our mini-bar was not refilled as it should have been. Noise is definitely a problem. Besides being close to the stage the hallways are all tile and you hear every step and every sound. One other note the maids are constantly going into your rooms, they will clean and take the dirty towels but don't always have clean towels to replace them with until later in the day and then they come back and turn down your bed in the evening. Service at the resort is excellent. The people are very friendly and helpful. The food was excellent and we really enjoyed not having to make reservations at the different restaurants. The Beach Party on Thursday was beautiful. The food at the beach party was a little disappointing compared to the usual, but just seeing all the work that went into the preparation was amazing. The beach is nice, yes there is seaweed but it is the beach. Enjoyed using the catamarans. We are powerboaters but the sail was easy to use. We snorkeled in the swimming area, not many fish but with a little bread and bananas you do get to see some. Needless to say the drinks were ever flowing. We went on the Outback Tour. Which is well worth the money. You really get a flavor of what the country is like. We also went on the Saona Island Tour. The catamaran ride is wonderful, the beach on Saona Island is OK, the powerboat ride is a bit much. We enjoyed it, but I could have skipped it. We did not see many of the shows (although we heard them all in our room). We booked through Apple and the really did their job. I would recommend the Sunscape to anyone. The smallness is one of it's greatest assets. It's nice to be able to walk everywhere. If you've left something in your room it's not a hike to go back and get it. And don't forget no wristbands.  
<Date>Mar 14, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Couldn't have asked for more We went to Sunscape in Punta Cana for our honeymoon. We had the Superior Ocean Front Room and it was amazing. Our room was perfect. The hotel staff was amazing. The food was great. While we did not drink the water, we did use it to brush our teeth and it was fine. The cleaning ladies supply you with plenty of water daily. The pools were clean and extremely nice. The beach was noticeably cleaner than any other resort nearby. Sunscape did a great job cleanig the seaweed off every day. We had absolutely no complaints except our balcony door was a little hard to open - not a big concern. I often wonder about the people who want to blame the resort food/water on illness. Could it possibly be the exposure to sunlight everyday and the constant consumption of alcohol?? The food was safe and the restaurant offers five restaurants. The buffets in Windows was incredible for both brunch and dinner. I would encourage anyone going to Punta Cana to stay at the Sunscape Grand. You could literally not take any extra money with you and be happy. Although, I do receommend going snorkling and parasailing. We went parasailing through Alex - he works out of a hut in front of the hotel. Although the hotel offers parasailing, if you go through Alex, you will be taken up to Bavaro Beach which is a great way to see a little more of the island.

<Author>Bandagger
<Content>Overall Quite Good--But Noisy! Been to all inclusives all over the Caribbean, and was pleased that Sunscape knows what its customers want, and serves them well. Plenty to do, plenty to eat, plenty to drink, and loads of the Dominican sun!Positives--no wrist bands, 24 hour food and drink, good night shows, nice variety at Windows, able to walk the beach to other resorts, hard working and polite staff.Negatives--forgot the bug spray (NOT the resort's fault!), and the noise from the people setting up the restaurants in the early, early morning. The shows get over about 11PM, and are heard throughout the resort. But a few hours later the restaurant workers start over the paths with their squeaky carts--hard to get back asleep! Luckily, we were too tired to care most of the time!The biggest positive is arriving at the airport. Anyone going into Cancun knows of the long wait to get through; or the long trips to Ocho Rios or Negril once through Montego Bay. Here, it can be minutes through Customs, and not much longer to the resort. If one sees all inclusives being very much alike, this is a huge, huge plus.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>What's not to like We were at the Sunscape Feb 14 - Feb 21. How could anyone not like the Sunscape? Of course it is absolutely beautiful. The rooms are spacious and the staff keeps them and the grounds sparkling clean. Everyone is very pleasant and they speak English so communication is not a problem. We were a group of 6 - 2 couples each with an 11 year old boy. All of us had a great time. The resort is small which we felt was a plus. We are comfortable with letting the kids free to walk about on there own and it was only a quick trip to your room, restaurant, lounge or beach. Several reviews indicate people got sick, but we did not have any problems. Bottled water is everywhere. If I had to find something wrong it would be perhaps that there were not enough options, food-wise for the kids. If you have a picky eater (like I do) it could be a challenge filling a dinner plate. If you want to RELAX, RELAX, RELAX this is the place to go. Lots of great drinks and a great pool to enjoy. I recommend getting to the pool early so you can get some chairs under the cabanas. This gives you a great place to relax when you feel you need a break from the sun. And if you have some family members that can't take a lot of sun this is perfect - they are right next to the pool. We loved it so much we are already thinking about going back next year. Enjoy!  
<Date>Feb 23, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>short but sweet Reading this site was very helpful. We just returned 2/19/04. As in the past reviews the grounds of this hotel are beautiful and well groomed. There are always people cleaning and prunning up the outside grounds. The pool was clean, a little cold to my liking, but enough to handle a sold out hotel as we had last week. Swim up bar was fun bartenders entertaining. The beach was beautiful with the palms trees a wonderful addition. They spent alot of time cleaming the beach from seaweed, they are the only hotel that does this, makes a big difference. There are servers on the beach to get you a cool drink in the afternoon. The rooms are older, but kept very clean. You will be told many times not to brush your teeth with the room water but that all other food and drinks are alright to consume. We had salads along with ice in our drinks and had no problems at all. All of the employees are very friendly but don not speak alot of english at all. I felt the prople at the front desk were very stand offish. When we arrived there was a water main break at the hotel so the whole hotel was without water for about 5 hours. It was our travel day so we were OK but for the people there wanting to shower for dinner there was nothing that you be done and the front desk was a bit rude. Thanks to the review that said bring bug spray Deep woods off if you have it, if your a person whom the mosquitoes love be aware they are BAD. I din't think to bring after bite or benedrill with, bring it!! Also many people had brought from home insulated mugs. Great idea the bartenders would just fill them up all day long. No bees flying around, or hanging around because there might be a empty glass around with some drink left in it. The cups are small that they use all day and plastic. Great selection of the hard stuff. good labels and plenty. They carry their local beer only, which is fine. They encourage tipping. You'll be surprised how a few dollars make a difference. On avarage for meals people were leaving 3-5 bucks it seemed. Bartenders? How good do you want to be served? Money talks in the area. As far as the kids club, I didn't have kids there but they seemed to be very busy all the time announcing things all the time. There were many kids there but they didn't bother us. They seemed to stay at one end of the pool. There also is a small wadding pool for little ones. They has a hugh movie screen outside wear they play first run movies at night, mostly kid related but enjoyable. The nighttime entertainment, all I can say is they try very hard, but coming from a family of dance I couldn't sit through it. If your using Apple Vacations make sure that if you ask for special items you have confirmation from your travel agent or copy of fax sent. The Apple reps at the hotel are very friendly and did help get us a different room. We requested king, which they said they never received any info on that but I had a copy of the fax which seemed to help us,we got 2 doubles, later that night we did get moved. Ask for an outside rooms or else you face directly into somones elses room. Not good. Front desk not helpful at all. There is a few huts on the beach for shopping, the whole barter thing. They all have the exact same thing. They all have a deal and want to braid your hair. Much nicer when one night during the week the vendors come into the hotel. As far as the food, I can't say that it was great, it was passable, filling but not fufilling. Best meal, American Tex Restaurant, get the medallion steak, best meal all week. About 4:00 everyday the cookie lady comes aroung with a sheet of cookies. The fresh fruit is great. Overall we had a good time. The 4 1/2 plane ride probably was the worst part of the whole travel experience. Don't count of getting things at the hotel gift shop. Not well stocked with reading materials at all so bring stuff from home unless your willing to pay $7.00 US for a Cosmo which was the only American magazine they had. Don't forget BUG SPRAY !!!!!  
<Date>Feb 21, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Felt like Adam and Eve Me and my boyfriend spent the best two weeks of our lives at sunscape last November. From arrival to departure nothing was too much trouble. Our room was kept immaculate at all times and our fridge was always re-stocked at least twice a day. Our only complaint was the amount of people complaining it became quite tiresome, we actually overheard one group complaining about a few clouds!!!, my only recommendation for these people would be to never holiday in england because you will definately not receive the standard of food and service that we did at sunscape. We felt like Adam and Eve being made to leave the garden of eden the day we went home. P.S And for all you people complaining about upset stomachs in our experience if you drink pina colada's which contains cocunut milk(A NATURAL LAXATIVE) is it any wonder!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful Holiday Spent two weeks from 26 November until 11 December 03 at Sunscape with my two sons (28 and 25 years old). We all had a fabulous time. The food was brilliant - so much to choose from! The grounds were kept spotless. The staff were great especially the entertainments team and the bar staff - they just couldn't do enough for us. Spent most of our time around the pool so that sons could meet more people but the beach was great as well. Yes there was some seaweed on the beach but it didn't bother us - it was cleaned up every day and after all it is the beach! The beach party was amazing - they took all day to prepare for it. The fruit carvings were spectacular. The entertainment was very good. We did have a tropical storm (Odette it was called) which was pretty awful but didn't spoil our holiday. Went on the Saona Island trip - a long day and quite expensive but still glad we went! - we made some great friends and are going back in December this year. Would recommend Sunscape to any age. Will tell everyone what a wonderful time we had!

<Author>mmbrew
<Content>Great people, OK beach My wife and I just came back from a week at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. If you are looking for good food, a nice pool and great people, this place is for you. If you're looking for the blue-green color and rolling waves of a tropical ocean this is not your place. There is a natural reef in out in the ocean which acts as a breakwater, knocking down the waves. That being said, the resort itself was wonderful. The staff was awesome, whether you wanted to sit by the pool or join in on the games or dance lessons. The beach party on Thursday night was a nice touch up until it rained. (Buffet on the beach and a movie on the beach afterward.) The food was also very good, but could have a slightly larger selection. The grounds were immaculate and the drinks free flowing. The movie every night was great for kids (Pirates of the Carribean, The Lion King, etc.). Do not believe the dress codes on the website! You only have to wear long pants in DaMario's. Shorts and T-shirts allowed everywhere else. For the money it was very nice, but my next trip will probably be back to the Gala Resort in Play Del Carmen Mexico.  
<Date>Feb 18, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Resort My wife  I spent a week at this wonderful resort. We travel extensivley throughout the country and out of the country  have a pretty good knowledge of resorts and their services. Check in was a breeze, the building I requested (Bldg 5, 3rd floor. Really quiet, overlooking the adult pool) was granted. The resort is probably the smallest on the strip, which is of great benefit, not far to walk to anywhere. The staff here is outstanding, from the management, to the bartenders, to the housekeepers. They bend over backwards to make sure you are happy. A couple of bucks here  there to these happy people goes a long way. The grounds were perfect, lush, spotless, and clean. People have complained about the seaweed at the beach. It was raked up by 9:00 every morning and touched up throughout the day. If you want to see seaweed problems, walk up the beach past some of the other resorts where they wade past piles of it. The main pool was a little busy at times, but we preferred the beach anyway. We never had a problem getting a lounge chair in the shade. and never felt we had to walk to the beach really early to reserve one. The food was really excellent. All 4 restaurants had plenty of variety to keep us well fed and happy for the week. The beach party Thurs. night was awesome! What could be better, great food, good drinks, ocean breezes, slow dancing and a nice little show afterwards. To all who complain about this resort, are you sure you were here? We never heard one complaint from any of the hundred or so people we talked to. I highly recommend Sunscape Punta Cana Grand to anyone. One of the nicest resorts I've ever been to  
<Date>Feb 10, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great time I was in the service industry for 15+ years. Worked all levels, all jobs. Vactioned in the Carribian/Costa Rica 3 times. Just so you know where I'm coming from when I say this was a truley wonderful vaction/resort. You like shows? Never saw one. Vacations, to me, mean getting sun, drinking good drinks, smoking Cubans, eating well, swimming, exploring. I was completely satisfied. I loved most of the food. Loved the fact that the whole place was not U.S. in the D.R. They had Presidente beer, tasted like Hieny to me and always ice cold. The service was great. Call and top shelf liquors. Don't listen to the nay sayers. They sound like the kind of people who'd complain in heaven (I mean, c'mon a freakin catapiller in your room is what you remember????!!!!). I did not use the tap water. I did not get sick (except at the southwestern rest. but I drank WAYYYY to much tequilla. It was not the great food). If you are picky, whiney or just no fun, don't go! That will leave more room for the rest of us when we go back next year. PS went in July, never too hot a single day.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Just Got Back Today From the Sunscape Just got back from the Sunscape ... went to the DR for a little R  R and that's exactly what we got. Had to spend the first few days at the Allegro (next door) because Sunscape was full. We knew this ahead of time, but noticed that other spillover people were moved to the Allegro upon arrival, so MAKE SURE you are absolutely staying at the Sunscape before leaving your city! That said, resort is great bang for the buck. Food generally quite good for a resort of this type (all-inclusive). American Grill is excellent. Beach is nice, but well worth it to take a walk past the resort areas (head north) during the day to swim in a more secluded area. Probably best to do this with another person. To sum up ... Positives: Facilities, food, adult pool (much quieter than main pool), staff, beach. Negatives/Things to Avoid: Shade scarce unless you reserve areas with towels in the a.m.; also a bit noisy if rowdy groups are in attendance and your room is close to main pool (i also would avoid the rooms near the stage). Also, don't go to Punta Cana if you think you might get stir crazy. Not much to do in the surrounding area. This is our second trip there, and we go there because there isn't much to do. And that's what makes it so lovely if you need to just get away from it all ...  
<Date>Feb 5, 2004

<Content>Our group just returned from Sunscape and we had a a great time. <Author>tdub24
<Content>Amazing Spot! My g/f and I stayed at Sunscape Jan 3-10, 2004 and loved it. The place is quite amazing, especially seeing it's rated a four star by most Cdn travel companies. It was a moderately priced resort in our opinion and was a real value for the buck, that's for sure. Seems odd that some would not like this place. The food and drink were great, the grounds are well kept and beautiful and there's lots to do. Most of all, the staff are outstanding. They go above and beyond to make your stay truly enjoyable. The beach party was awesome. Can't beat it. The beach has some seaweed but it is cleaned regularly. The pool was large and well kept. Loved the swim up bar! We would go back in a heart beat. Highly recommend Sunscape to all!
