<Author>jigglypuff
<Content>Nice but noisy My husband, myself and our two children aged 9 and 6 enjoyed Christmas week at Sunscape having spent the previous 7 nights at the Iberostar Bavaro. At Sunscape we had booked a Family Suite comprising two interconnecting rooms with two bathrooms and we were very pleased with the accommodation. Even taking into account that we had booked two rooms Sunscape was considerably cheaper than the Iberostar over Christmas which was why we chose to spend our second week there. I was very pleasantly suprised at how Sunscape compared to the Iberostar and I have to say that I consider it excellent value for money. Our children enjoyed the Kids Club (which they did not at the Iberostar) and happily ate lunch and occasionally dinner with the club. On the subject of food Sunscape again did not disappoint, in fact my husband and I both preferred the food at the buffet restaurant to that at the Iberostar buffet. However, I have to say that both of us were sick at both hotels and in the end I barely ate or drank anything at Sunscape although the food looked and tasted delicious. We travel several times a year all over the world and I have only ever once been ill (10 years ago in Egypt) before. I can tell you that we were very grateful to have two bathrooms available for our use and I spent far too much time there for my liking! I was very disgruntled at watching my family eat (and my husband drink) and not being able to join them. Other than the food issue, the only other problem we experienced was the location of our rooms. We were in building 3 top floor which had a great view but unfortunately was just above the main pool bar which became very rowdy during the evenings. We were also pretty close to the Theatre and the shows are very noisy. Now if we hadn't been travelling with a 6 year old who was shattered by 9pm we would have been at the bar ourselves making just as much noise as other guests and enjoying the shows too. However if you have young children with you I recommend that you request building 4 or 5. We were also unfortunate to have noisy and inconsiderate (English) neighbours who kept us awake in the early hours. Otherwise Sunscape is a great hotel with a good pool, great food, excellent bar, lovely grounds and plenty going on in the evenings. If I ever risked going back to the DR - which is very very unlikely - I would very happily return to Sunscape. If you have a hardy stomach, go, you will have a fabulous time.  
<Date>Jan 27, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Punta Cana Review It was nice, but we would not go back. We stayed at the Sunscape Grand Resort and the resort itself was nice - beautiful pool area, nice room. However, I must tell you, before we left on this vacation to Punta Cana I had heard many different reviews about both Punta Cana and this resort. We have traveled to Cancun and Jamaica and loved both areas.In Punta Cana you will (I repeat) you will not get the clear, beautiful Carribean water you may be use to; the seaweed on the beaches are a huge problem. I have to say that Sunscape made every effort several times each day to rake all the seaweed and they did a pretty good job, however, it never stopped. And it does not make a difference what time of the year you go - this is solely due because of where Punta Cana is located and it gets lots of wind from the Atlantic which brings all this seaweed in. When you go in the water, there is no seeing your feet as the water is murky....We heard that many people would get sick from what they ate - that's anywhere in Punta Cana - I don't think it does matter which resort you stay at. While we were all very very careful what we ate (and of course you don't even think about brushing your teeth with the faucet water) 3 out of the 6 people we traveled with still got sick (2 out of the 7 days they were there). Stay away from all seafood. This was very hard for me as I am a lover of seafood, but this is what made our friends very sick.The weather was very nice and warm, and the facility was nice, however, I would have to say that I would not go back because of the two issues I mentioned above.  
<Date>Jan 23, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sunscape is awesome! I really enjoyed my trip to Punta Cana. My family and I went from December 26th, 2003 to January 2, 2004. We tried every resturant at least once, but ended up eating at Windows the most because of the variety of food and rolls. We also enjoyed the shows. The dancers were very energetic, and the costumes were beautiful. Also, the resort had activities planned for New Year's Eve, with a special show and fireworks. If you go to Sunscape through Apple vacations, as my family did, go to the orientation the first day and find out about the excursions. My mom and I went on a trip where we could swim with nurse sharks(who have no teeth) and rays. Before the trip left, I saw the most beautiful rainbow stretching across the ocean. Great picture! For any couples out there, it is also a popular place to get married. However, the weather was a little rainy and it was very windy on the beach. But everything else was fantastic. I would go back in a second if I could. Finally, try the adult pool and the swim up bar. Both are excellent! Thanks to Apple Vacations for a fabulous time at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>a perfect vacation! This trip was really ideal for me and my family in every way. I read a lot of these reviews when we were planning, and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised every single minute during the trip. I really wouldn't have changed a thing about this place. My family visited Punta Cana for 7 days over Christmas, Dec. 20-27, and we're 7 people: 2 50-something parents, I'm 23, sisters 21, 21, and 12, and brother 19. We took a Bahamas cruise last Christmas, and this trip was 10x better (and cheaper too, actually). We booked through Apple Vacations and they were wonderful (please please go to the orientation meeting your first day! So helpful.). The vacation really started with the plane ride, with free mimosas, a real dinner, and games with champagne and cash prizes. Unreal! We flew into La Romana (hour and a half drive as opposed to 20 minutes from Punta Cana airport) but I loved the scenery on the bus and didn't mind a bit. This country is beautiful. As for the hotel itself, I just thought everything was excellent. THE STAFF: These are the most happy, positive, and hard working people I've ever met (not to mention gorgeous -- I swear, no unattractive Dominicans). The restaurant service was faster than I've ever had at restaurants at home. Everybody was there working on Christmas Day with a huge smile on their face, and they are really honestly happy to help you. The economy isn't great in the Dominican Republic, and they have some of the best jobs available, so they're happy about it. Those I met loved practicing English with me, and loved it more when I practiced my Spanish with them (I don't know much but I got pretty good by the end of the week!). Our family learned a ton about another culture, and honestly if you don't speak a word of Spanish you'll be fine (nobody else in my family did). It is really nice however to know a bit, and I'd definitely recommend a little Spanish-English dictionary to carry around with you. Everybody at the resort is required to take English classes, but obviously some are better than others. THE ROOMS: I thought the rooms were really nice, tropical feeling, pretty furniture, AC and a ceiling fan, beds were comfortable, everything was clean, maids made swans out of towels, etc. and the size of our room made my jaw drop (but I'm used to Ramadas). :-) We were on the top (3rd) floor of our building -- which has hallways that are open to the air on both ends, how cool! -- so we had high vaulted ceilings too. Don't get me wrong, it's not the Plaza... it's not like the dressers are made out of gold or anything... but I thought it was great. My parents' room next door had trouble with the AC and bathroom fan when we arrived. They were fixed without a problem though. THE HOTEL: Tons of palm trees, gorgeous landscaping, and everything is compact so nothing is a far walk. It's really well thought out, I think, to make everything more relaxing. You get a free 15-minute massage which is right on the beach, there's a spa facility and gym, a big pool (with a swim-up bar!!!) and it's very clean and has mats to float on, etc. There's a fun and energetic entertainment team that is always looking for people to participate in little games on the beach, aerobics, dancing lessons, etc. and if you win any of the games (which are short and easy) you get prizes, like free bottles of rum. The shows they put on aren't exactly Broadway-quality, but most are pretty entertaining. One of the best features though was movies and Monday night football on the beach, in lounge chairs, at night with a great breeze, and of course a drink. Wow, how perfect??! THE BEACH: Beautiful! White, clean sand, with a decent sized roped-off area of water for swimming, etc. and the water sports building is right next to it. Lots of palm trees, cozy little shady huts, and lounge chairs, but it doesn't feel crowded. The water is clean and blue and like bath temperature, but there is a little seaweed. Being from the East coast it's much better than I'm used to though -- the seaweed is like little blades of a twiggy grass, only about 2-3 inches long each, so it's nothing to cry about, and they do come through periodically to clean it up. My brother lived on the water trampoline. The water sports were really nice to have too. There's always a paddle boat or kayak available to take out, and the water is clear and relatively shallow so you can see sting rays and coral/rock beds clearly. There's apparently a barrier reef -- you can see big waves crashing on the horizon, which is kind of cool. It's like they put it out there on purpose, because it makes the beach on shore so relaxing with little tiny waves rolling in. THE FOOD: I think I was most pleasantly surprised in the food category. I was preparing myself for a week of cafeteria/college dining hall food (we took a cruise last Christmas...) but oh my goodness, it was unbelievable. Needless to say the best feature is that it's an all-inclusive so it's all-you-can-eat (and drink) but they weren't kidding -- there's tons and in 7 days we didn't come close to trying everything. And the drinks are not watered down, in fact they're pretty strong. If you get a coconut drink, you get real coconut which is delicious (but a natural laxative, so go easy on them) -- the best pina colada I've ever had! There were lots of foods I was not expecting to see, even in the buffet restaurant, Windows, which was great. The fruit was I think the best I've ever had, and they offered interesting fruit juices too which were great... pineapple, passion fruit, watermelon, cantaloupe juice (my favorite). Great omlettes, and a great mix of dishes from around the world to try. The italian restaurant, the most formal place to eat, offered entrees like duck ravioli, veal, seafood  pasta that included calamari, mussels, etc.... I was really impressed. Even the service there was fast, and they serve you a cordial as soon as you sit down. I don't think I tried anything I didn't like. Christmas dinner was ridiculously impressive... completely set up on the beach with the most elaborate display of food, including sculptures and a LIVE nativity scene featuring the entertainment staff complete with a goat and a donkey! And by the way, our family wasn't cautious when it came to food. Obviously we didn't drink the water, but I love seafood and all of it was fantastic. I didn't take any pepto bismol or anything, so I think some of the reviews that tell you you're definitely going to get sick are exaggerating a little. 2 of our 7 people had diarrhea on the last day, however. It could have been caused by absolutely anything, maybe one too many pina coladas? I'm not sure if they ate anything in common. THE OUTBACK SAFARI: We decided to take one of the excursions offered at the hotel and I'm so so so glad we did. It was the best day of the trip. We learned a ton about the culture -- our guide, Alex, spoke perfect English and was absolutely full of information. He knew tiny details about Dominican and U.S. history and he couldn't have been nicer. He served as our bartender too and there was no shortage of rum drinks. It was on a 15-or so passenger bus that basically didn't have sides or a top, just saftey bars and 2 long benches (with seatbelts), so we could see the gorgeous landscape and talk to locals, etc. Gorgeous mountains, green hills, palm trees... they apparently fimed parts of Jurassic Park there. We stopped at a typical Dominican home which was absolutely incredible. I think there's a lot of people that should meet these wonderful people and see how little you need to be happy... it was a wake up call in a lot of ways. We stopped at a ranch for lunch, again it was great, and also made stops to buy exotic liquors, and Dominican coffee and chocolate. We learned about how the coffee and chocolate are made with really short but informative and funny presentations. The last stop was at Macau beach which had perfectly clear blue water as well, but was in a different location and had nice-sized waves for boogie boarding. So fun! We got back to the resort around 5.. a great day that I would do again in a second. SOME THINGS THAT COULD BOTHER OTHER VISITORS: Keep in mind I still gave the Sunscape 5 stars! :) We bought a couple of jars of Dominican coffee beans on the Outback Safari and I think we bot a bad batch. It smelled like an ashtray! Maybe we were supposed to treat them somehow, I don't know.... but I have to say the ground coffee we bought was excellent! Also, there are vendors on the beach right next to the Sunscape's beach that have great souveneirs and really pretty jewelery. However, if you walk by them, they're going to talk to you, and invite you to come into their store. I didn't mind at all, but I know some people do (my Dad got pretty annoyed). I actually got into a great conversation with one guy who was really anxious to learn more english. Some are nice, but most will do a ton of talking, sometimes can get pretty pushy, and give you a very special price, but like the Apple people tell you the first day, talk them down to 30-50% of their original asking price, or just walk away. :) Another thing that bothered my parents a little was our check-out day. I think the hotel turned off one of our rooms' keys early by mistake, but a trip to the front desk fixed that and they were very apologetic. We had to leave for our flight around 4, but to leave the room later than noon was a $20 charge. They do offer a free hospitality room though where you can go for an hour I think to shower, etc. before your flight, which was nice. We scheduled the room for 3pm and had to wait I'd say 15 minutes for it to be ready after that. Again, didn't bother me, but I should be fair!Wow I wrote a lot! I hope it's been helpful... the Sunscape is paradise and I'd highly recommend it!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>great do not use primi taxi though We just returned from Sunscape on Dec. 19 2003, My wife and I, 2 sons and one nephew (21,23,23). We had a blast. What a great place. the only problem that we encountered in the Dominican Republic was Primi Taxi. we took an afternoon to Higuay and know about the general fares associated with taxis in foreign countries. However, in this case the price quoted was not the price expected. After a short ride (approx 2 km) we paid the fifty pesos and continued to drink at a couple local pubs on the main street. the Owner wanted to sell us a taxi driver as a tour guide and we said that we have been there before and know our way around. However the taxi driver followed us, and, thinking he was off duty and just wanted a drink, bought him a few beers. After visiting a couple pubs and picking up some souveniers, it was time that we thought to get back to the hotel to indulge in the excellent food at Sunscape. Unexpectedly, we were told that we owe 150 US dollard for the travel guide. Well after trying to shake the man the whole time, and spending what we wanted to (and basically brought) we said that we never wanted a travel guide and were going to take the bus as planned. this is where it got ugly. The swaring was wretched and then the owner made us get into the cab and took us to jail. The people at the jail were nice understanding people, as most all Dominicans are, and refused to throw us in jail. We further protested and wanted to take a bus back to the hotel to pay the man just to avoid further turmoil. but he said that we had to take his taxi to the hotel and charge us an additional 20 dollars. we got in and on the way he took us to another jail where he tried to throw us in the cell. again the police refused. well we finally made it to the hotel and paid, however the security was very helpful at the hotel when they stopped him when he continued cussing at my family. Francisco, thank you. DO NOT USE PRIMI TAXI! The rest of the stay was excellent and aside from the trouble with Primi was probably the best vacation we have been to thus far.   
<Date>Dec 22, 2003

10	5(time):1	16(food):1	21(excellent):1	65(visit):1	99(couple):1	266(pick):1	1393(pub):1	2787(sunscape):1	3892(indulge):1	4234(souvenier):1

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Entertainment/food/beach/service/room=Good time! My wife and I just returned from our 7-day trip to Sunscape, Punta Cana. DR. Our objective was to relax and get away and we were able to do exactly that. I read these review before I left and found some things to be true and some to be either false or corrected. I will provide some tips to make your trip to Punta Cana more enjoyable.Arrival This is an open-air airport. You walk off the plane and down stairs like Nixon. You can wave this peace sign if you want (I wish I would have done it!). You walk into the terminal, which could be a 300-yard walk if your plane is parked far from the baggage claim. Keep your carry on to a minimum. You will pay 20$ to get your tourist card.Transfer If you are a lady and you are carrying a bag, you are not going to do it long in the airport. A porter is going to take your bag from you. The guy saw my wife expression and said in perfect English, it s OK don't worry, I will take you to an Apple rep. We got on the bus and sped off for our 20 min ride to Sunscape. The driver drove fast and passed on the left when I thought caution was the better part of valor.Resort appearance The place was decked out in Christmas decorations, which were tasteful and tropical. The resort is like a garden. We saw hummingbirds, at least 12 different butterflies, birds, camilo lizards and a marine Iguana that hangs out between Windows resturant and Building 4. The guys feed her bananas and she is a fat, happy lizard. Probably be on the menu soon! The resort is clean and well kept. Most days there were 12-15 workers mowing the lawn raking the grass, etc. This is a 300-325-room property that has a large footprint. So this helps you to not feel a great density of people. The resort was booked full but it seemed at the time that we were the only ones there.Food My favorite topic. We brought pepto, immodium AD etc. Take them 1 day before you leave. You ARE GOING TO GET DIARREAH. It s inevitable. You are traveling in a 3rd world country. You need to stay away from the following: Salad Raw vegetables Cold pasta Undercooked or med rare, rare steak or pork All cold seafood Some cooked seafood like shellfish Coconut milk (which is a natural laxative typically found in pina colada's) Tap water (don t brush your teeth with it or drink it, more later on the water)All of this being said, I don t want to scare you, but you can prepare your self and be smart about what you eat. We were and had the ability to the bathroom when and where we wanted, which are a big part of having a good time! The pepto AA/D should help you to at least control it. We got busted in the Italian restaurant and I had to go back to the room and put long pants on. It was no problem. The veal was excellent! We went back later in the week and I had the lasagna appetizer and it was so good I had it for desert as well! The tex mex restaurant was outstanding! We ate there twice as well. The Chicken/steak fajitas were soo good and huge proportions, you will need to ask for more tortillas. They played Garth and Brooks and Dunn on CD s that were skipping all the time. It was a great reminder of home after hearing the meringue 1000 times by the end of the first day.Windows is a fine buffet restaurant for breakfast and lunch; we did not eat dinner there so I will not comment. The best was Thursday night, which was the beach party extravaganza.They started on Wednesday night with 60 workers setting out dining tables, buffet tables and chairs. The set up a stage and decorations as well. Everything was ready by 6:30 Thursday night. They turned a 50 yard section of the beach to a 5 star reception/dining hall. They had fruit carvings, braided palm decorations and a desert table 10 yards long. On the menu was: Pork with a sweet sauce, corn on the cob! (hhhhrrrr), steak cooked on the beach, seafood mix (didn t eat it per above) and fresh steamed broccoli and about 60 more items I won t bore you with. After we ate the staff put on a show and everyone had a good time.Now back to the water. You can wash with it but that is it. Don t get it near your mouth! Don t stand in the shower with you mouth open and don t drink out of the toilet. The resort is aware of this and will provide bottled water that is OK. The drinks (coffee, teas etc are made with it and the ice is too. You will have as much bottle water as you can consume in your room. Check you mini refrigerator in your room. It has beer, OJ coke and water. (Nice and cold after a hot day on the beach). We took 4 liters of USA water and did not finish them. Enough with the food and Dominican bathroom practicesEntertainmentThese are 7-8 of the funniest people I have yet to meet. Mini, is the leader and MC s most of the shows. Mini speaks at least 3 languages very well. Eng, Span, Fr.. He is small but his is the second funniest guy on the resort. The first is Chuki. This is a more than slightly over weight Dominican man that has a smile on his face 24/7. He deals the free blackjack and leads most of the beach activities. He also does the Spanish lesson every day at 3:00. Chuki s pot belly is the star of every show. He is like the Punta Cana s Chris Farley. He had a grass skirt and a half shirt on and was dancing to the Cotton Eye Joe like his feet were on fire.BeachThey keep the seaweed off pretty good. We got up early and by 6:00 there a guy out there with a rake taking care of cleaning the beach. There is some considerable seaweed in the water. The nicest thing about this beach, were the palm trees. I am not a big sun guy so I like the shade. We usually found a spot were I could get the shade and my wife could work on her golden coat. The water is warm and the natural reef 400 yard off the coast breaks up the waves, so they come in gently. We took some 40 DEET bug spray on the trip. We did not need it until the wind died down during the beach dinner on Thursday. We used it but still got bit up around our ankles from sand fleas (I guess). Recommendation, take the bug spray and use it around your feet and ankles.RoomThe room was nice. We asked for a beach view and got it with out any problem. We had room 4223. It had a nice balcony that wrapped around the corner of building 4. We did not pay extra for this and it was real nice. The A/C did not work too well and we were hot the first night. The toilet was running and it forced me to get up and be a plumber for a few minutes. I went to the front desk the next day and told them about our issues and they took care of the A/C and the commode in a few hours. We also asked for two more pillows, which they took care of as well. The A/C unit could not be adjusted all week. We controlled the room s temperature with the ceiling fan.ServiceThe waiters/bartenders are very committed to there work. Tip them on your first day and on your last day. We gave them 5 U.S. for the ones who really took care of us. The bartenders like to pour drinks. The all have good drinking wrists, once a bottle is bottom s up it does not come upright for several long seconds. Other all-inclusive resorts have well drinks and bottom shelf booze. Not at the Sunscape, Alleluia the SUNSCAPE! They had Jack Daniels, Jim Beam, Drambui, Dewars, Absolute, Bailey s all of the good stuff. The beer is El Presidente, which is decent ale.Misc. The Dominican paintings that we bought did not come home in good shape as the salesmen suggested. They will rolled them up for you but ours came home stuck together.To negotiate with the street/beach vendors, start at 75% off asking price. They likely will not give you a price; they will ask you what you are willing to pay. If that happens go to the hotel gift shop, where everything has a price tag and get some prices in your head. You should expect to pay 25-35% less outside that gift shop. Then offer the beach guy 75% off the gift shop price and start back from there. If you give some, they will give some. Try not to pay more than 50% the beach vendors originally asking price. They cannot bother you on the beach, but if you walk near their stand, which are located on the opposite side of the water sports, you will be asked to take a look at what they have. As soon as you walk out of one shop the next guy has got you. No gracias works pretty well.The hotel will ask for a credit card for incidentals. They will ask your permission to take the card and imprint it. They will seal it in an envelope until you check out. They will not put your name on it, just your room #. When you check out, if you have no charges, they will give the envelope to you to tear up. This is a great effort to reduce credit card and ATM card theft in DR. If you check out the U.S. State department web site, this is a major issue for tourists. Do not even take your ATM card. Watch your credit cards at all times. In conclusion, we had an overall great trip. With some of these additional learning s, we would have had a better trip. The people on this resort understand and will help you to have a good time. If you go say hi to Pappe, Mini, Fernando and Chuki!  
<Date>Dec 22, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good time for the money I'm a little late with the review, but better late than never. My wife and I went down for our 3 year wedding anniversary. Things went smoothly on the transistions from the airport to the resort. It's about a 30 minute trip to the resort. When you arrive they are they to serve you. We told them it was our anniversary and we had excellent service. It is a family typ atmosphere so if your going their for romance you may want to go elsewhere. For us it was great because we have a young boy that stayed home and so it felt a little like home seeing all the children around. The food was decent...you must east at the Texas Grill...their meat was to die for. You should take some imodium ad. You never know when something might hit. Also the beach was decent, but there was a lot of seaweed. If you plan to go on a excusion, you must go on the outback safari (time of your life). Lastly, you should know that coconut is a natural laxative......you get my drift. Overall we had a great time and for the price you couldn't beat the deal. Good luck in making your choice.

<Author>Julia21136
<Content>Staying with kids at Sunscape Grand I really enjoyed my stay at the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand this Thanksgiving. The grounds are well planned, everything is close by, food is very good at all restourants. I shall admit though that by the end of our stay i was tired of the same menu at the Windows. Staff is very nice, everyone spoke English and did their best to make our stay comfortable. Tons of sports activities, games of all kinds for kids and adults alike - you won't be bored there, no way! Dinner at the beach is something that makes you remember this place for years to come. Rooms furniture is a little dated, but clean. Kids club is awesome: special children activities in the morning and in the afternoon, movies and mini-disco at night, donkey-riding on the beach, visit to the horse farm, all this made my 8 years old daugter's vacation a blast. Even my 1 year old found things to do at the clean, very well organized kids club! One day they brought tables and chairs to the grass near the pool for the afternoon ice-cream for kids only! I found the area to be quite secure to let my 8 years old move around independently most of the time. Is not a upscale resort but very relaxing place to be!! Highly recommend. Oh, yeah, i shall also add that none of us get upset stomach.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>One of a Kind!! My boyfriend and I just returned from the best vacation ever!!! at Sunscape!! I am also one of the people who read the reviews before I went and I can't even believe that anyone would rate their trip less than excellent!! It was even better than we thought - we were told by our rep that drinks and entry to the disco were not included, which they were and as well, there was 24 hour room service! not just for breakfast!!! The food was AMAZING!! I can't believe the quality of the food for what we paid! Windows was amazing! I picked the ingredients for the chef to make me my own omelet every morning...the lunch buffet was awesome as well...so was the American Grill - my boyfriend had the steak and it rocked! I had the best combo platter (definetely try it!) and Da Mario's was very good as well...constantly refilling our wine glasses and treating us like royalty!! the food there was the best!! you have to go!! Another great plus was the fact that they had all International drinks!! there was so much to choose from! everyone was friendly and our mini-bar was stocked every day, and our room was cleaned everyday...we left $5 the first day and were treated like royalty!! we met the manager and he even had a special dinner prepared for us! The beach Barbeque on thursday night was the best! tons to choose from, and you eat on the beach! We seriously couldn't have asked for anything else!! We will definetely be going back...I miss the white sand and palm trees already!! If you are thinking of visiting PLEASE do not listen to the people who did not enjoy themselves...they are obviously not people who travel to other countries much! Sunscape is the best spot to go in Punta Cana!!

<Author>mrsbarbosa
<Content>We loved it!!!! This was one top notch resort. Everything about it was absolutely perfect. First of all, it is beautiful. The palms trees on the beach, the perfect white sand, the glistening pool - everything was just as it was shown in their brochures and on their website. The restaurants and the food was incredible, especially Da Mario's. After reading some of the reviews on this website, my husband and I were a little leary of the food but once we were there experiencing it for ourselves we thought the people that wrote those reviews must have been crazy (or maybe just inexperienced at trying international foods). Every meal I had was incredible! The breakfast buffet at Windows can't be beat, and the dinners at Da Mario's and the Beach Garden Restaurants were fabulous! If you go, you have to try the grouper filet and the teramisu at Da Mario's. I wish we could bring this restaurant home with us. The restaurant and bar staff treated us like royalty. We became especially attached to Julio who bartends at Umbrella's, the piano bar. Very funny guy! These people are pros and you'd think they were working for the biggest tips of their lives with the quality of service they give. And there is always some kind of activity going on. There were games on the beach and in the pool, dance lessons, aerobics, shows, parties. One great thing they did while we were there was to show the Monday Night Football game on a big movie screen on the beach! So much fun! We loved this place and if we ever return to the Dominican Republic, we would definately stay at the Sunscape again. We highly recommend it!  
<Date>Dec 1, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>We're going back in May 2003 Wow!!! Sunscape was wonderful!! I traveled on 10/10/03-10/17/03 wirh two of my friends. It was the best vacation i have ever had. When we got off the plane the airport wasnt as bad as everyone had said. They took our picture, had live music that made us start doin the slasa. the bus ride to the hotel was 20 minutes the guide on the bus was informative and gave us a few tips such as NOT to drink the tap water. When we arrived at the sunscape a very handsome gentleman named Nicholas greeted us along with a few other bell boys. He was very charming...and believe it or not he did speak english. most of the staff spoke english as well as french and german. the grounds of suscape were so beautiful!!! the main lobby was also very beautiful,lots of chairs to sit and relax. while we were checkin in the staff came around with punch and cookies. from the reviews i have read i knew to wait for them to come around with the rum...it was GREAT!! it was the beginning of a nice long week of relaxation, fun in the sun with my friends and drinking the dominican rum!! Nicholas the bell boy brought our luggage to our room. Not know ing what to expect we all thought the worst just so we wouldnt be dissappointed. Well let me say the room was also beautiful. Very clean!!! A stocked fridge of beer,beer and more beer :) as well as soda and water. the maid would bring us as much as we wanted! also she left fresh flowers in our room everyday which was great because i loved having a flower in my hair. The food was excellent. ever morning we went to the buffet for breakfast and dinner was at the american grill which was the best!! loved the fahitas,nachos and potatoes skins. everyone there was so friendly and gave us alot of attention. the bartenders were wonderful!! Wendy who is a bartender by the pool was the best. he had my drink ready as soon as he saw me walking over! he would dance salsa with me everynight when i saw him at the bar. Ronaldo our bartender on the beach was great! everyone was so friendly i cant wait to go back this may 2004 to see my friends. the beach was WONDERFUL! i love the sun.the ocean was wonderful.yea there was a lil seaweed but i moved away from it and it was fine! the sand was soft and not hot at all so u could walk with ypur shoes off. the activity staff was so much fun.every day they would get you involved in games, spainish lessons, and salsa lessons on the beach! Me and my girl were shakin it!! there is a fresh fruit stand on the beach which was ownderful. we would fill a watermelon with rum and daiquiri and sip it all day.we took long walks on the beach everday and just soaked up the sun! the flea market on the side of the beach had great prices !!! go see davids store he will give you the best prices i bought so much stuff from him! we spent alot of time talking and hanging out with the dominican people. getting to know there culture AND HAVING A GREAT TIME! well the vacation was great My friend Lauren and I are goin back in may. we booked the trip a week after we came home!! oh 1 more thing. the dance club was great.we chilled there every night for a few hours doin the salsa and shakin our booty on the dance floor! we also were a lil daring and went off the resort to club mangoo which was open until 6am. the people are all friendly.food is excellent,entertainment was fun.beach was out of this world.CANT WAIT TO GO BACK IN MAY 2004!!! PUNTA CANA HERE I COME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

<Author>mj1m
<Content>Not a bad Place for the Price Just wanted to write a short comment about the hotel to tell of our experience. Have been to the DR before staying at the Caribe Club (Bavaro Beach). This where some of the problems started as we overheard some of the hotel front desk staff tell guests the hotel was on Bavaro Beach, which is not the case. We booked and paid for a VIP Package that was to include a larger room on th ethird floor and have complimentary perks. Well when arriving upon the hotel low and behold they strictly told us that no VIP Packages exist and that our travel agent doesn't know what she was doing!!! Quite interesting. Was put on the first floor because we were told that rooms were always on a first come first serve basis. (We could see and hear the staff making up new rules for the guests as they went along. Quite Interesting!!! Our room was ok, very clean and located at the front corner right at the beach, the only downfall was staring atthe washrooms and having to smell the sewage. Now we rarely complain but as a well season Caribbean Traveller, we found this place to fly by the hip. The second night we were there a major storm blew in and low and behold all the rooms on the first floor started to flood. Was told it was not a major problem, and we figured hey were on vacation, it's not my home so if they don't care why should we!!! Right!!! Right!!! The size of the hotel is nice with everything being so close. We did manage to catch on to Yuan at the pool bar and the other gentleman at the back bar who pretended not to speak English, but low and behold when customers started to flash money in their faces, low and behold they could speak clear English!!! Absolutely amazing, a Miracle was performed. We still have ahard time with the fact that people think it's ok to tip staff while staying at an All-Inclusive. You know you are in a great resort when the Management team frowns on this and expects people to just sit back relax and not have to worry about tipping money! One poor American woman we met was running into the hundreds of dollars tippins staff and then realizing she was going broke!!! All in all, not a bad resort for the price you pay, if you are a true visitor to the DR and want to have the full Punta Cana experince you have to stay at a resort that is righ on Bavaro Beach. You will then see the beauty of of Punta Cana. Not staring at a boat docking station where you get to breath fumes 24-7. I would return to the DR in a heartbeat, but I think we will be returning back to the Caribe Princess ( Hodelpa Caribe Club). Better beach, better service, better and more modern hotel. Sorry for the so-so rating, but new guests to the DR have to be aware before you spend yor hard earned money!!  
<Date>Nov 24, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best Bang for the Buck! My husband and I were looking for a short, but fun vacation. We chose the Sunscape because it was the best deal we found, and the reviews I read were complimentary. They really put a lot of effort into presentation, and it shows! I have nothing but great things to say, and am planning a return visit in April with my 2 children who I know will have More fun than humans are allowed!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The most wonderful time I just got back after going to the Dominican from October 22 to the 28th. This was a trip for me with three of my single friends. I can assure you that you will have a great time, married or not. I loved the buildings and was greeted upon entrance by staff. Our room was lovely with beautiful decor. There are mini bars in each room that are stocked free of charge. The beach was wonderful and the staff dispose of the seaweed each morning. Some people complain of the seaweed. Honestly, it's an ocean and it is still clearer than anything you will see in the states. There were many activities that were held it was just up to you if you wanted to be involved. The staff was very focued on making sure you had fun. They pulled you into Merenge or Salsa lessons, water aerobics, stretching or even beer drinking contests!! You could make this vacation very social or relax and hang out on the beach. The discotheque was great and so was the piano bar. The noise that people complain about was easily muffled with the drapes and I was so tierd that I did not lose any sleep over it. The bartenders were friendly and always ready. The food was great and so much variety!! I went scuba diving everyday with Scuba Caribe and had a blast. They have a location on the beach and someone staffed in the pool at all times. Very nice. I used the gym there and they have some equiptment: a treadmill, three bikes and a stair master. They had steps, weights and some weight machines. I met some neat people in there and worked out two days. My friends did the spa thing and had a great time. It did rain the first few days and our room flooded. We were right there in the room with the maids bailing out the water. She was there as we all took care of this. We were all laughing and having a good time. The staff were very nice and helpful. They wanted to make sure we had a good time. We saw the shows there and they were great and very entertaining. I must say that I have two children and next time I would bring them. There are activities galore for them. I saw at least four jungle gyms, donkeys, junior olympics and the staff taking kids to dinner in Windows so the parents could have a romantic dinner in the Italian Restaurant. When I left they even printed off the weather for me in Kansas City and ran it out to my van for me. I cannot praise the staff there enough!!Thanks for the wonderful time!  
<Date>Nov 5, 2003

<Author>alphillyswim
<Content>Had a Blast! My boyfriend and I just got back from Punta Cana and loved it! The staff were great, the beach lovely (a little seaweed once in a while, but we were still able to snorkle right in front of the hotel), the food was abundant and we were always able to find something good to eat, and the liquor was top shelf. The vendors on the beach were pushy, we bought most merchandise from Safari rum hut. Apple Rep, Linda was helpful and really nice. We had champagne and caviar twice! Lots of photos, no sunburn, and all in all a great and relaxing vacation. Please email with any questions.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>We will be back in 6 months!!! My friends and I traveled to Sunscape in October. From the moment we stepped foot on the beach, we loved it. The staff was wonderful, especially all the waitors, and the room service, the bartenders, Wendy was so pleasant and friendly. The foot was delicous, especially the mexican, that was our favorite. The fahita's were scrumpious. The shops on the beach were a lot of fun, and the best shops to go to are David's, and Charles, they definately give you a good deal for your money. We had went to a club one night out of the resort, and we had a blast, the club was called mangoo. Something like that, it opens at 12 midnight until 6 am, tons of fun there, shaking that booty. Ronaldo was great on the beach, taking care of us, getting us whatever we needed. Sunscape is definately the place to be and we will be back in may.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good value but...... In January 2003 my husband and I booked the Sunscape for a 7 night stay. It seemed like a bargain and it looked gorgeous in the Apple Vacation book. When we arrived in the lobby the manager approached us and offered us an upgrade to a different resort called Secrets. We were leary about this because it seemed too good to be true. She said she would give us the night to think about it as she couldnt move us until the next day. So we checked into our room and made our decision. The room smelled musty and was very dark even with all the lights on. This resort has some wear and tear on it. We enjoyed a wonderful show that evening put on by a group who travels to different resorts. It was a las vegas type show and it was great! Such talent by the dancers. My husband who usually doesnt like that sort of thing was impressed. The food was good. We enjoyed the next day by the pool and had snacks and drinks before we left for the other resort. Although I didnt stay there for the whole week I think from just what I saw while I was there I would have been unhappy. The resort was very small and not enough to do there and it was a little worn. I think a younger crowd looking for value might enjoy this resort. After moving to the other resort we were on an excursion (swimming with sharks and stingrays) and we were telling people about being moved from the Sunscape to Secrets and how much happier we were. There were people there from the from Sunscape and they also were offered to move and didnt and they were saying how disappointed they were that they didnt move and how bored they were. I vacation every year in the carribean and stay at all-inclusives either 5 or 6 Apples and I dont feel the Sunscape should have been rated a 5 Apple -- it was definitely more like a 4 Apple. It was a bargain but no-frills.  
<Date>Oct 17, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not American-ized and Immodium-ized A group of 14 Adults traveled to Punta Cana's Sunscape Grand on 9-8-03 to 9-12-03 for 5 days and 4 nites. I have never been to an All inclusive resort, but HAVE traveled to the caribbean 4 times. I enjoyed being able to swim up to the pool bar and Juan Cruz, the bartender at the splash bar was an EXCELLENT bartender. Drinks were great and had a high percentage of alcohol content. The Presidente beer got warm very quick so drink it fast!! The entertainment was okay---fun at first but I do agree with a previous writer.....Put your hands up in the air phrase got REAL old from Antonio the activities director. I think this is the only line that he knew!! Pool games were fun---but don't let your drunk husband partake in the game of the  mens tri-athalon pool game...saw a guy tumble on the bicycle into the pool and could have gotten hurt. And YES.....take immodium AD with you along with some nexium, zantac or pepcid....I think that at least 50% of our crew got GI upsets and spent most of the day on the toilet and in bed...take your own toilet paper too! :) As I sit here typing, I still have a gnawing feeling in my stomach....The english speaking workers are few and far between...don't even try to ask the maids, grounds keepers or the maintence men a word in english....they don't speak it!! I advise you to learn a little bit of spanish prior to going...it surely helps...All of the employees were very friendly, but could not understand you. Our room was clean, nothing got stolen, but did hear of others getting items stolen and of cock roaches on the sink counter....Use your room safe. We left the maid $3.00 everday and ALWAYS had an abundance of towels and a clean room.. Beware of the obnoxious beach vendors....have a couple of drinks proir to venturing down to negiotiate with them...they ARE hysterical to deal with...got to vendor #5...he has deals better than WalMart....only offer them 25% of what they first tell you....and if you don't get them down to that price....go to the next store---they are all listening to each other and the next guy will give you a better deal!! Mama-jana is their version of our Viagra.....they will try to get you to drink it, but the bottles are not sealed and neither is the vanilla...so I didn't buy any of them.. Heard the safari trip (recommended highly by Apple Vacation) was great----lots of items to buy CHEAP---cartons of Marlboros were only $8.00 and vanilla was $2.00 and they saw sugar cane and coffee plantations. Make sure you go to the Apple Vacation talks prior to signing up for any excursions.....Was made aware of the 4X4's and cycle and horse excursions to be dangerous....but ole Pedro the horse Man at the beach towel shack will try to talk you into it!! BEWARE---if you are young, blonde and single....stay away from the entertainment/activity crew...they are on the prowl at all times......The food was good...not sure what made us sick---could not pin point it to any particular item...the Italian resturant was nice and had a great atmoshere...Windows ( Buffet ) was nice also...always something to find to eat.....and the Amercian grill/Tex Mex food was GREAT!!!! The bacon cheesburgers at lunch were out of this world....The beach was okay---warm and blue---but nothing like others that I have been to.....SEAWEED---SEAWEED---SEAWEED!! They did pitchfork it up occasionally...but it was still a nuisance!! Heard on the plane ride back that another couple at another resort had no seaweed !! That was disappointing!! Overall...would I go back to the same place???? Answer---NO!! Back to Punta Cana---Yes!! Was overall inexpensive and for a first time all inclusive...I got my money's worth!!  
<Date>Sep 13, 2003

<Author>hogandi
<Content>Mixed Review We vacationed at Sunscape 8/20-25 with our 3 children (13,11,5). Overall, I have to go with a just average rating, but my review is really quite mixed:The Bad News: We were expecting beautiful clear Caribbean water and were surprised at the dull, seaweed-filled beachfront at the Sunscape---not at all as pictured in the brochure I had sent for!!!!Don't get me wrong---the water was quite swimable, and the beach/lounge area was fine and kept quite clean, but for us, we were expecting the Caribbean and what we got was a nice Atlantic Ocean area. (We DID venture out to a recommended area about 20 minutes from the resort one day, and got to see the pretty turquoise water we were missing).Other negatives: Our kids were very excited to try Sunscapes water-trampoline--but it was broken. The wonderful Beach Party Dinner many people have written about was canceled twice while we were there, supposedly due to weather (but both nights there was no weather issue). The nightly entertainment was amateurish at best. The Teen Center was nothing more than some worn-out ping-pong tables and a croquet set (in need of repair). Our room was adequate and clean, but pretty basic and in need of some repair. Hot water was available sporatically. We were kept awake one night by a wild, extremely loud party taking place at the adjacent bar (rumor was that it was the Sunscape Staff party). We were located in the quieter building 5 near the adult pool, but noted that had we been in just about any of the other buildings, we think noise would be a big factor. The resort is small, and although this makes everything convenient, it is, at times, confining and limited.The Good News: The staff at the Sunscape is outstanding. They do the most with what they have. Service was excellent. Food was quite good. The nightly 7:30 movies were a nice feature for the kids. The main pool area is nice---kept very clean, but it's showing its age. Because the resort is small, everything is just steps away: rooms, beach, pool, restaurants.OVERALL: This resort is only for you if your top priorities are value, convenience, good food, and great service. If you're looking for a more luxurious vacation, gorgeous Caribbean waters, and lots of variety--you'll need to make another choice.  
<Date>Sep 2, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>overall great vacation The resort was perfect. I couldnt have asked for more. The staff were all plesant and wearing smiles. Of coarse the drinks were always made with little alcohol so always ask for double liquor. The food was only okay. There was a lot to choose from but it was very oily. Stick to the simple stuff. The beach had been kept up but always had a lot of seaweed on it. The water was nice but not as clear blue as the water in past vacations. Both our day trips were spectacular. We took the snorkling trip with the sharks and the jungle adventure. Great scenery. I would recomend taking the trips to everyone. Our tour guides were funny and informing. Great all around vacation. Punta Cana is one of the most beautiful places.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>True Paradise. We visited Sunscape in August tis year(2003) and we recieved the perfect holiday. We have two young daughters and the staff at the hotel treated them like queens. We have never visited a more friendly relaxed place before. Everyone from the manager to the cleaners made you feel welcome and not one day passed when they were not all smiling. We feel that even though we only stayed there for two weeks that we have made life time friends with some of the staff there. No matter how busy the staff seemed to be they always stopped and made time for the girls. We feel that the holiday brochure did not give this hotel justice in their write up of it as the hotel will far out do any expectations that you have off it. We will most definatly be going back. When we left the hotel the girls, ourselves and even the staff were crying. How more friendly can be? It was the most relaxed , friendly holiday we could ever expect to have. True paradise. Thank you Sunscape.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>great trip We just returned from a very nice trip to Punta Cana where we stayed at the Sunscape resort. The beach was beautiful as well as the grounds of the resort. There was plenty to do the entire time. I highly recommend the snorkeling excursion with the sharks and sting rays- very exciting!!!! We both have had Diarreah and stomach cramps for 3 days. Other than that our trip was truly wonderful and we will return some day.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Had a wonderful time! My husband and I just returned from the Sunscape Grand in Punta Cana and what an experience! We had a wonderful time! We had never been to an all-inclusive resort or the Dominican Republic so we were a little skeptical and truly could not get our brains around the fact that everything was included!We arrived in the morning and were met with an enthusiastic staff who immediately took us to our room. I had previously e-mailed to request a room in one of the quieter buildings and our request was honored. We stayed in Building 5 and our room was beautiful and clean. The maid staff came by several times a day - one person to mop and clean, another for towels and refreshing the in room refridgerator with bottled water and soda. We were warned to bring stomach medicines as we could become ill, we did do that but fortunately we did not need it. Our most favorite part of the trip was the staff - they were truly wonderful and as they say when you check in welcome home - we felt at home. An all around great time - the food was great, service and amenities were even better! Loved the fresh fruit stand on the beach - we are taking our three children back in the spring!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good and bad My wife and I recently returned from a week trip 7/11-7/18. We have been to other all-inclusive resorts so have something to base our opinions on.The Good: The resort itself was beautiful and very well maintained. They had many activities going on that were good to break up the day (which typically last about 1/2-1 hour each). The staff is very friendly and make all the daily events entertaining.The Bad: The food is average at best. The biggest problem was almost everyone we talked to got sick (about 80% of them). Not sick enough to ruin the vacation, but definately an inconvenience. The ocean is average at best, definately not as blue as expected, and the seaweed is an issue (even though Suscape cleans it up better than the other resorts). The entertainment was the worst we have seen at any resort. It was typically the everyday employees putting on a show. I guess it was entertaining, but they definately do not spend money for quality shows. Overall, an excellent trip for the money, however next time I would spend more to go where I will not get sick. If not for the sickness from so many people, I would rate this resort a 4 out of 5. If you are going, have fun and remember the Imodium A-D. You will be glad you have it!  
<Date>Jul 24, 2003

<Author>famouschinesec
<Content>Beware Salmonella! Went to Sunscape with the family over Easter Break 2003. The kids (ages 9  11) were looking forward to the kids club. For 3 nights in a row we could not locate the kids club on the property even with help from the manager and a walkie talkie, so we gave up. My daughter developed food poisoning at the end of the vacation so we took her to the doctor at home where she was diagnosed with Salmonella, verified by duplicate lab tests and reported to the health department. We called the hotel to report it to the manager, but we were never able to speak directly to him, SURPRISE. I wasn't going to bother to write a review until I read the recent reviews about the recurring illness issues, so I think they seriously have a hygiene/food prep problem. If you have kids and want to go to Punta Cana, go to Club Med. We've been there twice and never gotten sick and the kids club is always where they say it will be when they say it will be.  
<Date>Jul 10, 2003

<Content>I We just got back from DR on 07.06.2003. Overall, it was so great that we were upset to come back.The ocean was clean and warm, a little bit of seeweed but not so much as other people described.The constant breezes made us feel very comfortable.The facilities are clean, people are very friendly and nice, very helpful. Food was pretty good in all restaurants, you have always something to choose from.We also tried different activities such as snorkeling,swimming with sharks and rays and it was awesome. One night we went to Carribean show and it was pretty cool.I t was located in the cave and it's somehing unbeleivable(cave itself). The Beach party on 4Th of July was incredible.We loved Sunscape and we may come back and it just because there are so many other places we want try as well. We highly recommend this place and you may ignore some nasty complaints from other people(some of them always unhappy no matter what or have very high expectations that can't be met).

<Author>lass=
<Content>Not empressed We spent a week in Punta Cana from June 13 - 20, 2003. I have traveled to various other islands and found this to be the most disappointing. My main disappointment was the ocean. It was very dirty the first few days. By Wednesday it did clear up some, but was full of seaweed. The blue water that was displayed in the brochures was definately not where we were located. The Sunscape was a 5 apple hotel and we have stayed at 6 apple hotels in the past. There is a definate difference. The food was okay, but after the same choices every day for breakfast that got very old. The best restaurant was the American Grill. My husband loved the beef medallions. We did not do any of the activities due to the fact that I was sick the whole time. I did not drink the water; therefore, I'm not sure if it was from the vegetables being rinsed or what. One other thing. Our flight was not until 8:35 pm so we asked for a late check out. They said that would be fine, but the day we were to check out the told us we had to be out by noon!! We had no choice. We offered to pay, but they said no. We had to use the hospitality suite which we booked for 5:00 and didn't get in until 5:30. The suite was very dirty, no towels or washclothes. There were some people that loved this place, but I don't think I would go back. I will stick with the Aventura Palace in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Can't Wait To Go Back I just returned from the Sunscape last week, and I am already in the process of planning another trip back. The resort itself is the perfect size. Not too big, and not too small. The beach is much larger than I was expecting. The sand was very soft and silky, and the water was perfect. There is a variety of restaurants, but keep in mind they are very strict with the dress codes. The food itself was very good for an all-inclusive resort. The only complaint on the food was the self serve snack bar. It only had pizza and hotdogs (that were only ok) The staff was extremely nice, and everyone goes out of there way to make you feel at home. There is a huge variety of activities day and night at the resort. If you get a chance to go, I strongly recomend swimming with the sharks and stingrays (it's an additional charge, but well worth it). The rooms were lovely, and very clean. I can't imagaine staying anywhere else.  
<Date>Jun 9, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Paradise We just returned from our honeymoon, we stayed at the Sunscapes Resort in Punta Cana. The resort was beautiful, very well maintained, staff was friendly, and helpful. The food in all of the resturants was good, you were able to get anything that you could of possibly wanted. We did not experience any problems with the water, but some of the visitors became ill from the sun. Make sure that you pack some strong suntan lotion, as the sun is VERY intense. This was our first experince with an all inclusive, and we were very impressed with all that they had to offer.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Resort was Great! I just got back from my abridged HONEYMOON to Sunscape (May 19-23). The resort was exactly as describe-BEAUTIFUL!!. The grounds were amazing the people were some of the friendliest I have encountered in my many trips to the Carribean. The rooms were nice although not great. They are large and at least in my room the AC worked great. The food was pretty typical of tropical destinations. You are not going to starve but you are not going to come home raving either. They do have an Italian specialty restaraunt that is fabulous, an absolute must if you go. The pool was nice, although a bit small for the capacity of the hotel but you alway have the beach which was very nice. Yes there is some seasweed but it isn't bad and if you are from the NE part of the US you won't believe the water color of the Atlantic. I did have one unfortunate story with housekeeping but all in all I would visit the Sunsacpe again. BTW this is deffinately a family destination which really doesn't come across in most of the reviews that I have read. It is not a singles or romantic destination, but don't let that stop you from going.  
<Date>May 28, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Escape from the Sunscape! We had three major problems and a few minor issues that you should know. Upon arrival, the front desk refused to acknowledge that we we had paid for (and were entitled) to a deluxe OCEAN FRONT room. They tried to stick us in room, overlooking the pool, just above a blaring music speaker. After a negotiation with the manager and front desk staff, they agreed to allow us an ocean front room for another additional fee. We started to settle into a lovely ocean front room with a wraparound balcony. Later the front desk man did apologize for their mistake and cancelled the extra charge. Of course, the story gets better(or worse). The previous guests did not return the vault key to the front desk. Of course this meant we were unable to use the vault. After explaining it three times to people who spoke english very well, the front desk staff still did not get it. It was not a language issue. I speak spanish. Finally, I personally assisted the maintenance man the next day as we cracked the safe open. That's number two! Eventually the assistant manager did call and apologize for the screwup. The third and final major complaint was from our day of departure. We planned at leaving the hotel at one in the afternoon. Checkout is at noon, but upon request, you may get a late checkout. We went to the beach in the morning. I went upstairs to the room at 10 to call and confirm our flight home. The phone was dead! The front desk apparently turns the phone off on day of departure. I went back to beach and asked my wife to handle it with the front desk because I reached my limit of verbal and physical restraint. When she went to the front desk, their immediate response at 10:15 am was what are you still doing here?; we need that room AND your keys will no longer work because we have invalidated them! Mind you, check out is normally noon. Can you imagine being purposely locked out of your own room before checking out ? I mean that's got to be some violation of the Geneva Convention. Anyhow, enough of our preriors and exteriors were of nice decor and the food was fine. The beach was adequate. No immediate snorkeling offshore and also be prepared for a lot of motor boat traffic fumes, oil etc. The marine boat gas pump is at the end of the property. Bartender Luis at the adult pool bar is fantastic. In summary, we travel extensively in the islands. I lived there. We had never encountered such an unresponsive or difficult front desk. Vacations shouldn't be that much work. When that taxi pulled up to the lobby for our departure, I felt like we were making a prison break!  
<Date>May 27, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>4 Days of Paradise!! :) All I can say is WOW. We had an excellent time. We travelled to Sunscape from May 16-19, for my boyfriend's birthday. Travel to the hotel: Just a tip...If you are used to great customer service and a decent meal on your flight, do NOT travel with CHAMPION Airlines. Their service was below average to say the least. When we arrived at the airport, the whole process was very speedy. Our luggage was coming out as soon as we went to baggage claims. There are many workers around to carry your luggage to your hotel transportation. Once you find your hotel transportation, they check your name of on the list, and you are off to start your vacation!!! Check-In: I have to say that check in was very smooth. As soon as you arrive, you are greeted by very friendly and helpful hotel staff. Even though their English is not great, it does the trick and they can still manage to make you laugh. We arrived at 11:30am and check-in is not until 3. Fortunately, our room was ready as soon as we arrived...How can I complain about that????Rooms: The rooms are standard, but very nicely furnished. We stayed in building 4 on the 3rd floor. It was very nice and you have high ceilings on the 3rd floor. The room was accented with fresh flowers. We wanted a closer ocean view, so we asked to be switched and had to wait until the next day. The maids are very friendly and give you whatever you ask for. A little tip goes a long way...For the next 2 nights, the maid bought us chocolates!! :) The bed was comfy, considering I like a firm mattress, but the sheets smelled a little funny. Staff: The staff was very friendly. They would assist you in any way they could. The waiters were excellent. Never once was my glass half empty without someone refilling it or asking me if I wanted another drink. I have to say Luis...WE LOVE YOU!!! There was one waiter however....it was the waiter that comes and brings you drinks on the beach. I asked for a drink, and I did not tip him. He didn't do anything special.. After that, he did not come back to mants: The food a 3 of the 4 restaurants was above average. The Italian restaurant and the American Grill were excellent. The beach restaurant was good, and the buffet (the windows) was okay.Entertainment: The entertainment was great. The live shows every night were awesome. And the show on Friday night was EXCELLENT!! After the show, the disco opens up. The dancers from the show teach you how to dance merengue. It was a lot of fun. The Spa: I think the spa was one of the highlights of our trip. The people in the spa were amazing. They really cater to you. My boyfriend and I both got the hydrotherapy massages and truly enjoyed them. We went back to the spa on our last day and got our 15 minute massage. We enjoyed both thoroughly.Overall, our trip was amazing, and I can not wait to go back again!!!  
<Date>May 20, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent Trip! My husband and I just returned from Sunscape , 5/9-5/16. I must say, we had a beautiful time. We did the 5 square deal with Apple and it worked out wonderfully. THere was a little confusion to what hotel we were at but no problem.When I read the complaints, I have to wonder if about the people writing them. I understand that mistakes happen all the time and everywhere but get over it, people that fixate on the negatives are probably impossible to please.The food was typical carribean food and we KNOW that the food is different. We KNOW we are in another country so the language can be an issue. Hellooo, we are in THEIR country, you should be the one speaking spanish if you have the problem. Either way, we never ever had a problem communicating and if we did, they would get someone else to translate to us.We loved everything. . The service was outstanding, the people were so helpful and we tipped here and there, not much and it wasn't expected either. The beach was beautiful and very well maintained. Seaweed started to appear by early afternoon but is cleaned up every morning and will always be an issue. We walked the beach past other resorts and Sunscape's beach was best kept.Punta Cana is so beautiful, miles upon miles of secluded beaches. We have vacationed all over to many all-incluse clubs (Jamaica 3x, Mexico, St. Lucia, Hawaii...) so I feel experienced enough to know what makes a great vacation and Sunscape did a wonderful job making our week one of the best!  
<Date>May 19, 2003

<Author>megals
<Content>Very relaxing My friend and I visited Sunscape May 9-12, 2003. We went for a short weekend - we treated ourselves for Mother's Day. The hotel is approx 20 min from the airport which is great considering we went for such a short time. Check in went smooth and we were sent to our room in Bldg 4, third floor - great ocean views. The rooms are very basic but kept very clean. A small tip and you will be brought as much water as you request. The weather was amazing the entire weekend. We spent most of our time on the beach, which had some seaweed but nothing out of control. They clean the beach every morning. The pools were VERY warmand we found that very unappealing. I know it must be hard to keep the pools cool but they should make an attempt. Considering it is only May what will they be like in July. This could be a potential health hazard. They should try to fix that problem. The staff was amazing and spoke very good english. The maids had more difficulty with English but we managed to communicate. The food was OK. We loved the italian restaurant, Windows is a typical buffet restaurant. The chicken/mushroom pizza at the American Grill was very good but we weren't thrilled with the burgers. We didn't make it to the Tex Mex but heard many great comments about it. All in all I would definitly return to this hotel. I am considering bringing my family in July. Remember you are in Punta Cana and they move very slowly - but you are on vacation - what is the rush !!!  
<Date>May 15, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not what it was cracked up to be!! To make a long story short? Spend your hard earned money elsewhere! When we arrived in Punta Cana ( 3hours late, thanks Apple Vacations) I must say that customs was not a nightmare compared to others. 3 planes landed at the same time, but as we went though customs, he barely looked at our documentation, which did speed up the process. Once we arrived at Sunscape, the people at the front desk barely spoke English. You would ask them a question, and the would just say ok, and go on with what they were doing before. We were traveling with our kids, and another family. When we got into our room, we had 1 kingsize bed. After calling numerous times, they told us to come back down to the front desk. After going all the way back down to the front desk with our things, they told us there was nothing they could do that night but give us a small cot. They said they could not change our room until 2pm the next day. (A bit of info. If you need something done, go to higher management!!! Hopefully they will give you what you need. )Their entertainment was so-so, but they cancelled our Bar-B-Q with no notification. There were several people walking out to the beach looking for it, but we finally found out it was cancelled. I was disappointed given the fact that the person running the hotel was from the U.S. and he is knowledgable on customer Service. The staff will only work for tips. (with the exceptions of the guys at the pool, and pool bar)If you have already booked, get a perscription for Cipro before leaving. There were a lot of people sick for several days!! Keep that in mind!!! We will not travel there again. A wast of money

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Had A Great Time!!!!!! I stayed at Sunscape April 9-16 2003 with my mom ,dad and brother.Upon arrival at Sunscape you enter into a lobby area where you check in.The lobby is open air.Very nice!When waiting in line to check in everyone was served fruit punch with or without rum.Also I was served chocolate chip cookies.The people really know how to treat someone right.Check in was smooth and it was off to the room.Room-I had a third floor room with cathedral ceilings.The rooms are nice but nothing special.In the room is a mini refrigerator that was stocked with beer , soda, and water everyday!That was nice.The maids kept the room clean everyday.Hotel-The hotel grounds are very well kept.Very lush and tropical plants.The hotel is very nice.Beach-The beach was very nice as well but most of my time was spent by the pool.The beach did have some seaweed but it didnt bother me at all.I took walks only to see other beaches overcrowded.Sunscapes beach was not crowded at all.At night it was nice to go on the beach and lay on a chair and relax.Pool-The pool was where I spent most of my time.The pool was like bath water and I enjoyed it.There is a swim up bar which is nice to get drinks.I was told there it is safe to brush your teeth with the tap water but do not!I brushed my teeth in the water once.Im pretty sure that explains why I got diarrhea.There is bottle water that the maids put by the sink so you can brush your teeth.Entertainment-At night there is a movie playing on a very large screen.One night the movie was playing on the beach.Following the movie is a nightly show.Some of the shows were funny but some were corny.Activities-There is some water activities you can do.There is water aerobics and games like water polo in the pool and activites on the beach like volleyball.For the kids is the Explorers Kids Club where the kids do fun activities.Food-I thought the food was great.They had a lot of variety.One evening there was dinner on the beach that took the people who set up tables and everything quite awhile.It started toet up and people went back to their tables.There are 4 restaurants on the property.All in all I had a very fun and good time.The staff is nice and friendly. I would definitely go back again. Thanks Sunscape for a great time!!!!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great resort with a seagrass beach We stayed at Sunscape March 29 - April 5. After reading many reviews about the pristine beach, we were extremely disappointed to find an almost unswimmable beach area with floating sea grass. Perhaps it was because of the wind or tide, but each morning workers had to rake and shovel piles of seagrass so that they could wheelbarrow it over to bigger piles for the beach dumptrucks to come pick it up. The palm tree beach area with white soft sand is beautiful, but we love to swim in the clear ocean and snorkel, however, the snorkelling was very poor. The sailing was a lot of fun and the boats were always available. We had to walk about 1km down the beach to find a nice swimming area. We did enjoy the beach aerobics, the coco party on the beach, the helpful and kind employees and the wonderful swimming pool. The food, service, variety of restaurants, entertainment/shows, cleanliness of the resort, availability of beach/pool chairs and overall lay-out are all very acceptable. We have been to many resorts and would recommend this resort only to those who don't wish to swim in the ocean.  
<Date>May 2, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fun as Sunscape My husband, myself and 5yr old daughter visited Sunscape April 6 - 13. We had a great time. The resort is lovely and taken care of like no other resort we have ever stayed at before(including Sandals). RoomsRooms are clean and spacious. It is not luxury but you don't spend much time there. Leave a dollar or two on your pillow for the maids. We forgot once and the room was not as well made up. We had a terrace and it was spotless, a great place to relax before dinner. There is a mini bar with beer and soft drinks and bottled water. There is even bottled water on the bathroom sink so no chance of running out. StaffMost of the staff were very pleasant and eager to please. Service was usually quick and with a smile. We had heard raves about the manager, Rod. Sorry to say we saw him a few times and he never said hello, maybe just a smile. The resident manager was terrific. Activities staff work from early in the morning until late at night. A special thank you to Paulina - coordinator for the kids club. She is very sweet and loves kids. If you have teen daughters be wary of some of the guys in the activities group - no names.FoodFood is okay, not great. Highly recommend the steak at the Texmex restaurant, the shrimp pasta and lasagna at the Italian restaurant and the continental breakfast and chicken at the Beach Cafe. Also, the buffet breakfast is pretty good with awesome smoothies.ActivitiesThe nightly shows are fun and the movies for the kids are great. If you like you can get away for an hour or so for a nice dinner and the kids watch a Disney movie. Pool activities are varied and fun. Overall a great place except the food wasn't great. The beach had a lot of seaweed but you could always walk up the beach and find a clear spot. I would definitely return. It's a beautiful, well kept resort with friendly staff and small enough that you don't feel lost in the crowd.  
<Date>May 1, 2003
