<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fun and Sun This was our first all-inclusive trip and don't think we could have asked for anything more. While the weather didn't agree with us the first two days, it was still one of our most relaxing, fun vacations.Rooms-We had a third floor room in building 2 which offered a nice ocean view and was away from the noise of the nightly shows. Double queen size beds or a single king are available (ours was double queen). Very nice and comparable to a nice US hotel. Cable TV, minibar, hair dryer all there.Food-Far exceeded my expectations. DiMarco's, the Northern Italian restuarant, is formal but the food is very good. Windows has everything for breakfast and lunch. The American grill has ala carte breakfast and burgers/sandwiches for lunch, and TexMex has great steaks and seafood. There was no problem in finding something to everyone's liking in any of these restuarants (we were a group of 20). There are also hot dogs and pizza available at the backstage bar in the afternoon and burgers and hot dogs on the beach side of the Garden Bar.Drink-Presidente is the beer of choice although Heinekin is available at the Backstage bar. There is a drink menu at every bar but the will make whatever you want and do have upper shelf brands if you ask by name (Tanquary gin, Johnny Walker Black, etc.). If you are a drinker, I would advise bringing a 20 oz., insulated cup with you, it saves on refilling drinks back and forth to the beach.Entertainment-The main stage entertainment was mostly good. Xiomara is the featured singer/dancer and she is very, very talented. The nights usually begin with a movie and show aimed at the kids followed by a more adult show. One or two of the shows are a bit corny but lots of fun.Beach-GorgeousPeople-Gloria at the backstage bar (tell her Papa sent you) and Julio at the Piano bar. Julio lights up the bar every night with 151 rum and is not to be missed. Xiomara shows up some nights and gets the crowd dancing. Tucki shows up all around the complex and gets everyone laughing. Al works at windows in the morning. She looks away while she pours coffee and rarely has her mind on her work.Other-Hobie Cats, windsurfers, snorkel equipment is all available free of charge but there are insurance charges which are pretty small ($3 a day for a hobie cat).Summary-A great, inexpensive vacation package. We didn't bring any kids but they cater to them very nicely from what we could see.  
<Date>Apr 28, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>wonderful vacation We stayed at the Sunscape Punta Cana the week of March 22-29. I don't know what happened at the hotel the week after we left, since there are so many negative comments, but we had the most wonderful time from the moment we woke up until the moment we went to sleep. We booked our trip through Apple Vacations (we had traveled with them before to Mexico, Jamaica, and the Dominican Republic). Everything went smoothly and we arrived at the hotel in the evening. Our room was ready as soon as we got there (I had requested a lower floor and got a room on the first floor). Everything was very clean throughout our stay. The food was excellent and the service was first-rate. Special thanks to Fernando, Papi, and Tono. All of our wishes were fulfilled before we even spoke them. Service with a smile has a special meaning here. We are going back in the summer for another wonderful week!  
<Date>Apr 25, 2003
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	
<Aspects>

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Do NOT stay here if you want quality This was promoted as a 5-star resort. It is at best a 2-3 star resort by american standards. The food is palatable at best and very inconsistent. The facilities are old and poorly maintained. The beds are uncomfortable and the pillows smell. The water makes you sick. The shows are amatuerish. The drinks are watered down. The disco caters ONLY to the locals. About the only good thing I can say is that the stafff was freindly and helpful. Otherwise, this was my worst vacation ever and I will never return to Punta Cana or the Dominican Republic for that matter. There are too many excellent islands out there that deserve your hard earned money.  
<Date>Apr 23, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sunscape Leaves a Little To Be Desired My first trip to the Dominican Republic with three friends was In June of 2002. We booked through Apple Vacations (which was a total nightmare) and ended up losing one whole day of our vacation because the Apple Vacations charter plane had problems and we had to wait FIFTEEN hours in the Philadelphia airport before we got there. Needless to say, we were expecting something amazing in Punta Cana. The Sunscape wasn't amazing, however. I would rate it as being dubbed a moderate resort by the skin of its teeth. The beach was absolutely terrible. The water is murky with a lot of seaweed and very coarse sand. It was almost as if we were swimming in a bay area because there is a huge marina RIGHT IN FRONT of the beach which blocks the view of the ocean. Enourmous boats are right in front of you on the beach at all times. It was like the Jaws ride at Universal Studios or something. Now here comes the scary part, get ready. We all got explosive diarreah about 3 days into the trip and so did every other single person we spoke to at the resort. We did not drink the water, but I'm sure they wash their foods in unpurified water. How else would we have gotten so sick? The pools were very nice, and the rooms were clean. The food was actually pretty good compared to other places in Mexico I have been. My friends and I are young, attractive, and gay, and we were surrounded by a mix of married 50 year olds, and hairy Europeans who were rude and clickish. If you are gay and like to party responsibly yet have fun, this is not the place for you. This year I'm staying at the Sunclub in Punta Cana which I have heard is moderate yet exceeds the expectations of many resorts in the area. I go in June, so I'll be sure to post my reflection.  
<Date>Apr 21, 2003

<Author>oceanfish058
<Content>Very relaxing; Had a great time My husband a I stayed at the Sunscape April 4- 11th. Our first trip to the Domican Republic and we had a very good time. We traveled with Apple Vacations from Chicago and things went smoothly. The Punta Cana airport is very small and is an open-air, grass hut looking airport. When you arrive you get in line, where you have your picture taken with a couple of girls in costume (which you can buy for $5 US dollars when you leave for home), then you have to buy a tourist card for $10 each, which you fill out and turn in to the immigration officer. You keep part of the form for your return trip - if you lose it you have to pay another $10. Then you claim your luggage and go out to the parking lot where the buses are waiting. There are tons of porters waiting to carry your luggage of course and we found it easiest to just allow them to carry our bags rather than fight them off. They only expect $1 per bag and took us directly to our Apple rep. Our luggage was put on the bus and we after everyone boarded we were off to the resort. It was about a 20 minute ride ot the resort. The countryside is very, very poor and very very dirty in US standards. Lots of garbage, especially bottles littered all over. This is due to the economy I think. The only real trade at Punta Cana is tourism.At the hotel we collected our luggage and checked in. Staff was walking around serving punch (rum added if you wanted) and chocolate chip cookies. We were assigned our room (I had requested a third floor room with a king bed,non-smoking near the beach in advance), given our keys and we were off. The porter brought the bags about 15 minutes later. We were in building 4 which was nice because it was near the beach and the restaurants and not near the kids club or the main stage. buildings 1, 2 and 3 were nearer to the kids club and the main stage, which I think would have been louder. Our room was large and had a great peaked ceiling. The bed was huge. The room is basic, but acceptable. We had a garden view anduested that and the resort was full. Our air conditioning unit was VERY loud and I complained. They came the next day (we had to remind them) to fix it and it worked better, but it was still loud and we often had to turn the fan off. Others we met said their AC were very loud as well. The mini fridge is not cold when you get there, because it has been turned off, but it cools off by the next day. Not cold by US standards, but is cool. It is stocked with bottled water, Sprite and Coke. They also bring beer (Bohemia Especial) to the room your first night and restock it daily. There was an ice machine in the 1st floor of the building. The week we were there they were just putting in alarm clocks in each room. They didn't have them before, so this is new.Maid service. Maid service was fine. We left a modest tip of $2 each day and left a note (in Spanish) of what we wanted, (i.e. extra water, beer, shampoo, pillowsetc.) and got what we asked for. There were many people who did not tipand also received the same treatment, so I don't think tipping is necessary. The tile floors were washed daily and if you put the towles in the bathtub you get fresh towels daily. I did leave $5 one day and asked for a different type of beer than Presidente or Bohemia but was informed they didn't have nay available for the rooms, which was disappointing. Bars and nightlife - This was our first experience with a pool bar and we loved it. At some of the bars they do serve Heineken beer (not at the pool bar though) if you ask, which seems to be a big secret. I drink beer and after awhile I had trouble tolerating the Presidente and the Bohemia beer they serve. My husband did as well. They definately need to get some other brands of beer. They serve local liquor unless you ask for a name brand (i.e. My husband requested Bacardi rum and Jack Daniels and coke and was able to get it without a problem) We did tip bartenders modestly ($1-2 a day) and found we had fairly good, friendly service. Many bartenders remembered what we r a beer with tomato juice and it foamed up like some sort of chemical reaction, so I'm not sure what their version of tomato juice is, but I don't recommend it. They used a lot of canned Clamato juice, which most people said was ok. There is a small disco that gets going around 11 p.m. It has a large screen TV, although the dance floor is right in front of it. It is very small and was very loud, not our cup of tea, but seemed to be popular with the younger crowd. There is a bar called Umbrellas which is a nice casual bar with large, comfortable chairs and karoake and singing. The night we were there there were only a few people there, but it seemed nice. There is a bar that is open 24 hours near the beach. Each night they showed a movie at the stage at around 7 p.m. for kids (Scooby Doo, A Bugs life, etc.) on a big screen. From 7:30 - 9 p.m. they had casino table set up for black jackin the back of the movie area. (This could get a little loud and did interefere with the people trying to watch the movie). At around 9:00 each night there was a show on the mainstage. We watched most of them. The Latin show and the Tribute show were pretty good. The others were more audience particpation and were pretty lame although the staff did try very hard to make it fun. I did get totally sick of hearing the put your hands up in the air song by the end of the week.If you are looking for an exciting trip with lots of energetic nightlife, I would say Punta Cana is not likely what you are looking for. We were looking for a very relaxing vacation so we were not disappointed with the nightlife, but some people we talked to had been hoping for more night life - more like Cancun.Restaurants - No reservations required at any of the restaurants which is nice. We always ate early (6 - 6:30 ) and never had trouble getting seated, although some we met said if you waited much past 7-7:30 you might have to wait for the specialty restaurants. Make srue to check which restaurants are closce much slower than in the US but may be so you don't feel rushed. We had things we wanted to do, so found this a little irritating at times.The main buffet restaurant is called Windows. I would rate is as average, cafeteria style food. They need more variety. There was a pasta station, a Mexican station (fajitas), several varieties of meats and some fish, salads, fruits, breads, etc. We found in most of the specialty restaurants that they use a lot of butter (their version of butter) in foods. De Marios - We ate ther 2 times. Gourmet italian, although not the type of Italian we find in the US. More formal atmosphere and children under 12 are not allowed. Good food in our opinion - we had 3 cheese lasagna (appetizer), duck ravioli (appetizer), cheese and ham (appetizer); shrimp and chicken was good. Too stuffed for dessert, but heard they were very good. American Grill - American fare with a cowbouy theme- steaks, etc. Not as good as midwest beef that we are used to but still good. Entertaining staff. Beach grill - a la carte breakfast and lunch, and dinner. We ate there 3 times. Dinner was great. Mahi mahi was excellent. My husband loved the onion soup. Seafood soup was fishy. Note: Almost all of the fish we had was very good, but it does have bones. Grouper was good, but not as good as the mahi mahi. Also at lunch they set up a little buffet with hot dogs (didn't hear good things about these!), hamburgers (these we ate and thought were fine), pizza (ok, not great) and french fries (best to get these when they are fresh and hot.)By the pool in the afternoon they have chips, salsa, hot dogs too. I loved the fresh salsa but I don't think I tolerated it well and I generally have no trouble with my stomach.Green Parrot - there is a restuarant/bar on the beach that is owned by the sunscape but is not included in the all-inclusive. You can get Corona and other beer there. Also a lobster dinner for $20. We didn't eat there but had a few beers there. It was a little odd because we ordered 2 beers and guy just shrugged. We gave him $5 and asked if this was ok and he said ok, so I have no idea what you could pay for a beer. You might be able to get them for much cheaper, but since we pay nearly $4 each for a Corona at home, I didn't complain much!Staff and service - The staff and service at the Sunscape were great. The staff always smiled and everyone said Hola! They work very long hours and did their best to serve us. We were very pleased. I walked around by myself on the resort at night a lot and always felt safe. There was a guard on duty and he walked the beach. We walked up the beach at night once to the Allegro and there was a guard there at night also. The grounds were very clean and the workers were always cleaning or working on something.We had brought along a lot of $1's bills (we brought along 50 1's)which is something I recommend for tipping, etc. You are not expected to tip, but if you do it is easiest to have small bills.Pool and beach - beautiful main pool with a section for activities. Separate small wade pool for kids. It would be nice if they had a section in main pool for kids activities and one for adults only as it was hard to play pool volleyball with all of the kids. The kids seem to have a geat time. There is an kids club that watches kids during the day and had a variety of fun activities for them. One night we saw tents set up on the beach where the kids got to camp out, they had a small screen with a movie and hot dogs/hamburgers on the beach. I would have loved this if I were a kid!There is a separate adult pool behind building 5. Quiet, no activities or music, it's own bar with a great bartender (Luis). Topless sunbathing here permitted.We didn't have a problem getting beach towels, but many people we ran into said they were often out of towels. We kept our towels for several days and when we turned them in we always made sure to exchange them right then for new ones so we knew we'd have one. We also brought a couple of our own.They could use more floate eventually. There is a problem getting a lounge chair in the shade by the main pool. You have to go down early in the morning and put your towel on a chair if you hope to get one in the shade. I went down one morning at 6 a.m. to do this. We only did this once because we found it wasn't that important to us since we spent most of the day in the water. We just kept our towels and stuff in a bag and put it by the wall near the pool bar. We did have one of our resort towels taken one day that we had hanging over the deck railing by the pool, probably because towels were in short supply. The activities desk did give us a new one so we wouldn't get charged for the lost towel. They need to get more towels and try to do something about the poolside chair situation. The beach was nice. There was a lot of seaweed, but they raked it up daily and did their best to keep it clean. If you are looking for a perfectly clean beach without seaweed, this likely won't meet your standards, but we found it fine. Plenty of chairs and shade on the beach.Spa - I didn't use it, but some others we talked to did and like it. One lady had an 80 minute massage/reflexology treatment for $80. It sounded like you could get any increment for a massage fro about $1 a minute. You could get your hair braided in those tiny braids on the beach by locals or in the spa. I was always warned not to do this because the braids are so tiny and tight it really wrecks your hair when you try to take them out.Excursions. Variety of excursions available through your tour company. Not as many as in Mexico. We went on the Kon Tiki party boat ($50 each US) which was 4 hours on a party barge. Open bar with dancing, limbo contests, etc. You can snorkel for about an hour. The snorkeling was ok, but the coral is mainly dead. This trip was ok, but I was not feeling well and didn't like the El Presidente beer, so didn't drink much. Hubby drnak rum punch and said it was ok. 5 others we talked to at the resort said they weren't impressed with it fo trip. Picked us up at 8 a.m. in lobby and returned around 4:30 p.m. Get to see the local scenery and a family home, stop for lunch, stop at a small river to take a dip if you want, coolers with beer, rum, water, flowing all day. Stop at a rum shack to buy liquor if you want. Last stop at Macao beach (beautiful) to boogie board (semi-surf) in the ocean for about 45 minutes. Bumpy ride all day and would be better if less packed but overall was a great trip for the money. Tip: Put your swim siut on before you leave and put on sunscreen before you leave and reapply all day long. Our guide Tony was great. Guides spoke English. Parasailing: Near the green Parrot on the beach there is a parasailing outfit run by the hotel. It is somewhat pricey - $45 for one person, $85 for two (you can tandem aparasail together) for 10 minutes. If you walk up the beach toward the Allegro, there is another vendor that will do it for $35 each for 12 minutes. I wanted to parasaid with a girl I had met and we had very little time, so we paid the higher price through the hotel because they were able to get out out right away. The guys running the parasail boat spoke very little English, but I had done it before so had no trouble figuring out what to do. This girl and I were alone, but we felt safe, although the guy running the boat had a tshirt tied over his face so you couldn't see anything but his eyes and looked a bit like a pirate! The parasailing was beautiful. 10 minutes isn't nearly long enough!Shopping - if you like to shop and are looking for a great shopping experience, this likely isn't the place for you. The only shops are a few shops in the hotel and some small shops set up on the beach. If you want to buy art or jewelry, buy it at the hotel. Several people bought jewelry on the beach which fell apart before then end of the week. My husband bought a pair of sunglasses at a beach shop for $10 (fake Oakleys') which fell apart by the end of the week. Be ready to barter. Every vendor calls you to his shop with plity etc. and nothing is marked. You ask how much and they start out with some OUTRAGEOUS amount. (For example $150 for my husbands sunglasses). You then say no way. They come down half or more. You still say no way and offer less. They counteroffer. You then offer what you want to pay (in our case we offered a max of $10). They whine and complain and may even swear at you adn may let you leave the shop. Most of the time they will then come and find you and say ok, they'll take your price. We found this entertaining for a short while, but soon tired of it and only went to a few shops. People we met did get good deals on t-shirts ($7 each) and cheap costume jewelry. Other tips: Bring along immodium, aspirin, Phasyme or GasX, PeptoBismal tablets, etc. just in case. My husband and I did get diarrhea and so did most of the people we talked to (about 10 people), but the immodium helped a lot. I'm not sure if it was the food, the tropical oils in the drinks, the beer or simply just drinking too much. You cannot drink the tap water, but they provide plenty of bottled water. Our room did have a sewer smell at times, which was gross and the resort grounds in general had that smell every so often. Not sure why.There was some rain ( 3 times in the 7 days we were there, mostly late afternoon/early evening), but it didn't last long and we actually found it refreshing because the sun is so intense. I brought along a small, cheap umbrella and it worked great the few times it rained. It evidently rained more the week before we were there, but we were told this was very unusual. Our Apple rep said to call direct from the room rather than using a calling card. Said calling cards were more expensive due to connection fees. We never used the phone. Bring lots of 1's (US) if you plan to shop or tip. Leaving for home: Bus picked us up in lobby around 10:30 a.m. for a 1:20 flight. They go through your luggage by hand at the airport. You can't taek fruit or Mamma Juana back. Hot in the airport and things aret food - expensive. I suggest you eat before leaving for the airport and bring a bottle of water with you. There is a very small gift shop with a very limited selection of stuff. Our flight was on time and we had no problems. They have a arrival/departure monitor, but don't rely on its accuracy. There was a flight to Philadelphia that it said was delayed but actually left right on time and several people almost missed it because they were in the bar. Listen to the announcements carefully.Overall, our experience was great and we would love to go back at some time. The Sunscape resort was very nice and the staff were great!  
<Date>Apr 13, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Just GO.. I am almost speachless. Sunscape is the best resort that I have ever been to. The food is good. The American Grill serves a great lunch and dinner, from salads to steaks. The Italian place was great, but not the kind of Italian you get in the states. The nightly shows are very entertaining and funny. The rooms are clean and well maintained. they are nothing special but we didn't spend much time there anyway. The staff.... The staff is the finest that I have ever experienced. I would like to thank Popi (bartender) and Eduardo (photograpy) these guys made us feel like we were royalty. The rest of the staff is just as good and treat you like family. The beach is great with plenty of shade for those who want it. The exec staff is very freindly and loves to here your ideas and input. If you like to drink, this is your place. 6 bars, dico, pool bar, adult pool bar. There were kids there, but you don't even notice them. The entire resort is super clean 24 hrs. a day. There are plenty of activities for the energetic or you can just spend your time relaxing on the beach or by the pool. Over all, this place is incredible. If you don't go then you are missing out on a dimmond in the ruff. Just go and see for yourself. We went with Apple Vacations, they were great. Give them a try and have fun!

<Content>It was just okay The rooms were a little musty smelling, but overall not too bad. The food was not as good as expected. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>4get The Rest Sunscape Is The Best! Before going 2 Punta Cana my Wife  I read alot of reviews on just about every resort in Punta Cana. We wnated to find 1 with a beautiful beach, good places 2 eat  fun activities. We were a bit unsure between a few different ones-but picked Sunscape. Well we are soooo glad we did!! The place was more than we expected by far. The beach was awesome  very clean (unlike the resorts next to us). They had 4 great places to eat (the Italian Rest. was super). The activity guys kept you laughing  wanting more. The rooms are nice  maid serv was very good. They have theme parties every night ( beach dinner party for 1,200 was really cool). The nightly shows were a ways from a Vegas show -but still enteraining. The GM is from Canada  really takes pride in making sure everyone (including his employees) are having a great time!! Beach,Pool,Food,Drinks,People,Activities were all great! So if your undecided like we were-do yourself a favor  go to Sunscape!!!!!

0	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Sunscape is spectacular. Since August 2002 I had heard and read all the reviews about Sunscape...more than 95% were raves and the few negatives were to be expected. There is no doubt in my mind that Sunscape has found a niche in the resort industry of rehabbing smaller and more compact resorts and Americanizing them for the North American trade. A vacationing British gentleman at the resort said that he came to Sunscape because Americans have higher standards. My reason for booking Sunscape was not because it was Americanized, but because it was not a mega sprawling resort. Twice we had been to the Casadel Mar in La Romana for that particular reason and it is now called Sunscape Casa del Mar..yipee.. Many people we have met also avoid larger chains that require trams, jitneys or long walks to take them place to place. Three times in the past we had been to the city of Santo Domingo, once to Puerto Platta which I hated..lol. Twice to the! Casa del Mar in a Romana and two years go to the Catalonia Bavaro which we liked very much except it was another sprawling resort. So, we aren't any strangers to the Dominican Republic and our expectations of the newer all inclusives and we do our homework way ahead of time before booking a resort. Let me tell you about our incredible experience at Sunscape In Punta Cana. If Rod Gahr, General Manager of Sunscape had ever gone to a hotel and restaurant management school he would have been told....you can't do what you want to do!! As a result of his working his way up he has learned what guests really want. He is a hands on person and is available to guests, he loads luggage as guests depart and thanks each and every one of them. He walks around giving out red gummy bears to guests and staff alike.. Rod doesn't hide behind a locked door.ARRIVAL: On Sunday, February 9th at 12:45 p.m.: We were greeted with s!miles and welcomes by the frontdesk staff and as reported it is true with warm chocolate chip cookies and rum punch with Caren, the Director of Public Relations adding rum for those who wanted it. Many people from our GWV group received their rooms immediately. We were told as others that our rooms would be ready at 2:00 p.m. so we went to lunch at Windows and had a drink. Two o'clock arrived and everybody received their room except us and we were told a great room was being prepared, but we would have to wait until 3:00 p.m. We had been up since 3:00 a.m. and I was not a happy camper. I happened to talk to Jessica, the Guest Relations person, and she promptly talked to the front desk and assured us the room would be ready in ten minutes....thank you Jessica....it was. When booking the room we had asked for a second floor and king sized bed. We were taken to what I judged was the most wonderful locat!ion...Building #3 and Room 3220 which overlooked the pool and beach. The new mahogany four poster king sized bed (with two swans made from the towels and flowers) and the furniture represented the mahogany wood the D.R. was famous for. In the bathroom there were huge white fluffy towels and lo and behold not one, not two, but three facecloths and the amenities of large week sized shampoos, conditioner and bath gel. How many times have been to resorts and have had to bring my own face cloths . I do bring my own shampoo and conditioner and bath gel as a rule. On the large balcony was a sturdy pull out clothes dryer (I always bring clothespins and liquidsoap) Yes, we were off to a great start. Sunday night about 7:30 we headed towards Da Mario's. There were people waiting outside and we put our names in. When we asked about how long the wait was the young man told us to keep coming back and checking. This from what I had read was n!ot the Sunscape Way. We headed to the Tex-Mex Restaurant where I had the ribs which were delicious. MONDAY... we were up early and as I had read almost all chairs in the shade are hard to come by, but we lucked out as all the other chairs in the shade under the palapas had been taken by 7:00 a.m. In mid-morning I spotted Rod Gahr and Johny Mendez, the Food and Beverage Manager walking around. early in the morning. Not being the bashful type I told him as far as I was concerned I would like to be moved to the Catalonia Bavaro down the road I was quite unhappy and told him why. He turned to Mr. Mendez, the Food and Beverage Manager and told him to take care of the problem at DaMario's and he apologized profusely for our inconvenience and long wait for our room. He guaranteed we would love the resort and that evening we received a lovely fruit platter and a personal letter of apology from him which was the proper way to handle an!unhappy guest. The rest of the week was filled with pleasant suprises beyond my expectations..Things happened that we had never seen at any other 4 star resort and let me tell you about them. POOL AREA: The pool is divided in two by a woodenbridge and on the deeper side was the very activepool bar and little kiddies pool which was actually being used. On the activities side was the palapa withthe towels and bulletin boards noting activities for that evening and movies. We never ever had a problem with replacing our towels, probably because we took the dirty ones to the room and replaced them in the a.m. Around the pool where we sat from 8:00 a.m. to at least 4:30 p.m. there was always something going on. Music was not loud and obtrusive as we have found in other places. There was the usual volley ball, wateraerobics, kayak fights, dance lessons, spanish lessons, step aerobics etc. etc. Large yellow floats! were put in the pool in the a.m. One morning I noticed several children hoarding one or two of the floats under their chaises.. I don't know who, but somebody from the staff nicely (I heard him) ask the children to use them or put them back in the pool and they did. Adults and children alike took turns sharing the floats and it was never a problem..nice to see Because this is a family type resort there were many children and it was wonderful to see them playing with their new friends. One little girl from Holland was included with two American and one British girls and by hand gestures and whatever they made a happy quartet. I even heard one girl thank three others for being her friends for the week, wasn't that sweet. The children I knew through their families would go off with Paulina doing kids stuff and one morning they had a volley ball game in the pool and another a treasure hunt and their team came back with T-shirts. Another afterno! o!n we noticed a little fake Dominican Hut beingput up and decorated with palms. They had brought in coconuts and had a Coconut Party around the pool. They broke them open and filled them with a coco loco drink and Caren again was there to add rum for those who wanted it. Dominican dancers were there to provide the entertainment and dance with the guests and give lessons. There were plenty of coconuts to go around and everybody seemed to enjoy this wonderful event..One afternoon chocolate chip cookies were passed around and another day or two although bars were just steps away drinks were served to guests by staff members. The Animation Staff under the direction of Adrian Gutierrez is always there working and one in particular draws my praise..Chookie (I hope that ishow his name is spelled)., the first day I saw this plus sized man start to do water exercises I thought..wow...the hospital isn't that faraw! ay..Surprise...he gave a great work out..at least 30 minutes and never faltered. One day he walked around talking to all the guests around the pool and with us was a new guest, a little girl. Chookie welcomed her with a chuck under the chin which brought a smile. Amazingly, a few days later when he walked around he asked where the little girl was, now that is amazing..Tuesday and Fridays the parrot men come around to take pictures of the guests posing with the birds. Since my name is Parrot Mom and I do own parrots I was quite anxious to meet the parrots and learn how and where they came from. Eduardo the photographer did not just take any old picture and was quite creative and is an excellent photographer. He told me about the birds that they rent per day and how they are taken care of. For whatever reason I adopted the charming Eduardo as my son. There was a different photographer with the handler on Friday and it was a one two three deal and the developed pictures that were for sale showed the difference. Yes, I bought a cute silly candid picture from Eduardo. Now, I must tell you the negative side of the pool area. if you want shade you must get up before 7:00a.m. to reserve your spot. There was ! gentleman who had a small baby and little toddler and he explained he needed the shade for them. There was a woman in a wheelchair whose palapa was saved by her family. Personally, I've had basal cell and also need shade and I had to get up early and do the same thing. The last full day were were going to be there I was determined after being out in the sun too much to reserve a special spot. The spot the family with the baby had used this spot for several days and had left the day before. On the whole we found people very respectful of the reserved spaces and the morning I knew they were gone I happened to be up at 5:45 and in the pitch black of the building and pool area I groped my way downstairs with towels and cover-ups to reserve the much desired spot. I moved the lounges into the area only bumping into the security guard coming and going and I wonder what he thought. Interesting enough the some of the same spots were ! c!overed with towels early in the a.m. day after day and privately I think I know how and why, but my lips are sealed. There was an incident where a husband had reserved one chair for his wife near us under a palapa at 7:00a.m., she had developed sun poisoning. When she went out to get the chair it had been pushed out into the sun by four non-english speaking guests who gestured they knew nothing about it. Two other chairs under a palapa with towels of guests I had met had their chairs pushed into the sun also by other non-english speaking guest. I do understand that people from other countries do not require the space around them and felt they have the right to share your space. Sadly, many of the saved chaises were not utilized until late afternoon. A woman told me that her chair and her friends chair under a tree on the beach had the fate of having her items dumped and the people know knowing a thing about it. Managem! ent is definitely aware ofthe problem and it was mentioned at the Cocktail Party. This problem is not unique to Sunscape and the solution maybe easy. At the Casa del Mar around the pool are four huge canopies that hold at least two dozen chaises so there is never a problem getting a place in the shade. There has to be a solution whether there are more palapas installed or perhaps one or two canopies on either side of the pool.. Guests on vacation should not have to get up at 6:00 or 7:00a.m. to find a place in the shade. Since we are retired I resent having to rise at least two hours earlier so we can find a bit of shade..Another request I've heard from other guests is that additional ladders be put in both sides of the pool. and or a set of steps. There is only one ladder on the bar side and one on the activities side. Small children needed boosts and a woman I talked to with bad knees had a definite problem getti! n!g in and outand needed assistance. BEACH--Don't know what the complaints about the beach were about a little seaweed and the marina off to the side. The boats added to the scenic beauty. We walked the beach daily down to the Allegro Resort and past returning by the way of the vendors. They can be persistent, but telling them I was just looking and they took it well. When we did go back to buy and to look for a particular item they were helpful. These vendors are not self-employed and work for a company that puts up the booths so the prices are a tad higher, but they need to make their money too. Between the pool and the beach over the wall is a young man hand painting T-shirts personalizing them. There is a kiddie playground with slides. and other adult games available. RESTAURANTS: WINDOWS; On the first day we had lunch in Windows and were very unhappy. The restaurant is cavernous and dark at the breakfast and lunch we had t! here. One of the joys of a winter vacation is eating on a deck under an umbrella. No complaints about the food being offered or the staff. TEX-MEX: Ate there the first night, great ribs. AMERICAN GRILLE: We never dined there...sorry...it was downstairs from the Tex-Mex restaurant and the same building as the Beach Grille BEACH GRILLE: The next morning we heard about the Beach Grille and headed to there at 8:00 a.m. to sit overlooking the beach under an umbrella. it was pure joy. There is an regular breakfast menu which were able to order from and that was fine and we also had lunch there. There is a waiter who deserves special attention.. I don't know remember his name, but hecomes from Puerto Platta and is easily recognizable because he is bald..Very experienced and delightful..he is also a head waiter in Da Mario's. DA MARIO'S: We spent much time eating there because of the excellent food and service. The secret is to go bef! o!re 6:45 and we usually arrived about 6:30 or 6:15. The food was wonderful, especially of note were their mashed potatoes. It got so that I would order grilled shrimp and instead of pasta requested the mashed potatoes. The food, presentation and service was excellent. I could barely get to the desserts, but if I did...they had a design of a spoon and fork outlined with cocoa powder....nice touch SURPRISES: This is what sets Sunscape apart and above other resorts we have ever been to......MANAGERS COCKTAIL PARTY: Wednesday Night there is a Manager's Cocktail Party in the Lobby. I couldn't believe my eyes when I saw Rod personally passing around appetizers as was Adrian head of the Animation Team, the Food and Beverage Director and the Chef's. In real champagne glasses bottles of champagne flowed freely. Cruise style Rod introduced his entire staff and the people behind the scenes. He also included two men who were responsible for the sa!nitation and cleanliness of the resort and restaurants. Rod proudly announced that Sunscape had the highest rating of any resort in Punta Cana for sanitation and I didn't hear of anybody getting sick. On the plane a woman told me her husband was hospitalized for two night with foodpoisoning...she was at one of the mega resort..BEACH PARTY: Early on Thursday morning the staff started setting up for beach party in the evening. At least two hundred tables with blue glassware, candles and white tablecloths. The staff had made an lovely arbor of palm leaves to enter the area... I looked around in disbelief and wonderment at the buffet tables set up. Even on cruise ships have I never seen the selection and displays they had. We wondered even at the huge selection of cheeses...all sorts of items being grilled like whole fish and steaks. In the very, very early morning as I enjoyed some air on the balcony I heard the staff cleaning up...The gi!gantic effort of Food and Beverage Manager, Johnny Mendez and his staff in the many man hours of putting up this buffet and then having to break it down and clear the tables, chair and clean the beach for the morning has to be be a Herculean affair..POOL PARTY: Friday morning lo and behold the staff is setting up again around the arbor and pool area for apool party...another incredible buffet. ANIMATION STAFF/SHOWS: Every evening there were great movies on a large screen for kids and have to and many adults alike. Harry Potter, Star Wars, Scooby Doo, 102Dalmations and Shreik. The shows for the adults were fun some of them judged by the staff as adult..The children were asked to come to the front of the stage where they were marched off by the staff to have their own party. Before several of the shows the chiildren put on little shows...one was a fashion show..another was the movng hat.. and seeing Chookie try to explain this game to the children who spoke several languages was funny enough. HOUSEKEEPING: Since our long wait the first day we would put the card asking for the room to be made up immediately..and it was. One morning we forgot and when we returned out room had still not been made. It!'s very possible with the constant coming and goings of guests during the week that additional housekeeping personell should be added. GROUNDS: Since this is an older resort the bushes and trees are lush and kept well trimmed. STAFF: By having the management team that they do at Suncape it is obvious the rest of the staff are happycampers and as a result reflect it in their attitude towards guests.

adder):1	5815(volley):1	5825(kiddy):1	6249(privately):1	6548(tex-mex):1	6584(americanize):1	7296(outline):1	9785(disbelief):1	9841(cavernous):1	10193(hospitalize):1

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Vacation We just returned from vacationing at the Sunscape Grand and were very impressed. From greeting to departure the staff made every effort to provide a welcome and enjoyable stay. The facility was large enough to afford a variety of activities but small enough that everything was convenient. Beach was wonderful, clean and provided plenty of lounges. The rooms were clean and well supplied. The dining facilities were varied and no reservations were needed. Our vacation was the last week of February and we plan to return the same time next year.

<Author>His_lamb_i_am
<Content>I Highly recommend Sunscape My husband and I visited Sunscape Feb.19-26, 2003. This was our first vacation w/o our children and the first time I felt completely and totally catered to. It was one of the more affordable, all-inclusive packages we could find (Apple Vacations) and although the room was not fancy, it was clean, cool and really did suit our needs. The staff there was wonderful and strived to make us comfortable. The grounds and beach were beautiful and well taken care of also. One day while on the beach we were approached by several people from the neighboring resorts (Occidental Allegro Resort Bavaro, Barcelo Bavaro Palace) who were just dying to talk to someone who spoke English, which was not a problem at Sunscape. It seemed that most of the quests (80-90%) Were American and Canadian, so there was never a lack of people to talk to. AND very few topless sun bathers. (I saw three (only on the beach) altogether and some could have past for men! LOL)The food was very different(some alittle bland) and sometimes inconsistent. We did have good luck at The American Grill(Tex Mex) getting some decent cuts of beef. We definitely didn't go hungry, for there was always something somewhere to eat. I honestly believe that if there is a problem with people getting sick, it would probably be the combination of the heat, sun and alcohol, rather then the food. I talked to a couple who have visited punta cana 5 times, each at a different resort. They told me that Although rooms at sunscape aren't quite as nice, the food was the best by far! Be sure to take anything you may need as far as medications and toiletries. A bottle of 24 Tylenol could cost ya up to ten American bucks. So be prepared! The snorkeling on the resort was much better then on the excursion we took and much cheaper. Make sure you find out when you get there what all is included, so you don't miss out on things like a free message, horseback riding,etc.I was very impressed with the staff and their work ethic! They work very hard and make very little money. Your all-inclusive covers tips for servers but not your maid, so she/he will dance and sing if you leave them a tip. We were so impressed with our maid the we ended up tipping her close to $40 for the week and have no regrets! Would be nice if more American's were as dedicated and had as great of attitudes as these people. I wish I could have brought alot of them home with me! All in all, we really have no real complaints! Give Sunscape Punta Cana a try!  
<Date>Feb 27, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent vacation Feb 15 - 22 four of us stayed at Sunscape resort in Punta Cana. What a beautiful resort. Clean, friendly staff (they don't expect or wait for tips), great drinks, good food specially the Italian restaurant and also the one night we had an outdoor buffet dinner by the pool. There is disco and the piano lounge bar was great if you want to relax and participate in Karaoke. The drinks are amazing if I can remember them all; miami vice (excellent drink); bahama mama; poco loco; strawberry daquiri; pina colada; and of course each bartender has a specialty, no name to it but if I tell him to make me a special that would not make me bloath, they make it for you with a smile - excellent specialty drinks!!! One waiter even called the drink after him, which is funny specially when you ordered it from another bartender - it's called Poppy Make Me Happy!!! The other bartenders doesn't know Poppy's concoction, so you have to remember Poppy's face! It rained on Wednesday which is the day that we supposed to have dinner right on the beach, it would have been perfect and romantic...next time. The bedroom is clean, regardless of whether I leave a tip or not, the maid still cleaned the room, with flowers too! We tipped her at the end of the week. We would definitely go back again to this resort, fantastic shows and Ron Gahr staff are excellent, very friendly specially one waitress that gave us her sweet smile and jokes as she cleaned our table. The beach is wonderful, soft to touch and we walked daily for 1 to 1 1/2 hours. The beach is endless, we tried walking to the Bavaro resort area and it would have taken us 1 1/2hr one way to get there so we turned back after walking for 45 minutes on the beach, it was a good excercise after eating all the good meals. My husband and our friends truly enjoyed this holiday, I would definitely go back. The day we got back in Toronto, it was snowing - we definitely wanted to go back!!!!  
<Date>Feb 25, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>beautiful beach, below average service We found Sunscape to be an average resort. Food- Good. Beaches- awesome. Cleanliness- above average. Service - POOR. When a domincan says 10 minutes- that actually means 1 hour. You must have alot of patience to get what you want. My husband and I were married here and the judge was an hour and 45 minutes late. Our room was never cleaned on our wedding night and we were out of toilet paper.At our rehearsal dinner, at THe American Grill we waited 2 hours for our food- this is no exaggeration. The last annoying thing was the beach chairs. People would lay their towels and reserve them at like 6:00 in the morning and then never even lay on them. Too petty for us and too many obnoxious drunks. If you go to punta cana, stay at the Iberostar Bavaro. Elegant, food is awesome, service unbelievabe, beaches clean and tons of chairs!!! To some it up..at the surroundings of the Iberostar there are beautiful pink flamingos that parade around. At Sunscape, a live chicken waddles around the adult pool. You make the decision.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best vacation ever! We stayed at Sunscape January 18-25, 2003. We had a wonderful stay and would return in a minute. The resort is beautiful, well kept and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The beach is wonderful, and you are not crowded in like sardines like at other resorts we have stayed - there are lots of chairs/loungers and palm trees to lay under. The resort does a good job at keeping the beach clean (seaweed floats in but the staff rakes it up and takes it away). The food is what impressed us the most. The American Grill served wings, ribs, steak, chicken, and shrimp - all were very good! And the buffet restaurant Windows was great too - lots of variety and it all tasted good. My favourite was Da Mario's - the italian restaurant, but they serve more than just italian. We had a wonderful chicken dish with garlic mashed potatos and steamed veggies, I also had shrimp primavera on another night. For dessert, the tiramisu was incredible! The guests at the resort were mostly American(65%), Canadians (30%) and the odd handful of Europeans(5%). We enjoyed this very much because everyone spoke English  it was very easy to meet people. Also, because the majority of guests are from North America, the resort tailors their menu to this type of food.The shows/entertainment at night were great to watch. One night they set up the beach for a dinner on the beach. This was wonderful - hundreds of tables with white linen table cloths and candles and a warm ocean breeze while eating dinner. Overall, it was an absolutely wonderful trip and we would go back again. Kim  Steve Tucker, Waterloo, ON Canada  
<Date>Feb 16, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>loved sunscape We had a great time at Sunscape. The staff, food, drinks, rooms, pool, beach, entertainment were excellent. The food was the best I've had thus far at an all-inclusive resort, and I'm a picky person. The rooms were very clean, the maid service was great, no complaints. I recommend leaving a small tip daily. The hotel does everything they can to keep it's guests happy. The beach was kept very clean. The nightly entertainment was great . The staff is very friendly and entertaining, they kept us busy by the pool all day long, from aqua aerobics to tequila volley ball! SPECIAL THANKS TO RIFIEAL AND CHEWKY.I was very happy with this resort and will definitly visit Sunscape again

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Awesome Time! We stayed at the Sunscape 2/9/03 for 4nts. And had a GREAT time. I'm a travel agent and get around to lots of other resorts  palces and I have to say the Sunscape was AWESOME. We also toured many other resorts in Punta Cana and some were so large there just wasn't that personal one on one staff to client ratio, You always felt like just another number. Here everyone treated you like family. It was very clean, they were always cleaning some thing. My friend and I went back to our room after breakfast one morning to change into our swimsuits and the maid was cleaning everything in our room from top to bottom. You have to take in to consideration it is very humid there and things are going to smell a bit damp! But that's par for the course in most resort areas that have humidity! The food was very good lots of variety on the buffet and the sit down resturants were good also we loved the American Grill and the best part was there was no reservations required like at other resorts I have been to. They always seem to have something going on around the pool and the staff tried very hard to get everyone involved. Even for children!! They sun is very hot so take caution and use lots of high SPF sunscreen and when need be find shade like in the beach bar and grill where you can order off the menu anything from cheese steaks, burgers, hotdogs, salads and pizza. The night life is so so the shows were a bit corny but we still had a few good laughs. We love JULIO our favorite GreenBay Packer Fan in the Piano  Cigar Bar, which they light the bar on fire a few times later at night. And Julio of course is always on fire and ready to greet you with a HUGE smile! The disco was also a very fun place lots of dancing. The staff at the Sunscape trys really hard to go out of there way to make your trip very special. Rod  Caren really try there best to make this resort WONDERFUL! It's as laid back as you want it to be or as busy as you want it to be. You can take the tours like the outback safari, or 4x4 or just walk the beach which is very natural, so if your looking for a very clean prestine beach I haven't seen one in DR yet! Also there is not alot of shopping just your basic t-shirts and island souvenirs. Yes some times there was the smell of sewer, but I have encountered that in many places as well, like Mexico and Cruises. The water pressure for the toilets and shower could be improved and that was just about my only complaint. I won't hesitate to send my clients to this resort and I myself will return. I'm confident they will have a wonderful time and come back smiling and ready to book a return trip to the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand. Carmin Markwardt ...  
<Date>Feb 15, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>LOVED SUNSCAPE!!! IT WAS PERFECT We stayed at Sunscape from 2/1-2/8/03!!!! It was fabulous!! The resort was very nice, better than I could have ever dreamed!! The people that work there are superb!! Everyone was very pleasant, and willing to do whatever they could for you to make your trip the best. I loved every minute of it...the only way it could have been any better, would have been if I could have stayed another 2 weeks or 2 months!! The GM, Rod was very nice, and seems to really have the resort in top running condition. We did have to wait a little while for our room to be ready when we arrived, but it was worth the wait. The rooms are huge, and we were on ground floor in building 5, about 10 feet from the beach. The BBQ on the beach was awesome as well. The food was very good, every restaurant was great. The disco was nice and very fun. The people that work for Sunscape were great about getting people to join in the fun on the dance floor!!! They are such great dancers as well!!! The nightly entertainment shows were great as well....I would come back to stay at Sunscape in a heart beat. Actually wish that I didn't have to leave!!!!! It was just a wonderfully fabulous time!!!!!! Thanks again for everything..............if you are considering going to Punta Cana this is the place to stay!!!!!!!!!!!!  
<Date>Feb 14, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>amazing I feel that this hotel is wonderful. My family and I havve been to the D.r four times now. we have stayed at the Sunscape twice. The beach is beautiful, white sand, clean water and a nice loong strip to walk or run. the water is also an excellent temp. nice and refreshing. there is a countless amunt of things you can do during the day. You can use the beautiful huge pool, with the very nice swim up bbar, particapte in the games may it be beach volley ball, soccer, aerobics, or other games the animation team has plannedd for that day. go shopping in the very tiny shop directly beside the hotel. or just lay in the sun. The animation team is wonderful putting on excellent shows at night that gets the croowd invovled as well as planning games and activities for the day. You always get asked to play but never forced. The food is the best I have tasted while staying in the D.R they have three very god resturants, windows the buffet excellent a little different every day, the tex mex or american grill which has excellent very hot wings and the best ribs I have ever tasted. The Italian restuarant was good not my favorite but thats just a personal thing. The hotel is very clean, while we where there (Jan 2-7 2003) the hotel won the award for cleanest hotel in the Punta Cana. the room are the standard hotel room, but the maid always add a special touch may it be fressh flowers, choclate, etc. The one thing i really enjoyed this year was the casion it was free to play, and you won pretend money to by things at the auction they had and youo could win things like rum, t-shirts and hats. I really enjoyed my stay here both years and would highly reccommened it to any one,looking forward to going back next year. If you havee any questions e-mail me. Diane  
<Date>Feb 7, 2003
